lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: So the runt made it here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ready to talk now? I'd even be up for trying that 
"blade to your throat" idea of yours, too. Dealer's 
choice.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Heh, no biting comment this time? I wonder if your 
bite is as a bad as your bark.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
There is no need. Your value is as dead as you 
yourself will soon be.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
You fucking brat... I'll pry it off your cold dead 
body.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
That does remind me. You wouldn't happen to 
have gold on you? You still owe me for that craps 
game I won.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: You fucking- ...hehehe... I'm gonna enjoy this.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Fuck... So close... Just needed... to...kill the... 
brat...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Arrghh!!!

The man stumbled over his feet and he burst 
forward from the forest.

But the fall to the dirt soon turned into an elegant 
roll that returned him to his feet.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah! Salvation~

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: It's that fucking brat!? Why now of all times?!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Don't tell me...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Dammit! That cretin... We were distracted.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I, a most humbled traveling bard, am at your 
service.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: B- Bard?! You have a mini army after you!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Everyone's a critic these days.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
So you're what they're after, eh?

He seems to be a fair source of information, at 
least. Pup. Satia. Keep the boy safe.

Win Condition: Defeat the Bandit Leader. 

Lose Condition: Anyone gets killed.

Win Condition: Defeat the Bandit Leader. 

Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan or Ivan die
The chest contents have been stolen!

With a proper party in tow, it's time we talked 
about mechanics like the convoy.

The convoy is the inventory for items that do not 
fit in individual character inventories.

Pup, the main character, has access to this at all 
times in battle. Other characters in spaces next to
him can also access it.
The camp menu between chapters will later let you 
freely move items and weapons between the 
convoy and characters. Make sure to use it!

With a few good slashes and stabs at the enemy, 
you've probably noticed that the number next to
each characters' weapons have went down.
This is called weapon durability. Weapons have 
limited uses, and you should take care not to burn 
through a good weapon too quickly.
At the same time, you cannot just neglect 
attacking. Along with experience, characters also 
have a Weapon Rank.
There are 5 weapons ranks (E->A). Every use 
increases a unit's experience with the weapon, and 
higher rankings let you equip better weapons.
What remained of the bandits scattered in a panic.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're getting away!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
It's fine. With the head cut off, they'll be no major 
trouble any time soon.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I do hope we gave them a few lengthy nightmares 
to keep them company, at least.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
There's still something we need to do, right? Or do 
we already have the full story?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
The boy said some interesting stuff before, but due 
diligence is half the job.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where is he anyways?

My head swiveled to find the man from before 
squatting over the dead body of the bandit leader.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Forget something?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ilvanis to... bard man!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course... this was already one of those days. We 
don't even have your name yet, do we?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: True. I do not believe we had a chance.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Haha... Serendipitous, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: (Clears throat)

The man spun on his heel all the way to a standing 
position. He found himself looking down on the 
smaller Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey... A little close.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
My greatest condolences! Introductions are more 
than just a formality, of course.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You may refer to me as Rowan. I am a traveling 
bard from the Kingdom of Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
My journey brought me to Rabaneau so
I could offer my services in aiding
the weary soldiers.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So basically what we already knew. A bad bard that 
pissed off a group of bandits.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
A bit unfair of an assessment, do you not think? 
Perhaps a ballad would change your tune?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah, I think it might be your tune that's the issue. 
What with the bandits wanting to kill you.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You do wound me, good sir.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
If anything, my song soothed their aching hearts... 
after I won their life savings in a game of chance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That's... probably something we should talk to you 
in more detail about... later.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Anyways, it's nice to meet you. My name is Anton 
Baranov.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Along with my father, Ivan, and a comrade, Satia, 
we are all members of the Nightless Crow 
Mercenary Corp.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A pleasure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We'll see how long that sentiment lasts in this sit-

A feeling of pressure encompassed me from behind. 
A soft... elastic... pressure.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
"Comrade"? So unfamiliar, my little Pup. I thought 
we were closer.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: C- Ca-... Can't... breathe...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Perhaps it's time we discussed this properly. Why 
not call me "Auntie Satia" from now on?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Let... me... go...!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
What was that? It's four simple syllables. "AUN-TIE 
SA-TIA"

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not... Not on... your life...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Haha! What a beautiful display of
camaraderie!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Perhaps I could slide-

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Rowan, was it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed. It's been a pleasure.

Perhaps you'd like payment for your assistance 
here?

I do have my winnings... from...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Winnings... from...?

Rowan looked down to find a rope tied around his 
wrists. Ivan finished tightening the knot.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...Pardon?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
By your account, you are the centerpiece of these 
recent disturbances in the region.

And as you said, we are by the border and the war. 
To say it simply, these matters are not taken
lightly.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Am I under arrest, my good sir?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Something like that. At least until the matter is 
investigated fully.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Just be happy we aren't handing you over to the 
governors. Last time we spoke  there was some 
yelling over "making an example" out of somebody.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, so kind of you... my saviors...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Pup. Head out and round up the other teams. 
We're heading back to town.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Say it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aun...tie... fuck you...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Serendipitous, isn't it...?

The continent of Ilvanis. The year is 813.

To the east lies the ages old Holy War and crusades 
of the Covenant. Their target being the declining
dynastic nation, the Emerald Empire.
The central plains house the expansionist Republic 
of Rabaneau and their current war against the
Nolvanus Empire.
Westward even more, therein lies the prosperous 
trade hubs along the Crimson Sea, like the city 
state of Lockhart and the Kingdom of Cartenan.
To the south lies the Outlands, a mysterious region 
ill documented in our modern time.

The future days are shrouded in mystery as the 
theaters of war and peace reach stagnation points.

What fate is in the store for this growing world? 
Which levy shall break?

Only the Goddess may truly know.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It's good to see a friendly face.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Everything's relative, I suppose.

Your current value, relative to us,
relies on what you know, after all.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
P- Perhaps I can also offer a melody for your 
troubles?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How did this turn out this way?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Snake eyes.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am inclined to think their pursuit turned into an 
obsession after I won against their commander in a 
high stakes gamble.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I didn't need another reason to want to kill the 
guy. How ridiculous.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... *sigh*...

My hand gripped the sword even tighter, and my 
heavy panting subsided while I collected myself.

The figure across from me wore armor from head 
to toe and reflected my own visage.

lines.speaker: Armored Figure
lines.text: Hmph.
I smiled in response. This would be the last blow.

With a step forward, the heavy mail felt like 
feathers to my mind and the sword like any other.

His step matched mine and the two curtains of 
steel rallied forth towards a barrage of power 
to end it once and for all.
And so, steel came unto steel, until a winner 
was decided.

It was...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh!

I squirmed as a heavy weight entrapped my body. 

It wasn't long before my senses were jolted 
entirely to consciousness by a tongue swiping 
itself across my face.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: G- Good afternoon to you, too.

In the corner of my vision, I spotted another figure 
to the side of my bedding. This one was 
positioned like he just dropped something.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You're awake. Good.

We're busier than normal with today's mission. You 
are now tasked with purchasing supplies in town 
for the corp at large.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What? Since when did we do that solo?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Jakson has volunteered to accompany you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The... dog...? You're not serious, are you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Try to finish up before the evening meal. We'll 
be questioning the prisoner at that point.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Wait!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess this is why we're called the 'Nightless 
Crows'... No rest for the weary.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And you're just excited for dinner? Can't say I 
blame you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Might as well get on it.

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Jakson... boy... move, please?

Jakson panted out a few chords that almost 
sounded like a chuckle to me. He did eventually 
get off me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We could probably hang some of the 
groceries around your neck.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whine*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No complaints. We both know I can't carry a 
week's worth of food for a dozen plus people by 
myself.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

The camp was full of a hustle and bustle as we 
made out way through it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Pup? I'm lucky to have caught you before heading 
out.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Thank you for volunteering to handle the supply 
run today. I have a list prepared already for you to 
follow.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That really isn't the issue here.

My eyes skimmed over the parchment she 
handed me before running off.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Seems pretty standard. Though...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Boy, you think we should sneak a little more meat 
into the stock?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I knew you'd be on my side. You're actually a 
pretty good partner for this.

Jakson raised his head like he was trying to 
exude confidence.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Enough people to drive the governors into a panic. 
This place is packed.)

We made our way through the village. It had seen 
an influx of people from the local bandit raids in 
the region.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...and how about this one?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whine*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rotten, then?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
You'd trust a dog over me? I've been at this for 
decades!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Come on, boy. There are better vendors to peruse.

(This guy is probably just trying to push what stock 
he has left because the mob already got 
everything good.)

The man scoffed, but he quickly found a 
different potential buyer to focus his attention on.

Our footsteps away from there left us at the stall of 
a more well stocked vendor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ma'am. You're not trying to sell rotten fruit, are 
you?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
By the Goddess, no. Was that basket of apples last 
time not any good?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, n- no... Sorry, I didn't recognize you. The 
apples were good.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Haha... You're not the only one of your mercenary 
corp to stop here. I was blessed with a bit 
more assistance in remembering you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I am... sorry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Even if it wasn't for that, I'd gladly do business 
here.

I was able to get much of Satia's list from the nice 
merchant lady.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Have you been able to bulk up at all?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...What?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Wasn't that you? The one who wanted to put 
meat on their bones last time?

...

Sorry! That must have been incredibly rude if I 
confused you for another one of your corp!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It... might have been?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
I was just wondering if you wanted to buy some of 
my new stock of premium beef?

I could feel a little drool on my lip as she presented 
a prime steak cut. I had already bought a little 
more meat than usual, but this looked delicious.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What do you think boy?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We'll if you say so...

I had opened my wallet only to find its capacity 
coming up short. My hopes sank.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe I could get her to come down on the price 
a little? How should I go about this?)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Ask for a bulk discount. / Try to leverage your history here. / Feign disinterest to get a discount.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I would love to buy it, but... I'm a bit short on the 
remaining funds.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I did buy quite a lot from you already. You wouldn't 
by chance be willing to give a little discount?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It'd certainly do a lot to make me remember you 
and want to do business with you in the future.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whine*...

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Hmm... Well...

I guess it can't hurt. It's not that large of 
a discount.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: T- Thank you!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I would love to buy it from such a lovely lady, but... 
I'm a bit short on the remaining funds.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You said you've been getting a lot of my corp 
buying from you lately, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We've been buying a lot... so maybe you'd consider 
giving me a discount on it?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whine*...

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Hmm... Well...

I guess it can't hurt. It's not that large of 
a discount.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Really? Thank you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's a bit much. Looks like a quality product, but I 
don't think I can realistically buy it.

Maybe if it was a little cheaper, but... Oh well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Come on, Jakson. We should start heading back.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Haha... If you want a discount, then why not just 
ask for it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... uh... mean... I can't afford it so I... shouldn't...

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
You never know what an opportunity can provide 
you until you've at least tried, it after all.

With all the business your group has given me, I 
can give a little bit of a discount.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... thank you.

The nice merchant packaged up my purchases and 
helped me hang some of it around Jakson's neck 
like a collar, much to his displeasure.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Perhaps this is a bit presumptuous of me, but you 
remind me a bit of my own child.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... Pardon?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Always trying their best. Trying to live up to their 
expectations. Trying to be a hero like father.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
I refer specifically to my own child. You just feel 
like a go getter, too.

Haha... apologies. I jumped ahead a bit much 
there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... won't pretend to know your son's situation well 
enough to compare.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Need to get going, though. Hopefully we'll be in 
town long enough to speak again.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
My son?

Haha... I don't have the heart to tell the boy that I 
meant my daughter.

We stopped by a spice shop for preservatives 
with the last remaining funds, and slowly 
found our way back into camp.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*... There... we... go!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just in time for supper, too.

My hand dropped to rustle the fur on Jakson's 
head.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Pup, you've returned with provisions?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I managed to get everything on Satia's list, yes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It was no problem.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Good.

My father passed by with a light hand tap on my 
shoulder before walking off.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yes, I'm excited for the prime steak we got, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Don't tell anyone and I'll even split it with you.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Soft bark*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Heh. Good boy.

Now let's see if I can get back to that nice dream 
from earlier. Before supper, at least.

lines.speaker: Telegraph
lines.text: *Click* *click* *click*

I took a sip of water from my mug. The 
clicking sound stopped.

With a glance to the side, I saw my fellows as 
calm as ever.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You two... okay?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I am fine.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Is something wrong?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No one else is getting annoyed by that?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, nothing's wrong. I just-

lines.speaker: Telegraph
lines.text: *Click* *click* *click*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I'm just going to go check on my father...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Do you think something happened?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Something inane, I imagine.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
And how much money did you win off them? Or at 
least claim to?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Enough to treat myself and a lady friend to a 
magnificent meal that night.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Again... Specifics, please...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That would require me to have counted it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
What I received was... more like a burlap sack. With 
a money symbol painted on it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I assumed he had previous problems with losing it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hello, you two. Going well?

After stepping into their view, I pulled up a chair 
and seated myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That bad?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I would accommodate you as a new arrival, but...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...alas, I am somewhat tied up at this time.

He waved at me. There was still rope tied tightly 
around his wrists.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I may regret this, but is there anything I can do to 
help?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Doubtful.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not even something minor?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I need to find an excuse to stay over here. At 
least for a little while.)
Ivan tilted his head in thought.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What about... if I...

...?

From the corner of my eye, I saw a man in a regal, 
fanciful outfit badgering the barkeep.

After a few seconds, their gaze turned towards us.

lines.speaker: Fancy Man
lines.text:
Good day! Good day! Might you be the leader of 
the Dayless Doves?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You mean Nightless Crows?

lines.speaker: Fancy Man
lines.text:
Yes, yes. Whichever.

Now, to answer the question...?

Ivan looked him over. After a few seconds to  
consider if he was a threat, he relaxed and then 
spoke.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Yes. I am.

lines.speaker: Fancy Man
lines.text:
Perfect! We're in need of a good few dirtied hands.

I am from the council of Lockhart, and I have 
a proposal for you.

For the sum of-

Ivan raised his hand to silence the man, and then 
turned to me.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Pup. I'll speak to this gentlemen about the job he 
wants done. Take the boy to sit with the others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sure.

With a push off the table's edge, I found 
myself back on my own two feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Come on, bard boy.

Grasping at his cloak, I pulled Rowan up along 
with me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do you not remember my name?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No time. Hurry up.

I guided Rowan away from the table and could 
only hear a little of the proceeding conversation.

lines.speaker: Fancy Man
lines.text: ...with a birthday coming... need of protection...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(At least I was able to get something to do in the 
end...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait...)

lines.speaker: Telegraph
lines.text: *Click* *click* *click*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ngh...!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... It's like the pitter patter of a soulful drum~

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Is that what was on your mind before, Pup?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Like I said. Something inane.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What even is it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What is... the telegraph?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do they not have them in Rabaneau?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't think I've ever seen one before.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It is a bit unusual to see one in a tavern.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
They've not been around so long as to be 
common. Usually, it's government buildings 
housing them.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
From my understanding, a telegraph line here 
implies it is part of the emergency broadcast 
network.
With the continuing war between Rabaneau and 
Nolvanus, more than a few parties wished for a 
more immediate news cycle.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: How many of those well wishers reside in Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Yes, I imagine the merchants there would love to 
be able to react more quickly to changing trends.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I wouldn't be surprised if the main communications 
hub was within that city.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (So it's a communication method?)

lines.speaker: Telegraph
lines.text: *Click* *click* *click*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...But... all it does is click?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It is an encoded message. There is meaning behind 
the pattern of clicks.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Can you translate?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...I cannot.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The last message was something about... troop  
movements to the east?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That or a new sale on eastern wares?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: My, my... Yet you somehow can?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Bits and pieces. It would be ill-advised for a meister 
like myself to not familiarize myself with a new beat.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... Perhaps I can send a message of my own?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Do not get your hopes up. You need red magic to 
be able to create the bursts of energy used in 
the system.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(A communication method based entirely around 
magic?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait, does that mean they've got some poor noble 
sitting on the other end? Clicking away day 
and night?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well... Not only nobles can use magic. See this 
rascal we picked up today.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...He can?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Heheh... another bit of plunder from an eventful 
night out.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Though, might it be too much trouble to ask for it 
back?
Satia pulled out a small necklace from her pouch.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
And leave our little prisoner armed? No, I think we'll 
hold onto your heirloom for now.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Without an heirloom, no one is a threat to 
use magic.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, but shouldn't my aptitude in wielding the 
goddess's blessings be proof of my noble character?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Nobility is more appearances than character.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah well... It was worth the attempt...
I scratched my nose as I eyed the telegraph.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I wonder if I could use that magic to stop that 
relentless clicking.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Can I try using it?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Eh...? So quick...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(So much for that plan. I wanted to break that 
noisemaker...)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Most people cannot use magic, anyways. It's 
supposed to be a sign of nobility.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
We can add our friend here to the list of 
exceptions I've seen over the years, though.
She patted Rowan on the head.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmph. I always knew I was special.

Norde's look of disbelief seemed to grab 
Rowan's attention.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I do not believe we've been introduced.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am Rowan, a traveling bard. Do let me know if I 
can ever serve to soothe your worries.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I am Norde. Second in command of the Nightless 
Crows.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Oh?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: And that is all you need to know.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Are you native of Rabaneau?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Huh...? Oh right. He said he's from Cartenan, 
right?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(If he's from a far northern kingdom like that,
then perhaps people like Norde could look out of
place to him.)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmph.

Norde just scoffed and returned to sipping on 
his drink.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I... meant no offense.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Don't worry. People can be prickly about their 
pasts.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Norde, a question.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: How long out are we covered for? Money wise?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
As of my last estimates a few days ago? About a 
month.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Is that not good?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: We've little choice, then.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Did something happen?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah, did that Lockhart council guy tell you 
something weird?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
He... made a strong offer on a job, but we need to 
be there by tomorrow afternoon.

Norde. Satia. Prepare supplies for a small dispatch 
mission to Crossing's Crown.

The others can stay and complete the protection 
contract for this region while we are there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Really? We never take jobs outside of Rabaneau...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Understood.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Sure thing, boss.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What about the bard guy?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: My name is Rowan...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Hmm...

Would you prefer to be interrogated by us or by 
the local governors?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You, of course. I value the hairs on my head.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Then we'll drag him along and finish it up in the 
downtime.

Pup, keep him in line.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, what?! Why me?

Ivan, Norde, and Satia had already started making 
their way out of the tavern.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, what fun we'll have.

Rowan, smile and all, rested his head on 
my shoulder.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...

We spent the next day heading westward to the 
crossroads of Nolvanus, Rabaneau, and the 
coastal city states.
After stopping in the city of Crossing's Crown to 
resupply, we took up residence in an old defensive 
outpost.
The Nightless Crows had been hired to act as 
protection on the outskirts.

Lockhart, one of the city states that made up the 
West Auran Alliance, was having a celebration.

It was a city wide birthday party for their 
princess, and they decided to hire extra security.

Such an action was, of course, merely 
precautionary.

Lockhart, due to it's strength as a maritime trade 
hub, had long warded off danger by it's value 
alone.
No one wished the international escalation an 
aggressive move against them would incite.

So, of course, we only committed a portion of our 
numbers to take on the well paying job.

It would be an easy task, after all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...and who was it that you had this dinner with?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Her name?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What was it...? Linda? Lucia? Luna?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I wonder if she even remembers your name herself.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Hmm... A better question then. Did she say where 
she was from?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why would that matter?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas, our pleasantries did not expand to such a 
topic.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Had you met her before this encounter?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It was our first meeting.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Had anyone approached you about your actions 
during these events? In any capacity?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, there it is.

That... that is the real question, is it not?

Did our beloved bard involve himself in grander 
designs within the chaos incited?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Hm... 

Then you understand well enough.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I cannot say anything stood out to me.

Mayhaps you deign me worthy of your worries, 
though? Something may spark a memory within.

Norde and Rowan seemed to stare at each other 
awkwardly until I felt the need to speak up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde... What is he talking about? Is there
something here I'm not aware of?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I imagine an extension of the war.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
What of it, then? A new wide scale invasion? Into
Nolvanus? Into Rabaneau?

Or perhaps a sprint across a border for an 
Oathbreaker?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah. Might you be working for the Covenant?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We are not. We are working for the governors of 
the Rabaneau region we came from.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oathbreaker? Aren't those all held in protection by 
the Covenant?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It is irrelevant. The boy just wants to distract with 
dramatics.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Again. Have you been approached by anyone that 
seems suspicious at all?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Heh.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: As I said, I have no awareness of such an event.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Very well. We had a few men checking your story 
at the restaurant.

We'll know if you are trustworthy upon our return.

With a scuff of the chair, Norde was on his feet. He 
reached over to place his notes in the group's 
supply pack.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, have your comrades returned?

My father and Satia had headed out to conduct 
a patrol.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I'll go check. Both of you...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...both of you stay out of trouble. I rather not 
waste rope securing two people.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, yeah.

Rowan raised his tied up wrists, and he gave Norde 
a hearty wave goodbye.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What a pleasant conversation.

I grabbed a chair and placed myself across 
from Rowan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
He can get a stick up his ass when left behind with 
me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Clears throat*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Let's pick up where he left off.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah! Shall we have some discourse, then?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Excellent. I did have some questions I wished to 
ask of you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not that stupid. I'll be the one asking the 
questions.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Very well. Do go on.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Let's see. What can I say to get some good info 
out of him?)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Offer to assist his goal to help weary soldiers. / Ask to hear the song he claimed to sing. /  Talk about the governors' retaliation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You said you came here to help the morale of 
soldiers, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We actually work a lot in those capacities. Assisting 
soldiers, I mean.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe we can find a way to help each other?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm... An interesting proposition.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I'm gonna regret this.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You said that you sang to the bandit group, yes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I would be... bereft of context should I leave that 
stone unturned.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, does the temptations of the siren's song reach 
you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You do know we're trying to resolve this without 
letting the governors do whatever, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It would be... unfortunate if their desire to placate 
the locals' anger fell onto you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Something. Anything you can tell us can let us 
better understand where that anger should be 
directed.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I trust you to not leave me to a terrible fate that I 
have not earned.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How about we just-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, shouldn't they...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Tsk... I've never fought soldiers before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Don't blame me for what's about to happen. Blame 
your superior officer for this stupid move of their's.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: This was supposed to be a simple job.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I'm not one to leave the job half done, though. 
Prepare yourself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Why? Why would they invade?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Sigh*... The fools...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
For the sake of everyone's happiness. I will do what 
I must.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
So they are an organized army unit, in the end... 
This will complicate things.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Perhaps it could serve as a good test of my training, 
at least.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Stay here. I'll go check what's going-

I turned to see Rowan reaching towards the 
supply pack on the table. He pulled out his 
heirloom. The one that allowed magic.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- How did you get free?!

The ropes that were around his wrists were strewn 
across the edge of the table.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, are you still here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then, please allow me to assist. I believe you'll 
require my skills.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
T- The ropes were tight. We... checked that 
recently.
My hands hovered around the grip of my sword.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

Hm hm... I wonder how you'd react?

Rowan fastened his heirloom necklace around his 
neck and then pulled up his sleeve to reveal 
a bracelet.
It was a bracelet with a small antique key 
connected to it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Eul'avais. Have you heard of it?

It is... 

...an Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What?!

(An... Oathbreaker?! Of THE Oathbreakers?!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Then... he's broken the oath to the Goddess?!)

You are... a corrupted soul?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I'm sure your concern for my purity would make 
the Covenant proud.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas, the laws of the Goddess can be quite 
inconvenient at times.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Like with certain overeager chastity devices...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Overeager... w- what now?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Such purity yourself. We make a fine pair of yin 
and yang.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
An Oathbreaker can create miracles and curses 
that defy the laws of the Goddess's domain.

Eul'avais is capable of undoing any restraint. 
Bindings, locks, and beyond.

Rowan spun his wrist as if to showcase the item 
in his possession.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Did you notice your friend locked the door behind 
him?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(What?! Goddess damn you, Norde! I'm not here 
to be babysat!)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: If you wish to help him...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...well, if you do, I will note that time is not likely 
on our side.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Bandits... Pillaging, maybe? Even civilians are 
distracted with the festivities, so there is a
sick sense to that logic.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
F- Fine. But if you do as much as raise your hand 
against a single one of us...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I wouldn't dare. You are much too... peculiar... to 
lose my sight on now.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Shall we?

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies

Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan or Norde die.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
If we're to reach him in time, we need to get 
through the locked door.

If Rowan, or any unit with a key or the skill 
"Unlock" move next to a door, they can 
unlock it. The same applies to chests.
Keys are 1 use only, while Rowan's Oathbraker has 
unlimited uses. 

At the same time, only Rowan can make use of the 
Eul'avais he now has in his inventory.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Why is the... person of interest... no longer bound? 
Anton, did you release him?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What? No, he-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I was able to break free myself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: There is no need to worry. I simply wish to help.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You kind folk are my best bet to not be drawn and 
quartered during my next foray into Rabaneau, 
after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(We can deal with his situation after everyone else 
is accounted for.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're safe. Now where are the others?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yes, let's focus on that.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Groups of bandits seem to be swarming from the 
east.

They're taking advantage of the celebration to 
loot the surrounding areas. Be alert.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, is that the chattering of hooves?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: There are so many of them.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: It may very well be more than one mercenary corp.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Might they be working together?

Jakson's head perked up as he looked across the 
field.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It is.

Norde raised his hand to create a signal that 
Ivan replicated.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Time to regroup.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: What's your situation?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We've neutralized what bandits we've come across. 
Others have likely passed the encampment already.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Our team identified small roving groups heading 
westward.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The fort had an emergency telegraph.

We should...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: More?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Wait... But these are...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Soldiers? Where from, though?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: *Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Those... Those are Imperial army uniforms. They're 
from Nolvanus.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What? I thought... Wasn't it bandits that were 
looting?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We need to send a message to Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Aim for the enemy commander. Disrupt their chain 
of command so we can focus on getting a message 
out.

Win Condition: Defeat the enemy commander.

Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Norde or Ivan die.

Win Condition: Defeat the enemy commander.

Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan,or Ivan die.

Time for some rescuing! ...What do you mean 
Norde was already rescued? That's actually not 
what I mean.
There is a mechanic in the game called "Rescue".
With it, cavalry and flying type units can shield and 
carry another unit.
It uses up turns, but it can also help move less 
mobile units faster across maps. Both cavalry and 
fliers can also move after picking up the ally.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Without their commander, the soldiers have begun 
to scatter.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right, if we have a second, then...

I looked over at Rowan. He seemed to be 
dedicated despite his earlier attitude.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I guess the Oathbreaker thing can wait...
for now...)

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
It's enough of opening to act, then? 
We should hurry with a message.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Right, priorities.)

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Rowan, correct?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Y- Yes?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: The telegraph. Can you send a message?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I can make an attempt.

Rowan placed himself next to the telegraph 
transmitter and held the charm on his necklace 
tightly.
After a deep breath, Rowan began tapping away 
at the device.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Huh?

There's... no resistance?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Dammit... The line's been cut.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So this... Is this all coordinated?

Ivan stood there for several seconds both 
thinking and calming himself.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
We'll have to ride for Lockhart.

We've no time to waste.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
There it is. Peeking out over the horizon... 
Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Light! So much brilliant light!

There was a girl with stars practically swimming 
around her head. She was hugging the floor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... Are you okay? How long were you in there?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I don't know. It felt like a year.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's sort of a bad time for this. Can you get out of 
here? The town isn't too far away.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
The town...

I don't wanna.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I didn't realize it was a choice.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why are you even here?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
I woke up in a field a bit ago. I'm a bit fuzzy on 
how, but after that I went to town.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
"Be a waitress, it's just like farming" they said.

Well, as a farmer, at least I didn't get locked in a 
prison cell as a prank!

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
I think...

They really weren't helpful with my patchy 
memories either.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This place is just getting progressively more 
dangerous, you know?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Can I stick around with you nice people? I don't 
want to go back to that town.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: You need a farmer? I've done that before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We. Are. On. A. Battlefield.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Then I can try to fight! I might not be great, but I 
don't think I'd be a hindrance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This isn't how saving people is supposed to go...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I can't control you. Just try to not get hurt, 
please?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Right!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: That necklace...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Necklace...? Ah, right.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Given the dire circumstances, it seemed only 
appropriate for me to use whatever I could to help.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Help... who exactly?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: No need to fret. I am on your side.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Just remember that if you give me reason to regret 
you having that...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'll fix it by ensuring there isn't a neck left for it to 
hang on.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I... understand...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
There you are, boy. Everything go well while you 
were out with the patrol?
I gave Jakson a pet on the head.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Concerned bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, we'll take them out. You and me together.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm sure I can get you a nice treat if you try extra 
hard, too.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: I heard you can encode telegraph messages.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: In a limited capacity, yes.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Good. We may need to rely on you.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Are you not going to give me the evil eye like your 
comrades?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Do you want me to? Give me a reason, then.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Message... taken.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: How did you get past the locked door?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Is this really the time? I'll just keep it on the 
downlow for now.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The locks are old and can be knocked open easily.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey! Before I forget... You forgot something.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Missing your axe? Feeling a little lonely out here 
with just a lance?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm... Thank you, I suppose.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Is Pup okay?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Anton seems to be faring well enough despite the 
scenario.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Thank you for looking after him.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It's no problem. He is your son, in the end.

As we saddled our horses two a piece, we began 
our long ride westward for Lockhart.

We were not the first to make that journey this 
day.

First, civilians aplenty made the daytrip into the city 
for the birthday festivities.

Next, bandits began their pillaging. They pushed 
their way further and further into the state's 
borders.

By our best estimation... This was a trap. It was a 
distraction.

As the bandits were causing chaos, the Nolvanus 
Imperial Military slipped through the border.

They took strategic location after strategic location. 
Communications lines were cut.

Even if a message had been delivered in time, it 
would've been about the bandits' incursion over 
any military one.
We rushed as much as we could to the crown 
jewel city state of the West Auran Alliance: 
Lockhart.

It was only a hope that we would make it in time 
to make a difference.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Fighting has broken out...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're too late?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Too late to warn the city, yes.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Should we fall back, then? The mission is a failure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We can't just leave the city to this fate.)

I jumped off the horseback and started towards 
the city proper.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We should stay and fight!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Fight what? For what? We are not an army of 
Lockhart, or of any kind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No. We're not an army...

My shoulders slumped, and my grip on the sword 
handle faltered.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap it is not my place to say...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But there are civilians caught between the blades. 
Even more so because of the celebrations.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Even if we're not... we're here now..

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We can at least try to help keep the people safe.

Norde approached me. He was uncomfortably and 
intimidatingly close.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- It's... It's the right thing to do.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That it is.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A hero's gambit, have you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Yeah. Like a proper hero.)

I breathed a deep breath as the tension from 
speaking up was let loose.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Ivan, what was it that Harold used to say all the 
time when he led the Crows?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
"A job's not worth doing if you're not willing to go 
all the way"?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Something like that, yes. And you take it as a creed 
for the Crows?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Sir, shall we map out a plan of action?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Hmph. I'm not heartless. Best to not leave the job 
half done, then?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I think the old boss would be happy if he could see 
this moment.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Sir, shall we map out a plan of action?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Best to not leave the job half done, then? Didn't 
Harold used to say that?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Like a mantra.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
That's that, then.

We've been hired to protect Lockhart, her 
princess, and her people.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Shall we?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Definitely!

(We can do this. I can.)
I tightened my grip on my sword.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Just... try not to be reckless, please.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We can start by...

Norde began to quickly set out a rudimentary 
plan for us to follow.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right... right...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mi-!

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Hmm... *scratches chin*

It looks like the rush from the birthday celebrations 
have died out.

Guess they must've made their way to Lockhart by 
now.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Ngh... Eh... My back.

The merchant started to shuffle through his wares 
as he prepared to close up shop for the day.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Hm?

He stopped mid stretch, and his head tilted to look 
behind him.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Uh... what?
It was...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H-Hey. Could...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What did you want again, Norde?
There were two people saddled on a horse.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A sweet potato.

One was a stern looking man that seemed to be a 
mix of Taikolyn and Einlyn races.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right. What about everyone else...?
The other was a young man with a smallish stature.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Must I do your job for you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- No! I got it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sir, please. One sweet potato... an apple... and... 
and... two loafs of peach bread?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that even right...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I... do not know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Satia's gonna kill me if we got the orders wrong...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The others are gonna be angry if we got the 
orders wrong...

The merchant stood there, still in mid-stretch, and 
looked at the two in bewilderment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sir?!
The boy was holding out money.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: What's happening now?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're in a bit of a hurry. Can we buy the food or 
not?!

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Hm... I suppose.

The merchant headed over to pack up the items, 
though he did so at a relaxed pace.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I knew we should've tried the next stall over.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Come on, come on, come on.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
...

*Scratches chin*

Here you go.

The sack of food was snatched up at a feverish 
pace and quickly replaced with coin.

Within a few blinks of the eye, the horse had 
already started to fade from distance.

Though one thing could be heard like a quiet 
whisper in the wind...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: THANK YOU!

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Hmm... *scratches chin*

You're welcome.

After a relaxed pivot back to the stall, the 
merchant continued to pack his wares.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: What do you think it's about?

lines.speaker: Other Villager
lines.text:
I wonder if it has to do with the smoke coming 
from the north a couple days ago?

lines.speaker: Another Villager
lines.text:
*Yawn*... Who cares? I just want it to end so I 
can get back to helping with the farm.

A crowd gathered around a small stage.

Creaks accompanied a dip in the chatter of the 
crowd. A figure soon stood atop the stage for 
all to see and hear.

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text:
Now, now. Calm down everyone. 
The announcement won't come any quicker.

lines.speaker: Other Villager
lines.text: Does this have to do with Lockhart!?

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text:
*Sigh*... What did I just say?

We are translating the finalized message from the 
telegraph network as we speak.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What did he say? Was it something about 
Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: They haven't started yet, I think?

In the recesses of a darkened alley, two sets of 
ears did their best to listen in from beyond the 
edge of the crowd.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Tsk. If only I could hear it less muffled.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
That's probably a chance that we wouldn't want 
to take...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I know, I know... But still...

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text: ...there it is... begin soon...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I heard that, at least.

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text: Here we are, then. Let's get started.
The mayor cleared his throat.

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text:
"Citizens of our sister city within our Alliance..."

"We of Lockhart apologize for any confusion the 
recent disturbance may have caused. It would 
appear that..."

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I think he's claiming the same stuff that the 
Imperial General claimed the other day.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Bastards...

lines.speaker: Other Villager
lines.text: Another power struggle in one of the big cities?

lines.speaker: Another Villager
lines.text: *Yawn*... Was just a matter of time.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Lockhart has been pretty stable, though? I don't 
recall them ever having a leadership shuffle before.

Not in my lifetime, at least.

The chatter of the crowd started to deafen the 
mayor's speech. But...

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text:
"We are pleased to inform you that the root cause 
of the disturbance has been identified and 
removed."
"As it stands..."

But a few words managed to cut through the noise 
as they bellowed from ear to ear.

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text: "...the traitors have been executed."

Time seemed to freeze for the two, but a hothead 
thawed through one's stasis quickly enough to 
speak.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm going to place a bullet... right through that 
general's eyes...

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text:
"...the exception lies with two descendants of the 
traitors' lineage."

"They are fugitives from justice."
The mayor cleared his throat as he finished.

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.text:
Soldiers may be passing through in their search of 
these fugitives, so we ask that you comply with 
anything they may need for this effort.
Outside of that, those of you with connections to 
Lockhart may wish to reach out to family or 
business partners.
And... uh... that's it. Let's all make this as painless 
as we can.

The crowd had largely gone quiet. 

What was left of sound was small pockets of 
laughs and grumbling taunts. 

The dispersion of sound was soon followed with 
the crowd itself dispersing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Sis... We... We should head back to the inn. We 
can't stay here anymore.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Y- Yeah. Yeah. We should... do that...

My eyes opened, but I didn't move.

With a turn of my head, my eyes looked over to 
see my father sleeping in the other bed. 

The restlessness that had plagued him prior was 
a thing of the past.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh...

Some hair had found itself surprising me as it fell 
into my eyeline. I quickly brushed it aside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*

With an exasperated sigh, I found myself placing 
my arm over my eyes to block out the light.

I thought back on to the event that happened a 
couple days prior: The attack on Lockhart.

Ever since then, our group had stayed at an inn 
south of the city. We didn't have a plan, but my 
father's injuries made moving him dangerous.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Why?

(Why did this happen? Why would the Goddess let 
this...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...the Goddess...?
A memory popped into my head.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas, the laws of the Goddess can be quite 
inconvenient at times.

An Oathbreaker can create miracles and curses that 
defy the laws of the Goddess's domain.

Rowan spun his wrist as if to showcase the item in 
his possession.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Eul'avais is capable of undoing any restraint. 
Bindings, locks, and beyond.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... almost forgot about that.

In the quiet, I could hear the faint sound of 
plucked strings from beyond the room's door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...and I never told anyone...

Within my next breath, I found my feet touching 
the floor and guiding me to the sound I heard.

As deftly as I could, my steps led to me to a 
doorway to the inn's lobby.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm...

The plucks of strings proved to be louder, and I 
peaked around the corner to see Rowan, Norde 
and others lazing about without much to do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How to approach this? The man... well...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmm...

(Breaking the Oath to the Goddess is one thing... 
We also found him in suspicious circumstances 
when we first came across him.)
(He and Norde talked about an escalation of the 
war between Nolvanus and Rabaneau, too.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Could he really have had a role in that...? I could 
imagine someone who'd be willing to use an
Oathbreaker to do that, but...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How should I handle this?)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Ask Rowan directly about his intentions / Manipulate Rowan into admitting his intentions / Force Rowan to admit his intentions

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Dammit, I'll just ask the guy. If he's planning stuff, 
then maybe he is willing to just admit it.)
I rounded the corner to enter the room.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton, there you are. Do you feel rested?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Better enough to not have to be dragged every 
which way it seems?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Maybe enough so that a little ballad could soothe 
your worries now?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We need to talk.

I grabbed a chair and pulled myself to a place across 
from Rowan at the table.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Perfect. Then I've some questions I'd like to ask of 
you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How about this? A question for a question? We 
each need to answer honestly?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That does sound fun.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
As the guest to this party, I shall take the liberty of 
the first question?

I clicked my tongue quietly, but I nodded in 
agreement.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You and your father... from where do you hail?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
"Where I hail from"? You mean where I was... 
born? Or what?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Whatever strikes you as most appropriate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmm...

We've moved about for most of the life I can 
remember.

There was a place we lived at for a while when I 
was really young. You'd have to ask my father for 
specifics.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You remember nothing of it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of the place... I remember thinking it was pretty?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Doesn't really matter. My turn.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: How about your family

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Question for a question. It's my turn.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, very well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Alright then. My question is as thus.

Did you have anything to do with the attack on 
Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...Where did this come from?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is there a problem answering the question?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It seems more accusation than question. Would 
you humor my confusion?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You... have an Oathbreaker. You suddenly show up 
and everything just went to shit.

All after, you were being suspicious around the 
border, too. Even Norde thought it might have to 
do with the war.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just be truthful with me... Did you have something 
to do with the attack on Lockhart?

I could feel the gazes of Norde and others turn our 
way.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Would I be believed should I utter the word, "No"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why would I believe that you- you...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Goddess dammit..

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I just want to know who we can trust...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And you...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Hmm... I wonder... if I try to talk circles around 
him, would he just cough it up accidentally?)
I rounded the corner to enter the room.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton, there you are. Do you feel rested?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Better enough to not have to be dragged every 
which way it seems?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Maybe enough so that a little ballad could soothe 
your worries now?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Tempting, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Perhaps a bit later.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not be surprised when I remember this detail, 
then~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Want something to drink?

I paced between Rowan the the inn's tavern 
counter.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I would not object to some water.

With a twirl of my hands, I soon found myself 
returning to him with a mug of water.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Much thanks to you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You pass through inns often in your time?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
In and out for a time now, yes.

More so as I've found myself zigzagging along the 
border.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Right, you've been causing some havoc along the 
border.

I glided over to by the door, with my back turned 
to Rowan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where'd you come from before that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm...? Cartenan, as I've said.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean, you had to have come through a port or 
Nolvanus territory, no?

With a silence to greet me, I turned to Rowan and 
walked over to the table.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Does that matter?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- Well... If you traveled through inns across the 
land, you must have some stories to tell, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ever get a chance to break out that little key on 
your wrist?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Perhaps... a few times...

Rowan placed down the mug of water he had 
been drinking from.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I mean... you're walking around carrying an 
Oathbreaker. You must be using it for... good 
reasons?

I could feel the gazes of Norde and others turn our 
way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
C- Causing issues around the border... showing up 
with a forbidden artifact of all things...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...Where did this come from?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... *sigh*...

F- Fine. I didn't really plan this out, but...

The screeching of the chair rang in the room as I 
quickly pulled it out to sit across from Rowan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You had something to do with the attack on 
Lockhart? Even Norde thought you were up to 
something.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Would I be believed should I utter the word, "No"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you... messing with me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Goddess dammit...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Fuck this, I'm just going to force him to tell me 
what's going on with him.)
I rounded the corner to enter the room.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton, there you are. Do you feel rested?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Better enough to not have to be dragged every 
which way it seems?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Maybe enough so that a little ballad could-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Grk!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm doing great, Norde. Thanks for asking.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That is... excellent...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...excellent to hear...

I had grabbed Rowan by his clothes and thrown 
him against the wall. At least, I did so as well as I 
could.
Rowan already was a tall, lanky man. Now with my 
change there was a good head's worth of height 
between us.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What do I owe the surprise?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, this rough behavior...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Should I be worried about getting a bill afterwards?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... You still have that... Eul... something, yeah?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Is that what this is about?

Why yes. Yes I do. Eul'avais hangs from my wrist as 
we speak.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Why do you have an Oathbreaker?! And that crap 
you were doing around the border... Is that related 
to it?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I won it in a game of chance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Bullshit.

Were you trying to cause a distraction around the 
border?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Where has this come from?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You have an Oathbreaker. You suddenly show up 
and this crap drops all around us.

Were you helping with that invasion of Lockhart?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Would I be believed should I utter the word, "No"?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Heh. I'll take that as a no.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do as you wish.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Maybe I will...)

My fist rose to a cocked position.

But a few seconds passed and it sat there, shaking 
a little.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Goddess... dammit...

What little was left of my grip released and I 
stepped away from Rowan.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: An... Oathbreaker...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah. Turns out he's not quite an expert with locks 
like you may have thought.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: See the key around his wrist? That's it.
I slumped down into a chair.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup...

Satia walked over and placed a hand on 
my shoulder.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Are you sure?
Norde stared daggers at Rowan.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: How do you know?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
He told me. When he got free of his bindings. I... 
thought there were higher priorities to deal with at
the time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Who knows what else it could do? What it could've 
made happen in Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He could've been the one to cause... this all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm?

Norde's head turned towards the sound of 
footsteps outside the door.

Two familiar women walked through the opening 
door.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We need to- ...to...?

Charlotte and Mariel came through the door. 
Charlotte stood tall with a purpose, but...
...Mariel slinked off into a corner to take a seat.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Did something happen here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The bard might've had something to do with the 
Lockhart invasion.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Am I allowed to speak for myself?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Quickly.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I shall attempt so.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
On my wrist I possess Eul'avais... an Oathbreaker.

By that, our 'Pup' here-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You don't get to call me that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
*Clears throat*... Our "Mr. Anton Baranov, 
descendent of Ivan Baranov and-"

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Actually, I've not met your mother, have I?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Quicker.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... By that, it is believed I am one of those 
"behind the attack" on Lockhart... in some 
manner or another?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You were also skulking around the border before.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is not a small border.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Honestly, we mainly pursued that out of an 
abundance of caution. We didn't have a solid 
reason to think that.
Can't say how it'd translate to the attack, either.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
He's suspicious, but... What about the 
Oathbreaker? What could that mean?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: B- But... The Oathbreaker thing, still!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... What does it do?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He said it can undo bindings and locks.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah. We've seen it at times. Who knows what 
else it could do?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's really it? Then he's harmless.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What? But he-!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
He's just got some master key. Don't try to lock 
him up or leave him alone and he'll just be...

Charlotte had paced herself over to Rowan, where 
she leaned down and looked him in the eye.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...and he'll just be a little creepy.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, you should still throw him over to the 
nearest Covenant you come across, though.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Your words... They cut through me like a 
sharpened sword.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why are you so confident?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
One thing to know about Oathbreakers are that 
they can only do one thing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Couldn't it be an exception?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Would be news to me.

It's just the nature of them. They're really good at 
one thing, but that one thing is all they got.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Where did you learn all that...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How would you even know that?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph.
She pointed at herself.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I am an heir to Lockhart. Some stuff is basically an 
open secret when you live in those circles.

I was about to protest once more, but the creak of 
the floorboards interrupted me.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: She's right.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Those things break the Goddess's laws of nature in 
one very specific way. One way unique to each.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Sir... Should you be...?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Ah, why are you-? You need to get back to bed!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Your wounds should have you out of commission 
for a lot longer than this?!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: It's okay. I'm just a bit sore now.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
If anything, I actually feel good. Almost like a spring 
chicken.

My father grabbed a seat as we reluctantly agreed 
to put off dealing with Rowan until we were in 
safer waters.
Charlotte expedited the conversation to her own 
news from the town square.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And with that, we would appreciate an escort to 
the town's limits.

Afterwards, we can be on our way and you on 
yours.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Hmm... I've given this some thought.

Ivan bit down on some meat the inn was serving. 
After such a long rest, he appeared famished.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
The Crows used to have a saying... "A job's not 
worth doing if you're not willing to go all the way", 
I believe.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I think I've come to want to live up to that, as the 
current leader.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*, how eerily familiar?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: At least I do. The rest of you...

Ivan turned towards the other members of the 
Nightless Crows.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
You're free to return to the rest of the group 
when we have safe passage that way.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You really don't have to. This much is plenty.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I definitely think we should keep helping them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (After what happened...)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I think it is a beautiful sentiment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You don't get an opinion.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I had already written to the rest of our comrades 
with the assumption we would do as much.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Was there a doubt that we'd want to help?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Plus, how are you going to pay us without the
key to your vaults of riches?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Heh...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Alright. Alright. We shall see this through together, 
then?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Thank you... All of you...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Reassuring bark*...
Jakson nuzzled up against Mariel's leg.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You, too.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: We can... make things right.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then shall we make our escape as soon as we can?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Best not to move without a plan.
Ivan bit another large bite out of the meat.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: ...or an empty stomach.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I honestly don't think I've seen you so ravenous 
before, Dad...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then, as to a plan, where are we headed? I 
imagine the two options are Rabaneau or New 
Aureria?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Actually...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I don't think New Aureria can help us. They're too 
underdeveloped. No notable trade and no real 
army.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then the Republic of Rabaneau?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It does seem like they'd be all for stopping the 
Empire from controlling Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I don't want Rabaneau's help unless absolutely 
needed.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I never want to see another battle within those 
walls.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's not exactly much of a choice, though.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Not if we head to Ranakstown first.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
From there we could sail to the Kingdom of 
Cartenan and the Holy City of Oadthine.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Nolvanus wants to use Lockhart as a shipping hub 
for their war, right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
But with Cartenan and Oadthine, we could put a 
stranglehold on trade in and out of the city.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Couldn't the empire just conquer them, too?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
They might be to able to take Oadthine without 
Lockhart as a buffer...

But taking a holy city is just asking to be the next 
target of the Covenant's crusades.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: And Cartenan is the uninvadable country.
I looked at my father in confusion.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Do you not remember that from our lessons?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... uh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
"Cartenan is famous for being invaded multiple times 
by large armies only to repel them easily"...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, so we see the difference between retention 
and memory.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grr...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That is correct, Anton.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The Kingdom of Cartenan is the uninvadable 
country by that legacy.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Hmm...

We should head to Rabaneau, still.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But I just said-

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
You did. And it is a clever plan, but one they likely 
have thought of themselves, no?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
As predictable as force is, a wall will still crumble 
despite the foresight.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well...
A silence fell onto the group.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Get the innkeeper, Anton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right...

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Have you seen...

The man at the door could be heard describing 
Charlotte and Mariel.

lines.speaker: Innkeeper
lines.text: Hmm...

The innkeeper's eyes slid to look out of their 
corners at the two girls.

lines.speaker: Innkeeper
lines.text:
No, I can't say I have. I will keep an eye out, of 
course.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Thank you for your assistance.

A slight rattle could be heard as the wooden door 
closed, and the innkeeper passed by us without a 
word of his own.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Thank you, but... why?

lines.speaker: Innkeeper
lines.text:
More trouble than it's worth.

Just leave the money for your tab on the counter 
before you leave.
And with that, the man slipped around a corner.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: They already have soldiers here doing rounds?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No doubt they will be much more thorough on the 
next pass. We should leave immediately.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Let's move quickly, then.
