lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What about you? Are you actually okay to move?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah, with your injuries...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: I do, sincerely, feel perfectly fit to do this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(He's just that good, then? That strong... to shake 
off such an injury.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right. Let's get moving then.

After we grabbed our gear, the innkeeper let us 
leave via the backdoor.

While Charlotte and Mariel weren't likely to be 
recognized by locals easily, we also didn't want 
to draw attention to ourselves for no reason.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Ms. Charlotte, go with Norde. You will likely find him 
quite reliable.

Ms. Mariel, you can go with Pup. You can trust him 
as well.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
As for our companion no one trusts... 
I'll pair with him.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: We shall have a lovely, uneventful stroll, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Trusting me with the important task?
Ivan's hand landed on the top of my head.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Please... Just stay safe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No need to worry about me just because I've got 
this illness. 

I can do still hold my own in a-

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Anton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay. I will do my best.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Thank you.

Broken off into pairs with each of our guests 
getting an escort, we each took a different route 
out of the town.
My father walked away from me with a back that 
felt like I hadn't seen it in a long time. Like a view I 
hadn't seen since I was young.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It doesn't matter what barrier I need to get over. 
If I can't... then there's no point.)

I turned towards Mariel and we moved to our 
route.

Rowan and Ivan walked along the perimeter of the 
town square.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Rowan, correct?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Forgetful? You've asked as much before.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: The answer is yes, by the way.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
When we have ourselves at a safe distance, you 
can make yourself scarce.

Otherwise we will likely be obligated to hand you 
over to the Covenant.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

I think...

As Rowan spoke the words, his eyes drifted to a 
chest with some soldiers walking away from it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I think we could stand to have some insurance for 
our escape.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I could certainly get behind that, but... 
What do you have in mind?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I've an inkling of an idea.

Norde and Charlotte crossed the town via the port 
side outskirts.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Nolvanus has no navy, correct?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah. They don't have many ports that aren't 
frozen over most of the year.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What of Lockhart? Could they claim use of her 
fleet?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Maybe... I imagine a lot of money would need to 
change hands.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Perhaps now would not be the time, but 
you should find a moment to let yourself grieve.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, I'll grieve.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'll grieve by putting a bullet through that "Steel 
Wolf"'s head.

Then the general's.

And maybe the Emperor and Empress if they're 
brave enough to show their faces.

Charlotte, with a rage steaming beneath the 
surface, took the lead as they walked through the 
town.

Mariel and I went a different direction well away 
from the others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know, for such a small village, this place is... 
really developed.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah, well... Most villages I've been to of this size 
don't have tiled roads and the like.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Really? I had no idea.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I've never been far from Lockhart, outside of my 
schooling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe it has something to do with Lockhart being 
a prosperous trade hub?)

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I... sort of want to see them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The small villages?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're really not all that special.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
No, that was presumptuous of me. There's more 
important things to worry about that my idle 
curiosity.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Never say never, I guess. Give it some time.

Mariel wasn't sure what to say, but we were cut 
off by a voice.

lines.speaker: Imperial Soldier
lines.text: Hey, you two...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Crap...)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: And that is the last of my batch.
Rowan slid the top of a crate back into place.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
A few well timed explosions will serve to draw the 
ear of the soldiers away from our escape.

And no one shall get hurt bar a vegetable or two.

Spinning towards his feet, Rowan's gaze turned 
towards his partner in this endeavor, Ivan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Have you finished yours?

Rowan turned his gaze, and his eyes settled on a 
target out in the distance.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (This is the meeting point?)

My group approached the meeting point to see 
those that got here before us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Did you have any trouble?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One soldier stopped us to ask about them, but 
didn't seem to realize anything was amiss.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I think they even had some of the details about 
you two wrong.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That's what they get for organizing a manhunt in 
less than a day.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Thank the Goddess for poor people management 
skills, haha...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We can be thankful for that, then.
I looked around to see who was here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where's my father? Is he running... late...?

The sentence ended with me hearing frantic 
footsteps behind me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Gasp*... I... *pant*... We need to keep moving.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What happened?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Pant*... that... *pant*... Steel Wolf...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Not... much... *pant*... time. We need to move 
before the distraction... goes off...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait...

I looked at the path Rowan ran through for
signs of another person.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where's my father?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I was asked to give you this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

Rowan stepped up to me and placed a small locket 
in my hand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why are you...? What is...?
Then a memory struck me.

My vision sealed shut as the memory dropped 
itself into my mind's eye.

The pattern on the metal cover somehow felt 
familiar, and I hesitantly opened it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You said that "Steel Wolf" is here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yes. That man and his army. We've not time to 
dwell on it. We need to move.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'll be the judge of that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Apologies, but the decision has already been made. 
We either move or become the target of the 
soldiers.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Why? What did you do?
My grip on the locket tightened.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That man...

My heels pivoted as I turned towards a nearby wall 
to start scaling it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The soldiers? Is this related to where Ivan is?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No... No...

I pulled myself to the top of the wall and pivoted 
once more to the town we had just left.

Off in the distance, a few specks of my vision 
caught my eye at the other edge of the town.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There he is!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Your father?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And he has company. We need to go help him.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
We've not the time! He sent me ahead for a 
reason.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

Jakson looked up to me from the bottom of the 
wall. He seemed raring to go, as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, we can do this, boy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(How long would it take me to sprint all the way 
over there...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You all can flee if you want, I'm going to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grk!

Something wavered within me as I took the step 
to jump down from the wall.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...there it is... out of time... must leave...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... not... again...
My eyes went in and out of focus.

My legs and arms felt depleted of strength, and 
what balance I had was lost.

My hearing felt stilted when suddenly only bits and 
pieces of the outside world reached me.

And my eyes only regained clarity as the last sight 
to greet me was the ground below.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...

My groggy eyes opened to the sound of horse 
hoofs clomping on the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We need to... help...?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Finally awake?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton, are you okay to walk?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm fine. Where's my father? We need to go help.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It is... too late.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ivan and the bard decided to set off some small 
scale explosions in town.

While it served as a distraction during our 
absconsion from it, going back would only 
find the soldiers on high alert.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...What?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We must place our faith in Ivan, for now.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We'll make to Rabaneau, like he was suggesting, 
and wait for him there.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, but I-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We are past the point of decision making. A voyage 
to Cartenan can come later.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But we need-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton. We are past the point of decision making.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Hey, everyone... I think there's... soldiers ahead?

All of our eyes shifted to see a small group of 
soldiers on the horizon. They hadn't appeared to 
notice us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Princesses, what is along this path to the south?

Norde said as much as he pulled us out of their line 
of sight.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
More villages. They're probably searching them, 
too.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Vigilant we will be, then. Do not let yourself be 
distracted.

Be ready for whatever may turn the corner in front 
of us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Goddess... dammit... I have no choice, don't I?)
I tightly held the locket I was given.

I took the lead as we exited the town we had 
been staying in.

With a strong step forward, I was officially on our 
path to Ranakstown.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Deep breath*...
I slapped my cheeks a few times with vigor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: LET'S GO!!!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Huzzah!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Actually, why don't you just stay
behind?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Did our venerable auditor not give me some well of 
credibility to pull from?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Who knows? Maybe you mind controlled him with 
your Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, such abuse.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: If you keep it up, I may even come to enjoy it~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Can you not?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What are you supposed to be? A morning person?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am a man of many hours.

From day to night to the waning of either, I am 
gladly at your disposal.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...for services of any vice that invites your parlay~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Flirting at the first opportunity from a nearly 
complete stranger? I feel at home already.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap we not have traveled together for long...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But our relationship feels like one casted in the 
steel of days past.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh no. My loins. They burn.

Quick! Take this!
Charlotte dumped her pack into Rowan's hands.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What is-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Grk!

T- This weight...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I've always been a big fan of the vice of sloth. 
Thanks for offering your services.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: This is... not exactly... what I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What's the staring for? You want to take an extra 
load, too?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No, just... You're not what I was expecting of a 
princess.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What were you expecting?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well... I used to hear fairy tales about princesses. 
Saved by heroes and the like.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where they were graceful, kind, elegant...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Do tell me all about how I don't live up to the 
standard.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh! Don't worry. You're no slouch. You're very 
pretty and... well...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hah. So this was a poor excuse to flirt in the end?

I shook my head in objection, but Charlotte just 
giggled at the action.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You're not the first to try and compare me to a 
proper princess.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Proper"? Do you mean you're not one?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
In title I am.

For all intents and purposes, Lockhart is a mercantile 
plutocracy.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Some like to debate that it's more akin to a 
kraterocracy given the lack of formal structures.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Which I get. Laws are more akin to individual 
groups' policies, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I like to think of it more a matter of supply and 
demand, though.

When issues arise, the race to the bottom helps 
create innovation and...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...and the supplier to do so... gets control of that... 
that...

Charlotte stared at me as I myself stared out into
nothingness.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Y- You okay?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I... yeah. I... hear you.

Got to love pluno... stuff...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... It's fine.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
My family has the biggest company so we get the 
keys to the castle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And... that makes you a princess?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Officially, yes.

But it's more an excuse to give more traditional 
pomp and circumstance to the role.

You're free to rid me from your mental warehouse 
of princess comparisons.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... I didn't mean it like that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well... maybe it'd be easier for us to do that 
anyways. To not to dwell on that sort of stuff.

There are enough distractions as is.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, you're right...

I took out my locket.

After taking a deep breath, I clenched it in my 
hand tightly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We can only just keep moving forward.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I have faith in my father. He wouldn't die so 
easily.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Besides, you might get to see a full fledged princess 
when we get to Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The Kingdom of Cartenan...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So you've been there? What's it like?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Some call it the "Land of a Thousand Summers".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ack! Where did you come from?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Uh... You're still carrying all that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I did offer, despite my otherwise ignored intents.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And on the topic of the Kingdom, who better to 
ask than I?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Right, you did say you were from Cartenan, didn't 
you?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You two are getting ahead of yourselves, anyways.

After all, in order to get to Cartenan, there is an 
obstacle in our way.

It is why we head for Ranakstown, no?

To get to Cartenan...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...they'd need to cross the Crimson Sea.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Or they fled behind the advancing troops of the 
Republic.

Those are your two choices. Cartenan or 
Rabaneau.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: They could have fled directly south as well.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Those big fox ears on your head just for show?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Choose your next words carefully, honlyn.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Ah, what a pain in the ass.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
No, you're right! They'd go south to get help from 
no one.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Honestly, it's what I'd do if I were them. It'd get 
me to my next paycheck sooner too.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Hmph.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
And what about you...

...sir?

The figure clad in armor had not moved for some 
time.

He stared down at his kill.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Come on. Stop wasting time on that corpse.

Aren't you supposed to be in charge?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
They probably retreated behind the Rabaneau front 
line before it was pushed back.

It's an old saying. The simplest answer often ends 
up being the truth.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I wasn't looking for your opinion.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Argh! You're overcomplicating it.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Why would they ignore the Republic when that 
opportunity comes waltzing up to them?

Is it really that you just want an excuse to keep 
rushing forward?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Tsk. We have a job to do.

We need to secure Lockhart so it can properly 
reorganize.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I won't sit still with such threats still out there.
The two stared each other down.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: They are no threats.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Huh? It talked?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Their champion is dead.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
And what of it? 

The other fugitives are still out there.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Their champion was weak.
Nora and Jude looked on with confusion.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Woman clad in red steel.

Are you strong?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Am I...?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I am as strong as I need to be for Lockhart's 
future.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Then there is no threat.

Their champion was weak.

Therefore, they are weak.

And there is only one fate awaiting the weak.

The Steel Wolf turned on his heel and began back 
towards Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Misery and death.

All roads lead to such an end.

The group traveled as a whole through the 
southern region of the West Auran Alliance.

While we were on our guard for imperial troops 
catching up to us, none ever did.

Despite this good fortune, our route to Cartenan 
was still blocked by the sea to our north.

The Crimson Sea was infamous for being very 
dangerous to navigate. Few ports offered transit 
across it.

With Lockhart as an enemy, we only had one 
choice of where to seek help.

Ranakstown. The infamous pirate's cove of the 
Crimson Sea.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then this would be Ranakstown?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: That it is. Have you not been?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I imagine most try to avoid pirate hotspots.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Bandits are nothing new in our line of work.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Bar the port, this city does have shades of bandit 
country more inland.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It certainly has a different aura about it than 
Lockhart has.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Ah, I didn't get a chance to think about it on our 
way from Lockhart, but the sea air is lovely.

Such a long time since I had the
pleasure~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: My feet are killing me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There's bound be an inn nearby, right?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Ah, not so fast.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
If we wish to take a ship in the morning, we'd best 
make contact with a crew before the night takes 
us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: True. They'd need time to prep.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then let's do that.

Our group walked through the city and asked 
around about potential leads.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(For a pirate town, you'd think they'd be easier to 
find.)

The inquiry seemed to be fleeting.

At least, it seemed that way until...

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text:
Sorry, can't say I ever seen no ferry services around 
this place.

A young nekolyn woman had stopped in her day 
to humor our questions.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We are in... a hurry of sorts.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Our group would be open to less... formal 
solutions.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Given the reputation of Ranakstown...

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Ugh... those creeps.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Creeps meaning... pirates?

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Shh!

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text:
The local guard don't like when people talk about 
them.

But...

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text:
If you're that desperate, there's a tavern I work at 
that probably has some of them getting drunk at.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It is a start, at the least. Thank you.

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: I was just headed in for a shift anyways.

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Hans! We got some out of towners!

A division of our members entered the tavern and 
were guided by the woman to sit at the bar.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (This place is... dank...)

A rustle sound met my ears and a man appeared 
from the backrooms.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text: Hm? What's up now?

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Sir, these guys want to access the secret menu.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text:
...Well, then.

What's your poison?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: My good man. I'll take-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Info. We need transit north.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text: North, eh? Rough waters that way.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then we'll need hardy seamen to cover us.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Seamen, you say?
I gave Rowan a stink eye.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text: Why so desperate to go north?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Are you asking because you actually care?

Or do you just want to confirm our desperation in 
setting a price?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text: Hmph.
The room went silent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It felt like a bunch of gazes just peeked our 
way...)

A variety of the patrons started to get up and walk 
out.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?
Drinks had been dropped in front of each of us.

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Consider it a going away gift.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text: It her?

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Yep.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What are you talking about?
But it only took another second for my answer.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...hey...where do you think...
Something had started outside!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Princess!

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text: Thank ya very much for bringing her!

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Then shall we negotiate the hard way?

The gaze in front of me showed me steel on steel.

Cainan had unsheathed his weapon to take on the 
sword slash of the tavern owner.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Grhhh!!!

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.text: D- Dammit!

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Ouch. That looked like it hurt.

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Well, nice meeting you all~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm not just going to let you-
I reach out my hand, but-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grk!
My head whiplashed back at I was hit in the face.

Before I could regain my bearings, I felt a weight 
land on my shoulders.

My eyesight began to return while I fell to the 
ground from this weight.

The first sight in my vision was that woman jumping 
off my shoulders and over our group towards the 
exit.

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Make sure to leave a tip!

She fell out of the tavern through the saloon doors 
and jumped to her feet outside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I-... What in the goddess's name just happened?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
No time. Charlotte and the others are still 
in trouble.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right.

We rushed out to find a small group of pirates that 
had already been defeated.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Don't you dare fucking touch me, you pieces of 
shit.
Charlotte gave one a hard kick.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, by the stars' damnedest, you are alright.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
W- Why are they attacking? Did your talks go that 
poorly?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: As far as business deals go, I'm not a fan.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It was a trap. It may even still be.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Hmm... did the notice of a bounty make it all the 
way here already?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey! Did a black haired nekolyn run through here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Nekolyn? The girl from before the meeting?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, she was in on it, too.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
If that girl did come out here, then she slipped 
away before we could notice.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If she did, she slipped away before we could 
notice.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Directional bark*!
Jakson pointed towards the port.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
If she wanted to get allies, then the port seems 
like the place for a pirate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then let's let her lead us to a source.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Is there truly no other port we could take 
our business to?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Not if we want a boat that can actually get across 
the Crimson Sea in one piece.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then we are decided?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: To battle!

WARNING: Cainan is about to leave the party. 
You may want to remove any items of value.
 
Are you ready to move foward?

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Yes / No

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Ugh... This... stupid... I want to go back in 
my armor, and...

Tatiana's words stopped in her throat as she felt 
something rising.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh... Does anyone else... feel..

I stopped my words as a wooziness started to wash 
over my mind.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Oi! If ya gonna hurl, do it over the side!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I- It'll be alright... You just need to get used to it.

Maybe we should all get some air?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: First timers...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's probably worth getting them some air.

The chilled sea air burst into the cabin and met the 
first time seafarers' lungs.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... ugh... That helps.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Heh. Try running a merchant shipping company.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I can only imagine how poorly that'd go.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... you were out here...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe inside was better.

A few of the others had already been on deck, 
including Norde, Cainan, and members of Otis's 
crew.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Helpful.

Especially so if a third of our group would be useless 
in a fight due to sea sickness.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Now, now... No need to pick a fight just to prove a 
point.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
After all this time, stuff like that out of your mouth 
still sounds vaguely like a threat.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: What a lovely atmosphere.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed. Mayhap we see forgiveness and 
merriment?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You. Don't. Talk.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: If you make me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay... I'm throwing it overboard.
I took a step forward.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I'll throw ya both overboard if you don't shut ya 
stupid traps.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Maybe the seasickness isn't the worst effect of the 
voyage, but being cooped up for days...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Argh! I'm never taking on fucking stowaways again.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I paid you way too much for you to be pretending 
we're stowaways.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Yeah, and you're not getting any refund if I need 
to throw some stowaways overboard.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ha... haha...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nrgh...
An awkward, tense silence fell over the group.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Truly, it is a shame I will be leaving this behind.

Cainan turned towards the sea.

A ship was visible on the horizon.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: That is your comrade?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ah, I see they're here for the meet up.

They should get ya to Oadthine in one piece.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oadthine...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And? Do you think your Covenant buddies will 
decide to help?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Most assuredly.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
The West Auran Alliance was created as a buffer 
zone of city-states for such external threats to the 
Holy City.
It would be odd for them to not care that a Holy 
City's autonomy is thrown into question.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, well... we need to put some faith into you, 
then. Do us proud.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Faith I would gladly accept...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Though, perhaps it is better saved to give to the 
Goddess.

The other ship slowly made its way to be in parallel 
with our own.

Cainan, with what luggage he had to bring, 
brought himself to the ramp leading to the other 
ship.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Well, then here we are. It was good fighting 
alongside you all.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Well, then here we are. It was good to be able to 
work with you all until this point.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
This contact you mentioned from Cartenan... What 
was her relation to you again?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Kara Lyons. She is my fiancé.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That's a name I haven't heard in a while.

To think she'd go and get herself a fiancé? I guess 
it was only a matter of time for a girl like her.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
That it was. At least as it was once we first 
laid eyes on one another.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
And she is a noble that can get us an audience 
with the Queen of Cartenan?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Indeed. I have written a letter of introduction, as 
well, so...

The goodbyes continued for Cainan's short stay 
with the group, and he handed an envelope to 
Charlotte.

I, on the other hand, chose to step aside and 
simply view from a short distance away.
Despite that, Cainan walked over to me.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: No words for our 'to be departed'?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Would you prefer some?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: If you do not, then I shall offer some of my own.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
This world is... unflinching.

It is an unforgiving decadence the typical soul 
leaves in their wake.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It is tempting to look back, but no matter what 
you hope to see...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: ...who you hope to see...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Who...? Does he mean...?)

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: ...it is better to keep your eyes facing forward.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: I suspect the sight to be most unpleasant.

A hand lowered on top of my head as Cainan gave 
a soft chuckle.

I wasn't sure how long the moment was, but it 
was over before I could get to my next thought.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Good luck, young Pup. Do me proud in your 
struggle.

He turned, and with relaxed steps headed onto the 
other ship.

I took a half step backwards, and my hand 
navigated to my pocket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (He... No, he's... He's wrong about my father...!)

My hand gripped tightly around the locket I had 
been given by my father.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I think we can trust he'll succeed.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Such confidence.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Apparently he's engaged to an old friend of mine. 
One I trust a lot.

If she picked him, then...

The words trailed off as they didn't register to me 
anymore.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I just... I just need to keep getting stronger.)
I turned on my heel to head into the ship cabin.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Oh... Why are you headed back in? Are you feeling 
better... or...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
He must be feeling a little better if he's headed 
back inside.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

With that, Cainan's ship disappeared into the 
horizon and day quickly turned to night.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dammit...

The blanket, wrapped tightly around me, started to 
feel like it was suffocating me as I pulled it in more 
and more.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I need some air...)

I rolled away from my bedding and the blanket slid 
deftly and messily across the floor I walked upon.

I sat at the deck's edge and stared out into
the sea.

No thoughts, but I had a feeling as though one 
may force itself out.

So I closed my eyes and leaned back...

...

......

...............................

The locket I had received was gripped tightly in my 
hand.

As I relaxed, the sensations soon became 
exclusively it.

The smooth casing.

The intricate patterns on it's side and likely within 
as well.

Again and again, those were my world.

Until...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Truly, a poor place to make your nightly quartering.
My eyes opened.

Rowan stood above me, looking down at me as my 
relaxed self faced the sky.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Go away.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It would be a folly of mine to let a friend catch a 
cold.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Particularly if said cold came from falling into the 
chilling sea.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're not friends.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Allies?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Acquaintances?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Fellow oath bearers of the Goddess?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*...

From you of all people...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then it would be a poor decision to let a fellow 
oath bearer of the Goddess...
Rowan moved to take a seat next to me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...fall into the ocean and catch a most frightful 
cold.

He tried to direct me to sit up and talk, but I just 
stayed staring at the stars in the sky.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Could you please just...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Of all people to not let me be alone? I just want 
to get rid of him.)
I tried to think of what precisely I wanted to say.

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Point out that this is pointless. / Joke about nonsense to fill the silence until he leaves / Refuse to even talk to him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't want to talk to you.

I just want to... be by myself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then I shall stay here... by myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
With you completely realizing how nonsensical even 
saying that is...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're not one to listen to reason, are you?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I realized in my waning years of life how little words 
truly meant when one had made up their mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aren't you my age?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So when will you get out of my hair?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: When you make me laugh.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Deal.
I turned my head towards him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What's the difference between a mercenary and a 
missionary?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not much. Both are gonna introduce you to 
the Goddess, though.

I looked back up at the stars, and I focused on one 
as I tried to remember.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Give a man a fish, he'll eat for a days. But give a 
man a woman...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He'll eat for a week.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe more with good rationing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, I've got a million more terrible jokes. How long 
do you think I've been living with mercenaries?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Haha...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Dammit...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just go.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What an inviting gesture~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm not asking.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of all people... I do not want to talk to you.

A heathen, a fool, a..

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A killer.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I don't blame the difficulty in disassociating me from 
that event.
With a deep breath, I calmed myself.

I pushed myself up to a sitting position, feeling 
hooked into Rowan's insistence.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What do you actually want?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
To not find one more body welcoming the depths 
of the Crimson Sea.

I did say it was dangerous to nap here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then I'm up. Can you leave now?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm... Have you slept at all tonight?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What do you want?

Why shouldn't I throw you over right now?

Send you and that stupid fucking Oathbreaker to 
the bottom of the sea...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Apologies, but...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I float.

My breath stopped for a moment as I had to 
actually stop myself from testing that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: And I do not know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I do not know what I want.

From you. From... this.

I saw a soul... a soul ever too lost... and I wanted 
to act.

To sing it a lullaby so it could find a peaceful resting 
spot.

When my mouth opened in response, I couldn't 
find the words.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm going back inside. Do not follow me.
I began to get up and head in, when...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... Perhaps this was a...

Rowan picked up something I had accidentally left 
behind.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: This is... that locket.
A click came with the locket opening.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Is this... our adorable Pup as a pup?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Give that back!
I jumped at Rowan and he deftly evaded.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
To steal this revelation from me at the height of 
interest would be most cruel!

I leaped at him again and got awfully close to 
tripping near the ship's edge.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
This is getting quite dangerous... mayhap we can 
make a deal?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Tell me about them. The people in these portraits.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I now know that this is what I want. I will leave 
you alone for as long as you want me to if you 
comply.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And... would you not like to speak your mind on 
them? How long has it been since you had a
chance to?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Fine.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Once upon a time there was a family.

A father, a mother, and two young boys.

And once upon a time in that time's not too distant 
future... that ended.

The end.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Now now. Do try to take it seriously.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: From you, I can't tell if that's a joke.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
So this in the painting is... you...? And your father 
is with you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. A long time ago.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ivan looks... much the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Without the gray in his hair, yeah.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Such a cute little boy he shepherded.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Were you as calm as the artist depicted you as? Or 
were you a terror of a pup? Chewing on 
the furniture and all that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Hmm?

What do you remember, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It was... so long ago. I was very young at the time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
At a point, everything just feels like... stories. 
Stories you tell yourself to convince yourself 
they were real.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

Then, in that story and these paintings, that'd 
make this person...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: My mother, Estella.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: And the other child?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: My older brother, Nikolai.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Truly?

I had imagined you to have more of a "twin" aura 
about you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Regardless... The occupants of this frame of the 
locket...

May I ask of their... current status?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...stories.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do you mean...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're all stories... in the end.

We are all stories in the end.

We are.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

Anton. May I ask another question?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Why do you feel the need to be "strong"?

I closed my eyes as the thought triggered an 
intense feeling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I remember bedtimes stories.

Myths and legends of the world.

The heroes that define our ideal of reality. 
Ideal of a person.

There was King Minae the wise, who had strength 
of mind.

The old legends of those that felled the dragons, 
and their strength of body.

Even the more modern, with the great liberator of 
Rabaneau, Kaeden Leopold, and his strength of will.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Men who did great feats for the benefit of 
many others.

Men truly worthy of their legacy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I sometimes hear those stories again when I dream. 
As though my mother was still here to tell them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: When I think of those, and then see my father...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I feel like he could put the world on his back and 
keep going.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I see that and those bedtime stories start to feel so 
real.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So real that... that I don't think I could forgive 
myself if...
I trailed off.
Rowan fiddled with the locket in his hand.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I do have a favorite part of stories myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah?

I said weakly, only half acknowledging his presence 
at this point of this talk.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
This locket.

I've held it twice now. So I feel as though I can 
make this observation with confidence.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is an heirloom.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

My eyebrows sprung up as my attention was fully 
grabbed.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed. Much as my own and others, it is a tool for 
performing magical mysteries through the Goddess's
blessings.
If you spent the time to learn the process, you may 
be even able to use it to cast magic yourself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Though mayhap most important of all.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is a classic sign of nobility to have such a blessed 
item passed down within a lineage.

Rowan extended his arm to hand the locket back 
to me.

He just held it there as I stared.

Only after what felt like a silent eternity did I start 
to slowly move to take it from him.

After I did, my eyes didn't stop staring at it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed, that is my favorite part of a story.

For every story we tell... There is a backstory.

And what wonders and treasures they can hide 
within~

My attention was only broken by the sun peeking 
over the horizon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Daybreak already...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So many intriguing questions about that locket...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It's legacy, and what sort of magic it can conjure.
Rowan turned more directly to me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I do not know if it would suit your chosen fighting 
style, but one can learn to use the magic of 
heirlooms.

I was only half listening. I was only half allowing 
myself thoughts.

My eyes simply stared out into the breaking sunrise.

Where I saw...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...?

(Is that... a figure in the sunlight?)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is a skill to be learned. Over time, and...

Rowan, noticing my more focused gaze, turned in 
that direction.

A weight rammed into me and threw me to my 
side.

Seconds later, the sound of whooshing air twirled 
by my ear moments before I felt myself crash into 
the wooden planks below.

Plastered against the wood, I turned my head up 
to see what had slammed into me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Uh...

Rowan was perched above me with hands to the 
side of my head like a scene out of a romantic 
novella.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Fancy meeting you like this~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What was... What happened?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Magic.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Which is impressively on topic given the nature of 
our discussion.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are we being attacked?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: R- Right... Yes!

Rowan got off me and helped me to my feet.

Swiveling to the attacker, I reached for my sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Shit! I didn't bring it with me!)
The enemy was in striking distance!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Now!

The enemy dissipated into flickers of dark and fiery 
shadows.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But... what was that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
A "shade".

Shades are tricky little rats that can use mirage-like 
shadows to disguise themselves as most any form.

They're a favorite of summoners for that reason.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Meaning the summoner needs to be nearby. 
Especially if they cast that magic and are controlling 
them.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Summoner, yes... Or summoners.
My head turned to the horizon again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Another ship.

We need to get the others.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Heheh... I assume the forward group has begun 
their assault?

Has their little ship been put up in flames?

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.text:
My associate appears to have started the attack, 
yes.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Excellent! A decisive battle at daybreak...

It shall be a wonderous headline for the news 
cycle.

A truly beautiful sight!

Let us sail the high seas! To glory!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: A- Argh! What... What are you doing?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (So, how to do this dance thing...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Or, you know, I could just go for a win in a less 
nonsensical way.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Not like she wants to hear me out...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Shall we begin?

Reagyn raised her weapon in an intentional way 
that seemed to be part of the sports’ rules, so I 
followed suit.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text: Now! Begin!

In order to correctly "dance", Pup must step into all 
red squares in one turn. 

Dancers' ability allow units to move again. Move the 
dancers next to Pup to use this ability.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Come now. What are you standing still for?

As I followed the prompts I was given to move, I...

...was outpacing her.

Not at first, but by the end of the dance...

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
And that is the end! The result... It is a... win! For 
Pup Baranov!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Hmph. That surprised me. I should’ve taken you 
more seriously.
She turned away in a bit of a huff.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: See what a battle hardened warrior can do?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I didn’t actually think you had it in you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: An impressive display of finesse.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm? Of what?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Ah... It isn’t so important.
+1 Charisma Points

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
Why did...? That... That would be a disqualification.

Lady Charlotte... Why did...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I- I’m so sorry. Pup just... Or Anton is very new to 
all this, I just...
The two trailed off out of my earshot.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What? It’s a duel. We’re supposed to fight each 
other.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I didn’t go for a fatal attack!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Anton... do please let it go.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ...A brute, as expected.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
This was my fault. I just let my mouth run and the 
Lord got the wrong impression.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
+1 Direct Points

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
And with that, we can move onto our main event. 
Please, can everyone move along to the arena 
field?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*... What other runaround have we got to 
deal with?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well, it should be more straightforward this time, 
at least.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text: Now! Let us begin... the wargame...!

As we approached our destination, a familiar face 
came into view.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: How did the banquet go?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde, there you are. And here I was hoping we’d 
gotten rid of you.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I’m inclined to assume it went poorly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... feels like home again already.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I knew you’d be on my side.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Unsure whine*...?

Jakson shifted his head back and forth, like he was 
unsure of what stance to take.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah, you’ll come around.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It went better than I imagined, but worse than I’d 
have hoped.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
From my understanding, despite some hiccups, it 
has been a net positive endeavor.

Best to continue that momentum, yes?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Noted and considered.

The Crows are fully prepared to assist with the next 
stage of this event.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well, I wouldn’t get your hopes up that it’ll be 
something fun.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I imagine this part will play more to your liking.

I tried following the prompts that were given to 
me.
And again...
And again...
And one final time...

I tried following the prompts that were given to 
me.
And again...
And again...
And one final time...

I tried following the prompts that were given to 
me.
And again...
And again...
And one final time...

I tried following the prompts that were given to 
me.
And again...
And again...
And one final time...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know, the Crows are pretty great if you get to 
know them.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: A noble’s responsibility is to serve their people.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Yours is to make money.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I’ve... I could stand to be more involved in those 
meetings.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It doesn’t mean we all do it out of greed, though.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Yet that conflict of interest remains as the core 
tenet of your approach to life.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Really, a noble of all people shouldn’t throw stones 
in glass-
Suddenly a burst of applause interrupted my words.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text: And that is the end! The result... It is a... tie?

As we had talked, I had been able to mirror 
her movements.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Hmph. You could’ve been worse.
She turned away in a bit of a huff.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: See what a battle hardened warrior can do?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wow, you actually kept up.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Quite the potential with finesse.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm? With what?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Ah... It isn’t so important.
+1 Diplomatic Points

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...and the crop production was up about 5% this 
year.

The farmers’ delegate surmised it was due to 
weather pattern timing.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Excellent. I am pleased to hear such positive results 
from our nation’s hard work.

The rays of light peppered a sea of stars across the 
marbled floors of the palace.

Above that cosmic starscape stood a pair of 
black heels, and further up still a graceful visage 
of a face.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The delegate did wish to pass along a sentiment.

One of pride for the work the farmers of Cartenan 
had put in this last season.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Ah... that is...

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Hmm...

A finger of consideration went to the chin of 
another figure. This one was raised above the tide 
of light by a throne.
She was cloaked within a flowing, elegant ensemble 
of green and white, with it emblazoned with 
striking accents of gold and royal purple.
She was Avalina. The Queen of Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
If you’ve the chance, do please return my 
agreeability to the sentiment.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Of course, your majesty.

Kara shuffled through her papers to move onto a 
new topic.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As for movement of bandit activity, there are some 
developments from our international scouts.

In Rabaneau, the bandits were seen moving toward 
the northern border.

In the Empire, the movement was towards the 
capital.

In New Aureria, they were-

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Yes, yes. Make a note to increase the scout corp.’s 
bonus fund.

We wouldn’t want them to get too demotivated in 
such boredom filled days.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Noted.

Kara then straightened out her papers and lowered 
them.

Her gaze shifted so she was addressing the Queen 
directly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The trend seen in the reports is of bandits moving 
northward.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Indeed? Then that really only points to one place.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Under conventional wisdom, I would agree.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Oh~ I wonder if the Empire is reaching their 
breaking point, then?

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
That tiresome, endless war they have with the 
Republic is becoming too much?

To think they would need to hire reinforcements 
just to secure their homeland.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Your majesty, I do believe that-

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
You have been such a treat to have, filling in as my 
secretary these last couple months, Miss Lyons.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Or should I say “Mrs. DeClares” instead?

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: It will be a shame when we must let you go.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Must such a silly thing as marriage stop you from 
serving in the royal court?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I appreciate the sentiment, your majesty.

But it would be poor optics to have the wife of a 
Covenant Auditor working for any government.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Ah... truly the greatest of shames.
The Queen leaned in her seat along with a sigh.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Then mayhap regale me with this newest gossip 
that has reached the court.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I am not sure what you refer to...?

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: The visitors from abroad!

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
A daring escape from an attack on the high seas. A 
princess in the crosshairs of fate.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: The servants speak of it like a novelette~

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes, Lady Charlotte Stewart of Lockhart has 
recently arrived in the city.

She has an appointment to petition the court in 
the coming week.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Lockhart’s situation is deteriorating. It might be 
better to have that meeting sooner over

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Of course not.

All things in their due process. It is what separates 
us from the savages of the Outlands and the like.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
I am sure Lady Stewart would agree. She was such 
a pleasant woman when we last met.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: As you wish, your majesty.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Now, do continue this story of heroism and drama.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Lady Stewart arrived with her retinue in tow? 
Shimmering in the heat of battle worn days?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The servants certainly do have a... way with words.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
But yes. She was accompanied by a hired band of 
mercenaries to escort her.

The “Nightless Crows”, as I have been told.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Such a daring group they must be.

Such... resilience they have shown! 
I must applaud it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes, from what I have been told, they are an 
impressive sort.
 
It would be easy to describe them as ones that 
would be difficult to knock down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I’m getting knocked down!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What... What the fuck?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah... well...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Language, please.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: WHAT. THE. FUCK?!?!

My distress came from the very thing that had 
decimated my balance. The very apparent thing 
now anchoring me to the ground.
The giant pair of breasts that had grown from my 
very own chest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
These... Why are they so massive?!

They’re bigger than my head!

N- No... they’re...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They’re bigger than my DOG!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They’re the size of a damned boulder!

I floundered around some, trying to get up from 
this position like a turtle flipped onto its back.

The professor, who was there to assist me in this 
endeavor of offsetting the curse’s effects, looked 
on with an apathetic scowl.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Didn’t you say you were going to make them 
smaller?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I did. Or it should have.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Cosmetic magic is a very precise science.

The technique I used is meant to take the fatty 
matter of the breasts and simply... put 
it somewhere else.
Such is the wonders of combining types of magic 
together. Anything is possible.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Really?

I gave the professor a hostile glare, and I motioned 
towards the giant mounds of flesh that stopped me 
from even getting up.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm... Yes, it did behave differently than the 
norm.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
And I do not know where that extra matter even 
came from...

Was it the “curse” and its impact?

Or is it because I haven’t done this much before?

As the professor’s words started to trail off into 
mumbling, I squinted harder at him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What was that last part?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Nothing of import.

For now, I can attempt to undo what I did before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Glare*...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Unless you’d prefer to simply stay in this state.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
F- Fine... Please undo the changes to my... my... 
m- my...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: “Breasts”...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah... please...

The professor started to get into position and my 
attention returned to the source of the problem.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: These... things...

The more I focused on them, the more I noticed 
the sense of touch I had in them. They were part 
of my body, after all.
After breaking though the buttons of my shirt, 
they were exposed to the air, and...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I- If... you could hurry.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Yes, yes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... Thank the Goddess that worked.

The lumps on my chests were now normal. Or as 
normal as they could be given the circumstances.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
“After reversal, the patient’s breast size returned to
approximately a smaller B cup size once more.”
Castel read out the note as he wrote it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... No, it’s more like... larger... A... cup.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
“Consider recommendation for therapeutic 
sessions.”

The professor put away his notes and approached 
me again.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Now, we’ll need to try another one. You said your 
hair had also changed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You want to try again? After all that?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Yes. It proved reversible, and we’ve only the single 
data point.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I am also much more experienced with this 
procedure.

I guarantee you this one will work.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh...

(I... I don’t have better options, do I...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: F- Fine...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmph. No need to be hesitant. You can trust in 
me, Professor Castel Balreig.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I am a professor of the Royal College. We shall solve 
this puzzle.

Kara entered the lab and was making her way 
through the lounge and observation room.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Professor Balreig, are you ready to-

Kara went to grab the doorknob for the inner lab, 
but something caught her eye.

Something blue. Something light blue.

Almost like overgrown grass, puffs of light blue 
poked through the bottom of the closed door.

Kara turned her head towards the windows of the 
observation room.

The blinds for it were closed to cut off view, but 
there was something at its edges...

Puffs of light blue.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Is that...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Muffled yelling*!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Muffled yelling*!

Deadened yelling from unclear sources came from 
within the room.

Kara’s hand hesitated inches away from the 
doorknob.

But as she hesitated, the sight of the puffs of 
blue retracting caught her attention.

From the corner of her eye, they slipped away 
back into the room like they were never there
in the first place.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Lovely how things can handle themselves 
sometimes.
She reached for the doorknob.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... almost suffocated me...?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah... that was...unexpected...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A good day to you both.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... Kara...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Welcome, Miss Lyons.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Professor Balreig. Mr. Baranov.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah... that feels weird.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Could you not refer to me like that?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Miss Baranov, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- No... I meant not so formally.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just “Anton” is fine

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Of course.

Professor Balreig, how are the experiments going?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: We’ve acquired some very useful data today.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Really? That’s your take away?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Science can often be a matter of trial and error 
when wading through the unknown.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Are you done for the day? I am here to retrieve 
Anton, after all.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Yes, I think that will be fine. There should be 
enough data for me to analyze and come up with 
an action plan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, don’t even dare. There’s no way I’m coming 
back after THAT.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You’d have to be crazy to even consider it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then we will be on our way. See you tomorrow.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: My best wishes. I’ll see you both bright and early.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You’re all...

Argh!

I turned on my heels and started to march out of 
the room.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Have a good evening, professor.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Mhm.

Having settled into the carriage to head back to 
the hotel, I leaned over to stare at the passing city 
out the window.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Indistinct mumbling*...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

Hmm...

Nothing will change unless you make the effort to 
change it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm? Aren’t you quick to speak up...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah, whatever. What would you know about it in 
the first place?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I know you’re currently afflicted with the effects of 
an Oathbreaker.

One that rewrites the rules of your being to 
change your very nature.

To have you “consumed by your weakness”, 
whatever that may be seen as within the eyes of 
the beholder.
And in your case, you’ve seen that play out as 
femininity being your “weakness”.

Perhaps you had a father as an outstanding role 
model.

Or lacked a mother to show you how strength can 
come from other avenues.

Am I on the right track?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... There was... Satia and some others, I guess.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But... they’re not exactly heroes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
They’re no Thame and Raiga, the hero Elva, or 
even a Kaeden Leopold. 

It’s just... I can’t pretend they can live up to that 
sort of true, world changing strength.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We have real living and breathing heroes in front of 
us changing the world and...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can’t just pretend it isn’t there.
Kara cleared her throat before continuing.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Regardless of the specific source, to be impacted so 
means the source is a matter of subconscious.

It means that it draws from an innate part of your 
worldview. A part that cannot be changed as 
is convenient to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like... an ideal?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes. Like an ideal.

The sort one may draw from the mythical heroes 
you described.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
One can understand and even acknowledge the 
fallacy of it, but that does not mean the 
underlying source changes so easily.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Yeah...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Nothing will change unless you put in the effort to 
change it, though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right... I do know that. I do.

Kara simply smiled a gentle, caring smile as the 
thoughts jumped through my head.

At least, I properly turned back in from the 
window.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

How... How did you do that? Figure all that out in a 
couple days?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Argh... Rowan told you about our recent chat, 
didn’t he? I’m gonna maim that guy, I swear...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Chat...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can assure you, Alexei has not mentioned 
anything of the sort to me.

As for why...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You are not the first to see the world as such. 
Though...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I cannot speak to if any had it backfire so 
intrinsically before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: “Alexei”? That again...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know, if you’re just making all that stuff up...

That he’s the prince of the Empire. That you two 
went to school with him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If you just want to mess with Charlotte, you can 
tell me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
She does seem like she’d be fun to tease, with you 
being her friend and all.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
*Giggle*... I can assure you that we’ve yet to 
speak a falsehood.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Any humor derived from it is from the fact that she 
truly did not notice.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... You mean... 

Really?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed.

...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: And... it can be fun to tease her... at times.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hah... I can imagine...

The two of us sat there in a progressively 
uncomfortable silence.

The clicks of the carriage wheel just made a pitter 
patter as they crossed the brick road.

Until... they stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We’re here?)

But before my eyes could be pulled to the carriage 
window, a voice interrupted me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Anton... I know we have just met, so forgive me 
the discourtesy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh no... Did I do something?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
My own guiding light is one of potential. The 
potential of humanity itself.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
So it makes me sad to hear that you judge that 
potential as limited.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh... I didn’t... You know I don’t mean it like that, 
right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It’s nothing personal. I’m not expecting you or 
anyone else to be a legendary hero.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I know. Nor do I mean what I said about myself, 
either.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It’s about you.

I believe you’ve potential beyond your imagination, 
the same as any of our brethren.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I would love to see what your potential blooms 
into.

After giving a gentle smile, Kara place her hand on 
mine in a considerate manner.

She stood up from her seat in the carriage and 
started to make her way outside of it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Potential...)

(I’ve always known I could... That I can... That I 
have to... but...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Nowadays, sometimes I feel like...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Haha... potential is just potential after all.

You got to actually make good on it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just look at our “prince” named Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Just look at what “prince”, now?

With the sudden intrusion, I quickly found my 
startled face outside of the carriage and in front of 
our hotel.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What a statement to hear from my dear friend!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I’m sorry, I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait, I hated you like half a week ago.

You know what! I stand by it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just look at...

Floundering a bit for the words, I waved my hands 
about the side of his silhouette for emphasis.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...look at... all of... that!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Whatever... the word is for that...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You mean the ‘homeless bard’ thing he’s got 
going?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yes! That! That exactly!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
To be doubled up on by such dear comrades of 
mine! The thought of it just...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Actually, this reminds me of a time during one 
weekend where a lovely married couple asked me 
to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I’m going to stop you there as I throw up a little.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And do not even dare joke about the idea of that 
being a fetish for you, too, or I swear to 
the Goddess...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Isn’t your claim that you’re supposed to be a 
prince?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You cannot tell me this is somehow a move 
towards your potential.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Can I not?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... well, you assume this is my final form.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
One day we will all throw aside these garbs and 
shroud ourselves in truly exquisite threads~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What sort of fever dream is that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It sounds like he’s just trying to get us naked.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You’ve simply never seen me ‘clean up’, as it were.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Oh Kara, my friend, do tell them of my wonder, 
would you?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: K- Kara...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I will let you get comfortable in the hole you’ve 
dug.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Truly, you would abandon me as well?!

Without Kara coming to his defense, Charlotte and 
I found ourselves cornering Rowan with little 
resistance.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Giggle*...

Kara watched us three bicker like the school 
children she had once known multiple of us as, 
content to watch it play out.

And so the days passed us by, as we waited for the 
meeting with the Queen.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: And here is the floral district, where...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There’s another district? How big is this place?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I bet they’re hiding the slums from us...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmph, I can just find ‘em myself.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
*Happy Bark*...!

*Panting out the carriage window*...!
We were brought on more city tours.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Have you ever heard of the “placebo” effect?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, then do I have the perfect cure for your 
condition.

I attended more lab sessions to try to counter the 
curse.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Now now, dear Pup. You cannot spend all day in 
the changing room~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why are you of all people rushing me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I was expecting-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Sigh*... Of course.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Argh, Goddess’s damned willy.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I- I mean, this is fine, too... I guess...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hah... I knew he’d not have the balls to do it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You assume the thought even occurred to him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What are... Why are... Where are you all going?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I believe they are disappointed to see you not don 
a “bikini” over a simple thick shirt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What? But they’re...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Women?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not worry, it is but benign curiosity among 
them.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And some non-benign curiosity.

Mayhap more malignant.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I’ll let you sort the matters of which is which~

And between these other daily routines, we were 
guided on trips to local tourist locations.

Every hour of every day was met by the exciting 
grandeur of this vast, flourishing city.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single hour...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single day...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single hour...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single day...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single hour...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single day...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single hour...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every single day...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: single

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: hour

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: single

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: day

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: single

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: hour

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: single

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: day

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: STOP!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: P- Pup...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We keep doing this every hour of every day.

We keep having this red carpet rolled out for us 
and we still aren’t getting anywhere!

It’s.... It’s just-...!
The group around me was silent.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Every hour of every day...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You have slept since you’ve arrived, have you not?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yes! You know what I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
I took a deep breath, and calmed my rhetoric.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It’s been the better part of a week.

Why are we still waiting to meet the Queen?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As Charlotte’s group, the scheduled meeting to 
petition Queen Avalina is...

Kara, with a pocket calendar in hand, showed us 
the exact date.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The Kingdom of Cartenan takes great pride in their 
customs.

The formality of proper court procedure is among 
those.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And what, the appointment got delayed?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No, that date matches the one we were given 
when we arrived.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How is that...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This place has been messing with my head.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The meeting with the Queen will come in due 
time. Patience is a virtue.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Is this not a prime opportunity to relax? I cannot 
imagine such a moment will occur again 
anytime soon.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A persuasive point, Alexei.

Could this not pose an opportunity that you did not 
anticipate?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe. I sort of get that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But... these are people’s lives that are in the 
balance.

Shouldn’t every day count?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I agree.

Charlotte, who had been strangely quiet until now, 
approached Kara with an determined posture.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I think we’ve been patient and pampered enough 
for one war.

The Kingdom has always been like this, I know. I’ve 
visited before.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
But is there really no way to expedite this process? 
At all?

Kara began to open her mouth like she was about
