to give a prepared answer, but she stopped 
herself.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I... 

I do not believe the Queen would be receptive to 
it if you pressed the issue.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There has to be something.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
How about some social gathering where we could 
“accidentally” bump into her?
She just shook her head.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: If you push, it will backfire.

And with those words, the group fell into a 
thoughtful silence.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then shall we return on our journey to a midday 
meal?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... guess...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

There isn’t...

Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Perhaps there is one thing that can be done.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Really?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If anyone could figure it out...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I cannot get you an earlier audience.

But you do not have to sit on your hands until that 
day. You can work towards improving your odds at 
a successful petition.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Heh? What does that even mean?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You mean to imply that we could make an 
impression beforehand?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed.

A kingdom places her majesty above all.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
But such a social ladder means the voices in her 
orbit are quite well defined.

Her matter of influence... is predictable.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That could really help.

Leave it to Kara to go all “spymaster” on the 
problem.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, that could be fun, indeed. I remember hearing 
about these before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fun? Wait, how does that...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I feel like I’m missing something.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is not so complicated, after all.

Kara turned her head to me with a hint of a 
mischievous smile starting to form on her face.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: One can simply ‘schmooze’ the nobility...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...with a game.

Later that afternoon, our group was escorted to a 
facility shortly outside the city limits.

As we approached in a carriage...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: “Sport”... That’s a... word?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What is a sport? I thought you said we were going 
to use a game to get on the nobles’ good side?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A sport is a more specific version of a game. It 
refers to one where the activities involve 
physical competition.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Leave it to nobles to make up random words for 
things that already exist.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What an odd culture.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... Just sounds like fighting to me...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I remember there being a few clubs for it when I 
was in the Royal College.

Typically you had the people aiming to be knights 
be pretty active in them.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It was pretty popular when we were at the 
academy, right Kara?

All the wannabe knights loved it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed. It is a popular activity for knights in the 
kingdom.

The country is quite peaceful, after all, and 
wargames are preferable to war.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Knights...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, it seems the Pup has taken the bait~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey, I didn’t say anything.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Not that it doesn’t sound interesting...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, we just need to focus, right?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Of course, of course.

The carriage stopped at our destination: a fancy 
stone facility out in an open field.

It was quite large, specifically to hold a large field, 
as I was told.

We began to approach the entrance proper.

lines.speaker: Security
lines.text: Welcome. You are Lady Stewart’s appointment?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Lucky boys. You get two "Lady Stewarts" for the 
price of one.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: We’re glad to make your acquaintance.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ‘Lady Stewart’, right here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes, this is the group I sent word about. We’ll be 
joining in the festivities for the day.

lines.speaker: Security
lines.text: Very good. Then we’ll just...

The security guard turned his head towards those 
in the back of our group.

lines.speaker: Security
lines.text:
If it would be possible, could your hired hands wait 
at the field for the main event?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh? Been a while since I had the red carpet rolled 
out for me like this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hired... what? Norde and them aren’t...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Really, you don’t get it?

Charlotte leaned in and pulled me aside for a 
second.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
They’re not actually asking, by the way.

Just consider it a matter of respect.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... O- Okay...?

Charlotte stopped whispering to me and turned 
back to Norde and the other non-homlyns in our 
group.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Everyone. If you wouldn’t mind...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Very well.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Pfft. Whateva’. I knew this was a comin’.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What, you think I’m gonna steal the silverware?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Norde, I am really sorry that they’re being like this.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It’s fine. I do not believe anyone is truly surprised 
by this.

Given the reason for our visit, it wouldn’t be wise 
to test our luck, either.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I appreciate it, everyone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No one surprised? I’m just confused.
I said so under my breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Why would we send away a good chunk of our 
fighting force before we start a wargame “sport” 
thing?)

Norde led a fairly notable part of our regiment, 
Crows and others, towards a different part of the 
facility.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, whatever. We’ll work it out.)

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
...Charlotte Stewart, heiress of the Stewart Works 
conglomerate and future head of the 
Lockhart Council.

From the dark room, Charlotte disappeared into a 
crack of light. One created by a set of heavy 
curtains being opened as she exited.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(W- Wait...?! What is this? I thought we were 
supposed to do some wargame thing?!)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not fret. All good festivities must start with a 
banquet.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And... You will likely be sat away from the major 
nobility in attendance.

Your faux pas will only be minorly detrimental to our 
effort.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: My... My what?!

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text: And now, of the Volkov Imperial Family...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, that would be me up next.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- Wait, what words did you just say?! Those can’t 
be real!

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
In attendance with Lady Stewart... Prince Alexei 
Volkov of the Nolvanus Empire.

With a wink and a sly smile, Rowan gracefully 
dipped through the curtains as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But... what is...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Do try to just follow my or Lady Kara’s lead.

It may not be obvious, but I had notable training 
on proper manners when I was younger.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Take a deep breath. There is no need to worry. It 
is just a meal, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right... Right... Just a meal... Right...

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
Introducing Lady Kara Lyons of the Kingdom’s Lyons 
lineage.

Kara gave me a reassuring smile before passing 
through the heavy curtain herself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Just a meal, just a meal, just a meal...)

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
In attendance with Lady Stewart for today’s 
festivities, we have the Nightless Crows Mercenary 
Company.
Introducing Gentleman Anton Baranov, the leader 
of the group.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Just a meal...)
I moved through the curtain.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Just a meal! Just a meal!)

I exited to the dining area and immediately felt the 
gazes of dozens in my direction.

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
Oh...? Sorry, I mean Lady... Anton Baranov? Is 
that...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Gentleman was fine!
I angrily whispered to the nearby host.

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text: Apologies. Gentleman Anton Baranov, introduced.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

Turning my eyes back to the dining room, a 
thought occurred.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, what do I do now?!)

I saw Charlotte and Rowan at a large, fancy table 
with a number of other also fancy looking nobles.

My eyes scanned the area, until...

...I saw Kara motioning for me to join her at a 
smaller, less notable table to the side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Thank the Goddess!)

I scurried over, stiff as a board with nervousness, to 
the seat she had motioned me towards.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you thank you thank you!

As I thanked Kara in hushed whispers, she only 
signaled for me to not get too loud.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You did well.

The rest of our group’s introductions were finished, 
and a thought occurred to me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hey, Kara... Why aren’t you sitting with Charlotte 
and Rowan?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
My family here in the Kingdom is a minor noble 
lineage.

So, my standing is more in line with honored guests 
such as yourself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...

The introductions went on, and it moved on past 
the Crows and back to other invited nobles from 
the kingdom.

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
Introducing Lord Flynn Coslett. Heir to the Coslett 
lineage.

I saw a young man exit from a different curtain 
than we had exited before.

He was wearing what looked like a purple colored 
uniform. It stood out from what other nobles were 
wearing.

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
And introducing Lady Reagyn Coslett, also of the 
Coslett lineage.
A young woman exited as well.

She was also wearing a similar style of uniform. It 
was as though the two uniforms were meant to 
match.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...”Coslett”?

lines.speaker: Host
lines.text:
Both Lord and Lady Coslett are graduates of the 
Theodal Royal College as of this week.

With this announcement of a milestone, a light 
applause rose from the nobles in attendance.

Flynn gave a short bow and Reagyn a customary 
curtsey, before they moved from the spotlight they 
were provided.
They moved to their seats... which were...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hello.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: A good day to you.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Y- Yeah. A good day to you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Congratulations on your graduation.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
To be graduating already. It must feel like time is 
flying by.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Maybe a little too quick at times.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Thank you for the sentiment, Lady Kara.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
It feels like it has been forever since you visited the 
school.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I really should try to make more time for that.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Nonsense. You’ve been appointed as an attendant 
to the Queen herself.

Such an honor should be given the utmost effort 
and focus.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I recall when I heard about the appointment. 
Everyone at home was very impressed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You really know just about everyone, don’t you 
Kara?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: “Lady” Kara.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right... Lady Kara.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Giggle*
After some time, we finally did get food, but...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The other fork.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, uh... this one?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Closer, but still another fork.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But I only have the...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, this is a fork?!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (At least I can eat now, I think?)

I plunged my fork into the meat slab in front of me. 
With a swift shift, I was in position to start cutting 
a piece.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Pup, your grip. You should be doing that 
underhanded.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Anton. Your grip. You should attempt it with an 
underhand grip.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Underhand... what? The fork?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Or the knife...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, which is it...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It depends on which hand is your dominant hand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Just... I’ll have to bear with it.)

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: It... uh... It can be... a learning curve.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

So this is the force tasked with keeping a princess 
safe?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Sis, that’s...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Now, Lady Reagyn, is that really appropriate?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I offer it as a sincere criticism.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Because I didn’t know which fork to use?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Because you neither know nor care why it is 
important.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Today was supposed to be relaxing...

The sound of 'spoon to glassware' interrupted our 
stare-off.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
Welcome to all our esteemed guests of the day.

Especially to those that I have not had the pleasure 
of greeting this fine day.

The noble was at the head of the fanciest table, 
with Charlotte and company within sight near him.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...didn’t mean that...
She was near him... in a clear panic.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
Before we give it our all on the field, it is per the 
rules to decide the starting positions via a “Knight’s 
Roundtable”.
And in such fair sporting measures, I would like to 
introduce our volunteer from Lady 
Charlotte’s team...
“Pup Baranov”!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Oh dear. Did she forget to use your proper name 
when talking to the Lord?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Volunteer for... what?

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
And for my team, we shall stay with our choice of 
Lady Reagyn Coslett.

Do us proud, our young compatriot!
I turned my head back to Reagyn.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So what was I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...just volunteered for?!

The switch from the banquet into a mini-arena was 
fast as servants zoomed about.

Reagyn was standing across from me, seeming to 
be prepared for a fight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What is...? Didn’t someone say the word “Knight” 
somewhere?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah! Are we finally going to actually duel?!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I can’t imagine you standing much of a chance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Let’s see how much you actually know about 
proper swordplay, then!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
No, Anton. It is a ceremonial fight. It is more akin 
to ‘dance’.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Huh...?!

The Goddess’s underwear, you’re ruining duels, 
too?!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
You should watch your tongue in these esteemed 
halls.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Pup, I’m... Yeah, I didn’t mean for this.

One thing led to the other, and the Lord 
misinterpretted what I was saying.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Just try to follow the rhythm.

This is a sport unto itself, and you’re aiming to get 
“points”.

We can act as support, but not participate directly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh... Fine. I’ll try to figure this out.

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte, Kara die

Queen Avalina and her dispatched knights entered the
village from the mountain trails nearby.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Good. Now move the package to-

She stared down our group with a look of surprise and
anger.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Men, focus on dispatching the Imperial riffraff.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Yes, your majesty.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Hm...? Those guys look different...)

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Argh!
The bandit fell to the ground.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: T- Thank you!
She said as she bolted away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, at least she's safe.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
This town is one housing a royal vacation home? 
Your queen must enjoy the tranquility.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

It is... a cover.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Cover for... what?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It is not my place to say. But if she is here for why I
believe she is... then she will need the assistance.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... Is that so?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then we'll hear it from the horse's mouth, I imagine.
Norde opened his medicine and downed the liquid.
I felt around in my gear for my own.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Not yet... I don't need it. Not yet.)

Let's not waste anymore time!

lines.speaker: Fancy Man
lines.text:
Thanks for coming to our rescue!

I recently saw a gryphon knight flying over the 
mountains... didn't look like one of the Queen's 
soldiers... 
She might have something to do with all this... but 
maybe I am just paranoid. 

Again, thanks for saving us.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is your decision to make.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I didn't say anything.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I asked Charlotte to help because her allies are less
likely to be beholden to those feelings of loyalty.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: But I will not blame you for acting on them.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Acknowledged.

Flynn slashed away at a bandit, and they fell down
seemingly dead.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: *Pant* ... *Pant* ...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: T- They're... dead...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do not dwell on it.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Oh- ... Prince Alexei, you...?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not dwell on it.

Look to the next target. Remember they wish to 
kill you.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: But...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Remember what they wish to do to you, your 
loved ones, and your country.

Do not let yourself get distracted.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: O- Okay... I'll try.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Notifying Bark*!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'll be right there!

Mariel jumped towards the direction of the bark and
quickly started her healing magic's process.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It'll be okay...

The injured villager there slowly gained their vitality
back.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Vigilant growl*...

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: T- Thank you...!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Just get to safety.
The villager did as they were told, and headed off.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Good job, boy. Let me know if you find any others.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Determined bark*!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Tsk! These scabs can just die.

What sort o' deplored souls would take on this sort 
o' job?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I can't imagine it as that different than you 
sinking ships.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heh. I knew what scum I was targettin'. None of 
'em lot didn't deserve their fate.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I wonder.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Wonder all you like, momma bird. Will be true til my
timely death.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
No. I more wonder if these bandits have those 
among them that think the same as you.

That they're just attacking people who deserve it.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh. Why'd ya gotta bring that gray area mishmush 
into this?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Perhaps it's a matter of the mood I'm in.

Not everyone will have sparkling memories of this
country.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya don't say...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You know, correct?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why that Kara women believes the Queen came here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then you are also compelled to silence.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm not about to spill a potential state secret if it
isn't relevant. Even if it isn't my own.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Understood.
## Kara x Reagyn #####

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is your decision to make.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I didn't say anything.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I asked Charlotte to help because her allies are less
likely to be beholden to those feelings of loyalty.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: But I will not blame you for acting on them.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Acknowledged.
## Flynn x Rowan #####

Flynn slashed away at a bandit, and they fell down
seemingly dead.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Pant
... 
pant
...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: T- They're... dead...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do not dwell on it.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Oh- ... Prince Alexei, you...?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not dwell on it.

Look to the next target. Remember they wish to kill
you.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: But...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Remember what they wish to do to you, your loved ones,
and your country.

Do not let yourself get distracted.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: O- Okay... I'll try.
## Mariel x Jakson #####

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Notifying Bark
!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'll be right there!

Mariel jumped towards the direction of the bark and
quickly started her healing magic's process.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It'll be okay...

The injured villager there slowly gained their vitality
back.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Vigilant growl
...
T- Thank you...!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Just get to safety.
The villager did as they were told, and headed off.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Good job, boy. Let me know if you find any others.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Determined bark
!
## Satia x Otis #####

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Tsk! These scabs can just die.

What sort o' deplored souls would take on this sort o'
job?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I can't imagine it that different than you sinking
ships.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heh. I knew what scum I was targettin'. None of 'em lot
didn't deserve their fate.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I wonder.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Wonder all you like, momma bird. Will be true til my
timely death.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
No. I more wonder if these bandits have those who think
the same as you.

That they're just attacking people who deserve it.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh. Why'd ya gotta bring that gray area mishmush into
this?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Not everyone will have sparkling memories of this
country.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya don't say...?
## Charlotte x Norde #####

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You know, correct?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why that Kara women believes the Queen came here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I don't know what you're talking about.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then you are also compelled to silence.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm not about to spill a potential state secret if it
isn't relevant. Even if it isn't my own.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Understood.
I stared at the sight of soldiers mobilizing.

Regiments were forming their units, and orders 
were barked all about.
But...
It was silent.

The clamor of the hustling scene was overwhelmed 
by the indomitable silence of my own thoughts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhales*...
I felt the pressure flow away as I breathed out.

And I hesitated, if just for a second, to breathe
again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We can do this.)
Some time before...

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: ...You DARE set foot here as such?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Your majesty...

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
This is a sacred place of authority and history.

It is not to be disrespected without expectation of
capital repercussions.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do hope you understand that I wouldn't have 
done it if the security of the Kingdom didn't 
depend on it.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
...!

You make such a claim... over bandits...?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Sigh

... As said, it is but a ploy.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You do not know the minds of those whom wish 
your reign disturbed.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
And when does the plea of a con artist ever not 
appeal to the ignorance of a target?

You act as though you have no motivation to drag 
my peace into the frenzy of war.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We want to help you save your kingdom. Then 
we can figure out if you'll help Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
We've already seen enough death... We wouldn't 
want more.

The Queen stood in perfect composure as her 
silence betrayed her antagonism.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Then make your case.

But to waste the court's time will be considered 
the crime it is.

Do remember that.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Of course, your majesty. 

I wouldn't have brought them here if such an 
end result was in the cards.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well, we're happy to have your cooperation for the 
time being, then.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As noted, the belief is that the Empire is 
attempting a similar gambit as they did with 
Lockhart.
Under the guise of bandit raids, they transition the
drama of the endeavor into a proper military attack.

It allows them to dictate the strategy of the early
moments of conflict and place the target on their
heels.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It happened to my home. I know too well how 
much damage those moments of uncertainty can 
do.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Why would they be foolish enough to conduct 
such a shaky strategy twice?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Because that's what everyone said about the idea 
in Lockhart.

As it was happening.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
The good news is that the Nightless Crows just 
happened to have been witness to both this and 
that occasion.
Anton, if you could approach?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Just a little longer...)

I was positioned in the back, away from the actual
discussion.

Unlike Charlotte and the other nobles, I stayed with
the rest of the Crows external to the session of 
royal court.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Anton, we need you to join us and come over 
here.

...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: PUP...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup, please come tell the Queen about it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right... Yeah...

I approached and stood at a stark attention as I 
began to talk.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you very much for your assistance with this.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Anton here was there when it happened.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Then, Anton Baranov of the Nightless Crows... Tell 
me of this ordeal.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I am... Anton Baranov. I currently act as...
I began to recount the story, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And the telegram lines. They were.. And then... 
then...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: P- Pup...!?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: M-...! A- Anton!

Mariel, Rowan, and a number of medical 
professionals jumped to assist my unconscious self.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mi-...! A- Anton!

Rowan and a number of medical professionals jumped to
assist my unconscious self.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Had it gotten that bad?

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Wh- What is this?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: An aftereffect of the scars left from Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It seems the commander of the Imperial forces 
wields an Oathbreaker as a weapon.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Mr. Norde. It seems we have no better option.
Norde turned his head towards the queen.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
...

Very well. It may approach.

And... speak, if it must.
Norde approached the group as I had.
And he faced the queen with eyes unflinching.
Back in present time.

With a delicate touch, my fingers fidgeted with a 
small glass bottle in my fingers.
In it existed a liquid with a slight glow to it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Thank you, Kara. I don't know how you did it, 
but...)

(With this I can fight.)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
This will not cure you. This will not ease your
symptoms.

It will, however, stop them from getting worse for 
a time.

And that is all it will be. Time. Time that you must
make the most of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How did you...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Promise everyone you will not allow yourself to die.

Promise.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay. I promise.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Good.

A glint of light from the rising sun flickered on the
curves of the glass bottle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (With this...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (With this I have time to fight. To help.)

I drew it close as I felt a sincere elevating 
hope around me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(But not yet. I can still wait.)

(I need to make the most of the time I have. 
Before this curse takes me out of the battle.)

The vial would only give me time. I decided that it
would be best used at strategic moments to stop 
the worst case scenarios.
So I stuffed it into a secure pouch on my gearset.

And with that, my eyes traveled towards the
preparations of the various military and mercenary
companies here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(The rest of the Crows are making their final
preparations to move out.)

(If I remember correctly... Kara also gave Otis and
Norde some medicine for the weakness symptoms.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(The rest of the Crows are making their final
preparations to move out.)

(If I remember correctly... Kara also gave Norde some
medicine for the weakness symptoms.)
My eyes wandered further.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (The Kingdom's nobility is being mobilized as well.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Though I think those two were assigned to 
accompany us after they fought with us before?)

(They'll probably join with the Crows soon
enough.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Hopefully the Goddess watches over them.)
My eyes continued to pan over the scene.
It was all a similar view, until...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (The Queen? She's mobilizing, too?)

The queen had mounted a horse while 
I had the thought pass through my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe she really believes in the threat now?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I believe she does.
Kara had appeared at my side.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Apologies for the surprise.

And thank you again for your assistance to the 
Kingdom.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course... And thanks for the medicine as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You'll have to teach me how to make it when this 
is done.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Haha... Some family secrets are not mine to divulge.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Speaking of family... Will you be joining yours? It
looks like the nobility is being mobilized.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Or are you here to go join the Queen in her 
efforts?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I have been assigned to be an escort to Charlotte 
and her company. So we shall remain allies on the 
field for a time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Good to have your reliable self along for the ride,
then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

As I said as much, I saw several knights also 
preparing their horses for travel.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(If she's headed off for the front lines, you'd think
she'd want her trusted advisors with her, though.)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is odd.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sorry?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Queen Avalina does appear to believe the threat is
real.

Tell me. What would you do if your home was 
threatened like Lockhart was?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh... That's quite a question. I don't know. I'd do
everything I can to protect it. I'd probably...

(Huh... Wait...)

I'd... protect my home. The city itself.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed. So why is our head of state riding off into 
the distance if she truly believes the threat true?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... probably beyond my paygrade.

Kara stood there staring out at Queen Avalina's
regiment as they began to move from the 
mobilizing area.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Anton Baranov. You said before you acted as
representative of the Nightless Crows, did you not?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, sort of. We haven't actually talked about it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're just waiting until... until my father catches 
up to the group again.

(It would be pointless to discuss it... It would.)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then, as acting representative of your fellows...

Kara had broken her eyeline from the queen and 
turned to me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I have a request of you Nightless Crows.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: "Follow the Queen"...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Yes. She will need help.

Our group had headed off, but were riding to 
where Kara believed the Queen had set off to 
instead.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And because we are allies outside of the nobility 
here, we can help without feeling like we're 
betraying any loyalty.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This far out, though... This seems really out of the
way and it isn't like it'd be a frontline for an
invasion.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
To even leave the capital and palace without her
leadership...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Is she abandoning it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: She wouldn't flee? She doesn't seem the sort.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I do not believe she is doing that.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I hesitate to speak on it without being sure, but...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm sure she has good reason to be here.

The horizon gave way to the sight of our 
destination, and our ride didn't last much longer.

And what stood before us was a sleepy village at 
the base of a mountain.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Not to be rude, but... here?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
This is Karotown. It is a small rustic town.

I also believe the Queen is rumored to have a 
vacation home situated here.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Does she? What an interesting coincidence.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Ahhh!!!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Bandit raids.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No time to waste!

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Burn to ash.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Rraghh!!!

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Good riddance.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Your majesty, I believe that was the last of them.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Thank you. Prepare the container for transport to 
the capital.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Yes, ma'am.

Several knights joined the queen by her side. One 
of them was holding a heavy metal case.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant* ... I can... I'm okay.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hm...?

(That case? Is that what they're here for?)

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Move with me.

Queen Avalina started on her way out of 
the village as though we weren't there.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Your majesty.
She stopped.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: How dare you?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Y- Your majesty, I only-

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
I can be lenient... if the punishment leads to the
proper reform.

Will it?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I am... 

I only wished to support you...

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Then we will speak again later. Return your forces 
to their assignments.
The Queen began forward again.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Then I will stop pretending.

Did you secure "it"?
Her forward march had come to an abrupt stop.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
What?

What did you just say?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Is "it" inside that case? Was it secured before it was
too late?

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
My dear Kara... You are a wonderfully bright young
woman.

But to try and manipulate your regent into 
providing you information you have no right to 
know...

Queen Avalina raised her hand as though she was 
about to have the knights attack.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What the...?! What's happening?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, so she was pulling on that string.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
*Sigh*... What a sour note to come from that 
pluck.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: String?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The fan.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: How do you...?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can assure you. I only wish for the best for the
Kingdom and the world.

Hiding it in the capital is a risk too great for your
plan. The empire could already have infiltrators 
ready to destroy it.
They know you'd want to bring it there.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
...

Men. At arms.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Ma'am!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What?! Why are you...!?

The Queen and Kara stared at each other, as 
though an execution was prepared to go off on a 
hair trigger.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pft. How stupid.
The queen's eyes shot daggers at Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? You think she's a traitor?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We've only met the handful of times before, but 
even through that I know you're better than this, 
Avalina.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: You dare...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You've surrounded yourself with too many yes-men 
if you think Kara figuring it out is some devious act.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I bet you have merchants that could work it out in 
the kingdom.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Work out... what's in the case?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed. After all, it's an open secret among
the noble circles of most countries.

Rumors are inevitable.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
What little faith one has in their attendants to think
they could not put two and two together?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Meaning what's in the case is...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: An Oathbreaker.

A murmur began within the knights accompanying 
the queen.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: A... we're transporting... what?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What...?!

That's... blasphemous... and...

Would the Covenant stand for that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Openly.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The Oathbreakers pre-date the Covenant. 

Naturally, powerful entitles like kings and emperors 
would hoard them.

And of the most powerful ones? Ones strong 
enough to say... win a war?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Why would they ever hand those over to the 
Covenant? Unholy as they be.

So stands the deterrents of the land. A dirty 
secret that keeps the peace.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then...

The equation solved in my mind. I knew what two 
plus two equaled.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The kingdom is... "the uninvadable country"... 
because of...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: An Oathbreaker, yes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A shame Lockhart is too modern to carry that sort 
of history.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So that means the empire has one too? 
Is it... that key of yours?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Hah! No, that is truly the loot of a bygone night of
festivity.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then... that sword. The Steel Wolf's sword?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

No. That one is new.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I do not know where it came from.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Your majesty. I only wish to help.

The capital is too dangerous of a place to transfer it
to.

The queen took a step back, but her raised hand 
from before did not waver.
The hair trigger was still ready to be pulled.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Are you crazy...?)
My own hand went to my sword hilt.
The ground quaked beneath our feet.

With my head on a swivel, it didn't take long to see
what the disturbance was.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: The fuckin' mountain's fuming?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That is smoke rising from it's peak?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It's... like it's on fire?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Is it on fire?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The volcano is erupting.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Volcano"? Is that another made up noble word?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is... new to me as well.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A volcano is a mountain that does... that.

She said, motioning to the rising smoke from it's 
top.
Kara spun back to the Queen.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: No... No no no. This is too soon.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Queen Avalina. Your mountain is exploding.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Y- Your majesty. What do we do?!

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
...

Create a defensive formation. Do not let the 
traitors near.

Prepare to open the case. I must act fast.

A curtain of steel blanketed the view between 
Kara's glare and the Queen herself.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Be careful with it.

We need to be deliberate... and...

...then we need... to...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Rrraghhhh!!!

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Your majesty!

Atop a gryphon, a figure had swooped in with 
eyes trained on the queen.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: *Pant*... Thank the Goddess I was in time.

Nora's strike had clashed with the defensive 
maneuver of the knight by the queen's side.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Isn't that...?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That mercenary from Lockhart! The one hired by 
the empire!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Hmph.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: NOW!!!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Arrows?)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Move!

I jumped to the side as an arrow narrowly missed 
my face.

My jumbled vision managed to catch the sight of 
most of my allies doing the same.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Your majesty!

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Agk!

The knight crumped to the floor as an arrow 
pierced cleanly through his neck.

And the queen stumbled to the ground, otherwise
unharmed due to the heroics.
But as the chaos of the scene played out...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The case...?!

The case came tumbling with the rest, and 
something fell out as it fully opened.
An ornate looking fan landed into the dirt and mud.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Is that it?)

(The Oathbreaker that "could win a war"?!)

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Fall into formation!

Nora and her gryphon were blocked from grabbing 
it, so she ordered a basic retreat to regroup.
Her move came with another rumble of the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(And there's that.)

What else do you want to throw at us this-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This... time...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(If that mercenary from Lockhart's invasion 
is here...)

(Then... couldn't that...)

(Couldn't... that... mean...)
My head turned slowly.

Inch by inch, it swiveled towards the village 
entrance.
I didn't want to look.
But then I caught sight of something.
There. At the very edge of my perception.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You...! You again?!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Ah, you’re that... uh...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: ...farmer...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What are you talking about?!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Should I recognize you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You tried to kill us!

Twice!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Huh...

You don’t... look like a princess...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
I thought those Lockhart girls were
blonde?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We’re the ones protecting Lockhart!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Argh! I’m not paid enough to remember all that!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Enemies from the flank...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Ugh... This isn’t what we’re here for...

I’m not paid nearly enough for this
sort of pain...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Return the Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ‘Return the what’...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Is there some sort of confusion to be had here? 
You work for the Covenant?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I saw your group take it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Actually, aren’t you Elliot Elvanus?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I have a fiancé named “Cainan DeClares”...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: You... know Sir Cainan...?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: N- No... I need to focus on retrieving the relic.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Argh... I can’t... retrieve it.

I’m sorry Goddess, but I need to retreat.

...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Sir Cainan’s fiancé, though...?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Argh... I can’t... retrieve it.

I’m sorry Goddess, but I need to retreat.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Return the Eul’unta.

It is Covenant property.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Return the Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ‘Return the what’...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Is there some sort of confusion to be had here? 
You work for the Covenant?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I saw your group take it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Actually, aren’t you Elliot Elvanus?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I have a fiancé named “Cainan DeClares”...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: You... know Sir Cainan...?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: N- No... I need to focus on retrieving the relic.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Argh... I can’t... retrieve it.

I’m sorry Goddess, but I need to retreat.

...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Sir Cainan’s fiancé, though...?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Argh... I can’t... retrieve it.

I’m sorry Goddess, but I need to retreat.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is truly a pleasure to see you all still safe.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Especially you, my little Pup! I was so worried!

Satia had burst forward and grabbed me 
from behind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh!

Up on my feet a bit too quickly, a slight dizziness
threw off my balance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yes. All fit as a fiddle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Now...
I slipped out of her grip.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We need to keep moving.

I looked down ever so slightly and saw the main 
source of my balance problems.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Aw...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We shouldn't stand around for too long.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do we have a plan of where to go?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Shoot me for being the voice of reason, but 
perhaps it'd be best to stop to catch our breath?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Between planning and... members of our group 
likely needing a slight adaptation period...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You, too?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's fine. I won't let it be a distraction.

There are more important things to worry
about over something too far in to stop.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That's not quite what I meant.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
A long trek through mountains with two newly 
endowed allies with you...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I imagine one of our more well equipped ladies can
speak to the nature of such a journey, even for 
those well adjusted to it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas, am I wrong? Shoot me for being the voice of
reason, not for being the messenger of it.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Aye. There's likely gonna be trouble it brings at
first.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I already figured out some ways to support them 
from when I was trying to hide it before.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Unless, Rowan, you were hoping they'd be jiggling 
out of my shirt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know what, if it gets us out of here quicker, 
feel free to stare all you want.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm personally more concerned about the scattering 
of bandits and soldiers in the area.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
True... Though, they do not look to be pursuing 
us, at least.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It'll probably be difficult to get all of us through
here without engaging them, though.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Yes, let's move with the intent to clear the way as 
the front line. Then the rest of our forces can 
follow.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Let's do that then.

Norde and myself started directing people into
positions.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

That... offer...

Does it expire...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, wait, where did everyone go?! Wait for me!

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies.
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte or Kara die.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There we go.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Eh, now what? Just walk through the mountains?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Where does that leave us for next steps? Just keep
walking?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is a village at the true border to the empire.

As predictable as it may be... so long as we stay
moving then we can take advantage of it for a 
short resupply.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then we-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We can do that then. No time to waste.

We moved across the foot of each mountain 
as we found our way to a nearby village.
On the outskirts of the village...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Finally, someplace with walls.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: This snow and cold is... so very inefficient...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A village with walls... and warmth? Thank the 
Goddess.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We should move quickly to resupply and get going.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What are the chances they are lacking in supplies 
for us to purchase?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Too many unknowns to say for sure.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
H- Hopefully they have some underlayers we can stock up
on for warmth...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Though if the cold is getting to those of us less used
to the climate, they may have options.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, she's not wrong...)

After a slight chill ran through me, I looked around
and saw some of the people that had joined us.

A few were clearly not handling it well.

Those from Cartenan or the south seemed 
particularly flustered.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Anton, do you also wish to partake?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... No, this coat is plenty.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It would give you the opportunity to revitalize your
wardrobe.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, that thing hasn't fit well since Lockhart. And
now...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, that's unnecessary.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
As a girl myself, all I can say is that thing looks
especially uncomfortable to move around in.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- We're talking about warmth for a trek through 
the mountains.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We don't have time to be worrying about irrelevant
things now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
In fact, let's just keep moving. I can check the
southern buildings and-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No, I imagine horseback would be quicker.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, it'd be quickest to just start-

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Wait.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The village is in danger.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Crows... Move! There isn't time to waste!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We need to save them!

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies
Lose Condition: any villager die, Pup, Rowan, 
Charlotte, Kara die.

Warning: do not save over your save, use a 
different slot.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... There we go.

The last of the beasts went down and the villagers 
were safe.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
T- Thank you! You've helped avert a tragic end for 
our friends and family.

Is there anything we can do to express 
our gratitude?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah. You're welcome.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We were actually looking for a chance to resupply.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right. Could you possibly help with that?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Most importantly, we were looking to acquire 
thermal layering that our group could use.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Aye, we do have our share of that. Follow me.

The mayor introduced us to a local shop that 
stocked what we needed, and we gladly paid full 
price for the supplies we wanted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We can't spend too long here, so we'll be off 
sooner over later.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: You'd be welcome back here at any time!
And with that, we continued on into the mountains.
We moved deliberately through the mountains.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Taking less traveled paths will make it more difficult
to follow us.
Or so had been said prior.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It does mean that the path is not as well 
maintained, though...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Which... can make it more difficult to traverse...)

My own idle mind looked down to my body's recent
changes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Needing time to adapt, they said...?)

I looked back towards the others and the rest of 
the Nightless Crows with us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I really can't afford to let it distract me.)

We were slowly exiting a mountain pass into a 
valley, and there were more than a few that were 
handling it differently.

Turning to some of the others worn out 
by the hike...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey, can you switch places with...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Yeah, I think it'll help pace out the...

I started to direct the Crows in a way I thought 
could mitigate their fatigue.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Oh, Pup, what initiative you take.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh? What does that mean?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I mean it as a sincere compliment.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It is true you have been much more proactive than 
I had seen previously.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: This isn't some side effect of the curse, is it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I mean...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I'm just trying to play my part.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... It feels like more than that.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Because of...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's not really complicated.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Someone needs to step up because of... recent events.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I might as well.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is important to remember that-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... what was what?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Avalanche?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Quickly! Move!

The valley opening was blanketed by a cascade of 
the winter's wrath.

We had noticed quickly enough to get people 
moving out of its pathway, but...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is everyone alright?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: M- Maybe?! We need to take a count.
It would take some time to know for sure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Shit, this isn't good.

(Clearing this to get everyone through the path 
would be a big delay for us, even if everyone was 
safe.)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Take your count and start digging out the snow 
just in case anyone is stuck beneath.

Once we're confident everyone is safe, we can 
carve out a path through.

And after that-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I think some of those steps will have to wait.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: It appears the local wildlife was drawn to the noise...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: More beasts? They must have noticed the noise.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If they're hungry, we're gonna have to hold out for a
bit.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Crows, a group of us needs to form a defensive 
line.

The rest of you focus on saving those caught in 
the snow.

Win Condition: Survive for 8 turns
Lose Condition: Pup, Charlotte, Rowan, Kara die

Warning: do not save over your save, use a 
different slot.
Ah...?! What's this?
A faint light came from the heirloom on them.

The ground beneath our feet slowly rose and 
collected into a humanoid form.

With a flash of a greenish magical aura, it melded 
into a form more resembling a person.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What just happened there?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It appears a summoning occurred...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The green magic thing?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It must've reacted to a capable heirloom? 
Though...

Acting on such a hair trigger is a surprise unto
itself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So, who is...?

The woman stretched out like she had awakened 
from a long and deep sleep.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: To traverse a world in this form...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Hmph. To think of that even being possible...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Uh... something about her presence is 
intimidating...)

Hello. Who are... you...?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: I am Liebra.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
I suspect, more specifically... Liebra... NOT of this
land.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
How have you created my image in a way that walks
within this world?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You were... summoned via green magic?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm probably not the best person to ask...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Ah, what a cute flustered face you have.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What's that supposed to mean?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Nothing to dwell on. Simply...

She raised her hands and flames flickered on her
fingertips.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Would you like some assistance with the beasts 
that place you in peril?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm not going to say no to help...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But what do you want in return?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Nothing too complicated.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: I wish for entertainment.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: So do put on a good show~

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Anton! Norde! Everyone!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah!?

I turned to see the Nightless Crows breaking 
through the mounds of snow that had blocked the 
path.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You've broken through?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Excellent. Now we should have enough man power 
to scare them off.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Right! We're on it!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Now...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...everyone...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...attack!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...attack!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank the Goddess... What sort of animals can live 
in these conditions?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank the Goddess... That was exhausting...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Mayhap this is a time to seek a warm place to 
sleep?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Finding somewhere warm might be difficult.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
At this point I'm more concerned about the animals
getting hungry again.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It is certainly advisable to move from this area 
before bunkering down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Night will fall soon, so let's be quick about it.

The rescue efforts had identified a few missing 
people, but each of those men were found safely 
in the snow by the end.

With that sigh of relief, our exhausted group 
moved again to find a better place to make camp 
for the night.

We moved from the most recent mountain pass 
into another valley.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: This area appears to have promise.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Goddess do I hope you're right.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It looks defensible, at least.

We can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The site over there is good for the main tent, we 
can-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We can set the shift guard posts over there and...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
...

Thank the Goddess you two at least agree on 
WHAT to do...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I think we should take care of the imperial troops
first.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, I recognize some faces and armor styles over
there.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I suppose that it was only a matter of time since 
we crossed the border.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We could go around.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, well, there is an addendum I'd like to make to 
my observation.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I may have noticed them because I saw a soldier
frantically running in the direction opposite of us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One more fight then...

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies
Lose Condition: Pup, Kara, Charlotte, Rowan die

Warning: do not save over your save, use a 
different slot.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
...

What is that noise...? It isn't thieves, is it?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Wait, no, that isn't yours to take!

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Return it, now.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Sigh*... I am not paid enough for this.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Imperial summoner, you're in charge.

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.text: I have a name, you know?

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.text:
...And he's gone.

Pfft. He was an amateur anyways.

This will be the perfect opportunity to show why I
should be in charge!

Summoning magic...!

...?!

I think... I got... a big one...!

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.text: Haha~! That'll show 'em.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... that... has to be the last of it...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The area appears clear, at least.

Just in time for...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... Morning already...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No rest for the weary.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
This area is also compromised. We need to find 
another place for camp.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Siiiigggghhhhhh*........

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Elliot, was it?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
My name is Elliot Elvanus of the holy country, 
Aureria.

I am here as a representative of the Covenant.

I wanted to request that you return the 
Oathbreaker. The one I assumed was picked up 
by... accident.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So you're still on about that? That we picked up
something like that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It wasn't like you were asking before.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I mean the coin that one of you picked up before.

It was given to me as part of my Covenant
responsibilities.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Heh... a coin? As an Oathbreaker?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is possible.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I have heard myself that Oathbreakers "could be
anything", technically.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
That is true.

I am an Oathkeeper acting as a squire to the 
Covenant auditor Cainan DeClares.

I've been traveling the Imperial north as he covers 
the southern regions.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I was... surprised to hear that you may be his
fiancé...

Despite those doubts... too much in my memory 
seemed to confirm it for me to deny it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It was a pleasure to meet you before in Oadthine, 
even if it was for a short time.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
So that was you.

What... What brings you here? And you're fighting 
the Imperial troops?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What, have you not heard about the war with 
Lockhart and Cartenan?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: The... what?

It turned out that Elliot was isolated enough from
world news to only now hear of these events.
We explained as best we could.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: What a predicament to be roped into...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We do what we must, after all.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Indeed. It is a worthy cause.

May I join it?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I... wouldn't want to pull you from your duties.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It would be irresponsible of me to turn a blind eye
when presented with such a dilemma and a chance 
to help.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
There is... a sense of romance and adventure to it, 
as well.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I would give my bow and arrow to this endeavor, if
you'll have me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are we in a position to say no?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I would likely be forced to pursue the return of
Eul'unta if you do not.

If I come with, myself and Lady Kara can ensure 
that it is not abused before the end of this conflict.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yes, we wouldn't want anyone behind Covenant 
jail bars for improperly wielding an Oathbreaker, 
after all.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I, for one, would be happy to have you along.

It will be a delight to get to know my fiancé's
subordinate.

I imagine you have all sorts of interesting stories to
tell about his activities.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I will do what I can to make it entertaining, then.
Elliot has joined the party!

With that, we moved once more to find a safe place to
make camp.

This is debug feature. Do you wish to go to the last 
chapter's base?

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Yes / No
Press skip as fast as possible

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There we go.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Eh, now what? Just walk through the mountains?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Where does that leave us for next steps? Just keep
walking?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is a village at the true border to the empire.

As predictable as it may be... so long as we stay
moving then we can take advantage of it for a 
short resupply.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then we-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We can do that then. No time to waste.

We moved across the foot of each mountain as we found
our way to a nearby village.
On the outskirts of the village...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Finally, someplace with walls.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: This snow and cold is... so very inefficient...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A village with walls... and warmth? Thank the 
Goddess.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We should move quickly to resupply and get going.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What are the chances they are lacking in supplies 
for us to purchase?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Too many unknowns to say for sure.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
H- Hopefully they have some underlayers we can stock up
on for warmth...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Though if the cold is getting to those of us less used
to the climate, they may have options.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, she's not wrong...)

After a slight chill ran through me, I looked around
and saw some of the people that had joined us not
handling it well.

Those from Cartenan or the south seemed 
particularly flustered.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Anton, do you also wish to partake?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... No, this coat is plenty.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It would give you the opportunity to revitalize your
wardrobe.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, that thing hasn't fit well since Lockhart. And
now...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, that's unnecessary.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
As a girl myself, all I can say is that thing looks
especially uncomfortable to move around in.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- We're talking about warmth for a trek through 
the mountains.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We don't have time to be worrying about irrelevant
things now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
In fact, let's just keep moving. I can check the
southern buildings and-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No, I imagine horseback would be quicker.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, it'd be quickest to just start-

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Wait.

STAGE DIRECTION> BEAST ENEMIES TO DEFEAT AND VILLAGER
ALLIES TO PROTECT ENTER AT THEIR PLACES IN EACH VILLAGE
LOCATION

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The village is in danger.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Crows... Move! There isn't time to waste!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We need to save them!

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies
Lose Cndition: All villagers die, Pup, Rowan, 
Charlotte, Kara die.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
T- Thank you! I don't know what has those beasts all
riled up lately...

Here, maybe this will help on your travels...

STAGE DIRECTION> GIFT USEFUL ITEM (HEALING?), PLAY
JINGLE, AND POP UP MESSAGE FOR IT

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Argh, those damned beasts again. Thanks for saving my
shop. Even if I think one ate my secret stash.

...Fuck it. The wife will be happy with flowers this
anniversary, anyways.

He walks off, but we stay behind and noticed that one
of the slain beasts spit out a small sack in the fight.

STAGE DIRECTION> GIFT GOLD, PLAY JINGLE, AND GIVE
MESSAGE THAT IT HAPPENED

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Thank the Goddess you lot were here.

I've been taking care of another mercenary that got
hurt as they passed through...

Hmm... Oh, are they one of yours?

"Nightless Crows"... I can check.

STAGE DIRECTION> GIFT TIER 2 MERC TOKEN, PLAY JINGLE,
AND GIVE MESSAGE THAT IT HAPPENED

################ Complete Map Part 2 objective
#############

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
T- Thank you! I don't know what has those beasts 
all riled up lately...

Here, maybe this will help on your travels...

lines.speaker: Villager 1
lines.text:
Argh, those damned beasts again. Thanks for 
saving my shop. Even if I think one ate my secret 
stash.
...Fuck it. The wife will be happy with flowers this
anniversary, anyways.

He walks off, but we stay behind and noticed that 
one of the slain beasts spit out a small sack in the 
fight.

lines.speaker: Villager 2
lines.text:
Thank the Goddess you lot were here.

I've been taking care of another mercenary that 
got hurt as they passed through...

Hmm... Oh, are they one of yours?

"Nightless Crows"... I can check.
Received a Merc Token Rank 2!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Hey... Pup... Do you... want to talk?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sorry, but... We're a bit busy, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You want to stay alive long enough to retake 
Lockhart, right?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...

I'm sorry about what happened to your father.

I know what it's like to... to...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We've got more important things to focus on.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Just... let me know if you want to talk about it.

I'm not going anywhere.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hey, Kara. I just wanted to say that I'm happy that
you're sticking around with us.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Leaving your country like that can't be easy. I'd
understand if you turned around and went back 
now, but...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I appreciate it. Truly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A lovely sentiment. Thank you for saying as much.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I do mean it that I'd understand if you turned 
around right now...

I wouldn't want you coming with us out of some 
sense of obligation.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I can assure you that isn't the case.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
What I see is the greatest opportunity to make a
difference in this conflict.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The Kingdom cannot be changed from its fate 
unless something more fundamental is solved.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I guess I would phrase it as...

"All roads lead to Lockhart"

...and I rather be in a position to have a hand in 
that fate than struggling in a losing battle.

It is the most I can do for Cartenan now.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You've put a lot of thought into this.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: There are few decisions I make lightly.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Then let me double the appreciation I gave before.
Thank you.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Satia... I need to ask..

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You want to know my opinion on Pup's recent 
change?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: At least it's obvious enough to draw your interest.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Then I'd ask... which change?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The behavior, of course.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Anton has never been one to try and be a leader 
of the Crows.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I do think I understand it.

I'll ask you... Why haven't you taken up the 
leadership of the company?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I regularly take on responsibilities with the
organization of it all.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
And everything else?

Why did you never try and be THE leader of the 
Crows?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Because there was always-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Because Ivan was always there.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I do not know if Pup really wants to step up like
this... Time will tell...

For now, I think it helps to keep his mind off of it...

...while also trying to fill the shoes that were lost.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Argh... Stupid... s- snow...!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Curious whine*...?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Oi, you've no place to talk. Stupid dog... You're
literally bred to do this shite.

Just look at you. Pile o' muscles and fat.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bragging bark*...!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Tsk. Damned mutt...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Brr...
Tatiana shrunk to within her armor like a turtle.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Much better...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: How well does that work?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Ah, is the little noble girl jealous?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: No, I-

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Nevermind, this isn't worth it.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
After everything in Cartenan recently, I don't have 
the patience.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I can't imagine you'd understand, so you can focus 
your attention elsewhere.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
...

Nah, I get it.

Waking up with everything you cared about fallin' 
to pieces around you...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
My best take on it all would be simple...

Sometimes you gotta rebuild or find a new place to 
find some warmth.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I... appreciate the thought. Though I'm not sure 
you entirely get my family's situation and obligations 
to-

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Sure I do.

Here, I'll even let you use my armor to warm up 
out here if ya need it.

You're small enough that the both of us could fit.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I honestly can't tell if you're trying to antagonize 
me or be nice.

I'll be optimistic and assume the latter.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: But... I'm not going to share your armor with you...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
We'll get that noble stuffiness out of ya at some
point.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I must say, I am surprised you've followed this 
group this far.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Uh... Sorry?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I mean no insult. I mean no compliment either.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I simply expected a noble of the Kingdom to be 
more hesitant to leave it behind.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
My own birth was across the continent, so that
patriotism amongst the nobles was always an 
enigma to me.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I don't think it's too complicated.

The kingdom was... is... a bastion worth 
protecting. It is a people worth protecting.

I was always taught that I, as a noble, have an
obligation to protect it.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
If the best option I have to fix my country's 
problems is outside of the country, I have no qualm 
doing so.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmph. I guess I must have simply misjudged how 
that patriotism was directed, then.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Maybe it is... a bit.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
But... as scared I am of the responsibility of being a
Lord one day...

I do truly want to do right by their happiness.

Even if we all moved to another country... I'd want
them to thrive.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I think that is wonderful. I can see the value.

It must be comforting to have that sense of 
purpose.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: "Terrifying"... That's the word I'd choose.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I think by your words alone that I know you'll do
wonderfully.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: I hope you're right...
It was not fine.
It was NOT FINE.
IT
WAS
NOT
FINE

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Y- Your majesty, I simply meant-

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
Traitor.

Take him to the deepest dungeon.

If he resists, slit his throat there and then.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Wait, no, all I did was-!
The soldier's vision was blanketed in darkness.

And his muffled pleas were drowned out by the 
heavy sound of plate armored guards dragging him 
away.

Alexei IV, the emperor of the Nolvanus Empire, 
slowly lowered again onto his throne.
And he sat there.
Silently.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Hmm...

That is one way to react to news of a resounding
victory.
His eyes turned slowly towards Simon.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: I... mean no insult.

lines.speaker: Simon
