lines.text: You are most wise, of course.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: That beast...

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: He... DESTROYED THE OATHBREAKER!
An audible crackling sound could be heard.

The emperor's fingers dug into his throne to the 
point of splintering it ever slightly.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Sir. We are not aware of why he did so. It may 
have been a strategic necessity.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Or it may be a ploy. He could've have faked its
destruction and kept it for himself.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
There is no need to inject such inciting, baseless
speculation.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
"Baseless"? What man of good sense would let 
such a treasure be destroyed?

It does not take a tactician to see the thread of
logic.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: I should've kept a closer eye on that one...

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Has that boy ever been disloyal before?

He even returned to serve his country after his 
time in the crusades.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
He was under no obligation to... and he did so in its
hour of need.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Hmph. Such loyalty yet these are the results he brings?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: How have you fared in your "Lockhart Princess" problem?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Progressing. No thanks to your beast, either.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
I should have kept a closer eye on that one.

Even as a child...

...was he plotting against me?

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Plotting against US.

The click of heels pierced through the dreary 
silence.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: The things the help will say!

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
...My emperor and empress. I ask of you to not 
panic in this time.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
Not panic? That bastard child is running out and 
about.

The maids are saying he is with the enemy!

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Bastard child?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: The crown prince? Or...?

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Of course it's him.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
They say 'the Prince of Nolvanus' appeared in the
Cartenan throne room as an ally!

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: No, that one knows his place. He will fulfill his role.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
Then why haven't we heard from him in over a 
year?

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
He will do what he must.

He has to.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Ah... It doesn't even matter...

The empress made her way over to the throne, 
slinking down into a fetal type position at its side.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
He must have just started a rumor...

That's where he's been this last year... Hiding and
waiting for his chance to ruin me...

A dreary silence once again fell across the throne
room.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
I will ask once again to allow yourself to be free of
these trains of thought.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
You must focus your efforts on the war itself. The
Empire's future is on the line.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Speaking of which, I was quite curious as to the 
ending of that story. What happened in Cartenan?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Yes, perhaps it'd have been to let the messenger
finish, at least.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
...

Guard.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text: S- Sir?

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
Drag what's left of that man back here.

I will hear every word...

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: ...of exactly what happened in Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Haven't you done enough?!

The two exchanged blows once more, with the 
Queen being driven back without much effort on 
the Wolf's part.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Argh...!

Queen Avalina fell to a knee, panting for any 
breath she could get.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
You... that dragon... Where did it even go?

What...  *pant*... are you planning...?

With a slight tilt of his head, the Wolf looked at the
Queen's arm.

A glistening patch of bloody red from the recent
exchange of blows.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Answer...!
But, he simply... sheathed his sword.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: P- Please... Why... Why have you...?!

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: It does not matter.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: W- What?!
He simply turned and start walking away.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: The seed is sown.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: You can't-
She started to rise to her feet to chase after him.
But a select number of guards blocked her path.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Not another movement.

What remained of the Queen's guard managed to 
pull her back into safety from Nora and the others.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: No... No no no...

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
She is of no threat.

She is weak.
The Steel Wolf turned back to Nora.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
You may continue your own task. It aligns with 
that man's goals, after all.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You mean...?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Thank you.
The Steel Wolf didn't stick around to listen.

He had turned his back to the scene and was 
already gone.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I will make the most of it. I must secure the future 
of my home and family.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Malcus... Kiolna... I won't let you down.
*Drip*
*Drip drip*...

My eyes fluttered open like I had awoken from
hibernation.

Everything felt new to me from my surroundings 
to my...
I got up... slowly...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Argh...

(That's... sore... everywhere...)

Up on my feet a bit too quickly, a slight dizziness
threw off my balance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shit... One more time...
Much more deliberately, I got to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... better.

I looked down ever so slightly and saw the main 
source of my balance problems.

Looking around where I was, there was a variety of
equipment and rubbish.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Some sort of cave based storehouse? A mine, 
even? It sounds... familiar.)

(Someone probably mentioned it when I was 
halfway to the Goddess earlier.)

Not too far away, there was a dirty but large mirror
shard.
I stepped in front of it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
My hands fidgeted as I looked.
I didn't know what to do with them.
I turned away from it.
It had served its purpose.

I pushed aside the makeshift door to the cave only 
to be greeted with the sun spilling over the 
horizon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Sunrise... or sunset?)
My gaze slowly scanned the area, until I saw...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...and they'll be here within the hour? Along with 
the rest of the Crows and our stragglers?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, Kara said there were a few other stragglers 
from the kingdom's army that wanted to join, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Join who?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup? You're up?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You're fine to move?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure. And you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I'm... well rested.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, are you sure you don't need more sleep? It's
still early.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
All the more reason for us to get moving quickly.

You're our client, and our job is to keep you safe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I can imagine you've still got people chasing after
you.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
That is true. That griffin rider was amongst the 
imperial group this time, unfortunately.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The fox-eared woman, right? She seemed to want 
our client's head, so...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
If she is leading other flying type units, they may be
able to make up ground quickly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: See? Scale brains over here agrees, so I must be right.

Charlotte stood there, quiet for a moment, unsure 
of how to respond.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Are you sure?

We all saw what happened.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

It's fine. I'm a girl.

What's the point in acting like it's going to
develop in any other way?

.........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Make a joke, if you'd like.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm not gonna let it distract me anymore, though.

I turned to the side and reached down to pick up a
readied sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There we go.
A nice tug fastened it to my gear.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

There is that, but... I mean... I more meant...

Norde closed his eyes as if flinching ever so slightly
from the topic being brought to the forefront.
I turned back to Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not gonna let it distract me anymore.

There's more important things to take care of
than to spend my time fretting over the
end of this curse's effects.
With one last tightening, I was ready to move.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Don't worry. We'll keep you and your sister safe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Don't worry. We'll keep you safe.

I stepped past Charlotte as I started to make my 
way from the temporary camp at the mine.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Was the plan to meet here, or meet further along 
our path so we don't lose as much time?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The idea proposed was that there are two main
recognizable regroup points along the way. Here, 
and...
Norde started to walk with me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Didn't you just note that I was the client in this
partnership?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Shouldn't I get the final say on when we rest and 
not rest?

I'm not going to let you just-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No, Anton is right.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
There physically isn't time to dwell on any of your
concerns.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Speak as we move, or save it for another time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I vote for the less distracting choice.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And when will "another time" be?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: When you are safe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah, I can... fix it at that point.

When the job is done.

I gave an affirming nod before spinning on my heel 
and returning to the path forward.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And when the Wolf is skewered...)

The Kingdom had met a challenge that appeared
insurmountable.

The trump card that their military strategy was built
around was gone, and they were forced to fight a 
losing battle.
Our own escape was one of acknowledged defeat.

We had no ally for Lockhart to seek within the 
Kingdom of Cartenan anymore.

The choice left to the Nightless Crows was one to
retreat and seek safety.

Yet the path forward was one directly through the
Empire itself.

We were between a rock and a hard place, and we 
were scattered from the recent flight from the 
ongoing war.

Satia, Rowan, and other allies among the Crows 
and associates had regrouped and met us at 
the designated meeting point.

Rowan and other allies among the Crows and 
associates had regrouped and met us at the 
designated meeting point.

Lady Kara and other stragglers from the Kingdom 
decided join the mission to retake Lockhart, as 
aimless as we were in the moment.

Those were the small victories we could take from 
our efforts in the Kingdom.
What was left was a simple choice.
The choice to keep moving forward.

With the last of our conflicts sorted, we were able 
to move slightly off course to find an opening to 
setup camp in.

It was open enough to have strong sightlines if an
attack was about to happen, and with escape 
routes to all directions.
So we went about setting up camp.

As we did, a conversation spurred from our 
unanswered questions.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Of course we had to run into imperial troops in all
this mess.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: When in Nolvanus, you'll see Nolvanans.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sure. And welcome home... Alexei.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I always did prefer the eternal spring of the 
kingdom. Truly a tragic loss.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Crown prince of the invading empire here, folks.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Alexei, are you aware of notable defensive 
structures along the border?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas, no. Cartenan never posed a realistic invasion
threat.

Many imperial generals would likely question if 
they'd die in these mountains before reaching the 
empire proper.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I was also surprised to see troops in the area.

I've been here for some time, and they've been 
few and far between.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Lady Kara, are you suggesting that as where the 
man retreated to? A military outpost?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You are suggesting that swordsman retreated to a
military outpost?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It was what I was hoping for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You want there to be a military outpost nearby?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Well, it may be favorable to an alternative...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Elliot, the man ran off farther into the mountains.

I assume that rings a bell for you?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Oh... The Vault?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
You think the empire is tampering with a local 
Vault?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
That man ran off farther into the mountains...

I've only heard rumors, but some say there is a 
Vault deeper within.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A Vault... that sounds familiar.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is where the Covenant seals away Oathbreakers 
to stop misuse of them.

They are scattered and often hidden for said
safekeeping.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Right... I think that Cainan guy said something 
about them before.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I visited the Ashen Fox at the Vault earlier on my
trip.

The facility was in good order at the time.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: But if a proper military force were to attack it...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
They also might simply be part of the Kingdom 
invasion force.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Stragglers that got left behind in the movement of 
an entire army.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A valid point.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We know how dangerous one Oathbreaker can be 
in the wrong hands. Do we really want to take that 
chance?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Also valid.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We already have a mission. What would you do if 
we run into the better part of an army?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Probably less valid.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're not going to just run into it without thinking.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And worse case, if that dragon shows up then we 
take down the Wolf's stupid fucking dragon.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'm not even sure how that could be valid.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Now now. Aren't I the client?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hey, aren't Vaults protected by former famous
crusaders?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Yes, the Ashen Wolf is stationed at the Border 
Mountain Vault.

He was quite acclaimed in the crusades decades 
ago. That's why the Covenant recruits them, after 
all.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes, the Covenant will recruit crusade heroes to 
ensure the security of the Vaults.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Then between a potential strong ally and whatever
Oathbreaker is inside...

I have every reason to head over and petition the 
guy for whatever help he has sympathies enough 
to offer.
Especially if we're already nearby.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So says the client. Understood?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yes, ma'am.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Understood.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Good. Then we'll go do that next.

...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... After at least a few hours of actual sleep.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh...!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: The Ashen Fox, I assume?
Jude stood still, ready to draw his sword.

Opposite of him was a man clad in the shadows of 
the pillars and the blood of Jude's allies.
He stepped forward, into the light.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: In the flesh.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Mostly, at least.
Jude eyed the right side of Atticus's face.

Despite the hair that covered parts of it, there was 
a third of his head that appeared petrified, and it
contrasted the scales on other parts of his face.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Reminds me of a passage I once read in a history 
book.

I assume that's the result of your Dralleus?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Or... No, Oathbreaker. That's what you'd call it.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
I'd have thought the Emerald Empire was too busy
fighting the crusades to attack a vault on the other
side of the continent.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Nope. Just a lost son and cast off.
I'm here to do a job.
Jude unsheathed his sword.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: We can do this the easy way, or the hard way.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: You’re that group from the  mountains...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Argh... that guy really was all  talk, then?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Am I being paid to do everything?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Pant*... Dammit. I... I am...  not... *pant*... paid 
enough for  this.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Time to retreat!

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Argh...! That... was not...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Everyone... hold you ground... I  need to... catch 
my breath...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I must hurry this up...

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's the guard down.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The vault should be towards the deepest part of 
the facility.

We should regroup and make our way there.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Ugh... D- Dammit!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Soldiers to defeat, then? So the battle is ongoing
here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, we weren't too late.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
They said it'd probably be towards the back when 
we were planning this.

Let's move there and we can regroup to help the 
locals here.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Mmm...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
You're... stronger than they said you'd be.

Aren't you supposed to be half stone?

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Ah... I suppose that's true.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
All it means is that I can put more force into my 
good side, no?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Annoying...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Do you want another shot at hitting my blindside?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Argh... They don't pay me enough for this.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Nora promised me stroganoff... Still nothing.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Perhaps I can offer you a warm soup when we're done?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
You can't afford me, so no can do. You know how this
ends.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Very well.

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies
Lose Condition: The vault is breached, Charlotte, 
Pup, Rowan, Kara die

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It was breached...?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Can we do anything?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Move, move, move!

The imperial troops flooded into the chamber and
blocked our ability to intercept them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's too late...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The fighting is all over...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- We're here to help!

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Very well.

Protect the Vault door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sure.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: And that one goes down.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Huh?

There was a partially completed dish on the kitchen
table.

It sat there, seeming to waft about an aroma like it
was fresh.

As best as one could tell, a denizen of the Vault 
was preparing a meal only be to chased off.

Then, an imperial soldier got cocky and tried to 
finish it themself.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text:
...

Maybe if I add this as a final touch?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And that one goes down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

There was a partially completed dish on the kitchen
table.

It sat there, seeming to waft about an aroma like it
was fresh.

As best as one could tell, a denizen of the Vault 
was preparing a meal only be to chased off.

Then, an imperial soldier got cocky and tried to 
finish it themself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Maybe if I add this as a final touch?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It’s been a while since I’ve had a home cooked 
meal like that...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No, I can’t get distracted by that. I am a 
professional mercenary. I need to act like it.

No, I can’t get distracted by that. I am 
a professional mercenary. I need to act like it.

I gripped my hand and took a defiant pose.

...

*Grooowl*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No, I need to stay strong.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It isn’t even something I like... like a sweet would 
go great right about now-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No. I can’t let a craving overcome me.)

As I continued on, the thoughts crept into my 
mind and became stronger, shifting between 
cravings until...
Pup has aquired a Sweet Tooth!

...the curse worked its magic without me even 
noticing.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
The captain is dead!

Damn it! 

 Kill them all!!

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I came here as soon as I could.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Argh, more of you. I'll just have to take you out 
and-

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Huh...?
A delectable aroma wafted into the area.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do you...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do you want this food?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Of course not.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Raise your weapon.
...*Groooowwwlllll*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Any chance you'd retreat for it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, might you?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: O- Of course not.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know, you're not exactly fighting for a just 
cause.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I don't care.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A mercenary following the money.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
You couldn't afford me.

What I seek isn't simple to just buy me with.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Is it... the food?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I said to raise your weapon.
...*Grrrooowwwwllllll*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Such a shame.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're a mercenary company. We're well traveled 
and know lots of recipes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not to mention there's this bard in our group. He's
well traveled across the continent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And also a noble from Cartenan. She always seems 
to know the best place to eat in any town she 
visits.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Best of all? THE heir to the Lockhart Stewart
mercantile group. She can bankroll it all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So how well has your current arrangement been 
going?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One nice meal for you a month. Anything you want.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: One fine dining meal a day.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: 1 every week.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: 4 a week.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: 2 a week.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
2 a week and I'll throw in this meal that caught your
eye.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Deal.
Jude joins the party!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
My name is Judais Cato Gaius del Aeneus Tiberius...
*munch* ...
 
But you are free to call me Jude.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
I am a mercenary from the Emerald Empire out in 
the east...  *munch*... and have no loyalty to the 
Nolvanus Empire here.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: We'll be good friends so long as our deal is satisfied.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good to have you on board with us this time, Jude.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I hope Charlotte won't be too mad about me 
making this deal...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There you are!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Great, you all made it through safely.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Was there ever a doubt?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So many.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ack. This curse hasn't slowed me down, you know?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Keep talking like that and it might do so in overdrive
instead.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: F- Fine...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Let's just do what we came here to do.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Rowan...! You all are alright.

How about Pup? Are they okay?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I do feel your care and love.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Even if not for me.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That's now what I...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Our dear Pup seems to be putting the nature of 
their situation to the side.

For better or worse, it is an attempt to delay and
refocus on the task at hand.

And... I would say the effort seems sincere, as we 
were worried about.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I can say less on if that effort will bear fruit.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Also as we feared.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Well... we'll just do what we can to support Pup.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am in full agreement.

I would not care for the sight of them to feel...
unrecognizable, after all.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Same~

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Atticus. You are still alive.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hm... You again.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Did you not leave for Cartenan after the inspection?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I ran into this mercenary group on my way.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Atticus, it sounds as though Oathbreakers are being
abused.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm... So nothing new.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
At the very least, I want to stop the opportunity 
for another to be subjected to that.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Heheh, you did seem like a good kid before.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Very well, be sure to keep up. Your form there 
should help.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I'll do my best.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Mr. Atticus Ranasseur. It is good to meet you.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Excuse me, young miss. Who might you be?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Kara Lyons, of the Cartenan Lyons household.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I... cannot say I am aware of them.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Nor is there any need to be.

I've followed your work through the historical 
tellings of the Crusades and beyond.

I simply wish to say it is a pleasure to meet you
properly.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Ah, same in return, then.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Though I wish it could be under better 
circumstances.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I will delight in the meeting regardless.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You! Prepare to fall, fiend!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Aren't you with the Crows?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: So am I.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Well, now I am.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Are you attempting to bamboozle me?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Attack me, if you like.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
It's starting to feel like it'd be less of a pain if we
need to go through all this "switching sides" drama.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I'll be watching you. Carefully.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Yay.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Mr. Castel Balreig. I have a question.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Oh, so formal.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What does our fair Crow have for me today?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Anton. Pup.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: How far are you from helping with this curse?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You did experiments when we were in the 
Kingdom's capital, no?

Surely you have lead enough to mitigate it and give
peace of mind for a little bit.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I wish I did. It would be a great help with my own
status.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: But I've no intention to give up.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
...Alright.

...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Alright.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Eh... So that Atticus guy. He's a taikolyn, yeah?
Working with the Covenant.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: So it seems.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I am not distinctly aware of many, let alone all
crusaders...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Non-homlyns do receive the honor it seems.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Honor? Working with the Covenent of all things?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Seems more like a sellout to me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

He is our ally. Treat him with respect.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
At least for the time being. I am not here to tell 
you what to think, after all.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmph...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
So... the Covenant was hiding an Oathbreaker... so
close to the kingdom?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heh. Expect it, lad.

That's what that lot does. All secrets and shit.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: But... so close to the kingdom.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
The empire theoretically could've grabbed it before
even attacking.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: But they didn't.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: And... that's a good point. Why is that?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh, probably just isn't as useful as you'd think.

Shite is an Oathbreaker, not Zened himself.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: But isn't your... current state due to one?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Yeah, well, not all of 'em are gonna be like that.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
They lock the things away cause they break the
Goddess's laws, not cause they all will break the
world.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Right... that makes sense...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Though, why do they want it now, then?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: I really have no idea, lad.

Blood dripping to the ground, muffled footsteps
haphazardly sounded out from the wounded
warrior.

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text:
*Pant*... *pant*...

Need to get back to... *pant*... camp...

I need to... Huh?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Pant*...  *pant*...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Need to... fuck... this is a deeper wound than I
thought...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Huh...?

A sound from a distance caught his attention, and 
he slipped behind a nearby tree.

lines.speaker: Soldier?
lines.text: Here it is.

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text: Excellent.
A small trinket was handed from one to the other.

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text:
I'll be sure to get this to our shared acquaintance.

Do you have an excuse prepared for why the 
Imperial garrison failed to get it?

lines.speaker: Soldier?
lines.text:
Yes, that mercenary that was in charge. We'll place 
the blame on him.

By the time anyone confirms that it really was
retrieved, it'll be too late.

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text: W- What...?
*Snap*...!

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text: H- huh?!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
What? Aren't those some of the soldiers from my
command...?
*Snap* ...!
A twig snapped beneath his foot.

lines.speaker: Soldier?
lines.text: Hm? Is that...?

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text: Heh. Better take care of that loose end.
They turned to approach.

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text: W- Wait, I can... I can...!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Pant* ... Crap... I don't stand a chance... in this
condition.

After all this bullshit... am I really gonna... like
this...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: F- Fuck it.... I...!

We Nightless Crows pushed forward through the
mountainous pass.

Once outside of the more treacherous path, we 
setup camp away from the well trodden trails.

Despite this, an inkling of danger became quite
clear...

There was strange movement by the imperial 
forces.
Strange movement that may indicate a play at...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...a Vault?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
To the north, there is the Border Mountain Vault.

If there was a target in the area, it would be that.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
To our north lies a Covenant Vault.

I am unaware of any other potential targets in the
area.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A Vault specifically being...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A Covenant stronghold.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: One with a dangerous treasure within...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
An Oathbreaker, right?

Cainan... Kara's fiancé... He was a Covenant auditor,
right?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Correct. I am his assistant in that endeavor.

We are the quality control for protection of
Oathbreakers. We check each Vault to ensure it is
secure.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
My recent visit did not indicate any issues... but an
army attacking, especially if they catch Atticus off
guard...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
He is, indeed. He travels between Vaults and 
ensures they are secure.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Though, an army assault on a none- the-wiser Vault
is...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That means that they're protecting an Oathbreaker
there?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What... What sort of one? Is it like that... You 
know, the sword?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Not necessarily. There isn't a known limit to the
potential effects of an Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Like my own being a 'master key' of sorts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
More importantly, it should be secure, correct? The
Covenant leaves no stone unturned to protect
Oathbreakers.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
More importantly, is this Vault properly secured? I
can't imagine the Covenant would leave it without a
defender.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The defensive mechanisms were operational when I
checked last.

And Atticus, the Guardian, was as diligent as the
protection plans expect of him.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Most likely they have it well maintained and with a
Guardian stationed there.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A Guardian... All Vaults have one, correct?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Guardian...? That sounds familiar.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I've heard that before. It sounds familiar.)

(They're the people in charge the Vaults, I'd 
assume?)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Guardians are often recruited from heroes in the
Crusades to the east.

They... should be as strong of warriors as one could
hope to lead that effort.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Guardians are recruited from the heroes of the
Crusades.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Amongst them are the greatest warriors and 
heroes of our era.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yes, as the moniker Steel Wolf may imply, we've 
met... at least one.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
While he may not be a Guardian, he must be a 
Crusader of significant renown to earn that title.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
At least two. My fiancé is called the "Azure Rook" at
times.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

And... the 'Storm Ram' would be another?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Where... did you hear that?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You've heard that name?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: From... the Steel Wolf. He said it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... my father, right? It was my father.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Ivan Baranov. "The Storm Ram"

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...and former Covenant Guardian.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(I thought so.)
A silence fell over the group.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then we need to make sure this place is safe?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean... Imagine another thing like that sword out
there. Not an option we can allow.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Yeah... if we're going to end this, then we can't 
have more of those in the hands of the enemy.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Y- Yeah...

Between that and a potential ally, it makes sense 
to make a detour there.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Then shall we move out?

We shall meet up with another guardian... 
The Ashen Fox.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, we can do this. We should start moving.

Let's head to the Vault and meet the Guardian that
protects it.

The travel was not lengthy, and we approached 
the hidden Vault.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ugh... They did come this way.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Imperial soldiers.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah... Are they doing patrols?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Ah... So you are recognizing militaristic patterns 
now? That is a good skill to have.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Y- Yeah...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's just a matter of experience.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The patrol seems stationary.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That, or they are segmenting their coverage.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
In an area this isolated, would they be able to 
sustain that cadence?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean... if they have enough people, then sure.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Or if they have any beasties to cover the gaps.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Not a dragon in sight... yet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're not gonna have a dragon... again...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No, that'd be crazy...)

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Assuming the dragon didn't stop here.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Assuming the dragon's retreat didn't lead it here.
Our conversation stalled.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A patrol means they're organized and here with intent.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes. That is true, Alexei.

Meaning they're executing an operation, or... have
already done so.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We should hurry.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Despite us acting as a scouting unit ahead of the 
other Crows...

We'd be best served to get through the holes in 
the patrol by splitting up.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Are you sure? This is a heavily forested area.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The poor sightlines stand out. As though the 
location was chosen... or designed... for that 
purpose.

Norde motioned to the trees, and a brief look did 
make it clear that seeing anything from a distance 
would be difficult.

It was a big part of why we could get as close as 
we did without the Imperial troops detecting us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I would doubt anyone's ability to improvise should
things not go to plan here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then, our patron Ms. Stewart...

How do you want to approach this? How should 
we split up?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, that'd b- be simple.
Charlotte fidgeted around.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, maybe...

Her hand had landed on her pack, and slipped in to 
pull out something I had not seen before.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How about this baby?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, yes. Truly a marvel you have there~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why do you have that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Or... a more appropriate question. What is it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It- It's a flare gun.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You see, it gets loaded with mini-red magic
incendiaries that-

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It'll work.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: What about splitting up?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Kara, I... shall delegate to you.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Delegating that choice is wise.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I do have an approach in mind...

Splitting into multiple groups, I found myself with a
few familiar faces.
The plan was straightforward.

We'd each approach from different directions and 
use the flare gun to coordinate our attack.

Outside of our advanced party...

The other Crows were securing an escape route in 
case things went south quickly, along with stealthily 
thinning out the patrols.

Deliberately, we made our way to our designated 
spot.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Guard is at 5 o'clock.

If we're right about the timing, he'll move in...
5...4...3...2...

Go.

We each shuffled as stealthily as we could through 
the thick forest.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: We movin'. Not a sign of the next one.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: No sign of a new patrol yet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good. Let's not stop here.

We weaved deliberately for a while longer, keeping
track of our foot placements to make sure we
were headed in the right direction.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: And... adjust now.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So... Pup... you are ready for this, yes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Well, when it was mentioned that your father was 
a Guardian, I thought that maybe...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey Elliot. I was meaning to ask you something.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Yes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How do you transform yourself when you're fighting?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No one is making a big deal out of THAT, but 
you're literally changing entirely.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Ah, my gray magic?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: It isn't... anything uniquely complicated.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It is gray magic. Which is a combination of red, 
blue, and green magic.

The Covenant teaches that the prayers of our 
ancestors are held deep within our heirlooms...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
And you can use the three branches of magic to 
create an echo of that lineage to envelop yourself 
in it.
From the energy of red magic, the divine 
manifestations of blue, and the creation nature of 
green magic...
You can extend that legacy to face the challenges 
of today.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: And such an act transforms you into a woman?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
...

Yes.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Well, it is a blessing of your familial heritage, so
perhaps you can indulge in-

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: A- And to answer a likely additional question...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
No, not all heirlooms can do this. Each heirlooms 
holds potential for a set of red, blue, or green 
magic.
Many only have one, let alone all three.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right.

I kept my eyes forward, but I nodded a slight 
thanks towards Elliot.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Actually, what's that over there?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Shouldn't I be asking you that about your first time
back here in the empire?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I suppose the reality hasn't entirely settled in, that
is true.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Mayhap it because I am not familiar with this
mountainous region?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Or, to the contrary, because...

As I was turned away, I felt a lingering gaze from
Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: No... I don't believe... Perhaps...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You said you had a sibling, correct?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah... Well, I may have...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh wait, w- what's that?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
That the place?

Yeah, that's gotta be it.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: That is our target, there in the distance.
We exited to the final perimeter before the facility.

Our group would need to hide here until we saw the
signal.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Have you heard any signs of an ongoing fight?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Negative.

But given it's a Vault, it could be soundproofed 
better than the normal fortress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...
I leaned back into my hiding place.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(No sign of a battle so far...)

(That could mean a great situation or a worst case
scenario.)

(The patrols were still cycling, so...)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then this curse...

You are confident is not still weakening you?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
After seeing the fight with the dragon and since, 
there is certainly a risk best not ignored.
I kept my eyes scanning the horizon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Forget about it. Just treat me as I am, a girl.

I'm not letting myself use it as an excuse anymore.

And... It'd be even worse if its distracting you all,
as well.
My hand fell down to my sword hilt.

We went silent as a patrol passed by our hiding 
place.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Based on the previous routes, the opening is in...
three minutes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Pass the confirmation back to the rear line support
unit. We have a straight shot from here.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Hmm...

Mayhap... it is for the best that you are 
approaching it as such.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: It ain't fixing shit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What...?)

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: I- I'll go and relay the data, then.

The Nightless Crow silently head back along our 
path.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Eh, not like I'm sayin' you're doing a bad thing.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Not sure what else ya can do but just accept it and
move on.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Just ain't gonna fix shit.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... My fairest Otis, this isn't the time to be that
forceful about it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not trying to fix it.

...

(Two minutes...)

I tried to keep the timer going in my head as we
talked.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So long as it stops being a distraction, that is what I
want.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Then be careful lassie.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Two fifteen... two seventeen...)

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
If ya do find a way to kill it in its tracks, it may
just shift targets.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: As the Pup said... what do you mean?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ya know, I figured once I got over hatin' the neko 
lot that it'd stop.

I thought it did, for a time...

But... lately I've been feeling like I can't hold my
drink like I used to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Your alcohol tolerance... has diminished...?

Are you sure it wasn't because of your smaller 
stature?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Woouldn't it of hit me before recently, then?!

I felt like I was getting pulled into their
conversation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Just ignore it... I need to focus.)

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Nah, nah... this feels like the curse again.

Maybe it's not hittin' as hard, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Two... uh... fifty...?)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Are you quite sure...?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Aye, but maybe it don't matter.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I only gained when I mellowed out, despite the
situation. Best to leave it be if that's the Pup's
wish.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap ignoring it is for the best.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: I- I'll go and relay the data, then.
The Nightless Crow silently head back along our path.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do not mistake my concern for lack of faith.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
By my words, I intend to convey that your 
approach is ideal.

This curse eats away at your sense of self, fighting
against it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: By all means, ignoring it may slow it the most...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(Two minutes...)

I tried to keep the timer going in my head as we
talked.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Exactly. You get what I'm thinking.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just... leave it be.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I could name many things more important to focus on.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I- Indeed...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Two... fifty...?)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I will try my utmost.

Mayhap it be like watching my own family change 
before my eyes at time, but... I will attempt to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Could you just...!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, was that... three minutes?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Move...!
I moved from the hiding spot...!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
...

Wait, who are...
As I jumped out, I stumbled into a patrol.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah... Uh...

Rowan was about to instinctively jump towards me, 
but another pulled him back.
Who are you? Are you from the facility?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... well...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Think of something...!)

(He sees... a girl, right?)

(Maybe...)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Act like I’m a lost girl / Try to charm the guard / Act like a mercenary for hire

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
H- Hey, Mister...

I- I was... I think I'm lost...?

I shrunk down a little as I said it, and I raised my
voice as though it was about to break.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Lost? What are you doing out here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't know. I was with family and... a day ago, 
I...

Sir, could you get one of your supervisors out here? 
I think...  *Sniff* ...

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
I mean... I can't just.. I... Maybe I can... can...

Wait.

Why do you have a sword?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fuck it.
My hand lowered to my sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: R- Right!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Pant
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Excellent work~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Though those acting skills...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, f- finally~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I've been looking for you all day.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: W- What? Who are you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Didn't the commander tell you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He gave us permission to have...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: To have a... romantic... date...?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: ...What?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: D- Do you wanna touch my boob?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: ...Lady, I'm gonna need to ask you to come with me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hahaha... But... don't you want to...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fuck it! You should've just taken the deal!
My hand lowered to my sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: R- Right!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant* ...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Excellent work~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Though the offer to touch your breast...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
There you are.

Head back to camp. I've been directed to take 
over your patrol.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Uh... What? Who are you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One of the mercenaries your company picked up in 
the capital.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The commander wanted to talk to you, so they 
sent me to cover.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: I... Why would the commander want to talk?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Something about a pay discrepancy, I think.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
W- What? At now of all times?

It's not like we're in the capital. We out here in the
middle of-

Wait, we didn't go to the capital.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... didn't say which capital?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ... It was always gonna come to this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fuck it...
My hand lowered to my sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: R- Right!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant* ...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Excellent work~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Though it does make me wonder if you've been to 
the imperial capital, in reality?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not the time.

 
Even more not the time than before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh* ... Seriously. Just focus on the mission. I 
beg of you.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yes, of course. Mayhap I had gotten too 
comfortable with the idea of being on a battlefield.
My shoulders slouched.
I just wanted to forget about this curse for once.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Anton, sir- Or uh, ma'am. I just got back from the
line. They-

Wait, what happened here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We may have a more limited time frame to start 
the assault.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Then should we move immediately into the Vault?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Apologies, but might that mean we need to find another
hiding place?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We should probably just start our assault on the 
Vault.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Charlotte mentioned that 'flare' thing, but the 
others were right. We'll probably not see a signal.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This forces our hand, so we should-
A streak of brilliant red filled the blue sky.

Flickering and sparkling, it traveled from the other
side of the vault and over our heads.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What was that?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It isn't the dragon, is it?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
No.

It was the signal.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ah, we be ready to take some heads, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Right... we need to move.

Now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Really...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then... we need to move.

Now.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's...  *pant*... I think that's all of them?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
At least amongst those that did not flee...

We should reinitiate contact with the rest of the 
Crows to see how well our net caught those in 
retreat.

As Kara said the words, the stone faced man 
turned towards us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I will reconnect with the rest of the Crows, then.

Norde stepped away, but the space he occupied 
was not long left unattended.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm...

A tall older man stepped towards us, towering 
above me.

He was clearly taikolyn, with scales like I had seen 
on Norde, including a beard like formation of them.
Most strikingly...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Atticus Ranasseur. Guardian of the Border Mountain
Vault and Ashen Fox of the Crusades...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: The Covenant's man... Elliot, was it?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: It seems we were in time to help.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
So you're this Vault's Guardian? I've heard about you
lot.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Hmm...

Atticus. Atticus Ranasseur.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Please to meet you. I'm happy we made it in time.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm... I thank you for it.

I could see it through the swaying strands of hair
across his face...
A stone eye.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hello...

Based on the movement of his body and what I 
could see, it looked like the better part of his  
right side was turned to stone.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hello. I am Charlotte Stewart of the city state of
Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'm Mariel Stewart, of the same.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
The others with me are the Nightless Crow mercenary
company.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Including him?

A familiar yet unfamiliar man walked up 
alongside us.
Atticus's hand leaned onto his hilt.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Sigh*... the battle's over. Could you calm down?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Why is... he here? And alive?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... I might have made an offer?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- You know mercenaries can be bought, right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

How much?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I'm not a cheap date.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha... hahaha...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: And your loyalties?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Never had any loyalty to them. I'm from the 
Emerald Empire.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Normally being from the 'Oathless Empire' would be
reason enough for me to cut you down.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
A fitting statment from a former crusader...
Emphasis on the "former".

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm not gonna pay you if you start a fight.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: What did I do?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Attempt to kill us on multiple occasions~

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Sigh*...
Jude rubbed the back of his neck wearily.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmph. Not bad.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I think he's sincere.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: This is out of my paygrade.
Without another word, Jude casually walked off.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Gotta be... a kitchen around here... somewhere...

...and mumbled just within earshot before 
disappearing into the facility.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Many unfamiliar faces amongst you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We... normally operate out of Rabaneau.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Understood.

My thanks, once more, to you all.

The group fell silent with some indistinct nods of
affirmation in response.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: That's that, then.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
So, uh... I was wondering if we could talk about my
mission.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: First things first, I need to check on the Vault.

Atticus turned and slowly stepped towards the 
Vault door.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Now... I just need to do this and...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Now... I just-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Ah... nothing too bad. No need to worry.

I must simply be still feeling the strikes from that
fight before.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I could help-

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: No, I need to.

Back towards our group, I leaned over to the 
others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why is... Why is his body like that?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The stone?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I imagine it must be the Oathbreaker, no?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Could they really do-
I looked down at myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess so.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Is he not protected from it? Why would the 
Covenant station people here if they're not?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Eul'dusa. I believe that was the name I read in the
files.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Does our big sister have the details already memorized?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
An item that grants wishes, of a sort.

At the very least, it appeared to shift the nature of
luck in the favor of the wish.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Though, the closer one gets to that wish, the more
their body petrifies.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Really...?
I looked back to the Vault Door.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: And... there.

He entered the heavily fortified room 
and then towards the alter within.
Secured within it...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Good.

I can rest easy.
Atticus returned from the dark of the vault.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Now, to the second most important task.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Would you like to stay for supper?
We took up the old Guardian on his offer.

Collecting the Crows, we split out forces with the
locals of the Vault to clean up the site and prepare 
a meal for all.

Due to the size of the group, a bonfire type meal 
was planned.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A bonfire~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Shall I sing a song?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Abso-fucking-lutely not.

From the line to get our meals, I watched as 
Charlotte and Rowan were carefree around 
the flames.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Should we really be doing this?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're still being chased.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Maybe...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We did make good time. And we are at a Vault 
that they would not expect us to go to.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I... imagine that should give enough pause to allow
this.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Though, at the heart of it, the bigger concern is...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why did they attack this Vault?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I mean... for the Oathbreaker, right?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You suspect foul play of some sort?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How about you? Am I paying you enough to talk?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Sure, but they didn't pay me enough to tell me 
why.

Our orders were to retrieve it and deliver it to a
specified location.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That location being...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Southeast of here. It was a nondescript 
drop off location.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm... So more parties could be involved...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: My concern more heavily involves the timing.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: That's what I was thinking, too.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Like... why attack after the invasion?

If the goal is to steal an Oathbreaker to use it, then
you'd do it before attacking Cartenan...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As in, the fact that it comes after the invasion of 
the Kingdom?

If they were to steal it to use it... then yes that
would have been more advantageous.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hmm... But it IS still an Oathbreaker. They're not
going to use it as a paperweight.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes, the question becomes of what purpose that it 
could still serve that it did not serve before.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

My eyes wandered over to the circle of Charlotte, 
Kara, Norde, and others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(They're probably talking strategy. Maybe I should 
go over anyways?)
I had just sat down with meal in hand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Charlotte just said to get my food and relax a bit. I
could do that in their discussion?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*... No, she'd probably just shoot me with the
flare gun.

I looked back down to my food, fork lightly 
poking at the sustenance.

As I pieced out a bite with the fork, the heat and
aroma spilled out and made my surroundings feel 
like a blanket.

I took a bite, and I savored the 
home wrought flavors.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I... didn't expect Atticus to be here with his
wife...)
My eyes drifted up to look around.

The halls we fought in felt transformed just from 
the atmosphere alone.

Even the otherwise foreboding sight of the Vault 
door felt more cozy than before.
My eyes lingered on that Vault door.

The aroma of my meal seemed to block out my 
other senses.
Like bristles in the edge of my mind...
An image of a similar door.
But from a lower perspective.
A image of wonder and curiosity.
Anton.
I turned.

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: There you are.

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: You know you're not supposed to be over here.
She lowered herself and took my hand in her own.

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text:
Now, where is Nikolai?

Were you two acting out one of my stories again?
And she started to pull me forward.
Step by step.
Step... by...
My head turned towards the sound.

My eyes focused in on some shrubbery along the 
wall.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Did I hear something?)

(Or... maybe...?)

.........

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup... there you are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... Mariel.
My head whipped back from the sound.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You got some of the food before it ran out. That's
good~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did they run out?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
No, but it smells so good that I can't imagine 
anyone not wanting seconds.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
If I learn how to cook properly, I'll have to learn
this one, too.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So that's where you ended up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... Charlotte.
My head whipped back from the sound.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You resting properly?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Because you've not done any real relaxation outside 
of sleep since Cartenan...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I know. I know I need to take the opportunity 
to relax to stay in my top form.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...
I could only chuckle softly.
Alongside her was Satia.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Mmm~

What a wonderful blend of flavors.

She was nibbling at her meal even as she entered 
the scene.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It seems a lot of people like the food today.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well, never ask me to cook for the Crows again if
that's our new standard.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh, you could learn to cook it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I'd love a 'Pup version' of this dish~

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You can have some of mine if it'll help you 
memorize how it should taste.
Satia picked up her fork and guided it towards me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle* ...
Both of them sat down next to me.
With much hesitation, she sat down next to me.

For my own part, I sliced off another bite 
from my own dish and savored the taste 
again.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You... look like you're feeling better.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Are there... any aches or pains?

Maybe I should conduct another health checkup? 
Has anything changed since then?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You look better than before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You can thank me. Great leader Charlotte saves the 
day.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Or... not? Are you okay? Should we get you 
another check-up?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm fine...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'd think you'd understand that being a girl isn't a
medical emergency.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Well, it has its moments.

Satia put her plate down to her side, and leaned 
over to set her head on my shoulder as though 
she was going to take a nap.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Just...

Comfortably nuzzled up against me, her words 
were both soft and clear to me.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Just let me know if it ever is.

I'll always be here for you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You really shouldn't worry about me that much. 
Aren't you getting a bit old for the big sister bit?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Don't be selfish. I'll love you no matter how much 
you want to resist it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: We all just want to help.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
We can only imagine how strange and scary what 
you've gone through is...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well, sometimes you got to take care of others so 
they take care of themselves.
A slight silence fell over us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I just want to do what needs to be done.

I just... want to focus on what's actually important.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just... can we talk about literally anything else?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I guess... Norde said something about your father 
being a Guardian like Atticus.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Have you ever been to one of these Vaults? Like 
how Atticus's wife is here with him.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... Well, there was one thing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Atticus has got his family here. If your father was a
Guardian, was that before your time, or...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I can't say I know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde probably knows better. You can ask him if-

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: A Guardian, you say?

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Of what Vault?

Atticus had entered the scene and seated himself 
into a relaxed position.

Atticus had entered the scene and gingerly seated
himself into a relaxed position, protecting his injury
from the battle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No idea. It's news to me.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I cannot say I know that much myself.

Without moving her head, Satia's eyes shifted over 
in my direction.

I took a bite of the dish, avoiding eye contact and
distracting myself with the food.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Well, Pup's father was named Ivan, right?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Ivan... Baranov? Yeah, that sounds right.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: ...Baranov?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Y- yes, sir... Pup is 'Anton Baranov'...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
The extent that I know is that his name was Ivan
Baranov and he ran the Nightless Crows.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: ...Baranov?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah? Is there something wrong with that.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: You are... Ivan Baranov's child? The Storm Ram's child?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Yeah.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Hmm...

That's...

That's good.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Did you know Ivan?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're talking as if you knew him...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Well, we only met the once... and I heard of his
exploits in the crusades...

But there were... rumors. Claims, as it were.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Seeing the Storm Ram's child is in good health is a
calming thought in light of that, though.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Rumors? How would that be related to Pup here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Rumors? What does that mean?

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Oh, it must've been... over a decade ago.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
A rumor went around that an Oathbreaker had 
been stolen from the Crekskia Vault...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: ...stolen by the Guardian who protected it.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
A Guardian... Are you implying that that Guardian
was...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A Guardian... meaning that Guardian was...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: ...Ivan Baranov, yes. The Storm Ram.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
The only official word I heard was that the Vault 
was closing indefinitely.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
More... morbidly beyond that... the rumor had 
another element it. It wasn't just that he had 
stolen it, but...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
...they said he killed his entire family in the process
of doing so.

My hand had held still for a while. I wasn't even
pretending that I could focus on eating.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
It gives my heart some calm and peace to see his child
alive and well.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: It is good... to see that rumor was just a rumor.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Hey... Pup...? Is this... something you already knew
about?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... Mind if I ask if you already knew about this?

My hand gripped my fork tighter to the point of
it having a slight shaking motion.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This is all... news to me. I hadn't heard any of it
before.

My father never really talked about the past.

And my memories of when I was really young are... 
bits and pieces, at best.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Well, try to take solace in that you being here 
proves it was a rumor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Does it?

You said something happened at this Vault, right?

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
True. I've never seen the truth of it for myself.

Hmm...

Atticus himself moved his good arm over to the
petrified one, and he rubbed it a little as he 
became contemplative.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
You know... Crekskia won't likely be too far outside 
of your path.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is true.

Rowan slipped into our circle, as though he was
listening the whole time.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Crekskia is a small northern village here in the
empire.

If we wish to go to Rabaneau without getting near 
the imperial capital, then it would be near our ideal 
path.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Indeed.

So... if you wish to pursue the truth of it...

...that... that will be your chance.

Blood dripping to the ground, muffled footsteps
haphazardly sounded out from the wounded
warrior.

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text:
*Pant*... *pant*...

Need to get back to... *pant*... camp...

I need to... Huh?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Pant*...  *pant*...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Need to... fuck... this is a deeper wound than I
thought...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Huh...?

A sound from a distance caught his attention, and 
he slipped behind a nearby tree.

lines.speaker: Soldier?
lines.text: Here it is.

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text: Excellent.
A small trinket was handed from one to the other.

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text:
I'll be sure to get this to our shared acquaintance.

Do you have an excuse prepared for why the 
Imperial garrison failed to get it?

lines.speaker: Soldier?
lines.text:
Yes, that mercenary that was in charge. We'll place 
the blame on him.

By the time anyone confirms that it really was
retrieved, it'll be too late.

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text: W- What...?
*Snap*...!

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text: H- huh?!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
What? Aren't those some of the soldiers from my
command...?
*Snap* ...!
A twig snapped beneath his foot.

lines.speaker: Soldier?
lines.text: Hm? Is that...?

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text: Heh. Better take care of that loose end.
They turned to approach.

lines.speaker: Defeated Soldier
lines.text: W- Wait, I can... I can...!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Pant* ... Crap... I don't stand a chance... in this
condition.

After all this bullshit... am I really gonna... like
this...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: F- Fuck it.... I...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Yawn*...
Charlotte pulled herself up from her bedding.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Is stone better than dirt below the bedding...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... Neither.

Her head turned and eventually laid her eyes on a
figure approaching her.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Charlotte Stewart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?

As Atticus continued to talk, Charlotte went to
pull herself to her feet.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I have a request to make of you...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Yawn*... Good morning.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What do you need?
Atticus's hand moved to rest on his weapon.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I wish to accompany your group.

Atticus looked away a bit meekly. His hand rubbed
around where he had been wounded.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I need you to add another goal to your journey.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- What? Why?

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
...

The Oathbreaker is gone.
Atticus joins the team!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Beasts...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Be on guard!

I don't think this is a wild animal.

Win Condition: Defeat all beasts
Lose Condition (Optional): Pup and Rowan get 
defeated

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: M- More...?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, these are definitely scouts.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Pant*... Is that all of them?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... Yeah, I think so.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- What happened?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Just in time, my good friends.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: This... did not go how I hoped...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shit... I need to... to...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Duck!

I jumped to Rowan, pushing him down to the ground with
me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Got 'em!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Are you two okay?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Better now... thank you.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Let me just... use this chance to cast some healing
magic.
Breathe.
Breathe.
...BREATHE!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Gasp* ...!

I breathed in deeply and desperately tried to 
fill my lungs with air.
It was like I hadn't breathed for an eternity.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Where... am I...?

The thought crept through my mind as my 
breathing slowed.

Slowly, but surely, my eyes drifted through 
the area.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's like... a mine?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(No, it's more like... tunnels. Like the sort built to
move through a building...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Half finished, but...)
I stood there for a moment.
I didn't know why, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Have I... been here before?
So I took a step.

And in that moment... from around a corner...
I saw them.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: Haha~

Two figures burst from the cavernous corridor,
sprinting around the corner and out of view.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That is... That was...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That was...
That was...

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: ...that was me.

In the blink of an eye, I was the figure that
I saw running about before.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: (Wait... why am I... a kid again?)

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Anton! Nikolai!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: That voice...

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Come back! It's too late for this.
