lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text:
Is that... really...

...mom?

As the thought passed through my head, I felt a 
hand on my wrist.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: C'mon, Anton!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai...

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: We gotta keep moving!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: But, what about...

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Where are you?! It's dangerous down here!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: It's... dangerous down here?

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text:
Heheh~ Don't worry.

I'll protect you.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: You...?

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text:
Of course. It's what a big brother does, isn't it?

I'll protect you, Anton. No matter what.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Okay...
I felt a tug on my wrist.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: Heheh~
And I was pulled along into the corridor.

Nikolai and I ran through the tunnels, passing all
sorts of strange structures and unfinished
construction.
It felt like an eternity.
An eternity of our play.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Haha...
But as we turned one more corner...

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai...?
My brother disappeared.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai... where are you...?

My heart began to beat faster and faster, and my 
walk picked up into a run.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text:
Nikolai!

...

MOM...!
Turning corners and corners and more corners...

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text:
*Pant* *pant* *pant*...!
 

WHERE... ARE... YOU!?
I turned another corner.
I entered a more constructed part of the tunnels.
Before me stood a stone wallway.
Cold.
Empty.
It was... THAT hallway.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai...?
I walked forward.
I shouldn't have.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Mom...?
I stood in front of a door.
I shouldn't have.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Are you... in there...?
I put my hand on the door.
I shouldn't have.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nikolai...! Mom!

I stuck my hand out... grasping at anything I could 
get ahold of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Please... don't... don't...!
My arm extended as much as I could.
Anything.
Please.
My hand was grasped by another's.

I looked on at Aegis, who looked at me with 
an expressionless face.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Y... Yeah...

Yeah, I'm okay. I'm... okay.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: Are you sure?
Aegis took his other hand and raised it to my face.
Pulling it away, a tear shone in the light.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm... crying?
The dam broke.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, I'm... okay...
Tears streamed down my face.
Aegis stepped forward.
Aegis had hugged me.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
It'll be okay.

It will be okay.

There was something comfortable about it. 
Welcoming, and warm.
So I hugged him back.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: It wasn't your fault.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sniff*...
I released Aegis, and he did too in return.

Wiping my face, my crying has reached its 
conclusion.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know... it wasn't...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just...

I couldn't respond. My thoughts were 
too scattered.

But my mind did focus on one thing, as I stared 
on at the figure in front of me.
As I looked on him, the thought came into focus.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aegis...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are you... really?

Our journey brought us from the mountain range 
that saddled the border between the Empire
and the Kingdom.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...but why would they steal it?

Charlotte's words were given an extra edge of 
concern.

We had traveled away from the Vault, but we had 
not stumbled upon any leads.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Hmm... unclear on why.

Oathbreakers are powerful, but they are simply a
singular tool to achieve one thing.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Per Atticus's words before we left...

While Oathbreakers are powerful, they are but a 
single tool for a single type of task.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Implying the need was specific.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Which, if identified, could narrow down the 
suspects.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Then the power of this Oathbreaker is...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So what does the Oathbreaker do?

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: "Eul'dusa" was its name.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: "Eul'dusa", as I understand.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
From my research, it is a "wish granting" type.

It operates by shifting the luck of the user to
create favorable results...

It also has a drawback.

The closer one comes to thir ultimate goal, the 
more one will become petrified.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Indeed...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That, I would say... is... less than useful.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is more than a little vague.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: But petrification is no laughing matter.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
There is an old legend of a village entirely turned to
stone.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
From my understanding, the Covenant attributes it 
to that Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Some foreboding myths focus around such a consequence.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Meaning it's someone who is okay with that consequence?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Or has subordinates to take on that risk for them...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I am at a loss of words to dictate all 
whom that could apply to, even within the 
Empire alone.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Though, it does match with the simple answer of it
being the Imperial Court to have ordered the raid 
and theft.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
But... did they know that it caused petrification 
when they stole it?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It could be someone who had no idea...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It does pose the question on if the thief even 
knew it would do that.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The Imperial Court should be aware of the nature 
of the Oathbreakers stored within their country.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Would the Empire not be aware of the 
Oathbreakers in its borders?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Indeed. I can confirm they would be aware.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
But it WAS an Imperial Regiment that attacked the
Vault, yeah?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That leaves it being an official order or a rogue
element.

Would a random rogue officer go after an 
Oathbreaker?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...
The group calmed to a quiet after that.

While the possibility of it being a rogue element
within the forces were not without potentiality...

...each and every one of them knew the more 
commonplace understanding and treatment of 
Oathbreakers for the population.

And how preposterous it sounded to say that 
someone would steal a blighted item off what the 
Covenant taught civilians about them.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Hey... Anton, right? Or Pup? Do you have any 
thoughts to share?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: A- Anton?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup, any thoughts?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hey, Pup, you're being talked to, you know?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Huh?

I... think... Norde has a good point.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Whatever Norde said is probably a good idea...)

I stepped back a little more from the group, trying 
to disengage myself from the conversation.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll... go scout ahead a bit.

Tapping my sheathed sword, I give a brief smile 
before heading off.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Something on Pup's mind?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I have an idea.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Must we travel through... that place?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then we are committed to route our travels through...
that place?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It is by and far the most expedient route if one 
wishes to avoid the Imperial Capital.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
That is true.

The north is a snowy tundra without many roads.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
At least, not many roads that do not lead to the
capital...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Well, the Storm Ram's child cannot escape it 
forever.

Be it answers or terrors... that place does will not
fade away.

Forever on their road, it is. The town of...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup cannot escape it forever.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do not know what answers lie there for Pup...

What answers lie in...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Crekskia.
I stepped onto the snow with a crunch.

Our travels through the Empire had largely brought 
us through barren or snow coated landscapes.
I breathed out, and I saw my breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Crekskia is...

It's... where I grew up before the Crows.

Stepping forward, the crunch of the snow 
beneath my feet seemed to match the beat 
of my heart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's... fine.
I had been having strange dreams lately.
I wasn't sure if they were for real, or not.

More and more they had felt real, and more 
engraved onto my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That place wasn't...

The most engraved image was of a scene. A grim 
scene that sent shivers up my spine.
I stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That wasn't... Crekskia, was it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Greetings, my friend~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I was asked to accompany you on your scouting 
mission.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...

I tried stepping back, but the crunch of 
the snow was enough to surprise me in 
my tense state.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure, let's scout then.
We stepped forward and walked along the path.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So... about our destination.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The Republic-Empire border?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Haha, you know what I mean...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Before that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
We talked once before of your family.

Of regrets you had in how you didn't remember 
them.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do you wish to learn more? Remember more?
I stopped again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sometimes I feel like that might be worse.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Truly? Why then do you feel-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait.

There's something in that bush.
I laid my hand on my sword and stepped towards it.
...and swung!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There it is!
STAGE DIRECTION> PRE SETUP SCREEN, PLAY SETUP MUSIC
STAGE DIRECTION> NO UNIT OPTIONS, JUST ROWAN AND PUP

STAGE DIRECTION> BATTLE ARENA IS SNOWY ROAD WITH
SCATTERED THINGS TO BLOCK MOVEMENT

STAGE DIRECTION> BATTLE IS AN OPTIONAL VICTORY. THIS IS
A STAT CHECK TO SEND A MESSAGE

STAGE DIRECTION> AS A RESULT, ALL ALLIES RETREAT AND
DON'T DIE, INCLUDING THEIR
STAGE DIRECTION> CONDITION TO BEAT ALL ENEMIES

STAGE DIRECTION> ENEMIES ARE TRACKING BEASTS, MAYBE
DOGS
STAGE DIRECTION> FOR BATTLE, PLAY BGM YF-BATTLE-ARIADNE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Beasts...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Be on guard!

I don't think this is a wild animal.
STAGE DIRECTION> MORE BEASTS ENTER

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: M- More...?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, these are definitely scouts.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Pant
... Is that all of them?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... Yeah, I think so.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- What happened?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Just in time, my good friends.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> GIVE REWARD TBD

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: This... did not go how I hoped...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shit... I need to... to...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Duck!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

I jumped to Rowan, pushing him down to the ground with
me.
STAGE DIRECTION> GUNSHOT SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> CHARLOTTE (s8 big Got 'em!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Are you two okay?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Better now... thank you.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Let me just... use this chance to cast some healing
magic.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT ANY REMAINING MUSIC
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE STRATEGY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_FIELD (DAY)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Pant
... 
pant
...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Might I ask what that was?
#### If otis recruited and live

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya two still alive? Can't have been too bad.
####  if not

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You two should be more careful around wild animals/

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, I think those are scout beasts.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Tracking animals?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. They were too... organized for wild animals.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They had to be trained.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So what does that mean?
The chatter died down, as people became thoughtful.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: So we've lost much of our lead.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You think it's that flyer woman?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The mercenary that was chasing us from Cartenan?
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO FLASHBACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_FIELD (DAY)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Even if we're being paranoid, we should act on it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You're not wrong, but... that does mean that we can't
do what we discussed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Yes, that option is off the table.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It would be much too time consuming to deviate from the
roads and keep ourselves supplied, unfortunately.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC SLOWLY

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We must traverse through Crekskia.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 260 FRAMES
What do you remember?
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE GRIEF1 INSTRUMENTAL
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SUBSCPACE (DAY/NORMAL)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES

I sat against a rock, and my legs curled up a bit
towards my body.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What do I remember?

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It can be hard to tell... what is memory and what is
imagination anymore...

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: You do not need to rush it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess...

I calmed myself down, trying to scour my mind for what
scraps of it remained within.
Memories.
Memories of Crekskia.
Memories of my family.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There was this one time... I think...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
My brother was playing hero. And I was... the damsel in
distress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not literally. I was like a villager or something.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: 'Hero'...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah, based on old fairytales and bedtime stories my
Mom told us.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: It gives a warm feeling to the heart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One of my favorites was about Tuvae the Shepherd.

The story of a simple shepherd who was able to hold off
an army, and guide his people to safety.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah... I always wanted to be Tuvae but Nikolai wanted to
play that too...

I often was the one shepherding the 'townsfolk' to
safety.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
It appears to give you warm memories as well, despite
that role.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course, he was my brother and we-

I stopped as I realized how easily that memory had
flowed.

Just one thread pulled and the yarn of a tale formed
within.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (But... only of the stories we were told?)

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: What were their names?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
The names of your mother and brother.

It appears curiosity beckons me, as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

My mother's name was Estella, and my older brother's
name was Nikolai.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
...

What do you believe became of them?

I opened my mouth. The grim reality of the thought
crept onto my mind.
But I couldn't say it.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: I see.
Aegis lowered his hand and placed it on my head.
With a rustling motion, he patted my head.

He didn't feel like a stranger. It was familiar and
comforting.
But I raised my own hands to remove his all the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... appreciate it.
And I moved his arm down, away from my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I'm there.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
I closed my eyes.
And took a deep breathe.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC CAMP_INSIDE (MORNING)
I opened my eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I'm ready to try.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE VERDURE1

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_MOUNTAINTOP
(DAY)
I stepped at an even pace.
My thoughts were numb, but not dormant.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Crekskia...)
My memories were little to none of the place.
What I remembered, if anything, was emotions.
The emotions of stories.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...Anton?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?
I turned to see Kara walking at my side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, hello.

Turning my head a few degrees more, a similar sight met
me from my rear flank.
######### If satia alive
STAGE DIRECTION> #######
######## If mariel alive
STAGE DIRECTION> ########
...looking at Kara and me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You appear distracted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm fine.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: This village is one you are familiar with, yes?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I've not been exposed to specifics, but... it seems
safe to say based on our time with Atticus.

The rumors of your father are rumors, but the
underlying connection...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Yes, I grew up there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Before my father and I joined the Crows, at least.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As I speculated.

This village is a place of bad memories for you, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then... the distracted moments and restless sleep?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I said I'm fine.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You say as much, but I am far from the only one to
notice.
I turned my eye back a bit once more.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do not know if it is the combination of the two, or
this topic is more impactful...

...but the group has noticed a lot more little signs of
problems lately. Too much to be ignored.
So I peeked back once more.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mouthing YES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I said I'm fine. With being a girl, and with coming
back here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The 'girl' one does seem more likely to be true now.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
While I was not sure of it at the time, your recent
signs of frustration have dwarfed those prior...
That was not what I expected her to say.
I was left a bit speechless as a mixture of emotion.
Was it a urge to correct her? Or a feeling of relief?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just... please don't let me distract everyone else.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can handle myself without costing us the mission.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The most sure way to stop it from distracting others...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...would be to allow them to help.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Particularly now, when the risk is around the corner.

We are capable of getting you a place to rest, and
letting you sleep your way through our visit to the
village.

My mind had words for that. What those words could be
was a mystery, but I fought the urge to open my mouth.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Alright...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Please take what actions will make the others
comfortable.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Being a hindrance would be... the last thing I'd want.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you.
Kara looked to breath out a bit more deliberately.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Was I worrying them that much?)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Norde was prepping some of the Crows to arrange
lodging, so I will go and inform him of your needed
accommodations.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
Kara stepped back, and I raised my hand to my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What am I doing? They're just worrying more...)
Rubbing my temples, the stress wasn't going away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sigh

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We can't be much farther now.)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

As we approached one major turn... one that should put
the village in our sights... I closed my eyes.
And took a deep breath.
And another.

And tried to swat away what the emotions I could
remember made me expect of this.
A ruin.

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC DARKWORLD_VILLAGE
(EVENING/PURPLE SKY)
That's what I expected to see.
The ruins of something terrible.

For all my attempts to not distract, Atticus's previous
words had rung true to me.

The rumors of a man who had killed his family, and
brought destruction and an end to the place he
protected.
I did not remember, but it felt too 'true' to ignore.
My heart wouldn't let me.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
So with a few more breaths, I waited to feel it.
The feeling of the sun lowering in the distance.

The feeling of the sightline to Crekskia being unveiled
beyond the next corner.
The feeling of...
...inevitability.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120
And there it was.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 200
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE NOCTURNAL BLOOM
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT (DAY)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
The tension warped away in an instant.
In my eyes was a village.

A village with people scattered about living their
lives.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan...?
I jumped a little, and was pulled out of the trance.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Crekskia, the mining town.

Out of the way of major trade routes, but also along
the way of many minor ones.

This region of the empire has ill- suited terrain and
climate for large scale farming operations...

...so the farms that keep the people going are
scattered amongst many small communities, along with
external trade with places like Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
In fact, nowadays the trade is applicable to most of
the Empire... as the Republic takes more and more of
the farmland along the border.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan, you know more about it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Of course. I was raised to take over the Empire one
day.

It would be unbecoming to not be knowledgeable of its
people and places.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right...

As I averted my eyes, Rowan tilted over to try and meet
my gaze.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not worry. From what I know, Crekskia lives
peacefully and, given its size, prosperously.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Then, you know what happened here, long ago?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Less than I'd like. Primarily the Covenant story that
Atticus told.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That, and there were some refugees from the incident...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do you know where the Vault is?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...to avoid? Or to find?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I agreed to avoid it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So Kara said.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas... I did not seek it out when I visited before,
no.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's okay. Thank you.

As I finished my words, some of the horses carrying
supplies reached me along with Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ready? You'll have to help with us getting rooms for
the night.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: If I can, sure.

So we both stepped forward, towards the town... towards
Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmmm...
This left Rowan at a standstill.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So the Empire doesn't know more about the incident?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Nothing I was privy to.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is no guarantee the Covenant was trying to cover
anything up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But... would that mean that Ivan... that Pup's dad...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps it because I have never had the chance to meet
the man, but people do not always wear the mask of
their true self.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I know, but that's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Difficult to believe, yes...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I apologize. I didn't mean to cause more stress.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps it would be best for me to assist Norde and
Pup.

Kara politely bowed, and then stepped forward to chase
after us two.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There's no way that guy would... kill his own family.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Hmm...

I suppose there is one other thing I know of it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Whatever happened wasn't without other refugees.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What? What do you mean? Like someone who fled Crekskia
besides Ivan and Pup?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed.

In fact, that other refugee is...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...my brother.

And with that note, Rowan stepped forward towards the
town as well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?!

Charlotte was left mouth agape, unable to collect
herself before Rowan had moved out of her arm's reach.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hey, wait, what do you mean by that?!
She stepped forward and chased after Rowan.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Weren't you... a bastard child.?!

You're only the heir... because the emperor didn't...
have other biological children... right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Alexei? Alexei...?!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

Charlotte's questioning faded away as the two closed
their distance to the village.

And all that was left was the lively chatter of Crows
and villagers as the group entered the town properly.
Happy voices, preparing for the days of the future.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE STARRY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT (DAY)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(EVENING)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(NIGHT)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 200 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG HOUSE (NIGHT)
Shhhink...!
The sharpening stone glided over the steeled edge.
##### if satia alive ############

That was soon accompanied by the creak of my door
opening.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'll be taking a shower. If you need anything from the
supply, please just let me know.

That was soon accompanied by a knock on my door and a
voice outside of it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Checking in as agreed. Just give me or the other Crows
a holler if you need anything.
STAGE DIRECTION> #################

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks. Will do.
I could hear footsteps disappear as she walked away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
... I know I agreed to this, but...

Must I be treated like a grounded child?

Per my conversation with Kara, I was arranged a remote
living quarters to the edge of the town.

There were not inns enough to house the Crows, so the
village accepted some of us to bunk with them at their
family homes.

Along with some unoccupied housing, like the small one
I was in now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(To think... kindhearted enough to let strangers into
their homes...)

I shook my head a little. That wasn't a thought I
needed to dwell on.

If all went well, I wouldn't need to step a foot closer
to the village.

The others were using the evening to load up on much
needed supplies, and I was left as one of many doing
weapon maintenance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There. In record time, too.
I set the sword back into the pile and stepped back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Now what?

It appeared that I rushed through my nightly
distraction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

As I considered what to do, my eye wandered to the
nearby window.

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (There's just a few people left.)

Even on the outskirts, the village felt lively. It was
only now with the night in full effect that the sight
softened.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG HOUSE (NIGHT)
I stumbled over into the bed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I should just... sleep.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. I should.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
I closed my eyes.

And through sheer force of will, I tried my best to
sleep.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 120 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY.
I succeeded, eventually.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 200 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE WONDER5
STAGE DIRECTION> HARD CUT TO BG HOUSE (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Gasp
...!

I vaulted up into a sitting position on the bedding,
trying to catch my breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What was... that?)

My body felt suddenly full of energy. Like a breath of
life had been radiated throughout my being.
Along with that, I saw an image of a familiar figure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Aegis?

The name appeared in my mind, but I wasn't sure what to
make of it. Whatever memory it encapsulated was fuzzy
to my waking mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How long have I been out?)
I looked around for any signs and...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe if I check the moon, then I can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait...?
There was a shine from my belt pocket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The locket that Dad gave me...

Why is it... shining?
STAGE DIRECTION> SHOW LOCKET

I clicked it, opening it up to see if something had
happened within.

Nothing too unusual stuck out to me, bar the glow I had
seen radiating around it.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE LOCKET IMAGE
I closed it.

The glow was still there, and I turned it around
looking for any other sign of the reason for it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Though... didn't Rowan say this was an heirloom? With
magical properties and all?)
I closed my hand tightly around the locket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(My mother's... heirloom.)

.........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?

As I gripped it. I noticed that the aura was leaking
out of my hand.

But it wasn't evenly doing do. It had a clear direction
as the light escaped the gaps between my fingers.

I moved my hand around, and the light stayed pointing
in a specific direction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Huh.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Like... a compass?)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> DOOR OPEN SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(NIGHT)
I closed the door behind me slowly and quietly.

Looking down at the locket, the glow pointed deeper
into the town.
Into Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What else would I expect...?
I looked forward.
Took a deep breath.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 90 FRAMES
And stepped forward.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 70 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Hm? Was that...?
The Nightless Crow scratched their chin.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Maybe I should let Norde and them know...
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE NOCTURNAL BLOOM
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_TOWN (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And... this way?)

lines.speaker: Villager 1
lines.text: Hey, looking for something?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- No thank you. I'm good.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I appreciate the thought.

It had been like this since I started following the
trail.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Clearly it's not late enough for everyone to be
asleep. People are settling down for the night.)
The act of walking through the town felt surreal.
All around me were happy and content faces.

It wasn't as active as the day, but the village was
very much alive, contrary to the emotional memory I had
of it.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Quite a few houses.)

(A trade depot... a doctor's office... a general
store...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, is that...?)
I stepped to the window of the shop.

Within it was a carved wooden statue. It was something
between a decoration and, to a child's eye, a toy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Raiga.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's still there...

.........

I stepped away in an instant like I was dodging a
strike.

The memory of seeing this here... all those years
ago... snapped into place.
But it was just that... The memory of wanting a toy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(To see it here still, all these years later...)

.........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
... I can't... I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I need to focus on this. Whatever it's trying to tell
me.)

I gripped the locket tighter, and I stepped forward
with it as a guide once more.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES

I continued on, and soon I felt the crunch of snow
underneath my feet.

My path had me climb to a higher area of the village
where the recent snow had yet to melt.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)

It was a path that set my feet in front of a manor to
the edges of the village.
So I raised my hand... and knocked.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 70 FRAME
STAGE DIRECTION> DOOR OPEN SE
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 80 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hello. The owners are aiming to go to sleep for the
day, so can you-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, Pup?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's MY question...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 70 FRAMES
#### If mariel alive ######

Charlotte, Mariel, and Kara were paying to use some
rooms here, same as I was in the house earlier.
#### If not

Charlotte and Kara were paying to use some rooms here,
same as I was in the house earlier.
STAGE DIRECTION> #################

The family was excited to see "one of their friends" at
the door, and quickly invited me in for a drink.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE LIMPID_WATER_NO-
MELODY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C (NIGHT)
Steam rose from the cup in my hand.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
Sorry, a hot cup of water is all we can do at the
moment. We're nearly out of tea and the next shipment
won't be for a week.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you. I appreciate it.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: It's cold out this time of year, so better to warm up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you for your hospitality towards our friend.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I will echo that.
Across from me sat a few familiar faces.
######### If Mariel Alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Haha... ha...
STAGE DIRECTION> ########

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
......

What brings you here, Pup...?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
Yes, I am curious as well!

These young ladies were the last sort I'd expect to be
traveling with mercenaries.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Ha, yeah, to think Cartenan of all places is in a war
now.

The two hosts sat alongside us as they co-opted
Charlotte's question.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
What about you, young miss? What brings you to Crekskia
along with the mercenaries?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... grew up with them.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Really? Ah, that's no place for a young lady. I hope
they treat you well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, they do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of... course they do. It's home.

I stared into the glass of water, seeing a reflection
of my current self.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Home is home, even if the place and... faces change.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

Charlotte and Kara glanced at each other with knowing
looks.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Home, eh? You know, Mr. and Mrs. Levin here were
telling us about that before.
####### if mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: The romance story?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Yes. The story of their romance, you mean?
STAGE DIRECTION> ################

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: Ah, yes. That little story of ours.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That's the one.

The one about how they were born here and met each
other here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...meaning they've lived here their entire lives.

For... over 20 years... longer than you've been alive,
Pup.
Charlotte was staring daggers at me expectantly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Over 20 years...?)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

Meaning they would've been here when IT happened 13
years ago.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... don't say...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You've likely seen a lot of history of Crekskia over
that time.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
A bit. But not much happens here.

Mainly just the depleting food stores since the war
with the Republic started...

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
There was that time that the Covenant occupied half the
village for a few months.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Back when we were kids? Yeah, that was a time. Thought
it was the end of the world, haha.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The Covenant occupied the village?

As Kara asked, she tilted her head so she could see me
out of the corner of her eyes. She was not trying to
hide that she was gauging my reactions.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: Yeah, a murder, apparently.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's...
### If mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Back when you kids... that'd have been...
STAGE DIRECTION> ###########

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
It was... a dozen years ago, maybe? Maybe a little
more.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
We were just teenagers at the time, so it was like
right out of a novel to us.

Thinking about it now, it was like a different world.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
May I inquire... if this was a family affair that you
refer to?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Kara, are you sure?

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Hmm... I think so. We used to play with the kids of the
affected family, despite them being younger than us.

One of them was a platinum blonde haired boy. He was a
real... haha... I remember him being high energy.

The other was... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
I don't think we talked much but that one had a blue
sort of hair? Followed around the older brother a lot.

It's been over a decade and I can still remember those
little fluffs of azure sticking out from behind the
older one's back.

In fact, it was a color a lot like...
I tried to keep quiet. I tried to just listen.
I tried to not talk.
###### If mariel alive #########

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup...
####### if not

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe we should...
STAGE DIRECTION> ########

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: And do you know what happened to those two children?

Kara pushed forward despite the hesitancy from the rest
of us.

Her willingness to face it... I didn't know if I could
take it as a blessing or a curse.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Well, we never saw any of them again. The mother, the
father, or the two kids.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
This house stood empty for quite a few years.

And even since we moved in, I've never felt anything
like a ghost or other spiritual remains.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, here? This house?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I don't mean to scare you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Perhaps it'd be best to stop here and-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did he do it?

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: Hmm... I shouldn't have brought it up.
#### If mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup, you don't need to. You can go back to your room.
STAGE DIRECTION> #########

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I need to know.

I held my locket close. My hand gripped tightly around
it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Did that man kill them?

Did he kill his family?
The room grew silent.

I faced the husband. The man I had apparently played
with as a child.

And I asked him something that it felt like only he
could tell me.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Did the father kill his family...? I cannot say I'll
ever really know, but...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

I gripped the locket tighter and instinctively squeezed
my eyes shut.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: But as for what I think happened... for what I believe.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
...

I do not believe he did.

lines.text: I'll try.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Isn't that comforting, haha...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe I'll have to dock your pay next time?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey... Don't go that far...
#### Pup x Satia #####

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup!

Satia ran up to me and quickly wrapped me in a tight
hug.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Satia?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you doing?

I blurted out the words and Satia nuzzled against me in
a happy bliss.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Quiet. I earned this. You earned this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's good to see you, Satia. I'm happy you're safe.

I hugged her back quickly, and soon enough we swiveled
to face any incoming enemy... back to back.
#### Pup x Norde #####

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Did you find what you needed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmm... Maybe. It may be a matter of time to really know
though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... think so, at least. Or am nearly there.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Now, shall we take down these Imperials?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I'm up for that.
#### Rowan x Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?! Why are you here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Et tu, dear Charlotte?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You should ask that question of the troops.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I know the answer to that already. They're trying to
kill me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A fair answer...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then shall I protect you, my dear friend?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We'll see if you can.

Maybe I'll protect you?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I look forward to being in your debt~
#### Mariel x Satia #####

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Satia! Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Yes, dear. I am in good condition.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
One ready to rid us of this threat to you, your sister,
Pup, and...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: And to you!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'll do my best to keep you safe, as well.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Sweet as that is, they are after you and others. I am
but a wall in their road to that.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: And a beautiful and valuable wall at that!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I'm not afraid of these people not anymore. Not with
you all around.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Giggle
... Very well, shall we fight them together,
then?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah!
#### Jude x Otis #####

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: You were awoken as well?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Gah, yeah. That hollering bard screaming up and down
the village.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Ah... same.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
But ya actually came? Didn't think ya would fight your
ol' crew.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: It is... awkward.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Some of them still owe me a debt, too...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heheh~

Maybe some lootin' will make ya lot even, then?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: That's... maybe a bit much.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I'm not that sort of mercenary.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ah, more loot for me, then. Maybe I'll buy ya somethin'
tasty?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: ...I wouldn't say "no" to that.
#### Jakson x Atticus #####

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: This place... Yes, this is a vault.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Whimper
...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
There, boy.

Well get your owner out of her safely.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: Appreciative bark

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Though you still look nervous...

Perhaps you can sense that this place was important to
the Pup child...?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: Determined bark
#### Elliot x Tatiana #####

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Eh, what a place for the Covenant to build. This is a
Vault?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Technically.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
This place appears unfinished, though?

Perhaps they were building out a maze as a protective
measure...? It is safer than a straight tunnel to the
Vault.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What a damn waste.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The Covenant takes the protection of Oathbreakers
seriously.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmph. Clearly didn't work here.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I... suppose not.
#### Castel x Reagyn #####

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Intriguing... An entire labyrinth... just to protect an
Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Should you be focusing on that at this time? We've
hostiles about.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, such is true. But one cannot take my curiosity. I
would not be me.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Do you not see these tunnels and rooms and have a rush
of wonder for its nature? It's purpose?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Not particularly.

We're not here to gawk. We're here to do a job.

If we're not trying to work towards saving my homeland,
it is not worth what time and resources I have.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, but that is the key. To understand is to be able to
achieve your goals more effectively.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
See those wooden structures supporting the tunnel? What
if we were to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What if the enemy was to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: That is... true.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Then I'll leave such observations to you.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Of course.
#### Flynn x Kara #####

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: This place is so dark and dank...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Be strong, friend. They are as blinded as we are.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Lady Kara...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I understand, but... they're organized. We just woke
up.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
They're also coming off a lengthy chase. They are tired
and we are rested.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Do no fret. They do not have the advantage. We do.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank you, Lady Kara. As usual, you know just what to
say.
#### Nora v Pup #####

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You don't even understand where you are, do you?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What are you rambling on about?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Listen clearly with those ears of yours.

This is not a place you are welcome. You've no right to
step foot in here.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: As if I care. I fight for my home.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And today, I fight for one of mine.
#### Nora v Jude #####

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Tsk... you.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Nora.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
How can you stand there? Acting as though you aren't a
traitor?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Traitor to who? The Empire?

Or to your own personal objectives?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
The Empire should pay their bills more promptly.

And you're just one of many amongst the Imperials that
owe me a good meal.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Sigh
... Not that I'll have a chance to cash out those
favors.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Quiet. You chose your side. This ends now.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Stronger women than you have tried.
#### Nora v Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph. Welcome to Crekskia, fox.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I see Princess A has picked up more than just
oppression from her vile parents.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You don't get to talk about my parents.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: If their sins are too much for you to burden...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...I'll relieve you of them!
#### Nora v Mariel #####

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The younger "princess", is it?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: How... How could you do this?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
The amount of people who have died... Lockhart...
Cartenan...

You're just spreading death and destruction everywhere.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The war is not mine to fight. I fight for Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
What?! But you're the one who brought war against our
home!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You know nothing of Lockhart.

I will fight for her future.

Threats to that future must be removed.
#### Nora v any other allies (first time) #####

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You lot... I am tired of you blocking my path...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Out of my way!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Ugh...! This...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'm not letting you get away AGAIN.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'll have to fall back...
STAGE DIRECTION> CONTINUE BATTLE MUSIC
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

The enemy was pushed back by our blades, and scattered
amongst the ruin.

Of those that could muster a retreat, they headed back
up the stairway to escape outside.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Fall back!
STAGE DIRECTION> FIGHT CLASH SE, WAIT 15 FRAMES (X3)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C

STAGE DIRECTION> DESTRUCTIVE RUMBLE SE, SHAKE SCREEN AT
SAME TIME
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 30 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING OUTSIDE SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Time it.

Nora and a few other Imperial troops and mercenaries
jettisoned out into the village.

Turning their heels back towards the house, they were
not retreating.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: They should still be in position, right?

One of the soldiers was clearly distracted, looking
around wildly to the surrounding area.
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING OUTSIDE SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Stop there, you piece of...!

Charlotte and Kara arrived. The former like a boar
ready to charge, and the latter calm and collected.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Surrender.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What?! After all she's done?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I understand. Trust me.
She turned back to Nora.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Surrender. We can negotiate for your safety.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

The groups stood at a standstill. Each with weapons
ready to move on their foe.
STAGE DIRECTION> .........

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Heh.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: NOW!!!
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF

The scream rang out into the trees and other houses of
the village.
Sending down...!
STAGE DIRECTION> ........
Nothing.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Idiots! Get out here!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'm not sure...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: There should be an ambush, based on her words.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A- Ambush?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Idiots! Get out here!
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: You mean this ambush?
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE NOCTURNAL BLOOM
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text: Argh...!
A tied up soldier fell to the ground.

The villager had entered from the edges of the area and
the darkness.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Or this one?

Suddenly, a variety of villagers and Nightless Crows
exited from the same darkness, each showing a soldier
or mercenary they had subdued.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Others came to help?
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING IN SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: There... There you all are!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ever am I glad I asked that Crows to spread the word of
this lot before I headed in.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Thank ya, prince. And the Nightless Crows that helped.

We're not about to let some rogue army regiment attack
our friends and families.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: R- Rogue...?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is the least I can do.

My last visit here was such a pleasure that it'd be a
shame to not see my people flourish.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you, Alexei. I'm so happy I could kiss you.
Charlotte cocked back the hammer on her gun.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It would be my pleasure.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It damn well will.
She lowered the gun to target Nora directly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I will say it again. Surrender.

This time with the utmost sincerity. After all, there
is no need to test if you have backup plans anymore.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Is that what that was?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We can indeed negotiate for your safety.

And...
Kara looked over Nora's face.
From her armor to her fox-like ears.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You are from Lockhart, I presume?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...Yes.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Fantastic. Then there is a matter of negotiation I
imagine would be prudent for you to engage in. (s1
neutral On the matter of your family.

Nora released her grip and her weapon fell to the
ground.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

Nora and the other troops were secured and looked over
by the Nightless Crows.
As Kara spoke to Nora, Charlotte stepped over to Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Is it time for my kiss?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I hope she'll give up info easily. Not sure I want to
drag her along with us.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Spurned once more...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Given how much she wants to kill me, it's probably
gonna be a pain...

...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, where's Pup?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm? Were they not with you by the end of the fight?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, I hope they're not doing something reckless again.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE
UNKNOWNWORLDS_HARP_LOOP
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031C
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 80 FRAMES
My feet stopped before a grave.
And my eyes tilted down to the locket.
I watched as the light faded.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One last stop...?

Lifting it up, I donned the locket around my neck, and
secured it safely under my shirt.

With a few more steps, I was in front of the grave
proper.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Here lies those... taken too early by the Goddess."

There was one grave with three names on it, and this
location split off from the main graveyard behind me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
"Estella Baranov."

"Nikolai Baranov."

.........

"Anton Baranov."
My eyes lingered on that the final one.

And as they did, I slowly sat myself before the three
names.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Exhale
...
Slowly, I let myself breathe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I suppose it's natural.

The "entire family was killed"... That was the story,
wasn't it?
In.
Out.

My mind calmed as I continued to try to find the words
to say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Nikolai...

...

Thank you. For protecting me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know... I can't remember what happened in the end.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But if I am here... and you... aren't...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you. For being my big brother.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
As for you, my mother...

...

Mom... I'm sorry. I'm sorry for forgetting.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And...
I tried to find words. Something to say.
Something to remember.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (All I could remember was...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Mom.

Can I... tell you a story, maybe?

A story to both of you, maybe... about a wannabe hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A silly boy chasing after the shadow of a true hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It all started...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... when would it start...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It all started when the wannabe hero and their father
joined a mercenary group...

As this wannabe hero was told of how those days
happened... the two showed up and were welcomed with
open arms...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And that's when "Bored" made the wannabe hero run
laps...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...around the capital city of the Republic!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It was... a tournament I think? In one of the
Republic's ports.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The hero expected them to come back with spoils of
victory, but Satia just-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Or, er, "Matia" just came back with a dress of all
things.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It was for her, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
... I didn't hear the end of that crusade for a
week...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I think you two would've liked them.
### if mariel alive

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte, Mariel, Rowan, Kara...
#### If not

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte, Rowan, Kara...
STAGE DIRECTION> #######

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: All these people we've met are... amazing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Always pushing forward. Always with a card up their
sleeve. Able to lift us up...

They make me want to be better.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: To not drag them down... with whatever my failures are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I wish you two got to meet them, too.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And then... when we...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...when... we...

Yawn
...

...when we saw... the mountain...

.........
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
The words spun their fabric of a tale.
A lullaby that spanned time beyond my awareness.
It was only a matter of time before sleep took me.

A sleep that, despite where I was, was like a cocoon of
comfort.
Like a weight had been lifted off my shoulders.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> CHANGE PUP TO STAGE 4 ART VERSIONS
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 210 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

Flickering sunlight streamed through the forested
canopy.
It hit my eyes and my grogginess was forced aside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mmm...

Sitting up from my sleeping position, I could feel a
new weight on my shoulders.
Or, perhaps, a new weight on my chest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...

My gambeson was big enough on me now that it slipped
off my shoulders as I moved.

Though, the tightness of my clothes otherwise, belts
and shirt included, stopped it from falling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course.

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha... hahaha...

I flopped back down onto my back and let the morning
sun pelt me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course it happened... one... more... time...

"Here lies Anton Baranov"

........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not much left to lose now, I think.

For all my efforts. For all my struggles. For all my
attempts to embrace it.
My "weakness" was my "weakness".
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
And maybe there was nothing I could do about it.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What do you think? Mom? Nikolai?

Do I at least make a half decent girl?

Hahaha!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What am I doing?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What even can I do?

...

Maybe that's the lesson.

You are who you are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And every second I spend trying to figure it out is
just another step down the same paths as before.

I slowly rose to my feet, and tried to get used to the
new shift in my center of gravity as I did.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... Yeah, this is workable, I think.

I padded down my outfit, clearing away the underbrush
from my clothes and longer hair.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mom, Nikolai... I'll visit again.

As I said the words, the rustle of distant sounds
drifted towards me.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...isn't... there...?
### If reagyn is recruited and alive

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ...think... over...
### if not

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...think... over...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...most... likely...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'll try to not take as long this time to visit
again... but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I do have a story to finish.
I bowed slightly to the grave.
And turned towards my comrades-in-arms.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Might I ask what that was?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya two still alive? Can't have been too bad.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You two should be more careful around wild animals/

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, I think those are scout beasts.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Tracking animals?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. They were too... organized for wild animals.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They had to be trained.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So what does that mean?

The chatter died down, as people 
became thoughtful.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: So we've lost much of our lead.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You think it's that flier woman?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The mercenary that was chasing us from Cartenan?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Even if we're being paranoid, we should act on it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You're not wrong, but... that does mean that we 
can't do what we discussed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Yes, that option is off the table.

lines.speaker: Kara
Kara
lines.text: We must traverse through Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay.
What do you remember?

I sat against a rock, and my legs curled up a bit
towards my body.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What do I remember?

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It can be hard to tell... what is memory and what is
imagination anymore...

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: You do not need to rush it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess...

I calmed myself down, trying to scour my mind
for what scraps of it remained within.
Memories.
Memories of Crekskia.
Memories of my family.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There was this one time... I think...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
My brother was playing hero. And I was... the 
damsel in distress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not literally. I was like a villager or something.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: 'Hero'...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah, based on old fairytales and bedtime stories 
my Mom told us.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: It gives a warm feeling to the heart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One of my favorites was about Tuvae the 
Shepherd.

The story of a simple shepherd who was able to 
hold off an army, and guide his people to safety.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah... I always wanted to be Tuvae but Nikolai 
wanted to play that too...

I often was the one shepherding the 'townsfolk' to
safety.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
It appears to give you warm memories as well, 
despite that role.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course, he was my brother and we-

I stopped as I realized how easily that memory 
had flowed.

Just one thread pulled and the yarn of a tale 
formed within.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (But... only of the stories we were told?)

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: What were their names?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
The names of your mother and brother.

It appears curiosity beckons me, as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

My mother's name was Estella, and my older 
brother's name was Nikolai.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
...

What do you believe became of them?

I opened my mouth. The grim reality of the 
thought crept onto my mind.
But I couldn't say it.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: I see.
Aegis lowered his hand and placed it on my head.
With a rustling motion, he patted my head.

He didn't feel like a stranger. It was familiar and
comforting.

But I raised my own hands to remove his 
all the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... appreciate it.
And I moved his arm down, away from my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I'm there.
I closed my eyes.
And took a deep breath.
I opened my eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I'm ready to try.
I stepped at an even pace.
My thoughts were numb, but not dormant.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Crekskia...)
My memories were little to none of the place.
What I remembered, if anything, was emotions.
The emotions of stories.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...Anton?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?
I turned to see Kara walking at my side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, hello.

Turning my head a few degrees more, a similar 
sight met me from my rear flank.
...looking at Kara and me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You appear distracted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm fine.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: This village is one you are familiar with, yes?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I've not been exposed to specifics, but... it seems
safe to say based on our time with Atticus.

The rumors of your father are rumors, but the
underlying connection...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Yes, I grew up there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Before my father and I joined the Crows, at least.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As I speculated.

This village is a place of bad memories for you, 
then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then... the distracted moments and restless sleep?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I said I'm fine.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You say as much, but I am far from the only one to
notice.
I turned my eye back a bit once more.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do not know if it is the combination of the two, 
or this topic is more impactful...

...but the group has noticed a lot more little signs 
of problems lately. Too much to be ignored.
So I peeked back once more.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Mouthing YES*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I said I'm fine. With being a girl, and with coming
back here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The 'girl' one does seem more likely to be true 
now.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
While I was not sure of it at the time, your recent
signs of frustration have dwarfed those prior...
That was not what I expected her to say.

I was left a bit speechless as a mixture of 
emotions stumbled about my mind.
Was it a urge to correct her? Or a feeling of relief?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just... please don't let me distract everyone else.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can handle myself without costing us the mission.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The most sure way to stop it from distracting others...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...would be to allow them to help.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Particularly now, when the risk is around the 
corner.

We are capable of getting you a place to rest, and
letting you sleep your way through our visit to the
village.

My mind had words for that. What those words 
could be was a mystery, but I fought the urge to 
open my mouth.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Alright...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Please take what actions will make the others
comfortable.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Being a hindrance would be... the last thing I'd want.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you.
Kara herself breathed out a bit more deliberately.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Was I worrying them that much?)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Norde was prepping some of the Crows to arrange
lodging, so I will go and inform him of your needed
accommodations.

Kara stepped back, and I raised my hand to 
my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What am I doing? They're just worrying more...)
Rubbing my temples, the stress wasn't going away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We can't be much farther now.)

As we approached one final turn... 
one that should put the village in our sights... 
I closed my eyes.
And took a deep breath.
And another.

And tried to swat away the expectations that
my vague memories were conjuring up.
A ruin.
That's what I expected to see.
The ruins of something terrible.

For all my attempts to not distract, Atticus's 
previous words had rung true to me.

The rumors of a man who had killed his family, and
brought destruction and an end to the place he
protected.
I did not remember, but it felt too 'true' to ignore.
My heart wouldn't let me.
So with a few more breaths, I waited to feel it.
The feeling of the sun lowering in the distance.

The feeling of the sightline to Crekskia being 
unveiled beyond the next corner.
The feeling of...
...inevitability.
And there it was.
The tension warped away in an instant.
In my eyes was a village.

A village with people scattered about living their
lives.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan...?
I jumped a little, and was pulled out of the trance.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Crekskia, the mining town.

Out of the way of major trade routes, but also 
along the way of many minor ones.

This region of the empire has ill-suited terrain and
climate for large scale farming operations...

...so the farms that keep the people going are
scattered amongst many small communities, along 
with external trade with places like Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
In fact, nowadays the trade is applicable to most of
the Empire... as the Republic takes more and more 
of the farmland along the border.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Rowan, you... seem to know a lot about this
village...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Of course. I was raised to take over the Empire one
day.

It would be unbecoming to not be knowledgeable 
of its people and places.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right...

As I averted my eyes, Rowan tilted over to try 
and meet my gaze.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not worry. From what I know, Crekskia lives
peacefully and, given its size, prosperously.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Then, you know what happened here, long ago?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Less than I'd like. Primarily the Covenant story that
Atticus told.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
That, and there were some refugees from the 
incident...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do you know where the Vault is?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...to avoid? Or to find?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I agreed to avoid it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So Kara said.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas... I did not seek it out when I visited before,
no.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's okay. Thank you.

As if to match the ending my sentence, 
some of the horses carrying supplies and
Norde reached where we were.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ready? You'll have to help with us getting rooms 
for the night.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: If I can, sure.

So we both stepped forward, towards the town... 

...towards Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmmm...
This left Rowan at a standstill.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So the Empire doesn't know more about the incident?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Nothing I was privy to.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is no guarantee the Covenant was trying to 
cover anything up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But... would that mean that Ivan... that Pup's dad...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps it is because I have never had the 
chance to meet the man...

But people do not always wear the 
mask of their true self.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I know, but that's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Difficult to believe, yes...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I apologize. I didn't mean to cause more stress.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps it would be best for me to assist Norde and
Pup.

Kara politely bowed, and then stepped forward to 
chase after us two.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There's no way that guy would... kill his own family.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Hmm...

I suppose there is one other thing I know of it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Whatever happened wasn't without other refugees.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What? What do you mean? Like someone who fled 
Crekskia besides Ivan and Pup?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed.

In fact, that other refugee is...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...my brother.

And with that note, Rowan stepped forward 
towards the town as well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?!

Charlotte was left mouth agape, unable to collect
herself before Rowan had moved out of her arm's 
reach.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hey, wait, what do you mean by that?!
She stepped forward and chased after Rowan.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Weren't you... a bastard child?!

You're only the heir... because the emperor 
didn't... have other biological children... right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Alexei? Alexei...?!

Charlotte's questioning faded away as the two 
closed their distance to the village.

And all that was left was the lively chatter of Crows
and villagers as the group entered the town 
properly.
Happy voices, preparing for the days of the future.
*Shhhink...!*

The sharpening stone glided over the steeled 
edge.

That was soon accompanied by the creak of my 
door opening.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'll be taking a shower. If you need anything from 
the supply, please just let me know.

That was soon accompanied by a knock on my door 
and a voice outside of it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Checking in as agreed. Just give me or the other 
Crows a holler if you need anything.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks. Will do.

I could hear footsteps disappear as she walked 
away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I know I agreed to this, but...

Must I be treated like a grounded child?

Per my conversation with Kara, I was arranged a 
remote living quarters to the edge of the town.

There were not inns enough to house the Crows, 
so the village accepted some of us to bunk with 
them at their family homes.

Along with some unoccupied housing, like the small 
one I was in now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(To think... kindhearted enough to let strangers 
into their homes...)

I shook my head a little. That wasn't a thought I
needed to dwell on.

If all went well, I wouldn't need to step a foot 
closer to the village.

The others were using the evening to load up on 
much needed supplies, and I was left as one of 
many doing weapon maintenance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There. In record time, too.

I set the sword back into the pile and stepped 
back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Now what?

It appeared that I rushed through my nightly
distraction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

As I considered what to do, my eye wandered to 
the nearby window.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (There's just a few people left.)

Even on the outskirts, the village felt lively. It was
only now with the night in full effect that the sight
softened.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
I stumbled over into the bed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I should just... sleep.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. I should.
I closed my eyes.

And through sheer force of will, I tried my best to
sleep.
I succeeded, eventually.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Gasp*...!
