I vaulted up into a sitting position on the bedding,
trying to catch my breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What was... that?)

My body felt suddenly full of energy. Like a breath 
of life had been radiated throughout my being.

Along with that, I saw an image of a familiar figure
during my dreaming.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Aegis?

The name appeared in my mind, but I wasn't sure 
what to make of it. Whatever memory it 
encapsulated was fuzzy to my waking mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How long have I been out?)
I looked around for any signs and...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe if I check the moon, then I can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait...?
There was a shine from my belt pocket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The locket that Dad gave me...

Why is it... shining?

I clicked it, opening it up to see if something had
happened within.

Nothing too unusual stuck out to me, bar the glow 
I had seen radiating around it.
I closed it.

The glow was still there, and I turned it around.
I looked for any other sign of the reason for it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Though... didn't Rowan say this was an heirloom? 
With magical properties and all?)
I closed my hand tightly around the locket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(My mother's... heirloom.)

.........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?

As I gripped it. I noticed that the aura was leaking
out of my hand.

But it wasn't evenly doing do. It had a clear 
direction as the light escaped the gaps between 
my fingers.

I moved my hand around, and the light stayed 
pointing in a specific direction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Huh.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Like... a compass?)
I closed the door behind me slowly and quietly.

Looking down at the locket, the glow pointed 
deeper into the town.
Into Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What else would I expect...?
I looked forward.
Took a deep breath.
And stepped forward.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Hm? Was that...?
The Nightless Crow scratched their chin.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Maybe I should let Norde and them know...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And... this way?)

lines.speaker: Villager 1
lines.text: Hey, looking for something?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- No thank you. I'm good.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I appreciate the thought.

It had been like this since I started following the
trail.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Clearly it's not late enough for everyone to be
asleep. People are settling down for the night.)
The act of walking through the town felt surreal.
All around me were happy and content faces.

It wasn't as active as the day, but the village was
very much alive, contrary to the emotional 
memory I had of it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Quite a few houses.)

(A trade depot... a doctor's office... a general
store...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, is that...?)
I stepped to the window of the shop.

Within it was a carved wooden statue. It was 
something between a decoration and, to a child's 
eye, a toy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Raiga.

It was a statue of a famous hero of the Empire: 
Raiga.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's still there...

.........

I stepped away in an instant like I was dodging a
strike.

The memory of seeing this here... all those years
ago... snapped into place.

But it was just that... The memory of wanting a 
toy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(To see it here still, all these years later...)

.........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I can't... I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I need to focus on this. Whatever it's trying to tell
me.)

I gripped the locket tighter, and I stepped forward
with it as a guide once more.

I continued on, and soon I felt the crunch of snow
underneath my feet.

My path had me climb to a higher area of the 
village where the recent snow had yet to melt.

It was a path that set my feet in front of a manor 
at the edges of the village.
So I raised my hand... and knocked.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hello. The owners are aiming to go to sleep for the
day, so can you-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, Pup?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's MY question...

Charlotte, Mariel, and Kara were paying to use some
rooms here, same as I was in the house earlier.

Charlotte and Kara were paying to use some rooms 
here, same as I was in the house earlier.

The family was excited to see "one of their friends" 
at the door, and quickly invited me in for a drink.
Steam rose from the cup in my hand.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
Sorry, a hot cup of water is all we can do at the
moment. We're nearly out of tea and the next 
shipment won't be for a week.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you. I appreciate it.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: It's cold out this time of year, so better to warm up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you for your hospitality towards our friend.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I will echo that.
Across from me sat a few familiar faces.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Haha... ha...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
......

So... what brings you here, Pup...?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
Yes, I am curious as well!

These young ladies were the last sort I'd expect to 
be traveling with mercenaries.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Ha, yeah, to think Cartenan of all places is in a war
now.

It is... hard to even imagine. It feels so far away.

The two hosts sat alongside us as they co-opted
Charlotte's question.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
What about you, young miss? What brings you to 
Crekskia along with the mercenaries?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... grew up with them.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Really? Ah, that's no place for a young lady. I hope
they treat you well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, they do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of... course they do. It's home.

I stared into the glass of water, seeing a reflection
of my current self.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Home is home, even if the place and... faces 
change.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

Charlotte and Kara glanced at each other with 
knowing looks.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Home, eh? You know, Mr. and Mrs. Levin here 
were telling us about that before.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: The romance story?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Yes. The story of their romance, you mean?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: Ah, yes. That little story of ours.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That's the one.

The one about how they were born here and met 
each other here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...meaning they've lived here their entire lives.

For... over 20 years... longer than you've been 
alive, Pup.
Charlotte was staring daggers at me, expectantly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Over 20 years...?)

Meaning they would've been here when 
IT happened 13 years ago.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... don't say...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You've likely seen a lot of the history of Crekskia
over that time.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
A bit. But not much happens here.

Mainly just the depleting food stores since the war
with the Republic started...

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
There was that time that the Covenant occupied 
half the village for a few months.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Back when we were kids? Yeah, that was a time. 
Thought it was the end of the world, haha.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The Covenant occupied the village?

As Kara asked, she tilted her head so she could see 
me out of the corner of her eyes. She was not 
trying to hide that she was gauging my reactions.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: Yeah, a murder, apparently.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Back when you kids... that'd have been...

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
It was... a dozen years ago, maybe? Maybe a little
more.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
We were just teenagers at the time, so it was like
right out of a novel to us.

Thinking about it now, it was like a different world.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
May I inquire... if this was a family affair that you
refer to?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Kara, are you sure?

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Hmm... I think so. We used to play with the kids of 
the affected family, despite them being younger 
than us.
One of them was a platinum blonde haired boy. He 
was a real... haha... I remember him being high 
energy.
The other was... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
I don't think we talked much. But that one had a 
blue sort of hair? Followed around the older brother 
a lot.
It's been over a decade and I can still remember 
those little fluffs of azure sticking out from behind 
the older one's back.
In fact, it was a color a lot like...
I tried to keep quiet. I tried to just listen.
I tried to not talk.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe we should...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: And do you know what happened to those two children?

Kara pushed forward despite the hesitancy from 
the rest of us.

Her willingness to face it... I didn't know if I could
take it as a blessing or a curse.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Well, we never saw any of them again. The 
mother, the father, or the two kids.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
This house stood empty for quite a few years.

And even since we moved in, I've never felt 
anything like a ghost or other spiritual remains.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, here? This house?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I don't mean to scare you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Perhaps it'd be best to stop here and-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
.........

Did he do it?

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
That's...

Hmm... I shouldn't have brought it up.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup, you don't need to. You can go back to your room.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I need to know.

I held my locket close. My hand gripped 
tightly around it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
........

Did that man kill them?

Did he kill his family?
The room grew silent.

I faced the husband. 

A man that I had apparently played with as 
a child.

And I asked him something that it felt like only he
could tell me.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Did the father kill his family...? I cannot say I'll
ever really know, but...

I gripped the locket tighter and instinctively 
squeezed my eyes shut.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: But as for what I think happened... for what I believe.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
...

I do not believe he did.

I do not believe he ever could.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
The idea, from what I knew of the family even as a
child, is preposterous to me.

It's why I'm okay with living in this house.
My eyes trailed down towards the locket.
It was glowing again.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup, is that...?
It was pointing towards the wall.
So I got up and sprinted over to it.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: W- What are you...?
I sprinted up to the wall.
I felt across wall, tapping and hitting parts of it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is there something beyond it?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: What are you doing?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I- I can explain?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup! Stop it!

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Young lady, step away from the wall!

Is she having some conniption or something?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: In your hand... is that...?
I looked down at the locket again.
The heirloom.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There.

I placed my hand on one of the bricks in the 
wall. The light of the locket was pointing at it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Almost like... it remembers?)

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: YOUNG LADY. STEP AWAY FROM THE WALL.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There!

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: What in the Goddess's realm is that...?!

The wall started moving, revealing a 
secret passage.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup... did you know that was there?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Were you looking for this?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I have... no idea.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But... I think this is it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This is where I'll find answers.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This is the-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh? It got jammed?

The mechanism to move the wall struggled, with 
audible gearing trying and failing to slide it open.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No!

It wasn't open enough for any of us to 
simply slide through.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is okay. We can fix it. But we need to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: NO!!!
My mind didn't want to accept it.

I pounded on the wall, trying to loosen it and get it
to move again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're not that thick of a wall! Just... start...
moving!

My desperation pushed away Kara, who had tried 
come closer so she could calmly lead me away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup, calm down! Just-

The light from the locket shined brighter, 
and started to appear as though it swirled 
around me.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Wait, is that a spell? Wind magic?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?! Doesn't that look like spellcasting?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Everyone back!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dammit!
I cocked my fist by instinct and frustration.

The swirling light gathered around my fist like a
swirling wind was forming.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: JUST... LET... ME... THROUGH!!!

My body flew threw the air surrounded by cobble 
broken from the wall.

Whatever balance I had was lost, and I quickly 
found myself upside down.

Upside down and looking back at the hole I just fell
through.

And hearing the muffled yells of a trusted ally now
mirrored in my view.
A view obstructed by the closing wall behind me.

A view that turned to black, as my head hit the 
stairs below.
A view that turned to nothing.

The clanking of a metallic footstep entered 
the town.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: They were tracked along this path.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: And they're still here?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Well, our deployment got here as fast as we could.

Hard to believe they'd get beyond here. But...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Right, if not here, then we know where to go next.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Surround the town.

If that princess is dumb enough to be here now...

We will end her. Permanently.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Gasp*...!
The air filled my lungs in a desperate fervor.

I jumped myself off the ground and to my knees 
with a jolt, stumbling a little before I caught 
myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Pant*... *pant*... I need to... 

Wait... I'm alive... unharmed...?

My panicked state from before persisted, and I 
found my eyes jumping about the room.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's... quiet. Safe... maybe?

Pushing myself over into a sitting position, I was 
able to calm myself enough to check on myself 
and my surroundings.

I could see the stairwell I tumbled down. 
The descent looked deadly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (But I'm not injured, am I?)

As I had the thought, I finally started to loosen my
grip on the locket.

Getting to my feet, it had a faint compass like glow
once more.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Thank you.

I turned around and saw the stone room 
around me.
It lead out into...
...an unfinished dirt corridor.
An eerily familiar one.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It's almost like this place was abandoned mid
construction?)

(An expansion to the place or renovation or 
something?)

...

I stepped further into it and looked down 
the tunnels.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Familiar.

...

I've seen this place before.

As I said as much, the locket's light pivoted towards
one of the dirt corridor's directions.
I stared down at tunnel with next to no light in it.
All I would have is the light from the locket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Okay.
So I stepped forward... into the dark.

Stumbling through the dim light, I made my way 
through the excavated halls and half finished 
stone rooms.

Most of the time, I only had my locket's light to 
guide me.

But on occasion, I was able to take a peek at my
surroundings via mystical looking fires dimly 
lighting the place.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Like they just left it and sealed the place up
after... what happened.)

But even so, the more corners I passed, the more
familiar it felt.

Not enough to know where I was or to
avoid getting lost.
But, enough to...
Out of the corner of my eye...

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: C'mon!
I blinked.

Whatever I had seen had started to run around the
corner, but was now gone.

I looked down to my locket to see what direction it
pointed in.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The same way...
So I stepped around the corner myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This is it.)

(The Vault proper.)
My hand settled on the metal door.

It was worn and broken. All I needed to do was 
push it open.
Looking down at the locket, it pointed within.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This is where you were leading me to...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text: Ha... hahaha...

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: M- Mom!!!
I opened the door.
To meet a scene I knew.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text:
These stupid children...

See what you've let them cause?
A shadow of a man towered over her.

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Argh...!
...with a hand around her neck.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: Let go of her!!!

Nikolai sat limp on the ground, glints of blood 
amongst the flickering light.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: M- Mom...?

And I stood there in shock, departed from 
my world.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text: Ah... another one.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: A- Anton...?!

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text:
What else would one expect, I suppose, from an
Emeraldian bitch and her blighted offspring?

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text:
A- Anton... Run!

Sweetie, just... RUN...!

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text:
Better to purge you all from any divine grace 
afforded to you.
His other hand gripped at my mother's neck.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text: Just one more dead by your failings.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: NOOOOOOO!!!!!!!
I ran.
Forward.
I charged towards the scene with no plan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...?

I opened my eyes and the dream like state was 
banished.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ow...
My head and shoulder throbbed with pain.

Looking up, it looked at though I had ran into a 
stone altar in the middle of the room.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Was that... part of the dream, too?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Plus... this...

Turning my head over, I saw something strange in 
my hand.
I tightly gripped a potsherd.

The sensation of the sharp edges digging into my 
hand took hold, and I dropped it to the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh... Why was I holding that...?

Through the whirlwind of it all, I managed to calm 
down some.
Readying myself to move...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Inhale*...

*Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

......

.........

That wasn't... That wasn't Dad.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How did I even get here...?)
I stumbled along in the dark.
The locket no longer shone any light.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Of the times I'd appreciate Aegis's help...)

One hand of mine sat on the wall as I tried to feel 
my way through the darker parts of the corridors.
The other hand was wrapped in a bandage.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(I still remember it clearly enough. That... That
couldn't have been my father.)
I was distracted by the memory I just relived.

I couldn't remember the face of whoever it 
was that did it.

But I could remember the smirk on his face 
when he did it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: When he... when he...

It was the best I could do to stop myself from
thinking about the rest of the memory.

That bastardly grin. That evil smile deserving of
revenge.

I was able to calm myself some with deep breaths 
as I rounded a corner.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (...a light?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And its moving about like...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (A shadow! Maybe that's Charlotte and them?)

I stepped forward, hurrying along to the
nearby room.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Kara! Charlotte! And-
The figure turned to me.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Hey... aren't you...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shit.

WARNING: the following map will take a little bit 
longer to load than usual.
STAGE DIRECTION> PRE SETUP SCREEN, PLAY SETUP MUSIC

STAGE DIRECTION> BATTLE ARENA IS A SET OF TUNNELS AND
ROOMS, WITH ESCAPING BEING THE MAIN GOAL, AND A BIG
ENEMY DEFENDING THE EXIT POINT (NORA)
STAGE DIRECTION> MAP IS TINTED FOR NIGHT

STAGE DIRECTION> CHARLOTTE, KARA, ROWAN, AND PUP
REQUIRED

STAGE DIRECTION> SET ALLIES UP WITHOUT DISTINCT
POSITIONS, THEY'LL BE REMOVED AT THE START OF BATTLE
AND SPECIFIC ROOMS THAT, WHEN ENTERING, THEY WILL
REJOIN THE PARTY. YOU START WITH PUP AND ROWAN IN ONE
ROOM, AND KARA AND CHARLOTTE IN ANOTHER.

STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALLIES FOR START OF BATTLE AND
SET PUP/CHARLOTTE/KARA, AND THE LOGIC FLAGS NEEDED FOR
IF THE OTHERS ARE SELECTED

STAGE DIRECTION> FOR BATTLE, PLAY BGM YF-BATTLE-
CONFLICT
STAGE DIRECTION> FOCUS CAMERA ON KARA AND CHARLOTTE

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Where did Pup go?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Do try to keep your wits about you.

With the troops about, we must be vigilant.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
To think they would barge in here after us... Argh...

And where did HE go, too?

STAGE DIRECTION> MOVE CAMERA TO PUP LOCATION, ROWAN NOT
THERE YET BUT A SOLDIER BEING THERE

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Yeah, it's one of those mercs!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
An Imperial soldier?!

(Speak of catching me off guard!)

The soldier, weapon already the ready, planted their
foot to strike.
STAGE DIRECTION> ROWAN ENTERS TO HIS LOCATION
STAGE DIRECTION> FIRE ANIMATION ON SOLDIER, THEY DIE

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: ARGH!!!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I am here to save the day~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you doing here?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
More appropriate to ask why are there Imperial troops
here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Or why YOU are down here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... it's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Complicated, yes.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
At this time, there are better enemies to best than
those questions, I'd think.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hah... Fair.
I grabbed the hilt of my sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing's gonna stop me from helping with my blade.

STAGE DIRECTION> SHOW MAP OBJECTIVES (DEFEAT ENEMY
BOSS)

### Player enters final room with Nora for first time
######

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
There they are...

No mercy for that coward traitor of a princess.

If I must, I'll end her threat to my home myself.
###### Maid even 1a (Talk) - Closest to Pup) ######

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
D- Don't hurt me! Don't steal from me! They forced us
in here!

I don't know where we are! Go harass that weird maids
instead! 
Sniff
...
###### Maid even 1b (Steal) ######

STAGE DIRECTION> GET MONEY, SHOW MESSAGE SAYING YOU GOT
IT

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
Hm...? I thought I grabbed more from those guys when I
pickpocketed them...?

Oh, uh, hello! Please don't hurt me!
###### Maid even 2a (Talk) ######

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
You! Are you one of them!? Fighting and stealing, you
lot! Let me give you a piece of my mind!

Oh, you aren't? Are you SURE? First we have that weird
maid show up, then the Imperial troops...
###### Maid even 2b (Steal) ######
STAGE DIRECTION> ACQUIRE SOMETHING

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
Hm... 
Glares intently
...

At the mess
... This place could use a cleaning...

Sigh
...
###### Maid even 3a (Talk) ######

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
Hey. What's up?

Yeah, no worries from me. I'm used to being stolen
from.

You're not gonna steal from me? Well at least you're
better than that weird maid.
###### Maid even 3b (Steal) ######
STAGE DIRECTION> ACQUIRE SOMETHING

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text: Could've just asked for it.
###### Maid even 4a (Talk) - MACY ######

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Hm? Oh, greetings. Are you the master of this abode? I
can start cleaning soon.

No? Why am I here you ask? I would be delighted to
answer. I am here due to the group of maids I work as a
part of being pushed here by troops.

What is wrong with my voice? I do not think anything is
strange with my voice, but I will correct it as soon as
I am able.

I will attend to that as soon as I finish cleaning this
area. Thank you dear masters and mistresses.
###### Maid even 4b (Steal) - MACY ######

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Hm~mm~hm~mm~

Welcome. I'll be right there. First I must finish
dusting this area.

STAGE DIRECTION> ACQUIRE "MAID CHIP" (JUST A MESSAGE,
NOT A REAL ITEM)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Hm?
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY RECRUITMENT MUSIC

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: H- Hey?! Why do you have that?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, what is this?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
It's a chip that I need to keep being an effective maid
and-!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Wait... why was I being a maid...? Last I remember I
was fighting... Elaine?

...Where am I?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Uh... Crekskia?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Oh Crekskia! That's...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What is Crek-shika?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Are you okay? What this... strange item doing something
to you?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I think I'm okay now. Just made me compulsive want to
act like a maid for a while...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I don't think I did anything too bad before you got it
off, like-

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: ...sign a contract.
Macy took out a perfectly maintained piece of paper.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hm? A contract?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A "Notice of Debt"... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I'm starting to remember signing this now... I'm
screwed now if I don't re-equip that chip and be a
super-maid again...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? Why?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
According to the paper, debt incurred at a restaurant
and inn.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
What am I supposed to do when I wake up buck naked in
the middle of a snowy field?

I found an inn that offered me a good meal and a
night's stay...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Next thing I know I have a contract shoved in my face!
One that would multiply my debt by 1000 if broken!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Between debt and my maid mind... of course I didn't
think twice before signing it...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's not a thing.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What? I think I misheard you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indentured Servitude Contracts like this have been
illegal since the Covenant became the dominant cultural
power.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Cove-what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Goods that can't be reclaimed - like food or housing -
are goods a merchant needs to get payment for upfront.

Real merchants want to get paid, not life debt people.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
This Imperial seal on the contract looks shoddily
forged, too.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Meaning I never needed to spend the last couple months
as a maid...

...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Well, I guess I'm happy I got skilled with these
knives~

Macy grabbed back the contract and ripped it up with a
vigor.

Then she grabbed the electronic looking chip and
stomped it beneath her heel.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: That jerk is gonna regret having me learn knifework...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If this guy did this to other people, then he's on my
shitlist, too.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Wait, but now I don't have food or a place to sleep...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: I guess I do have clothes now.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: A maid outfit...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Are you guys hiring, maybe?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I- Uh... Well, I guess we can always use more help?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Thank God I met you all!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You mean "the Goddess", no?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
"Goddess" what now?

...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
You know what, forget I asked. This hurts my head to
think about.
STAGE DIRECTION> MACY JOINED PARTY MEMBER AND JINGLE
STAGE DIRECTION> RETURN TO NORMAL MAP MUSIC
#### Pup x Kara #####

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Ah, you are alive.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That is encouraging.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not gonna fall here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not then, and not now.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: "Then"...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah... it's unimportant. Especially in the middle of a
fight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But it's good to see you, Kara. Thank you for what
you've done today.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...Of course.
#### Pup x Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm gonna have you executed, Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's good to see you, too, princess.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Sigh
... No more running off, yeah?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll try.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Isn't that comforting, haha...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe I'll have to dock your pay next time?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey... Don't go that far...
#### Pup x Satia #####

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup!

Satia ran up to me and quickly wrapped me in a tight
hug.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Satia?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you doing?

I blurted out the words and Satia nuzzled against me in
a happy bliss.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Quiet. I earned this. You earned this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's good to see you, Satia. I'm happy you're safe.

I hugged her back quickly, and soon enough we swiveled
to face any incoming enemy... back to back.
#### Pup x Norde #####

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Did you find what you needed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmm... Maybe. It may be a matter of time to really know
though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... think so, at least. Or am nearly there.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Now, shall we take down these Imperials?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I'm up for that.
#### Rowan x Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?! Why are you here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Et tu, dear Charlotte?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You should ask that question of the troops.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I know the answer to that already. They're trying to
kill me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A fair answer...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then shall I protect you, my dear friend?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We'll see if you can.

Maybe I'll protect you?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I look forward to being in your debt~
#### Mariel x Satia #####

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Satia! Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Yes, dear. I am in good condition.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
One ready to rid us of this threat to you, your sister,
Pup, and...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: And to you!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'll do my best to keep you safe, as well.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Sweet as that is, they are after you and others. I am
but a wall in their road to that.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: And a beautiful and valuable wall at that!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I'm not afraid of these people not anymore. Not with
you all around.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Giggle
... Very well, shall we fight them together,
then?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah!
#### Jude x Otis #####

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: You were awoken as well?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Gah, yeah. That hollering bard screaming up and down
the village.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Ah... same.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
But ya actually came? Didn't think ya would fight your
ol' crew.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: It is... awkward.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Some of them still owe me a debt, too...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heheh~

Maybe some lootin' will make ya lot even, then?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: That's... maybe a bit much.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I'm not that sort of mercenary.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ah, more loot for me, then. Maybe I'll buy ya somethin'
tasty?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: ...I wouldn't say "no" to that.
#### Jakson x Atticus #####

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: This place... Yes, this is a vault.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Whimper
...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
There, boy.

Well get your owner out of her safely.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: Appreciative bark

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Though you still look nervous...

Perhaps you can sense that this place was important to
the Pup child...?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: Determined bark
#### Elliot x Tatiana #####

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Eh, what a place for the Covenant to build. This is a
Vault?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Technically.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
This place appears unfinished, though?

Perhaps they were building out a maze as a protective
measure...? It is safer than a straight tunnel to the
Vault.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What a damn waste.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The Covenant takes the protection of Oathbreakers
seriously.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmph. Clearly didn't work here.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I... suppose not.
#### Castel x Reagyn #####

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Intriguing... An entire labyrinth... just to protect an
Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Should you be focusing on that at this time? We've
hostiles about.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, such is true. But one cannot take my curiosity. I
would not be me.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Do you not see these tunnels and rooms and have a rush
of wonder for its nature? It's purpose?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Not particularly.

We're not here to gawk. We're here to do a job.

If we're not trying to work towards saving my homeland,
it is not worth what time and resources I have.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, but that is the key. To understand is to be able to
achieve your goals more effectively.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
See those wooden structures supporting the tunnel? What
if we were to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What if the enemy was to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: That is... true.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Then I'll leave such observations to you.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Of course.
#### Flynn x Kara #####

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: This place is so dark and dank...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Be strong, friend. They are as blinded as we are.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Lady Kara...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I understand, but... they're organized. We just woke
up.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
They're also coming off a lengthy chase. They are tired
and we are rested.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Do no fret. They do not have the advantage. We do.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank you, Lady Kara. As usual, you know just what to
say.
#### Nora v Pup #####

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You don't even understand where you are, do you?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What are you rambling on about?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Listen clearly with those ears of yours.

This is not a place you are welcome. You've no right to
step foot in here.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: As if I care. I fight for my home.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And today, I fight for one of mine.
#### Nora v Jude #####

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Tsk... you.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Nora.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
How can you stand there? Acting as though you aren't a
traitor?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Traitor to who? The Empire?

Or to your own personal objectives?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
The Empire should pay their bills more promptly.

And you're just one of many amongst the Imperials that
owe me a good meal.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Sigh
... Not that I'll have a chance to cash out those
favors.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Quiet. You chose your side. This ends now.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Stronger women than you have tried.
#### Nora v Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph. Welcome to Crekskia, fox.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I see Princess A has picked up more than just
oppression from her vile parents.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You don't get to talk about my parents.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: If their sins are too much for you to burden...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...I'll relieve you of them!
#### Nora v Mariel #####

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The younger "princess", is it?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: How... How could you do this?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
The amount of people who have died... Lockhart...
Cartenan...

You're just spreading death and destruction everywhere.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The war is not mine to fight. I fight for Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
What?! But you're the one who brought war against our
home!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You know nothing of Lockhart.

I will fight for her future.

Threats to that future must be removed.
#### Nora v any other allies (first time) #####

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You lot... I am tired of you blocking my path...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Out of my way!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Ugh...! This...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'm not letting you get away AGAIN.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'll have to fall back...
STAGE DIRECTION> CONTINUE BATTLE MUSIC
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

The enemy was pushed back by our blades, and scattered
amongst the ruin.

Of those that could muster a retreat, they headed back
up the stairway to escape outside.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Fall back!
STAGE DIRECTION> FIGHT CLASH SE, WAIT 15 FRAMES (X3)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C

STAGE DIRECTION> DESTRUCTIVE RUMBLE SE, SHAKE SCREEN AT
SAME TIME
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 30 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING OUTSIDE SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Time it.

Nora and a few other Imperial troops and mercenaries
jettisoned out into the village.

Turning their heels back towards the house, they were
not retreating.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: They should still be in position, right?

One of the soldiers was clearly distracted, looking
around wildly to the surrounding area.
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING OUTSIDE SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Stop there, you piece of...!

Charlotte and Kara arrived. The former like a boar
ready to charge, and the latter calm and collected.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Surrender.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What?! After all she's done?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I understand. Trust me.
She turned back to Nora.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Surrender. We can negotiate for your safety.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

The groups stood at a standstill. Each with weapons
ready to move on their foe.
STAGE DIRECTION> .........

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Heh.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: NOW!!!
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF

The scream rang out into the trees and other houses of
the village.
Sending down...!
STAGE DIRECTION> ........
Nothing.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Idiots! Get out here!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'm not sure...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: There should be an ambush, based on her words.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A- Ambush?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Idiots! Get out here!
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: You mean this ambush?
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE NOCTURNAL BLOOM
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text: Argh...!
A tied up soldier fell to the ground.

The villager had entered from the edges of the area and
the darkness.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Or this one?

Suddenly, a variety of villagers and Nightless Crows
exited from the same darkness, each showing a soldier
or mercenary they had subdued.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Others came to help?
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING IN SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: There... There you all are!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ever am I glad I asked that Crows to spread the word of
this lot before I headed in.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Thank ya, prince. And the Nightless Crows that helped.

We're not about to let some rogue army regiment attack
our friends and families.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: R- Rogue...?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is the least I can do.

My last visit here was such a pleasure that it'd be a
shame to not see my people flourish.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you, Alexei. I'm so happy I could kiss you.
Charlotte cocked back the hammer on her gun.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It would be my pleasure.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It damn well will.
She lowered the gun to target Nora directly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I will say it again. Surrender.

This time with the utmost sincerity. After all, there
is no need to test if you have backup plans anymore.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Is that what that was?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We can indeed negotiate for your safety.

And...
Kara looked over Nora's face.
From her armor to her fox-like ears.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You are from Lockhart, I presume?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...Yes.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Fantastic. Then there is a matter of negotiation I
imagine would be prudent for you to engage in. (s1
neutral On the matter of your family.

Nora released her grip and her weapon fell to the
ground.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

Nora and the other troops were secured and looked over
by the Nightless Crows.
As Kara spoke to Nora, Charlotte stepped over to Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Is it time for my kiss?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I hope she'll give up info easily. Not sure I want to
drag her along with us.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Spurned once more...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Given how much she wants to kill me, it's probably
gonna be a pain...

...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, where's Pup?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm? Were they not with you by the end of the fight?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, I hope they're not doing something reckless again.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE
UNKNOWNWORLDS_HARP_LOOP
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031C
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 80 FRAMES
My feet stopped before a grave.
And my eyes tilted down to the locket.
I watched as the light faded.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One last stop...?

Lifting it up, I donned the locket around my neck, and
secured it safely under my shirt.

With a few more steps, I was in front of the grave
proper.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Here lies those... taken too early by the Goddess."

There was one grave with three names on it, and this
location split off from the main graveyard behind me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
"Estella Baranov."

"Nikolai Baranov."

.........

"Anton Baranov."
My eyes lingered on that the final one.

And as they did, I slowly sat myself before the three
names.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Exhale
...
Slowly, I let myself breathe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I suppose it's natural.

The "entire family was killed"... That was the story,
wasn't it?
In.
Out.

My mind calmed as I continued to try to find the words
to say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Nikolai...

...

Thank you. For protecting me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know... I can't remember what happened in the end.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But if I am here... and you... aren't...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you. For being my big brother.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
As for you, my mother...

...

Mom... I'm sorry. I'm sorry for forgetting.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And...
I tried to find words. Something to say.
Something to remember.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (All I could remember was...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Mom.

Can I... tell you a story, maybe?

A story to both of you, maybe... about a wannabe hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A silly boy chasing after the shadow of a true hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It all started...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... when would it start...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It all started when the wannabe hero and their father
joined a mercenary group...

As this wannabe hero was told of how those days
happened... the two showed up and were welcomed with
open arms...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And that's when "Bored" made the wannabe hero run
laps...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...around the capital city of the Republic!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It was... a tournament I think? In one of the
Republic's ports.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The hero expected them to come back with spoils of
victory, but Satia just-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Or, er, "Matia" just came back with a dress of all
things.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It was for her, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
... I didn't hear the end of that crusade for a
week...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I think you two would've liked them.
### if mariel alive

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte, Mariel, Rowan, Kara...
#### If not

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte, Rowan, Kara...
STAGE DIRECTION> #######

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: All these people we've met are... amazing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Always pushing forward. Always with a card up their
sleeve. Able to lift us up...

They make me want to be better.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: To not drag them down... with whatever my failures are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I wish you two got to meet them, too.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And then... when we...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...when... we...

Yawn
...

...when we saw... the mountain...

.........
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
The words spun their fabric of a tale.
A lullaby that spanned time beyond my awareness.
It was only a matter of time before sleep took me.

A sleep that, despite where I was, was like a cocoon of
comfort.
Like a weight had been lifted off my shoulders.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> CHANGE PUP TO STAGE 4 ART VERSIONS
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 210 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

Flickering sunlight streamed through the forested
canopy.
It hit my eyes and my grogginess was forced aside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mmm...

Sitting up from my sleeping position, I could feel a
new weight on my shoulders.
Or, perhaps, a new weight on my chest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...

My gambeson was big enough on me now that it slipped
off my shoulders as I moved.

Though, the tightness of my clothes otherwise, belts
and shirt included, stopped it from falling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course.

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha... hahaha...

I flopped back down onto my back and let the morning
sun pelt me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course it happened... one... more... time...

"Here lies Anton Baranov"

........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not much left to lose now, I think.

For all my efforts. For all my struggles. For all my
attempts to embrace it.
My "weakness" was my "weakness".
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
And maybe there was nothing I could do about it.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What do you think? Mom? Nikolai?

Do I at least make a half decent girl?

Hahaha!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What am I doing?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What even can I do?

...

Maybe that's the lesson.

You are who you are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And every second I spend trying to figure it out is
just another step down the same paths as before.

I slowly rose to my feet, and tried to get used to the
new shift in my center of gravity as I did.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... Yeah, this is workable, I think.

I padded down my outfit, clearing away the underbrush
from my clothes and longer hair.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mom, Nikolai... I'll visit again.

As I said the words, the rustle of distant sounds
drifted towards me.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...isn't... there...?
### If reagyn is recruited and alive

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ...think... over...
### if not

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...think... over...
STAGE DIRECTION> ###########

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...most... likely...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'll try to not take as long this time to visit
again... but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I do have a story to finish.
I bowed slightly to the grave.
And turned towards my comrades-in-arms.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 200 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> CHAPTER ELEVEN END
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 200 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> CAMP MENU IS COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(MORNING) AND WONDER5 FOR MUSIC

After spending the morning training up our advance
unit, we arrived on scene.

As we did, we found the Fort approach to be a
combination of the plains and hills we had seen so 
far.

The mines weren't readily apparent, but we could 
see a scattering of beasts and remnant soldiers.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(They're still probably around from previous fights in
the area...)

Hmm...
I turned to our group.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're as prepared as we can get for this. Be ready. 
Be vigilant.
The group I had assembled nodded back.
And that included...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know... I said it before, but you don't need to
stick your neck out for this task.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is... a dangerous affair.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
And one that is important to pick the right 
personnel for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Yeah, sis. We have Lockhart to save, right?

I get why you may feel the urge to now, but... 
You don't need to take this risk.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Thank you, Mariel. You know me so well, but... 
that also means you'll get why I need to say this.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I agree with Kara.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I am the most experienced person here with 
bleeding edge technology. These landmines are 
something I've seen before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're not... wrong.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And... what would it make me if I was equipped to 
help and decided to throw the task onto someone 
else for the sake of my safety?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm happy you all understand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I'll... try to keep an eye on if her needing sleep
puts her at risk...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What's that feel-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (An earthquake...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, there's no volcano this time... I think...)

I looked around at the others, and no one seemed
perturbed by it enough to retreat.
Not yet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Again.

(Maybe we should retreat...?)
I turned to Charlotte.
She was stone-faced. She was determined.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We've come too far to stop now...)
So I turned forward again.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Another rumble.

Watcha think it was?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
I swear to the Godess if there's another one 
of those exploding mountains...
Both were fixated out towards the battlefield.
Behind the two...

...were a couple of the captive Imperial soldiers and
hired mercenaries that had been interrogated.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
I sure hope not. I can't imagine the Goddess would be
that-

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Huh?!

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Ugh!
And the two fell to the ground.

lines.speaker: Mercenary
lines.text: Finally... they shut the fuck up.
He started messing with his bindings...

lines.speaker: Imperial
lines.text:
I think I know where they were holdin' the rest of 
us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...? I can... feel that...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Maybe... we really should step back...)

lines.speaker: Mercenary
lines.text: There you go.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Mercenary
lines.text:
So, should we head over to the Imperial base?

I'm pretty sure there is at least one makeshift one 
in the town up north.

That... or we could go home to Lockhart and 
regroup.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I won't let that woman drag Lockhart back into 
that hellish night.
#### Mariel x Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm okay, Mariel.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: D- Don't look at me like that... I said I was fine...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: F- Fine...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'll be even more careful than I was planning to.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But you have to do that, too, sis!
#### Pup x Jakson #####

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Investigative sniff
...
Jakson was helping sniff out mines.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're such a good dog~
I was close by, guiding him.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
...

Investigative sniff
...?
...and before I knew it, he was sniffing me instead.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Huh...?

Is something wrong?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Curious whine
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... don't smell like a mine, do I...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or do I smell like... a woman...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Satisfied bark
~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...what to even make of that?
#### Satia x Rowan #####

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I hear you gave Pup a pep talk.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap it not be the right phrase for it...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: But yes, I tried to encourage her.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you for it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: But... "her"?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Are you not realizing you're saying that?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Calling Pup "her".

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I have...? I guess I did.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well, do just keep an eye on Pup. She may not enjoy it,
but I can't say either way yet.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Indeed. She may not know either.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you.
#### Otis x Norde #####

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So how about you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What about me?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The pup and me ain't the only ones who got hit by the
curse here.

You're subject numero tres.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So, ya got questions?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The pup also isn't the only one I'm an elder to, ya
know?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
You've clearly been around the part, but I've got a
couple decades at least on ya.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya know I am just trying to help.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No. I do have questions.

Just not now. Not here.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: What a mature, measured response ya got.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Sigh
... Borin'
#### Jude x Reagyn #####

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Hmm...

So... that mercenary learned how to disarm them in...
the crusades...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Don't.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Don't think of going to the crusades yourself.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Who are you to tell me that?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Someone from the other side of that graveyard.

No matter what your Covenant tells you, there is no
honor to be won there.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Only what might deteriorate your humanity.
Reagyn stumbled for the second, but soon enough...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I was only offering idling thoughts.

I do not need the opinions of a man from the Emerald
Empire.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: As you say, ma'am.
#### Atticus x Kara #####

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
You seem quite knowledgable despite being so far from
Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can give full credit to the Queen's willingness to
let me travel.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Is that so? I assume it was limited to political
missions?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Largely, though there were a few occasions I had free
time.

I'd be happy to give your recommendations on
restaurants if you ever are planning a vacation.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I'd appreciate that.
#### Tatiana x Castel #####

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Why was I picked for the minefield mission?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Why was I picked for the minefield mission?
They said at the same time.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You too?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: So it seems...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Well, let's at least make sure they don't regret
picking us.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Or... we could let them focus on the mines?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I though ya were supposed to be smart?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I am not equipped to disarm a mine while being attacked
by enemies...!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Then I'll watch your back.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Oh... thank you...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Wait, no, that's not the problem...!
#### Flynn x Elliot #####

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I wonder... if I target my bow just right...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Please don't try it.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
You're right. One wrong move and I could activate a
different one.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: You... listened...?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Good advice comes from good sources.

lines.speaker: Heyzus
lines.text:
So, based on my experience in the crusades... 

Farmland mines are often not very kind to 
farm crops.

Red crops tend to be long lived. Meaning no
mines probably have gone off around them any
time lately.
...that means the mines are probably still there
around them. Red means unsafe.

Blue crops are shorter lived, so there's at least
a better chance the mines are already gone from
where you see them.
Don't go gettin' blown up, ya lot.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm okay, Mariel.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: D- Don't look at me like that... I said I was fine...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: F- Fine...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'll be even more careful than I was planning
to be.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But you have to do that, too, sis!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Investigative sniff*...
Jakson was helping sniff out mines.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're such a good dog~
I was close by, guiding him.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
...

*Investigative sniff*...?
...and before I knew it, he was sniffing me instead.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Huh...?

Is something wrong?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Curious whine*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... don't smell like a mine, do I...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or do I smell like... a woman...?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Satisfied bark* ~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...what to even make of that?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I hear you gave Pup a pep talk.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap it not be the right phrase for it...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: But yes, I tried to encourage her.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you for it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: But... "her"?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Are you not realizing you're saying that?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Calling Pup "her".

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I have...? I guess I did.

My apologies.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well, do just keep an eye on Pup. They may not 
enjoy it, but I can't say either way yet.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed. She may not know either.

Or... they may not know.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So how about you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What about me?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The pup and me ain't the only ones who got hit by 
the curse here.

You're subject numero tres.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So, ya got questions?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The pup also isn't the only one I'm an elder to, ya
know?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
You've clearly been around the park a few times,
but I've got a couple decades on ya, at least.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya know I am just trying to help.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No. I do have questions.

Just not now. Not here.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: What a mature, measured response ya got.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: *Sigh*... Borin'

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Hmm...

So... that mercenary learned how to disarm them 
in... the crusades...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Don't.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Don't think of going to the crusades yourself.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Who are you to tell me that?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Someone from the other side of that graveyard.

No matter what your Covenant tells you, there is 
no honor to be won there.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Only what might deteriorate your humanity.
Reagyn stumbled for the second, but soon enough...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I was only offering idling thoughts.

I do not need the opinions of a man from the 
Emerald Empire.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: As you say, ma'am.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
You seem quite knowledgable despite being so far 
from Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can give full credit to the Queen's willingness to
let me travel.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Is that so? I assume it was limited to political
missions?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Largely, though there were a few occasions I had 
free time.

I'd be happy to give your recommendations on
restaurants if you ever are planning a vacation.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I'd appreciate that.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Why was I picked for the minefield mission?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Why was I picked for the minefield mission?
They said at the same time.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You too?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: So it seems...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Well, let's at least make sure they don't regret
picking us.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Or... we could let them focus on the mines?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I though ya were supposed to be smart?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I am not equipped to disarm a mine while being attacked
by enemies...!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Then I'll watch your back.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Oh... thank you...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Wait, no, that's not the problem...!

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I wonder... if I target my bow just right...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Please don't try it.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
You're right. One wrong move and I could activate 
a different one.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: You... listened...?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Good advice comes from good sources.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Mm...

Nora sat on a rudimentary chair with her hands 
and feet securely bound.

The hot light of a magical lamp shone down onto
her, creating the main light source in the room.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Name, homeland, occupation.
Norde sat across from her.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
.........

Nora Nicollet. Lockhart. Mercenary.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mercenary for the Empire.
Charlotte stepped into the edges of the light.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Mercenary for liberating Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Because Imperials are the epitome of freedom and
liberty.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: They've done it before.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yes, from the Emerald Empire.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The same can be said for most of the continent.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Lockhart, included.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What we need to know...

...is what the Empire is planning.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We can wait.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
...

I'm not an Imperial.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Heh. So they didn't trust her enough to tell her.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I won't betray Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Too late.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
.........

For which of us is it too late, Princess?

The two stared at each other, daggers pointed at 
each others' souls.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The question we want answered isn't-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What did they offer you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Stewart, we don't need to engage in-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's fine. I'm used to her random jabs at this point.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That's not...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So... what was the price of selling out Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You mean, "what was the price of the traitors' 
heads?"

The price of the cretins who stomp all over an 
entire city to line their pockets with gold?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Stop. We aren't trying to-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Who are you to try and speak for the people of 
Lockhart after you brought war to its streets?!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
What do you think those streets are paved with?

It's the blood, sweat, and tears of everyone BUT 
you.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You've never seen a friend go to work one day and 
not return, have you?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What...?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
An "accident".

At the docks. The factory. The proving grounds.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Swept aside, and the next desperate soul steps up 
to fill their place.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What? 

No, I've seen those reports and those 
numbers were down.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Listen to the words coming out of your mouth.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You don't see us as people, do you?

Who do you think are desperate enough to take 
those jobs?

The nekolyn, caizlyn, einlyn...
Nora turned to Norde.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Taikolyn and plenty of mixed, too.
Norde sat in their calm and did not take the bait.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I was lucky enough to work my way into a 
mercenary core.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Yet still I'm forced to watch family - siblings - be at
their mercy.

The mercy of your vile parents.

At your mercy.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Raargh!

Charlotte turned on her heel and disappeared into 
the shadows.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Good riddance.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...they're taking a long time.

Are they...?

Charlotte burst out of the tent, and she strutted
angrily past those standing outside.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: ...? Charlotte?

Mariel broke into a trot as she tried to catch up to
Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Did it go... poorly?
Charlotte stopped.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I heard bits and pieces.

"Lockhart"... "Parents"...

..."Nekolyn"...

Mariel opened her mouth to continue, but she 
struggled to say the next words.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Sis, you know I think you're the best person 
to lead Lockhart.

I would never try to...

Mariel trailed off, and the two stood there in silence
for several seconds.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Mariel, I love you.

I don't deserve...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I love you, too.

Mariel started to take a step forward to hug 
Charlotte, but Charlotte turned a step away.

And Charlotte's shoulders pitched up and down as 
she tried to control her breathing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Inhale*...

And Charlotte's shoulders pitched up and down as 
she tried to control her breathing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Mariel... Mom... Dad...

I love you. I do.

She breathed out, and her hand jittered as she 
resisted tightening it into a fist.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Exhale*...

She took a breath once more, and a few more of 
those seemed to settle her heart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We will save Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No matter who we need to save it from.

Our group had managed to subdue the forward 
attack team sent by the pursuing imperial force.

Nora, the mercenary leading it, was now in our 
custody.

She was not alone. We kept a handful of the 
enemies as prisoners for the sake of extracting 
info on the Empire's plans.

Actions like attacking the Kingdom of Cartenan or
stealing Oathbreakers from Vaults were still
unexplained.

We dragged along the prisoners that seemed to 
have a better chance of having answers.

And the others were left by to be handled by the
village of Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
From what they told us, the other troops were 
stripped of their military gear and sent home with a 
sack of supplies.

We Nightless Crows headed south as we continued 
on our journey towards the Republic of Rabaneau.

If the main force of Imperial troops was still 
chasing us, we had days of time on them.
So we continued to seek out allies for Lockhart.

Without the Kingdom, the Republic was the best
alternative.

A hesitance was born from the Republic being the
Empire's actual enemy in this war.

They had a vested interest. 

But it was also far from an impartial one.
Asking their help would come with a cost.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Lockhart will not be some vassal state to a waring
nation that wants a trade port.
Our journey was not at its end.
But...
The mountains of Nolvanus were a distant memory.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ugh...

Charlotte let out a tired moan to the tempo of the
convoy's step.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Are you feeling well? You've not come down with 
an illness, have you?

Kara leaned a bit from her horse, as though trying 
to get a closer look at Charlotte over on her horse.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah. Just... tired.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The interrogation?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Mayhap it be sleeping in the same camp as people 
who wish to kill you?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Maybe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or... what we've all just been through...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Yawn*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...we've all just been through a lot lately.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I would say other events explain your own tiredness.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Maybe.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You've sharpened your intuitions, Alexei. It is a
pleasure to see you blossom so.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I thank you, dear Kara.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Though I do sincerely wish I could flex those 
muscles in happier times.

As the words came out, it resonated with 
many of us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Well, it's not like we're in a bad situation.)

(We've got a straight shot to the Republic, and 
we've got prisoners to extract info from.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Then again...)
I turned my head to the other three's horses.

Each of their gazes were turned away from one 
another in a blend of anxiety and thoughtful 
trances.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We haven't really... done much.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(How much closer are we to actually helping 
Lockhart since we left?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We've questions. And more questions. And...)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What a voluptuous look upon our dear Pup's face?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One of those words don't fit.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I simply mean to suggest that you've more notable
reasons that would disturb your sleep recently.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: How have you adapted to not sleeping on your front?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I didn't do that before anyways...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I had been meaning to ask.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You've been more somber since we left Crekskia.

How are you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm... fine.

I'm me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Whatever that is, at the end of the day, that'll 
keep being true.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You don't need to worry on that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I feel like I've heard that speech before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, not like I meant it, then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Back then I was just trying to push it to the side. It
was just me giving up on it and focusing on doing 
the job.
In reality, I'm still... well...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm still... me...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That's inevitably going to require me to face the 
job we need to do as me, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...whatever that means about who that 'me' is and
what... implications are attached to it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Like the two hardy breasts that accompany you on 
that journey?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Rowan...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No... it's fine...
I looked down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: These are me. A part of me.
Their weight was an ever present sensation.
Each trot of the horse reminded me of them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're not going to just disappear...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is good that Pup is embracing being self-reflective
and not rejecting herself.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...what do you mean by that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am not blind. Nor were you all.

Regardless of the specifics, Pup danced between 
stances of wishes and 'would-be's.

One is not obligated to face their true self.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Nor can one be forced to take that road of self-
reflection.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But everyone does deserve to love oneself.

And the first step of such an endeavor is to 
let oneself be their true self.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Right...

Charlotte turned away and her daggered stare was
removed from Rowan.

Her hat seemed to settled down, as though the 
tension escaped with the air pressure.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I am proud of you, Alexei. To be able to say those
words.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You are one of the shoulders I stand atop of, 
my dear friend.

The two smiled at each other, but Rowan returned 
to his serious demeanor when he turned back 
towards me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Pup... Anton...

You've road ahead of you.

No matter where that road takes you... No matter 
what you learn about it's destination...

I will support you in that, to the ends of Ilvanis.

Whether that be defying the Goddess herself to 
undo that curse, or otherwise.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I think that's a beautiful sentiment.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You have allies from all over the world it seems. Not
to mention the Crows like Satia.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You have allies from all over the world it seems. Not
to mention the Crows.
Kara, with a beaming smile, turned towards me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'd be happy to count myself amongst those allies.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: What do you...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...what do you... think...?

Kara's words were kind as she continued to talk.

But... my clouded mind had lingered, and her
speech was background noise that trailed off.
The word slipped quietly out of my mouth.
