lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Mayhap our dear Pup delves into her own 
reflection?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Even moreso, could she be daydreaming of a new
wardrobe?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Stranger tides have turned before this day...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Very funny. This outfit works well enough when
tailored. I'm used to it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You say such things...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: But are you even wearing a br-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
B- But...! Just because I say that doesn't mean
I can't do... something...!

Uh... perhaps... headwear?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I could try like a hat or something? Maybe...?!
My eyes darted to try and grasp a more solid idea.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: M- Maybe a headband...? Like Rowan...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If your hair is getting in the way, we could try to 
tie it up with a ribbon?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...or maybe just a hat?

My eyes had shifted to another target. It was one 
in a thoughtful daze.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I could try a hat?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte, could I...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I would not...

I drifted my horse closer to her own, and I started 
to reach out my hand.

...but she snapped at me, as though silently 
hissing, and knocked my hand away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: C- Charlotte...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I could've told you that such a move was unwise.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Our Lady Stewart here loves her hats.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I do not think I've seen a day in my life where she
wasn't wearing one.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Both of the sisters had a nickname before they
established themselves in the academy.

"Hat Girl" for Charlotte, and "Ribbon Girl" for Mariel.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A lot of the freshmen had a nickname before they
established themselves in the academy.

"Hat Girl" for Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
A nickname, you say? In a sense...

It was a nickname from... the days before anyone 
knew who anyone else was...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess... I've never seen her without it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I wonder...)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don't even think about it.

Both of Charlotte's arms had raised to the elastic 
of her hat, and she gripped it tightly with both.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
My fair Pup, you may try on my headband if the 
fancy drives you so.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Alexei...

Do you wash that headband?

As the discussion wandered off, so did the three 
horses carrying Rowan, Kara, and myself.
Charlotte was still gripping the elastic of her hat.
Though...

...without losing that grip, her aura changed from 
a tense anger to a somber melancholy.

Her horse had sensed her unease, and the two lost
ground on the rest of us.
So...

Charlotte was left by herself and with her 
thoughts.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I should...

I should talk to Mariel.

Or...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I should...

I should talk to someone.

Or...

She gripped her hat a little tighter, and the tips of
the loose beret seemed to stand on edge.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
"...the first step of such an endeavor is to let
oneself be their true self..."

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What of other collaborators? Their motivations?

Mercenaries don't like playing front line soldier,
after all.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...I think you know the answer.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...that everyone has a price.

Both of their heads turned subtly from the noise of
someone entering.
...and turned more as she entered the light.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It would probably be best for you to step outside.

If you want to-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I want to ask her a couple questions.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Please.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
.........

Very well.

Norde stood up, and stepped to the side for 
Charlotte to take a seat.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Who are your collaborators?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I answered this already.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Collaborators in Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Do you really want that answer... princess?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The answer is "everyone".
Nora paused again, waiting for a reaction.
...but not getting one.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Do you think a soul in that city hopes for you to
return?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
All we did was take the lid off the boiling pot.

Every worker, from homlyns to non-homlyns, 
would welcome new management.

All the parasites your family surrounded themselves
with? Biting at the chance to get you out of the 
way.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
And don't think the rumors about your sister and 
you didn't make their way to the slums, too.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
The prodigal younger sister... the 'better' sister...
the one that should be heir.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Even your own genes are tainted by piranha from 
within.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Though... I guess you don't need to worry about that
anymore.

Nora said it smugly, as though she knew Charlotte
better than herself.

But Charlotte stayed stone-faced. She listened
carefully, neither admitting nor denying it.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
...so my collaborators?

Anyone and everyone.

Lockhart is your enemy.

You are the enemy of Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Maybe...

Maybe we should be.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Years of that lie...

Of not being worthy from what even I thought
disqualified us.

We should've...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No. That's not it.

I should have. Not we.

Because, in the end...

I AM the enemy.

I am the enemy of Lockhart.

We soldiered on as a group, moving through 
the small villages that made up the imperial 
countryside.

Much of the region was made up of hills and 
forests, and the land started to level out the 
more we made our way to the south.
And with that leveled land...
...came an influx of farmland.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know... I just noticed that we saw very few 
farms before now.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The Crows avoided working in the empire...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
But, its topography makes it so the most suitable 
land for farming is concentrated towards the south.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right around the border...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And right around the war, yes. A war that the 
Empire is slowly losing, at that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
One can imagine the spark for wanting to occupy a 
major trade hub like Lockhart...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

Our horses settled at the bottom of a hill, and 
ahead of us rode more of the Crows.

As my eyes shifted up towards the forward group,
one of their own turned back towards us.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Military fort in view!

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Military fort in view!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: There it is.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: There it is.
Up the hill, the forward team looked on.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: That's the Republic fortification?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: That's the Republic fortification we were aiming for?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes. The main staging point for the Republic's war
effort in the area.

Though, technically, we've already crossed the 
border.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I imagine it'd be difficult to take a military fort and
move it with the front lines...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
If any commander ever asked me to pick up a 
military fort and move it along with the front lines...

I'd desert the army then and there.

The trot of horses accompanied our group reaching 
the hill's apex.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So that's the Republic fort...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Quite a sight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...
I turned back to the voice.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Quite a sight indeed...
...and found a couple Crows leering at me.

The two turned away, and they started 
trotting their horses back down the hill.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Fuckin' asses.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... I wasn't just imagining it?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya get used to it, lass.
Otis rubbed his neck.
Even I could feel Kara's disapproving glare at the two.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... I wasn't just imagining it?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It can be a bit of a curse to start noticing that they
notice...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: But it does get easier to ignore them as time goes on.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If you're lucky, you won't have to get used to it.

Charlotte turned on her horse, and she started 
back down the hill, too.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I know we might push you at times to try things 
you wouldn't have had the chance to otherwise...

But we do want you to feel like your body is... 
in your best interest?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Not sure how to phrase that best...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No... it's... it's okay.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No matter how I tried to run... 

This is me, like I said before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The good and bad are just... on full display.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well...

Is it a bad thing to you? For this to be 'Pup'?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... Maybe. I don't know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The curse did do this me. It may know best...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The curse targets your perceived greatest 
weakness though. Do you think it's a weakness?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...who am I to argue?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Sometimes you just need to just do your best with 
the hand you're given.
The group had a silence about it.

The seconds dragged on as the various Nightless 
Crows started disembarking horses and unloading 
equipment.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Bunch'a hogwash.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: I don't let this damn curse tell me who I am.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: As if some ears are actually gonna slow me down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Didn't you also get a bunch shorter...?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: And I still can sink an entire navy ship on my own.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The big difference now is I can take a dick from 
both ends like a world beater, and top a gal like 
she's runnin' outta style!
I didn't know what to say.
Otis dropped off his horse and pulled its reigns.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Point bein' that this damn curse doesn't tell ya who
you can be. 

All it does it face you with the lass that ya are
today.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Just face what it shows ya, and use it to straddle 
the curse into submission.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...and that's... what you did?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya got this.
Otis patted the side of my horse.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I once heard a bedtime story from my brother.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
We did not grow up in our youth together, but he 
used to love the stories his mother told him.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
There was one about a king who turned the 
supposed weaknesses of his land into strength.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Isn't that...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed, a story about the Empire's founding. It's 
how I started to love my homeland when I arrived 
there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah. I remember being told that one when I was young,
too...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I thought you might recognize it. You seemed to love
those stories.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah...
I didn't know what to say.
Rowan dropped off his horse and pulled its reigns.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The curse isn't an arbiter of you, my friend.

It can only show the you of now. Not what you'll 
mold your future into.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...and what do you think that future will be?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A good one.
Rowan patted the side of my horse.

And I watched him trot off with his horse to the 
place the other Crows were gathering.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Take the time you need.

The fort is less than half a day away, and we'll have 
a safe haven for a time after we introduce 
ourselves.

Kara's horse stepped past me and towards the 
group building the temporary camp.
I could hear her give some orders as she moved.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...have a few men scout the last trek of the...

But soon enough, she was too far away for me to 
make out the words she said.
I breathed in.
And I breathed out.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I get what they're saying.)

(It makes sense.)

(...but...)

...
I raised my hands to pull on the horse reigns.
And I followed the others to the forming campsite.
Charlotte anxiously tapped her finger.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well? What does the Empire plan to do with Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Save it.
Charlotte's finger stopped.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Sure, but that implies it's not already saved.

You hate me. 

You hate my family. 

You hate the entire system.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I can't imagine you'd want a weasel like Simon in
charge.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: With his... stupid creepy goatee...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Whatever you think is gonna happen is something 
that makes him temporary.

...whether he knows it or not.

The tapping continued as Charlotte became visibly
restless again.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
It burns at your soul, doesn't it?

Seeing whatever cursed future you imagined die 
with your lineage.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: An heiress to failure.
It stopped again. Charlotte's finger was still.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I guess it's just an assumption that they
even told you the truth...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...What about you?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Where would you guide Lockhart's future to?

Forget anything anyone might have told you about 
their plans.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What are you...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
How would you do it?

How would you save Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Yawn*...

As I stepped from my tent, my hand raised to my 
mouth as the yawn wearily slipped out.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Ah, excuse me.
A fellow Crow passed me by, almost hitting me.

My head swiveled in a few directions as I tracked 
him and a few others rushing by.

It didn't take long for me to notice an unexpected
sight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...on the hill?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...and you are sure on that?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...to the extent we can trust our scouts.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Hayzus saw this out in the Crusades.

He may have not earned a title, but he knows 
what he's talking about on this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What's up?

I stepped into the circle of people that were 
chatting away.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Mines.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Your... what?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: As in landmines.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It seems these parts of the battlefield have had 
more... stringent lines set.

Whether it be the Empire or Republic, someone has
coated the Fort's approach with landmines.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Could be both. One starts it. The other adds their 
own while the other side still feels complacent.

One of our guys managed to set one off out of 
range. There seems to be a lot.

Some were the classic explosive powder tech. 
Others seemed more like they were primed with 
magical power.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
To think the fighting had escalated here to this
extent...

Deploying prototype weaponry of that nature...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmm...

(If there's just hidden bombs in front of the fort,
then the important part to us is...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We have no safe path directly to the fort?
A silence fell over the group.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Not without a multi-day detour.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Which risks additional Imperial forces catching up to
us.

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: We’ll send someone to make contact. / Maybe we leverage our experience? / We can push our way through it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe we find a way through and connect with 
the Republic soldiers?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I suppose you were sheltered from these sorts of
dangers as a child... even if you stood with the 
Crows in that time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean, didn't someone just say that one of them 
was able to be set off safely?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If we can ally ourselves with the Republic troops, 
they could get the rest of us through safely.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There is still technically a safe path through, right?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I suppose you were sheltered from these sorts of
dangers as a child... even if you stood with the 
Crows in that time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean, didn't someone just say that one of them 
was able to be set off safely?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It sounds like we have that experience. We should
leverage it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why not just push forward and find a safe path through?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I suppose you were sheltered from these sorts of
dangers as a child... even if you stood with the 
Crows in that time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean, didn't someone just say that one of them 
was able to be set off safely?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm not afraid of some danger. We're mercenaries.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Y- Yeah... But Heyzus is super experienced 
with these. I have no idea how simple it is.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It'd be best for us to take the detour, and hope 
that route isn't also blocked.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Actually...

It may be possible.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Could you retrieve the man who has experience in
detecting mines?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: S- Sure?

The Crow threw out a thumbs up, and he headed 
off down the hill.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If the prototype mines are what I think they are...

I believe Charlotte and I have the expertise to have
the advantage.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...are you sure?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Enough to attempt it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So we can train up a small advanced force to try 
and clear out a path?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It depends how long we take...

But... I suppose that one could at least test 
out this approach in the time we'd take to 
prepare for the detour.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: My thought exactly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I can gather a group for that, while everyone else
packs up camp.

As the words exited my mouth, I felt a presence 
come up from behind.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Morning.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...morning, Charlotte.

You look...
She looked like she hadn't slept all night.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What's being discussed? You'll work on what while 
the Crows prep to move?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: To start from the beginning...

lines.speaker: Heyzus
lines.text: ...! Where... did...

lines.speaker: Imperial
lines.text: Just go down, you swine!

lines.speaker: Heyzus
lines.text: Wait... aren't you the-

Nora burst forth on her griffin, speeding past the
clash between the Crow and Imperial.

lines.speaker: Heyzus
lines.text: Crap...! They're the prisoners...!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Pant*...  *pant*...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Hey... Heyzus...!

lines.speaker: Heyzus
lines.text:
Don't worry about me, I've got this!

They went after your sister!

Mariel looked back between Heyzus and 
the path forward.

lines.speaker: Heyzus
lines.text: Go!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: ...Thank you.
And she sprinted off.

lines.speaker: Imperial
lines.text:
Maybe you should pay attention to the blade in 
front of you...!

Nora and a few of the other imperial mercenaries
swiftly made their way through the minefields.
Their self-preservation be damned...

But they managed through with little damage 
thanks to the path paved by the Crows.
It wasn't long until they were on top of us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We've made good progress, all things considered.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I agree.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I'll always be impressed by your technical 
skill, sis.

Charlotte was near me, and I turned towards 
her only to see her still stone-faced.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's probably best that she's... focused...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (She has done nothing but a good job so far.)
I turned towards where we were heading.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ya know... we're not in that much of a hurry.
And I turned back towards Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe we can take a break and-
From the corner of my eye, a blur came into frame.

The blood red armor triggered my fight or flight, 
and I stepped forward.
With one arm, I pushed Charlotte to the side...
...and I drew my sword with the other.

The clash pushed me back, and I managed to 
keep my footing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The fox eared mercenary...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Her...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...but how?

Charlotte had fallen to the ground, and she looked 
at the two of us with blades pointed to each 
other.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: There's been enough talking.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But... we... I...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Argh...!

So be it!

From her prone position, Charlotte reached for her
holster and her gun.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- What?

Out of the corner of her eye, a distinct red glow 
came from beneath the dirt.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A landmine?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?!

I inserted myself between the fox eared mercenary 
and Charlotte.

With a few slashes, we pushed each other back 
once more.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: A m- mine?! Can you disarm it?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course it's a mine... Can you disarm it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: T- Trying...! I'm trying!

She said so, slowly moving her hands as to not 
trigger it fully.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Sis! ...Charlotte!

Mariel stepped over the horizon, and she yelled out 
as she reached us.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Heh.
Nora flipped her lance grip.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Is... she gonna throw it?)

I tracked her aim, and she was clearly aiming 
for the mine with the hopes of setting it off.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Dammit...!)
I took a step forward...!
...and my foot sunk into the ground.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What...?!
My eyeline slipped beneath the floor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I'm... falling...?!)

The voices of the others' dismay was washed away 
by the explosions rumbling the earth.
And they got quieter as I fell.
When would it stop?
When did I pass into unconsciousness?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Inhale*...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *Cough*! *Pant*...
I stared up at the light filtering from above.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (...a cave?)

My body was covered with dirt and small pieces of
rubble.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh...

With my vision wavering in and out, I moved to 
clear the rubble away.

And with a grunt, I pushed myself up to a sitting
position.
That, though, was not without a realization.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Metal...)

A cold feeling pulsated through my hand as I used 
it to push myself up off the ground.
The ground was cold, and - distinctly - metallic.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What is this...?
I turned to Charlotte's voice.
She was safe.
Even her hat stayed on, as though a miracle.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oww...

lines.speaker: Imperial
lines.text: Guh...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Was that a cave-in...?

I looked around and we seemed lucky enough to 
not have any large pile ups of debris to bury 
anyone.

Though, the reason for that became clear with
Charlotte's words.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Is this a train?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
A... what?

Like the thing you travel on?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Down... here?)

I pushed myself to my feet, and the hum of the
vehicle's magical motor vibrated into my feet.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: In that direction...

She looked towards the underground tunnel that 
the train came from.
It was pointed at Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why would you build a train underground?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Better yet... how did they do so this quickly?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Don't play dumb, 'princess'.

Our fox eared enemy brought herself to her feet, 
with rubble falling aside aplenty as she did.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
The subterranean train system had been a work in
progress for years.

I had friends who worked in these damned tunnels.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? Who... Who did that?

But even as the words left her mouth, Charlotte 
seemed to realize with a whisper.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Simon... or one of the others who had sold out 
Lockhart to the Empire.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Don't pretend you weren't planning it.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Planning... what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What do you mean by that? Planning what?
Nora raised her weapon.

A collection of the mercenaries and Imperials from
outside and within the trains started to gather to 
her sides.
They also turned towards us.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You were always planning to drag Lockhart into war.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Ngh! ...That's my limit. Falling back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Another lackey? Piece of cake.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: You guard is weak to your right.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What?

J- Just shut up and fight!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: That, I can do.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Enemy troops litter the cityscape.

Many citizens have fled here for safety, but many 
still are trying to make the voyage.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The soldier we met before is leading the effort to 
thin the herd of enemies, right?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And when they reach a breaking point, then comes 
the grand finale?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I am surprised that you are still here.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The best way to pen the chorus of glorious victory 
is to storm the enemy myself, no?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: No storming, charging, or singing of any kind.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Very well. It will wait for a better time.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
To note, the enemy appears to be hiring  
mercenaries of their own, and they may have 
some aces up their sleeve.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Avoid them if possible. There is little more to make 
a mercenary dangerous than not yet having 
their paycheck for the day.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Our mission is to shepherd the people to safety and 
keep those within covered. Be vigilant.

Win Condition: Survive until sentry arrives. 
Lose condition: 3 villagers die, Pup, Ivan, Rowan die

lines.speaker: Female Voice
lines.text: ...not going... wait around...

lines.speaker: Another Voice
lines.text: ...too dangerous... guards handle...

lines.speaker: Civilian
lines.text: Stage one complete.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Y- You shot him!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Serves him right, the 3rd rate assassin from a 3rd 
rate country.
Charlotte holstered her smoking pistol.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm tired of cowering in fear. Sis, how about we 
take-

Murmurs arose from the crowd of Lockhart citizens 
around the two girls.

lines.speaker: Civilian
lines.text: Is that... Did she just...?

lines.speaker: Civilian
lines.text:
The princess?! Did something happen in the 
estate?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah- Uh... Well...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Charlotte, we should head back inside. It's 
dangerous out here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You don't need to follow me, but I'm
not going to stand idly by.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I rather find the person I need to grind under my 
boot to make this stop.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Who is in charge out here?!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
The Lockhart princess and her younger sister?

You do know we are trying to keep you and yours 
safe, yes?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
*Sigh*... But you'd be safer helping us than 
running off on your own, too...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Such pleasantly expedited negotiations. I'm sure 
we'll work well together.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Mariel, if you want to stay away from the fighting, 
then go back inside with Mother and Father or help 
heal the people gathered here.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I mean... I...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'll help, too! J- Just tell me what I need to do!
Charlotte and Mariel were recruited!

Win Condition: Survive until sentry arrives. 
Lose condition: 3 villagers die, Pup, Ivan, Rowan die
Charlotte or Mariel die.
You received bonus experience for saving civilians.
You received bonus experience for saving civilians.
You received bonus experience for saving civilians.

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text: There we go. We've made a path.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Hm?

It looks like the Lockhart soldiers are regrouping 
around the mansion. Let's fall back and join them.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Why, hello there. How have you fared on this 
waning day, young miss?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We've got a jokester now? Whoever you are, 
there is a fight to focus on.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Oh?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Heh. Unless you're offering to be a human shield.

We've never tested if this prototype pistol could 
shoot a round through two bodies, after all.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
As tempting as the offer is... Alas, I do require this 
body should I wish to sing the song of victory.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I will step aside.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Stay alive, will you? I want to hear that song when 
we're done here.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I will do my utmost.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: H- Hello?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, one of the Lockhart girls.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No need to fear. I- ..I'll protect you.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Protect? You?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sorry?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: N- Nothing!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just stay behind me when you can. I can take 
these rabble no problem.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You'll be a great protector, I'm sure. Just lead the 
way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course.
I ran off to the next fight.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I got to make sure he stays safe.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Aw~ A cute puppy. Are you lost?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I suppose you're not quite a puppy, but a grand ol' 
beautiful furball.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Where are your owners? We should-
An enemy soldier appeared from behind a corner

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: N- No!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Angry bark*!

Jakson leaped at the enemy, quickly disarming him 
and knocking him out.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Angry growl*...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: ...C-... C- Cute puppy...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: How are you holding up, Pup?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm... *Pant*... good.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Fall back if you start to lose momentum.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right, right...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Let's go! We can do this!

I started off ahead of my father and back into the 
fray.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(We can do it. I can do it. We're strong. I'm... 
going to be strong.)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Ah, this almost makes me nostalgic
for Belven.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What? You mean that warzone?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
A crossroads of three nations... A city at their 
center?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
If the Republic shows up now, the city will truly 
burn to it's foundation, you know?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hehe~ ...Perhaps.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Ivan and Pup weren't even with the Crows back 
then. A lot of time has passed.

You and I were closer to fresh recruits around 
then, too

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: That's nostalgia for you, I guess.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmph. I suppose I can understand... a little.
Deployment Tutorial

In the Deployment/Battle Prep Menu you will be 
able to choose your units and manage their 
inventory. 
Select or deselct units in the UNIT menu.

Manage their inventory in the MANAGE Menu. You 
can also use items and other things from your base. 

To move your units around, right click to see the 
map and then right click to move your units around.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Watch out!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I... shit...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That flew right by my head!

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text: Imperial scum.

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text: You. Targets of this bandit. Are you friend or foe?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We are the Nightless Crows mercenary corp. We 
were hired to help protect the city.

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
In the city itself? Bloody gold fingers had no faith, 
did they?

*Sigh*... Though I could hardly blame them at this 
point.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- We want to help the civilians!

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
Good enough.

The people have been evacuated largely to the 
north around the governor's mansion.

If your group could reinforce that position, it would 
do a lot to let the rest of us clear out these cretin.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Understood. We will head to the mansion, then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right... Thank you!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
You've not the look of an Imperial soldier. Are you 
another hired mercenary?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I'd put up your guard, if I were you. You're not 
close to dropping mine.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You'd stand with these... monsters?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Are those ears just for show? I stand with those I 
trust, of course.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Besides, I see only one monster in front of me. The 
one fighting for this atrocity.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Tsk... Self-destructive fool.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Target 2 acquired.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'd say it's nothing personal, but... well...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'm not afraid... I'm not afraid of you b- bullies!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Target 1 acquired.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh, are you part of this too? Are you another 
assassin?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'll gladly use you as target practice for the damned 
"Wolf" later.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: As self serving as one would expect.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: For Lockhart!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Mercenaries fighting for the "princesses"? Fine, you 
will share their fate.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
It's no good. I have to retreat... This isn't the end 
of this!

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Death... would suit you well.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: I know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Everyone keep going!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I can hold him off!

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: What an... empty visage.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The "Steel Wolf", is it? You've fought on the front 
lines of the crusades, too?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
...

No exceptions.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Crap... it's no use trying to ask questions.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What's the rush for?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why are you hurrying?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That... man...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
We're evacuating ourselves and these two girls to 
outside the city.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: "The Steel Wolf"...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You know who that man is?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Do tell.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
His armor looks similar to a man I've read about fairly 
recently.

A crusader that was extremely deadly and gained 
the nickname "Steel Wolf".

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Crusader? From out in the-

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: There is no time for this!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Norde, can we escape to outside of Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
They've created a perimeter, but it is thin.

It appears more meant to take the city than to 
entrap those within.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We'll have to break through their line, however.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Then that's the plan. Break their line and get out.

Do whatever you can to stay alive, everyone.

Win Condition: Escape
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte, Mariel,  Ivan 
die

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
How... wretched! I will end that stain you place on 
existence itself!

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text: How... How did- did...?

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text: My ladies, are you alright?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: We've been... managing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Let's just get to the point. What's the situation? 
How are we faring?

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
Very well, then.

The invading force inside the city has only stragglers 
remaining.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I do believe I saw some of the soldiers retreating 
for the city limits.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Victory, then? We won?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I do wonder...

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
Mercenary, are you suggesting what I think you 
are?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Hm... The amount of men they'd have to hire to 
supplement the Nolvanus regiment would be 
absurd.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
That, and the soldiers they'd need to divert from 
their war with Rabaneau...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait? What would they need those sorts of 
numbers for?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Surrounding the city, no?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Surrounding... What? How?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Could they actually manage that?

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
Well... If they focus on strategic points, then it's 
not unfeasible.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Even then, their numbers couldn't be enough to 
manage it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Or they simply wished to project such intent onto 
our weary minds?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
M- Maybe they were just retreating? It doesn't 
need to be some dastardly plan, right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We're not about to just imagine up an answer.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You said we've just stragglers left? Dedicate some 
men to scout the outskirts of the city.

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
That would be most wise, my lady. For such a bold 
move as invasion, this has felt too... simple.

It would be best to-
He was cutoff by the approach of marching feet.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It was only a matter of time.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Speak of the devil.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that guy a Nolvanus general?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Yes. Do not interfere.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Am I speaking to a representative of the current 
Lockhart government?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: "Current"...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Whatever you want to say, you can say it to me.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Charlotte Stewart? Heir to the Stewart Works 
conglomerate that runs the Lockhart government.

And Mariel Stewart? 2nd child of the Stewart 
Works leading family.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Out with it, or get out of our city.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Hmph...

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Charlotte and Mariel Stewart. You and others of 
the Stewart Works group are under arrest for 
treason against Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What did you just say? Choose your next words 
carefully.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
I, as representative of the Nolvanus government, 
act as a patron to the Lockhart City Council.

Hearing of the havoc your family has caused with 
it's duplicitous dealings with the Republic...

The general motioned to the damaged cityscape 
around him.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
...the Emperor had no choice but to intervene 
when requested by the council itself.

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
How dare you besmirch the good name of Lockhart 
and the Stewarts!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That's... why would they...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What a bunch of- of...! ...of catshit!

When I get my hands on the necks of those 
backstabbing, scheming bastards...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: To go to such ridiculous lengths...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No one's ever going to believe that story.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: They don't need to.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Now calm down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grh...

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: What say you? Will you cooperate peacefully?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I... will never...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We Stewarts will never bow to your invasion. Of 
that, I can say sincerely from the heart of every
one of us.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Very well. By force, then.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Best of luck, young stewards of Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Get back here and die like the pitiful coward you 
are!

Charlotte stood with a smoking pistol at the end of 
her outstretched arm.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Goddess... damn it!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Th- They're going to attack again?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
There's no way he thinks anyone is going to buy 
that story.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: But he said it with such confidence...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... It could be a bluff.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah. Maybe they've lost and this is a desperation 
play to bluff their way to victory?

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
My ladies, I will organize a scout to ascertain the 
situation.

You two. Please return to the mansion. Your 
parents must be worried sick.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I am no child. We are no children.

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text: My lady...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
If... If they really have an army around the city, is it 
even safe inside?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Some of my comrades left to do another pass. 
They should be returning soon.

If there are troops at the perimeter, they may have 
noticed and investigated.

lines.speaker: Lockhart Sentry
lines.text:
Then perhaps we can-

...can...

We turned to the mansion as a silhouette began to 
take shape in the darkness.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who is... that?

A screech enveloped our ears. Step by step, steel 
grinded the stone below.

A relaxed cadence of metal clicked with each step 
the figure took.

The ill-defined shadow stepped forward, where 
dulled metal met the flickering lights of the 
moonlit city.

The figure stopped. He was trailed by a sword 
dragged haphazardly across the ground.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
...

Friend of yours?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: He's not one of the guards.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What? Then... is he associated with the Empire?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...?
Something had caught my eye.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Another 3rd rate assassin?
Charlotte raised her pistol.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What is that? It's almost like... a trail?)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Talk. Now.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
You've already sent away the one willing to 
negotiate.

The voice was muffled and echoed through the 
helmet. It felt far away, in both sound and spirit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(A trail of... something... It's like footprints. That 
and more coming from where the sword 
was dragging.)

A flicker of the candlelight reflected a color more 
clearly than before.

Crimson.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Blood?!
Several heads turned my way with the declaration.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What?

Charlotte's eyes dotted towards what I had 
noticed.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What... What did you do inside?

He did not respond, as his gaze was still fixed in the
direction of me and my father.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (He... Did he...?)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What did you do!?

The helmet turned towards her, with a creak to 
pierce the silence.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: You know what.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You... YOU-!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: What... just... happened?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: He just...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Even more blood...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Who are you?!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: This isn't good.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Everyone. Retreat. We'll head to the exterior of 
the city.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But that guy just-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: As much as I wish otherwise, he is right.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: D- Dammit!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Y- You... You... What did you do... i- inside?

Charlotte still had her pistol raised. Her arm shook 
without relenting.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: RUN!
The man lifted his sword off the ground.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Run.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Charlotte, w- we should go.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Don't think this is the end of this. You will pay for 
this.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
...?

I wonder... is it the years, or...?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: ...or have I found you?

lines.speaker: Lockhart Soldier
lines.text:
How... wretched! I will end that stain you place on 
existence itself!

lines.speaker: Lockhart Soldier
lines.text: How... How did- did...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Dammit!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Already?!)

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Let's keep moving!
I turned my head toward my fellows.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Are we going to make it at this rate?)
My head about faced.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Maybe I could distract-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That... That was close.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... You picked the wrong person to die to...
I grabbed my sword and landed on my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fall!

My sword clattered against the stone beneath our 
feet, and I had fallen to a knee.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I won't let you-

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Weak.
His arm raised to pierce forth one final strike.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Crap...!

I clenched my eyes shut and braced myself for 
what seemed like an eternity.

And with eternity and a second came the stinging 
pain of steel unto flesh. It buried itself within my 
shoulder.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Is that... Is that it?

Through the pain, I grabbed onto the blade of the 
sword and it cut into my hand...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You...

...and pulled the shallow dearth of steel from 
my flesh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that all you-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Father?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you doing?!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Pup... Flee...

Footsteps accompanied the desperate growls from 
my father.

Step by step, he was driving the Steel Wolf back 
with a grip on the sword itself.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Do you wish to die?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Pup, now!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I can help!

(Where's my sword, I can-)

My vision blurred and wavered.

Thoughts dispersed as pain struck through my 
mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... can...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Ngh!
The sword twisted ever so slightly.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
So I am to be ignored, 'hapless' crow?

All these years since Crekskia, and not even a 
word?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Crekskia? How could you know... about that?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Am I to be forgotten, as well? After being thrown 
aside?

It seems the worth of our memory is much the 
same.

Let me shepherd you to your existence as one.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Ah- ...Argh!!!

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Pup... go...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, I can... I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can... I... I...

A stinging headache wrapped itself around my head 
and what energy I had drained to nothing.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...get away from...not be allowed to...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Grk!

lines.speaker: Lockhart Soldier
lines.text:
...get the princesses...

...them safe...

...hold him off...

With a scene crumbling around me, the shadows
of new and familar actors entered the stage.

As they did, my body gave in to pressures and 
pain beyond my understanding.

I felt weak. Weaker than I ever had before.

lines.speaker: Nameless Voice
lines.text:
Another story? It's not even nightfall yet.

Ah, okay, okay. What story have I not told you 
two, then?

What about... the legend of Thame and Raiga? Of 
more heroes from before the Emerald Age?

Thame was a prince of nowhere, exiled to the 
farthest reaches of civilization.

He spent his days in peace until a messenger landed 
before his gaze. A messenger that told of war.

He was called to action, but refused it. He simply 
wished for a quiet life.

War would not give it to him, though. His quaint 
village of exile burned away from the march 
of conquest.
In his anger, he reclaimed a sword of royal 
succession, and led an army through many battles 
to the doorsteps of the perpetrators.
And so they burned as well.

Thame had struck at the heart of the villains. Every 
weakness was an untold story to unravel the 
enemy.
His army continued its march to his land of origin, 
where he found his brother Raiga sitting on the 
throne.
But Raiga created a shield against Thame's strikes. 
A shield that would not crack.

With every failure, Thame's desperation grew 
and grew.

It grew until the sword thrust once more into the 
shield, only to crack itself.

So desperate to find a weakness of his brother, 
Thame had succumb to his own.

And the world knew peace, for a time.

A peace where the resilient shield glimmered in the 
sunlit sky from sea to shining sea.

From these legends came two Oathbreakers... 
Eul'raiga and Eul'thame.

One a symbol of ideals. The other a warning, like 
a double edged sword.

That even the greatest of us have cracks that can 
consume our very being.

Light filtered through the morning sky to awaken 
me.

My eyes opened, though my vision was fleeting in 
such stupor.
I forced myself out of the bed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(What was that... dream? That memory? It's so 
hazy now.)

My arm leaned against the wall to assist my sore 
body.
And as if by instinct, I looked.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

I grabbed both sides of the mirror as I saw a new 
image reflect back at me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Is that... me?)

My hair had lengthened. My face had softened. My 
body was simply smaller than I knew it to be.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Am I imagining it?)
My breathing increased tempo.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I have to be imagining it, right?
I had swiveled to remove the mirror from my view.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: O- Oh...

...only to see the other bed in the room with 
someone sitting by it.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Sorry, did I wake you?

My eyes shifted to see the person resting in the 
second bed.

I could see him breathing from where I was. 
It was hampered, but it was breathing 
nonetheless.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oh, that's good.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: And... it's not your imagination.

She pointed her finger around her face to refer to 
the changes I saw.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I was able to heal your wounds the best I could, 
but I don't know what happened there.

It's not like any disease or magic I know of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right... Right..

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Your father... He is your father, right? His wound
was worse. He's stable, but he'll likely struggle
just to stay awake as he is.

I felt what strength I had slip away as I leaned 
against the wall with my back.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It'd be best to get what rest you can. It sounds 
like we won't be able to stay in this village much 
longer.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Also, I just wanted to say something before I 
forget, too.

Thank you. For everything you were able to do.
For what all of you were able to do.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: For everything... you could do...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. It was... the least...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, didn't her parents...?)
Mariel had turned to continue treating my father.

I slid down along the wall, and I found myself 
sitting on the floor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...it was... the least I could do...

I averted my eyes towards the dawn peeking 
through the window.

lines.speaker: Imperial Soldier
lines.text:
General, sir, the remaining resistance has been 
taken care of.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: A shame. So much unnecessary bloodshed.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: What about the Stewart Works group?

lines.speaker: Imperial Soldier
lines.text:
Only the two daughters are unaccounted for.

After... well... the... t- the events of last night.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Fled among a retinue of mercenaries, have they?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
They won't get far with three of their number 
crippled and cursed.

He looked over to the Steel Wolf, as if expecting a 
response.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Hmm... "Steel Wolf"...

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
I need to mediate the transition process here in 
Lockhart.

Are you up for a hunt?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
...

Yes.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Then I'll leave you with some soldiers and two of 
the better mercenaries we've recruited. It should 
help you think like them.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: You two. Get out here.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'm ready to move out.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Yo.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Wait up! Shouldn't we discuss a plan of action?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Eh, so noisy.

The three had quickly paced themselves away from 
the scene.

lines.speaker: Imperial Soldier
lines.text:
Sir, are you sure you want to let... him take care of 
such an important mission?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Honestly, I'm not sure if that man could lose in a 
fight. He may even be excessive for this.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Besides, I've never seen the man speak so many 
words as what was reported.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Call me curious... and perhaps a little selfish.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
With Lockhart in tow, I'd like to spend a little time 
enjoying it, after all.

To bask in the glow of the light from the end of 
the tunnel.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I imagine they're treating all the towns like they're 
just some strategic objective.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Or... worse.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Unfortunately there is little we can do bar 
continuing to move.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: We could liberate them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Quiet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But why couldn't we help them?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Giving ourselves up would likely not stop them from 
taking advantage of the town. Especially in the 
other towns around the area.
And it would be recklessly dangerous to try to take 
them on directly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I wonder...)

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
The ones in the villages are likely to be on high 
alert, too.

Don't get spotted! Unless you really want to.
But the question becomes how to know where
is safe and where is not?
If you left click on an enemy, a red aura will appear. 
This means that the unit can attack any one of 
those squares. 
If you right click anywhere on the map, a yellow 
aura will appear on all enemies. This is all 
enemy's ranges combined.
The red and yellow auras can be set at the same 
time to track both "all dangerous areas" and a 
specific enemy's "dangerous area".
Use this liberally! Knowing the attacking options of
your opponent can be the difference between 
life and death!
In this map, some enemies are on high alert and 
could call for reinforcements if you are spotted by 
them!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We should keep moving. Head south to the border 
to Rabaneau.

Win Condition: Escape!

Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan or Charlotte die.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Crap... that feeling again...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I... am...

Try... to not faint from it again.

Norde said as much while his fist tightened to the 
point of shaking.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... won't...

I won't faint.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This will pass... I just... need to concentrate and 
avoid danger until it does.)

Feeling weak? That familiar feeling might become
all to common of a companion for Pup and co.

Those struck by a particular person's sword are
afflicted with a state of being. A state of being
that can bring on bouts of feeling weak.
It isn't a mechanic that will impact you on every
map, but rather specific maps during the story.

With that, each of these map's exact impact 
on Pup and others will change with unique
mechanics to fit the story.
In this map, you will receive a debuff. 
     -2 to speed 
     -2 to skill.

title: CH4 Battle - All Vill safe NH TF

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Was that all the villages around here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
There may be more to the south, but that's 
everything in the immediate area.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: How unnecessarily reckless.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Thank you for letting us make the effort, though.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Thank you for letting us make the effort, though.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you for helping these places.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
There was quite literally no way for me to resist at 
a point.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A little less of a load to put on the shoulders of 
everyone is a good thing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Plus it makes for some good practice for me to put 
some hair on my chest.

I chuckled away at my thought and I felt a surge 
of pride from my strength in this task.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

Then I felt something weird.

I felt itchy.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Did I just see something fall out of your jacket?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What the...

I pulled off my jacket and saw a rain of hair 
fall out of it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why? What is this?

My eyes gazed down on a set of smooth arms. The 
hair had fallen out.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Your body hair...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
"Put hair on your chest", was it? This disease has 
fantastic comedic timing.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That is... concerning.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: All the more reason to keep moving, however.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just don't... have the words...

The event had caught me off guard, and I couldn't 
do much more than follow the group again.
"No Body Hair" TF Aquired!?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Let's not dawdle. The town isn't too far away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I could definitely stand to get some rest after all 
this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You said you were with the Covenant? Could 
you...?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: All in good time. First let's settle at a safe haven.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A town?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I could definitely stand to get some rest after all 
this.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Ah, the group that passed near the village I was 
at?

It seems we have headed the same way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Cainan DeClares of the Covenant.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
If you need a place to rest, I have been to this 
town before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That sounds...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...nice, to be honest.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Then follow me.

lines.speaker: Imperial Soldier
lines.text: I found the enemy!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Damn... Well, we might as well save the villages 
now.

TUTORIAL: Villages

Approach the entrance of a village to interact with 
it. You might get some goodies!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Who is that? He doesn't look like one of the 
Imperial soldiers?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
That may be a scout. The outerwear is reminiscent 
of Rabaneau soldiers.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Perfect. We can get an escort the rest of the way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hello! Are you from the Republic?!

lines.speaker: Rabaneau Scout
lines.text:
Did I hear something...?

...?!

Mercenaries? The report must be right, Nolvanus is 
hiring mercenaries to bulk up their numbers.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If you're from the Republic, we have some guests 
you might want to meet!

lines.speaker: Rabaneau Scout
lines.text:
I need to fall back and let the main force know...

You'll never get away with this treachery, you 
Imperial scum!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Did he just yell at us like we were part of the 
Empire?!

lines.speaker: Geoffrey
lines.text:
There it is. The Imperial Army. They've really done 
it.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Now Rabaneau makes their move? I won't let you 
near Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Geoffrey
lines.text:
I see the scout was right about hired mercenaries.

Let us get to know each other, then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It... It's turned into a battlefield?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: They think we're an enemy?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: With the path to Rabaneau blocked off.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What now?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: There must be another escape route.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Of course. It was my pleasure to help.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I really must move to my next mission for the 
Covenant.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Hm... Are those troops in the distance?

Oh hey, look. Another person not fighting in 
either of the armies? Wonder what that's about?

Some units out and about have special conditions 
to be recruited to your cause.

Those conditions could be simple, like talking to
them. Or they could be complex like... let's
not get to into right now.
Either way, keep an eye out for possibilities!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe we could force our way through...?

(I don't want to go somewhere my father might 
not follow, but... what choice do we have?)

NEW OBJECTIVE: Find a new way to escape!

Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte or Cainan 
die.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: There we go. Their commander is down.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Thank you! They were threatening my daughter 
and... and...
The villager dumped a pile of money in our hands.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: You don't have to...

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
I insist! It was a bribe amount I was already willing 
to part with. I much rather see it go with saviors.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: T- Thanks...?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Oh thank you! You've saved us! You are our daring 
heroes!

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: It was the least we could do. Don't worry about-

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Here, take this! And this!

Bits of random stuff started to fill all the hands 
available.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: I- I... What do I...
And it continued. And continued...

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Oh thank you so much our heroes! Go along now 
with your hoard of treasure!
So we were hurried along and out of sight.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text:
...

This is just that guy's garbage...

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: *Sigh*... Maybe there's something useful in here?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Down that one goes.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Where they at!? I'll... I'll...

Oh, the soldier is already down.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: No problems here.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Guess I don't need this anymore...

The villager tossed the weapon he was holding 
into our hands before nonchalantly pivoting 
back into his house.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Wait, is he grateful or not?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Why'd you have to kill the guy?! They're probably 
just going send another and blame us!

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: We're just trying to help and-

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Get out! You've caused enough trouble!

Random objects started getting thrown in our 
direction.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Okay! We're leaving!

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Fleeing the violence, are you? It does appear quite 
senseless here.

I've just set off on my way myself, so perhaps I can 
escort you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well, we're not exactly going to say "no" to the 
assistance in all this chaos.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I know of a nice town to the west. It should be 
out of the crossfires of this battle.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Ah, but where are my manners?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I am Cainan DeClares, an arbiter for The Holy Oath's 
Covenant to the Mother Soul.

I am at your service.
Cainan was recruited!

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Fleeing the violence, are you? It does appear quite 
senseless here.

I've just set off on my way myself, so perhaps I can 
escort you?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text:
Well, we're not exactly going to say "no" to the 
assistance in all this chaos.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I know of a nice town to the west. It should be 
out of the crossfires of this battle.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Ah, but where are my manners?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I am Cainan DeClares, an arbiter for The Holy Oath's 
Covenant to the Mother Soul.

I am at your service.
Cainan was recruited!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I need to ask... What did you see when you 
climbed that wall?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It... It was two people standing together like 
they were about to fight...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That... "Steel Wolf" along with my father.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So he really was there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah. I... hope my father can take care of him. Or 
get away at least.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I... knew the feeling, yeah.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
There's been too much of this. We'll get him one 
way or another.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's been the plan all along.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Ugh...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
If I am not mistaken... you were struck by that 
Steel Wolf as well back in Lockhart.

When you were creating an opening for your leader 
to flee.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What of it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
An inkling, nothing more.

Be sure not to push yourself beyond any limits.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grk...! Gotta keep... going...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Worried Whine*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll be fine... Just a bit dizzy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And weak in the hands... and legs...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll be fine.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Doubtful bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then if I'm not, I'll rely on you to do what you 
need to, yeah?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Determined bark*!

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: What brings you here, Al-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah! No need to say anything unnecessary.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I go by my birthname these days. You may call me 
Rowan.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Hm... Then, "Rowan"... What brings you here? Are 
you with them?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I've been wandering for a time. For now, I follow in 
the steps of an intriguing image.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You see it too, no?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Perhaps. There is a certain resemblance to be had 
there.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You should have seen him a few days before. After 
Lockhart and the strike of that sword...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Strike of a sword?

...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I suspect the continuation of this conversation best 
be had when we arrive in a safe haven, no?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Of course, of course.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Hahaha! You kittens ain't half bad, ya know?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How the hell are you swinging around that big 
axe?!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Decades of experience, kid. Decades of experience.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But... Y- You don't look any older
than me...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Hey, sometimes girls like us got to make ends 
meet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Again with that nonsense...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ack! It doesn't matter if you mistake me for a girl. 
You'll be going down soon enough.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: You're mighty well organized. Lockhart troops or...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Well, you don't need to answer.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I can figure out anything I feel like when we're 
done.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Grk! Really? This was supposed to be a trap, ya 
kids!

To think that princess was able to turn the tides.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heh. At this point it's more fun when I get key 
hauled anyways.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Wonder what set them on this course?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: You owe me... like 6 bushels of apples!

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Aw dammit... I knew that crap alcohol would be 
the death of me...
Her body started to disintegrate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: She's disappearing?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sort of... sort of like a summoned ally?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Dammit, they're still coming. We can work through 
that later!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (So that girl went to the port, right?)

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
That Lockhart lass is wanted dead or alive!

Whichever one of you dirtbags sacks her gets the 
prime cut of meat tonight!

lines.speaker: Many Pirates
lines.text: YEAH!!!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I got a bad feeling about this.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A little late on that premonition?

Win Condition: Defeat Otis
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte die

Some pirates are drunk. This means their 
movement is reduced.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!
...found a local lottery ticket?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's a winner?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...for only a little money.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: It's a winner?!

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: ...for only a little money.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.text: Ah, there they are!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's not good...

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: That's not good...

Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

There's a store at the end of the hallway.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Welcome, comrade. The Nightless Crows fly 
together.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: YEAH?! How do you like- like... them apples!?

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.text:
Fucking bitch! You owe me- *hic*... You owe me a 
beer!

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: No! You...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: You... owe me... like... zzzzz...
She started sleeping on her feet.

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.text: Give me my money!

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
...!

Give me my apples!
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.text: I'm eating steak tonight! Hahaha!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: These guys...

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: These guys...

Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

There's a store at the end of the hallway.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!
Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There should be something here?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: There should be something here?

They looked around for some time.

They didn't find anything.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That can't be good...

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: That can't be good...

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.text:
YOOOUUUU.....?!!?!

Magnificent bastard!

Have a... *hic*! ...a tip.
He slid some money towards us before passing out.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

Nothing.

Did you expect more?

Expectations are a double edged sword.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!
It was a half open box of weapons.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Isn't this one pretty rare?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Isn't this one is pretty rare?
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.text: Heheh...

The pirates snapped their fingers in a rhythm like 
they were trying to set the mood for the fight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I feel like you're referencing something I don't 
get...

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text:
I feel like you're referencing something I don't 
get...
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Shop Owner
lines.text:
Ah, yes. The one foretold to conquer the world...!

Or something like that. Hurry up, I need to close 
up.
Our forces entered the alleyway and...!

lines.speaker: Shop Owner
lines.text:
Eh? Be quick. I was just about to close up for the 
day.
Rowan placed himself in Charlotte's view.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Line of sight, please.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do you really not...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Busy, bard. I really don't have time to make fun of 
you.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I suppose some things truly never change.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... feeling better?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: A lot, actually. Thanks.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
This place is really not good for my health 
considering my history with alcohol.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... that... I've never tried it.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: And don't! That crap is the worst.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Soothing, smooth... it's all just a trap.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: A delicious... intoxicating trap...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Is this what they call a relapse?)

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Thanks again, though.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
I just sort of showed up here randomly. Not sure 
what's going on.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
You guys give me an excuse to get my bearings in 
relative safety, and I'll gladly help you out 
with... whatever is happening here.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Careful. They'd be after both of you, after all.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: R- Right.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Well... maybe. Charlotte is the proper heir, after all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why would that matter?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: She's just... a lot more important, right?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You may be surprised by how little others outside 
your social circle care about that.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oh...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Man, this place is a dump.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oh? But the noble presence is basically non-
existent.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Eh, at least they make it fun. This is just anarchy.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmm... An interesting thought.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Maybe you just need to find the fun in anarchy?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Never took you for an anarchist.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh, I wouldn't say I am.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Only that I don't think it is worse than a noble 
infested town.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Plus, a wild ride can be fun here and there.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Heh. I guess I'll have to try it some time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Calm yourself!

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Calm yourself!

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: WHERE ARE THE FUCKING APPLES?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We'll... We will buy you some apples!

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: We'll... We will buy you some apples!

lines.speaker: Bennett
