lines.text: Wait... Really? Really really?!

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Thank you~

I really appreciate-

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: I really...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Uh-oh.
She barfed all over the ground.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Oh... crapbaskets...

I really need to sober up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Would you prefer to retreat to safety?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Would you prefer to retreat to safety?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Nah, I'll be fine when...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: ...when I...

She barfed again, and the two deposits shimmered 
together to create a rainbow.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
I've had... much worse before. I just need to get it 
out of my system.
Bennet has joined the team!

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: So Lockhart has fallen into Imperial hands?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I imagine the High Seat in Oadthine must be 
panicking as we speak.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who exactly were you again?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
As before, I am Cainan DeClares. I am an arbiter for 
The Holy Oath's Covenant to the Mother Soul.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Arbiter"?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It would take some time to discuss in detail, but...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
You may think of me as a hand of the Covenant. I 
travel the lands to ensure that our operations in 
towns, Vaults, and the like go well.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
While I am not one to handle political affairs, this 
has certainly had it's tendrils go beyond that benign 
of a topic.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I've met a few Covenant arbiters in the past. 
They're like a fancy auditor.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: That we are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So you're an expert on all things the Goddess and 
such?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How about stuff like... the Oathbreakers?

I eyed over to Rowan, who was sitting somewhat 
to the side of the main group.

...who only took the opportunity to smile 
in response.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I certainly have a significant knowledge base to pull 
from, yes.

I assume you ask because of that sword from your 
story in Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... no. Wait, what about a sword?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
You were struck by sword with a diamond shaped 
hilt, yes? Then have felt bouts of weakness 
through your body since?
It matches a phenomena I know of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait, wait... This is some sickness I picked up. My 
father and Norde didn't have the same symptoms 
as me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I... should note that I have felt dizzy and 
lightheaded at times myself.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
"Eul'thame, the weakness cursing sword". 

Have you heard of it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Eul'thame...?

Thame had struck at the heart of the villains. Every 
weakness was an untold story to unravel the 
enemy.
So desperate to find a weakness of his brother, 
Thame had succumb to his own.

From these legends came two Oathbreakers... 
Eul'raiga and Eul'thame.

One a symbol of ideals. The other a warning, like a 
double edged sword.

That even the greatest of us have cracks that can 
consume our very being.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The legend of Thame and Raiga...?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
You've heard of that fable? It's not commonly told 
outside of the old lands anymore.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... bedtimes stories from way back, I think.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Regardless of the reality of it, the story embodies 
the nature of Eul'thame well.

It is the weakness cursing sword.

Those struck with it are cursed to be consumed by 
their greatest weakness.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
That is the law of the Goddess's domain it warps 
and defies. 

The law that establishes the wall between the
soul and the world beyond.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What? What does that even mean?

How are you so sure of that?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
One of my roles is to watch over the Vaults and 
their associated Guardians.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The what?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I suppose they are not common knowledge, are 
they?
I turned my head to glare at Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Vaults are fortresses built to protect the most 
dangerous of Oathbreakers.

Guardians are the handpicked warriors tasked with 
keeping them safe from the world outside.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Basically, this knowledge is a prerequisite to 
doing my job well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
"Consumed by their greatest weakness"... Anton, 
Ivan, and I were all struck in battle by it.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It will vary from person to person.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
For most, to be "consumed by their weakness" 
means a slow and painful death, though.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: How does one remove this curse, then?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: And a cure for this state of being?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Well... cures for it are... 

It is an Oathbreaker. Do remember that.

Perhaps manipulating the source can reverse the 
effect?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No cure, then?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: The effects may be able to be masked, as well?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grr... I...

I slammed my hands on the table and pushed 
myself to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then I'll just become strong enough that I have no 
weaknesses!

The screech of the chair I was sitting in echoed 
through the room as it fell to the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll just play by its own rules and win!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Mr. DeClares, do you know of a facility that could 
help mask the symptoms, as you said?

Maybe the Royal College in Cartenan?

Charlotte had basically ignored my outburst and 
just continued on with the conversation on her 
own.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: From this location? It is certainly your best option.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Then we'll hit two birds with one stone. We'll head 
to Cartenan for both this curse and to petition
assistance for Lockhart.
You think the Covenant would be agreeable to 
helping reclaim Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I couldn't imagine those in the Holy City wanting 
anything more than a return of the status quo.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Then let's make that two birds and a wolf with one 
stone, yeah?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What about... What about my father? The farther 
we go the harder it will be for him to follow us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Well... we do actually have protocol for this sort of 
scenario.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I will leave a coded message with the innkeeper  
here. It should inform any Nightless Crow that  
comes.
This should also apply to the others still in Rabaneau 
that I contacted before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, but how does he know to start here?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It is... not a perfect solution.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If you want to stay here and wait for him, I won't 
stop you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I... don't think...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We'll be to Cartenan as soon as we're properly 
rested and supplied.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Then we are once more headed in the same 
direction?

Perhaps we should plan this out in more detail?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Gladly.

As others stood up from their seats, I found myself 
falling back into one.

Footsteps felt distant as the group had a goal 
to follow.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dad...

I took out the locket that had been passed along 
to me.

My fingers wrapped around it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ("Consumed by your greatest weakness"...)
...and squeezed as tightly as I could.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Hm...?

You've lost your gray, old man.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Is this the core of your demise?

Your wanting... spinning in futility.

lines.speaker: Imperial Soldier
lines.text:
Sir! We've had a report that the targets have 
cleared the battlefield.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: I do not care.

lines.speaker: Imperial Soldier
lines.text: But sir, we-

The soldier fell into ground, blood pooling 
around his body.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: I. Do. Not. Care.

Seeing an opportunity, Ivan rushed towards his 
target with his lance angled for a killing blow.
And it...!

The lance stopped mid flight. The tip of steel 
served only to tap the armor of the Steel Wolf 
with the lightest touch.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I... can't...

I've already killed you once.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Hmph.

A metal clad hand raised to grab the shaft of the 
weapon.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Even as you become a phantom of those days, you 
waver on these regrets.

Your gray took your wounds with it, but not your 
weakness.

Ivan let go of the lance, leaving only one hand 
to remain with a grip on it.

The lance broke in two as the Steel Wolf's grip 
shattered the shaft of it.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: I... I can't...
Ivan faltered backwards before falling to his knees.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: I can't... be the one to kill you... not again...

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Weak.

The Steel Wolf turned on his heels to face 
the defeated Ivan.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Of your folly, that is among the least.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I failed you. I failed all of you.

I only ever wanted...

...for you all to be happy.

Tears streamed down Ivan's face as he watched 
the Steel Wolf raise his sword.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: No phantoms of your past will save you this time.
Ivan's eyes closed.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
For those sins you've conducted.

And the sins you've created.

Let you be excised.

And a better world composed from your ashes.

...

Goodbye.

I laid on the bed, and drifted to sleep with my 
hand tightly grasping the locket.

Even as my mind lost its grip on the world around,
my own grip only tightened more.

My blurry vision focused on a sight that seemed 
dream like.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What is...?

Around me stood a sea of darkness.

Stars glimmered and faded.

Islands among the abyss were barren and 
incomplete.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Am I dreaming?

A the sound of whooshing air turned my attention 
to my backside.

A silhouette had appeared from nowhere. 

It was as if it wasn't even fully formed without 
hands or feet to speak of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are you, now?

It's mouth opened, but it didn't seem capable of 
finding the words.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Can you not speak?
It gritted its teeth out of frustration.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do you want something from me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I don't know... Maybe you could mime an 
answer?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
I wish to...

I wish to protect you.

I didn't know what to make of it, so I rubbed my 
eyes.

The silhouette had disappeared as quickly as it 
appeared.

Bewildered, I rubbed my eyes again.

But this time... 

...I woke up.

lines.speaker: Clock
lines.text:
*Tick*

*Tick*

*Tick*
My heart beated to the tick of the clock.

Quiet breaths formed the chorus to stand beside it. 
It was a calm and peaceful chorus.

For my part, I stared at the ceiling with my 
thoughts being washed away by the melody.

lines.speaker: Clock
lines.text:
*Tick*

*Tick*

*Tick*

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Oh, sorry. 

Anton, right? You're still here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm... sick, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I should keep rested.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Actually, maybe you should...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's what you said, right? Illness?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Do you still feel weak?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A little, maybe. Can't say I feel like moving.

I shifted my sleeve over my eyes to block out the 
light.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Get up. Let me check you over. Maybe that will 
settle your mind?

After some prodding, I did eventually place myself 
on my own two feet again.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Hmm...

Mariel sized up my body and took out a tape 
measure. I lifted my arms to my side so she 
could have room to work.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Arm length... hair length... They both seem the 
same.

At least since that first change after Norde
and the soldiers saved you two.

She quickly jotted down the numbers on a sheet 
of paper.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where did you even learn all this?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Along with healing magic, I learned the 
fundamentals of medicine when I was at the 
academy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Academy"

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Theodal Royal College. I attended there as a 
student.

I've actually been considering going back for a 
couple years of advanced courses in the field.

Mariel took the tape measure and wrapped it 
around my waist.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That's about the same, too...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So that's... like a school, or something?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah... do you not...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I've not been to a school since Sunday school.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Even back then it was just when I could. We were 
always on the move.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not stupid or anything. I was given plenty of 
lessons by Norde, Satia, and... my father.
Both of our eyes drifted to the side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How's... he doing?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Much better, I think. Miraculous given what all
happened to him, even.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
But it can be difficult to understand the extent of 
internal injuries, so we can't be too cautious.

After she was finished with measurements of my 
waist, she started to go a bit lower.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh! Y- You don't need to check there.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I was measuring your thighs.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: My, oh my...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right... My bad.
Mariel wrote down the last of her measurements.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Everything seems to be the same as last time I 
checked.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess my rest must be killing it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll just head back to bed, then.

I started to slink back into bed before I felt a tug 
on my sleeve.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Actually, I was thinking...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Maybe it'd be a good idea to get you some new 
clothes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Those clearly don't fit you anymore.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're fine.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: They're clearly not.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I already had the exam. Just let me sleep.
My body crawled back into the bed.

title: Ch 3-4's Supply Run - If Satia alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Do I need to get... what's her name? The pink 
haired lady?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
She doesn't seem like she'd be happy with you 
ignoring your caretaker's orders.
I popped up back to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sure. We can do clothes. Shopping. Whatever.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It'll be fun!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
And an active mind and body means a healthy mind 
and body, so...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I get it.

We turned into the main lobby of the inn and some 
familiar faces were there to greet us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sleeping beauty rises?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha ha...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup? Is it okay for him to be out of bed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm fine. Just need to go out for something.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Really? That's a reason to celebrate then?

Satia jumped me with a hug, and my pleas for her 
to stopped were muffled in her cleavage.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hwhhh! Stwww ki!
(Hey! Stop it!)

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Whatever was going through his system seems to 
have stopped.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
We we're actually going to buy some
new clothes.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: That's a great idea.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You know... With you being a little smaller and with 
longer hair, I think I have an idea for a cute-
I pushed away from Satia and freed myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
N- No time for all that. We need to not spend too 
much time, money, or thought on it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No need to be that stingy over it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: But-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're good with our plan.

Princess, let's go.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*

title: Ch 3-4's Supply Run - If Satia Dead

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Do I need to get... what's his name? That grumpy 
guy?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That does sound like a pain)

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
He doesn't seem like he'd be happy with you 
ignoring your caretaker's orders.
I got back up to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fine. You win.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It'll be fun!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
And an active mind and body means a healthy mind 
and body, so...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I get it.

We turned into the main lobby of the inn and some 
familiar faces were there to greet us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sleeping beauty rises?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha ha...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Feeling better, then?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Whatever was going through his
system seems to have stopped.

We we're actually going to buy some
new clothes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That's good to hear. I wonder what sort of 
selection this place would have?

I've never shopped here before, but it's not that 
far from Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Me neither, but I heard from-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- Please don't over complicate this.

It's just some better fitting clothes.

We need to not spend too much time, money, or 
thought on it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No need to be so stingy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's not your coin purse.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Princess, let's go.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: C

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: P

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: M

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: C

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: P

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: M

I turned the corner towards the door to make my 
way out of the Inn.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I said I didn't need anymore help.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You said for the "princess" to follow you. You didn't 
say which.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Plus, it sounds fun.

I was about to say something when a figure 
carrying several bags turned the corner in front 
of us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
A retinue of princesses, it seems?

Should I assume your health is improved, Anton?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, we were just heading out to buy some-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good, then here.
A small list was pushed into my hands.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What's this?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Supplies. You can acquire the 2nd batch while 
you're out.

The others should be able to supplement your loss 
in strength, yes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I'm not any weaker.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm...

Norde just walked by me without an additional 
word.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dammit. That guy sometimes.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I mean, you should be weaker since you loss some 
muscle mass, right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Not that we have a good comparison from before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll go back to the inn. I swear I will.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Fine, fine.
Back behind our path, Norde placed his bags down.

He rubbed his shoulders as though they were sore 
from carrying them.

In a short while, we found ourselves at the local 
tailor's shop.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Now that I think on it, why are you two even 
here?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: To help?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's just clothes. I'll probably just get a new shirt 
and pants anyways.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Why do I get the feeling you're not exactly up to 
date on fashion?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I've higher priorities than "fashion".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Plus, what help are you two? I need to try on stuff 
to see what fits best now myself.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I have your measurements right here?

Mariel held up her notepad from the check-up 
before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh- I...
My mouth just held itself agape.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Nice job, sis.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Now, then. We'll grab some stuff. You go wait over 
there. Any type you want?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, no. I'm not agreeing to-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Not gonna work.

Last chance. Want anything in particular? Or we'll 
just pick out a nice dress for you.
Fumbling out words in a slight panic, I said...

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Something classy / Something with personality / Something cool

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... I don't know. Something like what I have. With 
a coat and the basics.

Just... simple and... I guess classy, okay?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... I don't know. Something like what I have. With 
a coat and the basics.

Just... something with personality, I guess?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... I don't know. Something like what I have. With 
a coat and the basics.

Just... something cool? Like a mercenary would 
wear?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's plenty for us to go on.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: We'll get you something nice.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But...

I reached out, but I felt my motivation to resist 
slowly crumble. It wasn't long before I moved to a 
changing room.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grr...
I sat in a changing room getting impatient.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Girls, you there?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Someone's got no patience.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You know what? 

Let's not make him wait any longer if he's in that 
much of a rush.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: But what about the cut? It isn't meant for...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm sure it'll fit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Girls...? Are you...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah!

The changing room curtain opened to show 
Charlotte and Mariel outside with a shirt in hand.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Nice enthusiasm. Happy to hear you're so 
raring to go on this now.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
We'll go get you a few coat options while you try 
that on.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Something nice and classy, then?

It'll go well with a white shirt, heheheh...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Something with a little flair, then?

It'll go well with a white shirt, heheheh...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Something cool and makes you look like you mean 
business, then?

It'll go well with a white shirt, heheheh...

Charlotte's sinister laugh was clearly in jest, but it 
still gave me an uneasy feeling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... J- Just get on with it already, won't you?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
We'll be right back! You can try on the shirt while 
we're away.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Let us know if- ...if anything seems off.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... Let's get this over with.
I undressed and threw on the shirt they brought.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (A little... tight around the waist?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, this feels a bit... off.

With my sigh, my feet brought me over to look in 
the mirror.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- What?

(That looks...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I didn't recognize myself at first...)

The changes were small, but they were enough to 
make me feel like I saw a different person entirely 
when I first looked in the mirror.
It was my first real time that I looked at the 
changes in depth. Especially so to have it 
without my normal gear.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(At first I thought I saw a girl... well, a boyish girl, 
but...)

My tightened fist loosened as I raised it to touch 
the glass.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Are those my nipples sticking out?)

My other hand raised to feel my chest.

There wasn't much there, but my focus on it made 
me hyperaware of a feeling below each nipple.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's like a tight... hard feeling.)

Thoughts raced through my mind, but they kept 
returning to my first impression.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Looked like a girl... looked like a girl...)

I shook my head as I tried to rid myself of the 
thought.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No, I don't. I don't... I... don't...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, no no no... I'm still me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Y- Yeah... I'm still... I'm still me.

This shirt just fits... oddly.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How do you like this-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Are you sure you don't want measurements around 
there?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- Why aren't you wearing any pants!?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why are- Why...

I ducked behind a dresser in the room to hide 
myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's a changing room!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We only gave you a shirt!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who cares!? Get out!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't need new clothes. I don't need anything 
new.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
But those clothes don't fit. What if it gets worse, 
still?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- No Way. It won't.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If anything I'll make sure it reverses. It's just a 
matter of training.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- Who needs new clothes at that point?! 
It's just a waste of money!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: But...
I stormed off and left the two princesses behind.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh no, don't go~ 

Mariel was definitely about to get through to you.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Why'd you have to go into the changing room?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hmph. I wasn't in the wrong, and I can wait for his 
apology to me.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
*Sigh*... A waste of a day. Who knows how much 
time we have left before they start looking for us
here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah, well. I had fun, at least.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I mean...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: A little... I guess.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Maybe we'll get a chance to try again in the 
future?
STAGE DIRECTION> CHAPTER 12 START
STAGE DIRECTION> BLACK SCREEN, NO MUSIC
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES
Click
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> HARD CUT TO BG CAMP_INSIDE W/
SPOTLIGHT EFFECT
STAGE DIRECTION> (NEED NEW BG EDIT FOR THIS)
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE INVESTIGATION

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Mm...

Nora sat on a rudimentary chair with her hands and feet
securely bound.

The hot light of a magical lamp created the main light
source in the room as it shone down.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Name, homeland, occupation.
Norde sat across from her.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Nora Nicollet. Lockhart. Mercenary.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mercenary for the Empire.
Charlotte stepped into the edges of the light.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Mercenary for liberating Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Because Imperials are the epitome of freedom and
liberty.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: They've done it before.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yes, from the Emerald Empire.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The same can be said for most of the continent.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Lockhart, included.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What we need to know...

...is what the Empire is planning.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We can wait.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
...

I'm not an Imperial.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So they didn't trust her enough to tell her.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I won't betray Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Too late.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: For which of us is it too late, Princess?
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

The two stared at each other, daggers pointed at each
others' souls.

STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE AND NARRATION
STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The question we want answered isn't-
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE SUSPENSE 1

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What did they offer you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Miss Stewart, we don't need to engage in-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's fine. I'm used to her random jabs at this point.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So... what was the price of selling out Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You mean, "what was the price of the traitors' heads?"

The price of the cretins who stomp all over an entire
city to line their pockets with gold?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Stop. We can't-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Who are you to try and speak for the people of Lockhart
after you brought war to its streets?!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
What do you think those streets are paved with?

It's the blood, sweat, and tears of everyone BUT you.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You've never seen a friend go to work one day and not
return, have you?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What...?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
An "accident".

At the docks. The factory. The proving grounds.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Swept aside, and the next desperate soul steps up to
fill their place.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What? No, I've seen those reports and those numbers
were down.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Listen to the words coming out of your mouth.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You don't see us as people, do you?

Who do you think are desperate enough to take those
jobs?

The nekolyn, caizlyn, einlyn...
Nora turned to Norde.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Taikolyn and plenty of mixed, too.
Norde sat in their calm and did not take the bait.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I was lucky enough to work my way into a mercenary
core.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Yet still I'm forced to watch family - siblings - be at
their mercy.

The mercy of your vile parents.

At your mercy.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 200 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Raargh!

Charlotte turned on her heel and disappeared into the
shadows.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Good riddance.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 240 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG (DLC) CAMP (EVENING)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
###### If Mariel Alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...they're taking a long time.

Are they...?
STAGE DIRECTION> ################
STAGE DIRECTION> TENT OPEN FLAP SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES

Charlotte burst out of the tent, and she strutted
angrily past those standing outside.
###### If Mariel Alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: ...? Charlotte?

Mariel broke into a trot as she tried to catch up to
Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Did it go... poorly?
STAGE DIRECTION> ###########
Charlotte stopped.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES
###### If Mariel Alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I heard bits and pieces.

"Lockhart"... "Parents"...

..."Nekolyn"...

Mariel opened her mouth to continue, but she struggled
to say the next words.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Sis, you know I think you're the best person to lead
Lockhart.

I would never try to...

Mariel trailed off, and the two stood there in silence
for several seconds.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Mariel, I love you.

I don't deserve...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I love you, too.

Mariel started to take a step forward to hug Charlotte,
but Charlotte turned a step away.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

And Charlotte's shoulders pitched up and down as she
tried to control her breathing.
########### If not alive

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Inhale
...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

And Charlotte's shoulders pitched up and down as she
tried to control her breathing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Mariel... Mom... Dad...

I love you. I do.

She breathed out, and her hand jittered as she resisted
tightening it into a fist.
STAGE DIRECTION> ################
STAGE DIRECTION> .........
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG (DLC) CAMP (EVENING)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Exhale
...

She took a breath once more, and a few more of those
seemed to settle her heart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We will save Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No matter who we need to save it from.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> HARD CUT TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> CHAPTER CARD SHOWS
STAGE DIRECTION> CHAPTER TWELVE

STAGE DIRECTION> BORDER UNTO TRUTH
-----------------------------------
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE STRATEGY 1
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO MAP

STAGE DIRECTION> PUP IS ON IT, AND IT TOWARDS THE LAST
POINT IN CREKSKIA

Our group had managed to subdue the forward attack team
sent by the pursuing imperial force.
Nora, the mercenary leading it, was now in our custody.

She was not alone. We kept a handful of the enemies
prisoners for the sake of extracting info on the
Empire's plans.

Actions like attacking the Kingdom of Cartenan or
stealing Oathbreakers from Vaults were still
unexplained.

We dragged along the prisoners that seemed to have a
better chance of having answers.

And the others were left by to be handled by the
village of Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
From what they told us, the other troops were stripped
of their military gear and sent home with a sack of
supplies.

We Nightless Crows headed south as we continued on our
journey towards the Republic of Rabaneau.
STAGE DIRECTION> MOVE PUP TOWARDS THE BORDER

If the main force of Imperial troops was still chasing
us, we had days of time on them.
So we continued to seek out allies for Lockhart.

Without the Kingdom, the Republic was the best
alternative.

A hesitance was born from the Republic being the
Empire's actual enemy in this war.

They had a vested interest but far from an impartial
one or one that could not ask for much as a cost.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Lockhart will not be some vassal state to a waring
nation that wants a trade port.
Our journey was not at it's end.
But...
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
The mountains of Nolvanus were a distant memory.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE WHISTLINGWINDS

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG (DLC) BG016 PLAIN WITH A
FEW TREES (NEW BG) (DAY)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ugh...

Charlotte let out a tired moan to the tempo of the
convo's step.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Are you feeling well? You've not come down with an
illness, have you?

Kara leaned a bit from her horse, as though trying to
get a closer look at Charlotte over on her horse.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah. Just... tired.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The investigation?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Mayhap it be sleeping in the same camp as people who
wish to kill you?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Maybe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or... we've all just been through...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yawn
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...we've all just been through a lot lately.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I would say other events explain your own tiredness.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Maybe.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You've sharpened your intuitions, Alexei. It is a
pleasure to see you blossom so.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I thank you, dear Kara.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But I do sincerely wish I could flex those muscles in a
happier times.
As the words came out, it resonated with many of us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Well, it's not like we're in a bad situation.)

(We've got a straight shot to the Republic, and we've
got prisoners to extract info from.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Then again...)
I turned my head to the other three's horses.

Each of their gazes were turned away from one another
in a blend of anxiety and thoughtful trances.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We haven't really... done much.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(How much closer are we to actually helping Lockhart
since we left?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We've questions. And more questions. And...)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What a voluptuous look upon our dear Pup's face?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One of those words don't fit.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I simply mean to suggest that you've more notable
reasons that would disturb your sleep recently.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: How have you adapted to not sleeping on your front?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I didn't do that before anyways...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I had been meaning to ask.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You've been more somber since we left Crekskia.

How are you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fine... I'm me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Whatever that is, at the end of the day, that'll keep
being true.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You don't need to worry on that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I feel like I've heard that speech before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, not like I meant it, then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Back then I was just trying to push it to the side. It
was just me giving up on it and focusing on doing the
job.

In reality, I'm still... well...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm still... me...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That's inevitably going to require me to face the job
we need to do as me, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...whatever that means about who that 'me' is and
what... implications are attached to it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Like the two hardy breasts that accompany you on that
journey?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Rowan...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No... it's fine...
I looked down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: These are me. A part of me.
Their weight was an ever present sensation.
Each trot of the horse reminded me of them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're not going to just disappear...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is good that Pup is embracing being self-reflective
and not rejecting herself.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...what do you mean by that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am not blind. Nor were you all.

Regardless of the specifics, Pup danced between stances
of wishes and 'would-be's.

One is not obligated to face their true self.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Nor can one be forced to take that road of self-
reflection.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But everyone does deserve to love oneself.

And the first step of such an endeavor is to let
oneself be their true self.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Right...

Charlotte turned away and her daggered stare was
removed from Rowan.

Her hat seemed to settled down, as though the tension
escaped with the air pressure.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I am proud of you, Alexei. To be able to say those
words.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You are one of the shoulders I stand atop of, my dear
friend.

The two smiled at each other, but Rowan returned to his
serious demeanor when he turned back towards me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Pup... Anton...

You've road ahead of you.

No matter where that road takes you... No matter what
you learn about it's destination...

I will support you in that, to the ends of Ilvanis.

Whether that be defying the Goddess herself to undo
that curse, or otherwise.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I think that's a beautiful sentiment.
### if Satia alive

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You have allies from all over the world it seems. Not
to mention the Crows like Satia.
#### If not

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You have allies from all over the world it seems. Not
to mention the Crows.
STAGE DIRECTION> ##############
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
Kara, with a beaming smile, turned towards me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'd be happy to count myself amongst those allies.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: What do you...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...what do you... think...?
Kara's words had trailed off in my perception of them.
The word slipped quietly out of my mouth.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap our dear Pup delved into her own reflection?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Even moreso, could she be daydreaming of a new
warbdrobe?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Stranger tides have turned before this day...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Very funny. This outfit works well enough when
tailored. I'm used to it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You say such things...

lines.speaker: Rowan

Charlotte was still gripping the elastic of her hat.
Though...

...without losing that grip, her aura changed from a

Her horse had sensed her unease, and the two lost
ground on the rest of us.
So...
Charlotte was left by herself and her thoughts.

lines.text:

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
All we did was take the lid off the boiling pot.

Every worker, from homlyns to non- homlyns, would

All the parasites your family surrounded themselves

lines.speaker: Nora

lines.speaker: Nora

The prodigal younger sister... the 'better' sister...

lines.speaker: Nora

Nora said it smugly, as though she knew Charlotte

But Charlotte stayed stone-faced. She listened
carefully, neither admitting nor denying it.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:

Anyone and everyone.

Lockhart is your enemy.

You are the enemy of Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

lines.text:
Years of that lie...

Of not being worthy from what even I thought

We should've...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No. That's not it.

I should have. Not we.

Because, in the end...

I AM the enemy.

I am the enemy of Lockhart.

After spending the morning training up our advance
unit, we arrived on scene.

As we did, we found the Fort approach to be a
combination of the plains and hills we had seen so far.

The mines weren't readily apparent, but we could see a
scattering of beasts and remnant soldiers.

(They're still probably around from previous fights in

Hmm...
I turned to our group.

And... what would it make me if I was equipped to help
and decided to throw the task onto someone else for the
sake of my safety?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Sigh
...

lines.speaker: Charlotte

perturbed by it enough to retreat.
Not yet.

I turned to Charlotte.
She was stone-faced. She was determined.

So I turned forward again.

Another rumble.

Watcha think it was?

I swear to goodness if there's another one of those

Both were fixated out towards the battlefield.
Behind the two...

...were a couple of the captive Imperial soldiers and
hired mercenaries that had been interrogated.

I sure hope not. I can't imagine the Goddess would be

lines.text: Huh?!
STAGE DIRECTION> DEFEAT SE

lines.text: Ugh!

Finally... they shut the fuck up.
He started messing with his bindings...
I think I know where they were holdin' the rest of us.

There you go.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Thank you.

So, should we head over to the Imperial base?

That... or we could go home to Lockhart and regroup.

lines.text: I'm okay, Mariel.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But you have to do that, too, sis!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Investigative sniff
...
Jakson was helping sniff out mines.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're such a good dog~
I was close by, guiding him.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
...

Investigative sniff
...?
...and before I knew it, he was sniffing me instead.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Huh...?

Is something wrong?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Curious whine
...

lines.speaker: Pup

Satisfied bark
~

lines.speaker: Rowan

Well, do just keep an eye on Pup. She may not enjoy it,

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So how about you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What about me?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The pup and me ain't the only ones who got hit by the
curse here.

You're subject numero tres.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So, ya got questions?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The pup also isn't the only one I'm an elder to, ya
know?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
You've clearly been around the part, but I've got a
couple decades at least on ya.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya know I am just trying to help.

lines.text:

lines.speaker: Otis

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Sigh
... Borin'

lines.text:
Hmm...

So... that mercenary learned how to disarm them in...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Don't.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Don't think of going to the crusades yourself.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Who are you to tell me that?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Someone from the other side of that graveyard.

No matter what your Covenant tells you, there is no
honor to be won there.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Only what might deteriorate your humanity.
Reagyn stumbled for the second, but soon enough...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I was only offering idling thoughts.

I do not need the opinions of a man from the Emerald
Empire.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: As you say, ma'am.

You seem quite knowledgable despite being so far from

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:

let me travel.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Is that so? I assume it was limited to political

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:

time.

I'd be happy to give your recommendations on
restaurants if you ever are planning a vacation.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: I'd appreciate that.

With my vision wavering in and out, I moved to clear

And with a grunt, I pushed myself up to a sitting

lines.text: (Metal...)

A cold feeling pulsated through my hand as I used it to

The ground was cold, and - distinctly - metallic.

lines.text: What is this...?
I turned to Charlotte's voice.
She was safe.
Even her hat stayed on, as though a miracle.

To remove its enemies so we can all pursue the city's

For everyone.

The battle was over.
We had won.

And with a pause...
She turned back to us.
With a gentle smile on her face.

Charlotte's truth was on full display.

Her ears stayed stable atop her head, determination

Never.

I was supposed to take this truth to the grave.

My parents loved me too much to take away my birthright

No matter what happened. No matter how many times I

Even when I had a genius little sister who did

They never stopped trusting in my ability to care for

Trusting me to love Lockhart just as they did.

Burn the Stewart legacy to the ground, and make sure I

If this is the path I must take to save Lockhart, then

lines.speaker: Charlotte

So long as Lockhart is safe and thrives, I'd like to

A soldier ran into the throne room, and he was holding

"This message is sent in good faith, as the oathbearers
of the Goddess may attest."

"In the name of the Goddess, we call for peace in these
lands. We are prepared to push for this reality."

"In one week from the appointed delivery of this
message, the Oadthine cathedral shall be designated
location."

"We formally invite all parties of this conflict to a
seat at the negotiating table."

"Under the guiding light of the Goddess, we shall make
peace and prosperity for all her people."
The Republic soldier closed the scroll.

lines.text: What do you make of it?

It is as she predicted.

They have been busy. The both of them.

lines.text:

Will the Republic send a representative?

Hmm...

I shall attend myself.

I imagine she will attend as well.

It would be unbecoming of our nation's grand project if

What cretin crawled behind my back to stab me so!

pant

I shall attend this summit.

The Empire is eternal. Our sun will never set.

Your answer... Does that mean you have an idea of who

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
...

I still have my trump card.

T- That's... How did a chasm get that big!?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We assume it is a result of the landmines making the
ground unstable.

Lockhart has been digging underground tunnels for
trains to travel through.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A... tactic. To levy surprise attacks across the
warring countries.
That's... nuts. How do they think of that stuff?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Most importantly... What do you figure may happen when
the tunnel goes beneath the minefield?

That... big chasm over there?

Should we send people in?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Once they realize we know, they will detonate
explosives to seal the tunnel.
Right... Yeah, that makes sense.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Thank you for receiving us on such short notice despite
that.

Y- Yeah... princess of the trade city and all. Seemed
like a no brainer.

.........

Actually, do you know?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Know what?

We just received word this morning. There's going to be
a peace summit.

I can't imagine the princess of Lockhart wouldn't be
invited.

Oadthine. The Holy City of the West.

We got word that we needed to create a safe route to

Yeah. It must be serious if the legendary Kaeden

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes. It is a well informed conclusion to come to.

.........

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then... we shall meet the Prime Director there.

lines.speaker: Kara

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Such... tiring work, this.
Cainan sat in the halls of the grand cathedral.

He stared out the window as he watched the sun set in
the distance.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: To move the hearts and wills of giants themselves...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: We shall all sit down together for the sake of peace.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It is but a dream to those embroiled in this hundred
year war.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Moved to reality by these very hands.

One would call it a miracle.

Others the will of the Goddess.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
But those who saw it done will say it be what it truly
is.
He turned his head to within the halls.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Now, my fellow traveler on this path.

What would you call it?
STAGE DIRECTION> .........

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: No need to be shy.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: What would you call it?
STAGE DIRECTION> .........

lines.text: Inevitable.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: And that is the correct answer.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: This reminds me of when I tutored you in your youth.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Such nostalgic days, those were.

Cainan got to his feet without an ounce of fear in his
movement.

After a few more steps, he laid his hand down on the
Steel Wolf's shoulder, giving it a firm pat.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I trust you shall fulfill your role in this...
agreement?

lines.speaker: Wolf
lines.text: I shall.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: We shall expect the Empire to attend? Emperor and all?

lines.speaker: Wolf
lines.text: They will.

Wolf's hand settled on the Oathbreaker sword sheathed
at his hip.

lines.speaker: Wolf
lines.text: They are a slave to their weakness.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Splendid.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It has been nothing but a pleasure, as usual.

Cainan casually and gracefully returned to the window
seat he called home but a minute before.
...and the Steel Wolf turned as well.
Exiting the scene.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Hahaha...

What a glorious path we tread upon.

To lead us to here.

Where we are but steps from the ascent...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: ...to the finale.

Full recognition to ya gents and ladies.

But it was a fine bout. Mayhap you be happy with

lines.text: She just tried to kill us.

lines.text: Hmm... I suppose...

lines.text:
It's no worry. I figure after that I ought to give you
