lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: A good drink goes a long way.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap it still be... inadvisable?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It could be a ploy to let our guards down, after all.
Cainan, Norde, and others were still at the ready.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Do what ya please. Can't say I didn't offer.

Otis slumped back, still hurt, into leaning on the 
large axe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
She said she "unified" the local pirates?

So... if we take this nekolyn out now, then we'd 
be free to negotiate with any pirate ship in the 
bay?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ah. That'd probably work, lassie.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Alternatively, just get one of them drunk enough 
to say yes, hahaha!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Stop calling me that.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Call you...? Did I call you something?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Lassie". I'm no girl.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya don't say...?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I feel ya. Can hit ya in the gut, but have ya 
considered the option of... ya know?

Otis made a chopping motion around the hair to 
signal "cut it".

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: I've... uh... got a blade if ya need one.

Otis smiled and leaned more into the axe as a 
crutch.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'd appreciate us not breaking our last pair of 
scissors on that like before.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ah. Yes. The ever inflating scissors budget after it 
just broke last time.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh? Now you've got me confused.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I got a disease and-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait.

I rubbed my temples as I sorted through correcting 
myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I got cursed by... a sword. An Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Argh! What are we doing? This is your last chance 
to stand down entirely.

The axe tumbled to the ground as Otis stood up 
straight.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: It got ya too, then? That damned sword?

Otis dragged us to a nearby tavern.

I found myself sitting there, water in hand, as Otis 
gulped down another shot.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ah~! That really hits the spot.

I'll gladly ferry ya lot across the bloody sea. You can 
have my axe at your side, too.

Would love a chance at revenge. Figured that 
sword had disappeared entirely!

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It truly is a small world.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I thought the name Grayson sounded familiar.

The Grayson Maritime Shipping company? Based out 
of Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Formerly the boss of that sorry bunch, yep.

Feels like a lifetime ago.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Not that they're even a large company. I've only 
ever heard of them in passing.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heh. So they fell out of the success I created? 
Suppose the punishment suits the crime.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
It was... oh, about a decade ago when that 
blasted sword changed me.

I just stared at the glass of water in my hand and 
didn't move a muscle.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Not a soul of friend or family believed I was even 
me. Forced me out onto the streets.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A nekolyn as a player in a notable Lockhart 
company would be... a sight to behold.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ha! That it would. You can give credit to that 
blasted curse for the ears on my head.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Used to have a beard longer than my ship hand 
down below, even.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
That would mean you were not originally a nekolyn 
or a woman, yes?

The curse of Eul'thame is to be consumed by your 
greatest weakness.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
So the blade has a name and a little fairy tale to go 
with it?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
It all tracks, I guess. A decade ago I was... a bit of 
an asshole about nekos and the fairer folk.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: A brilliant asshole, but a bloody asshole nonetheless.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Such sounds... unpleasant.

Ripples began forming in my glass's water from my 
shaking hand.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Then, lass-

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: *Clears throat*

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Then... laddie. How far along are ya?

Otis had slumped down in a stupor and turned my 
way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't know... far enough.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: He shrank some. Plus the hair growth.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I said... far enough.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're headed to Cartenan to fix it. This is as far as 
this thing goes.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Have you gotten any cravings yet?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: C- Cravings...? For what? Food?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh.
Otis made a slide whistle type noise.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: The mast and the seaman playing lookout up top.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you implying?!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Cock. Semen.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Might be an acquired taste, though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you trying to make me angry?!
I jumped to my feet and started raising my voice.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're heading to Cartenan to fix this. I'm not going 
to deal with you- you...!

My hand jammed into the countertop to catch 
myself from falling.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Are you okay?! Are you dizzy again?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Another flash of dizziness?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm... I'm fine. Just need to... lay down for a little.

I pushed myself off of the counter and hurriedly 
made my way out of the room.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I should check on him.
Satia jumped her own feet and followed.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: So...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Could he really... stop liking women and like... 
well... guys...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Could he really... start to like... that stuff?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Depends on how the lassie handles it.

Like the blokes? Like the gals? Like both? Who 
knows?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Personally I've become a fan of partaking in all the 
pleasures of the material world.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Here here!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The boy can make a mess of things fairly easily. I 
wouldn't rule anything out.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: It'll all work itself out somehow.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
No matter how. We've still got some revenge to 
enact, yeah?
Otis was recruited!

The door closed as a pressure was building in my 
chest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*...

It was like a lump or knot had been there for a 
while, but now...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is this what... I think it is...?

I could feel my shirt start to stretch from the 
pressure.

More pressure... more pressure..!

And then...

It stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*...

I looked down to see my chest area converted 
from buds to proper breasts.

They wasn't enough there before to be 
noticable under my baggy coat and shirt.

But now I could feel pressure up against the 
oversized shirt. They had grown to make up
the difference, it seemed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shit... shit shit shit...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Pup? Are you okay? 

...Anton?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not again...

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
And introducing the guests to Lockhart!

I present, of the Nolvanus Empire, Emperor Alexei 
IV and Empress Inessa.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: My lord and lady. Welcome to Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Ah. What is that smell? Are you trying to kill us?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
My dearest apologies.

We've yet to find the time to fumigate the 
residence from the previous rodents that had lived
here.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Rodents? How vile.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: Who is this man?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Let me introduce Simon Evanston, proprietor of the 
Evanston Trading Company.

He is the man assigned to managing the city after 
the liberation.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Of which I must offer my highest levels of gratitude 
for!

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
The mismanagement of the Stewarts before I... 
Well, it had left us with an air of disrepair.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: We welcome the Empire with open arms!

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: So he was the rotting thing I smelled.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: I'm... sure you'll find my skills quite invaluable.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: Then... the Stewarts... They are no more?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Unfortunately, a couple of them initially escaped our 
raid.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
The Republic showed up before we could take the 
daughters into custody when searching for them.

Scouts were still trying to confirm their heading 
when I left to report the situation.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: Then that means...

Alexei IV turned towards a figure standing in the 
corner of the throne room.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: It means you failed.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
What little difference a fancy title from the 
Crusades makes.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Did you expect any different?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Ah! If I may interject?

The emperor swiveled his head to the man, but 
the Steel Wolf stayed locked onto the emperor.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
This may be a blessing in disguise.

You see. Rodents as they were, the Stewarts 
always had sway and support enough to keep them 
in power.
A transition without that is inevitable to be... 
messy.

With the princess still alive, we have an opportunity 
to leverage it.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: And how do you propose such a measure be done?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Marriage, of course.

I'm well acquainted with the princess Charlotte. 
The one you are likely aware of.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
Hmm...

Do what you need to, then.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: What else is to there to report?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Sir...

Ruslan went into detail about the encounter with 
Rabaneau.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
The "Storm Ram"? Is that another crusader or 
guardian?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Formerly.

Ivan Baranov gained the Storm Ram title during his 
time in the crusades.

He later took up a Covenant guardianship.

As for that... might you remember that scandal at 
Crekskia over a decade ago?

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Hmm... That long ago?

The empress pressed her finger to her lips as she 
struggled to remember.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: Where was Crekskia, again?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: That's a town in the empire, right?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Yes. Towards the northwest. It has a Covenant 
Vault hidden there.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
Ah! Was that when a man had killed his entire 
family before fleeing?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
As a summary, that is accurate.

We have confirmed the fugitive has been killed 
after all this time.

The empress clapped her hands in glee over being 
able to remember it correctly.

While listening, the emperor turned his head back 
towards the Steel Wolf.
The emperor turned back to Ruslan.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
And of Cartenan, General Ruslan? Have they made 
a move?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Nothing, yet.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: Then we will make it first.

The emperor turned on his heel and walked up to 
the Steel Wolf.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: Do not fail this time.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
...

Yes, sir.

With that affirmation, the emperor started to walk 
out of the room only to stop in whispering distance 
of General Ruslan.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
If either of them step out of line even a little, kill 
them.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Of course, sir.

The emperor continued on his way out of the 
governor's mansion.
A familiar visage came before my sight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This dream again...?

I turned around to catch the sight of what I
expected to see.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And you again, too?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean... What are you?
I... do not know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How could you not know who or what you are? 
Amnesia?
Such does not feel right.

I simply know... I wish to protect you.

No more. No less.

Other thoughts are fleeting instincts.

I simply wish to protect.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Fat load of good you're doing there.

*Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

It... does sort of remind me of a story I once 
heard, though.
A story...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
A bedtime story about an old warrior called "Aegis". 
A mythical protector of the downtrodden.

He had a selfless instinct like no other.

He was a wall that none could ever climb.
A shining shield atop the hill.
How... familiar.
Such a thought feels... nostalgic... and right.

If you wish to call me a name, "Aegis" will do for 
now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well, that's a lofty expectation you're taking on 
with that name.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: I will...

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: No, I must live up to it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What a weird... whatever you are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I wonder... if this is a dream... is he my imagination 
or...?)

If you don't know what you are... could you be 
connected to this curse I have?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Might... this be your fault?
I briefly motioned to the new weight on my chest.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: A curse...?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
For all the words and sentiments of yours that have 
rung a nostalgic tune...

That one does not.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Maybe I'll be able to remember this dream 
a bit better when I wake up this time, at least.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not that you've helped me understand it any 
better.

Hmm...

I looked at his ethereal body. Bits and pieces of it 
were transparent or non-existent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's like he's not entirely there?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
In many ways... you're sort of like a child. A 
newborn, even.
I had blinked.

I blinked again.

But this time, the stirring of awakening took me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Welcome, welcome~

I see you are the delightful 'would be' fiancé of my 
dear friend?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
What an annoying sound. Has the princess fallen so 
low as to spend time associating with such 
paupers?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But wait until you see my wedding gift before you 
demean my station!

It shall be a exquisite meal of 'Flambé of Simon'.

The chef's recommendation? Well done. Allow me 
to add some char to our cooking time~

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Oh, the lovely Princess Mariel?

I am happy to see you've survived this long.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: I did not even...

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Princess Mariel. Many said you were a better 
candidate as an heir.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Perhaps...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
You are a smart young woman. Don't
simply just-

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Hmph... Very well. You were disposable anyways.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Heheh... What shall I make you do first?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh, I can think of a few idea.

Most having to do with you begging me for mercy.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Ah, that arrogance. I only wish I could've seen it 
get cracked when your intolerable parents died.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Even when they're dead... you still can't rise above 
them, can you?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Heheh...

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
So you're the little gnats that stopped the Lockhart 
plan from working to perfection.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Heheh... I'll have fun getting some revenge.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Urgh... That hurt, you damned gnats!

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
I cannot see this to it's end, can I?

Fine, I will fall back. Finish this you sorry lot!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This guy... we've seen him before... He was in 
Lockhart, wasn't he?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(And he's quick and dangerous, too... Though a bit 
much on the pretty boy spectrum to be 
too dangerous though.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe if I was able to get a larger burst to strike 
quicker? Like if my legs were a notch stronger...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Actually, I wonder... This 'curse'... could I use it to 
my advantage? To get my sea legs under me?)

I prepared my sword as the enemy swordsman and 
I locked eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Now, watch his movements... I'll fight 
methodically. Maybe... Maybe to an extreme 
extent. To force this curse to work for me.)
(If it's my "weaknesses", maybe I need to really 
convince myself in a moment that it is a 
weakness?)

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
So you all are still up and running smoothly, are 
you?

...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Can anyone else do their job for once?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Nrgh... This is... not going well.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: This is a lost battle, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Ah, whatever, strategic retreat then? Not like that 
guy is the one paying me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What are these people doing here at this hour?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Merchants attacking pirates?

Not the sight ya want to see with a hangover.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: What? Why isn't their ship set aflame?

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.text:
Well, we could only rush so many people to get 
here for the daybreak attack...

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Then finish the job.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Or would you like to see what I do to failures? 
Being paid would be the least of your worries.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ugh... Oh no. Him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You know him?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: He appears to be leading this attack.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Simon Evanston. Rodent extraordinaire.

He's been worming his way into getting influence in 
Lockhart for decades.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Ah, my dearest Charlotte! There you are.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: I have come to save you, my dear.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh? Did you actually break your brain?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Do be careful how you speak. Your words are to 
the one who runs your beloved Lockhart after all.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You've finally lost it.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Would you like to test that theory?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The empire can't be that stupid...

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
I come, my dearest, to offer you a hand of 
salvation.

For both yourself and the city of Lockhart itself...

Take my hand in marriage, and I will guide us to the 
peak of the world!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
This shit again.

I'm already too tired of declining politely to relish 
this chance to kick you in the throat for it.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Oh, do not answer yet.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Do try to hold it in until your entourage is on the 
verge of the abyss.

Think of their screams of agony as vows to our 
eternal bliss.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
I do like that face. I will look forward to years of 
painting it on you, my dear.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hmph.

You know, you only ever tried to marry me before 
out of desperation. You had no other option that
was even remotely viable.
How bad must things be going to make you feel 
like you still need me for your goals?

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
We... We will see what tune you sing when your 
allies speak their final words.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And I'll thank you for the extra motivation. To keep 
Lockhart away from your slimy hands.

Win Condition: Defeat all enemies
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte die

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Another boat!?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Everyone, be ready!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Crows! Crew! Be wary of both sides! We have 
another ship arriving!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Hmm... Wasn't this ship supposed to be on fire by 
the time I got here...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Let's get this over with.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: This is a lost battle, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Ah, whatever, strategic retreat then? Not like that 
guy is the one paying me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, run away, pretty boy!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I'm happy my efforts there paid off. Slow, 
methodical, and...)

I made an effort to test if I did manage to get any 
extra burst to my sea legs.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... Oh well. That'd have been too easy.

I went back to rub my neck as I made the 
comment only to get a brush of my hair along my 
hand and neck.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh... That felt... different...?
Pup has manifested "Silky Hair TF"!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Fuck... did that backfire?!

(Why did that happen? Because I was
fighting that pretty boy while trying to...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fuck...!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Argh! No! Stop dem biters!

Norde saw multiple enemies converging on a set of 
boxes and barrels that Otis was around.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I can assist!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
There we go. Are the supplies okay? The last thing 
we need is-

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ah~ My beloved rum. You're safe~

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It is... okay. The supplies are... safe.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: C- Careful!

Tatiana held back her attack as she noticed Jakson 
burst forth from her blind spot.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I'm gonna hurt you, stupid dog.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confident bark*!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Fine! Then don't cry when you get stomped!

The two continued their fights, and Jakson deftly 
leapt through the gaps that Tatiana's slow armor 
created.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: ...?! From behind?!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Victory bark*!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: ...Not bad.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Shades... and these are more well formed than 
you'd expect.

Does Lockhart employ such skilled summoners?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Charlotte, did Lockhart-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Headshot~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What was that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, never mind me. Mayhap when you are... 
enjoying yourself less later.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What's that supposed to mean?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Whatever. I'll just make a mental note to punish 
you later.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: How fun...?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: A- Are you okay?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I... No, that's what I should be asking. Are you 
okay?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: B- But that attack... Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I stepped in to protect my ally... Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I can't just ignore you if you're hurt. Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I chose to protect you... so are you okay?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Are you okay?
BOTH: Are you okay?!

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Why have you not killed them yet?!

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.text: Argh!

The last of the enemy commanders fell to the 
ground.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: What do I pay you simpletons for?!

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
What now...? Maybe if I sent the ships' crews at 
them...?

No... We have to retreat entirely, don't we? Argh!

Next time, then... Next time!
Swords clashed between crow and shade.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And...!
The shade, a summoned being, dissipated into ash.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Even for something made with creation magic, 
they put up more than a little bit of a fight!)
Turning my head to my next foe, I see...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Nothing? Are we done?)

My head went on a swivel to look around, only to 
see the ships that had attacked us sailing away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah! They're getting away!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: After those bastards!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Eh, not in the job description, lass.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
If he don't want no prolongated fight, I'm not one 
to lose my ship over it.

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.text:
We... probably shouldn't. If they're not going to 
pick a ship-on-ship battle, especially.

We only have the one ship to their two, after all.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Grh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Who was that guy, again? He had some imperial 
troops with him.

Not to mention all that marriage talk...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That man is Simon Evanston of the similarly named 
trading company.

His family's company is like... I don't know, the 6th 
or 7th most influential in the city.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Or was. If he's working with the Nolvanus Empire,
then his status has likely risen.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
He's always been trying to merge our companies via 
a marriage.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Ugh... I remember that shit from when I was a little 
kid.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Sis, if he's working with the Empire, you don't think 
he was involved in... that, do you?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
He's just the sort of desperate that could've helped 
set that invasion up...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
But if he's in charge of Lockhart now, then... He 
still wants to marry you. He's even more dangerous 
now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So he got Lockhart but still wants to marry you? He 
sounds dangerous.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It should be... fine.

He's in control, but if he still needs me then it 
means they haven't fully converted public opinion 
on my family.
All that crap about us being an enemy of city will 
only get eaten up by some of the factions in 
that place.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
At least it's good to hear things haven't gotten 
completely out of hand there.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: He was much as I had heard of him before.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: His reputation outside of Lockhart is that bad, too?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Oh, I've just heard a few stories.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
All the more motivation to take the city back as 
soon as we can.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right...
I reached into my pocket and felt for my locket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...motivation.

Our course continued on, and Cainan's ship stayed
on its course to Oadthine, the Holy City of the
west.
Having been over halfway there already, it wasn't 
long until we saw a port for Cartenan's capital.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that it? The city?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Yes, that is Theodal.

Capital of the Kingdom of Cartenan. The 
uninvadable country.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And home to the Theodal Royal College.

Mariel and I went to school there. Along with most 
nobles this side of Ilvanis.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And home to the Theodal Royal College.

I, along with many nobles, went to school there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wow... So there's a lot of influential people here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well... 'to be' influential. It's one of the safest 
places in the world to put your child for learning.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What we want is the queen, though.

As the city came more into view, the skyline stood 
out to me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (So much stone and marble...)

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oh, is this your first time to a bigger city like this?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It wasn't as though Lockhart was in any condition 
to show off.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh, is this your first time to a bigger city like this?

Lockhart wasn't exactly in top form for showing off 
when you were there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well I've been to Rabaneau's capital. It's also grand, 
but... different.

For port cities, there's Kalabris in Rabaneau too, 
but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's nothing compared to this, though.

The ship entered port, and we were guided 
offboard into an impressive port deck.

Before we could even get to unpacking the ship, a 
person showed up with a smile on her face.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hello, is this the ship inbound from Ranakstown?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Kara! You're here!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's been so long.

Charlotte dotted down off the ship, and the rest of 
us followed.

She jumped into giving the woman an affectionate 
and overzealous hug.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is good to see you as well.

She said with a straight face despite the antics 
encompassing her.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oh, is this the girl we heard about? The fiancé of 
Cainan?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then this is our contact? The woman that was 
mentioned?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes. In spite of the communication outages from 
the Lockhart situation, we have received word of 
your voyage.

Charlotte released the hug, with a more serious 
look now on her face.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'd be surprised if you didn't know more than us 
about specifics happening in Lockhart now.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A fair conjecture.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... this is a friend of yours...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
My apologies. I have yet to introduce myself 
properly.
The lady backed away and fixed her clothes.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
My name is Kara Lyons.

I am the daughter of the minor noble house 'Lyons' 
here in the Kingdom.

I am here to act as a representative of the Queen 
on this issue.

Due to my connections to both Charlotte and my 
dear fiancé, it was deemed I would be the best 
choice for this role.
It is a true pleasure to meet each and every one of 
you. The reunions are only the sweeter for it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Smart people. There's no one I'd like to rely on 
more than my former reliable upperclassman.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What beautiful bonds to have forged~

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is good to see you as well, Alexei.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ignore this fool. He's just-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

"Alexei"?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes. Alexei Volkov. The prince of the Nolvanus 
Empire.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Alexei, it has been some time since you left from 
the academy. Have you grown even more?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... yes. I was hoping to mention...

That particular detail of my identity has not been a 
topic of conversation before this point.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Truly?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Such an odd choice, given its relevance to current 
events.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The PRINCE OF THE EMPIRE?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How could you not say anything about that?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It hadn't come up...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We asked you about your background so many 
times!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: And not a lie was told.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No. No, you're not Alexei.

Alexei was... just some short scrawny kid... He... 
He...!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
That poses the question of why you didn't 
recognize Alexei. We all did attend school together.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... Kara. To note, I do go properly by "Rowan" 
these days.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That... cannot be true. Alexei was an awkward kid 
who was diligent in class. He wasn't some homeless 
guy.
And... and...

Charlotte looked at the notable height of Rowan's 
that towered over her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: He was shorter than me!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Growth spurt.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can confirm as much. I believe I informed you of 
as much in a letter before, even.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: B- But-... But-...

Charlotte slumped back with her perception of 
reality at risk.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I did mean to tell eventually... preferably in a 
moment more... exhilarating and whatnot.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, the anti-climax to my riveting climaxes~

You always impress, Kara.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... 

This is too much. I need time to process this.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: And time you shall have.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Your appointment with the Queen is set for a few 
days from now.

Shall I show you to your accommodations?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
And I must say it properly now.

Welcome to the Kingdom of Cartenan.
Kara joined the group!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
And welcome to... *Pant*... the Kingdom of...

W- Wait... *Pant*... *pant*...!

S- Sir...!

The click of metal armor accompanied steps 
through the snow.
And then they stopped as a precipice was reached.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: *Pant*... You... You stopped...

The accompanying soldier caught up in the snowy 
mountain trek. He desperately gasped to catch 
his breath.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
T- There... There it is, sir.

The lush plains at the base of the mountains.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
That's it... That's our goal, sir.
There out on the horizon.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Welcome... to the Kingdom of Cartenan.

And so my eyes settled on the horizon in front
of them.

A horizon of greenery and grandeur.
A reality to forsake the turbulent path behind us.

The view was unfocused. 
It drifted into the abyss as time did not stop.

An abyss where the view stayed unfocused.

An unfocused view that settled down onto my
hands fidgeting with the rocks around me.

Fidgeting with them as though they were real.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aegis, Aegis, Aegis... What art thou...?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: You appear... distracted. Is that the word for it?

I was playing with one of the rocks on the ground. 
Twirling it around in the dirt like a kid playing a 
game.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess.

This locket heirloom thing... 

This 'Rowan-Alexei' nonsense...

...
My hand stopped fidgeting with the rock.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: My father...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah... you're just a... a thing.

You don't even know what I am talking about.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: Perhaps...

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
But I do feel something. Something deep down.

Like there is a hole. That something is missing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Me too.
I tossed the rock aside and faced Aegis properly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So you...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You said you want to protect me.

Why?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: Because I do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is it because you feel like something is missing?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: I do not think so.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A feeling of... obligation?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: Hmm... No to that, as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How about... legacy?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: For honor? For glory? For... strength?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
Again, these stir no affirmations within me.

I wish to protect you because...
Aegis rose his faded hand over his chest.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: When I think of you safe...

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: I am at peace.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I... 

I... don't understand.

...
I had blinked.
I blinked again. One final time for this dream.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Now we’re in my battlefield.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
You think we’ve not trained diligently?

A noble must be able to protect their people at any 
minute.

We must lead the people of our domains to a 
better life. A safer life. A happier life.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You truly understand nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Tsk. You act like you’re some hero just for being 
born.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, let’s see how well you handle this.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You are... Prince Alexei Volkov?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Also known as... Entirely different names. At times.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
If you find yourself suspicious of the assertion, do 
not force yourself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Treat Rowan as Rowan, and happiness shall follow.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: This reminds me of a salesman’s scam.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A scam you say? Such a wound to bear...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Argh! I... You really managed to beat me.

Fine. I won’t deny it.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Ugh... I... Of course I...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Good job. Much respect to you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... h- hello.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We haven’t talked much properly, have we?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Sorry about that. My twin sister can come across... 
a bit strongly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You think?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Though... I can’t say I disagree with her.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then I’ll just have to prove myself to you, too.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I guess so.

I hope you do.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Good day to you.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Oh, uh... H- Hello.

Y- You’re the imperial prince,right?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Are you... Are you sure?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So they say. So they say.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: And... what do you say?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I also say.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not fret. Have fun with our sporting event 
here.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: R- Right...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh... What are you doing here? Where is 
everyone?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, that is but a part of the game.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: We are split according to random lots.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Lucky me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed. It must be the guiding hand of the 
Goddess~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Can that also be said about..

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...those two?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap it can.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What other weird rules have we got this time?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Uh... Do not kill?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I can work with that.

You have 10 rounds to defeat as many enemies as 
possible. 

Each arena will have a winner and a loser. 

The winner is the one that wins 2 out of 3 battles.

If you can't reach other combatants, wait the 
remaining turns.
Your units will not permanently die in this battle.

lines.speaker: Crowd
lines.text:
So Lady Stewart is here... why? It’s got to be 
about Lockhart.

Does she think she can just show up and make 
everyone do what she wants?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You bet your ass I will.

lines.speaker: Crowd
lines.text:
Ah, Lady Lyons is fighting with Lady Stewart’s 
group? I don’t think I’ve ever seen her fight 
before.
You know, she’s actually... I didn’t think she’d be 
so capable there.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It is good to hear I’ve developed a quality 
reputation.

lines.speaker: Crowd
lines.text:
Ugh... to think the Lockhart princess would employ 
such a creature.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmph. The usual.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then I’ll show you truth through my actions.

lines.speaker: Crowd
lines.text:
Why is a dog on the field...? Wait, did that dog 
just...?! My Goddess!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy Bark*!

lines.speaker: Crowd
lines.text:
Oh, that’s Lady Charlotte’s sister. The rumors used 
to say that she might make a better...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Just... Just ignore them.

lines.speaker: Crowd
lines.text:
A little nekolyn woman with a... Woah, how did she 
swing it like that?!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Bwahaha! Let’s make this fun!

lines.speaker: Crowd
lines.text: T- That armor... That isn’t... No, it couldn’t be.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Yeah, gawk in awe at my awesomeness, you 
creeps.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Wait?! We’re actually fighting?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We’re finally doing the thing?!

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
Thank you, friends and family, for joining us today.

Today we commemorate the hard work of our 
recent graduating fellows.

To rise from the Royal College to join us in nobility 
proper.

Ah, look at me ramble on. I can see the excited 
faces of everyone here.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
Without further delay, the results of the Knight’s 
Roundtable set the lots for today’s fight to be...

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
It looks like we have a winning group! Lady Stewart 
and the Nightless Crows!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank you for the excellent match. You really 
overwhelmed our side.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: To think a mercenary group would be so...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: “So...”? So what?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I applaud your efforts. I underestimated you all. All 
of you.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Not that there isn’t room for improvement.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Sis, even I can see we don’t have room to say 
that.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
It looks like we have a winning group! Lady Stewart 
and the Nightless Crows!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: An excellent match.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Indeed. I may have underestimated you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, you really...?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You still have a lot to learn, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Heh...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
It looks like we have a winning group! Lady Stewart 
and the Nightless Crows!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank you for the excellent match. Your side did 
quite well.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Indeed. I share the sentiment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Being like that...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I withdraw my complaint. Perhaps your group has 
enough strength in its numbers to serve Lady 
Stewart.
In... some of its numbers.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Sis...

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
It looks like we have a winning group! Lady Stewart 
and the Nightless Crows!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank you for the excellent match. Your side did 
quite well.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Indeed. I share the sentiment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Being like that...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I withdraw my complaint. Perhaps your group has 
enough strength in its numbers to serve Lady 
Stewart.
In... some of its numbers.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Sis...

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
It looks like we have a winning group! The Kingdom 
nobles! What a wonderful match!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A loss is a loss...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: But you did beat us...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

I apologize for my shameful display. It seems I 
underestimated you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I didn’t expect that.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
It looks like we have a winning group! The Kingdom 
nobles! What a wonderful match!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh... Goddess dammit...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Uh... thank you for the match.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Thank you for the match.
She turned towards her brother.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Lord Flynn, would you like me to schedule a 
meeting with Lady Charlotte after the match?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Uh.. well... I don’t think...

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
It looks like we have a winning group! The Kingdom 
nobles! What a wonderful match!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh... Goddess dammit...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Uh... thank you for the match.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Thank you for the match.
She turned towards her brother.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Lord Flynn, would you like me to schedule a 
meeting with Lady Charlotte after the match?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Uh.. well... I don’t think...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Who is that? They look out of place with the 
nobles. Are they...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What!?

lines.speaker: Noble
lines.text: Ah!!!

The axe swung down, narrowing missing the noble 
as they scampered away from the scene.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Tsk...

The crowd started dispersing, and more bandits 
started to become visible in the stands.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Bandits? They got past the facility's security?

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text: What is this nonsense?! Where are the guards?!

lines.speaker: Noble
lines.text: S- Sir... I think the guards are... dead!

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text: P- Preposterous!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Sir, I do believe you would be best served escorting 
your guests away from the danger.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah. We got this. Keep everyone else safe.

lines.speaker: Head Noble
lines.text:
Y- Yes. Of course...

My friends and family...!

The leader of the noble group’s voice became 
muffled as he ran off to do as much.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Reagyn, should we...?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ...I think...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Sir... Lord Flynn Coslett... This is an emergency. I 
am at your command.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: W- Wait, but...

Reagyn looked at her brother with a determined, 
dutiful expression.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: R- Right... we can... uh... follow his lead for now?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I think we should help him.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
But... Lord Flynn Coslett... This is an emergency. I 
am at your command.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: W- Wait, but...

Reagyn looked at her brother with a determined, 
dutiful expression.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: R- Right... you’re right. We should follow his lead.

The two Coslett twins scattered off in a similar 
direction.

This left our group and a select few of the noble’s 
group to deal with the ever growing bandit threat.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
A bandit raid? I thought this was an “uninvadable” 
country?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A heavy rarity, but not unheard of.

To attack a facility like this, though...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I imagine the nobles would be grateful to have this 
taken care of.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
What a wonderful opportunity to sweep them off 
their feet.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: For once I agree with you.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Let’s clean this up, then, shall we?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(A bandit raid? It’s been a while since we’ve had to 
deal with that.)

(Not since...)

...

A thought creeped upon my mind, but I shook my 
head and dismissed it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No, that’d be ridiculous...)

Win Conditon: Kill the enemy leader
Lose Condition: Pup, Charlotte, Kara or Rowan die.
A distant voice could be heard vaguely.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: ...are you sure? We could... guard the...?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ...leave them to their fate...?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
...right... can’t just abandon...

...

...alright, I can give the order...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Yes, my lord! We will repel this bandit incursion!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: W- Wait, you didn’t let me finish...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is good to see you two.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Yeah... I’m happy to see you all still alive and well.

We’d like to help, if you’ll have us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How nice of you to ask.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Not you.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Lady Kara? Lady Stewart?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Giggle*, I certainly have no objections.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The more the merrier.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Thank you. Both of you.
Reagyn and Flynn joined the team!

Win Conditon: Kill all bandits. 
Lose Condition: Pup, Charlotte, Kara, Rowan or 
the twins die.
I took a deep breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Come on, you bandit scum! Let me show you how 
a real swordsman fights!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: These bandit raids are getting silly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Have these been common for you to deal with?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well... not really. We’ve been focused on helping 
Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
True, the closest we’ve gotten has been in the 
pirate infested town.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh. Don’t forget we live there, princess.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Though... There was a bandit raid before we met 
you in Lockhart.

It was on the outskirts of the Western Auran 
Alliance.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I do remember bandits being the first people to 
attack.

Weren’t people saying it was a bandit raid at first?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Actually, I think I remember people saying that was 
a bandit raid at first...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde, didn’t those bandits start with-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...!
A wooziness overtook me suddenly.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton, are you-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (This... feeling...?!)

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Eh? Anyone else startin’ to feel a bit... seasick?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: What is happening?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You don’t look alright...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is... a long story.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We’ll... We’ll catch you up later.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: F- For now... We need to finish this quickly!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is happening again?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... I think so, yeah.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We need to finish this quickly!

Members with the "Weakness" Skill have the 
Weakness debuff.
The chest opened with a ‘pop’.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: AHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!

What looked to be a young girl sprung up from the 
chest, even breaking its hinges.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: ...Oh, hello there.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: I had the weirdest dream.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Wait... Where am I?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confuse whine*

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: You were... hiding in a chest...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Well, I suddenly found myself summoned by this 
demon lady one day and I was like way girly for 
some reason.
Thank God that was just a dream or I might have-
Jenny looked down.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Oh... flub it all... I...

Soon, Jenny shyly started to retreat into the chest 
like it was a turtle shell.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Was that not... a dream...?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: You’re not gonna... try to corrupt me, are you?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
You know, this place seems a lot more open than 
the last place...

I could just run away if they try that...?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Surprised bark*

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text:
Just be careful, there are a lot of dangerous people 
around.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
You know what? I’ll come with you and fight for 
you. You seem like you’re probably nice enough.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused bark*

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Sure...?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Is this is a recruitment scene?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: A what?
Jenny was recruited!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Yep! Recruitment scene!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Reluctant happy bark*

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Welcome...?
The chest opened with a ‘pop’.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: AHHHHHHHHH!!!!!!!!!!!!

What looked to be a young girl sprung up from the 
chest, even breaking its hinges.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: ...Oh, hello there.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: I had the weirdest dream.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Wait... Where am I?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text:
Why were you in that box?! What do you mean 
“dream”?!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Well, I suddenly found myself summoned by this 
demon lady one day and I was like way girly for 
some reason.
Thank God that was just a dream or I might have-
Jenny looked down.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Oh... flub it all... I...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Was that not... a dream...?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Are you okay? Do you need help?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: You’re not gonna... try to corrupt me, are you?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text:
I have no idea what that’s even supposed to 
mean...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
You know, this place seems a lot more open than 
the last place...

I could just run away if they try that...?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
You know what? I’ll come with you and fight for 
you. You seem like you’re probably nice enough.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: I... don’t recall offering that...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Is this is a recruitment scene?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: A... what?
Jenny joins the party!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Yep! Recruitment scene!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
...

Okay...

The chest opener found a letter.

“Your demon lord is in another
castle.”

Weird...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of all the people to come back. I wasn’t expecting 
this.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I said before that I underestimated you.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
But it’d be irresponsible of me to not try and keep 
that capability on an honorable track.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: At least while you are in Lady Stewart’s employ.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, try to keep up. Maybe you’ll learn something.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: The same sentiment to you.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Flynn? Flynn Coslett? I haven’t seen you since 
school.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Mariel. I hope you’ve done well since graduating.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I’ve been well.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Bar... recent events.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: O- Oh... I’m sorry.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It’s okay. How have you been doing since you 
graduated? I heard about it at the banquet.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Well... it’s been a week.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
That’s okay. I’m sure you have a bright future 
ahead.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Y- Yeah... I hope so. Thank you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: What an odd thing to happen.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A bandit raid?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A bandit raid on a secured facility filled with trained 
fighters.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I imagine you’ve not dealt with underworld type 
tactics very often, then.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I have had my moments.

It would delightful to hear your thoughts over a 
cup of tea, though.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I’ll consider it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Just... checking, but... You didn’t..

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: No, I didn’t call no bandits here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I didn’t think so, but you in particular don’t get 
along with nobles.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Get a big gathering of them and...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: If I was gonna, I’d do it myself.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah... sorry. Just wanted to be doubly sure.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Pft. I expect a nice charitable donation in my next 
“paycheck” for this gig, you know?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, yeah. At least I know you’ll put it to good 
use.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Float like a butterfly...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: And sting like a bee!

Through Rowan’s more elegant distraction, Otis’s 
forceful strike came at the enemy like a surprise.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: We should put on a show more often.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A delightful proposition you have there.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hey boy. Are you also distracted?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Curious whine*...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh, nothing actually important.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Insistent bark*!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Fine, I can vent to you about it later. But only if 
you agree to not chew on my stuff.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Undecided whine*...

The bandit fell down limp as my sword 
slice connected.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Pant*... *pant*...

I think... that’s the last of them.

I deftly sheathed my sword, and turned to the 
group as a whole.
I scanned the field of battle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That’ll probably make a good impression on the 
nobles.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: I’d be lying if I didn’t find it impressive.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Do you normally make Lady Kara and Lady Stewart 
fight on the front lines?!

What sort of protection is that?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It’s fine. It’s fine.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I wouldn’t be able to forgive myself if I could make 
a difference and didn’t even try, anyways.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
You have a commendable noble spirit, Lady 
Stewart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That’s a heel turn.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

I must ask on it. That discussion from before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That discussion from before what-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...
The wooziness had another bout.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right, from when this started again.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
My apologies for needing to disregard that for now.

I meant the topic before it.

The last time you saw a bandit raid.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It was...

Norde was clearly speaking through some 
semblance of discomfort.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It was before Lockhart. We were hired to act as 
guards on the western border of the WAA.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The invasion of Lockhart started under the guise of 
a bandit attack.

It left the city guard playing catch up when real 
soldiers showed up.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I... I thought bandit raids were the norm around 
the world.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Even in the Coslett domain here in Cartenan, we do 
have to fend the incursions off.

Why suggest this is anything like Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The target.

Bandits don’t raid notably fortified facilities.

Especially one specifically meant for armed and 
trained nobility to do sport.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean, they took out the guard.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Our intervention assuredly kept friendly casualties 
to a minimum.

But even if we were not here, it would have been 
a suicide run for the bandits.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So they attacked for what...? The armory?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
That would still be a suicide run. I am not one to 
assume the enemy is brain dead.

There is only one thing that comes to mind that 
would be of value to them here.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Lady Kara... are you suggesting what I think you 
are...?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Suggesting? Suggesting what?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Or... uh... n- nevermind.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is okay, Lord Coslett.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I just mean... if this happened before to trick 
people...

Couldn’t attacking nobility rapidly spread the word 
of bandit raids?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed.

We originally came to this gathering because we 
ourselves wanted to make a good impression.

To establish reputation in the Queen’s inner circle.

...

This development has likely already made it to 
Queen Avalina.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So they might be really invading...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Kara, we need our audience with the Queen. Now.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
No.

Is this entire premise not flawed?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
We are Cartenan. We are the uninvadable 
Kingdom.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Lady Kara, as much as my respect for you runs 
deep... this is ludicrous.

No entity would be dumb enough to invade 
Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
No defense is without weakness.

To be overly reliant on...
Kara trailed off, for once being at a loss for words.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Kara.

We need to meet with the Queen.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... Yeah. We... We need to talk to her...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

Yes, of course...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We will meet with Queen Avalina.

We will meet with the Queen of the Cartenan.

The bandit fell down limp as my sword 
slice connected.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Pant*... *pant*...

I think... that’s the last of them.

I deftly sheathed my sword, and turned to the 
group as a whole.
I scanned the field of battle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That’ll probably make a good impression on the 
nobles.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It shall dazzle them, yes~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hard to imagine it wouldn’t make a striking 
impression, yeah.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

I must ask on it. That discussion from before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That discussion from before what-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...
The wooziness had another bout.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right, from when this started again.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
My apologies for needing to disregard that for now.

I meant the topic before it.

The last time you saw a bandit raid.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It was...

Norde was clearly speaking through some 
semblance of discomfort.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It was before Lockhart. We were hired to act as 
guards on the western border of the WAA.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The invasion of Lockhart started under the guise of 
a bandit attack.

It left the city guard playing catch up when real 
soldiers showed up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Don’t bandit raids happens a bunch, though? Why 
would this one be like that one?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The target.

Bandits don’t raid notably fortified facilities.

Especially one specifically meant for armed and 
trained nobility to do sport.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean, they took out the guard.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Our intervention assuredly kept friendly casualties 
to a minimum.

But even if we were not here, it would have been 
a suicide run for the bandits.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So they attacked for what...? The armory?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
That would still be a suicide run. I am not one to 
assume the enemy is brain dead.

There is only one thing that comes to mind that 
would be of value to them here.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
If it is like Lockhart, they would want to make their 
real targetbelieve there are bandit raids occurring.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
So in the Kingdom’s case, you attack the nobles. 
Make them panic.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed.

We originally came to this gathering because we 
ourselves wanted to make a good impression.

To establish reputation in the Queen’s inner circle.

...

This development has likely already made it to 
Queen Avalina.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So they might be really invading...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Kara, we need our audience with the Queen. Now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But isn’t... *pant*... this the “uninvadable” 
country? Why would the Empire try to do that 
here?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
No defense is without weakness.

To be overly reliant on...
Kara trailed off, for once being at a loss for words.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Kara.

We need to meet with the Queen.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... Yeah. We... We need to talk to her...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

Yes, of course...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We will meet with Queen Avalina.

We will meet with the Queen of the Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Sir, the first wave has made it through successfully.

Our troops are moving the strategic points we’ve 
planned for.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: And the path to the summit?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Yes, we’ve seen no signs of them reorganizing to 
protect it.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Good.

“Uninvadable” will be a distant memory, then.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Oh, is that the plan?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
It must be quite the Dralleus to make that big of a 
strategic swing.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You know we don’t call them that outside of the 
Oathless Empire.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Sure, sure.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
But it does make me wonder.

Mr. Steel Wolf guy, how did you even learn of it?

It has to be a closely guarded secret. At least for 
the level of detail we were told about it.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Try to not speak out of turn. We have a job to do.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I am just curious.

The Steel Wolf raised a sword.

That sword.

The cursing sword that had struck more than a few 
helpless souls over its existence.

Eul’thame... an Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: A former friend once told me of it.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: He had friends?
The hushed whisper was directed to his comrade.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Shut up. Why are you-

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Let us begin.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Yes, sir! We’ll have the soldiers start moving at 
once.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Got it. I’ll lead the troops to...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Jude, go and start your mission.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Right, the Vault.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I’ll see you all after, then.
Nora and Jude each went in separate directions.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Sir, do you want to...?

T- To... head out, too?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
...

Yes.
The Wolf's grip on Eul’thame became tighter.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
We shall see if weakness hides beneath that veil.

If this glorified kingdom can even survive... the 
coming winter.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You...!

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: You.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You won’t... *pant*... win this time!

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Stirring in the misery of ignorance, then?

You will see yourself as you are one day.

Weak.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: RARRRGHHH!!!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You do not need to do this.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I do not know what you were told, or where you 
acquired that sword, but...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You know you can be better than this.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
...

Stay out of my way.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You show yourself after what you did to my 
parents...?!

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: The oligarchs? The world is better off.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You...! I’ll give you a clean bullet through the head!

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: Do it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
So you are this monstrous “Steel Wolf” I have 
heard of.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: It does not matter.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed it doesn’t.

Crusades and the heroic titles they bestow? It’s all 
more a subject for a Covenant historian.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
What matters is where you acquired that 
Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Who gave it to you?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Is this silence a sign of loyalty... or...?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Haha!

Ya really thought it be a good idea to stand in the 
way of my axe? With *that* sword?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: I’ll gut ya like a fish.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I... know what you did to Ivan. I won’t run away 
from it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I will hold his honor high.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Barbarian imperial lackey...

I do not care if you’re some Crusade hero or 
otherwise, you will fall just as all others have.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Pant*... Be careful! That sword... Just one strike 
and... *pant*... this damned curse...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Tsk. So you’re still alive to be a thorn in Lockhart’s 
side.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I don’t care about you. Just die and get out of my 
way.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I can say the same...!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Y- You...! You’re one of those people that 
attacked Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Liberated, more like.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That... doesn’t make any sense!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: As if you could even comprehend it!

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: I... I will not let myself fall here...!

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Barbarian imperial lackey...

I do not care if you’re some Crusade hero or 
otherwise, you will fall just as all others have.

Win Condition: Defend for 12 turns
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte, Kara die. 
Avalina dies before the 12th turn

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No... no no no...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It can't be. Not now!)

I pulled myself up from my prone position to my 
knees.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Pant* ...!

(Shit...! The curse...)

As I caught my breath, I looked to my side for my
compatriots.

Rowan, without a emotion leaking through, stared
unblinking at the Steel Wolf.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There you are! Are you alright?

Charlotte had come running up after 
recovering from the chaos herself.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Here, let me just...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? What are you... looking...
Her head turned to parallel my eyeline.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Sir, what's our next move?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
...

Do what you will.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: F- Fine... We'll continue blocking the escape routes.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: Urgh... Who is that?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: The Steel Wolf.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
"Steel Wolf"? Like the titles that famous crusaders 
are given?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
So this is him? The one with the Oathbreaker as a
weapon?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
The murderer who is going to die today, yes. 
That's him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Pant*...

(I think I'm reaching a point of... of no return...!)

A shaky hand of mine violently pulled the medicinal
glass vial from my gear pouch.

In a swift gulp, I downed half of it and stuffed the
rest back in storage.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhale*...
My breathing settled. The oncoming panic settled.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Steel Wolf!

What is it you want? What you wish for? What 
would bring you and the empire to the negotiating 
table?

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text:
Hmph.

Weak.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's not... gonna work...

I stuck my sword in the ground and used it to help 
me get to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We... We'll have to just escape. Or win. 
Something... Something like that.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Escape blocked by ambush...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right. Then we'll unblock it. Or win. Or... something.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: WOLF!!!

I tightened my sword grip as I entered my fighting
stance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No other choice.

lines.speaker: Steel Wolf
lines.text: This is getting no where.

lines.speaker: Baby Dragon
lines.text: RAAWRRGGHHH!!!!!!!!!!

Win Condition: Destroy the pillars to trap the 
dragon or...
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte, Kara die.

lines.speaker: Baby Dragon
lines.text: Rrawgh...!
The dragon's path was blocked.
Its head turned like it was distracted.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...There.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Now...

lines.speaker: Baby Dragon
lines.text: Rrawgh...!

lines.text: ...There.

lines.text: Now...

lines.speaker: Baby Dragon
lines.text: Rrawgh...!

impede.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...There.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Now...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That thing is a newborn?! It's as big as a house!

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: I... This cannot...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Your majesty, we must do something. Your 
country needs you.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
An entire climate shift is one thing, but to also have
a dragon to deal with...

Just looking at that thing as a baby makes
it feel like a walking natural disaster.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It may well get a taste for human flesh at this rate...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Your. Majesty.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: We're all dead...

Pushing her aside, Kara moved to address the 
soldiers under the queen's command directly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Good men of Cartenan! Never has your land 
needed you more!

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: W- We can't fight something that big!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
All the more reason to do something before it 
matures.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We can disable it’s greatest strength: Flight!

Prepare artillery and archers to cripple the beast’s 
wings.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The rest of us must find a way to entrap it long 
enough to strike at the wings.
Kara gave more detailed orders to the soldiers.

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Y- Yes, my lady...!
And the knights ran off to conduct their roles.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We will assist in entrapping the beast. We much block
it in somehow.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Anton... Pup... Are you okay to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll kill that man... I will...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Consider it a second wind.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: This is... the worst case scenario.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We will do what we must.

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG VILLAGE (DAY)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Now! Attack!
Go go go!
STAGE DIRECTION> ARROW UNLEASHED SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES
Arrows and rocks from catapults blanketed the sky!
The dragon had gone stiff.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's not even trying to dodge?

Suddenly, its wings swung through the air and a large
swell of air was propelled at us all!
It jolted up into the sky...!

And the artillery battered against the now empty dirt
below.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Damn the Goddess...

It hovered in the air calmly... almost like it was
lifeless.
It's head swiveled to the east.
And...
It flew away.

lines.text: Are you okay to move?

lines.text: That... That man deserves to die!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

I suppose there will be a point it reaches that
threshold. Where it truly was beyond forgiveness.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: There always was that inevitability.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: All you bastards... just die already!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I know how you feel, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How can you just stand there after... that! What he
said!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I agree with every word you utter.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Do what you must.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I... am struggling to keep that inner beast at bay
myself.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup! You changed again! Are you okay?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It doesn't matter. I'll kill that man!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'll do what I can to keep you safe... unlike how I
didn't with...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Concerned whine*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Don't worry, boy. We'll make him regret every day he
wakes up still breathing. We will!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Increasingly concerned whine*...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: For Queen Avalina to fall apart as such...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I... honestly don't even know what to think anymore...
How did this happen to our home?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I... I don't know. But...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: We... We can still protect it.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Yeah. We'll do everything we can.
