lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You don’t even understand where you
are, do you?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What are you rambling on about?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Listen clearly with those ears of
yours.

This is not a place you are welcome. You’ve no 
right to step foot in here.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: As if I care. I fight for my home.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And today, I fight for one of mine.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph. Welcome to Crekskia, fox.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I see Princess A has picked up more
than just oppression from her vile
parents.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You don’t get to talk about my
parents.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
If their sins are too much for you
to burden...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...I’ll relieve you of them!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The younger “princess”, is it?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: How... How could you do this?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
The amount of people who have died... Lockhart... 
Cartenan...

You’re just spreading death and destruction 
everywhere.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The war is not mine to fight. I fight for Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
What?! But you’re the one who brought war 
against our home!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You know nothing of Lockhart.

I will fight for her future.

Threats to that future must be removed.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Tsk... you.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Nora.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
How can you stand there? Acting as though you 
aren’t a traitor?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Traitor to who? The Empire?

Or to your own personal objectives?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
The Empire should pay their bills more promptly.

And you’re just one of many amongst the Imperials 
that owe me a good meal.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Not that I’ll have a chance to cash out 
those favors.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Quiet. You chose your side. This ends now.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Stronger women than you have tried.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You lot... I am tired of you blocking my path...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Out of my way!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Ugh...! This...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I’m not letting you get away AGAIN.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I’ll have to fall back...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Where did Pup go?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Do try to keep your wits about you.

With the troops about, we must be vigilant.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
To think they would barge in here after us... 
Argh...

And where did HE go, too?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Yeah, it's one of those mercs!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
An Imperial soldier?!

(Speak of catching me off guard!)

The soldier, weapon already the ready, 
planted their foot to strike.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: ARGH!!!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I am here to save the day~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you doing here?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
May it be more appropriate to ask why there 
are Imperial troops here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Or why YOU are down here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... it's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Complicated, yes.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
At this time, there are better enemies to best than
those questions, I'd think.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hah... Fair.
I grabbed the hilt of my sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing's gonna stop me from helping with my blade.

This is a fog of war map. This means that the units 
will appear as you explore the map, this includes 
your units.

Win Condition: Defeat Enemy Commander by Exit
Lose Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte or Kara die

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
There they are...

No mercy for that coward traitor of a princess.

If I must, I'll end her threat to my home myself.

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
D- Don't hurt me! Don't steal from me! They forced 
us in here!

I don't know where we are! Go harass that weird 
maid instead!  *Sniff*...

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
Hm...? I thought I grabbed more from those guys 
when I pickpocketed them...?

Oh, uh, hello! Please don't hurt me!

lines.text:
Hm...? I thought I grabbed more from those guys 
when I pickpocketed them...?

Oh, uh, hello! Please don't hurt me!

lines.text:
Hm...? I thought I grabbed more from those guys 
when I pickpocketed them...?

Oh, uh, hello! Please don't hurt me!

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text:
You! Are you one of them!? Fighting and stealing, 
you lot! Let me give you a piece of my mind!

Oh, you aren't? Are you SURE? First we have that 
weird maid show up, then the Imperial troops...

lines.text:
Hm...  *Glares intently*...

At the mess ... This place could use a cleaning...

*Sigh*...

lines.text:
Hm...  *Glares intently*...

lines.text:
Hey. What's up?

Yeah, no worries from me. I'm used to being stolen
from.

You're not gonna steal from me? Well at least 
you're better than that weird maid.

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text: Could've just asked for it.

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text: Could've just asked for it.

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.text: Could've just asked for it.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Hm? Oh, greetings. Are you the master of this 
abode? I can start cleaning soon.

No? Why am I here you ask? I would be delighted 
to answer. I am here due to the group of maids I 
work as a part of being pushed here by troops.
What is wrong with my voice? I do not think 
anything is strange with my voice, but I will correct 
it as soon as I am able.
I will attend to that as soon as I finish cleaning this
area. Thank you dear masters and mistresses.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Hm~mm~hm~mm~

Welcome. I'll be right there. First I must finish
dusting this area.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: H- Hey?! Why do you have that?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, what is this?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
It's a chip that I need to keep being an effective maid
and-!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Wait... why was I being a maid...? Last I remember 
I was fighting... Elaine?

...Where am I?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Uh... Crekskia?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Oh Crekskia! That's...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What is a Crek-shika?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Are you okay? What this... strange item doing something
to you?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I think I'm okay now. Just made me compulsively 
want to act like a maid for a while...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I don't think I did anything too bad before you got 
it off, like-

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: ...sign a contract.
Macy took out a perfectly maintained piece of paper.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hm? A contract?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A "Notice of Debt"... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I'm starting to remember signing this now... I'm
screwed now if I don't re-equip that chip and be a
super-maid again...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? Why?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
According to the paper, debt incurred at a 
restaurant and inn.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
What am I supposed to do when I wake up buck 
naked in the middle of a snowy field?

I found an inn that offered me a good meal and a
night's stay...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Next thing I know I have a contract shoved in my 
face! One that would multiply my debt by 1000 if 
broken!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Between debt and my maid mind... of course I 
didn't think twice before signing it...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's not a thing.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What? I think I misheard you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indentured Servitude Contracts like this have been
illegal since the Covenant became the dominant 
cultural power.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Cove-what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Goods that can't be reclaimed - like food or housing 
- are goods a merchant needs to get payment for 
upfront.
Real merchants want to get paid, not life debt 
people.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
This Imperial seal on the contract looks shoddily
forged, too.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Meaning I never needed to spend the last couple months
as a maid...

...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Well, I guess I'm happy I got skilled with these
knives~

Macy grabbed back the contract and ripped it up with a
vigor.

Then she grabbed the electronic looking chip and
stomped it beneath her heel.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: That jerk is gonna regret having me learn knifework...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If this guy did this to other people, then he's on 
my shitlist, too.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Wait, but now I don't have food or a place to 
sleep...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: I guess I do have clothes now.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: A maid outfit...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Are you guys hiring, maybe?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I- Uh... Well, I guess we can always use more help?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Thank God I met you all!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You mean "the Goddess", no?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
"Goddess" what now?

...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
You know what, forget I asked. This hurts my head 
to think about.
Macy has joined the party!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Hm~mm~hm~mm~

Welcome. I'll be right there. First I must finish

lines.text: Ah, you are alive.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That is encouraging.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not gonna fall here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not then, and not now.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: "Then"...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah... it's unimportant. Especially in the middle of a
fight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But it's good to see you, Kara. Thank you for what
you've done today.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...Of course.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm gonna have you executed, Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's good to see you, too, princess.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... No more running off, yeah?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll try.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Isn't that comforting, haha...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe I'll have to dock your pay next time?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey... Don't go that far...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup!

Satia ran up to me and quickly wrapped me in 
a tight hug.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Satia?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you doing?

I blurted out the words and Satia nuzzled against
me in a happy bliss.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Quiet. I earned this. You earned this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's good to see you, Satia. I'm happy you're safe.

I hugged her back quickly, and soon enough we 
swiveled to face any incoming enemy... back to 
back.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Did you find what you needed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmm... Maybe. It may be a matter of time to really 
know though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... think so, at least. Or am nearly there.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Now, shall we take down these Imperials?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I'm up for that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?! Why are you here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Et tu, dear Charlotte?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You should ask that question of the troops.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I know the answer to that already. They're trying 
to kill me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A fair answer...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then shall I protect you, my dear friend?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We'll see if you can.

Maybe I'll protect you?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I look forward to being in your debt~

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Satia! Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Yes, dear. I am in good condition.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
One ready to rid us of this threat to you, your 
sister, Pup, and...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: And to you!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'll do my best to keep you safe, as well.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Sweet as that is, they are after you and others. I 
am but a wall in their road to that.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: And a beautiful and valuable wall at that!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I'm not afraid of these people not anymore. Not 
with you all around.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
*Giggle*... Very well, shall we fight them 
together, then?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: You were awoken as well?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Gah, yeah. That hollering bard screaming up and 
down the village.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Ah... same.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
But ya actually came? Didn't think ya would fight 
your ol' crew.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: It is... awkward.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Some of them still owe me a debt, too...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heheh~

Maybe some lootin' will make ya lot even, then?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: That's... maybe a bit much.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I'm not that sort of mercenary.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ah, more loot for me, then. Maybe I'll buy ya 
somethin' tasty?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: ...I wouldn't say "no" to that.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: This place... Yes, this is a Vault.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whimper*...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
There, boy.

Well get your owner out of her safely.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Appreciative bark*

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Though you still look nervous...

Perhaps you can sense that this place was 
important to the Pup child...?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Determined bark*

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Eh, what a place for the Covenant to build. This is a
Vault?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Technically.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
This place appears unfinished, though?

Perhaps they were building out a maze as a 
protective measure...? It is safer than a straight 
tunnel to the Vault.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What a damn waste.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The Covenant takes the protection of 
Oathbreakers seriously.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmph. Clearly didn't work here.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I... suppose not.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Intriguing... An entire labyrinth... just to protect an
Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Shouldn't you be focusing on that at this time?
We've hostiles about.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, such is true. But one cannot take my curiosity. 
I would not be me.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Do you not see these tunnels and rooms and have 
a rush of wonder for its nature? Its purpose?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Not particularly.

We're not here to gawk. We're here to do a job.

If we're not trying to work towards saving my 
homeland, it is not worth what time and resources 
I have.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, but that is the key. To understand is to be able 
to achieve your goals more effectively.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
See those wooden structures supporting the 
tunnel? What if we were to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What if the enemy was to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: That is... true.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Then I'll leave such observations to you.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Of course.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: This place is so dark and dank...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Be strong, friend. They are as blinded as we are.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Lady Kara...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I understand, but... they're organized. 
We just woke up.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
They're also coming off a lengthy chase. They are 
tired and we are rested.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Do no fret. They do not have the advantage. We 
do.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank you, Lady Kara. As usual, you know just 
what to say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Gasp
...!

I breathed in deeply and desperately tried to fill my
air with lungs.
It was like I hadn't breathed for an eternity.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Where... am I...?

The thought crept through my mind as my breathing
slowed.
Slowly, but surely, my eyes drifted through the area.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's like... a mine?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(No, it's more like... tunnels. Like the sort built to
move through a building...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Half finished, but...)
I stood there for a moment.
I didn't know why, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Have I... been here before?
So I took a step.
And in that moment... from around a corner, I saw them.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: Haha~

Two figures burst from the cavernous corridor,
sprinting around the corner and out of view.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That is... That was...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That was...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE
That was...

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_LIFT
(NIGHT/BLUE COLOR)

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: ...that was me.

Suddenly, I was the image I saw run about in front of
me.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: (Wait... why am I... a kid again?)

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Anton! Nikolai!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: That voice...

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Come back! It's too late for this.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text:
Is that... really...

...mom?

As the thought passed through my head, I felt a hand on
my wrist.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: C'mon, Anton!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai...

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: We gotta keep moving!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: But, what about...

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Where are you?! It's dangerous down here!

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: It's... dangerous down here?

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text:
Heheh~ Don't worry.

I'll protect you.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: You...?

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text:
Of course. It's what a big brother does, isn't it?

I'll protect you, Anton. No matter what.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Okay...
I felt a tug on my wrist.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: Heheh~
And I was pulled along into the corridor.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

Nikolai and I ran through the tunnels, passing all
sorts of strange structures and unfinished
construction.
It felt like an eternity.
An eternity of our play.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Haha...
But as we turned one more corner...

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC
COAL_MINE_MATERIALS_SITE (EVENING BLUEISH TINT)

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai...?
My brother disappeared.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai... where are you...?

My heart began to beat faster and faster, and my walk
picked up into a run.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text:
Nikolai!

...

MOM...!
Turning corners and corners and more corners...

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text:
Pant
 
pant
 
pant
...!

WHERE... ARE... YOU!?
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
I turned another corner.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG PAID BG027C
I entered a more constructed part of the tunnels.
Before me stood a stone wallway.
Cold.
Empty.
It was... THAT hallway.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Nikolai...?
I walked forward.
I shouldn't have.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Mom...?
I stood in front of a door.
I shouldn't have.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: Are you... in there...?
I put my hand on the door.
I shouldn't have.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> DOOR OPEN SE

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC
COAL_MINE_MATERIALS_SITE (EVENING BLUEISH TINT)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO WHITE BG

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nikolai...! Mom!

I stuck my hand out... grasping at anything I could get
ahold of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Please... don't... don't...!
My arm extended as much as I could.
Anything.
Please.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL BOXES
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> HAND GRAB/RUSTLING SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE GRIEF1_INSTRUMENTAL
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SUBSCPACE (DAY/NORMAL)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES
My hand was grasped by another's.

I looked on Aegis, who looked at me with an
expressionless face.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah...

Yeah, I'm okay. I'm... okay.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: Are you sure?
Aegis took his other hand and raised it to my face.
Pulling it away, a tear shone in the light.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm... crying?
The dam broke.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, I'm... okay...
Tears streamed down my face.
Aegis stepped forward.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> HUG SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SUBSCPACE (DAY/NORMAL)
Aegis had hugged me.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
It'll be okay.

It will be okay.

There was something comfortable about it. Welcoming,
and warm.
So I hugged him back.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: It wasn't your fault.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sniff
...
I released Aegis, and he did too in return.
Wiping my face, I was finishing my cry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know... it wasn't...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just...
I couldn't respond. My thoughts were too scattered.

But my mind did focus on one thing, as I stared on the
figure in front of me.
As I looked on him, the thought came into focus.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aegis...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are you... really?
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 240 FRAMES

Our journey brought us from the mountain range of the
Empire and Kingdom border.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...but why would they steal it?
Charlotte's words were given an extra edge of concern.

Oathbreakers are powerful, but they are simply a

... I am at a loss of words to dictate all who

I stepped onto the snow with a crunch.

Our travels through the Empire had largely brought us
through barren or snow coated landscapes.
I breathed, and I saw my breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Crekskia is...

It's... where I grew up before the Crows.

Stepping forward, the crunch of the snow beneath my
feet seemed to match the beat of my heart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's... fine.
I had been having strange dreams lately.
I wasn't sure if they were for real, or not.

More and more they had felt real, and more engraved
onto my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That place wasn't...

The most engraved image was of a scene. A grim scene
that sent shivers up my spine.
I stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That wasn't... Crekskia, was it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Greetings, my friend~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I was asked to accompany you on your scouting mission.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...

I tried stepping back, but the crunch of the snow was
enough to surprise me in my tense state.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure, let's scout then.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK
We stepped forward and walked along the path.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So... about our destination.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The Republic-Empire border?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Haha, you know what I mean...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Before that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
We talked once before of your family.

Of regrets you had in how you didn't remember them.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do you wish to learn more? Remember more?
I stopped again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sometimes I feel like that might be worse.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Truly? Why then do you feel-
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

lines.text:
Wait.

There's something in that bush.
I laid my hand on my sword and stepped towards it.
...and swung!

Be on guard!

Pant

Pant

lines.text: So what does that mean?
The chatter died down, as people became thoughtful.

lines.speaker: Kara

I sat against a rock, and my legs curled up a bit
towards my body.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What do I remember?

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It can be hard to tell... what is memory and what is
imagination anymore...

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: You do not need to rush it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess...

I calmed myself down, trying to scour my mind for what
scraps of it remained within.
Memories.
Memories of Crekskia.
Memories of my family.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There was this one time... I think...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
My brother was playing hero. And I was... the damsel in
distress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not literally. I was like a villager or something.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: 'Hero'...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah, based on old fairytales and bedtime stories my
Mom told us.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: It gives a warm feeling to the heart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One of my favorites was about Tuvae the Shepherd.

The story of a simple shepherd who was able to hold off
an army, and guide his people to safety.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah... I always wanted to be Tuvae but Nikolai wanted to
play that too...

I often was the one shepherding the 'townsfolk' to
safety.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
It appears to give you warm memories as well, despite
that role.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course, he was my brother and we-

I stopped as I realized how easily that memory had
flowed.

Just one thread pulled and the yarn of a tale formed
within.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (But... only of the stories we were told?)

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: What were their names?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
The names of your mother and brother.

It appears curiosity beckons me, as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

My mother's name was Estella, and my older brother's
name was Nikolai.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text:
...

What do you believe became of them?

I opened my mouth. The grim reality of the thought
crept onto my mind.
But I couldn't say it.

lines.speaker: Aegis
lines.text: I see.
Aegis lowered his hand and placed it on my head.
With a rustling motion, he patted my head.

He didn't feel like a stranger. It was familiar and
comforting.
But I raised my own hands to remove his all the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... appreciate it.
And I moved his arm down, away from my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I'm there.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
I closed my eyes.
And took a deep breathe.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC CAMP_INSIDE (MORNING)
I opened my eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I'm ready to try.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE VERDURE1

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_MOUNTAINTOP
(DAY)
I stepped at an even pace.
My thoughts were numb, but not dormant.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Crekskia...)
My memories were little to none of the place.
What I remembered, if anything, was emotions.
The emotions of stories.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...Anton?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?
I turned to see Kara walking at my side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, hello.

Turning my head a few degrees more, a similar sight met
me from my rear flank.
######### If satia alive
STAGE DIRECTION> #######
######## If mariel alive
STAGE DIRECTION> ########
...looking at Kara and me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You appear distracted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm fine.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: This village is one you are familiar with, yes?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I've not been exposed to specifics, but... it seems
safe to say based on our time with Atticus.

The rumors of your father are rumors, but the
underlying connection...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Yes, I grew up there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Before my father and I joined the Crows, at least.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As I speculated.

This village is a place of bad memories for you, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then... the distracted moments and restless sleep?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I said I'm fine.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You say as much, but I am far from the only one to
notice.
I turned my eye back a bit once more.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do not know if it is the combination of the two, or
this topic is more impactful...

...but the group has noticed a lot more little signs of
problems lately. Too much to be ignored.
So I peeked back once more.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mouthing YES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I said I'm fine. With being a girl, and with coming
back here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The 'girl' one does seem more likely to be true now.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
While I was not sure of it at the time, your recent
signs of frustration have dwarfed those prior...
That was not what I expected her to say.
I was left a bit speechless as a mixture of emotion.
Was it a urge to correct her? Or a feeling of relief?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just... please don't let me distract everyone else.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can handle myself without costing us the mission.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The most sure way to stop it from distracting others...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...would be to allow them to help.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Particularly now, when the risk is around the corner.

We are capable of getting you a place to rest, and
letting you sleep your way through our visit to the
village.

My mind had words for that. What those words could be
was a mystery, but I fought the urge to open my mouth.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Alright...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Please take what actions will make the others
comfortable.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Being a hindrance would be... the last thing I'd want.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you.
Kara looked to breath out a bit more deliberately.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Was I worrying them that much?)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Norde was prepping some of the Crows to arrange
lodging, so I will go and inform him of your needed
accommodations.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
Kara stepped back, and I raised my hand to my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What am I doing? They're just worrying more...)
Rubbing my temples, the stress wasn't going away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sigh

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (We can't be much farther now.)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

As we approached one major turn... one that should put
the village in our sights... I closed my eyes.
And took a deep breath.
And another.

And tried to swat away what the emotions I could
remember made me expect of this.
A ruin.

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC DARKWORLD_VILLAGE
(EVENING/PURPLE SKY)
That's what I expected to see.
The ruins of something terrible.

For all my attempts to not distract, Atticus's previous
words had rung true to me.

The rumors of a man who had killed his family, and
brought destruction and an end to the place he
protected.
I did not remember, but it felt too 'true' to ignore.
My heart wouldn't let me.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
So with a few more breaths, I waited to feel it.
The feeling of the sun lowering in the distance.

The feeling of the sightline to Crekskia being unveiled
beyond the next corner.
The feeling of...
...inevitability.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120
And there it was.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 200
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE NOCTURNAL BLOOM
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT (DAY)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
The tension warped away in an instant.
In my eyes was a village.

A village with people scattered about living their
lives.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan...?
I jumped a little, and was pulled out of the trance.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Crekskia, the mining town.

Out of the way of major trade routes, but also along
the way of many minor ones.

This region of the empire has ill- suited terrain and
climate for large scale farming operations...

...so the farms that keep the people going are
scattered amongst many small communities, along with
external trade with places like Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
In fact, nowadays the trade is applicable to most of
the Empire... as the Republic takes more and more of
the farmland along the border.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan, you know more about it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Of course. I was raised to take over the Empire one
day.

It would be unbecoming to not be knowledgeable of its
people and places.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right...

As I averted my eyes, Rowan tilted over to try and meet
my gaze.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do not worry. From what I know, Crekskia lives
peacefully and, given its size, prosperously.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Then, you know what happened here, long ago?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Less than I'd like. Primarily the Covenant story that
Atticus told.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That, and there were some refugees from the incident...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do you know where the Vault is?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...to avoid? Or to find?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I agreed to avoid it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So Kara said.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas... I did not seek it out when I visited before,
no.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's okay. Thank you.

As I finished my words, some of the horses carrying
supplies reached me along with Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ready? You'll have to help with us getting rooms for
the night.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: If I can, sure.

So we both stepped forward, towards the town... towards
Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmmm...
This left Rowan at a standstill.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So the Empire doesn't know more about the incident?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Nothing I was privy to.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is no guarantee the Covenant was trying to cover
anything up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But... would that mean that Ivan... that Pup's dad...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps it because I have never had the chance to meet
the man, but people do not always wear the mask of
their true self.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I know, but that's...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Difficult to believe, yes...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I apologize. I didn't mean to cause more stress.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps it would be best for me to assist Norde and
Pup.

Kara politely bowed, and then stepped forward to chase
after us two.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There's no way that guy would... kill his own family.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Hmm...

I suppose there is one other thing I know of it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Whatever happened wasn't without other refugees.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What? What do you mean? Like someone who fled Crekskia
besides Ivan and Pup?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed.

In fact, that other refugee is...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...my brother.

And with that note, Rowan stepped forward towards the
town as well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?!

Charlotte was left mouth agape, unable to collect
herself before Rowan had moved out of her arm's reach.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hey, wait, what do you mean by that?!
She stepped forward and chased after Rowan.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Weren't you... a bastard child.?!

You're only the heir... because the emperor didn't...
have other biological children... right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Alexei? Alexei...?!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

Charlotte's questioning faded away as the two closed
their distance to the village.

And all that was left was the lively chatter of Crows
and villagers as the group entered the town properly.
Happy voices, preparing for the days of the future.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE STARRY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT (DAY)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(EVENING)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 140 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(NIGHT)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 200 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG HOUSE (NIGHT)
Shhhink...!
The sharpening stone glided over the steeled edge.
##### if satia alive ############

That was soon accompanied by the creak of my door
opening.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'll be taking a shower. If you need anything from the
supply, please just let me know.

That was soon accompanied by a knock on my door and a
voice outside of it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Checking in as agreed. Just give me or the other Crows
a holler if you need anything.
STAGE DIRECTION> #################

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks. Will do.
I could hear footsteps disappear as she walked away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
... I know I agreed to this, but...

Must I be treated like a grounded child?

Per my conversation with Kara, I was arranged a remote
living quarters to the edge of the town.

There were not inns enough to house the Crows, so the
village accepted some of us to bunk with them at their
family homes.

Along with some unoccupied housing, like the small one
I was in now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(To think... kindhearted enough to let strangers into
their homes...)

I shook my head a little. That wasn't a thought I
needed to dwell on.

If all went well, I wouldn't need to step a foot closer
to the village.

The others were using the evening to load up on much
needed supplies, and I was left as one of many doing
weapon maintenance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There. In record time, too.
I set the sword back into the pile and stepped back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Now what?

It appeared that I rushed through my nightly
distraction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

As I considered what to do, my eye wandered to the
nearby window.

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (There's just a few people left.)

Even on the outskirts, the village felt lively. It was
only now with the night in full effect that the sight
softened.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG HOUSE (NIGHT)
I stumbled over into the bed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I should just... sleep.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. I should.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
I closed my eyes.

And through sheer force of will, I tried my best to
sleep.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 120 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY.
I succeeded, eventually.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 200 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE WONDER5
STAGE DIRECTION> HARD CUT TO BG HOUSE (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Gasp
...!

I vaulted up into a sitting position on the bedding,
trying to catch my breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What was... that?)

My body felt suddenly full of energy. Like a breath of
life had been radiated throughout my being.
Along with that, I saw an image of a familiar figure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Aegis?

The name appeared in my mind, but I wasn't sure what to
make of it. Whatever memory it encapsulated was fuzzy
to my waking mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How long have I been out?)
I looked around for any signs and...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe if I check the moon, then I can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait...?
There was a shine from my belt pocket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The locket that Dad gave me...

Why is it... shining?
STAGE DIRECTION> SHOW LOCKET

I clicked it, opening it up to see if something had
happened within.

Nothing too unusual stuck out to me, bar the glow I had
seen radiating around it.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE LOCKET IMAGE
I closed it.

The glow was still there, and I turned it around
looking for any other sign of the reason for it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Though... didn't Rowan say this was an heirloom? With
magical properties and all?)
I closed my hand tightly around the locket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(My mother's... heirloom.)

.........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?

As I gripped it. I noticed that the aura was leaking
out of my hand.

But it wasn't evenly doing do. It had a clear direction
as the light escaped the gaps between my fingers.

I moved my hand around, and the light stayed pointing
in a specific direction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Huh.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Like... a compass?)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> DOOR OPEN SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_SUMMIT
(NIGHT)
I closed the door behind me slowly and quietly.

Looking down at the locket, the glow pointed deeper
into the town.
Into Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What else would I expect...?
I looked forward.
Took a deep breath.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 90 FRAMES
And stepped forward.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 70 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Hm? Was that...?
The Nightless Crow scratched their chin.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Maybe I should let Norde and them know...
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL, WAIT 140 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE NOCTURNAL BLOOM
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_TOWN (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And... this way?)

lines.speaker: Villager 1
lines.text: Hey, looking for something?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- No thank you. I'm good.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I appreciate the thought.

It had been like this since I started following the
trail.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Clearly it's not late enough for everyone to be
asleep. People are settling down for the night.)
The act of walking through the town felt surreal.
All around me were happy and content faces.

It wasn't as active as the day, but the village was
very much alive, contrary to the emotional memory I had
of it.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Quite a few houses.)

(A trade depot... a doctor's office... a general
store...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, is that...?)
I stepped to the window of the shop.

Within it was a carved wooden statue. It was something
between a decoration and, to a child's eye, a toy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Raiga.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's still there...

.........

I stepped away in an instant like I was dodging a
strike.

The memory of seeing this here... all those years
ago... snapped into place.
But it was just that... The memory of wanting a toy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(To see it here still, all these years later...)

.........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
... I can't... I...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I need to focus on this. Whatever it's trying to tell
me.)

I gripped the locket tighter, and I stepped forward
with it as a guide once more.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES

I continued on, and soon I felt the crunch of snow
underneath my feet.

My path had me climb to a higher area of the village
where the recent snow had yet to melt.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)

It was a path that set my feet in front of a manor to
the edges of the village.
So I raised my hand... and knocked.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 70 FRAME
STAGE DIRECTION> DOOR OPEN SE
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 80 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hello. The owners are aiming to go to sleep for the
day, so can you-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, Pup?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's MY question...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 70 FRAMES
#### If mariel alive ######

Charlotte, Mariel, and Kara were paying to use some
rooms here, same as I was in the house earlier.
#### If not

Charlotte and Kara were paying to use some rooms here,
same as I was in the house earlier.
STAGE DIRECTION> #################

The family was excited to see "one of their friends" at
the door, and quickly invited me in for a drink.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE LIMPID_WATER_NO-
MELODY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C (NIGHT)
Steam rose from the cup in my hand.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
Sorry, a hot cup of water is all we can do at the
moment. We're nearly out of tea and the next shipment
won't be for a week.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you. I appreciate it.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: It's cold out this time of year, so better to warm up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you for your hospitality towards our friend.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I will echo that.
Across from me sat a few familiar faces.
######### If Mariel Alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Haha... ha...
STAGE DIRECTION> ########

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
......

What brings you here, Pup...?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
Yes, I am curious as well!

These young ladies were the last sort I'd expect to be
traveling with mercenaries.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Ha, yeah, to think Cartenan of all places is in a war
now.

The two hosts sat alongside us as they co-opted
Charlotte's question.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
What about you, young miss? What brings you to Crekskia
along with the mercenaries?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... grew up with them.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Really? Ah, that's no place for a young lady. I hope
they treat you well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, they do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of... course they do. It's home.

I stared into the glass of water, seeing a reflection
of my current self.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Home is home, even if the place and... faces change.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

Charlotte and Kara glanced at each other with knowing
looks.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Home, eh? You know, Mr. and Mrs. Levin here were
telling us about that before.
####### if mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: The romance story?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Yes. The story of their romance, you mean?
STAGE DIRECTION> ################

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: Ah, yes. That little story of ours.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That's the one.

The one about how they were born here and met each
other here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...meaning they've lived here their entire lives.

For... over 20 years... longer than you've been alive,
Pup.
Charlotte was staring daggers at me expectantly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Over 20 years...?)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

Meaning they would've been here when IT happened 13
years ago.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... don't say...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You've likely seen a lot of history of Crekskia over
that time.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
A bit. But not much happens here.

Mainly just the depleting food stores since the war
with the Republic started...

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
There was that time that the Covenant occupied half the
village for a few months.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Back when we were kids? Yeah, that was a time. Thought
it was the end of the world, haha.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The Covenant occupied the village?

As Kara asked, she tilted her head so she could see me
out of the corner of her eyes. She was not trying to
hide that she was gauging my reactions.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: Yeah, a murder, apparently.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's...
### If mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Back when you kids... that'd have been...
STAGE DIRECTION> ###########

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
It was... a dozen years ago, maybe? Maybe a little
more.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
We were just teenagers at the time, so it was like
right out of a novel to us.

Thinking about it now, it was like a different world.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
May I inquire... if this was a family affair that you
refer to?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Kara, are you sure?

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Hmm... I think so. We used to play with the kids of the
affected family, despite them being younger than us.

One of them was a platinum blonde haired boy. He was a
real... haha... I remember him being high energy.

The other was... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
I don't think we talked much but that one had a blue
sort of hair? Followed around the older brother a lot.

It's been over a decade and I can still remember those
little fluffs of azure sticking out from behind the
older one's back.

In fact, it was a color a lot like...
I tried to keep quiet. I tried to just listen.
I tried to not talk.
###### If mariel alive #########

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup...
####### if not

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe we should...
STAGE DIRECTION> ########

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: And do you know what happened to those two children?

Kara pushed forward despite the hesitancy from the rest
of us.

Her willingness to face it... I didn't know if I could
take it as a blessing or a curse.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Well, we never saw any of them again. The mother, the
father, or the two kids.

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text:
This house stood empty for quite a few years.

And even since we moved in, I've never felt anything
like a ghost or other spiritual remains.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, here? This house?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: Oh, I'm sorry. I don't mean to scare you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Perhaps it'd be best to stop here and-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did he do it?

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: Hmm... I shouldn't have brought it up.
#### If mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup, you don't need to. You can go back to your room.
STAGE DIRECTION> #########

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I need to know.

I held my locket close. My hand gripped tightly around
it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Did that man kill them?

Did he kill his family?
The room grew silent.

I faced the husband. The man I had apparently played
with as a child.

And I asked him something that it felt like only he
could tell me.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Did the father kill his family...? I cannot say I'll
ever really know, but...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

I gripped the locket tighter and instinctively squeezed
my eyes shut.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: But as for what I think happened... for what I believe.

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
...

I do not believe he did.

I do not believe he ever could.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
The idea, from what I knew of the family even as a
child, is preposterous to me.

It's why I'm okay with living in this house.
My eyes trailed down towards the locket.
STAGE DIRECTION> ...
It was glowing again.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup, is that...?
It was pointing towards the wall.
So I got up and sprinted over to it.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: W- What are you...?
I sprinted up to the wall.
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE SUSPENSE 5
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C (NIGHT)
I felt across wall, tapping and hitting parts of it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is there something beyond it?

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: What are you doing?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I- I can explain?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup! Stop it!

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text:
Young lady, step away from the wall!

Is she having some conniption or something?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: In your hand... is that...?
I looked down at the locket again.
The heirloom.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There.

I placed my hand on one of the bricks in the wall. The
light of the locket was pointing at it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Almost like... it remembers?)

lines.speaker: Husband
lines.text: YOUNG LADY. STEP AWAY FROM THE WALL.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> CLICK SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 30 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There!
STAGE DIRECTION> WALL MOVING SE, SHAKE SCREEN BRIEFLY

lines.speaker: Wife
lines.text: What in the Goddess's realm is that...?!
The wall started moving, revealing a secret passage.
###### if mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup... did you know that was there?
#### if not

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Were you looking for this?
STAGE DIRECTION> ########

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I have... no idea.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But... I think this is it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This is where I'll find answers.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This is the-
STAGE DIRECTION> WALL MOVEMENT MALFUNCTION SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 50 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh? It got jammed?

The mechanism to move the wall struggled, with audible
gearing trying and failing to slide it open.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No!
It wasn't open enough for any of us to slide through.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is okay. We can fix it. But we need to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: NO!!!
My mind didn't want to accept it.

I pounded on the wall, trying to loosen it and get it
to move again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're not that thick of a wall! Just... start...
moving!

My desperation pushed away Kara, who had tried to
approach to calmly lead me back.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup, calm down! Just-
STAGE DIRECTION> FLASH OF GREEN

The light from the locket shined brighter, and started
to appear as though it swirled around me.
####### if mariel alive

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Wait, is that a spell? Wind magic?!
###### if not

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?! Doesn't that look like spellcasting?!
STAGE DIRECTION> ##########

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Everyone back!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dammit!
I cocked my fist by instinct and frustration.

The swirling light gathered around my fist like a
swirling wind was forming.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: JUST... LET... ME... THROUGH!!!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> SWOOSH SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C (NIGHT)

STAGE DIRECTION> FLASH A LIGHT GREEN (DO NOT WAIT TO
FINISH)
STAGE DIRECTION> SMASH SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120 FRAMES

My body flew threw the air surrounded by cobble broken
from the wall.

Whatever balance I had was lost, and I quickly found
myself upside down.

Upside down and looking back at the hole I just fell
through.

And hearing the muffled yells of a trusted ally now
mirrored in my view.
A view obstructed by the closing wall behind me.

A view that turned to black, as my head hit the stairs
below.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
A view that turned to nothing.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 210
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_TOWN (NIGHT)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
The clanking of a metallic footstep entered the town.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: They were tracked along this path.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: And they're still here?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Well, our deployment got here as fast as we could.

Hard to believe they'd get beyond here. But...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Right, if not here, then we know where to go next.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Surround the town.

If that princess is dumb enough to be here now.

We will end her. Permanently.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE SUSPENSE7
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG027C

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Gasp
...!
The air filled my lungs in a desperate fervor.

I jumped myself off the ground to my knees with a jolt,
stumbling a little before I caught myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Pant
...
pant
... I need to... I'm alive...
unharmed...?

My panicked state from before persisted, and I found my
eyes jumping about the room.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... quiet. Safe... maybe?

Pushing myself over into a sitting position, I was able
to calm myself to check on myself and my surroundings.

I could see the stairwell I tumbled down. The descent
looked deadly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (But I'm not injured, am I?)

As I had the thought, I finally started to loosen my
grip on the locket.

Getting to my feet, it had a faint compass like glow
once more.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Thank you.
I turned around and saw the stone room around me.
It lead out into...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_LIFT (NIGHT)
...an unfinished dirt corridor.
An eerily familiar one.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It's almost like this place was abandoned mid
construction?)

(An expansion to the place or renovation or something?)

...
I stepped further into it and looked down the tunnels.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Familiar.

...

I've seen this place before.

As I said as much, the locket's light pivoted towards
one of the dirt corridor's directions.
I stared down at tunnel with next to no light in it.
All I would have is the light from the locket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Okay.
So I stepped forward... into the dark.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC
COAL_MINE_MATERIALS_SITE (EVENING BLUEISH)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG027C
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_TUNNEL (NIGHT
GREENISH)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES

Stumbling through the dim light, I made my way through
the excavated halls and half finishes stone rooms.

Most of the time, I only had my locket's light to guide
me.

But on occasion, I was able to take a peek at my
surroundings via mystical looking fires dimly lighting
the place.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Like they just left it and sealed the place up
after... what happened.)
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE DIALOGUE STUFF

But even so, the more corners I passed, the more
familiar it felt.

Not enough to know where I was or to avoid getting
lost.
But, enough to...
Out of the corner of my eye...

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: C'mon!
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE DIALOGUE STUFF
I blinked.

Whatever I had seen had started to run around the
corner, but was now gone.

I looked down to my locket to see what direction it
pointed in.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The same way...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
So I stepped around the corner myself.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE OUT MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG027C
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This is it.)

(The Vault proper.)
My hand settled on the metal door.

It was worn and broken. All I needed to do was push it
open.
Looking down at the locket, it pointed within.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This is where you were leading me to...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Exhale
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> METAL DOOR OPENING SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 210
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM YF_DARKKING_THEME05_LOOP

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC ALTAR (NIGHT, FULLY
ACTIVE)

STAGE DIRECTION> THE FOLLOWING "SHADOW" CHARACTER IS A
SILHOUETTE. A "SHADOW" PUP DOESN'T CURRENTLY REMEMBER.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text: Ha... hahaha...

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: M- Mom!!!
I opened the door.
To meet a scene I knew.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text:
These stupid children...

See what you've let them cause?
A shadow of a man towered over her.

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text: Argh...!
...with a hand around her neck.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: Let go of her!!!

Nikolai sat limp on the ground, glints of blood amongst
the flickering light.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: M- Mom...?
And I stood there in shock, departed from my world.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text: Ah... another one.

lines.speaker: Nikolai
lines.text: A- Anton...?!

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text:
What else would one expect, I suppose, from an
Emeraldian bitch and her blighted offspring?

lines.speaker: Estella
lines.text:
A- Anton... Run!

Sweetie, just... RUN...!

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text:
Better to purge you all from any divine grace afforded
to you.
His other hand gripped at my mother's neck.

lines.speaker: Shadow
lines.text: Just one more dead by your failings.

lines.speaker: Anton
lines.text: NOOOOOOO!!!!!!!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
I ran.

STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL NARRATION/DIALOGUE, WAIT 60
FRAMES
Forward.

STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL NARRATION/DIALOGUE, WAIT 60
FRAMES
I charged towards the scene with no plan.

STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL NARRATION/DIALOGUE, WAIT
150 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC ALTAR (NIGHT, FULLY
ACTIVE)

SOUND EFFECT LIKE ANTON RAN INTO THE TWO. FADE TO BLACK

STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 30 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

STAGE DIRECTION> CRASH SE (LIKE A VASE BROKE)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 210 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC ALTAR (EVENING, NO
FIRE)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...?
I opened my eyes and the dream like state was banished.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ow...
My head and shoulder throbbed with pain.

Looking up, it looked at though I had ran into a stone
altar in the middle of the room.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Was that... part of the dream, too?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Plus... this...

Turning my head over, I saw something strange in my
hand.
I tightly gripped a potsherd.

The sensation of the sharp edges digging into my hand
took hold, and I dropped it to the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh... Why was I holding that...?
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF

Through the whirlwind of it all, I managed to calm down
some.
Readying myself to move...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Inhale
...

Exhale
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

......

.........

That wasn't... That wasn't Dad.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE
LIMPID_WATER_NOMELODY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC COAL_MINE_LIFT

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How did I even get here...?)
I stumbled along in the dark.
The locket no longer shone any light.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Of the times I'd appreciate Aegis's help...)

One hand of mine sat on the wall as I tried to feel my
way through the darker parts of the corridors.
The other hand was wrapped in a bandage.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(I still remember it clearly enough. That... That
couldn't have been my father.)
I was distracted by the memory I just relived.

I couldn't remember the face of whoever it was that did
it.

But I could remember the smirk on his face when he did
it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: When he... when he...

It was the best I could do from trying not to think
about the rest of it.

That bastardly grin. That evil smile deserving of
revenge.

STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF, WAIT 60
FRAMES

I was able to calm myself some with deep breathes as I
rounded a corner.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (...a light?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And its moving about like...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (A shadow! Maybe that's Charlotte and them?)
I stepped forward, hurrying along to the nearby room.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG027C

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Kara! Charlotte! And-
The figure turned to me.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Hey... aren't you...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shit.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Where did Pup go?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Do try to keep your wits about you.

lines.text:
To think they would barge in here after us... Argh...

lines.speaker: Soldier

No mercy for that coward traitor of a princess.

You! Are you one of them!? Fighting and stealing, you

Hm? Oh, greetings. Are you the master of this abode? I

No? Why am I here you ask? I would be delighted to

What is wrong with my voice? I do not think anything is

I will attend to that as soon as I finish cleaning this

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Hm~mm~hm~mm~

Welcome. I'll be right there. First I must finish

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: H- Hey?! Why do you have that?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, what is this?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
It's a chip that I need to keep being an effective maid
and-!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Wait... why was I being a maid...? Last I remember I
was fighting... Elaine?

...Where am I?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Uh... Crekskia?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Oh Crekskia! That's...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What is Crek-shika?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Are you okay? What this... strange item doing something
to you?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I think I'm okay now. Just made me compulsive want to
act like a maid for a while...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I don't think I did anything too bad before you got it
off, like-

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: ...sign a contract.
Macy took out a perfectly maintained piece of paper.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hm? A contract?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A "Notice of Debt"... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I'm starting to remember signing this now... I'm
screwed now if I don't re-equip that chip and be a
super-maid again...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? Why?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
According to the paper, debt incurred at a restaurant
and inn.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
What am I supposed to do when I wake up buck naked in
the middle of a snowy field?

I found an inn that offered me a good meal and a
night's stay...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Next thing I know I have a contract shoved in my face!
One that would multiply my debt by 1000 if broken!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Between debt and my maid mind... of course I didn't
think twice before signing it...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That's not a thing.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What? I think I misheard you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indentured Servitude Contracts like this have been
illegal since the Covenant became the dominant cultural
power.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Cove-what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Goods that can't be reclaimed - like food or housing -
are goods a merchant needs to get payment for upfront.

Real merchants want to get paid, not life debt people.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
This Imperial seal on the contract looks shoddily
forged, too.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Meaning I never needed to spend the last couple months
as a maid...

...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Well, I guess I'm happy I got skilled with these
knives~

Macy grabbed back the contract and ripped it up with a
vigor.

Then she grabbed the electronic looking chip and
stomped it beneath her heel.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: That jerk is gonna regret having me learn knifework...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If this guy did this to other people, then he's on my
shitlist, too.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Wait, but now I don't have food or a place to sleep...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: I guess I do have clothes now.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: A maid outfit...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Are you guys hiring, maybe?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I- Uh... Well, I guess we can always use more help?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Thank God I met you all!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You mean "the Goddess", no?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
"Goddess" what now?

...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
You know what, forget I asked. This hurts my head to
think about.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Ah, you are alive.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That is encouraging.

lines.text: Not gonna fall here.

lines.text: Not then, and not now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah... it's unimportant. Especially in the middle of a

lines.speaker: Pup

you've done today.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...Of course.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Sigh
... No more running off, yeah?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup!

Satia ran up to me and quickly wrapped me in a tight
hug.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Satia?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you doing?

I blurted out the words and Satia nuzzled against me in

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
...

lines.text: It's good to see you, Satia. I'm happy you're safe.

I hugged her back quickly, and soon enough we swiveled

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde.

Giggle

lines.text:

Eh, what a place for the Covenant to build. This is a

lines.text:

#### Castel x Reagyn #####

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Intriguing... An entire labyrinth... just to protect an
Oathbreaker.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Should you be focusing on that at this time? We've
hostiles about.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, such is true. But one cannot take my curiosity. I
would not be me.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Do you not see these tunnels and rooms and have a rush
of wonder for its nature? It's purpose?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Not particularly.

We're not here to gawk. We're here to do a job.

If we're not trying to work towards saving my homeland,
it is not worth what time and resources I have.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, but that is the key. To understand is to be able to
achieve your goals more effectively.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
See those wooden structures supporting the tunnel? What
if we were to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What if the enemy was to destroy them?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: That is... true.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Then I'll leave such observations to you.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Of course.

lines.text: This place is so dark and dank...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Be strong, friend. They are as blinded as we are.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Lady Kara...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I understand, but... they're organized. We just woke

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Do no fret. They do not have the advantage. We do.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Thank you, Lady Kara. As usual, you know just what to
say.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What are you rambling on about?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:

This is not a place you are welcome. You've no right to
step foot in here.

lines.text: As if I care. I fight for my home.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And today, I fight for one of mine.
#### Nora v Jude #####

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Tsk... you.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Nora.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
How can you stand there? Acting as though you aren't a
traitor?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Traitor to who? The Empire?

Or to your own personal objectives?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
The Empire should pay their bills more promptly.

And you're just one of many amongst the Imperials that
owe me a good meal.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Sigh
... Not that I'll have a chance to cash out those
favors.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Quiet. You chose your side. This ends now.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Stronger women than you have tried.
#### Nora v Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph. Welcome to Crekskia, fox.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I see Princess A has picked up more than just
oppression from her vile parents.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You don't get to talk about my parents.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: If their sins are too much for you to burden...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...I'll relieve you of them!
#### Nora v Mariel #####

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The younger "princess", is it?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: How... How could you do this?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
The amount of people who have died... Lockhart...
Cartenan...

You're just spreading death and destruction everywhere.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: The war is not mine to fight. I fight for Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
What?! But you're the one who brought war against our
home!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You know nothing of Lockhart.

I will fight for her future.

Threats to that future must be removed.
#### Nora v any other allies (first time) #####

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You lot... I am tired of you blocking my path...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Out of my way!

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Ugh...! This...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'm not letting you get away AGAIN.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I'll have to fall back...
STAGE DIRECTION> CONTINUE BATTLE MUSIC
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

The enemy was pushed back by our blades, and scattered
amongst the ruin.

Of those that could muster a retreat, they headed back
up the stairway to escape outside.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Fall back!
STAGE DIRECTION> FIGHT CLASH SE, WAIT 15 FRAMES (X3)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG015C
