STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Time it.

Nora and a few other Imperial troops and mercenaries
jettisoned out into the village.

Turning their heels back towards the house, they were
not retreating.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: They should still be in position, right?

One of the soldiers was clearly distracted, looking
around wildly to the surrounding area.
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING OUTSIDE SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Stop there, you piece of...!

Charlotte and Kara arrived. The former like a boar
ready to charge, and the latter calm and collected.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Surrender.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What?! After all she's done?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I understand. Trust me.
She turned back to Nora.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Surrender. We can negotiate for your safety.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY

The groups stood at a standstill. Each with weapons
ready to move on their foe.
STAGE DIRECTION> .........

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Heh.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: NOW!!!
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF

The scream rang out into the trees and other houses of
the village.
Sending down...!
STAGE DIRECTION> ........
Nothing.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Idiots! Get out here!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'm not sure...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: There should be an ambush, based on her words.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A- Ambush?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Idiots! Get out here!
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 150 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: You mean this ambush?
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE NOCTURNAL BLOOM
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_VILLAGE (NIGHT)

lines.speaker: Other Soldier
lines.text: Argh...!
A tied up soldier fell to the ground.

The villager had entered from the edges of the area and
the darkness.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Or this one?

Suddenly, a variety of villagers and Nightless Crows
exited from the same darkness, each showing a soldier
or mercenary they had subdued.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Others came to help?
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING IN SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 40 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: There... There you all are!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ever am I glad I asked that Crows to spread the word of
this lot before I headed in.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Thank ya, prince. And the Nightless Crows that helped.

We're not about to let some rogue army regiment attack
our friends and families.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: R- Rogue...?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is the least I can do.

My last visit here was such a pleasure that it'd be a
shame to not see my people flourish.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you, Alexei. I'm so happy I could kiss you.
Charlotte cocked back the hammer on her gun.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It would be my pleasure.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It damn well will.
She lowered the gun to target Nora directly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I will say it again. Surrender.

This time with the utmost sincerity. After all, there
is no need to test if you have backup plans anymore.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Is that what that was?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We can indeed negotiate for your safety.

And...
Kara looked over Nora's face.
From her armor to her fox-like ears.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You are from Lockhart, I presume?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...Yes.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Fantastic. Then there is a matter of negotiation I
imagine would be prudent for you to engage in. (s1
neutral On the matter of your family.

Nora released her grip and her weapon fell to the
ground.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you.
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

Nora and the other troops were secured and looked over
by the Nightless Crows.
As Kara spoke to Nora, Charlotte stepped over to Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Is it time for my kiss?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I hope she'll give up info easily. Not sure I want to
drag her along with us.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Spurned once more...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Given how much she wants to kill me, it's probably
gonna be a pain...

...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, where's Pup?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm? Were they not with you by the end of the fight?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, I hope they're not doing something reckless again.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE
UNKNOWNWORLDS_HARP_LOOP
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031C
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 80 FRAMES
My feet stopped before a grave.
And my eyes tilted down to the locket.
I watched as the light faded.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One last stop...?

Lifting it up, I donned the locket around my neck, and
secured it safely under my shirt.

With a few more steps, I was in front of the grave
proper.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Here lies those... taken too early by the Goddess."

There was one grave with three names on it, and this
location split off from the main graveyard behind me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
"Estella Baranov."

"Nikolai Baranov."

.........

"Anton Baranov."
My eyes lingered on that the final one.

And as they did, I slowly sat myself before the three
names.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Exhale
...
Slowly, I let myself breathe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I suppose it's natural.

The "entire family was killed"... That was the story,
wasn't it?
In.
Out.

My mind calmed as I continued to try to find the words
to say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Nikolai...

...

Thank you. For protecting me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know... I can't remember what happened in the end.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But if I am here... and you... aren't...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you. For being my big brother.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
As for you, my mother...

...

Mom... I'm sorry. I'm sorry for forgetting.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And...
I tried to find words. Something to say.
Something to remember.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (All I could remember was...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Mom.

Can I... tell you a story, maybe?

A story to both of you, maybe... about a wannabe hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A silly boy chasing after the shadow of a true hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It all started...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... when would it start...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It all started when the wannabe hero and their father
joined a mercenary group...

As this wannabe hero was told of how those days
happened... the two showed up and were welcomed with
open arms...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And that's when "Bored" made the wannabe hero run
laps...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...around the capital city of the Republic!
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It was... a tournament I think? In one of the
Republic's ports.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The hero expected them to come back with spoils of
victory, but Satia just-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Or, er, "Matia" just came back with a dress of all
things.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It was for her, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sigh
... I didn't hear the end of that crusade for a
week...
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK AND BACK

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... I think you two would've liked them.
### if mariel alive

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte, Mariel, Rowan, Kara...
#### If not

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte, Rowan, Kara...
STAGE DIRECTION> #######

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: All these people we've met are... amazing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Always pushing forward. Always with a card up their
sleeve. Able to lift us up...

They make me want to be better.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: To not drag them down... with whatever my failures are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I wish you two got to meet them, too.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And then... when we...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...when... we...

Yawn
...

...when we saw... the mountain...

.........
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
The words spun their fabric of a tale.
A lullaby that spanned time beyond my awareness.
It was only a matter of time before sleep took me.

A sleep that, despite where I was, was like a cocoon of
comfort.
Like a weight had been lifted off my shoulders.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> CHANGE PUP TO STAGE 4 ART VERSIONS
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 210 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE AWAY MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

Flickering sunlight streamed through the forested
canopy.
It hit my eyes and my grogginess was forced aside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mmm...

Sitting up from my sleeping position, I could feel a
new weight on my shoulders.
Or, perhaps, a new weight on my chest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...

My gambeson was big enough on me now that it slipped
off my shoulders as I moved.

Though, the tightness of my clothes otherwise, belts
and shirt included, stopped it from falling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course.

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha... hahaha...

I flopped back down onto my back and let the morning
sun pelt me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course it happened... one... more... time...

"Here lies Anton Baranov"

........

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not much left to lose now, I think.

For all my efforts. For all my struggles. For all my
attempts to embrace it.
My "weakness" was my "weakness".
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
And maybe there was nothing I could do about it.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC BG031B (MORNING)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What do you think? Mom? Nikolai?

Do I at least make a half decent girl?

Hahaha!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What am I doing?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What even can I do?

...

Maybe that's the lesson.

You are who you are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And every second I spend trying to figure it out is
just another step down the same paths as before.

I slowly rose to my feet, and tried to get used to the
new shift in my center of gravity as I did.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... Yeah, this is workable, I think.

I padded down my outfit, clearing away the underbrush
from my clothes and longer hair.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mom, Nikolai... I'll visit again.

As I said the words, the rustle of distant sounds
drifted towards me.
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE ALL DIALOGUE STUFF
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...isn't... there...?
### If reagyn is recruited and alive

lines.text: ...think... over...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'll try to not take as long this time to visit
again... but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I do have a story to finish.
I bowed slightly to the grave.
And turned towards my comrades-in-arms.

lines.text: (There it is... it's done. Fully.)

This new change gave a feeling of finality. It was a
feeling of closure.
So I started at the top, as I usually did.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Long hair, cute face... A woman's complexion.)

My azure locks settled towards the arch of my back, and
lacked styling bar 'long' and 'feminine'.

It still fell onto my face to frame a set of soft
facial features.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (None of that changed since last time... Below it...)
My frame and figure was untouched as well.

Slim shoulders and wide hips came inward into an
hourglass silhouette.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I've been noticing my walk has more of a...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What do they call it? A strut? A sway?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I wonder if that's because of this?)

I let those thoughts run, and I turned to see the arch
of my back transition into a perky butt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

This time, the only thing poking out the other side was
a pair of breasts.
Substantial breasts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (They are... a bit big...)

I had lived with this size for some time, and I was
trying to decide if I felt they were "too big".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Not even aesthetically... just...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (...trying to move around with.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Not like the curse is trying to do me any favors.)

I swung my hips back to look at the climax of my time
here in front of the mirror.
It was gone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (The deed is done...)

It hadn't been something that held me back from seeing
myself as a woman anymore.
I had come to that conclusion some time ago.

But it was surreal to see myself with a vagina instead
though, and I took a slow breath.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What do I even feel about that? Should I? Do I?
In, and out.

I breathed, and let myself focus on other things for
the moment.

I took a deep breath. I felt like my nerves were
shaking when I stepped in front of the mirror.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I'm okay. I can do this.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I chose this path.)

What faced me in the mirror was a womanly face, looking
back with feminine features.

Framed by my now styled hair, I didn't just look like a
man turned woman... I looked like a proper lady.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Though maybe a bit like a dress up doll, too...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Not that... that is all that bad, sometimes...)

It would take time to get used to the decision I made.
I wanted to give this a proper shot, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(If anything, I'm more used to my body now than
anything.)

Things like seeing my notably sized breasts didn't
phase me as they did, especially now that I had
accepted them.

Months having constant reacclimation to their growth
was nothing to sneeze at in terms of honing my
instincts, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I have learned a lot about how to use other's weight
against them.)

My frame and height were notably smaller than when we
started. I didn't have the muscle on them that I used
to, and that was undeniable.

Instead, I had to be more picky about my powerful
strikes, using openings and their own power against
them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It does tend to take them off guard. People are so
used to trying to counter brute force.)

With a small sway of my hips and dangling hair as I let
the slight moment of pride wash over me, I moved onto
my lower body.

As before, I had a distinct hourglass figure that went
into my hips and thighs.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Useful in itself for controlling flow and momentum...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And maybe it looks decent...)
I stepped to my side and lowered my stand some.

As a trained instinct, I settled into a slight bounce.
I moved about like I was prepping for an enemy.

I was able to move nimbly, where even my breasts didn't
bounce significantly at their size.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It's sort of hard to believe I picked this all up over
the course of this adventure...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(To think I never even considered to think on it
until... well...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha...

With a small laugh, I let myself look to other elements
I had not yet.
####### If extra small height

My lessened height was noticeable, particularly with
the extra inches I lost over what I assumed would've
happened otherwise.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I guess there's some advantage to getting under their
range...?)

I was relieved that the breast size didn't stick around
after I took that lucky shot to change it in that
turbulent time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Do I even take a shot at trying to... customize more
stuff? Nudge them in a direction?)

Though what I saw below was the closest thing I had to
a souvenir of my old life before all this started.

changes, my chiseled abs seemed almost mundane.

pretty.)
####### If Flawless teeth   (charisma)

My face had an unexpected distraction as I had those
thoughts. A quick smile unveiled pearly whites without
a notable flaw.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Not that they look unnatural, but... they seem like
they self maintain?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Thanks curse, I guess?)
####### If subtle makeup  (diplomatic)

A few blinks of the eye made my eyelashes flap like
wings.

My eyelashes, eyelids, and lips had a slight
distinctness to them. Small coloration made me feel
like I had subtle makeup on.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Is it real though? Better yet does it change with the
curse?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Or better yet, change with my clothes? Though maybe a
better question for after the mission)
####### If no body hair

I could relax some when I rubbed my hand across my
skin, at least. The lack of hair gave a smooth texture.

But, seconds later, I came back to thinking more about
it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No body hair is... I guess nice, in a sense, but...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I can't say I cared for it enough to get mad about it
being gone.)

Whenever I felt my hair, as a de-stressor or via
investigation, I noticed it had a very fine and silky
texture to it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(So smooth... I sort of want to just... feel it for a
while.)

I turned my attention to my skin. Some of the small
mole or blemishes I was expecting to see weren't there
anymore.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:

my skin were disappeared...?)

It was not the silhouette of a hero from legend, or
even a heroic crusader of the modern day.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I brought this on myself.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I resisted and thought I could overcome magic that can

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Fine. I'm a girl.)

But I could only separate my mind from thinking on my

I breathed in and out, and I was forced to consider it
more deeply than I had before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's not even worth thinking about.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(If its gonna turn me into a woman, then it'll finish
the job soon enough.)

(Just a matter of... when, I guess?)
I was a woman.
What that really meant to me, I didn't know.

But the curse had done it's job, not matter when it
really thought its endgame would be.
I accepted that.

But, no matter how I tried, it all came back to
something that had changed on a more mental level.

I couldn't see myself as anything but a woman in the
mirror.

And I was still trying to process what that meant for
me... what it meant about me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(The curse got its way. I am the opposite of what I
aspire to.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (My "weakness"... That's how the curse goes, right?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It made me into the opposite of all the things I
idolized.)

(All the stories of strong warriors in legends. Those
stories my mom told us as kids...)

(To live up to my father. All of that is...)

...
I wasn't ready to think the next works.
####### if post ch. 14-15 Class change

With those reviewed, I took a deep breath and looked
over my new form once more.

I was a women, and I was going to be the best woman I
could be.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I'm not entirely sure if I can ever not think of it
as... "weakness"...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Or... however the curse wants to see it.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It just isn't what I think of when I think of
strength. Those peerless heroes of legend and myth...)

(Just because they're heroes doesn't mean...)
I shook my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It doesn't mean I need to be them. Not to do whatever
I need in order to do right by those I care for.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Or live a good life...)

(Find something worth fighting for in... "weakness"...
haha...)

The tension I let build up dissipated. I could just
laugh at how silly I sounded.
I was a self-contradictory mess.
And maybe...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's okay.)
I let that moment settle on my mind for a time.

I stepped back and went to get dressed.

STAGE DIRECTION> FLASH ON SCREEN
STAGE DIRECTION> HEAL NORA FULLY

STAGE DIRECTION> GIVE TOOLTIP THAT "NORA HAD A SECOND
WIND"
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE IMMORTALITY FLAG
#### Nora x Charlotte #####

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I won't give up on Lockhart.
#### Nora x Mariel ######

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Save your words.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I wasn't going to say anything.

I know you've closed off your heart.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I am not...

No. I'm not here to convince you.
#### Nora x Jude ######

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Give up trying to call me a traitor.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You're just another enemy.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
I suppose so.

This is for the best.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: N- *Pant*... No...

Nora's armor rattled against itself as she fell to a
knee.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... Did we... get her...?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It's... over...
My stance was faltering, but we had won.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Are you finally... going... to listen...?!

Charlotte aggressively stepped past me and toward 
Nora.
Charlotte slowly raised her gun.
And it was directed straight at Nora's head.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Can you please... just... listen...?

Nora looked back and forth, only to see her allies
being apprehended by the rest of us.
It was complete defeat.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
I don't...

I don't... accept the word of traitors...

Nora had fallen down entirely as exhaustion had 
fully taken her.

She stared to the sky through the hole we created
above.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That armor feeling a bit heavy now?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: After all that... it may be hard to even move...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I didn't know anything about these tunnels.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: Trying to rewrite history as a victor already?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Argh...!
Nora's eyes shifted to the skies above.
The sky was painted in the hues of a sunset.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
...I'm sorry, everyone.

I'm sorry, Malcus.

I'm sorry, Kiolna.

Sis didn't manage it.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: I entrust you all... with our future...
And she closed her eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you asking for us to end it?

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
Do what you must to a non-homlyn that's worn out 
their use.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I do not want to kill you!

Charlotte stepped forward and kicked Nora's leg 
out of frustration.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Sis... maybe not... the best time...
And the words stuttered out of Mariel.

Both seemed their most frustrated self despite the
victory.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Careful...

Charlotte seemed her most frustrated self despite the
victory.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
...

Spare me the tantrum.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm not...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Exhale*...
Charlotte let herself calm down.
The seconds ticked by.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I want to... I want to save the same people you 
want to save.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
You want to return to your posh life.

To continue trampling over us.

Even if some homlyns get caught up with the non-
homlyns.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I want... to make Lockhart safe.

To remove its enemies so we can all pursue the 
city's future... together.

For everyone.

And...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...if one of those enemies is me... so be it.
Nora's eyebrows furrowed.
The dismissive look on her face only deepened.
The battle was over.
We had won.
But to Charlotte...
...she was on the edge of defeat.
She took a deep breath.
And with a pause...
She turned back to us.
With a gentle smile on her face.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Sis... are you...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I think I have to. If it is what I must do...
then I will.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...

Charlotte, you don't have to prove anything to 
anyone.

You don't need to...

You can... You could...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's okay, sis. I should've done this a long time ago.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm sorry for the trouble this is going to cause.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What... do you mean?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It's something I should've done a long time ago.

So...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm sorry.
Charlotte turned back to Nora.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Here.
She extended her hand.
Nora made no move.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Very well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Could you help her up?

lines.speaker: Imperial
lines.text: Huh? But...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You are her allies.

lines.speaker: Mercenary
lines.text: A- Alright...

The two were watched closely as they walked over 
from the Crow that was guarding them.
They helped Nora rise to her feet.

She didn't resist, but she made no effort to help. 
So her allies continued to hold her up.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: S- Sure?

A couple of the Crows we were with lifted 
Nora to her feet.

She didn't resist, but she made no effort to help. 
So the Crows continued to hold her up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you, you two.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
So you want to make a show of it.

Just finish it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I will.

I will save Lockhart.

And I will finish what I must on that path.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Inhale*...

She took a long, deep breath.

Charlotte's shaking hand settled with it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I will save Lockhart.

I will save ALL of Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That includes you.

That includes all of Lockhart. Each and every person 
is what makes Lockhart what it is.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That includes you.

You are part of what makes Lockhart what it is.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: ...what?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oh, sis...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... what was below her hat this whole time?
Charlotte's truth was on full display.

Her ears stayed stable atop her head, 
determination radiating from her aura.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: You're... nekolyn?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It... is a recessive trait in my family.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
They'd never let you be in charge of Lockhart.

Never.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Exactly.

I was supposed to take this truth to the grave.

My parents loved me too much to take away my 
birthright over it.

No matter what happened. No matter how many 
times I failed...

Even when I had a genius little sister who did
everything I could do better...

They never stopped trusting in my ability to care 
for my home.

Trusting me to love Lockhart just as they did.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: They... could've just not wanted the bad publicity...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Then do it.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text: What...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Publish this reality in every newspaper from Zdara to
Aurelia.

Burn the Stewart legacy to the ground, and make 
sure I could never recover the status quo you so 
loathed.
If this is the path I must take to save Lockhart, 
then so be it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
So long as Lockhart is safe and thrives, I'd like to
think my parents would be proud of us.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And even if not...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Then I found something more important than their 
pride.

Mariel stepped up and gently wrapped her arms 
around Charlotte in a hug.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis...?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'm proud of you.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you. I'm proud of you, too.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: After all this time, you always...
And Charlotte hugged her back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess I don't really get it.

Homlyns, nekolyns... all that feels strange to get so
worked up over.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That speech did make me want to fight a bit 
harder for Lockhart.

I stepped forward with a smile to greet 
Charlotte with.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you.

And behind me was a clamoring of fellow voices 
from the group.

Many of those Crows, who were removed from the 
dynamics of a flashpoint city such as Lockhart...

We stood shoulder to shoulder.

We trusted each other with our lives.

We trusted each other with our futures.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: All of you...
Charlotte froze a bit.

And we could see her ears twitch like a nervous 
tick.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Right... this is...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... That feels... less...

Charlotte adjusted the hat, and I noticed how she
tensed up her ears to help it stay on.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Quiet, you.
Charlotte turned back to Nora.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I just... want to talk.

For Lockhart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And for everyone who calls it home.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
...

I...

...

Okay.

We can... talk.

lines.speaker: Nora
lines.text:
...

I...

...

Was it... 

...all for nothing?
Kingdom of Cartenan - Royal Palace

lines.speaker: Advisor
lines.text: Your Majesty... We've another report of...

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
...

Of... what?

lines.speaker: Advisor
lines.text:
Of... another refugee group of citizens has arrived
from the north.

Her hand reached for a loose sword near 
the throne.

But before she could consider throwing it, the door
rumbled open.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Your Majesty!

A soldier ran into the throne room, and he was 
holding a scroll.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
What do you interrupt me with?

This had better be good.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
I- It's a message.

Delivered directly from a man of the faith.

A message from the Covenant.
Republic of Rabaneau - Seat of the Director

lines.speaker: Rep. Soldier
lines.text:
"This message is sent in good faith, as the 
oathbearers of the Goddess may attest."

"In the name of the Goddess, we call for peace in 
these lands. We are prepared to push for this 
reality."
"In one week from the appointed delivery of this
message, the Oadthine cathedral shall be 
designated location."
"We formally invite all parties of this conflict to a
seat at the negotiating table."

"Under the guiding light of the Goddess, we shall 
make peace and prosperity for all her people."
The Republic soldier closed the scroll.

lines.speaker: Geoffrey
lines.text: What do you make of it?

lines.speaker: Leopold
lines.text:
It is as she predicted.

They have been busy. The both of them.

lines.speaker: Geoffrey
lines.text:
Then, my Prime Director... how shall we act on it?

Will the Republic send a representative?

lines.speaker: Leopold
lines.text:
Hmm...

I shall attend myself.

lines.speaker: Geoffrey
lines.text: Are you sure?

lines.speaker: Leopold
lines.text:
Yes. This is my duty.

I imagine she will attend as well.

It would be unbecoming of our nation's grand 
project if we were to not.

lines.speaker: Geoffrey
lines.text:
I understand, sir.

I can imagine how it may undermine the effort if 
they were treated as unworthy of the savior of 
Rabaneau.
Unworthy of the legendary Kaeden Leopold... 
The Prime Director of the Republic.
Nolvanus Empire - Imperial Palace

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
AARGHHHH!!!!!

A... PEACE summit?!

What cretin crawled behind my back to stab me so!

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
To think... calling on the Covenant... it is treachery,
I tell you.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text: I bet it was that bastard child who did it.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: My emperor and empress.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
Setback to our efforts it may seem... this may be 
an opportunity.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: Indeed.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
If ever there was a time to bargain, it'd be when 
the Goddess puts her neck on the line for the sake 
of peace.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Please do not speak on this...

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
But... yes. We could demand the return of the
farmlands.

Reparations for rebuilding our agriculture
infrastructure.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text: And you don't even need to let go of Lockhart.

Emperor Alexei breathed raggedly, slowly turning 
to the two advisors.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
And even if they insist on Lockhart being 
independent again...

Well, just make sure I stay in charge and you won't
lose your influence.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
I rather burn it down before surrendering our right 
to it.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
No.

I shall attend this summit.
He turned to Ruslan.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text:
The Empire is eternal. Our sun will never set.

And those who undermine our light will see their 
head on a pike.

lines.speaker: Alexei IV
lines.text: That is an order to see through, general.

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text: Yes, my emperor.
And the emperor stormed past Ruslan and Simon.

lines.speaker: Inessa
lines.text:
I shall retire to my quarters. I am bereft of energy.

Such... draining times.

And she quickly stepped out of the throne room 
as well.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Hmm...

Your answer... Does that mean you have an idea of 
who arranged this peace talk?

lines.speaker: Ruslan
lines.text:
...

Do not speak to me.
And so the last of the Imperials exited.

lines.speaker: Simon
lines.text:
Heh. No matter.

I still have my trump card.
Republic/Imperial Border - Republic Base

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text: T- That's... How did a chasm get that big!?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
We assume it is a result of the landmines making 
the ground unstable.

Lockhart has been digging underground tunnels for
trains to travel through.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A... tactic. To levy surprise attacks across the
warring countries.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text: That's... nuts. How do they think of that stuff?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Most importantly... What do you figure may happen 
when the tunnel goes beneath the minefield?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text:
That... big chasm over there?

Should we send people in?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Once they realize we know, they will detonate
explosives to seal the tunnel.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text: Right... Yeah, that makes sense.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Thank you for receiving us on such short notice 
despite that.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text:
Y- Yeah... princess of the trade city and all. 
Seemed like a no brainer.

.........

Actually, do you know?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Know what?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text:
We just received word this morning. There's going 
to be a peace summit.

I can't imagine the princess of Lockhart wouldn't be
invited.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
.......

And where is it being held?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text:
Oadthine. The Holy City of the West.

We got word that we needed to create a safe 
route to Oadthine for the Prime Director.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The leader of the Republic is attending?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.text:
Yeah. It must be serious if the legendary Kaeden
Leopold is taking action.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes. It is a well informed conclusion to come to.

.........

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then... we shall meet the Prime Director there.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: To find peace... in Oadthine.
Nora has joined the party!
West Auran Alliance
Oadthine, the Holy City of the West
The Seat of the Goddess

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Such... tiring work, this.
Cainan sat in the halls of the grand cathedral.

He stared out the window as he watched the sun 
set in the distance.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: To move the hearts and wills of giants themselves...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: We shall all sit down together for the sake of peace.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It is but a dream to those embroiled in this hundred
year war.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Moved to reality by these very hands.

One would call it a miracle.

Others the will of the Goddess.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
But those who saw it done will say it be what it 
truly is.
He turned his head to within the halls.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Now, my fellow traveler on this path.

What would you call it?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: No need to be shy.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: What would you call it?

lines.speaker: Wolf
lines.text: Inevitable.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: And that is the correct answer.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: This reminds me of when I tutored you in your youth.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Such nostalgic days, those were.

Cainan got to his feet without an ounce of fear in 
his movement.

After a few more steps, he laid his hand down on 
the Steel Wolf's shoulder, giving it a firm pat.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: I trust you shall fulfill your role in this... agreement?

lines.speaker: Wolf
lines.text: I shall.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: We shall expect the Empire to attend? Emperor and all?

lines.speaker: Wolf
lines.text: They will.

Wolf's hand settled on the Oathbreaker sword 
sheathed at his hip.

lines.speaker: Wolf
lines.text: They are a slave to their weakness.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Splendid.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It has been nothing but a pleasure, as usual.

Cainan casually and gracefully returned to the 
window seat he called home but a minute before.
...and the Steel Wolf turned as well.
Exiting the scene.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
.........

Hahaha...

What a glorious path we tread upon.

To lead us to here.

Where we are but steps from the ascent...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: ...to the finale.

The sizzle of grilled sausages wafted through the 
air as a bundle was plopped down onto my plate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Those smell great. It's been a while, too)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You're lucky. Those were the last batch.
I looked down at the three pieces of meat I held.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aren't they a little... burnt?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you for the food!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This looks like a good place.

I dropped myself to sit against a solemn tree. It 
was peaceful away from the camp.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Did I hear something?)

A blink of the eyes and a turn of the head later, 
a new sight stood before me.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Pant*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey boy, what are-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- HEY!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Munch*

A sausage was gulped down in one bite. 
He licked his lips and I jumped to my feet 
with two sausages still in hand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Jakson! Bad!
Jakson turned to me, hungrily...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What are you looking at?!

YOU just stole from me! I'm not giving you another 
bite!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whine*
Jakson turned his head, pleading innocence.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not one nibble!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Have I lost him? Does he think he's a hunter or 
something now?)

I hesitantly took a seat, readying myself to eat 
my meal.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (The tall grass?! I'll be ready this time!)

The plate swiftly launched upwards as my arms 
extended it beyond the reach of the tall grass. I 
stared vigilantly for Jakson to make his move.
A bird flew out of the tall grass.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... It was just a bird... It was just a...

As my body relaxed, I had turned my head back 
towards the plate at the end of my outstretched 
arms.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Munch munch*
And then there was one.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Jakson! This is my meal!

I jumped to my feet and Jakson didn't move at 
first.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do not... follow me... Stay!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good boy.

With a single sausage left in hand, I sprinted as far 
as my legs could carry me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Pant*...*pant*...

(Did I finally lose the 'mighty hunter'...?)

I looked at the ever cooling sausage still on 
my plate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Cold or no, it's still mine!)

Through my ragged breaths, I caught a sight in my 
peripheral along the horizon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just try to take it from me!

I shoved the full sausage down my throat until 
half lay hanging out of my mouth.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hfff! Nwff Whfft?!
(Ha! Now what?!)

...the sausage jiggling as I blurted out my 
muffled declaration.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

The dog burst into a full sprint like he was on 
the battlefield.

The next thing I knew, a heavy dog was on top of 
me and the sausage was ejected upwards.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh!

It hung in the air for what seemed like 
forever before dropping into the gullet 
of one Jakson.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Munch*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... I will get you for this...

I shifted myself up to sit next to him. Within a few 
seconds, I instinctively started petting him on the 
head.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy panting*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... what did you think?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A little burnt, right?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right? I knew you'd agree with me, at least.

title: SP: Satia x Ivan C - New Event

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...and they need to meet within the hour.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Understood. I'll head out soon.

The two bid their farewells, and Ivan turned 
to enter a nearby tent.

The hum of a boiling pot matched the steam 
circulating around the tent.
Ivan's hand reached for the lid of the boiling pot.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Guess who?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Aren't you a bit old to be
doing this?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
If you get it wrong, then you owe me a gold 
piece~

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Satia. I am not playing this game.

With hands removed from Ivan's eyes, Satia moved 
between him and the boiling meal.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh? I thought you liked to gamble.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: News to me.
Satia opened the lid herself and steam burst out.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: And how long do you figure this has been cooking?

Satia used some tongs to pull out the fish meat 
held within.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
What if you got sick? What if you went down and 
left the Crows without their commander?

A knife entered Satia's grip as she expertly diced 
the meat.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Better yet, what if you left your little Pup all alone?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: I imagine he'd be in good hands.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Regardless...

With a twirl, Satia's hand sprinkled a variety of 
spices across the meal.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Some days I wonder what Harold was thinking 
leaving the Nightless Crows under your command...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Are we done, then?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Obviously not.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: What's left then? What do you want?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
A complete and utter reformation doesn't seem like 
too much to ask for?

Satia pulled a piece of packing paper and string 
from a nearby supply box.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
When you get to my age, it can become 
more dangerous than not to start doubting your 
instincts.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Yes, yes... "Old dogs can't learn new tricks". 
You've said as much before.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Then may I have my meal?

Satia's hands weaved back and forth as the string 
became taught around the now packaged fish.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Sigh*... Very well.
One packaged fish meal dropped into Ivan's hands.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Thank you very much. Have a good evening.

Ivan promptly pivoted on his foot towards the 
tent's entryway. A flap of the door later and 
Satia was by herself.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Some days with him...

Satia took a few breaths to calm herself. 

With a flick of her wrist, a small pouch flipped from 
within her sleeve to her hand.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*... The wonders of-

Satia's arm with the pouch fully extended and she 
pinched her nose closed.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Ugh... That is... much more rancid than I 
remember. I need to prepare a new one.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oh well. He probably won't even notice it until the 
slice hits his bowels.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Maybe even an old dog would be motivated to 
learn some new tricks after that.

title: SP: Jakson x Ivan C - New Event

lines.text:
A shadow slipped through the night, sliding across 
the soft glow of light from within the camp's tents.

A dog sat in front of one of the tents. It's head 
dropped down as it relaxed it's body.

The glow of the tent faded to black, and the 
shadow disappeared into the darkness.

The dog's head bolted up at the sound.

The click of metal accompanied moonlight 
shimmering off a steel blade.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Growl*...

As the blade unsheathed, the dog met it with a 
quiet yet audible growl.

The sword stayed locked into placed, and only after 
several tense seconds did it return to its sheathe.

The dog stared intently at the shadow as it stared 
back.

With a step backwards, the shadow moved into 
the moonlight.

Another step back left Ivan having once more 
retreated into the dark.

Jakson stayed at attention for several minutes 
longer before finally relaxing.

The crowd moaned and swayed as the notable 
number obscured several presences.

Ivan moved deliberately to ensure he moved 
inconspicuously through the crowd.

His eyes had focused on one person in particular.

They were by a stall, haggling with a merchant.

With a click, a sword began to slide from 
it's sheathe.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Growl*

Jakson had placed himself between Ivan and his 
target.

Ivan raised his head to see a handful of the busy 
crowd turn and stare in their direction.

With a click once more, the weapon was put away 
and Ivan disappeared into the mass of people.
Jakson still stared into the crowd.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Everything okay, boy?
A familiar scene.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Growl*

The glow of the tent had faded into the shadows, 
leaving only the moonlit shine of the blade.

A step forward.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Growl*!

The growling intensified.

So too did the shine of the blade grow wider 
as the full length came into view.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*...
A soft bark. It was a warning.
Another step.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Growl*!

Jakson launched himself forward towards the 
commander of the Nightless Crows.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Urk...!

Ivan raised his arm to intercept, but it created a 
well sized target for teeth to bear down on.

The scene played at a standstill, and a few drops of 
crimson splashed on the dirt below.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: You broke the skin?

Ivan dropped the weapon, and Jakson's grip on 
his arm went away.

Shuffling back to the nearby fence, Ivan lowered 
himself down to sit against it.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: You did well, but...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: You do realize he'll never learn this way, right?
Ivan eyed the nearby tent.

Jakson just sat by the commander, happily 
wagging his tail with the dissipating tension.

Ivan's free hand lowered to the top of the 
dog's head.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Maybe... he doesn't need to be ready 
for that.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
So long as you're here to keep protecting him, at 
least.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy panting*

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I hope you continue to look after him no matter 
what happens.

Thank you for all these years. And for the years to 
come.

title: SP: Rowan x Ivan C - If in CH2

lines.text: Earlier in the Rabaneau Tavern...

title: SP: Rowan x Ivan C - New Event

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: And?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: The Kingdom of Cartenan.

Ivan tapped the quill in his hand on the table. It's 
beat was quiet, but audible within the sleepy 
tavern.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Where in Cartenan are you from?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Cambre. On the outskirts.
The taps of the quill calmed.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: And you've lived there all your life?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Home is where the heart is.
Quill taps.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I've left the country at times in my life, if that is 
what you pursue.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Alright.

What brings you to Rabaneau?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Have I not spoken of it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: To quell the pains of war with a song of healing.

The tapping stopped, but a sigh echoed in 
the sleepy tavern.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: And how has that gone?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... Some wounds are best left closed, no?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Where did you train in this so called singing?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So the dagger slices ever deeper...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: And an answer?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm... Where did I learn to sing?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Along the winds of the spring skies, I suppose?

The scribbling of words by the pen 
stopped abruptly.

No tapping resumed, but the quill - feather and all - 
softly dropped to the table's surface.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: What's your favorite color?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Color?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Raspberry.
A silence grated on Ivan.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Favorite food?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Orange.

The silence was broken by the wood of a chair 
scuffing across the ground.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mr. Savior-Crow-Man?

Ivan lowered himself haphazardly to the chair once 
more. This time, he had a wooden mug in hand.
Ivan took a sip from the mug.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Well if we insist on that endeavor, then...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: May I perhaps have a

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Age?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Old enough to love life.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
So not old enough to know your ass from your 
nose.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
You've met my son. Even I know how foolhardy 
that age can be.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, yes. The industrious "Anton", was it? Or 
perhaps "Pup"?

An interesting child that one is.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Hmm...

With dramatic swing, Ivan gulped down the 
remains of the mug. It echoed as it was 
slammed down on the table.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Let's start from the beginning.

Name?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, tedium.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

Rowan. Rowan MacKinnon

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Homeland?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Once more, the Kingdom of Cartenan.
The little village of Cambre.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Perhaps I should ask the same. Where
are you from?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Reason for being in Rabaneau?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Where did this "Anton" and you find your way 
from?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: "Baranov". It is not of Rabaneau, is it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A tad more... Nolvanian.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Perhaps even more than that. 
Perhaps even a hint of-

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...Pardon?

Ivan raised the mug once more, aiming at the little 
left within.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...Crekskia...

The Vault? The Vault at...

Rowan stared at Ivan's eyes and looked for a sign 
to doubt.

But it never came, and Rowan slumped back into 
his chair.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do know I answered your questions without a lie.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: But did you answer honestly?

What silence there was rattled away with the 
tumbling of the empty mug from Ivan's hands.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Perhaps you are one that can understand?

That some wounds are best left closed...

That some pieces of a past... are best left 
forgotten.

title: SP: Jakson x Norde C - New Event

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good. I'm back in time for supper rations.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I wonder who is on cooking duty today?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*...

Norde slumped into a seat around the warm 
campfire.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm...? What was...
Norde turned to not see anything behind him.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

My imagination, maybe?

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Norde, not gonna have any? The duck is great 
today.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Duck? We didn't purchase any duck meat lately.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Uh... Don't know what to tell ya.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Who is on cooking duty today?

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: I dunno. Maybe- Oh, hey boy.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Panting*

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Jakson... do you need something?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: I think he wants your order?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Don't worry about it. Just get him some of the 
duck.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy Bark*!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why is the dog taking food orders?
The other man just shrugged his shoulders.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then I must inter-

Norde's effort to raise to his feet was cutoff by him 
hearing something from the nearby cooking tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: DUCK!?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Why... Why is everyone ordering... duck?

We don't have any duck!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde? Then...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Does that mean we should have duck? Did I forget 
it when I was at the market?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh... What do we have left that might taste like 
duck? Even a little?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

After a few short minutes, the flap of the tent  
burst open with a brown fuzzball now in sight.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark muffled by carrying food*...
A small bowl was dropped into Norde's hands.

It was mostly empty. Distinct bite marks were left 
on multiple pieces of meat.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Licks lips*

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Jakson...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I... would recommend showing this to your owner.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

Grabbing the bowl, Jakson headed back to the 
tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What? They already want seconds?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What's left to...
Norde was soon on his feet.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Not hungry?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
An itch at the back of my mind has stolen my 
appetite.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Eh. Your loss.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha! This... Now this could work!

Norde made his way over to the bulletins for the 
corp.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
After all the effort I put into putting together a 
rotation for these....

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Who is on duty and left that idiot to use a dog as a 
waiter?
His eyes scanned the sheet for the current day.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Hans... Illec... and...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark muffled by carrying food*...

To the side of Norde's leg was Jakson. He was 
carrying a new bowl.

The bowl held a bread roll with lettuce and pickles 
adorning it.

It looked a little like a duck.
Norde's eyes returned to the sheet.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ..."Jakson"...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
*Happy bark*!

*Whine*...?!

The shattered dinnerware bounced across the 
ground, and the bread fell into the dirt as well.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Stomach growling*...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
This... must be my punishment for botching the 
duty rotation...

title: SP: Pup x Ivan C - New Event

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: ...and that makes three bushels of apples.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There... we... go...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We finishing early this time?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Yes. Now to weapon maintenance.

Ivan continued to note down marks on his 
paperwork. He looked up after a few seconds 
of me hesitating.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Pup?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Weapon maintenance. Got it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe I can make it in half the
time this time?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grh!

With a thud, I dropped a greatsword next to me. 
Ivan leaned down to inspect it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Next one. Quicker this time.)

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Hmm... There's a small chip in...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And... there!
This time an axe lay at my father's feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Last one... to be accounted for...
fully sharpened.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Argh... How'd we do? We make good time this 
time around?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Good enough. Thank you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And... uh... How about me? I make good time 
myself?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
You did well. Make sure you get rested. 
Tomorrow's a long day, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right... Will do...
I watched as my father dipped into a nearby tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(He does have the entire group to worry about, 
after all.)

(...an entire group... to protect...)

An image of a silhouette covered in an onslaught of 
light popped into my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Like usual, I just need to be strong like a proper 
man that can hold his head high.)

(To be strong like him. That's my step one. To be 
strong like a mercenary leader)
I clenched my hand into a fist.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Step one... to no longer being weak.)

The air rushed out of my lungs along with the 
tension in my body.

I rubbed my biceps. They were quite sore from 
rushing around all day.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And that starts with a proper rest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I'll take the initiative in tomorrow's mission too.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I need every chance I can get to train and 
challenge myself.)
Ivan was scribbling down notes on parchment.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Are the plans for tomorrow's mission prepared?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Not... quite...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I thought you were just needing to finalize them 
earlier this-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Ah. That's it.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: I believe if we deploy this group this way, then-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then Anton will be in less danger of a surprise 
attack.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
How many nights have you done this
dance this week?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why not just take the princess off the frontlines?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: The others wouldn't accept it.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Nor would he.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
And we've passed a point of no return on those, 
then?

It was inevitable, I suppose.
Ivan scratched out what he had just written down.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Here. I'll help. It'll go quicker that way, at least.

title: SP: Pup x Satia C - New Event

lines.text:
The blade in my hand sliced through the air as I 
paced my way through a training routine.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...!

There!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Another ten on those and-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ow!
A stinging pain broke me out of the pattern.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What was that for?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmm... Nope. Not good. Not good at all.

Satia was holding up the hair she had plucked from 
my head towards the sun above.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This is... new.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Expect the unexpected?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
But truly... Such a shame. It's like you try to bring 
misfortune upon yourself at times.
She went back to looking at the strand of hair.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You don't say...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Does she just want to rile me up?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Or... Is this what I think it is?)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
A shame, a shame. It seems we'll
have to do a thorough-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Expect the unexpected!
A sword, handle first, was lobbed towards Satia.

She caught it in her bewilderment, but I had 
already made a sprint for an exit.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup! Get back here!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... did I... lose her?
I turned.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Crap!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This time. There's no way she-
I turned a corner.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Every time!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (She's still hot on my tail... What now?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Oh, that's an idea.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(If I can just swim across the river, she might not 
even want to follow!)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What are you doing?!

The water splashed around me as I dived into
the nearby river.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Perfect, now I just need to...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, what the...? What's that?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Dammit, not now!)

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Hey, Satia.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Good afternoon.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Big catch today?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It was a feisty one, for sure.

Satia made her way through the camp dragging 
along a large net.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: And...!
Satia dumped out the contents of the fishing net.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Shall we get started?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I just wanted to do my daily training. Is that so 
unreasonable?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You should've thought of that before you made it 
even worse.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Your hair smells like raw fish.
I took a sniff of some of my hair.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Yeah, that's bad.)

title: SP: Pup x Satia C - Pup TG3

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
With... well, everything's that has happened, it's 
even more important for you to properly take care 
of it.
At worst, you'll draw more illadvised attention to us 
if you don't.

title: SP: Pup x Satia C - Pup less than3

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You don't exactly have a bald head. Hair care has 
it's importance.

How long ago was it that you decided to let your 
hair grow out some? Before all this started.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I said then that you'd need to actually take care of 
it, yes?

title: SP: Pup x Satia C - Continue

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess. It's not like my hair stunk when you came 
to me earlier, though.
I shifted myself to a sitting position.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Hair maintenance is more than just how it smells. 
It's a duty to yourself.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
If there's anything you should try to not take after 
your father with, it's these sorts of habits.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
And if you let me teach you properly, then you 
wouldn't need me to hassle you over it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I didn't want to do it because I wanted to finish 
my training. This is going to take hours.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Well it's going to take hours with a lesson or 
not...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... guess. Fine.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Perfect!
Satia rustled through a nearby box.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I actually stumbled upon this mixture lately. They 
say it will make your hair smell like a flower.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... don't say?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A better smell than fish, I suppose.

title: SP: Ivan x Norde C - New Event

lines.text:
A glow arose from a bracelet on Mariel's arm. 
Through it, she was channeling divine healing.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Ms. Stewart? How goes it? Have they stabilized?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Stable, yes. Your boss is still in a precarious
state, however. I've healed their wounds
with my blessings the best I can.
In the most optimistic case, they'll likely need 
plenty more rest and recovery, though.

Mariel looked over at Pup, who was on the bed she 
was not attending to.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Nightmares and all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is that so?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You have my thanks. We were lucky to have a Blue 
magic user to assist us.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It's nothing. Especially after you helped my sister 
and me as you did.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
It... wouldn't do to understate it, Norde. 
We... really are thankful.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
A- Ah. You really shouldn't be up. You need to go 
back to sleep.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: In a short while, yes.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You're going to hurt yourself. This time I may
not even be able to keep you alive.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I imagine Norde came with the hopes that I would 
be stirring, though.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: There is... truth in that.

As Mariel looked between the two faces,
it seemed as though the decision was 
already made.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Let me know immediately if anything even
starts hurting a little.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I certainly will. It is appreciated. 

We should be done shortly.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Fairing well?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I am the same as ever.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: You have a bandage sticking out of your sleeve.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Wounds are to be expected in battle.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I'm happy to see you can be so lively. It's a good 
sign.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Are you truly in a position to be so worried about 
others?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Ah... This? I'm not worth the worry.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Sir...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Enough of that. You came to ask a question, I 
assume?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Very well.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That man. That "Steel Wolf". Do you know him?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Hard to say.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: ...He mentioned Crekskia, though.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Sir. I know it may be hard to talk about... But if 
ever there was a time to open up about that 
event, then this is it.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
No. That is my sin to bear.

Whatever may come of it, I will shoulder it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...How long as it been? Nearly 25 years?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
From when you saved me? From when you gave 
me my name?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
That still? Like I said, I said you should "head 
north", haha...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ever since then, I've spent every day aiming 
towards being like your example.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You are... my guiding star.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Sir, if I've taken even one correct step along that 
path, I'd like to use that strength to assist.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Haha... I am a poor star to guide you to what you 
want to be.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: With all due respect, that is not for you to decide.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: True. Very true.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Then I ask you to not risk your goals for the 
mistakes of this... tired old man.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
If you wish to use that strength for something... 
then... keep my son safe, like we've discussed 
before.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Of course. I didn't plan to abandon that promise.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Some things are worth more...

...are worth... worth more than...

...more than...

...
Ivan had fallen asleep from the exhaustion.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Sir. I don't plan to give up on you so easily.
I blinked.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dammit...

I blinked rapidly. My eyes stung from the staring 
contest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Fine. Take the bedding. It's not like I haven't slept 
on the ground before.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Hello, you two.

We just had a messenger deliver the receipt for a
successful bedding purchase.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Perfect timing, Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It isn't as though I had any control over it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Though... of what I can control, I am surprised by 
the need for another set.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I could have sworn that the recent supply refresh 
purchased enough to suit our current numbers...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah... well...

I looked over at Jakson while trying to not let 
Norde notice.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(He never counts Jakson in those, since he's a 
dog.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Mistakes like that are bound to happen sometime... 
yeah?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Regardless, the bedding needs to be picked up 
from the nearby town.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's not here?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yes. Like I said, we heard from a messenger.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It's in your hands now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Tsk.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Why not send it instead of a messenger?)

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Looks like we've got a mission to complete before 
the day's out.

After trekking to the nearby town, we had 
procured the admittedly mediocre sleeping cot.

Tying it up like a backpack, we headed out to 
return to camp.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There we go. Let's head back, boy.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy pant*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(While we're here, maybe we should pick up some 
other supplies.)

(Aren't we running low on... on...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What was it again? It was-)

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grk!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(A... horse? With some riding it?)

Yeah! You run away! You- You..!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh* ...Damn that asshole. He sort of looked 
drunk, even.

I turned, only to see the cot snapped in two and 
off to my side.
My body slumped down fully onto the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll just sleep here.

I had no energy while my body ragdolled in
exasperation.

Jakson approached me and started to lick my hand.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The ground is the ground wherever you go. Why 
not just embrace it for once in my-
A heavy, furry weight plopped down on top of me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Jakson... please... get off?!

Sort of... hard to breath...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Panting*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
F- Fine! I'll head back! Is that what you want to 
hear?!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I wasn't really going to sleep here, you know?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*...?

The cold of the night could be felt on my skin. It 
felt like getting to sleep would be a true challenge 
for me this time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ugh...

(What timing for a particularly cold night...)

I couldn't do much else outside of shiver and pull 
the blanket up more.
Or so I thought. The blanket pulled itself back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No, that doesn't make any... sense...)

A certain brown fuzzball was sliding himself into the 
blanket with me.

Jakson slid all the way to the top. He didn't do 
much else as he laid down into a sleeping position.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... warm...)

The blanket didn't fit properly now, but I found 
comfort in cuddling up with the teddy bear in front 
of me.
The living, breathing, slobbering teddy bear.

The night wore on and sleep started to take me.

Sleepy thoughts faded as my consciousness left 
me.

The sounds of existence blending into eternity.

And the darkness of it became absolute.

So every tick of a second carried on and on...

...Until a final twinge of the mind burst from the 
rapidly disappearing crack of the mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Why don't we just both move to the bed?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Urgh...
 Dammit.

title: SP: Pup x Cainan C - Begining

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm... Not a bad price...

lines.speaker: ShopKeep
lines.text: Are you gonna buy something or not?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe. I'm undecided.

lines.speaker: ShopKeep
lines.text: Kid, it's been over an hour.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Well...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then the answer is no if you're going to be like 
that. I'm not going to buy shit from here.

I stormed off feeling like steam was rising from 
my ears.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who does that guy think he is?
My aimless march brought me in front of a café.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Something soothing actually sounds really nice 
right now)

With a paid for tea in hand, I found a corner of the 
shop to park myself in.

It wasn't long before I looked up to see a familiar 
face in front of me.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Ah, one of those... mercenaries. The Dayless 
Doves, was it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Nightless Crows...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Ha! Much cooler.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I didn't name the thing.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Would you mind some company? I just ordered a 
cup myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do what you want.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: My thanks.

Cainan grabbed one of the chairs and sat himself 
down. A café staff member dropped off his own 
cup of tea soon after.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Hm...

So...

You are worried for your father?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No. He'll be fine. He's strong, after all.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Is that so?

Who is your father then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What? Why does that matter?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I may hail from the Covenant, but I can offer no 
salvation for you or him. That is your burden to 
carry.
So I wished to know of him and the traits that 
inspire such confidence. To tell you how founded 
your belief in him is.

I bit my lip a little.

I wanted to hear him tell me it'd be alright, but 
there was the very real chance he wouldn't.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

My father is Ivan Baranov. Leader of the Nightless 
Crows.

He's... stalwart and powerful.

He's protected me all my life.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
He's strong. He's always been the strongest person 
I've known.

My fist tightened enough that I started to lose 
feeling in it.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
...

"Ivan Baranov"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. What about it? I'm Anton Baranov.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It has been a long time since I've heard that name. 
So he became a mercenary?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What? You... knew my father?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It would be odd if I didn't in my line of work.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
With your striking hair color, I should have figured 
you were his child. Quite the resemblance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
In your "line of work"? With the Covenant? My 
father was a mercenary.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Has he never told you of his time before then?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
"Ivan Baranov", the Storm Ram.

He was a hero of the Crusades and given the 
position Guardian within the ranks of the Covenant.

His role was to watch over an Oathbreaker to 
ensure it wasn't used for foul measures.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
And you are right. He was strong. Perhaps the 
strongest of them all.

I looked down to see my cup of tea shaking ever 
so slightly, so I placed it down on the table.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

A- And... How did you know him?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I said before that I am an arbiter of the Covenant, 
yes? That I travel to organize and conduct reviews 
of members like the Guardians?
We met through that role.

My breaths began to become heavy. I tried to calm 
myself.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
He was among the nicest men I had ever known. I 
was honored to call him my friend.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
If your father is truly the Ivan Baranov I know, then 
he will make it to you.

He is as you said. Truly strong.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I, at least, think you can rest easy, son of the 
Storm Ram.

In a frenzy, I jumped to my feet and accidentally 
knocked my cup of tea to the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I... I'm sorry. I need to go.

Dumping some money on the table for the tea and 
the broken cup, I rushed out of the café.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Hahaha...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
...

So that is the person that child grew up to be?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
