Ah, perhaps it isn't so surprising, given the 
connection.

A café employee frantically shifted between 
apologizing the other patrons and trying to clean 
up.
All the while, Cainan sat there and calmly sipped on 
his tea.

title: SP: Pup x Mariel C - Begining

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One, two, three!

One, two... three!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*

Drops of water fell back to the surface and left 
ripples among the otherwise static depths.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One more set...

I readied my sword once more, but my focus was 
broken by the sound of approaching footsteps.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup? Up early for some training?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah, Mariel?

With her here, I shift my sword to a passive 
position.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yep. Training to improve the quickness of my 
strike.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: At the shoreline?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
My father once showed me how he could slice 
through the water.

Here...

Tightening the grip on my sword, I wound up a 
rising slice.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hah!

...but it crashed into the water, kicking up a bunch 
of the liquid to fall back down in a mini shower.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oh~ Explosive!
She clapped a little.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, no. It's not supposed to do that...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If I swing it fast enough, I should be able to slice 
cleanly through the water.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I think it looked cool.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks, I guess
I sheathed my sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What brings you here?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'm delivering a note from Charlotte.

With a few steps forward and an outstretched 
hand, Mariel handed off a small piece of 
parchment to me.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Good luck with your training!
Mariel ran off, clearly in a hurry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: T- Thanks...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (A note from the head princess?)

I unfolded the paper and a couple short sentences 
were unveiled.

lines.speaker: Charlotte's Note
lines.text: Stop buying extra meat. We're not your bank.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Blasphemy.

With a huff to my step, I soon found my way back 
to camp.

It was long enough of a walk for my head to cool 
down some.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe I could convince her that the meat is a 
good idea?)

I had turned a corner and ended up running into 
someone.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: O- Ow...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh crap! I'm so sorry!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
No, it's my bad. I was rushing to find the medical 
supplies.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I was rushing, too.

Here.
I extended my arm and helped her to her feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did someone get hurt?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: B- Besides you...?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: No, it's about inventory.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Oh, that's probably why Charlotte sent that note.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Want me to show you where we keep them?
Maybe something there could make you feel 
better?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I think I'm fine, but I'll gladly take your offer.

These are the supplies we were looking for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hm...

We don't actually keep all of this on hand. We'd 
need to go to town to get everything.

Mariel accepted my offer and started following me 
to the area between camp and a nearby town.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
So... If you don't mind me asking. What were you 
in a rush for?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (She would know what's in the note, right?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I wanted to meet with your sister after I saw the 
note she sent.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You wanted to meet privately with my sister... 
after she sent you a note...?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Charlotte... so brazen...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah, that's one word for it. Could feel my head 
heat up when I read it.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Y- You don't say?

I turned to see Mariel not really paying attention 
to her surroundings.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where did that-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Look out!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Stupid drunk horse riders.

My eyes focused on the scenario. I had pushed 
Mariel out of the way and we both toppled to the 
ground.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: O- Ow... That one might actually sting tomorrow.

I laid on top of her, with our positioning being easily
misunderstood without the context.

My eyes drifted to her outfit, which was rustled to 
a messy state. 

It wasn't compromising, but it was suggestive.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Thank you. *Giggle*... That could have been much 
worse.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sorry, let me just-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What... is going on here?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: N- Nothing's happening!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, there was a horse and-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Get up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...

I jumped to my feet, and Charlotte helped Mariel 
to her own.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
There was a horse that almost hit me. Did you hear 
it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hm... I guess I did hear something when I was 
walking this way.

Fine. I made a bad assumption. My apologies.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don't do anything stupid.

Charlotte stared daggers at me as she turned to 
walk back to camp.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Didn't you want to talk with her in private?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Now... Now's probably not a good time. Not after 
that.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: What? Why not strike while the iron's hot?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I'm sure it'll... *clears throat*.. I'm sure it'll come 
up later.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That's.. That's...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Then I'll just have to do it myself.

Mariel walked up close to my face with a look of 
excitement plastered across her own.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Don't worry about it, then.

I'll do my best to make sure you have an amazing 
romance.

Mariel, in her excitement, started skipping off 
towards the town for the medical supplies.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Romance"? Did she... Did she just...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (...c- confess to me...?!)

I felt my eyesight become unfocused a little along 
with my guard dropping.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(No way... She couldn't be interested in me. She's 
a princess.)

(Maybe it's some slang that nobility use?)

(Slang for... some sort of meat?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It- It's gotta be...

title: SP: Pup x Satia B - Begining

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...23... 24... I think that's all of them?

I put away my notepad as I finished my inventory 
rounds for the day.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hah...

My hands reflexively brought themselves to my 
shoulders.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Must still be sore from my workout earlier?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good thing I'm done for the day, then.
With a pivot on my heel, I made my way for a tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Where did I put that-)

I felt a pressing, cushioned feeling pressed against 
my back.
Guess who~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The cold, slimy hands of death?

...

"Slimy"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: In- In a good way?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ow!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Too far.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sorry...

I rubbed the stinging feeling on the back of my
head as I probed Satia face for whether she
accepted the apology.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did you need something?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: So cold... and slimy.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
What if I simply wished to spend time with my 
favorite Crow?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm sure Norde is around here somewhere.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oh, he can be quite cold. That is true. But he's not 
nearly as slimy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I said I was sorry.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well if the rumors on the sliminess aren't true, 
mayhap you have grip enough to carry a few items?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
They're quite heavy, and I was hoping for some 
help from our premiere soldier of fortune.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Boxes? S- Sure. I can help.
Satia led me to the edge of camp.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Grunt*! There... G- Got it. Where to?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hm... Where best to put it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: O- Of course... no hurry.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: How gallant of you~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What is even in this?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh, that's where it should go. Follow me.

Our path led us to the armory tent. Inside were a 
few stations for changing, and Satia led us into the 
woman's changing area.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: There... we... go...

An audible thud filled the room as the box hit the 
ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why here?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It had some storage space still open.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Actually, while we're here, could you help check 
this armor shipment? It's a different supplier 
than we've used in the past.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah... That's why it's so heavy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure. I was just doing inventory earlier anyways.

Satia gave me some space as I stripped down to 
my smallclothes.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
While we're here, I was also hoping to talk to you 
about something serious.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I've noticed others among the Crows being... 
distracted by you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, this new outfit is a bit... eye-catching

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What, my outfit? It's a bit big on me now, but it's 
not that bad.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: No, not your clothes.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmm... Let's say this?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Pup's "puppies" have been bouncing about all over 
the place.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Those weren't *my* puppies.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not to mention they were starved. I wouldn't 
blame them for bouncing around when they're
all excited for a meal.

I had finished undressing and had placed my 
clothes in a pile to the side.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Breasts, Pup. Breasts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh...

(Wait, is she-)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Tits. Tatas. Bazongas.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
The premium melons of flesh that you've freed to 
swing from your chest.
My face reddened.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: C- Could we not talk about this?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You can't let them just bounce around without 
support!

You're going to hurt your back. They might even 
start sagging later on.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- Who knows what'll happen when we resolve all 
this with Wolf and such?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We just need to beat Wolf! Or I can overcome the 
weakness. It's... It's not like this will stay like this.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
And what if you end up with back pain and saggy 
breasts for life?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We... We're not going to discuss this.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmph. Very well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Seriously, do you try to give me stress?

I spun towards the box to open it and retrieve the 
full armor set.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It's full of ROCKS?!)

(Rocks and...)

I lifted up a piece of fabric that was both all too 
familiar and all too alien to me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Satia, what is the-

With a pivot, I turned to see my clothes were 
gone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: SATIA?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: "Auntie" Satia, thank you very much.

The voice stifled giggles from beyond the changing 
area's doorway.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What are you doing? Where are my clothes?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Making a very pretty bonfire outside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Those clothes were a gift!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How could you just burn my clothes?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Leverage is a tricky thing, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Maybe you could stand to use some more support?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?
I looked down to the bra I was still holding.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know I'm just going to leave at this rate? I'll 
have a chance to grab something from the supply.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
And I wonder who might have the key to that 
particular chest?
I heard a metallic jingle along with her voice.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oh? Is that a visitor I hear? They sound mere 
minutes away?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Did I mentioned I invited Charlotte here as well?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I'll just make a break for it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
*Giggle*... It's not that big of a camp. She and 
everyone else would get quite a show.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
The rumors that could spread. A vile pervert on the 
loose!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?

A sort of humming sound caught my attention. It 
was like an approaching voice.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: (Inaudible speech)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh Pup. Why are you- Oh, how daring.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: F- Fine! Deal! Just get the clothes ready!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggles*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Now how do you...)

With a defeated sigh, I put on the bra. I wore one 
hoop, then the other... but then the back part 
was open.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait. What the... Really, how do you...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh!

After some struggle, I finally managed to clasp the 
back part of the bra by myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's on! Clothes!

A bundle of cloth rolled through the flap of the 
changing area's door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (My normal clothes!)

Another sound of a moving tent flap interrupted 
my revelation.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So what did you need?

I rushed to get my normal clothes on like the wind.

Just as I was throwing on the last piece, I heard 
the changing room's doorway open.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah, Pup! Sorry. I didn't realize anyone was in here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey Charlotte. Nothing... weird happening here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: In the woman's changing area? I think- ...think...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Satia finally convinced you to wear a bra? Good for 
you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How do you...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Really? Did you not realize how obvious it was that 
you weren't before?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Like I said, good for you.

As I stood there wordless and dumbstruck, 
Charlotte walked around me to take one of the 
rocks from the box.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Apparently this region has some useful minerals. 
Satia got me a sample to see if starting a mine
would be a good idea.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Talk to you later.

Charlotte left and I was left with the sound of 
the tent flap to accompany me collapsing to 
the floor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hahhhhhh-

Footsteps brought a familiar face to look down 
upon my exhausted expression.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hm...
She bent down and poked me in the cheek.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It only gets easier from here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I really hope so. I really do.

title: SP: Pup x Satia A - Begining

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Flanking approaches... Supply line...?

My head hurt a bit when I tried to process a recent 
lesson from Kara on battlefield strategy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Ah... Things really get complicated when you have 
a lot of people in a conflict.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That smell...)

A hot bowl of stew dropped itself into my hands. I 
had been waiting in line for dinner.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(The evening is getting a bit cold, so this would hit 
the spot near the campfire.)

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Pup. Made it in time for dinner?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'd never miss it when we're having this stew.

I plopped myself down onto a bench by the 
campfire next to the other Nightless Crow.

He seemed to be finishing up his own meal.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
I'll... I'll leave you to your little romance with your 
meal.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah, come on!
He started on his way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: More like a sibling relationship, if anything~

I raised the spoon, only to be interrupted by the 
sound of a familiar click of a boot.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No! Not now!)

My body froze, as if I was hoping the foreboding 
feeling would go away if I pretended it wasn't 
there.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Pup! I thought I saw that flash of red cloth pitter-
patter past me before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What brings you here...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Be careful. Be very careful!)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I could smell the stew from a mile away. It's a nice 
smell in the waning day.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, I was actually just about to-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It... reminded me of the old days.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

That so...?

Satia placed herself down in the seat the other 
Nightless Crow had just vacated.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You know that stew recipe pre-dates myself or 
Norde joining the Crows?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wow. This is an old recipe.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I take it back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just mean... I remember eating this as a kid.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Back when my dad used to chase me around 
because he feared that I'd trip onto a sword's 
edge.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You were so cute then. I do miss those days.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I sometimes wonder if I'd go back if given the 
chance...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
No need. In a roundabout way, you're back to 
being cute like then, again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Th- That's not what I meant.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Or maybe you always were and the cute little Pup 
never went away?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. That helps. Thanks.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
The more things change, the more they stay the 
same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Speak for yourself. These things are a killer with the 
weight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I could only imagine how bad it'd be if they were 
still as big as before.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Speak for yourself. These things weigh a ton.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I really don't know how you girls manage to carry 
them around all the time.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I'm sure you'll get use to it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Though, I have to say...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That look isn't good. Did I fall into another trap?!)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Your new outfit looks quite nice. A bit breezy, 
maybe?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... got to be a leading question?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No, it's nothing like that. Just a matter of getting 
used... to... all the flappy bits?

The skirts and stuff. They can be comfortable and 
all that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (W- Was that the wrong answer?)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'm happy to hear you think that. Skirts and dresses 
can be a girl's best friend.

My eye twitched a little. It still felt very weird to 
have that directed at me.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: They can also be a girl's worst enemy at times.

She motioned downwards.

I looked down to match.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh? Did I... Did I step in something?

Satia stood up and walked over to me.

Her hands lowered onto my knees...

...and closed them.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: A well adjusted young lady...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...does not sit with her legs wide open.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sorry?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, but I have spats for that?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: That's not the issue.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Maybe it's time for a pop quiz?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Trap sprung! Trap sprung!)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Have you been taking care of your hair? Brushing it 
like I showed you?

How about your clothes? Are you cleaning them 
properly? They will show dirt more easily than your 
old clothes.
What about skin... shampoo... nails...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean- I...

My head went in circles as the standing Satia 
towered over me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I've been brushing my hair daily! With the- With the 
brown- No, green brush!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: From top to bottom!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It's from bottom to top.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: And why would the color matter?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... mean... atmosphere...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Plus, I've been changing between my sets of 
clothes each day!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: While folding them like I showed you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Fold"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I'm sorry! I'm no good at being a girl!

I- I'm just a failure at this, too!

My eyes closed and my hands sprung up as if in 
submission.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Sigh*

An eye of mine peeked open with the silence.

Satia wasn't standing in front of me anymore.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hm?
I turned my head to the side and-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I'm sorry.

An encircling feeling of pressure and warmth was 
placed upon me.

Satia was hugging me.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I'm being too harsh on you., aren't I?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
It can be hard for me to understand how big the 
learning curve can be, but all girls go through it at 
some point.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: And you make a lovely girl.
I hugged her back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You keep calling me that, haha...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: A very pretty girl.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Actually, could you not?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
The envy of every woman and the focus of every 
man's eyeline.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're loving this, aren't you?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I mean it. I think you make a lovely girl. Do you not 
want to be?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I do. It just... feels like another ideal I can't live up 
to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How in Ilvanis have you been able to manage this all 
for your whole life?

Satia backed away from the hug and looked me 
straight in the eye.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
It's a matter of accepting and knowing who you 
are.

A woman’s body takes a lot of care, yes. But I can 
assure you it's worth it.

Few things that are worth it will come easily.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's easy to say that, but...

(I could ask... I mean, does that really have a 
chance of backfiring now?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Could you- Could you... teach me? Properly? All the 
things I never learned on how to be a girl?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Of course.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
And I'll try to make sure we take it at your pace.

So you can take each step towards becoming a 
woman you can be proud of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
T- Thank you.

(Maybe she really isn't as bad as I thought?)

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: First lesson is bathing together~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... I take it all back.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Ladies.
I turned my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Oh, did I just react to that without hesitation?)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Kara wanted to confirm some things with us. Do 
you have a minute?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure.

I stood up and began after Norde. Turning to Satia 
before I left, I said my farewell.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'll talk to you later...

...Auntie Satia.

I quickly pivoted to trail in Norde's footsteps, but 
gave a wave on my path.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Better etch that into your memory! It's the only 
one you'll get.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*

Satia's head shifted to the stew that was left cold 
and half eaten.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I'll miss these times, too...
A figure stood on a street corner.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
So stands the horizon's valiant winds~

Swept up with blossoms so twilight rescinds~

Day by daybreak~

Passes us by~

Night by midnight~

Counters with questions of why~

The small crowd that had formed around Rowan 
stood still.

And stayed still for longer still.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: ...is that... it?

A light, hesitant applause rose from the onlookers. 

The crowd soon dispersed with a small set of coins 
having found their way into Rowan's donation bag.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Another brilliant performance.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: A performance? Is that what that was?
Cainan stepped forward from the dispersing crowd.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The glittering of bronze and silver at my feet is 
proof enough.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Of your skill?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Of happiness.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Appreciation that reflects a little joy being sparked 
within the world.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Interesting. Interesting.

Cainan pulled out a gold coin and dropped it into 
the donation bag.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Consider it a reflection much the same, though 
perhaps not so directly from the song.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Every bit of light brightens the world.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Such light is the light of the Goddess, no?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
You do well to refuse me the option of disagreeing, 
haha...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Though, if this is your normal income... it would be 
difficult to travel as you have.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
There are... other sources of revenue for those 
that wander.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Few of legal certainty, I imagine.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Was joining this band of mercenaries meant to give 
you financial stability?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It was an unexpected boon. That much is sure.

Rowan hummed a melody that cut through the
silence of a pause.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
You know...

I barely recognized you when we met again. You 
could be considered a new person in more ways 
than one.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I feel...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...liberated.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You may say I've thrown off those chains that 
weighed me down.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Poetic.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Do your parents know? I can't imagine this would 
please them.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I would think news made its way home long ago. 
Maybe before journey's start?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: But I'll hold their disapproval as a badge of pride.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: After the trouble they've caused...

Rowan just sighed dramatically while Cainan 
acted unfazed.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
So what twists has your life been through since 
we last met?

I likely was away when you last visited, no?

Mayhap you even have knowledge of... Mikhail?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: What of him?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You are not aware? I had thought that since he 
headed to...

Ah, no matter.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I will not burden you needlessly, then.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Is that what drives you to action?

You are looking for him? Is that the motivation for 
following this group, even?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

There is no need for you to-

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Nonsense. I've known the boy for as long as I've 
known you.

While I haven't heard anything as of now, I'll be 
sure to keep my ear to the ground should anything 
surface.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: You needn't say a word.
Cainan placed his hand on Rowan's shoulder.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
We'll do what we can to keep Mikhail's light of 
happiness faced towards to the days ahead.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: T- Thank you... sir...

Cainan smiled a large smile before heading off 
on his way.

Rowan, on the other hand, stared down at the 
donation bag with an uncertain look on his face.

title: SP: Rowan x Eve C - Talk

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Didn't they say there was going to be a 
"celebration" tonight?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I guess this will be peaceful after all.
Five minutes later...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And so...~

The midnight wanders wearily~

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: *Whistles* Encore!

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow 2
lines.text:
Haha! Bravo! I didn't know you could butcher that 
song so badly!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Thank you, my dear fans! Thank you!
Shortly away from the singing and dancing...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And then the guy took a swing at me. Then he-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Then he missed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Shut up. I'm telling the story.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So it turned out that his weapon wasn't sharpened 
properly, so it...
Shortly away from that still...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: W- What is this... What is this a celebration of...?

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Who gets next dibs on singing?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... I have an idea!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Our dear beloved Eve... Would you?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Eek!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Did she faint?!

A blur of pink, blue, and brown could be seen 
literally rolling away from the festivities at a 
fevered pace.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think that's more a tactical retreat...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Oh my...
The blur of rolling stopped and jumped to its feet.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
*Breathes in*

*Breathes out*

For a few minutes, Eve simply stood there to
catch her breath.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Have you managed to calm yourself?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I won't let you-
Eve jumped to an awkward defensive stance.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Oh, you're not a monster.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I just wanted some fresh air, I guess...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I suppose even a flower can get tired of the sun, 
after a time.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Uh... yeah?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: That is why the night is important for them.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
The seasons are probably a lot more impactful, 
though.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Unless you're an alrune... You'd be surprised how 
much sun they can handle.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hah! Such an avalanche of words.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Are you sure you don't wish to take the stage 
tonight? Mayhap with melodies of flowers?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Oh, I don't sing.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Besides, you had plenty of good options for who 
could sing next. The guy before you was pretty 
good.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Bah humbleness!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Surely a flower sprouts forth from every seed?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
*Chuckles*... I think you'd be surprised.

Some plants don't even have flowers. Plus flowers 
without seeds.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: That's a whole different topic, though...
Rowan smiled and nodded along absentmindedly.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Did you just come out here to talk to me about 
flowers and fruit?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Are you interested in gardening, maybe?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I came to water a withered flower.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
You all seemed to be having fun at the party. Are 
you sure you want to talk about this now? Don't 
you want to go back?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yet a flower arrangement is not at its pinnacle with 
one member missing, no?

Would you like to return together?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Oh, I'm okay. I'll slip into my tent later on.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I'm not really the... word talking sort of person...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I've yet to see any trouble with the words you rain 
down upon me.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I'm pretty used to talking to... unique individuals...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
It can take time to meet them, but they've all 
become close friends.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Honestly, I really miss them.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap we become close much the same?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I know a traditional dance that is said to evaporate 
the stress of the day.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Oh, that sounds nice! Maybe you could teach it to 
me?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Gladly!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
First of all, it a dance of the night. One to be 
performed in one's formal birthday attire.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Birthday... attire? Like your PJs? I guess I've worn 
them on my birthday before?

This place might be weirder than the farm, though. 
Shouldn't that be used for sleeping?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Sleep. Yes. We would sleep together.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It would be dance to tire our souls and wipe away 
the exhaustion of the day into the blissful slumber.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Oh~ I get it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Right, then shall we- ?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
A good exercise always gets me into the sleeping 
mood.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I guess that is true, but...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I meant to sleep... together. As a pair.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Like... in the same tent?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
There's not that much room, but I guess its okay if 
that's how the dance works.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
To casually accept as we reach the point of no 
return? I knew I liked you.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Well it's just two guys sleeping together. Is that a 
weird thing here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A... man, you say?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Oh, wait... You didn't...?

It's the dress, right?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: A dear friend gifted it to me, so...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Say no more. I am not objecting.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
A rose is more beautiful with a thorn or two, after 
all.
The two met again at Rowan's tent.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You are... with company of sorts?
Eve was carrying an extra sleeping bag.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
I wouldn't want to get a cold from sleeping on the 
ground.

Don't worry! We can set it up after the dance.
Eve dropped it in front of the tent.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
So how does the dance go? Are the steps 
complicated?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I really should be more... direct... at times...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Sorry?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Nothing of import.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Now, there is a dance I learned of during my 
wandering.

They say it is several thousand years old and passed 
down by the people of the east island, Nodhan.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Oo~ Really? That's neat.

title: SP: Satia x Jak C - Talk

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: There we go.
Satia placed down an axe on the weapon rack.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Now, with that organized, I should-

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark*!

Satia stumbled back in surprise, and she almost 
knocked over the weapons she had just organized.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Phew...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Jakson? I didn't notice you enter. Did you need 
something?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Actually, maybe you shouldn't stand so... so...

Jakson had walked up to Satia to the point he was 
standing right next to her.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You shouldn't... stand so... so...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...CLOSE! ACHOO!
Satia flailed back from her sneeze.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: No!

One by one, the weapons acted like dominoes as 
they plunged to the ground.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Ah... fuck nuggets...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Maybe you... you should.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ACHOO!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Please wait outside.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Curious whine*?

Satia hurriedly fixed the mess while Jakson
stepped outside.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ACHOO!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Ack!

Drops of hot grease flew upward from the pan 
after Satia's surprise sneeze.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hot hot! That... might burn...
She turned to see...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: J- Jackson... Could you... wait outside?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

Jakson happily complied and moved away from 
Satia.

She sighed with a feeling of relief and went back to 
her cooking.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It doesn't look like it was ruined?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank the Goddess... This was going so well.

Satia shook the pan over the fire and shuffled the 
meat around inside it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmm...?
A sound had pulled her attention.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What was-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ACHOO!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: The food!

As Satia's eyes scanned down to where the meat 
had fallen, she was immediately greeted with 
something else.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Munch* *munch* *munch*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Again?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Laugh-Like Whine*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Jakson...

You wouldn't be doing this on purpose, would 
you?

The dog looked up while throwing puppy-dog eyes 
at Satia.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Don't think I'm so easily bewitched.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Huff*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Do it again and you're not getting-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ACHOO!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...and you're not getting dinner.
Jakson just scoffed and went back to eating.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Sigh*... is this going to be a trend?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You were quite sneaky about it. Where are you 
when I-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh... I have an idea.

Her eyes went down to the inattentive furball 
below.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Munch* *munch* *munch*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
So you want food? Maybe without the trouble of 
this prank of yours?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Curious whine*?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You just need to do something for me every once 
in a while.
A few days later...

A Nightless Crow threw some playing cards on 
the ground.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Argh! Again?

You sure you didn't magic up the Goddess to use 
you as a vessel tonight?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I'm just channeling her luck, haha...

Satia pulled in the pot for the card game hand. The 
coins jiggled as they fell onto her pile of winnings.

Soon enough, another hand was dealt among the 
circle of Crows.

Satia looked at her hand. It was quite good. Maybe 
not perfect, but very good.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Getting a bit late. Maybe we should turn in after 
this hand?
She rolled her shoulder a couple times.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Heh. I still got to get my paycheck back.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You're free to try.

Satia stared at her cards.

But her eyes shifted upwards as a figure moved in 
the background.

He moved slowly and deliberately around the group 
of card players.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Last chance to bet.
Jakson passed by Satia's back.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Well maybe I should up the-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ACHOO!

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Come on, Jakson. You know she gets like that 
around you.

Come here, boy. Don't bother her.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It's... *sniff*... quite alright.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I think I'll fold.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: What? Dammit...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What did you have?

The Crow laid down his hand to show how lucky 
and unbeatable his hand was that round.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Eh... at least I got a little of that Goddess's luck in 
the end.
The group dispersed with the game ending.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Same time next week?
Jakson discreetly approached Satia.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thanks, boy.

She gave Jakson a pet and pulled out some 
meat for him to snack on.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy whine*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I never would've thought he'd have that sort of 
hand. I would have lost there for sure.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Munch*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ACHOO!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Now, for next time, the pattern will be a bit 
different. We can...

title: SP: Satia x Norde C - Talk

lines.text:
Satia walked through the setting night in the 
quiet and still camp.

A sound like a whisper came from a tent she was 
passing.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: ...and you... want it...

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: But yeah, I can grab that.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you.
The Crow turned to notice Satia.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Didn't see you there, Dunaid.

Need something from town? I'm headed out 
to pick up a-

A raised hand from Norde stopped the man from 
talking.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text:
Uh... I guess you can ask, instead.

Still, need anything?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I appreciate the offer, but I'm good.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Gotcha. I'll be off.
The Nightless Crow walked out of the tent.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You're sending him off to wander through the 
night to town?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Are we not supposed to be "Nightless"?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
*Gasp*! A joke? From grumpy face Norde of all 
people?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: D- Did something happen?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*... Of course not.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Now, may I-
Satia placed herself between Norde and the exit.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What did you send him to get?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Nothing to put you in a rush to find out.

Norde tried to sidestep Satia. She repositioned 
herself again.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I really must...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I could chase after him myself.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...There is no... need.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Maybe I could even distract him from finishing the 
job you sent him on?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*... Fine.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A mantlet.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Sorry?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A mantlet.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I heard.

Why would we need one? Those are shields meant 
for adjustable fortifications.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Since Lockhart, I have felt...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No... We have objectively found ourselves passing 
through more populated areas than normal.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Right... We ARE new to most of these places.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Are you worried about the villages getting attacked 
because of us?

If so, we can just run away and pull the attacking 
forces away from the villages.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Even then...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Who would carry the mantlet? They are not small 
nor light.

We'd need more than one to provide a true 
defense, too.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Even... then...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
What would the populace think if we just carried 
those into town? Maybe they'd think we're 
expecting a seige?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: EVEN... THEN...!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Even then... I wish to be prepared. Prepared for 
what seems inevitable.
A silence fell over the two.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You don't get like this often.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Protecting the populace, though...?

Admirable, but we'd have to give priorities to the 
Crows.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Trying to play guardian can be a bit foolish at 
times...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: May I leave?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh... I remember now.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I am leaving now.

Norde tried to pass around Satia, but she took hold 
of an arm to block safe passage.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hellena.

lines.speaker: Young Norde
lines.text: I... I want to join you! To join the Nightless Crows!

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text: What's this now, boy?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I remember the scene quite clearly.

A village, mostly burned to the ground... a young 
man, standing with several small children hiding 
behind his back...

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text:
Want to make a difference in the war? Join the 
army.

lines.speaker: Young Norde
lines.text:
I tried... I tried again and again and again and... 
and...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
He had saved those children. They were strangers 
to him, but when the soldiers came to the village, 
he stood tall.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
*Giggle*... I remember you looking cute as you 
puffed out your chest.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is that how you remember it?

lines.speaker: Young Satia
lines.text:
Why would the army take a lizard? They don't want 
savages.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
It has...

It has been more than a few years since then. I 
was new in the Crows myself at the time.

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text:
Satia... hold your tongue.

*Sigh*... What is it that you want, boy? The 
reason you ask?

lines.speaker: Young Norde
lines.text:
I want to make a difference. If he was here... this 
would have never happened...

I want to become strong enough to make a 
difference!

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text:
Valiant. 

But do you know what mercenaries normally 
do?

It isn't a business of saving children.

lines.speaker: Young Norde
lines.text: I just need... something... to take that first step...

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Young Satia
lines.text: You're not really going to do this?

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text: Boy, what's your name?

lines.speaker: Young Norde
lines.text: Norde.

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text: Norde what?

lines.speaker: Young Norde
lines.text: "Norde" is all I need.

lines.speaker: Harold
lines.text:
Very well, Norde of the Norde lineage.

Consider yourself a Crow.

lines.speaker: Young Norde
lines.text:
...

Thank you.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is there a point to this story?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
A very important point.

You've done this before.

Throw yourself into the fire to fight for a hopeless 
cause.

I just want to make sure you're not going to kill the 
Crows to save a couple children you never met
before.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Strength in inaction is no strength at all.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What?!

Norde was freed from Satia's grip after a quick 
movement.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Strength is... like...

Strength is like the ability to... protect those you 
love!

Satia's words fell on deaf ears with Norde exiting 
the tent before she could think of what she 
wanted to say.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You want to be like that?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Maybe I should bring Pup in on this conversation?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Please don't overcomplicate this.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oh dear Pup, we've got a new thing for you to 
carry as we travel~

It's a portable wall as big as you!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Tsk... that could work for your intent...

Fine. What is your price?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh, we're bigger than that this time.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Pup~

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: D- Dammit!

title: SP: Tatiana x Rowan C - Talk

lines.speaker: Old Woman
lines.text: T- Take it! Just take it and leave!

In an alleyway, an old woman's hand extended out.

It held a sparkling golden necklace with a beautiful 
ruby in its center.

lines.speaker: A Bandit
lines.text: Shit ain't a heirloom, is it?

lines.speaker: A Bandit too
lines.text:
Yeah. Noble asses like you got that shit right?

Don't even think about trying to track us.
with your shitty magic!

The two men stood in the only path of retreat 
that the woman had. They were already holding 
a purse.

lines.speaker: Old Woman
lines.text: No magic! My damn brother got that thing...

lines.speaker: A Bandit
lines.text: Hmph.
He snatched the necklace from her.

lines.speaker: A Bandit too
lines.text: Nice doing business with you, then.

Slipping into a nearby abandoned building, the two 
bandits started to search through the purse they 
had also stolen.

lines.speaker: A Bandit
lines.text:
Not bad.

Not bad at all...

lines.speaker: A Bandit too
lines.text: Think maybe she's got friends and-

lines.speaker: A Bandit
lines.text: Ack!

A metal hand burst through a nearby wall! 

It grabbed the man by his throat!

lines.speaker: A Bandit too
lines.text: What the fuck?!
A hollow voice echoed in the building.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Drop the crap and make yourself scarce.

lines.speaker: A Bandit too
lines.text: Who the fuck are you? The army?!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Don't make me say it twice.

lines.speaker: A Bandit
lines.text: D- D- Do what... it- it says...!

Both of the bandits dropped their loot.

Tatiana released her grip.

lines.speaker: A Bandit
lines.text:
*Gasp*!

Run!

Like scared rats, the bandits scattered out of the 
building.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Perfect.

Not too long after, a crowd formed in the nearby 
street.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: On the ground! Hands where I can see them!

lines.speaker: Old Woman
lines.text: Y- Yes. Those were the men!

lines.speaker: A Bandit
lines.text: I swear! We don't got nothin'!

A set of eyes looked on the scene. They gazed 
from where the hushed whisper's of the crowd
resonated.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Heh. And you'll never get it back

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap that be the case.
She jumped back a step in shock.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Oh, it's you...

Why are you here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I stake out the street corners on all the towns we 
visit. They are my stage, after all.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Okay... Sure. Whatever.
Tatiana started to turn away from the gathering.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You don't need to do this, you know?
She stopped for a second before continuing on.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Sigh*...

With a skip in his step, Rowan caught up with 
Tatiana.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is admirable to help that old lady, but...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Would it not be best to avoid any action that
draws such attention to oneself?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: It wasn't for her.

Tatiana stopped dead in her tracks, and Rowan 
almost lost his balance when trying to mimic her.

She turned to her side to see a youthful homeless 
boy sleeping at the inlet of an alleyway.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah...

Tatiana looked around to make sure no one was 
watching.

She bent down and lowered the gold necklace into 
a small donation bag sitting next to the sleeping 
youth.
Carefully, she covered it up with the little other 
donations he had gotten recently.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
There...

Let's go.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Of course.

Rowan silently followed Tatiana as she quietly 
distributed some of the stolen noble wealth to the 
poor of the city.
Their day ended as they retreated to an isolated 
alley.
Rowan appeared both excited and distraught.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
What to do? What to do?

For such a daring endeavor... 
Yet one of dauntless risk all the same!

Ah! But I must...!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Shh! Do you want to cause a scene?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: My dearest Tatiana!

Rowan's hands exploded upwards and grabbed 
onto the sides of Tatiana's shoulders.
She didn't like it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: We two are stuck between a rock and a hard-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... Ack! Grgh...!

Two metal gauntlets had jumped out of Tatiana's 
pack and grabbed tightly onto Rowan's wrists.

Inch by inch, the gauntlets painfully and forcefully 
pushed Rowan's arms back into a vulnerable 
position.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Don't touch me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ack- Acknowledged.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Just say what you need to say.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then... I suppose I have two questions.

First...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Have you ever used these in foreplay before?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Second question.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, well... It is simply a matter of what was 
discussed prior.

You are best served by laying low for some time, 
yes?

These acts are only a risk to yourself and the group 
as a whole.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I'm not going to stop, if that's what you're asking.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Not like I'm not trying to lay low. I went after the
bandits instead of the noble bitch directly.

*Sigh*... You're saying I should leave and shit, 
right?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Well, then mayhap we could...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Actually, these gauntlets are starting to make me 
feel numb. Could you...?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Are you going to get weird again?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That... is not a promise I can make.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Then be quick about it for your blood flow's sake.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then... if you wish to steal from the rich... then 
I may have a more promising solution?

Not as valiant and dashing as your crusade 
from before was, but...

There is more than one way to steal from the 
rich and powerful.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Huh? What do you mean?

With Tatiana being surprised, the grip of the 
gauntlets was released.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... much better.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
What are you talking about? 
"Other ways to steal from the rich?"

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Many a ways.

If I may present one as example alone?

Rowan waited, and Tatiana nodded for him to 
continue.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Excellent.

Rowan moved his hands around in a whimsical 
fashion, only to end up with a playing card in his 
grip.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Have you ever heard of...

He turned the card to show it as the Ace of 
Hearts.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...the heart of the cards?

title: SP: Charlotte x Mariel C - Talk

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph.

Charlotte fiddled with the gadget in her hand. The 
flickers of the firepit melded with the fire stained 
sky that curtained the scene.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What's the point of a mobile telegraph station if 
you can't handle the magic input?

If I could get this to work, we wouldn't have to 
rely on carriers and... and...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Argh! Dammit...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
They really had the gall to claim the development 
of this was finished.

Charlotte, without looking, turned and reached 
towards a small work surface she had setup 
nearby.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Maybe... the energy storage needs to be 
expanded?

Maybe it... it...

Charlotte's head turned as the item she reached 
for didn't slide into her hand.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The power cell was definitely there.

Charlotte turned on her firepit adjacent seat and 
towards the camp around her.

It was mostly empty after people hustled to get 
some rest after a recent battle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Here. This remedy typically helps with burns and 
blood loss.

Though, there was one set of people lined up 
directly in Charlotte's eyeline.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That one probably wouldn't be helpful...

The pair happened to be a pair of two.
The conversation included another.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I didn't think you'd be able to get it so quickly.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Now her? She can probably help.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Thank you. This is just what the doctor ordered.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: My pleasure.

Charlotte stood up and stepped within earshot of 
the two.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis, would you happen to have seen-

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oh, Charlotte. Good night to you, too!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...happen to have seen... a power cell...?

With a tilt of the head, Charlotte watched as Mariel 
ducked into a nearby tent.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... What's she in a rush for?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You need something, too?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe. You see where my power cell went?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A power what?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- If you lost something, then maybe you dropped 
it in that last fight?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It did just happen before we got back to camp.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Don't you have a stick to swing around or 
something?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey. Practice does makes perfect.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: At swinging a-
She stopped herself.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... Sure, you go perfect that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Heh. Just watch me.

Charlotte was met with the gaze of someone 
heading off to grab a sword.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Did I really drop it?

Mariel might have seen if I did.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: She went in here, right?

Charlotte had begun to enter the tent quietly, 
but her thoughts were interrupted by an 
unexpected scene.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Come on... You can... make it...

A small flash of light burst from the ground where 
Mariel's hands had steadied.

Beside them, the glow of a power cell could been 
seen flickering away its remaining light.

Another burst of light.

Another burst.

Another.

And then none.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Pant*...

Mariel took a few deep breathes.

After a few tense seconds, she relaxed back into 
sitting on the ground.
Her shoulders slumped down.

Charlotte's hand reached to fully open the tent's 
door, but she hesitated for a second.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis?
There was a slight twinge in her voice.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: C- Charlotte...

Mariel scooted herself over to block the view of 
what she was performing the magic on.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm... I'm looking for a power cell. I thought maybe 
you saw it recently.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Y- Yes, actually.. I found this on the ground, 
actually... It was already dead, actually.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Then perhaps it isn't the one I'm thinking of.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Perhaps, yeah... Maybe Pup saw something?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That I doubt.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Always worth asking, right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
True. Which reminds me that I had another 
question.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How's that bird doing?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You... You saw?
Charlotte just nodded.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
No good...

It got hit by some stray magic in the last fight, 
and... and...

I'm sorry. I didn't want to appear like I was being 
wasteful.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It's very... you, I suppose. I guess I can't blame 
you for trying.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Knowing you, you probably almost saved it, too.

Charlotte lowered herself to pick up the 
spent power cell.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hmm...

Do we have anyone that can charge these things?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Compatible heirlooms aren't that common...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I- I want to give it a funeral!

Mariel looked down at the ground and tensed up 
even more.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Why?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I just... want to give it closure. Let it greet the 
Goddess on a better note than... than this...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
But... it's a...

*Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I want to... give it closure...

A short silence fell between the two. Charlotte 
fiddled with the power cell.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How did this work, again?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
The power cell. How did you use it in your healing 
magic?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Well... From what I learned at the academy...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You can have it release the elemental energy in a 
short burst.

If the heart starts and you can get healing magic 
off in time, then...

Then... Then there's a chance that...
Mariel trailed off into whispers.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I think I'm going to get this recharged.

Maybe we can get another one. So you can have 
one on hand.

Mariel's eyes turned downward.

Charlotte's hand was left untaken.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis... It's a bird.
Mariel didn't move.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*...

The hand receded and Charlotte turned towards 
the tent's entryway.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Waste your time, then.

Mariel turned downwards to gently close the bird's 
eyes.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Maybe I could make a gravestone?

Or...

Or maybe a few of them...

title: SP: Pup x Mariel B - Talk

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Next was... in the medical tent?

Mariel rounded a corner in the camp and 
a sight fell before her eyes.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Is that...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's a matter of... morale...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Morale for who? You?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm among those counted, yes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't think you want to do a thorough census on 
people who enjoy meat from our ranks.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Is it... is it time?

Is Charlotte about to be confessed to?

Mariel ducked behind one of the larger nearby 
crates.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: What are they saying...?
She leaned a little forward, but it was to no avail.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Mrrgrr...

After a short while of steaming in her frustrations, 
Mariel's hands rose.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Hand Puppets*

lines.speaker: Left Hand
lines.text: I wonder what they're up to?

lines.speaker: Right Hand
lines.text: It must be the awaited confession!

The hand opened and closed along with the words 
coming out of Mariel's mouth.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Clears throat*

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Hand Puppets*

She looked on at the two and saw their mouths 
moving. She followed along with the seeming 
flow of their conversation.

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text: P- Pup? What brings you here?

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text: My dear Ms. Stewart...

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text: No. Charlotte, my dearest of all!

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text: Ah, you mustn't!

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text:
I am a princess of Lockhart! And you are but a 
mercenary!

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text: Such a thing would be forbidden!

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text: Then... You know of my... my feelings?

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text: I can only speak of my idling speculation.

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text:
But...

Should you say the words, then I might...

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text:
Hush, my dearest. It is but words.

I will offer you no obligations of reciprocation.

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text:
No worlds are left closed to you. It is... It is your 
decision to make.

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text:
And more to say and extra words here because I 
am still talking.

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text: Pup... I...

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text: Charlotte. I love you.

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text: I love you too!

lines.speaker: "Pup"
lines.text: *Kissing noises*

lines.speaker: "Charlotte"
lines.text: *Kissing noises*

Mariel closed her eyes before giggling gleefully 
and softly to herself.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I'm sure it'll go well.

Or went well, I suppose?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're sure what went well?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Ah!
She jumped back a step.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... okay?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I've been well... I... Oh, right.
Mariel tidied up her clothes.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: How'd it go with Charlotte?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That? Same as ever.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You... You've done it before?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well, yeah. We need to buy meat often. It's like a 
constant negotiation to try and keep it in supply.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Wait, then you didn't... confess to her?
I blinked a few times.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: After all this time and nothing?
I blinked a few more times.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Could you go back a step?

Before she said a word on my request,
I felt her hand on my arm, and I was
pulled into the nearby tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wh- What now?

Mariel pulled me in and looked around to confirm no 
one else was there at the time.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: How have you not confessed yet?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Confessed? Confessed what to who?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It's okay. You don't need to play dumb. Your 
secret's safe with me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What if... What if I am that dumb?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You just need some practice to get the butterflies 
out of your system, right?
Mariel started to lean in very close to me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... well...

I turned slightly to noticed I was backed into a 
corner.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Why not use me to practice? Just come out and 
say "I love you"!

Mariel got even closer. It was to the point that she 
was very far into my personal space.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I...

(Thoughts... slowing...)

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Just say it once and it'll be easier the second time!

I can help you with the steps after that too, if you 
like.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... a... thing...

My heart was racing enough that it seemed like 
Mariel might be able to hear it from so close.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: One time. That's all you need. Just say "I love you."

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You can do it!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I lo- I looovv...

I... love you... Mariel...

Over the beating of my own heart, I felt like I could 
hear a 'thump' come from Mariel herself.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That's...
She turned her face and backed away from me.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: G- Good job.
She started to make her way out of the tent.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Great job! You'll do great!

I was alone in the tent watching the flaps of the 
entryway swish back and forth.

Silence was left to accompany the beating drum 
that was my heart.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Good... Good talk...

title: SP: Tatiana x Rowan B - Talk

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Really? Isn't that 6 pieces up from last week?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
What can I say? Market sways how the market 
sways.

Blame the cronies in Lockhart if you really need 
someone to throw shit at.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
But apples went up last week too.

Now that I think on it, didn't they go up the week 
before that, too?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Are you going to buy? I don't have time to explain 
market economics to every hick passing through.

The merchant said as he lazily slumped back 
into his chair.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Or maybe go to another stall?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: I did. They had the same price...

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
And that, my dear simpleton, is supply and demand.

Instead of thanking me for my market low, 
generous prices, you complain and complain.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
I- I only said one other stall had the same price. Not 
all of them.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
...

And?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: I- I'll... Guard!
The villager scampered up to a nearby guard.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Guard, uh, sir! I think the merchants are fixing their 
prices.

The guard turned towards the merchant.

He waved at him to leave and the guard nodded.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: What are you...?

Footsteps met the villager's ears while the guard 
walked away.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Now. I heard you needed some apples? Heheheh...

After locking up his stall for the today, the 
merchant started on his way home through a 
nearby alleyway.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Another good day. Those villagers are getting 
annoying though.

Simple in the mind and simple in the pocketbook. 
They're not paying as much as they used to.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: H- Hello, sir!

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Argh! You nearly have me a heart attack.

The merchant grabbed at the alley wall after 
jumping back from surprise.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Really? Have I got the product for you!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Wait, no... That comes later...

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Product? What are you on? Just head back to your 
parents, little girl.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I am not a... "little girl"... I am a merchant like 
yourself.

Tatiana could hear a dull sound in her ear as she 
grinded her teeth through the smile.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Hah! A failing merchant maybe.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Such a... h- handsome man, you are. You've had 
your share of love and passion with the ladies?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Ah, that sort of "merchant".

You're acceptable, I guess.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: No, no no no. Not what I mean.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I mean, you've surely known the intoxicating 
sensation of love and passion many times.

Tatiana hesitated a little, remembering a phrase 
repeated to hear in rehearsal.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
And likely... have... provided... bountiful pleasure to 
many a woman.

I... could clearly tell... being a woman.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Huh... 7/10 for the compliment. 3/10 on the pitch. 
Go on.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Thank the goddess...

Tatiana let out an exasperated gust of air.

She then pulled out a fancy box with ornate 
metal lining.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Oo~... What have you here?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
It's a new collaboration by the Theodal Royal 
College and Lockhart.

A Potion of Love~

Tatiana unlatched the box and it sprung open to 
reveal...!

...a fairly plain flask with a red liquid inside.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I spent all the budget on the carrying box, already.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Imagine how desperate people would be to get 
their hands on this product?

All you need to do is to drink a dose, and everyone 
around you will become instantly attracted to one
another.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Hmm... Interesting concept, but I call bullshit. I'd 
know if there was a "love potion" out there.

I'm not some no name merchant. Me? I have 
connections.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Have you seen the obscene wealth some of the 
Lockhart nobles have?

This was kept under lock and key for their private 
use.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Until a recent occupation set some dominoes in 
motion.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Hmm... I could actually see that...

The merchant picked up the flask and started 
examining it.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Surely it'd be simple to prove with a demonstration, 
though?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: A... demonstration?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Simple, right?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Y- Yeah. Easy peasy.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Then how about...
The merchant scanned the nearby area.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
He'll look about the area and immediately see me 
standing out from the crowd.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: That guy.
He pointed to Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
He'll identify me as a handsome man that would be 
difficult to woo so easily.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
He'd be a hard one for even you to stomach, yeah?

Shabby. And has been around all day causing ear 
ache for everyone.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: D- Demonstration it is.

Tatiana turned from the merchant and headed 
over to Rowan

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ladies, please. I am about to start another 
performance.

A couple woman were loitering around his 
performance spot.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You lose the bet.

She said, whispering it so the merchant couldn't 
hear.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
What? How could he not be enamored
with my visage?

Rowan made exaggerated, dismissive gestures like 
he was perplexed by a request Tatiana had made.

The merchant looked on, satisfied.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I expect payment in full for the bet.

Tatiana handed over the potion to Rowan. Rowan 
shrugged merrily has he took it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, such is life.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Do remember the script in question is now flipped 
between us.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Fine.

Rowan, making a spectacle of it, chugged down 
the potion.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ANYTHING FOR A FAN!

The loud, clear message caused the merchant's 
eyebrow to raise.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Are YOU okay. Good SIR?!
Tatiana was not a good actress.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Maybe you should lie-

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: *Gasp*, sir, you...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Perhaps it'd be better for me to ask if you are 
alright?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Oh right...
Tatiana cleared her throat.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I am perfectly fine, oh angel of mine.

From ground to bright blue sky!

You have picked me out from a vine!

Sacred elixir rain from up high!

The other women got up and started getting close 
to Rowan, as well.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Naturally, the women around us will use it as an 
excuse to approach me as well.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: No, they won't.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then we shall pay them.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You already spent our entire budget!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Please be mine! Oh sweet green haired maiden! 
Or... uh... Gentleman!

Tatiana started to approach for a kiss, but her 
hesitancy led Rowan to jumping in to kiss her by 
surprise.

It was just a quick kiss, but to Tatiana it felt
much longer.

Slowly she backed away, shaking a little.

The encounter ended and Tatiana tried to keep up 
a lovesick appearance until she exited a set radius 
around Rowan.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Ugh... that was...

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
That was truly disgusting.

I'll take all you have. If you've got any set aside for 
other regions, I want that too.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I... I'll see what I can do.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
And as a favor for taking your entire stock... We 
never met, you hear me?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Who are you again?
A few days later.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: So, how do you feel about it now?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Ask me again and I actually will break your 
kneecaps.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But you were excellent!

A blooming lily to to be displayed at the theater!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Anyone would be nervous their first time. I just 
wrote it into the script.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Script my ass. You kissing me wasn't part of the 
plan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Next time you try that I'll kick your teeth out.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Shh. I think I heard something interesting at that 
table over there.

lines.speaker: Villager 2
lines.text:
Have you heard about it? A group of merchants 
had their stands attacked.

I think it included that guy you were talking about.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Seriously? They probably deserved it.

lines.speaker: Villager 2
lines.text:
Yeah. And even better, once the commotion was 
over, the guards arrested THEM for disturbing the
peace!

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
Wow... So that's why fruit prices have gone down?

I fucking knew they were doing something 
underhanded.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Wow indeed. Right, Tatiana?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am truly sorry. The place is a bit loud, I couldn’t 
hear you.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Yes! You were right!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Tsk. Are you happy now?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: If you are happy, then I am radiant.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I guess it's cleaner than my normal M.O.

Figuratively and literally.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Though I wish I could've seen it...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Maybe we could join the bandit smashing next 
time?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Old habits die hard?

title: SP: Otis x Cainan C - Talk

lines.speaker: Otis
