Our "relationship" was an a- act, so... It was just 
a... a...!

Tatiana, who was already off balance, tried to back 
up ever so slightly until...
She began to fall from the wagon...!
...pulling the entangled associate with her!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: M- My...

Tatiana's arm extended to use her magic to 
summon her armor from the wagon.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Make it... in time...!

Her eyes snapped shut as the seconds felt like a 
never ending wait.

Her eyes snapped open, only to find herself safely 
caught by her armor.

But she quickly felt another source of heat 
contained within.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Such spaciousness! I did not expect it so.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Now, about the Armored Bandit... I do not much 
care either way. Do you?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Y- You..!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ask yourself...

Rowan leaned in and kissed her again within the 
confined space.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ask yourself what you want. How does the 
thought make you feel?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Aren't... Aren't you one to t- take advantage of 
the situation?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Says the lady who doth chosen toleave the 
situation as is, despite wielding control over the 
armor encasing us.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: ...W- Well...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
How does that make your sweet heart beat? What 
feelings arise...?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I guess...

H-... H- Ha...ppy...?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Wipe that smirk off your face!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I look forward to seeing how our story unfolds from 
here~

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: D- Dammit... I'll... I'll get you, you stupid noble...

title: SP: Charlotte x Mariel B - Begining

lines.text:
Mariel sat near the cliff's edge. Her gaze wandered 
off into the horizon.

The silence carried through her eyes to her mind. 
The tiny speck on the horizon gathered what 
attention she could muster.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You're missing the planning meeting. Why are you 
out here?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis?
Charlotte put her hand on Mariel's shoulder.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You falling asleep with your eyes open now?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: N- No...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You really should take this stuff more seriously. We 
do want to liberate our home, don't we?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...

Do you remember when we were little?

We used to watch the horizon whenever we sailed 
away from Lockhart.

And just... watch it disappear.

Charlotte paused for a second.

But then she moved to sit next to Mariel.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I do. It's a nice memory.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
The first time I saw your reaction to it is one of my 
earliest memories, even.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You were just like "Oh~ Wow!"

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It was so cute.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Haha... I would have loved to see your first time, 
too.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm sure you've seen plenty of my firsts.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Like...
Charlotte looked off into nothing as she thought.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Remember my high society debut?

That birthday party.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Oh, was that the one where...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yep.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Lucky you, not being known by anyone then. You 
got to watch.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Giggle*

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That man was quite livid.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I still say that he deserved it.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It's hard to entirely disagree. I know father didn't.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
But maybe it wasn't the best idea to assault the 
man just because you knew he couldn't go against 
our family?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I was just a little girl. And it was a little bruise on his 
shin.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You're saying you were thinking of that at the 
time?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No, I was thinking of kicking his shin.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Haha... It did look satisfying.
The two lightly laughed together.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: More fun than my debut...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wish I kicked that guy's shin, too. Making you cry.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It wasn't his fault. I was just... overwhelmed by the 
moment.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Tell me it wouldn't have been satisfying to kick the 
guy, though?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Uh... Well...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: P- Perhaps...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You've come a long way since then, too.

Remember when that foreign businessman came 
not too long ago?

He wanted to build that warehouse.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Right, the one from the East Auran Alliance.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, you stood up to him when the proposal was 
barely out of his mouth.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
He wanted to build in a poor residential district. So 
many people would've been displaced.

Even for others that could find new homes, they 
would have had to travel even further to get to 
their jobs.
The traffic, the time away from families, and...

Everything would've been miserable. Worse so with 
a new warehouse to require even more workers.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Exactly. You've gotten so much better than 
standing up for yourself and your beliefs.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It was an amazing insight. It was the sort of stuff 
that I never dreamed of thinking of right away.

I remember even father being shocked. It hadn't 
even occurred to him, yet.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Right... Father...

That would've been the last time that...

An awkward silence fell over the horizon watching 
duo.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You know what?

You should take over Lockhart once we get it 
back.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: ...What?

For the first time, Mariel had taken her eyes off the 
sight in front of her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Maybe those whispers among the upper echelon of 
the city were right.

Maybe you are the right choice to take over the 
company and the city.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I... Charlotte...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm not afraid to admit it. Not anymore. Not with 
everything that has happened.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You know the city so well. The people, the 
places... That wasn't the first time you've surprised 
me with it.
You're a natural born user of the Goddess's 
blessings. There's a reason you still have our family's
heirloom.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Not to mention, you'd be better suited to 
actually...

Charlotte raised her hand and gently rubbed her 
ears below her hat.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You'd be... You'd be better suited to actually 
leading. They'd accept you. They already want to.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Sis... I... can't. I wouldn't be a good choice for 
that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Don't try to save my feelings.

Do I need to repeat what I said? You'd be a great 
choice.

You're not exactly a slouch when it comes to 
economics and-

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
No... Charlotte... I...

Maybe I wouldn't be a bad choice. Maybe I could 
do a good job.

But I couldn't replace you.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It's okay. I'm not afraid to admit it.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I mean I couldn't replace how irreplaceable I think 
you are to Lockhart.

The idea of us not succeeding doesn't even seem 
to cross your mind. It's like a part of you.

When I look at you... I see Lockhart.

The city is you, as you are the city.

You'd fight for it. Like you were fighting for your 
own life.

And as much as I love my home... I love it like my 
home. I could never match that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I don't... think...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I know.

I don't think I'd be good enough either.

Mariel looked back towards the horizon. 

She leaned over to rest her head on Charlotte, and 
Charlotte ended up doing the same in kind.

They stared silently for a time. A speck in the 
distant horizon their focus once more.

A place they believed to be calling to them. 

Home.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah... So much for whatever 'rivalry' we had.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I never wanted to see it like that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I guess.. I was more afraid it would become a rivalry 
than anything.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I know. I know... We just...

We just both want what's best for Lockhart. 
What's best for our home.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah... When we liberate it... we... we'll do what 
we can.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I hope so. I really do.

title: SP: Norde x Satia A - Begining

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
...and I just wanted to thank you personally, sir.

Or... uh... ma'am...? Or...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: ...and I just wanted to thank you personally, sir.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is this what you requested a meeting for?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
I- I just wanted to thank you for 
enabling the armor repairs.

I heard it came from your and Satia's expenses 
and... well, it saved my life in the last fight.

I am... truly grateful.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Understood. 

Your gratitude is accepted.

Norde began to turn to pick up equipment to 
leave.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Oh, uh... is that... it? I was expecting... 

I just felt like I had to say it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It is good that you are alive, and no thanks are 
required for such a matter of course.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: But I am not one to reject a sincere sentiment.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: T- Thanks... Norde...

As Norde finished adjusting the armor straps, a 
swivel of the head placed Norde's vision in the
Crow's direction.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You are welcome. I look forward to
continuing to fight by your-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Come back here!

A figure sprinted through the camp.

Norde began to jolt after the man, but quickly 
started stumbling.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Careful! Didn't you take a hit to
the knee last battle?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Damn archer...
Satia sprinted into the area and stopped.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You saw that man?

Wordlessly, Satia began to turn to continue the 
chase, but Norde reached out to stop her by 
grabbing her wrist.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What's happening?

I can't work on no information.
Strategizing or otherwise.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I... don't have time to...

Satia turned her head back towards the direction of 
the fleeing man, only to find no sign of him.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Fine.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I was just-

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...Let go of my wrist.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
How do I know you won’t just
immediately run off afterwards?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Look. Do you see him anymore?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Right...
The grip on the wrist was released.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I'm not that reckless, you know?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Now. What happened...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: So, to summarize...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
One of the men has been building up
gambling debts at practically every
stop we’ve made.
And now we have a loan shark collecting on 
payments via extorting strategic info about the
Crows from him.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is that all correct?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Yeah. It was Jothram, too.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is he the one...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
That everyone knows has a terrible
poker face...? Yeah...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Given the source, this has been
surprisingly thorough.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Thanks, I-

...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What was that about "given the source", again?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Come to think of it, much of it seems oddly familiar.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What was the name of the man at that time...? 
"Black"... something?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Ignoring me is only going to make
the punishment worse later.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It was from a story from another mercenary 
company. That was a couple years ago.

It wasn’t with gambling debts, though. It was with 
unpaid bar tabs, but that’s not important.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
*Sigh*

...Fine, I'll play along.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I remember this story.

About the "Black Fang" loan shark guy.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then do you remember how the guy was 
described?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
A brash man with an ego to match.

Apparently, he has a fondness for exotic female 
prostitutes.

Emphasis on the "exotic".

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
A brash man with an ego to match.

He is very brazen about his distaste for outlanders.

The sort to fling words like "savages" at anyone but 
honlyns.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Not an uncommon sight when you look
below the surface of society.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: But it does give me an idea.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Nothing reckless...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Then it's settled.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I just said--

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Let me know if you think of a better idea before 
we put this plan into action, then.

Until you can, consider it punishment for your little 
quip before~

After tracking down the indebted and previously 
fleeing Crow, the two were able to get a meeting 
setup with the loan shark.

title: SP: Norde x Satia A - Femenine Path (7-12)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: For the record, I object to this.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I object to everything about this.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Aw, but you look amazing.
Norde was dressed in a dark blue and silver dress.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I even let you have the dress you like.

It looked suspiciously similar, pattern wise, to her
normal mercenary armor.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I simply am trying to make the best out of a bad 
situation.

We must think strategically about details if this is to 
have a chance at working.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Yep, yep. You are so right.

Every girl will indeed have her own sense of style.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*... This won't work.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You say that, but Pup's been handling her changes 
quite well.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: What? Can't keep up?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That is not what I-
Footsteps interrupted Norde.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Ah! Is that him? I need to go.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Don't forget the plan!

Satia whispered loudly as she ducked out of the 
scene and a new face entered it.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
Hmm... Curvy bod, nice dress...
lots of sharp angles...
The man looked up and down Norde.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: You the broad Jothram set up for me?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: "Black Fang", I take it?

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: Heh, yep. Scourge of the west.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: It's okay. You can bask in my glory.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm... That's extra.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
Hmph. Lizards like you live longer when you can 
control your tongue, you know?

Norde took several steps towards the man.

The clicks of her heels pierced through the silence 
in the alleyway.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The great "Black Fang" isn't up to the challenge of 
silencing a silly little "lizard" girl?

What? Can't keep up?

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
...

Heheh... I'm gonna enjoy this.

Two glasses of a shimmering liquid were still 
as the mood within the hotel room.

The Black Fang eyed the wine suspiciously, 
glancing at Norde and back.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What better way to add bite to a 'wild' ride of a 
night than with a pristine vintage?

Courtesy of your friend, Jothram.
The Black Fang shrugged, chuckling lowly.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
That hopeless sap’s hardly my friend... but I 
suppose you’re right. Let us get good and drunk.

Heh! I'll need to if I want to forget the nature of 
my company.

The Fang raised his glass and downed it almost
immediately.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
Ah... that wasn’t half bad. 
That fool knows how to treat his betters. 

You could learn a thing or two from him.

He poured another one and raised his glass for a 
toast.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Very well.
Norde raised her glass as well, but...

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
Ha! 
As if I'd celebrate a bitch in heat.
Pulling back, he downed his glass once more.

As the Fang finished his glass, he turned to Norde 
with a more suspicious look to his face.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: N- Not... drinkin'...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I like to earn my prizes.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: Heheh... Twen dwet's have you earn it!

The Fang reached for Norde’s glass and downed it 
as well.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: Now that thatsh out of the way...

The Fang sprung on Norde and pushed her against 
the wall.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
I shee. 

Thish ish why you wanted me drunk, you bitsh. 
You wanted it rough after all. 

I’ll oblige.
The Fang's hands jumped to grab Norde's neck!

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: Heheh... heheh...
The gripped tightened and tightened!

His eyes blinked in the aftermath.

The Fang stared at the mix of broken glass, spilled 
wine, and blood from the glass cuts on his hands.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: W- What...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: About time.
The Fang turned his head to his side.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: W- What?! How dwid you...?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Why did you end up strangling a
wine bottle to its breaking point?

That would be the hallucinogenic effects of the 
mushroom powder I put in your wine.

Enough to kill ten men, actually.
And you just drank about a quarter of it.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
You bitsch... I’ll fucking kill-

Ugh...!

He stopped dead in his movements as though he 
became possessed, and he fell to the floor while 
convulsing.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You better kill me quickly then.
You have seconds left.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: Pleash... anti... antidote...?!
Norde pulled a vial from her cleavage.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
After what you did to the Crows,
the world would be a better place without you.

Let's not forget that you're wanted 
dead or alive, so...

Norde stared on, just one tiny movement away 
from opening the antidote vial if so motivated.

title: SP: Norde x Satia A - Draconic Path (13-19)

lines.text: Norde stood in the shadows of the alleyway.
Soon, a set of footsteps joined him.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: Jothram? That your stupid face?

Norde turned his head towards the man, 
creating a shadowed silhouette in his vision.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
Hmph. You know a last minute
meeting like this is gonna cost ya?

I don't care if ya lot are gonna be
moving out first thing in the morning...

You're dealing with the illustrious
'Black Fang'. You play by my rules.
Norde started to step out the shadows, if partially.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Jothram won't make it today.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: Ah...! A... a beast?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I will give you one chance.

We can end this diplomatically.

Without issue. Without blood being spilt.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
After all, I can provide the info you want on the 
Nightless Crows in place of Jothram.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: G- Guards!

A few armed men swarmed in from the alleyway 
entrance.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

I need your answer.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
As if I’d listen to pleas for diplomacy from a savage 
like you!

What did you do to Jothram?! 
A beast like you... could you have...?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then I'll be magnanimous.

 
One more chance.

I work within parts of the Crows that put me in a 
position to give you more information than Jothram
ever could.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
W- What?

You're trying to tell me that THE Nightless Crows 
would bother with a lizard?

Try a believable lie!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You may believe whatever you wish.
But it is the truth.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Last chance to make a deal.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: I only make deals with people!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then there's your answer.
Norde smiled wickedly.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
Now what did you do to Jothram, you beast?!

Tell me, and I’ll consider putting you down quick!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We Nightless Crows are a rather...

unforgiving bunch, you see.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: For traitors...? Hmm...

Norde gave a light belch, and a slight spark of fire 
came along with it.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text: T- The hell...?

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
You fuckin' lizard... 

You really did eat the bloke, didn't you?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
*Soft chuckling*...

"Lizard" would be the wrong word.

There can't be that many creatures you know of 
that can breath fire, can there?

You remember the old legends. 

The 'beasts' that took armies to fell.

You didn't really think they truly
ever entirely went away, did you?

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
No... it can’t be. 
You must be bluffing.

Norde puffed out his chest and began inhaling 
deeply.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
It has to be some kind of trick.
You won’t fool me twice. 

Guards! Put down the beast!
The guards began to advance cautiously.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text:
Boss, I’m not sure about this. 
You think it could really be a...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Inhales slowly*...

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.text: Eep! Fuck this shit!

The guards sprinted away, narrowly avoiding the 
flames.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Low-hum growling*...

Norde stood there with steam rising from his 
breath.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text:
T- The town guard?! H- Help! 
You need to kill this beast!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Feel free to try. I'm a quick eater.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oo~! That was a good one. 
You can still see the heat rising.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Never doubt my hand for showmanship, 
my fair lady.

Rowan and Satia were hidden on a nearby roof, 
with Rowan's magical heirloom in hand.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Oh... I feel so... famished.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: F- Fine! I- I'll make a deal! DEAL!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
To see a sliver of reason, but not to satiate me... 

Oh, that hunger.

My hunger.

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: I’ll agree to any deal you want! J- Just don’t kill me!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anything?

lines.speaker: Black Fang
lines.text: ANYTHING!!!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good. You can see true reason, in the end.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Now listen carefully, or I’ll dine on your bones 
tonight...

After hearing and agreeing to Norde’s demands, 
the Fang finally scampered off.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That went better than expected.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Yep. And it's thanks to you, again.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Shower me not with compliments, 
o’fiery dragon and lady of fine repute, 
for I merely set the stage.
It was your inspired plan and performance 
that truly gripped the crowd.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It was breathtaking.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It worked, at least.

We still had to rely on your heirloom. For that, 
thanks is obligatory.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Such a sincere word to be directed
towards me!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: So what do you want for helping?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
These words showered upon me give flight to my 
heart, and give me reason enough to indulge.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Though...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Just get on with it. 

What do you want? A favor?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You have struck at the heart of the matter.

A sympathetic ear should I ever need such a favor 
would be much appreciated.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I think we can do that.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Must you speak for me?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Then your answer would be?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I... think we can do that.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Giggle*...

title: SP: Norde x Satia A - Merged paths

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Now, it wasn't so bad in the end, was it?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It wasn’t the method I would have preferred...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
But all things considered, 
I suppose it could have ended worse.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Oo~ The valiant, heroic Norde admits being wrong?

What world is this?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Have your moment. We've done well enough to 
enjoy it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
...

Okay, now you're actually starting to worry me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It has been a while since I've felt this sort of 
satisfaction. 

Not since... 

Not since Ivan...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
...

I think he'd be proud of how you've grown.

For all the complaints and dour stares, you've 
managed to make your situation into a good thing.

You'd never have done that before.
You'd have pushed forward stubbornly 
no matter what with your normal tactics.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You've grown yourself.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Your plan was well developed.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A... manageable recklessness.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh? Such high praise for this hotblooded lady.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It was annoyingly well developed, even. 

Almost...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Almost calculated... haha...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Conventional tactics would've caused problems that 
your plan didn't.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It... posed an efficient compromise of ideals, 
I would say.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: To think the day would come.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
So are you going to stop belittling every idea I 
bring up now?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Are you going to stop treating my approach like it 
has no merit?
They both opened their mouth at the same time.

lines.speaker: Both
lines.text: "No deal."

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Someone's got to keep you in line.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I'm the one that should be kept in line?

The two shared a soft laugh together as the night 
went on.

And into that dark, went the discussions of plans 
for horizons yet traveled.

title: SP: Pup x Otis C - First

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm... Four... Five...?

I was shifting through the money that Norde had 
given us for supplies.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah, that should be enough.

We can be quick about this and-

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
He-ey-ey~! Look at that, laddylassie-loo!

That booty! The woman is packed!

I turned my head to my... assigned and 'not my 
choice' partner for the supplying expedition.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Otis... my dear ally... do please remember... we are 
here for supplies...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ah... The way the booty bounces~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Please stop gawking at women so... predatorily...
I tried to whisper it.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh? Gawkin' at the women? What are ya on 
about?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I'm talkin' about that coin purse.

The way it jiggles and jingles... Divine.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
It wounds me to think of ya jumping to such... 
depraved assumptions, lad.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then why are you even telling me about it?!
My attempts to whisper were starting to fail.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: You keep lookout while I see to her losin' it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm... I'm not gonna lie to the guards, you know?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh. Nothin' criminal 'bout findin' a "lost item".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did you seriously just actually use air quotes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're doing this on purpose. How are you not 
kicked off the supply run work schedule yet?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh.

Otis raised his fingers into a 'V' shape around his 
mouth.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Must be my silver tongue.

Otis said as his tongue flapped about in a 
blunt, suggestive manner.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... Let's just make this quick.
I started to walk briskly to the market stalls.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Why do it quickly when we can go all night long?!
Otis yelled after me.
And I decided to speed up my walking pace.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heheh...

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Ladies. Fine day we're having.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay, so I'm no-

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
May I interest you in some bread? It's as fresh as 
the morning harvest!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah... That's what we were looking for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Specifically, we wanted a lot for our mercenary 
group. Could we get a bulk discount?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Eh? My bread is worth every bit of money it takes 
to buy it. I do have my pride.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're not the only breadmaker in town.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
You know what? How about I give a free sample to 
show what I mean?

Consider it a gift for the most beautiful ladies to 
pass through this town.

The merchant extended his hand with a slice of the 
bread.

Its aroma caused me to flinch in delight.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Got a good sniffer on ya?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... I- I mean... How much were you wanting to 
sell-

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ah! That's a good slice!

Otis had taken a bite without it even leaving the 
man's hands.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Nice an' fluffy. Really gives a nice texture with that 
flavor.

With this taste... dis using imported soil for the 
growin'?

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Ah... What a fine palate you've got.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ai. Merchant family and all. I've heard all the tricks 
of these trades.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
But you know what? I've never seen how the... 
process... is done.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: I... Hmm...

The merchant eyed over Otis, who had started to 
lean in a slightly suggestive manner.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
I... will gladly give a bread connoisseur a tour of my 
atelier.
Otis's lips curled into a devilish smile.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Wait outside, puppy-lad.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Watch the stall and make sure no "lost items" are 
found.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... What? Or... Okay...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(He sure is taking his sweet
time...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Finally, what was taking so-

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Lad, grab those bags of bread. I cut a deal with the 
merchant. It takes care of most of ya list there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How much did you...?
Something on Otis's face caught my eye.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, Otis. You've got something on your...

(Lip? Something a bit... off-white...?)

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: *Licks lips*

And it went away before I could think about it 
more.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What did you... do...? Do to him?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Relax, laddy-pup.

I just told him about the time we wiped the floor 
with a dragon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dragon?! But we never killed a dragon?!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: 'Drag on' these nuts in his face!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: High to the five seas?

Otis held his hand up high. I did not slap his hand 
and walked past.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Eh. Tough crowd, are ya?

In front of me, there was a stall of sausages. The 
smell reached my nose and my stomach began to 
growl.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe we can use those savings to increase our 
meat supply?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Sausages, eh?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not a fan of the idea?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Oh, it’s not that. It's that I tend to prefer a thick 
and long...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Cucumber!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Get ya mind out of the gutter, lassie-loo!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

To eat.

You prefer cucumbers over sausages... to eat?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Well... is because it would take one cucumber to 
satisfy me.

But it'd take 3 sausages to completely fill me up, if 
you catch my drift. Hehehe...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why did I ask?

After a long day, we managed to complete our 
shopping list.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... I'm tired. And parched.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Feeling thirsty? I know the perfect bit of white 
liquid to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Goddess's undergarments!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Could you please stop with these constant 
innuendos?!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: What? I was talking about the milk I stole-

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Oh...uh....was 'gifted' to me from the merchant.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
T- That doesn't make it better. Not any less... 
vulgar.

We're not on your pirate ship at the moment.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
And so what? Do I have to act like a proper dainty 
lady?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Cuz that'd mean I got to be able to take a nice 
solid cock, yeah?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
If ya offering advice on how to behave, do show 
and tell!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you...?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Do ya really care if I make the jokes?

Or do ya just not want to think about that stuff?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
N- No... I...

Weren't you nobility or rich at some point? You 
know... You know it's just p- plain inappropriate...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: For what? A lady to talk like that? Just say it, lad.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Because I have breasts means I can’t swear?

Because I have a pussy means I can’t talk about 
women’s bountiful asses?

Because I am short means I can’t have a drinking 
contest with the boys?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I do get ya, lad.

My own life drastically changed one day. I lost my 
family, my business, and my 12 inch cock.
I raised an eyebrow at the cock measurement.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
It isn't easy never being to escape the topic, truly.

Everythin' starts seeming inevitable. Including what 
sort of person ya are and will be.

But the thing about a laddie becoming a lassie is 
that they still get to decide what sort of lassie 
they'll be.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Includin' ones that can take them nice solid cocks.
I flinched at that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Otis... Please...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Like I said, I get ya.

Otis reached out his hand to offer it for 
a handshake.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Parley, yeah? I'll try to give ya a break, laddie-lass.

Just don't forget to choose what sort of lassie ya 
become.

By the damned stars, it might even be a laddie if ya 
can manage it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Will do. I'll make sure I will.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Good on ya.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Time to head back before that 'freshest' bread 
goes stale?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sure. We could even head back by the docks. 
Some ships are probably arriving in port about now.

(I imagine he'd like that?)

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Oh, you sure know me, lad.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: How did you know I love seamen?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You said-

But Otis had already scurried away snickering.

His voice barely reached me.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: I only said I'd 'try'!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Goddess... damn it...

title: SP: Charlotte x Mariel A - Begining

lines.text:
Charlotte adjusted her gear, fixing it in place.

With tightened straps, her hand lowered down to 
pat one of her Lockhart developed handguns in its 
holster.

A small exhale accompanied the motion, and her 
tense posture relaxed a little.

But with the relaxation, she saw her ears adjust in 
the mirror looking back at her.

She breathed in.

And out...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...and then you'll need to use the power cell 
directly on the chest.

It will...

lines.speaker: Medic
lines.text: Right... Yeah...

Mariel was explaining a potentially life saving 
procedure that she had refined.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...so you have to be precise. It can be the 
difference maker.

While I am gone, you will need to-
Footsteps interrupted her, and Mariel turned.
Mariel turned back to the Lockhart based medic.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
And while I am gone, remember... we all do our 
part to help each other thrive.

The city is still reeling, so never forget how much of 
a difference every action you can take can be.

lines.speaker: Medic
lines.text: R- Right... No pressure then.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Good luck while you're in charge.

The medic pumped herself up as she headed off to 
work.

Charlotte's footsteps accompanied her effort to find 
her way to Mariel's side.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Are you ready?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah... So it's time then?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah.

Both of the sisters turned towards the camp 
exit. 

They faced it, and they tried to control their 
breathing.

They closed their eyes...

And took breaths slowly but surely.

In and out, preparing the self for the moment to 
come.

And... their eyes opened.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It's that time.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah.

Time to say goodbye.

Bells rang across the Covenant church grounds.

And with it, the large wooden doors of the building 
creaked open.
The two sisters turned to each other and...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Even with the rubble around... this city still feels 
nostalgic.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah, like home.

Mariel nodded in agreement, and Charlotte let her 
take the lead as they made their way to their next 
destination.

The faint sound of a bark could be heard, so Mariel 
turned into an alleyway.
...only to see a coyote scampering away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
An opportunist species, right? We should be... 
more...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sis...?

Mariel had started to approach an even fainter 
sound.

The sound of a small, injured bird.

Bellowing what little sound it could into chirps of 
pain.

Charlotte turned towards the alley entrance to try 
to call for help, but she was met with the 
lowering sun instead.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That time already...

It's not that long until-

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Puff*!

Mariel slapped her cheeks a little and jumped into 
action.

Quickly pulling out some of her supplies, she 
kneeled down around the small bird.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...not that long... until... sunset...

Charlotte finished her sentence, but the words 
trailed off to a whisper as she did.
She stepped to the side, and she chose to wait.

lines.speaker: Bird
lines.text:
...

*Chirp chirp*...!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
*Giggle*

I'm happy you're better too, little guy.

lines.speaker: Bird
lines.text: *Chirp*~

The bird tweeted melodically.

But soon enough it flapped its wings and took off.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Be safe, will you?

Mariel rose to her feet and turned towards 
Charlotte.

With a smile and nod each, the two were back on 
their way.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
...and then, Charlotte looked like she was about to 
cry.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I- I wasn't...! It was a harrowing experience!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You never had a secret like mine, so...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
But it was adorable.

I could just imagine how Mom would've reacted.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: How she is reacting...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah.

The two turned their heads to the precipice of the 
hill.

A place where two stones stuck out of the ground.

Two stones with names on them.

Two gravestones.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm sure they're watching and have enjoyed our 
shenanigans.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Our stupid little choices. All that immaturity.

It must have looked so silly looking at it from afar.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I can just imagine their faces through it all.

The two laughed softly together.

But their faces shifted to one more serious.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

And there's something we wanted to tell you.

I don't know how you two would react, but... this 
isn't an ask, either.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah. We came to a decision. Together.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Lockhart needs to change.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It has so much potential.

The city has some great people. People that can 
do great things as a people.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I think... No, we think you both would've liked 
them, if you had the chance to truly know that 
city.
Charlotte's ears twitched a little with a sense of joy.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
We want to create a city that works for the city 
itself. For its people.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And we know it won't be easy. Many will oppose it.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Many of those in power won't want to give that 
up.

They'll fight it to the bitter end.

...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: But... so will we. It'll work out. We know it will.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If we fight for the people, we fight for the city 
itself.

It's a source of power and motivation that can 
never have its flame extinguished.

What we seek... What we seek is inevitable.

No matter what roadblocks we encounter... no 
matter what barrier must overcome...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Lockhart will have a shining future.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I can't wait to see it one day.

And for us to show it to you, Mom and Dad.

The two turned to each other with smiles on their 
faces before rising to their feet.

Approaching the gravestones, they both put their 
hands tenderly on them.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Goodbye, and...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: ...and until we meet again.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah.

The two turned, and they started their descent 
along the hill.

The two gravestones stayed there in the setting 
sun as though giving farewells as well.

And to their side... 

...sat a smaller, third stone among the grassy 
hillside.

A third gravestone.

lines.speaker: Bird
lines.text: *Chirp*

A familiar tweeting sound passed along the sight of 
the setting sun.

And a small bird landed on this third gravestone.

One it nestled itself upon.

As both greeted the night together.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm~...

Charlotte rose the glass to her lips, taking in the 
crisp smell of the tea.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah... Just the right amount of sweet.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You really have always known how to pick them, 
Kara.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I thought you would enjoy this
blend.

Did you happen to see the daily special for our 
snack? It has a strawberry on top.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
This is starting to feel like that time from freshman 
year.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Or... Uh... my freshman year, I mean. When we 
went to a place with a strawberry dessert.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I do remember such a place.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Was that a strawberry cake then, too? Just 
thinking about the taste is so nostalgic~

Charlotte’s beaming smile met a waitress delivering 
three slices of the strawberry cake.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do not believe you actually were able to sample 
the cake that day.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? Of course I did.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I can still remember the kick of the strawberry’s 
flavor.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then perhaps you went back another day?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, I wouldn’t do that to you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I would describe it as the only possibility.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Why is it so hard for you to believe? Wasn’t that a 
fun day for you, too?

Kara adjusted herself and more directly faced 
Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Well... The odd thing about that day...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Do you remember our outing when you got lost 
and I had to arrange for you to be picked up?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Y- Yeah... I was a freshman and got lost in a big 
new city.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- What... What are you getting at?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It was the very same outing.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Such a memory would be hard to form, no?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We went back later...? Or maybe another shop had 
a...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
None of the above are applicable to our outings.

In fact, this shop itself is a recently opened branch 
of that same little café. It is a specialty offering.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: S- Sorry...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
No need to apologize.

More than anything, I am delighted to see the 
mysterious ways memories can work.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Still...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
If you wish to replicate the happy memory, I would 
be delighted to assist.

Charlotte’s neck creaked a foreboding screech as it 
turned.

And turned to place her eyes squarely on the third 
part of this group.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
They say the strawberry shouldn’t taken lightly for 
one’s figure.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Or... so I am told?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Haha... I can imagine some girls feeling self-
conscious over it.

Another creaking sound.

Charlotte’s eyeline slowly turned away from the 
thing to her side.

Before her now was... Kara, again.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well, it wouldn’t be the first time I did something 
stupid.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Remember that time I accidentally negotiated a 
trade deal in the middle of a class?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do. It caused quite a stir at the contract signing 
when the story was told.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Imagine trying to tell someone about how you 
wrote out tariff rates on a napkin. I doubt 
even you’ve had to do that before, Kara.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Haha, I might have to think on that, yes.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I do not believe I’ve heard this one before, actually.

Who was it with?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
One of the city states from the East Auran Alliance, 
should I recall it correctly.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... Yes, there was that one boy in the academy 
at the time.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Charlotte, am I remembering correctly?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Charlotte?
Charlotte took in a deep breath, and then exhaled.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah, something like that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Kara, how about that time we went to that one 
sweets store just outside of-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, sweets once more.

Such an interesting topic...

Rowan was inching his hand and body over to pilfer 
the still uneaten strawberry atop Charlotte’s cake.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Or... there was that time we went to that 
restaurant...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You may need to be more specific.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well, there was... was that...

Charlotte’s eyes were jumping to Rowan’s 
presence.

To his hand inching towards her plate as he acted 
like he wasn’t noticed.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That time... that...

...

Closer and closer...

Until...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Get your damn hands away from my cake!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You merely needed to say...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And could you shut up for once?! Stop acting like 
you’re Alexei.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... That may be... difficult?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: My friend, we have been over this topic before.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You’re not Alexei, so you can’t just have my food!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Wait... Does that not imply that I could have the 
berry should I be labeled as ‘Alexei’?

Kara! We must make haste to a courtroom to keep 
this verbal contract valid!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I wouldn’t give it to him either!

Charlotte swiped the strawberry up and quickly 
dumped the entirely thing into her mouth.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Violently, Audibly Chewing*...!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... No recompense from a judge could replace 
this empty feeling I have...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I... I jwust nweed two...

...

AWAHWAHAW...!

Charlotte jumped to her feet and stormed away 
from the scene, still smashing the strawberry into 
nothingness within her mouth.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is a shame she hasn’t come to terms with it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Such is the state of things.

Her path is her path, and I am not one to judge it 
regardless of my position within.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am sure everything will work out in the end, at 
the pace most appropriate.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Hmm...?

So you choose the path where you have no actions 
to take or effort to exert?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Haha... There may be some... indisputable truth to 
that.

Rowan lowered his finger to take a dollop of icing 
off Charlotte’s mostly untouched slice of cake.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Could one truly blame me? When it offers an extra 
serving of aftermeal sweets as so?
The icing covered finger slid betwixt his lips.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... As deliciously chosen as ever, my ever lovely 
Lady Kara.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Say that again.

Charlotte was staring daggers at a member of the 
Crows.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Uh... w- well... Like I said, we exceeded our 
operations budget by about 5% this month.

And... uh... Yeah. Still just that.

Charlotte felt around for her holstered fire arm. 

Half ready to shoot the messenger.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How... dare you...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: W- What...?
Charlotte breathed in deeply.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah...
Rowan winced from the sharp pain in his ears.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That was...?

His head turned around the corner to see Charlotte 
yelling at a member of the Nightless Crows.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Haha... I imagine Norde will be hearing about this 
soon enough.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Is the stress getting to her?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Is it... related to... me?

Rowan sighed a dramatic sigh. One that acted like 
it wanted to be heard.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Alas, no savior to my rescue.
He continued to observe Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...and ANOTHER thing...!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It doesn’t truly matter who she believes I am, does 
it? I cannot say that I care.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah... I have an idea.

Oh... happy day.

Happy days to come, for her and me~

I gritted my teeth. I forced myself to continue 
walking.

My arms felt as though they were on fire.

But I wouldn’t dare admit that aloud.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Especially... with HER around...)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What’s wrong? Do you need some help?

Charlotte had turned around to see me carrying the 
shopping bags.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah... Let me check something.

With a smirk, Charlotte pulled a bag and lifted it up 
over her shoulder.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey... I’m fine, you don’t need to...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Could’ve fooled me, with all that grunting and 
wheezing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I’m just... a bit winded. I did sword training in the 
morning.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And I did some shooting practice.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Ever try to use a bow that can penetrate armor? 
Think of the draw weight that needs.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I am well aware. I grew up around a band of 
mercenaries, remember?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
One would think a mercenary kid would understand 
physical limits better.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It’s... You know it’s only...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It’s the curse. It’s been hitting me harder than 
normal today...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not that you deserve that much of an explanation.

With a huff, I had closed my eyes and turned my 
head away to prepare myself for another teasing 
blow.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Then you’ll be fine resting for a bit.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: While I... uh...
She cleared her throat.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...answer the call of nature...

With hastened, muffled words hidden behind the 
distraction of a beaming smile... 

The ever delightful princess gingerly ducked around 
a corner towards a nearby shop.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sure... I’ll...
She exited my sight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I’ll watch your bags.

...

...............

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *SIGH*...!

I collapsed against the alley wall with my 
exasperated exhale.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Thank the Goddess... My arms felt like they were 
about to fall off.

Slinking further down into a sitting position, my 
eyelids felt heavy.

I left them drift closed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe just...

(...a little... nap...)

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: ...look what we have here...

My eyes creeped open and the light was obscured 
by several silhouettes.

Silhouettes of...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(People)

(Young adults)

(Young men)

(Thugs)

...
I jumped to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: E- Excuse me? Who are...?

As my senses came back to me, I found myself 
surrounded by a group of five men around my age.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: What’s a pretty girl like you doing all alone here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Girl?

The thug raised his eyebrow, and his friends behind 
him also chuckled.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Wait? Me!? I’m no girl!

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: Ha! Funny one.

The entire group laughed along, unclear if they 
found it funny or were following the guy’s lead.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
Come on, now. No way someone as cute as you 
could be a guy.

You’ll have to try harder than that to get rid of me, 
babe~
He pressed closer, and his size became imposing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(The Goddess’s underpants... have I shrunk that 
much? Was I always this... this...)

The thug had slammed his hand against the wall 
inches from my face.

He leaned in, and the whole ordeal had 
shocked me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hah! I’m not “your babe”, you creep!

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
How about we start with introductions? 
Your name?

He smiled that creepy smile, and I felt like punching 
him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (My arms still feel...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (If it was just him, I could, but...)

My eyes scanned the full group of five blocking all 
my exit paths.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Anton. Anton Baranov.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
Pft... Pretty masculine name for a pretty thing like 
yourself, no?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Almost like it’s a name for a guy. 
Like I told you, moron.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
Eh? Well... I guess you are a bit disheveled for a 
chick...

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
Eh? Well... I guess you are a bit flat chested for a 
chick...
He paused, scanning me lecherously.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: Heh. Never been with a tomboy before...

He started twirling a finger in the air, before 
leaning in and sniffing.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: Hm... Lilac? What a nice smell.
I closed my eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (This isn’t happening...!)
A hand cupped my cheek.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: G- Get away from me!

I went for a kick to the groin...!

But...

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: Been there, done that.

He closed his knees to trap my leg before it could 
make contact.

lines.speaker: Thug Grunt
lines.text:
Haha! Boss got them moves!

Ladykiller there!

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: Heh. Yeah. That ain’t gonna work on me, babe.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Then how about this!?

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: Argh!

A shopping bag came crashing down hard over his 
head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (An opening!)

I dived forward through a gap between the men!

With a somersault and springing myself to my feet, 
I was away from the wall.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte?!

She winked at me as she started to spin another 
bag into a mini-tornado.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Now who’s next, you filthy shit-eating perverts!?
So a thug brilliant volunteered as he lunged at her.
Like a flail, the bag smashed down onto his head.

lines.speaker: Thug Grunt
lines.text: The hell’s sort of arm does that chick got?!
The lead thug rubbed his head and stood up.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
That’s assault, you bitch! I could call the guard on 
your for that!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh do try.

Gonna have to get past my friend ‘La Tornade’ 
here first, though.

She brandished the high momentum and spinning 
bag at the thug.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
Oh, ya gonna take on all five of us with just two of 
you bitches?

With her smirk withering just a touch, Charlotte’s 
eyes shifted to me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (She’s not confident about our odds, either...)

Both us knew we couldn’t just brute force way out 
of this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I got to try something... I got to try...)

I closed my eyes in concentration. 
Searching for an answer.

Anything I could just say to help.

Then a memory popped into my head.
And it all clicked into place.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hahaha...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: HAHAHA!

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: What the...? W- What’s so funny?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The absurdity of it!

To think... you’d fall for my very first trap!

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text: T- Trap?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You’d have to be blind to not see the reports...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: “Group of thugs harass young women”

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You’re infamous in the wrong places to be 
infamous.
I saw the group’s lead take a step back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Did you really expect to find a noblewoman 
defenseless and alone? With no protection in the 
wings?

lines.speaker: Thug Grunt
lines.text:
A- A noble?! B- Boss, should we really be doin’ 
this?!

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
S- Shut it! Don’t let her fool you so easily, boys. 
She ain’t no noble.

Just look at her.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Such hope you’ve given... to something so easy to 
prove.

I reached into my equipment and pulled out...!

My locket!

lines.speaker: Thug Grunt
lines.text: Shit... Is that an heirloom?

It may have been a trick of the light, but the locket 
almost looked like it was glowing.

Like it was prepared to protect me.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
Noble bitches or not, ya still fucking assaulted us. 
You got no proof we did shit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Haha... So we bow down to a simple ‘word against 
word’ with the guard?

Oh, I wonder, I wonder... whose word they would 
believe?

I plastered the haughtiest look I could on my face, 
all the while jingling the locket for emphasis.

lines.speaker: Thug
lines.text:
FUCK!

Run boys! We’ve been had!

The gang of thugs sprinted down the alley and 
disappeared around a bend.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: GAHH!!!

The tension released from my body and my heart 
stopped pounding as hard.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Actually a brilliant play there from our little pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What? Oh that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just... made that up.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It was actually a pretty convincing argument.

Maybe a tad melodramatic, but it was better than I 
could’ve come up with on the spot. And I’m an 
actual noble.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, that’s... not entirely true.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You have very convincing... fists...

lines.speaker: Both
lines.text: *Laughing*...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I suppose so. Maybe I should try them out more 
often?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: On... uninformed targets, of course.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Guess we’ll chalk this one up as a team effort.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean... I would’ve clobbered them too if it wasn’t 
for this curse...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I’m sure you would’ve.

As I locked eyes with Charlotte, she looked like she 
looked at me wistfully.

There wasn’t any condescension in her tone, 
for once.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don’t worry. I’ll protect you if any others show up.
She put a hand on my shoulder reassuringly.
And retracted it just as swiftly.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A- As I would do for anyone.

I just hate those damned handsy creeps, you 
know?

You even get them in court events and fancy 
parties.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah, yeah. I can imagine.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Though, maybe we should get going before any 
witnesses actually do call the guards.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That would get them killed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What if I... grease the ground?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Wouldn’t that assume you have a jar of grease on 
hand at any given moment?

Norde and I had been discussing tactics. 

Between us was a board meant to represent a 
battlefield. One with tiles representing enemies, 
allies, terrain, and objectives.
I had, at multiple occasions, slipped up and referred 
to it as a game in front of Norde.
Norde was not amused.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You know, Rowan might.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Carry around a jar of grease, I mean.
Norde just rose an eyebrow.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then you gamble on luck alone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay... fine.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How about I skirt the enemy’s range with the 
tank?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Without getting into the logistics of measuring 
that...

Let’s assume you can bait attacks. It would still be 
inefficient.

What if that gives time for reinforcements to arrive? 
Or we wear out our troops?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
More importantly, you are giving the prerogative to 
the enemy to execute their own strategies.

Ambushes, group rushes...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I get it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then how about sending our strongest ally in to 
wear down the enemy?

When they’re weak, we can send in reinforcements 
to finish them off.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
That’s... slightly more efficient. 
Only slightly, though.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: At least you’re taking the initiative in the battle.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
But mercenaries with no real hands on experience 
against trained units will rust.

Our troops need experience or they will never 
grow. We need real fighting experience for real
mercenaries.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Dad could’ve taken them out by himself, though.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
And heroes like that are rare. They even can die...

Sometimes even the best of us meet tragic ends 
without support.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did you... have to say it like that?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It... is what it is.

And then suddenly a red hair girl popped into 
their perception.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Oh, are you moving figurines around this board?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Are you playing a...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: ...a- a game...?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: I’ll... come back later...

Without moving any muscles above her hip, Jenny 
scurried back to the tent door with a crab walk.

Step by slow step, she shuffled deftly through the 
tent entrance.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*... I need to take a break.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(Yeah, I could use a breather, too.)

We left soon after, leaving the tactics figurines on 
the table.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Have you cooled off as well?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Yeah.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
One must accept the realities of war. Especially 
when others’ lives are in our hands.

As we went to enter the tent, the red-haired girl 
exited the tent.

Our situation distracted us too much to notice who 
it was beyond the hair color.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
To review the scenario we were discussing... 
Bandits here, forest here, and your units here.

How do you proceed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Wrong.

What sort of answer is that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did you look at the board?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: The board?

The figurines were positioned in such a way that I 
had basically won against Norde’s troops. I didn’t 
even need to move them.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You didn’t move these before we left?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

After?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No!

Did you move them?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why would I do that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why would I?!
I gave Norde a stink-eye, but it was paid no mind.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm... Perhaps...?

Norde’s feet were soon moving and out of the 
tent.

Soon enough, Norde returned with a red haired girl 
being pulled along.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: I- I don’t wanna be corrupted~...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde, what are you doing...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
VIP retrieval.

A good skill for a mercenary.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure, I’ll just... write that down...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
C- Compliments won’t make me want you to 
corrupt me more, you know!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I am not doing... whatever that is. I do not even 
know what it means.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Then how do you know you’re not doing it?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: S- Scary...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Tell me about it...

Norde pulled Jenny up from her prone position and 
to her feet.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Did you move the figurines?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Oh! I’m sorry! I didn’t realize they were important!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Show us what you did.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I... I just thought it was a game. So I moved the 
blue pieces so they could win.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Show us... what you... did...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Y- Yes! Sorry!

Jenny scurried over the table with the figurines. I 
had moved them to our previous positions again.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: It wasn’t much. Just a simple idea.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Just capitalize on your units’ movement range and 
set them up in terrain that’s most appropriate to
their class.
Move this guy here... and this one here... and... 
voila!

We both peeked over Jenny’s shoulders to look at 
the endeavor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You didn’t need grease?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: No? Do you bring grease everywhere?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
No.

...

I’ll be right back.
I ducked out of the tent and left the two behind.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: An excellent demonstration...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: “Jenny”

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yes, an excellent demonstration, Jenny.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Pup would do well to learn from you.

Dividing one’s units to cover more ground is 
important.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Do you have something to add?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Just that... Well...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It is fine.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Okay. Then if I may...

Dividing a squad for completion speed can work in 
some scenarios, but not others.

Imagine you are in the middle of the night or in a 
heavy mist.

Spreading out when visibility is not in your favor can 
let an archer or mage pick off allies from a blind 
spot.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Turtling to avoid casualties can be more efficient, at 
times.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A fair point. I may have spoken too generally.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
But... consider this scenario: You are inside a 
fortress.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Visibility is also going to be limited with the twisting
corridors.

How do you make sure you have looted the place 
in as timely a manner as possible?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I’ll admit I have a bit of a bias there. My luck with 
chests is... bad.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
With that being said, I would check if they’re 
trapped or not before looting.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
And before that, shouldn’t you secure the place 
first?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
A dead friend is heavier than any piles of gold we 
can carry.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Right. Of course that’s right...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Ah, no need to feel gloomy~ I’m sure every tactic 
is valid to a scenario out there.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I’m back!
And I was holding a jar of grease.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I got Rowan’s grease!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Like... grease. I’m... sure there’s a good place to 
use that as a tactic.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Everything can be a good tactic if placed well.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Goddess... I feel like I am being talked down to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Any tactic? What about broken weapons?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Why are you... going into battle with broken 
weapons?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh... So I cannot harm the enemy? The battle lasts 
longer and...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That’d be good for... “real fighting experience for 
real mercenaries”?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You know I didn’t mean it like that.

That sounds incredibly inefficient and... put 
bluntly... stupid.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You couldn’t guard with half a blade.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Are your battles THAT long?!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I can’t say I have experience with broken weapons 
during battle.

Maybe that was the demon lord’s influence?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
As much as we maintain weapons, they will 
eventually break with enough wear and tear.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait... “Demon Lord”?!

You mean like Zened the...
I went to point upwards to the sky, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, it’s the middle of the day.
So I... pointed to the ground?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like Zened the Moon?! THE Zened?! THE Moon?!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Uh... I don’t think she was quite as round as the 
moon, I guess?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
But the demon lord I did escape... I just barely 
managed to. By getting sent here... somehow...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey, Norde... What do you... you...

I turned to a Norde that had a dour look of 
contemplation.

Mumbling... Scenarios to counter Jenny’s tactics... 
state of our weapons... Etc.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Is Norde okay?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde will probably be... “fine”.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Eventually...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Oh... is there nothing I can do?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, but maybe there is one thing you could help 
with.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Right, so this is important since many things could 
go wrong if we don’t do this.

...

Do not tell Rowan I stole his jar of grease.

title: SP: Pup x Otisl B - Begining

lines.text: *Chop*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I... I can’t believe I’m doing this.
*Chop*!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ya have a problem with it, lad?
*Chop*!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Don’t see much differentiation between this n’ 
what ya normally do.
*Chop*!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It just... feels wrong.
*Chop*!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...!

Stop talking...

...and more...

...more wood-chopping.

A split log fell to the ground around 
everyone’s feet.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Wood won’t chop itself.

The passing remark came and went as Norde exited 
and left hearing range to continue rounds.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I still don’t see any problem in handlin’ our wood 
together.

I see you handle wood with other folk all the time.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Unless... you’re a laddy-lass that prefers to handle 
their wood alone?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...This.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*... This is what I was referring to.

Do you really still need to be so... unnecessarily 
dirty all the time?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heh, just teasing ya a bit lassyloo.

Nothin’ wrong with two laddies handlin’ some 
mornin’ wood.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just because it’s the morning doesn’t make this 
“morning wood”.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Alas, laddy-lass! I never knew.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I must retrieve my ‘mourning’ wood to cope with 
this stroke of crisis.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... Sometimes I just wanna...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmm...

(Two people... two lads... conflict...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A duel?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh? I don’t know what ya was taught, but take 
your morning wood at your own pace.

A competition may turn it sour.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
A duel in combat. If I win, then you stop all this 
vulgar stuff around me.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh? I guess I haven’t done one in ages. 

People get scared at beating a small girl or gettin’ 
beat by one.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So what’s your ante?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One week’s salary! I’ll give you a week of my salary!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
That’s ya prize pool?

Give me an hour an’ I’ll have more loot than that on 
me own.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Three months.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: U- Uh... Two weeks...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Oh so confident, aren’t ya laddylass?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: One month!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Deal.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Call it a week. In one week at high noon.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Get the grumpy fiend to officiate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Deal...!
One Week Later

I twirled a sword as I stood in the impromptu 
dueling ring.

I breathed in with my weapon ready to strike.

And...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Where is he?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It’s almost high noon already...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(And I’m starting to really... need to go the 
bathroom?)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I have places to be. Why am I even here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: To officiate the duel.

lines.speaker: Fellow Crow
lines.text: Norde. I have a message from Otis.
The Crow whispered into Norde’s ear.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Thank you for the message.

Let's see what it says...
Norde turned my way.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I am leaving. Otis cannot participate and has 
requested a postponement.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So I... I won?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It doesn’t-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Sure.
Norde left as quickly as possible.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yes! Victory!

(No more vulgar shit from that fucking crap mouth 
of his!)

(I can’t wait to rub his shit eating grin in this!)

After looking around for some time, no one had a 
good idea for where Otis was.

But as I passed through a nearby building, that’s 
when I saw him.

Walking slouched with his hands on his stomach.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Urgh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey... So... About the duel...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It’s my win. You were given a forfeit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh... What was that? Right. Cat’s got your tongue.

You can’t say your innuendos anymore~

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Shove it up your end-o, you noisy twat!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sheesh... No need to get that angry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Getting into sore loser territory there.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Just leave, Pup. I... have important matters to 
attend to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Really? That’s your big excuse after all this?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Aren’t you the “do whatever I want” territory’s 
local nobility?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Sure, yeah. Normally...

Not today... Since today...

...rains crimson.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Now leave!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Huh? What are you-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...
A stomach cramp hit me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Okay... yeah... so the meat was expired...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Be... right back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
