(Bathroom, bathroom, bathroom!)

...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Phew...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What? Is... nothing... happening?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Though upfront, something is wet?)

...
I nearly jumped from the seat.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: B- Blood?! Why?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sniff*... W- Why...?

(Is that... a tear?!)

I thought it had to be some evil magical attack.

I tried to think of any time we encountered magic 
like this and...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Ugh! C- Cramp! Getting... worse...!)

(Is this the curse somehow, too?!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Why...)

(Why am I not...? I don't feel normal...)

(Like I’m... broken...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sniff*
*Knock knock*

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
*Clears throat*

Lassie-lad. I’ve noticed you’ve been in the toilet for 
over an hour.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Figured I should check on ya...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sniff*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That’s...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That’s uncharacteristically... nice of you.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ya sound quite the mess for someone that’d won a 
duel today.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I don’t know what’s happening anymore...

Terrible stomachaches... Then I sat down and just 
had... blood... from... yeah...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh. That’s a wickedly awful sense of humor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: That damned Oathbreaker sword whatcha’ma’callit.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Got the nerve to make us have our periods on the 
same day.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: *Sigh*...

I could hear an exasperated Otis loudly lean against 
the bathroom’s door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Period...?

(Oh... Goddess... I didn’t even think of... of that...)

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Normal me woulda bragged about liking something 
long n’ sturdy to pierce me...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: But I just “lost” my joke making privileges.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I, for one, can’t wait to bury my long thick sword 
into Wolf’s behind after he caused all this.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heh. Careful what you ask for, laddy-lass.

But do keep makin’ ‘em jokes for the both of us. I 
love it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Don’t worry about the duel results... I can get why 
you were a no show.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I think there’s a long and hard day ahead of us for 
when we do actually duel...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh? Well, we gotta long and hard day ahead of us 
after I win the duel.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ahaha... Things to look forward to.

title: SP: Satia x Otis B - Begining

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text: *Yawn*... Zzzzzzzz......

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text:
Come on, man. Stay awake. I’m not your damned 
alarm.

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text: ...then... don’t wake... me...

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text:
All ya fuckin’ gotta do is look pretty and make a 
show of it. I’m not getting fired cause you’re that
lazy!

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text:
Then get fired for... waking up the dead... Dealer’s 
choice.

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text: What the HELL are ya on about?!

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text:
I dunno... Got like four hours of sleep... Your 
shrieks are like gunshots...

This herb I’m runnin’ on only helps so much.

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text: Goddess’s underpants, I get the damned druggie!

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text:
Well if it’ll shut you up... Shit ain’t doing anything 
for me.

No night vision... Just makes the ground look like 
the best bed you could get... and...

...and... makes everythin’ smell like vinegar.

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text:
Of for fuck’s sake, I...!

I...

Vinegar? I smell vinegar too.

The guard spun around, and he started blinking 
rapidly.

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text: My eyes... The hell’s wrong with them?!

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text: Heh. Someone picklin’ around here?

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text:
No you dumbass! We gotta check inside. It’s comin’ 
from within!

Grabbing the other guard, the two made their way 
to the entrance.

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text: Ugh... Whatever...

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text: *Cough cough*! What the hell?!

A miasma of gas seeped out from the cracks of the 
sliding heavy door.

lines.speaker: Guard B
lines.text: R- Run... We... gotta...

lines.speaker: Guard A
lines.text: The... hell... I feel... Ugh...!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
By the Goddess with a dick on the side... I knew 
this stuff was good, but not THAT good!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Focus.

As Otis snickered his head off, Satia went to 
inspect one of the fainted men.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Have some fun, Momma. Whatcha even need to 
focus on?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...still breathing. Hmm...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Careful with your pretty face around that 
concoction.

Back in the day, these damned fungi ruined so 
many of the trade shipments that I was itchin’ to 
get sold.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
One time a lad of mine thought burnin’ the shit 
would be good enough to save some of the 
product.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
T’is not his brightest idea... as the result of this 
merry jaunt do show.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: And they are 100% likely to live?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Your bet does depend on it.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heheh...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It’s your ass on the line.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Not yours, Momma?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Just... get inside.

In order to finish preparations, Otis stepped away 
from Satia and did a final inventory of the fungi 
bombs.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh... Would’ve been cheaper to do it the normal 
way. Might not even break even with this...

Otis, as he did inventory, started to eye Satia’s 
bum.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Heh. Somethings money can’t buy.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Now go, my Murder of Crows!

Grab the loot and smash the rest! Ahahahaha!

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Ugh... of course he makes up a name.

The Nightless Crows broke in through the open 
door to find a won battle with smoldering 
remains and knocked out guards.
The fungi bombs had spread effectively and didn’t 
leave one person left to resist.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Argh! Rum this bad is barely worth drinkin’, let alone 
sellin’...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: ...but still fun to break!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...”Galzus Trading Company”...

Satia looked at the box’s logo with little hiding her
disgust. She raised her weapon, and...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
It’s like a shell of its former self.

Not even a shell company for horrid deeds... Just 
ruined to the core even with their products.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
In a sense, your skullduggery tonight is almost an 
admirable goal.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: “Almost”? That hurts, Momma.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Don’t call me that.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Got it twice. Don’t blame me goin’ for triplets.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well, you should go for triplets of tearing down 
these 'rotten to the core' companies.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ya know, I did make it a point to go after ‘em with 
my pirate fellas.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh!? I did, though. Had a shit list knifed to a galley 
wall and everythin’!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
The shite those bastards put me through as soon 
as I wasn’t a long dicked merchant anymore? Fuck 
‘em.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well... you’re not the only one with bad memories 
of noble merchants like this.

Otis stood there as Satia lost herself in the bottle 
smashing. He was content to let her have that 
moment.
Some time passed between each shattering glass.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
...and that’s all the valuables we could snag. Not all 
that much.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ay... Part of the business but sad when it happens 
all the same.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Let’s get before the guards catch on. Ain’t got 
shrooms left for them.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Speaking of the mushroom bombs, there was 
one that didn’t go off.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh? Nice. Might be the most worthwhile thing 
here.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
They seem like they’d be useful for the future, 
too.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Oh? Happy with ‘em?

Not in my normal wheelhouse to get, but I’ll be 
sure to keep my fluffy little ears out for ‘em.

The group headed out, and Otis followed Satia as 
she fled from the scene.

And as they did, Otis decided to speak up.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: And... listen, Satia.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I respect ya keeping stuff close to your bosom. But 
if ya ever need to speak with someone...

As Satia was about to round a corner, she stopped 
and the others stopped with her.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmph.

Satia turned liked a knife through the crowd of 
fleeing Crows.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Why, Otis! Look at you.

Trying to double dip on a bet, are you~?

I thought you wanted to get in my pants, not dig 
into my life story.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Eh?!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
You are quite ‘ballsy’ for a lass... especially after 
such a middling success!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ay! After what you gave me to work with, anyone 
would’a considered that a success!

None of them lot died and we got some loot from 
it!
Otis leaned in as he shifted to offense.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: And if ya seriously wanna make me choose?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Of course I’d want to know if the carpet matches 
that smooth, silky, pin-like-peach drapes!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
W- What? You of all people should know that 
peaches aren’t pink...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: And unlike you, I know how to use a razor...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
And for constructive purposes over destructive 
ones, at that.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh? Then teach me. Ya can wrap your arms 
around me and...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Very funny. Such a jester you are, nekolyn~

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
You know that I love it when you get all hot and 
bothered.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Mayhap you should drop that pack of fungal brain 
rot.

With the curse, can you really risk what’s left?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Pft! If anythin’ the curse has made me smarter! 

So smart that I may be a bonafide genie-us!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Are you just trying to hurt me now?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Heheh~ Consider it foreplay for tonight.

I’ve left many a girl with tears as the night brought 
on the morn’~

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I meant that you were hurting my brain. Was yours 
not enough rot for us both?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: And why would you take that as a compliment?!

Otis grabbed his petite belly and laughed a full 
sounding laugh.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Don’t worry, lassie!

You’ll be takin’ that and more by the time I’m done 
with-

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Argh! The shrooms!?

Otis’s eyes scrambled as he watched the fungi 
bomb pack slip through his fingers.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: *Cough cough cough*!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
*Cough cough*...

Otis, you... stupid... dammit...! *Cough*...!

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
...

Did they forget we were here?

...

*Sigh*... Come on guys.

Guards might still show up soon. Let’s drag ‘em 
outta here...

title: SP: Pup x CHarlotte B - Begining

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: HIYYAA!!!

My sword bounced awkwardly off the dummy’s 
shield, leaving me wide open for a nonexistent 
counterattack.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay, let’s try that again...

I sized up my target and swung with a little more 
caution this time.
And so repeated the result.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh... The hell is wrong with me?
I readied my sword for the third time.
I raised my sword for the follow-through!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*...

(This doesn’t feel right. I’m only getting worse 
results.)

It had been a few hours of this endeavor, and I 
didn’t have much to show for it.

Besides a thoroughly chipped sword.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...
A memory popped into my head.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Stubborn persistence isn’t always the answer. 
Sometimes it's just not meant to be.

If you try another approach, it could be insightful 
on what went wrong, at the very minimum.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (You’re right. That’s almost definitely right.)

I let the damaged sword fall unceremoniously into 
the dirt as I started walking towards the side of 
the training area.
The corner of my eye caught a blur of blonde hair 
in my vision. It turned away from me quickly.

The figure started fiddling with the gun holstered 
on her hip as if pretending to ignore me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Charlotte?

And the princess previously known as a blonde blur 
hesitantly turned her head towards me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: O- Oh... Hello... I didn’t see you there.

She had looked up with a seeming feigned 
confusion, and a tint of blush was waning 
from her visage.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (She’s not sick, is she?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you feeling okay?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What? Of course... Why would you even ask that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, you’re... uh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...acting a bit strangely...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: H- How so?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Because... you “didn’t see me” as I was making a 
lot of noise while training...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
D- Don’t think so highly of yourself. You’re not as 
fascinating as you think.

I blinked a few times. I didn’t know how to process 
that as a response to what I said.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... How long were you standing there?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Not important.

She cleared her throat as she turned to her side 
and avoided eye contact.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You see, I came here to follow up on that tutoring 
I mentioned.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
“Tutoring”...? Oh, do you mean that thing about 
nobility?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Sort of. I had a thought that it’d be good to go 
beyond just that.

We can go over the art of diplomacy itself: rhetoric, 
elocution, and so on.
I found myself blinking in silence again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Are we... speaking the same language? You didn’t 
just make those words up, did you?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oho... So we’ve strained the limits of your feeble 
vocabulary, have we?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (She’s acting like I’m some barbarian...)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Let me just start from the basics. In simpler terms...

I want to teach you to make more sense in 
debates and act more like a dignified, educated 
noble.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But maybe that was misguided.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If you’re too busy whacking hunks of metal with 
other hunks of metal, I’ll be on my way.

Charlotte pointed her pistol at the dummy and 
peered down the sights with a confident smirk.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This all coming from “La Tornade”?

She lowered the gun and looked down with a 
crestfallen expression.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You remember that from last time, then...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Heh... I guess you’re right...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(That’s... Crap. Did I say something too 
insensitive?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know... I was... I was just looking for a change 
of pace anyways.

Charlotte looked over at me without any words 
spoken, but I could see a variety of emotions 
alternating on her face.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So sure. Let’s do this training. It might give me a 
new perspective.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Clears throat*... Then maybe we should relocate 
to my quarters.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It’d be a more fitting venue.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
In conclusion, you’re going to have to learn to rely 
more on wits and eloquence than theatrics.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But why?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Because it fits your personality better.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Persuasion is born from authenticity.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That’ll be the case whether its a sleezy noble telling 
a lie or you advocating for something you’re
passionate about.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What’s wrong with what I did before? Those 
alleyway thugs seemed perfectly well persuaded.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That was more of a matter of “right time, right 
place” for tricking some uneducated common folk.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
With noble education, someone could’ve poked 
enough holes in it to see through it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... guess that makes sense.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Besides... I could tell you were channeling...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...THAT thing...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There’s more to charisma than simple flamboyance.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Presenting a logical argument, for one.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And even if you don’t have a clear logic to give, 
just present it in a compelling way.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Like simply being nice could lead the other person 
to being agreeable.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I’m not sure I follow...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah, of course not.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Here, let’s start by working through some 
roleplaying scenarios and you’ll see what I mean.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And... that’s why it’d be a bad idea to attack us. 
You’d lose too many men.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
But why should I care if I’d lose too many men? It 
means I win.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... Well...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Try to meet the other person halfway. Avoid things 
like... intimidating them like a brute, for example.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So avoid what-

I stopped myself before the key word there.

“You”... “...what you’d do...”

She sat there bracing herself with an expectant 
look on her face.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... avoid what I’d normally do as a mercenary.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hah... Yeah. Something like that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So, Lady Charlotte. You may be able to take the 
land. But you cannot hold it.

The amount of troops you’d lose would make it 
neigh impossible to hold it against a rebellious
populace.
If it really is the resources you want, it would be 
more productive to work with us, the 
local government, instead.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A rocky start to it, but I think you aced the landing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Keep practicing, and you could be pretty good at 
this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks... I think.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(More little jabs here and there. Why can’t she just 
say I did well?)

Ironically, after the training I had just drilled into 
me, my instinct was that I should avoid a 
response to her that was too direct.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I do feel like I’m starting to understand now. I get 
what you were praising in it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
As per the bylaws of Lockhart, I am always right 
after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It’s also a relief to not need to rely on acting like 
Rowan either.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Better to be true to what strengths I have.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Indeed. Every noble man or woman must discover 
their own form of elegance.
As she said as much, a thought came to mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... how did you discover yours?
Charlotte breathed in a deep, lengthy breath.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I didn’t.
And she exhaled.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
As an heir to a city state’s leadership group... I had 
it all forced onto me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And one day I realized I was sick of it.

All the faux charm, all the fake diplomacy worn like 
a mask to cover up selfish manipulations...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I wasn’t true to myself. I eventually threw a lot of 
it away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And even now, I’m still trying to search for the 
approaches that fit me like a glove.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Like... I’ll let myself snap in anger a little more 
than I ever could have imagined before.

Let the Goddess’s judgement deal with the 
enemies I make, haha~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If you hated it so much, then why pass it along to 
me?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Because I saw someone who might resonate with 
it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And... maybe I just didn’t want those years of high 
society crap I went through to go to waste?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah, so that’s the plan. I suffer in your place?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don’t act like you didn’t enjoy it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It... should come in useful. I won't need to 
resort to strong arming as much.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Aggression may not win you many allies, but it helps 
set boundaries.

Now you can try to use the best of both worlds? 
You don’t need to live up to being some 
tough as nails mercenary all the time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(I wonder if I could...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know... 

Maybe I could return the favor?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
My father taught me a lot about intimidation 
techniques he had picked up over time.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Sure, why not?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... so...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One was the idea that you could use their 
imagination against them.

Make a vague threat to make their mind go wild.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Like “you don’t want to know what I’ll do to you” 
or something?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha, not quite.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That comes off like you’re trying too hard.

“You have to be subtle. Lead them to the 
conclusion as if it was their own idea.”

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That... makes a lot of sense. I’d never really 
thought about it like that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Too many words can be bad. Since you want them 
to fill in the blanks with what THEY fear the most.

It can be like an animal feeling. It’s instinct.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Like there was this one time we were 
outnumbered 5 to 1.

The bandit leader approached my father, so he 
stared his down for a good 10 seconds before 
finally saying...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...*whispering*...
She had turned a bit pale.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I wanna try! And whatever else you’ve got!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... W- Well..

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure. Let me just set a scene for you...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: And then you’ll check on the armament.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Right.

Flynn was listening to Norde’s lecture outside the 
supply tent.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We keep a logbook of our stockpile in the tent, so 
be sure to review previous days as well 
for discrepancies.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: R- Right...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Hm?

Reagyn exited from the tent as the lecture went 
on.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
If we’re missing anything, be sure to make note of 
what’s missing so we can track down whoever 
forgot to return theirs.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: And that would be...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Here.

Norde had taken out the stock records 
to demonstrate.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Ah, that’s what you meant.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Hm...
Reagyn was peeking in to look as well.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: It’d be better to note who the offender is, too.
The group halted.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Oh, sis... Greetings.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: My lord.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is there something you need?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: It is natural that I am to assist my lord, no?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Well, I’m not... not yet...

We’re just going over the Nightless Crow procedure 
for doing rounds, really.
Norde turned back to Flynn.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Once you’ve confirmed the stock’s inventory, you’ll 
need to check the status of the weapons.

Check for cracks, chips, sharpness, and the like. We 
require maintenance when it...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Okay, so when-

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
What? That’s irresponsibly dangerous to let your 
equipment deteriorate that much.

Do you mean to get those you are given charge of 
killed?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I do not think you understand the investment that 
comes with keeping equipment pristine for an 
active fighting force.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Sister, I do think-

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
What sort of excuse is that? What sort of example 
are you setting for the people your serve?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Sis, please just-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Do you wish to dedicate your time and money to 
make up the difference then?

Reagyn was unable to respond, and the frustration 
showed on her face.

Flynn just stared his sister’s way as he was left 
speechless by Reagyn’s speechlessness.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then, Flynn, let’s move to discussing emergency 
procedures.

If we’re ambushed, or a nearby village is struck by a 
bandit raid, our armory tent is setup so we can
retreat quickly.
We’ll have a regroup point picked when we setup 
camp and-

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You’d let the villagers die?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Even if we wanted to, we’d still need to regroup.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Then design your weapon storage to allow for a 
quick counteroffensive.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Uh... guys...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We cannot commit to that for every time a similar 
situation arises.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Uh... I just wanted to learn the procedure so I 
could start...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
So is that how you mercenaries operate? You’d 
abandon others?

As Flynn failed to get a word in, he looked down to 
the box of supplies Norde had brought.

It was a kit meant for helping conduct the rounds 
that Flynn was being taught.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: So the first step was...
He reached down and picked it up...

..and walked away without either of the other two 
noticing.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: That should be everything on the supply list.

Flynn worked his way step by step through the trail 
back to camp.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I believe it’d be prudent to get more flour.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: S- Sis...!?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I believe the camp’s menu has been more focused 
on baked goods lately.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Right... Yeah, that makes sense...

And... We’re not too far out of town...

...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: There we go. All done.

Flynn placed the steel helmet down on the ground 
after he finished removing scratches and polishing 
it.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Done?

Reagyn’s head had suddenly popped in through the 
tent opening.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
The armorer at the Coslett household always said 
you should be able to see yourself in them.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Yes. That does sound familiar...

The two stayed quiet as Reagyn seemed to wait 
for Flynn.

And so he reached out to pick up the helmet 
again.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Hragh!
The log split in two and fell to the ground.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
My lord.

...

I believe the split there was off-center. 
It won’t stack well.

When we were taught this before, there was one 
technique that helped keep it more consistent.

Reagyn began to move into position 
to demonstrate.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: It’s not... that bad.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Hm... I still think it isn’t ideal.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Right. Of course it is.

Flynn moved to place another log in a position to 
cut.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Then...

Hragh!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Agh...

The axe swung and kicked the edge of the log. It 
cut, but it was so off center that it was more 
damaging than not.
...

........

..............

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Yes, of course. I’m sorry I didn’t listen, sister.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
It all comes so naturally to you... of course you’d 
know best.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

I think you can be a great lord. I think there’s so 
much good you could do.

I just think you need just a little more of a push 
here and there.

Little adjustments could go a long way in making 
things better for everyone involved.

My lord. I mean no disrespect. I only mean to help 
you be the best you that you can be.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Right... It’d be bad if a lord couldn’t chop a log...

Couldn’t swing a sword... cast a spell...

Flynn picked up his axe and positioned it like he 
was going to do a horizontal swing.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Couldn’t...!
The axe smashed into the side of the log.

Flynn lost his grip on the axe and it, along with the 
log it stuck itself within, went flying off to the side 
of the scene.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
*Sigh*...

It’d be bad if a lord couldn’t do anything right...

He slumped to the ground with an exhausted 
exhale.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Yes, that would be bad.

People depend on their lords.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
...

Can I be alone?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: My lord, I think that we shouldn’t-

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Please.

I just...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: I just need a second to regroup on my own.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Of course, my lord.

If there is any assistance you need, I will be sure to 
be at the ready to help.

Reagyn dismissed herself respectfully and began 
walking back towards camp proper.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: *Sigh*... It’s always the same, isn’t it?

Flynn leaned back and laid on the ground as he 
looked towards the sky.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Haha... If I wilt so easily now, how will I fare as a 
Lord?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Dammit...

title: SP: Pup x Norde B - Begining

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A letter for Norde?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Yeppers. Dropped off just recently.

Wasn't the typical sort of delivery person either, so
be careful with it.

Could've come from a sketchy source over a friendly
one.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde doesn't have friends, just associates.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Uh... Sure. Just giving you a heads up.

My fellow Nightless Crow bid his farewell before
heading off.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (A letter for Norde?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's not like an arrest warrant or something...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(No, it couldn't actually be from a friend...?! Could
it...?)
A sense of morbid curiosity washed over me.
I had to know.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A letter?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It was handed off to one of our guys earlier today.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You... uh... expecting some correspondence from a
friend?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Hmm...

Unlikely.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Not many would claim me as a friend, I suspect. More
often it would be an acquaintance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's what I said!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A- As a joke...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Please just hand it over.

Norde reached out to grab the envelope, but I 
pulled it away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...! Ah ah ah! Not quite!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Playing the hand I was dealt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I wanna know the contents.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You just said it wouldn't be a friend, so I can't be
anything too intimate to share, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're going to kill me with curiosity if you don't, at
this rate.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It is safe to assume you'd read it yourself anyways if
I refused?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, no.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'd get an audience, too.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Very well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Great, now we can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah!

As my guard fell, Norde snatched the envelope 
from me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Wait, this wasn't the deal...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Do not worry. I will read it out loud.

The sound of paper filled the silence as he opened 
the letter.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
'Dear Mr. North, we hope you are doing well...'

'It has been some time since we've seen you, and 
we hope our previous letters had arrived safely...'

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: 'We are-'...'We are'....

Norde stumbled on the line a few times as a 
surprised expression overtook his face.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh? Why'd you stop? Who is the letter from?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It is from a group of children I once saved from a 
life threatening situation.

...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I believe I'll need to take a leave of absence soon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That... was a out of left field.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Often times... peace is earned through heroics...
'happily ever afters' are beyond the grasp of most.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Even for vulnerable children.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Then I'll come, too.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You do not need to. This is my responsibility.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I insist in every way I can.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
After all, what's the point of trying to get strong if
you can't use that strength when the need 
presents itself?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Indeed.
Paralogue Unlocked: "Beauty or Beast"

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... shit! I'm late, aren't I?!

Bursting out of my tent, I almost tripped 
over myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course Rowan had to schedule a sparring 
match for an inane time...
I had been busy with logistical prep for the Crows.

More specifically... I had been having our logistical
needs drilled into me by Norde.

An orange blur rose from the corner of my vision to
encapsulate all the sight in front of me.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Sir... Or ma'am? I... Anton?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: O- Oh... Hey. 'Pup' is fine.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ("Sir"...? I thought she hated my guts?)

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Such seems... inappropriate for one acting as a
provisional leader, but if you insist.
Reagyn stood back and cleared her throat.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Then, Pup. I have a report that is important for the
group's leadership to be aware of.

Since I have started working within this system, I 
have made notes of a handful of startling poor 
practices being used.

Reagyn pulled out a notebook. One that was 
spilling out clusters of notes at its edges.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's a "handful"?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: In particular, the logistical side is lacking.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, more logistics?!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- Why not ask Norde? Norde has been our
logistical expert for... a time?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I did.

Norde mentioned that you "should act like a leader 
and listen to the feedback".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, such a jokester.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm more the "lead the charge into battle" type of
leader.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
If the problem is a lack of experience, then we better
get started now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Shit... this is gonna take forever, isn't it?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm actually organizing sparring matches right this
moment... so how about we resume this wonderful 
talk after?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Hmm... I WAS wanting to check on the quality and
organization of training...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Though... Wait, I had that paperwork deadline
looming, too. When was that...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah shucks. Sounds like you're busy! We'll have to
reschedule!

With a hop and a skip, I had jumped past 
and escaped.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: That's it, you have him cornered!

lines.speaker: Another Crow
lines.text: Don't let yourself be beaten!

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Yeah! This is what we're talking about!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Well, well, well... Is our indomitable Pup all bark and
no bite?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Since when did you have a jab like that in your
skillset?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You mistake my comment for critique.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
We can howl to the moon together. It would be a...
passionate way to see off the sun~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Tsk!

(I can't block his magic, so... I need to stay light on
my feet to evade)
I readied my sword with a sidestep prepared.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rragh!!!
And so Rowan fell to the ground.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Urk! I have been bested...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait, he went down easily...?!)

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: A lively activity, isn't it?

Reagyn stepped into the scene, and the audience 
of Crows started to scatter.
For my part, I swiftly threw a blanket over Rowan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, we try to keep morale up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I thought you were busy...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I made it work. Enough so to watch your "sparring
match", it seems.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why say it like that?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: *Sigh* ... I wonder.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I believe this transitions well into the conversation I
wished to have earlier.

First off, I have noticed how you lack a morning roll
call or a roll call of any sort.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Roll call"?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
It's a process to take attendance, assign tasks, and
document completion of said task.

For example, what if someone had deserted the 
regiment?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then they don't get paid.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
And what about food? How do you if know your 
supplies will be sufficient for the number of soldiers?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, stuff like that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We do take a count every once in a while for stuff like
that.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Which leads me to the topic of food organization... 
or the lack thereof.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
The percent of forgotten food... or even rotting 
food... that I've made note of is problematic.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait, are YOU of all people saying we shouldn't eat
food when it's fresh?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
With better logistics and numbers to back up 
decision making, you can buy and distribute food 
with less waste.
As of now, you're just hemorrhaging money.
Reagyn tried to soothe an oncoming headache.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Perhaps we should talk about the sparring matches while
we're here?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ha... Out of everything, I know I can do this well.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Then...

How are you organizing and scheduling them?

How are you planning for balancing of matches and
development of skillsets?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
And how are you setting up security control to avoid
injuries?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Balancing of matches"?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
With a magic user vs a weapon wielder, the latter 
has the advantage in close range combat.

Isn't that right?
Tsk.

A disgruntled voice was heard from 
below the blanket.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
And, as noted, the security protocols for the 
audience is entirely lacking.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: F- For the audience?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just don't stand in front of the sharp stick and you
should be fine. We are all proper mercs, for the
Goddess's sake.

As I finished my sentence, Reagyn already 
had a finger pointed at a nearby tree.

One flickering with embers from a fiery 
attack that Rowan had made.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Would you like me to elaborate?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: P- Point taken...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: And maybe worst of all... Bless the Goddess...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: There's the gambling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Gambling? What?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
So you are not aware. Or at least claim not to be?

I wonder...

Reagyn's foot stomped down hard onto the nearby
blanket.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- Hey! Be careful!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: How much did you make?

The playful voice was directed at a blanketed lump
below. A lump that had been foiled in its slow 
moving getaway.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Ah, what do we have here?

Reagyn reached down to the edge of 
the blanket and...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: A bag of coins? How fortuitous.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Surely no one would ever miss it. Doubly so a blanket.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: How much?
A head stuck out from the blanket.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Uh... 103 gold pieces? Give or take?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Then there you have-
Rowan jumped to his feet and grabbed the bag.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I mean... BLEH!
Rowan fell down underneath the blanket again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: B- B- B- But...?!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: *Sigh* ...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I'd guess that he threw the match on the final 
move after betting against himself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Your words wound me.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Would you dispute it?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: No, you are correct.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: But the words do still wound me.

And without any subtlety, the blanket rolled away 
from the scene at a brisk pace.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
*Sigh* ... If you allow these temptations to occur
undisturbed, it'll never be a fair match.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: F- Fine... I... guess you have a point.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Let's... imagine all your complaints are based in
fact...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just imagining it... not saying they are...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But... what would be your recommendations, then?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Well, I would start with...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Yeah. Yeah, that should work.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: It's a good edge.
Flynn flipped his dagger in his grip.

The shine of the newly sharpened blade glittered in 
the fiery flicker of the tent's lighting.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Haha...

Perhaps a bit recklessly, Flynn started to play 
with his weapon via casually going through 
training drills.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: My lord.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Oh...! H- Hey, sis...
Flynn quickly ended his playful endeavor.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I have a...

...?

Ah, had you completed a sharpening routine?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: I did. I think it came out well.
Flynn offered the dagger up for her inspection.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

It's good. Nothing I can see being problematic with 
it.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Right? I thought its the best result I've gotten in a
while.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I'd agree, though I'm not an expert.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: How long did it take?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Ah...! W- Well...

Flynn briefly admitted to it taking notably longer 
than normal.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
B- But... you gotta develop the skill, then speed it
up... right?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I agree.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I just... I just have to build on this. 

"A good heir to noble seat is one that's always 
learning"... as we were taught.

...right?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I said I agreed, no?

Keep up the good work at progressing.
Reagyn raised her hand with something in it.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: A letter was delivered to the camp.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Sure...
He took the envelope and Reagyn began to leave.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
...

Hey... Reagyn...

What's... your time on that task now?

How long does it take you for blade maintenance?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: *Sigh*

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Right... I thought so.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Hey... sis... Do you...?

Do you ever think... that maybe you'd... you'd be a
better...
Flynn's words trailed off.

A silence came over them both until Reagyn turned 
to Flynn.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I have. I think I would be an excellent heir to our
family's title.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Oh...

Yeah, you have always been a natural at all this...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
But I also cannot. I am not the heir. You are.

The choice was made long ago.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
I mean... If you really feel that way...

We could just do something to make you heir.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
If you're worried about reputation, I'm sure we 
could think of a plan to-

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
That...! How underhanded...

I thought you had moved past that.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: B- But...! If we're just smart about it...!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: The choice was made long ago, brother.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
*Sigh*

...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Is this really what you want to waste your worries on?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: I... guess... not...
Another silence fell over the two.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Flynn. I do sincerely believe you'll be a great lord.

Do not let your stumbles determine your motivation 
for getting there.

Reagyn turned and, with a hint of hesitation, exited
the tent.
...leaving Flynn alone with his thoughts.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Yeah... She's right. As usual... she's...

Trailing off, Flynn looked at the letter he had been
handed.
Opening it, he read the first line.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Ah...!

R- Reagyn! You need to see this!
He scampered out of the tent after his sister.
Paralogue Unlocked: "The Twin Reflection"

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Breathes in* ...

The warmth of the sun shined down onto 
my relaxed visage.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Always nice to hear the birds chirping away under 
an inviting sun...

And along with that...
I held a piece of parchment up to that same sun.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...I finished the count of ALL the mercenaries in 
camp now.

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Finally... How is one person supposed to do this every
day, anyways?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But at least I can finally sit and relax...
I turned towards my tent.
And what met me was a set of judgmental eyes.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Hello, "leader"... Or was "Pup" the one that'd do?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good, uh... afternoon, Reagyn.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I was hoping for a follow-up on my proposals.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... you see... I am busy since...
I looked around for who else was here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Because... uh... Norde!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Eh... I mean... Rowan!
Luckily for me, Rowan was passing by.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(At least one good thing came from counting everyone
here.)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Fancy meeting you two ladies... or two... uh...

...well, meeting a Pup and a Reagyn, at least. 
Always a pleasure.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Did you finish that task you were-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Actually, I was meaning to talk to you about that!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I have not finished and am busy with it, so can you
help me do it... right... over... far away from here.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... I see where this is going.
Rowan lowered his voice and whispered in my ear.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Well, I have been feeling a bit... thirsty.

I hope you don't mind... sharing your "goods" with 
me for a week or so.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Rowan. I don't have any. I'm too young to-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ha! When has that ever stopped you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Always.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Exactly! Now, I expect it to be delivered to my tent by
midnight.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...?!

(He's joking, right? Right?)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And, but of course, such a task would take the WHOLE
day.

Rowan had swiftly shifted from whispers into 
something akin to someone projecting to an 
audience.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The task includes such endeavors to keep one 
busy... doing... stuff. Manly stuff... and Pup stuff.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Really? That last part?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: *Sigh* ... Understood.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Please contact me when you are available to talk, then.
And with that, Reagyn turned on her heel and left.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhale* ...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And then my father deflected the swing of steel by 
that brute of a man!
I stood up to rally the crowd.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
He attacked and attacked but could barely make 
him bleed!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It was then that the beast did the dastardly deed,
using a handful of sand from his pocket to blind our
brave leader!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But he evaded all of his blows! He managed to 
defeat him without sight!

A clamor of cheers came from pockets of the 
crowd.

After the noise settled down a bit, but before I was
ready to continue, a familiar voice spoke.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I think I've heard this one before. A crusades tale,
correct?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... I don't know... I just heard it from my father.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
So the tale went, he had regained his sight after 
the battle due to well maintained organization.

He was able to get back and get quality care 
despite the impairment.

If it was a crusade, then is it safe to assume he was 
a part of that logistical effort before the event?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you trying to insinuate something?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: No, no... I think you are doing your best.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
But examples of quality can serve as a vision to strive
towards, no?

The remark stung. Maybe it shouldn't have, but the
topic would probably never be a simple one to me.

I slowed my breathing, as I didn't want to let it
distract me from the situation in front of me.

I had been wanting to undermine Reagyn's naggy 
attitude for some time, and this felt like my golden 
chance.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Just be classy and thorough. Don't be so easy to 
push around.)

It isn't as though the camp is... poorly 
administrated.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're just working with the resources we have. Money
and all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're used to working with nobles, right?

Trying to cater to a diverse group's likes and dislikes
from equipment to food isn't simple.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Is that so? Then is the recent food rationing part of
some dietary plan?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...What?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I... I do not mean to offend.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I want to understand what you're approach 
here really is. 

i want to see what I'm missing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Reagyn...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

...maybe we should talk in a more quiet place 
where we can... hear each other better.

Reagyn affirmed the idea and we slipped 
away from the nightly festivities.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The observation wasn't wrong.

Ivan ran a tighter ship around here.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Who's to blame for that change, though...
Norde paused in indecision for a second.
And then returned to eating.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This is probably far away enough...

Reagyn, I want to be diplomatic about this, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...you might even be giving the Goddess a 
headache at this point.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I... simply want to make this work.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: What we do is important, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right... Then with that in mind...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know the food shortage is because I was trying to
follow your guidelines, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're doing matches by your ruleset, too...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Should you really be grilling me like that when we're
doing things by YOUR book?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I don't see it happening like that.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Maybe... a fundamental understanding is lacking?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Excuse me?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
How about we review the basics from step one? How do
you perform a roll call?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Eh? Just walk around and count the heads. Simple.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Wait, but couldn't that lead to misses or redundancy?
You'd get an incorrect count.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Have we been purchasing food on that basis?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's not like I go everywhere only once, you know?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Next topic.

What's the current process for practice weapon
maintenance?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Same as any other weapon.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Meaning... the practice weapons are just real weapons?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah... when they get too worn down in battle, we move
them to be used for practice.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
That poses a number of issues with people 
restraining themselves in practice...

If they don't hold back, the injuries could be
deadly... but the practice is significantly less
effective if they do.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Did we ever address the gambling issue on those
sparring matches?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You do realize we didn't have these major problems
before your "recommendations"?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

So that is your conclusion. That this is my fault?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Of all conclusions to come to...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Speaking of. You nag a lot for someone doing so 
little yourself.

I tried your ideas and you still give me shit for not
doing them PERFECTLY.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Inhale* ...  *Exhale* ...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I... understand that you just want to help and
appreciate the sentiment.

But they're not working out. Unless you want to
implement them yourself, then...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Okay.

It was foolish of me to expect you to understand
the standards without the foundational education.

A good leader or teacher can be as much by 
providing an example.
Reagyn nodded and started heading back to camp.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

That worked?
I was soon alone again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Really?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Honestly, I just suggested Reagyn do it because 
that's how Rowan normally gets out of it.)

(Maybe... Is he onto something?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Actually...)

(Maybe I can "accidentally" leave some things
unfinished and she can "correct" that?)

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Maybe Rowan is rubbing off on me?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Eww...

title: SP: Pup x Charlotte A - Begining

lines.text: I focused on the locket pinched between my fingers.

A curtain of crimson flames enveloped the dummy, 
then disappeared.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I knew you'd eventually move on from pounding 
steel mindlessly.

Charlotte entered the training area with a 
smug grin.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Is "La Tornade" offering to help me refine my
technique?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Perhaps she could fan these flames with some of 
her legendary hot air?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hah... I see you've been doing your readings.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That line is similar to one of Sir Rangar's famous
retorts in that volume I recommended.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Huh? Really? 

I guess I just internalized that one into my
repertoire without realizing?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Trisyllabic words? Who are you and what have you 
done with Pup!?

My heart fluttered with humor and one other 
tingling feeling I couldn't quite identify.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah. Sometimes I don't even recognize myself in 
the mirror.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...Well... Speaking of changes, would you mind 
speaking privately in your tent?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Wow, you've really started to build up a collection of
books.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It suits you.

Charlotte glanced around at my small collection of
half-open tomes and scribbled notes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, we can only carry so much once we move.
I picked up a loose book and put it on a small pile.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So what did you want to see me for? Another mutual
lesson?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No, actually. It's more of a personal matter.
I breathed a sigh of relief.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm glad. You've grown beyond my meager tutelage.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Likewise. Which leads me to my next point: I need 
some replacement parts for my revolver.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It's a prototype weapon, so the parts are hard to 
come by. Especially if I want to avoid getting undue
attention.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: If you want extra muscle for a back alley deal, then...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Trust me, I'll bring plenty of muscle all on my own.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What I'd to rely on is your brain.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I think we compliment the other's skillset very well.
With knowledge on brains and brawn to make the 
two work well together.
A... tactical alliance, if you would.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Is that what it is? Just a tactical alliance?)

My face twitched a little from the thought, though 
I couldn't get myself to actually disagree with it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How could I possibly say no after all we've been
through together?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you! Then get ready and we'll meet at...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So this is the place?
Charlotte nodded as I slipped inside the warehouse.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You there? "Fist"?

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Ah, you must be my buyer. Let's-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, goddess. It's you!

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Huh... Wait, C- Charlotte?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What's going on?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I've told you about... 'handsy' nobles before, right?

It didn't take much for me to put two 
and two together.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
Heheh. I didn't realize we were back on speaking 
terms. You must have missed me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don't flatter yourself. You do want my business, right?

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
Hmm... Do I?

No. No, I don't think I do.

I think I have a new offer. One exclusive for our 
dear Lady Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well, fuck off.

Charlotte turned to start heading towards 
the door.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Grgh! I don't think so, princess.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don't you dare call me th-

Fist raised his hand to snap, and several men 
entered from the shadows.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
You know, if it wasn't for that foul temperament of
yours, you might not be in this position in the first
place.
Despite those barbaric ears of yours, you could at
least pretend to be of good breeding when 
addressing a gentleman.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Is this... Is this about those rejections I gave you?!
Still?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If you had taken them like the proud man you pretend to
be, maybe it wouldn't have been so humiliating.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Y- You pinned me to a table in front of everyone!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: YOU tried to grab my butt!
Even some of the thugs snickered at that.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: S- Shut it! Stop laughing!

His eyes spun from person to person, 
settling on me.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
Wait. Who the hell are you?

So you've become so arrogant as to drag your 
chambermaid instead of a proper rugged guard?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No. I'm not a chamermaid. I'm...
Charlotte and I glanced at each other.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm a frie-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Comrade-in-arms.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm... I'm a friend.

Not yours, though.
I motioned towards the guards.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You two are... I'm still making up my mind on that. 
I hope he's paying you enough to deal with this.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
This... This explains everything. The rejections, 
your lack of ladylike qualities...

You were always just into women, weren't you?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah... THAT'S why a girl would reject you...

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
You actually think this girl can be strong? That she
can protect you with that sword?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: First of all, dipshit, I don't need protection.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Secondly, you don't know who you're talking 
about. She's stronger than you'll ever be without 
even needing to lift that sword.

Charlotte cocked her head as if realizing 
something for the first time.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Maybe... Maybe that's why I like her so much.

Charlotte grabbed my hand and squeezed it, 
causing my heart to soar. I was completely 
stunned.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
Grh... You know, even now the Empire has people 
that would gladly see you delivered in a body bag, 
yeah?
Fist motioned to his men.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Any last words?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...Just three.

Duel me, coward.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Hah! You can't be serious.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
After all these years... can your 'oh-so-manly' ego
really live with needing to outnumber me to win?

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: You...!
He paused with a slight twitch to his eye.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: F- Fine! What are the terms, then?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You win, I'll honor your years old marriage proposal.

We win, we go free. With my parts.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Heh. Deal.

Fist gestured, and the hired thugs formed a sort of
ring to act as an arena.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good luck...

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text:
She'll need it.

Last chance, princess. Are you sure you wanna do 
this?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Never been surer of anything in my life.
They were off!
Fist came at her, but his stance was sloppy.

Charlotte took advantage immediately, out 
maneuvering him and going completely on the 
offensive by turning his power against him.
Fist didn't even land a blow.

He fell to the floor after less than a minute, bloody
and bruised.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I win.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Ughh... how is this... even possible?

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Dammit...! Men! Shoot them both!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Not even going to hesitate, are you?!)

I turned to the thugs that were on the verge of 
moving, and I decided to act on an observation I 
made before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait! "Fist" isn't your real name, obviously...

You're Thileous Sork, right? Of the Sork 
family name?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The same 'Sork' family that's lost a lot of trade
agreements in Lockhart over the past few years?

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: W- What?! What does that matter?! You think I care?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think they'd care.

I turned to the thugs, who had tilted their heads in 
my direction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I really do hope he paid you guys enough to deal with
this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or rather... already paid you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I imagine that's most of what he has left.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This man has nothing to pay you with except a few
shoddy firearms.

He already botched the trade he needed to get 
you the rest of your pay.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: All over a personal dispute he can't even win.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I guess that does technically mean you're working 
for me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Assuming they WANT to get paid.

I tilted my head to the hired help, and slightly
reached out my hand in an inviting manner.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How about it? We came here expecting to pay 
that money anyways.

lines.speaker: Thug 1
lines.text: Fuck... he did say half up front for me. You?

lines.speaker: Thug 2
lines.text: Yeah, same...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And an awful lot of silence from him on the topic so
far.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: W- Wait, no. That doesn't mean I can't...!
The thugs lowered their weapons.

lines.speaker: Thug 1
lines.text: I'm gonna go guard outside... ma'am.

He nodded at Charlotte and myself before 
leaving. 

The others nodded in agreement as they
followed him.

lines.speaker: Fist
lines.text: Y- You can't just...! You fucking...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I think that's enough out of you.

Fist continued to spout obscenities until Charlotte
knocked him out with a pistol whip.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Happy to do business with you.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That was amazing~

With parts in hand and a few kind words from our 
new hired hand friends, we were on the road back 
to camp by sunrise.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So tell me, how did you know who he was?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
One of the books you have me had a 'genealogy of
Lockhart' section.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Sigh*... That does sound like Lockhart.

Where people get to be featured in an
academic book because they financed 
its publication.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Between that and hearing about rumors in my 
time as a mercenary... His 'escapades' are well 
documented.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Color me impressed. I never would have connected 
those dots like that, and I've known him for years.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't think I could have pulled it off without you 
making him look like a fool first.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah... well, let's not give me too much credit.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I just… reacted when I realized you were dealing 
with all this nastiness on my account.

I bit my lip, debating if I should voice the thoughts
that were burning in my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, that's not what really bothered me about it...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Really? Then why do you look so pale?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did you mean what you said back there?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hm? I said a lot of stuff.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What you said about...

My mouth started to move, but the word didn't 
want to come out immediately.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do you really see me as a... strong person?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I- I don't know... There are many different kinds of
strength.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Do you see me as a mindless brute?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course not. You've got so much more to you, and I
like that side of you.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well... then there's your answer.

There was a tense silence. My heart was pounding 
again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But I mean, you still don't actually... you know...
right?
Charlotte looked a bit hurt.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don't... what?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What I mean is, I know you wanted to do this 
training because you felt sorry for me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I shouldn't have expected anything.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's just that even though you're... 
and I'm... I still felt a sort of...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmph...

As my eyeline dodged the scene forming in 
front of me, she leaned in.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (S- Soft?!)
Her lips pressed to mine.
I was frozen, not knowing what to do.

Then I felt her hands on my lower back and behind 
my head, pulling me deeper into the kiss.
I started to act on instinct in return.

Seconds later, when we were both breathless, 
we pulled apart.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Clear throat*

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
For someone who has come such a long way so 
quickly, you can act really dumb.

And that's what all these insecurities are. Dumb.
She stepped back and fixed her outfit.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Now, let's continue this later.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm exhausted...

As Charlotte headed off, I caught the faint hint of a
blush forming on her face.

I watched her head back, and I saw her pace 
slowly change from a composed one to a rushed 
one.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

What just happened?

She had already made a habit of odd actions 
like this.
What I wasn't sure about...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Was that a genuine moment of vulnerability?)

...

I raised my hand to feel the lingering imprint of her
on my own lips.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Could have it meant... No... It... couldn't...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

I turned my gaze to the sea as my thoughts 
jumbled themselves within indecision.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, she was right about one thing.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I am so... very... very... dumb...

Ahaha.... haha...

title: SP: Pup x Reagyn A - Begining

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ...and you just have to shove that thing there...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Is there a problem? It's not about force, it's about
technique.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Come on, let me show you how it's done.

Reagyn gently moved my hands in a rhythmic 
pattern. I noticed an elegance to the motion.

The pen she guided in my hand moved like a 
dancer on a ballroom floor.
Graceful, no hesitation, no error.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
And if you follow this specific pattern you will be
able to shave some seconds on each signature.

Trust me, these few seconds will accumulate to 
minutes or sometimes hours in the long run.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Right. Yeah, you're right.
I looked towards the written words...

"...or your family line may end unceremoniously 
rather than flourish alongside ours."

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's... graceful.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Indeed. One must show respect and decorum.

And they must show that respect to their 
adversaries and, more importantly, to their 
own kin.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
If one's noble leader cannot act with such 
confidence in their purpose, then how can one 
expect the people you lead to follow suit?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I... I guess that makes sense.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Reagyn really knows the theory on this all inside 
and out.)

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Why don't you give it a try? This time you can do it 
by yourself.

I grabbed the pen, carefully dipped it into the ink 
and carefully moved it onto the paper.
I carefully looked at Reagyn for approval.

I knew that if I took too long or made a mistake,
Reagyn would end up covering for me and do the 
whole thing without my input.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I don't really wanna do this... but I do feel like I
should try.)
However...
*Splat*

In a moment of hesitation, my nervous twitch 
knocked over the inkwell.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Quick! Pup, grab those cloths! We got to clean 
this spat of ink before it bleeds to other 
parchments!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhale* ...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think... only one piece of paper got ruined?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Luckily so...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Pup, why don't you go ahead and finish the other 
task? The one in the armory.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: U- Uh... Yeah. I can do that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I am... sorry, you know? I didn't mean to do that.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: No need to worry. I'm sure you'll-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: -get it next time... Yeah. I know.

It wasn't the first time that was said.
The reminder of it did manage to annoy me.

She was being nice. This was even what I 
wanted: To get out of doing the chore.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Yes... As you and I have said before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I do mean it. I really do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I was... actually sort of trying this time. Sort
of...)

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...

Of course you do. I understand.

Just make sure the weapons task is done as I told 
you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I feel a little guilty about that.
She has been very helpful lately...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(On the bright side, I can trust that Reagyn will do
the paperwork well.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(She didn't seem... too mad. Not happy, but I've 
seen angrier.)
I turned to start walking away from the tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Besides, everything will work out if it's Reagyn 
doing it. The paperwork will be done in record 
time!)
(The whole "mother hawk" over my shoulder thing 
was a waste of both our times. There are better 
things for us to do.)
I stopped walking.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Wait, what was I doing now? Something with 
the... weapons?)
I shook my head and scampered off to do my task.

Stepping away from the armory tent, 
and I smacked my hands to get off 
the dust.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: All good.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The weapons are in a way better state since 
Reagyn started to take care of the logistics around 
here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Reminds me of how Dad used to run things...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...weapons.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah!
I stepped back in a bit of a shock.

Norde was standing over mty shoulder with a stern,
annoyed look.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Pup, do you have the weapons specifications 
ready? I told you weeks ago today was the 
deadline.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Weapon specifications...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Oh, shoot! The thing I was supposed to do was 
not to check on the weapons, but order new 
ones!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Right... the weapons specs... I had them ready. 
Yep... Right over... in my tent.

Ready to send... at any given moment... The 
weapon specs...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Just make sure to send them by the end of the day.

With a familiar disappointed look, Norde turned 
around and left.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Shoot! Writing them will take days...  I need...)

(I need...!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (...Reagyn!)

STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC SLOWLY, 
RUNNING SE

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant* ... R-...  *Pant* ... Reagyn!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Reagyn?!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ...And done.

Reagyn put the pen down as I hunched over just 
within the tent flaps.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: You forgot to do something again, didn't you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- How did you... I mean... of course not...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: The way you blush and stutter says otherwise...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
It's something related to sending the weapon 
specs to the blacksmith, isn't it?
I nodded.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Did you forget where you put them, or...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A little closer to... "or"...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: *Sigh* ... Forgotten, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- Not 100% forgotten... but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Would you be upset if I told you that I did?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
More... disappointed than upset. I can't get mad 
with that-
Reagyn shook the thought away.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I guess we're at a crossroads then.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
You won't be a great leader of anything if you 
don't own up to your mistakes.

And we can't fix it if I don't understand the 
situation in detail.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Explain to me what happened in as much detail as 
you can.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Fine... then... I... accidentally... maybe a little on
purpose... then again... forgot to write out the
weapons specs.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: ..."on purpose"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well... there was a small blunder... and you helped.

Then another blunder you helped with again... 
and...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I see where this is going... leading up to this
impossible, multi-day task.

If we don't do them, it may cause the death of 
multiple allies in an upcoming battle.
Reagyn had started pacing with a slight huff.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
You know what, let's talk about this "you purposely
forget to do things so I do them for you" part.
