To be that irresponsible! And to wait this long to 
tell me.

Did it not occur to you the consequences of your 
own actions!? Were you not ashamed a little bit 
about it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean... yeah, a little.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But you really are great at this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're more graceful and assertive when doing it. 
I'm best with a sword in my hand.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
It's a bit too late to sweet talk your way out of 
this, missy!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
You lied. You know what they do to liars in some
countries?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
They cut their tongues! Sometimes they cut their 
hands, or even sometimes your eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Gulp* ...!

Less Reagyn's words, but the dominating aura 
around the words pushed me back on my heels.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Of course, I can go easy on you... I can make you 
carry all the weapons from to the top of a 
mountain...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Or maybe some mental punishment would be best. 
Some 'deep end' training for your womanhood?

I've heard about this new "bikini" outfit making its
way out of Lockhart in the past months.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "B- Bikini"? What is...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Don't worry about it. I have a better idea for your
punishment~

I flinched, closing my eyes as I expected a strong
slap.
*Bonk*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Huh? Did you... Did you just softly "bonk" me 
with a book?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Maybe that way you'll grow a little smarter.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Why didn't you just ask me to help?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... thought you'd be angry...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Each time I let you do the work, it was
done better and the risk you getting angrier
got bigger and bigger...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not good at these sorts of things... I thought 
you were helping me out of pity...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
It's not pity. I grew up helping Flynn out. It's 
second nature to me.

I couldn't be the heir to my family, but I was well
positioned to be Flynn's right hand, including the
struggles there.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
And in this moment, I am helping you be a better
leader, so we can return to our paths as quickly as
possible.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You...  want to leave as quickly as possible?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I- I mean... I wouldn't say it like that.

There are some benefits of being here... lack of
cleanliness notwithstanding.
Reagyn's face had turned away.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
But anyways, we have a task we need to fulfill as
urgently as possible.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, you were right... It'd take days to do it.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
It's going to take days if you do it or I do it...

...separately. 

But together...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You think? 

Well... If you believe we can, then we can.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You tell me what to do and I will do my best in 
order to do so!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
First, I need you to go to the training grounds and
gather up these details.

Write them up and bring them here. I'll start 
writing the requisition forms.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Got it!
I started to run off to the training grounds.
But then...

My face planted itself into the group as I tripped on a
nearby tree root.
Without another word, I stood back up.
...and continued sprinting.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
PFFT!!!

Haha! Haha... I... Haha...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
*Sigh*...

You're lucky you're cute.

title: SP: Tatiana x Jakson C - Story

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Ah... what a long battle.

Tatiana emptied her backpack, leaving a pile of 
armor sitting on a ground cloth.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Should make sure none of these are too banged 
up, then...?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
*YAWN*

Eh... It's fine. Probably... I'll just...

She slumped with weary eyes that were becoming 
more difficult to keep open.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
...just take a...

...little...

...nap...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Wha' was...? Where am.. I...?
She blinked a few times.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Oh right... 

*Yawn*

...my armor.

With a few more blinks, her awakening mind forced 
her neck to creak her head towards the left.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What the...?!

From her armor set, the cuirass and leg-guards 
were missing.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: T- Thieves...?

A few angrier blinks directed her attention to 
nearby the incomplete armor set.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Footprints?

...

...Amateurs.

The footprints, while aged and indistinct, led her to 
a bonfire where Nightless Crows were carousing 
loudly.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Heresh to our victoreh! ... *hic* ...

The Crow toasted a mug of beer, nearly spilling the
contents.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
All right, you drunken louts. Which one of you stole 
my armor?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Of for the fuckin' Goddess's sake... Why are you 
not even wearing shoes?!

The group of drunken Crows burst forth in laughs 
and snickers.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Is your imminent demise really that funny?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Should we tell 'er?

Her stare was accompanied by the foreboding 
sound of cracking knuckles.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Five... four... three...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Aight! I'll tell ya...

'Tis the same feller that... *hic* ... nipped me 
shoes.

'Sides, we aint havin' enough legs to make off with 
yer armor... hehe...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Legs? Are you actually making a pass at me right now?

The Crow flailed about in a poor attempt to what
appeared to be a shrug.

And the remaining Crows burst into laughter around
them.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
You're lucky I'm too busy catching a thief to teach 
you dogs a lesson.
Tatiana glared at them before walking off.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Ah, wait... He went...
The Crow pointed to the armory tent.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: ...that-away-I-thin'...?

The Crow blinked, and the flap of the tent's 
opening was already flapping from an entrant.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
...

Well, I can't exactly say I'm surprised...

The tent was a mess of knocked over weapons and 
armor stands.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: So whoever took my armor stole from here too...
Tatiana knelt to inspect the pile of metal.

There was a leather boot partially buried by some 
armor pieces.
Tatiana reached for it.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Gross...
It was wet with a weird substance.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Almost like a dog slobbered on it.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Well, at least it's obvious what happened.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
The same thief stole my armor, the Crow's boot, 
and from here.

They were interrupted by Jakson, who latched 
onto the perp, ripping the boot off.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Only question is... where is Jakson now?

Tatiana stopped in front of Jakson's miniature 
doggy-tent.
The canine was nowhere to be seen.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Did the thief come here, too?

There were no human footprints, only pawprints 
leading away from the scene.
Tatiana began to follow them.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: O- Ow...

She looked down to see what she'd 
stubbed her toe on.
It was a pauldron covered in slobber.
The lightbulb illuminated above her head.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Oh, that mangy mutt!

Tatiana's cuirass and leg-guards lay in the middle of
the clearing at the end of the pawprint trail.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Found you!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Now come home to mama...

Tatiana extended her hand, summoning the armor 
to her with a magical grip.

Instead, the armor sprouted four furry legs that 
began running around in circles.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: ...This night just will not end, will it?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Playful bark*!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Playtime's over.

She invoked her magic, attempting to summon the 
armor to her body.
It twitched slightly but remained firmly in place.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Bark feigning innocence* ...!
The canine planted his feet, resisting her pull.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Ugh... You...!

Tatiana's veins bulged as she fought to control the
armor with all her willpower.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I am vengeance! I am a knight! I am...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: *Sigh*... completely at an impasse.
Tatiana relaxed, releasing her magical grip.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Snickering pants*...

Jakson wiggled through the armor, emerging his 
head from the top of the cuirass.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Tricked you!

Tatiana flung out her hand, propelling a gauntlet to
move across the grass and grab for the armor.

Jakson leaped, discarding his spoils as he chomped 
down on the gauntlet in midair.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Tsk...! You little...!
Jakson landed, pinning the gauntlet on the ground.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What are you doing with that? Knock it off!

Jakson dragged the gauntlet with him to the 
cuirass, put it on, and then wedged himself inside 
the armor again.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Defiant bark*

He stomped awkwardly with his gauntleted paw as 
he made his way over to the discarded leg-guards.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Annoyed whine*...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Oi, come now. My armor isn't that loud.

The canine slammed his gauntleted paw repeatedly 
into the leg-guards, making loud clanging noises.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Uh... I guess... point taken.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark*!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Oh boy... this is as bad as the time with 
the pickled...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Wait, why am I even comparing it... 
The mutt is a mutt, not a human.
The absurdity of the situation suddenly struck her.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Heh...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Heh... hehehe... bwahaha!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Jovial bark*!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I guess I could see how you'd find it fun to play 
with. I like it myself.

You know, I've got an idea for a little agreement 
we could come to on that.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Curious whine*...?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Alright so... hic... what I got ta do ta get me shoes
back again?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Just go over there and attack my armor. I'm testing
some... improvements.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Ya gunna do your magic watchamit to make it moove?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Nope. I put my heirloom down over there, if you're
curious. Can't use my magic.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Er... okay, I guess...
The Crow stumbled over to his sword.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: CCCHHHHAAAAaarrrgggee...!
But the armor started flying towards him.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
AARGHH!!!???

I- It's possessed!
A low, keening howl reverberated from the armor.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: B- Banshee! Banshee!

The crow dropped his weapon and sprinted away in
terror.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Bwahaha!!

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Pft...! Oi, ya think he soiled himself?
The other Crows shared the laugh with Tatiana.

Meanwhile, Jakson poked his head from the armor 
once the crow was out of sight.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Triumphant bark*!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You know as well as I do that the price you're 
asking is excessive.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text:
Well, that's the only offer you're getting. Take it or
leave it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You understand that I'll be taking my business
elsewhere?

My bulk purchase business.

The shopkeep's glare lingered on Norde's scales and
pointed ears.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: And what a terrible loss it is, too.
Norde detected sarcasm in the man's voice.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Aye. Indeed so.

With just a hint of a lingering antagonistic glance,
Norde turned away from the stall and disappeared 
into the crowd.

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.text: Tsk. Damn lizard.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Patience, Norde. Patience.

Norde had almost left the market when 
a strange sight appeared.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
That should be about everything...

Hm...?

There was a flash of violet eyes as a feminine figure
in a bulky cloak flipped a hood over their head.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is that...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Perhaps I should ensure nothing goes wrong...?

Norde followed the figure to a stall that had just
opened up in an isolated corner.

They had stopped and began peering at the titles
displayed on the carts.

lines.speaker: Bookseller
lines.text: Hello ma'am. What can I do for you today?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Sigh* ...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Don't mind me. I'm just browsing for now.

Castel adjusted his hood and robe to better ensure 
his appearance was obscured as much as possible.

lines.speaker: Bookseller
lines.text:
If you're sure. Just... let me know if I can help
and... get you on your way.

Castel stared at the titles on display for several
minutes.

People soon began to point and whisper. A small 
crowd formed to gawk at the shady figure.

lines.speaker: Bookseller
lines.text:
Listen ma'am, I hate to turn away a paying 
customer, but you're starting to scare away my 
other customers.
If you're not going to buy anything, then I'm going 
to have to ask you to leave.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Er... I suppose I am actually looking for a couple of
things...
He rattled off a list of academic-sounding texts.

lines.speaker: Bookseller
lines.text:
Ah, what luck! I do happen to have one of those 
left in stock.

The bookseller hurriedly grabbed the book and 
turned back to Castel.

lines.speaker: Bookseller
lines.text:
You have excellent taste, miss.

This is actually one of my favorites. The binding is
superb and...

The bookseller got close to Castel, entering his
personal space with said book.
Castel backed away.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I can see that very well from here, thank you.

lines.speaker: Bookseller
lines.text:
Nonsense! How can you get that smell of a good 
book if not from up close?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Oooooh, you're right. That is quite nice.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: And a first edition? Exquisite.

Just then, a strong breeze kicked up and slipped 
the hood from Castel's head.

lines.speaker: Bookseller
lines.text: B- By the Goddess...?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I- uh...

Castel tried to yank the hood back up, but the 
wind was too strong.

The crowd from the nearby merchant stall started 
to gasp audibly.

lines.speaker: Villager 1
lines.text: W- What do you think she is?

lines.speaker: Villager 2
lines.text: Some sort of... dark spirit?

lines.speaker: Villager 1
lines.text: I- it looks like a m- monster!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What? Of all the things...?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Clearly I am a 'Shade'! Have you imbeciles never 
seen a summoner's-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh* ...
Norde ran up to Castel and grabbed his arm.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Not here. Not now.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: But... But I...!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We're leaving.

Quickly now.
A proper crowd was starting to form in the market.

Norde pulled Castel into a sprint and the two swiftly
exited the scene.

Despite Castel's grumblings, the two were able to 
make it back to camp without more than stares 
directed their way.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What is with those... Argh!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
How can they not at least recognize a shade?! Do 
they not even know what they are?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I actually do doubt many would be aware in a small
village like that.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
What? Shades, especially summoned ones, 
are all too common.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: In academia, noble spaces, affluent districts... yes.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: This place, though?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Then... I can explain it. I could explain my situation,
even.

You didn't need to drag me away from the scene.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: They wouldn't have understood.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...and you were causing a scene.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: It wasn't that bad.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Trust me. I know how quickly those situations can 
go sideways.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Moreover, what do you suppose the reaction would 
be even among those that did recognize what a 
shade was?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
...

I... may have not gotten to considering that step, 
yet.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Exactly.
Norde approached the active campfire in the camp.

Only a scattered few other Crows were out and 
about, so Norde took a seat next to it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Something bad could've happened because of it.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Are you saying... perhaps... as a person who 
appears as a shade...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
You are suggesting the idea that an innocent 
person may be unfairly castigated?

Castel shuffled over in a slight huff, sitting across
from Norde.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Do I not have the right to freely conduct business 
in a town square?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That is not the issue here.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Then enlighten me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The issue is that people like you and I can't always
get what we want.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It's unfortunate, but it's the reality we live in.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
If you refuse to adapt to it, then you will create
trouble for yourself.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: So... what? Your solution is to just give up, then?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It's not 'giving up'. It's called being realistic.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Even beyond myself, I've never wanted to pull the 
Crows or Ivan into trouble of my own making.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmph. I can see that further conversation is 
completely pointless.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I'll do things my way, thank you very much.

Castel pushed himself to his feet as he started to 
make his way from the campfire.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*... Wait.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Hard to let that one pass, as one of the people
responsible for the Crows.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Explain what your way is.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I am willing to hear you out.

But more importantly...
Norde turned his head towards Castel.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I won't let the Crows be drawn into that sort of
trouble.

You decision will affect all of us, regardless of
specifics.

You are a part of this team, too.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm... Well...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Given sufficient rhetorical acumen, my hypothesis is
that anyone could be persuaded.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
They can be persuaded to see that people in a 
situation like my own, shade or not, are not so far 
removed from what they see as "a real person".

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
The same can be applied to homlyns and non-
homlyns, I'll note.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
So your answer is to meet suspicions with an 
academic debate.

Do you think that'd actually work?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: ...In truth, I cannot say.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I do know that giving up before even trying is
illogical.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
The steps we have taken forward are largely by 
those who didn't take "impossible" as an answer.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

I can understand the desire.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Nor am I inherently opposed to the attempt.
Norde rose to meet Castel's gaze.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
All I'm saying is that we should approach this with a
greater level of caution.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: "We"?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We are a team, after all. You have joined the 
Crows for this mission, and your problems are our 
problems.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
So solving your problems is solving our problems, as
well.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmph. Tis' true that great discoveries were seldom 
made alone.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Very well. I'll be looking forward to our partnership.
So the sun hit its apex.

The beat of the Goddess's light shone down upon 
her realm.

The oppressive aura of the day fed into the daily 
lives of all those around.
After all, the agreed upon time had come.

This would be a day that lived in the shadows of 
fame and infamy.

It would be a decisive day for two nations and the
world around them.
Shadows blanketed the inside of the tent.
A sole table sat within the dim light at its center.

lines.speaker: Feminine Voice?
lines.text: So you're ready?

lines.speaker: Masculine Voice?
lines.text: Indeed I am.
One of the voices stepped from the shadows.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You better take this seriously.

She was flanked by two people, dressed in 
traditional Lockhart military garb.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I will do my utmost.

He was also flanked by two people. They were 
dressed in Imperial military styles.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ladies first?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...
Charlotte was hesitant, but she soon took her seat.

Rowan soon followed her lead and sat across 
from her.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Now then. You know that I called you here. 
As for the why...

Beyond the conflict we are embroiled within, we 
both seek the empire's withdraw from Lockhart.

This meeting is meant to establish expectations and
initial plans for a post-conflict world for the both of
us.
Do you agree to this goal, with we as 
representatives of Nolvanus and Lockhart?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mmm...

The room was met with silence as Rowan sat 
waiting for her to confirm.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Calling yourself a representative of the empire is a
bit...
She glared harder at Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then... what would manifest your trust in that
sentiment?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Do the shit you're claiming to want to do.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Your condition is a simple matter of fixing the 
empire.

Something I've already the motivation to do.

Now, shall we establish an ideal path forward for 
our two great states of people?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mmm...!

Rowan waited patiently with a very serious look 
across his face.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... Fine. You already set this up, I guess.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Then, on the topic of...

The two sat and worked through political issues like
borders, reparations, and trade routes.

Much of the conversation delved down a rabbit 
hole of "what if"s, but not all.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Isn't that just giving the Empire what it wanted 
when it invaded?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yes, but if we can end the war with the Republic, 
then Lockhart doing so wouldn't be dangerous.

Taking a side in that war was what your 
government was avoiding, no?

Working with the empire or republic more closely 
would just be business, rather than an act of war.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hmm... Maybe.

You know, since when did you get an actual feel 
for this political stuff?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I've had my share of it hammered into me in my youth.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I take it you don't disagree, though?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Mmm...
Charlotte stewed in her seat.
The conversation continued on, until...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: And that would settle that topic quite effectively.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: In a sense...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: As for the next topic...

Rowan hung on those words as the atmosphere 
of the room settled into the silence.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Shall we have a cup of tea?

This dreariness has quite of subtle aroma to it, but
tea would be all the nicer, no?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*...

Rowan's tone shifted from the more serious one he 
had taken into the more lighthearted one he 
typically used.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Only a matter of time.

lines.speaker: Armored Guard
lines.text: Uh... are we gonna be here much longer?
Within the armor...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's... not the easiest to breath in this thing, you
know. Or hear. Or see anything going on.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sort of getting stuffy, too...

lines.speaker: Armored Guard 2
lines.text:
Y- Yeah. This isn't what I was expecting when you
asked.
In the other armor.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I'm getting... a little... sweaty in here...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Argh... I just wanted to eat my breakfast in peace.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Did you rope in... all of...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Alexei...!
She turned to Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Oh?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: That'll do.
Rowan reached out to grab her hand.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah, what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- Wait, what are you-?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Negotiations, my dear! Negotiations!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I didn't say you could-
Rowan pulled Charlotte out of the tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I couldn't hear that clearly. Are we done?

lines.speaker: Armored Guard
lines.text: ...Hello?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What are we doing here?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: This location will work.
The two stopped at the apex of a small, grassy hill.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Work for what?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: As I said: Negotiations.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Now, at the top of this fair hill, we need to... 
lay down.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
If you try to do something...

...

Fine, but I'm keeping my hand on my gun in case 
you do anything... funny.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: If it helps you relax, then I embrace that choice~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So what do you wanna negotiate now that we-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Shh.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What...?
Charlotte laid back along with Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah...

Rowan started to relax his eyes and stare out into 
the sky.
Charlotte, on the other hand...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

Kept moving her eyes towards Rowan as though 
expecting something more to happen.

As though expecting this "negotiation" to start in
earnest.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Rowan, aren't we-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Shh... At the right time.
Charlotte, bewildered still, laid back again.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...
Both of the two had entered a zen like calm.
Relaxing.
In the warmth of the sun.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...?

There you two are.

Charlotte jumped to her feet with her gun ready to 
be drawn.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- What are you doing here?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I was just trying to figure out where you guys 
went. It's been an hour.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... good morning~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It isn't morning.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It's morning somewhere.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And you! Did you just waste an hour of mine...!?

Argh! I should...! I should...!
In a huff, Charlotte stomped away.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: *Pant* ... Wait... for...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Huh...?! Sis? Where are you...?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm... just confused, now.

She seemed pretty mad... I thought you guys 
were discussing Lockhart and the Empire.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What was that about? Did it not go well?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

I would call it...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...progress.

title: SP: Castel x Pup C - Story

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm....

What if I use that spell in order to...?

In a cozy corner of the encampment, Castel
flipped through an academic text.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm... but then I would have to shift that to, 
wait... that won't work...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm...

If my hypothesis is correct, that may be a good first
step.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Could the curse stabilize long enough to apply a
procedure properly?
Castel leaned back in his seat.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Wait... that's it...?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Mmm...  *munch* ...

(Such tender and plump meat. I wonder what the 
chickens in the area eat?)

I looked over to the cook tent's interior to see who
was tasked with it today.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I wonder if they know how they got the meat this
tender?)
As I was about to get up to ask...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Pup. I need you to undress and follow me.
I stopped chewing.

I blinked back at the person that had suddenly 
appeared in front of me, but the distraction from 
the meat didn't go away.
So I started chewing again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Insh… thash order?
I could barely talk with my mouth full of chicken.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Gulp*

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Order? Order is irrelevant.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Though, undressing as we travel could save time...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What about I follow you... THEN I undress...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: If you must, but do please not dawdle, then.

I stood up, but Castel noticed something I was
carrying.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Are you... bringing the chicken into the lab?
I looked at the "lab" and saw a tent.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ywou mhen da tent?

I talked while munching on another piece 
of chicken.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Whatever you wish to call it, it is unhygienic to 
bring half eaten food into a place of research.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aww...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... Let me just... What to do with it...?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Hungrily licks lips* ...

I had just entered the lab's door, but Castel 
stopped me before I could.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Clothes off.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...

While I hesitated for a second, the next few 
seconds after that were spent staring at Castel.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It'll... probably... be fine...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Give it to me straight, doc... how bad is the damage?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: From 1 to 10... maybe a 5...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That doesn't sound... too bad...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
With a 10 being so large that they break your spine 
and you could not walk anymore.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmph. A 5 is not terrible, indeed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Break my spine? W- We're talking about these 
things on my chest, right?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Naturally.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: If that's a 10, then what's a 0 or 1?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It is simply a scale derived from my own
observations... Men being, of course... a zero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That'd imply that you've seen a 10?

What unlucky soul got that fate?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I cannot disclose that information. Research
confidentiality.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...

I fidgeted around as the imagined image flickered 
in my mind's eye.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... what are we doing here?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I hypothesize that in order for your body to 
become a man, it first off must be more manly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh! So this is about transforming back to a man?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait... "become a man" and "be more manly"... 
aren't those the same thing?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Not quite.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If we try to revert the entire process at once, 
there's a high rate of failure. Therefore...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Make... small changes first?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Precisely!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Starting with...!

I looked down towards our previous topic of
conversation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Boobs...)

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Your gaze surmises correctly.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: With that consent, I will start immediately.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A- Ah... Umm...

I was at a loss for words. I did not know what 
Castel was about to do.

A way to fight the curse was tempting, but I had a 
bad feeling about this.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hands on top of your head.

Grab your hair and don't let it go, unless you want 
to resemble a nekolyn.

Castel created a green light from his hands. I could
sense a warm sensation on my chest.
And...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I think it's actually working this time?!

The weight I felt on my chest was noticeably
decreasing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wow...
As it went along, I let my mind drift.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(On the bright side, if this is done quickly enough, I
can go back and eat the chicken legs... if they're
still there.)

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Almost... there...

...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: And... done.
Castel slowly stepped back.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: From a 5 down to a 1.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Can you do some stretches? Anything hurt?

My breasts went down a significant level. My chest 
was almost flat.

There were still small mounds of flesh, but nothing
that couldn't be hidden if I wanted to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Nope. I feel pretty light! My shoulders won't feel as
stiff anymore!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Excellent. Then we can continue with another
transformation at a later date.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Once your body reacclimates and stabilizes with the
"new" change, of course.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks, Castel! You've really outdone yourself.

As I dressed back up again, I could feel that my 
pants were a bit tighter than I remembered.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Weird... Maybe I ate too much?)

After finishing dressing, I headed out and about the
Nightless Crows campsite.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Is that ye olde leader over there?

lines.speaker: Another Crow
lines.text: Hm? No, couldn't be. Not with that... cake.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hm...? Cake?

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's been forever since I had cake...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Though... maybe I should avoid sweets for a while...)

As I walked through camp, I could feel something
swaying on my rear.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Weird.
And suddenly.
*RIIPPPP* ...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah... W- What the-?!
I felt a sudden breeze along my rear.

As I checked what had happened, the sight behind 
me showed a mountainous trek.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I- Is that my ass?! It's huge!)

As I touched the cheeks, they felt like big and 
fluffy marshmallows. They were like melon sized 
cushions.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I- I need to go back to Castel!)
The breeze became more distinct.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: P- Pants...! My tent is close by...!
The sight inside was one of dread and silence.
It was as though a death in a family had taken place.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...nothing fits...
My gaze drifted towards my bed.
...where someone, likely as a prank, had left a skirt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: C- Castel...!?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Castel!

I stuck my head into Castel's tent with my 
whispered yells.
Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Where did he...?

(At a time like this?! I'm gonna kill him!)

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm... An 8, maybe?
I spun to find Castel closely observing my butt.
Emphasis on "closely".

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hypotheses are made to be tested.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Undo it...!

I leaned in towards him to whisper exasperatedly 
as to not draw more attention.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: You say that, but with data from this, we could...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
*Sigh* ... Very well. That should theoretically be
possible.
Castel raised himself to a standing position.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
You will have to remove the... new apparel before
entering.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just fix it!

And my angry whisper ushered us both within to 
live for another day.
And to live for another experiment.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmm?
Tatiana leaned down with her eyes on her pants.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
A... hole? 

Dammit.
She shuffled along across the camp.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Oi. Doily girl. We got any thread and needle sets in
that stash back there?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Oh, Tatiana...? You mean for that hole in your 
pants? That might be hard to get done.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Thread is good for stitching wounds when blue 
magic isn't plentiful, after all.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
We've gone through so much in our recent 
battles... could you perhaps find another source?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Oi. Crow friend. We got any thread and needle sets 
in that stash back there?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
'fraid not. Been going through a lot of supplies in 
the recent battles.

Thread is good for stitching wounds when blue 
magic ain't plentiful, after all.

You'll have to supply your own unless it's an
emergency.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Tsk. That's my luck, alright...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: If that changes, let me know, 'kay?

As Tatiana began to walk off, a head popped 
around the corner.
One that overheard the conversation.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Oh? Hello, Tatiana... You were looking for thread?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Ai. My trousers finally ripped, so I need to close up
the hole in it.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
A few threads and a minute of work and it'd be 
done, but supplies are low.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well, if that's all, then I have a patch and bobby 
pins that you can have.

It won't be as stable as proper needlework, but it
should last until we can get more thread.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: A patch can work. Where'd you have it?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Back at my quarters. Just follow me~
Satia turned, beckoning Tatiana to follow.
The two entered Satia's personal tent.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: One moment.
Satia moved to her bag.

Rifling through it for a moment, she pulled out the
patch.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Here it is~

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Thanks, that should-

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: ...Wait.
Tatiana looked closer at it. It had a flowery design.

Specifically, it was a Peony patch. 
Prominently purple, too.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Is something wrong?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
It's... not... really my style.

Ya know... fancy flower patterns might give off the
wrong impression...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Like... I'm a noble or somethin'
She shivered a bit.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Aw, don't be like that. Flowers are something 
everyone can have.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Did you know there's a 'language of flowers'? Each 
can have different meanings.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: This one means prosperity and fortune.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Well... hmm...

She fidgeted, seemingly hesitant to take a stance
either way at first.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Nah...
She shook her head.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Appreciate the thought, but think I'll go without for
now.
She left, leaving Satia alone.

Satia stood there and watched her leave with a
thoughtful gaze.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Not a fan of flowers, perhaps...?

It could've worked... But maybe something else 
instead.
Some time later.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Alright, so we have the list for the food, the plates
for replacing broken armor, medical supplies...

Tatiana, having been keeping her ears perked for 
any tell of someone going to town, stepped 
forward into Satia's view.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: And the stuff I mentioned?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Of course, of course. We can spend some more on 
that in exchange for your help here.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Good deal, thanks!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Even for an order this size, this is a long fulfillment
time...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
We've some free time now. Did you want to go window
shop? Perhaps we can find what you need?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Yeah, that works. I have a couple things to do in town
anyways.

The two walked through the crowded 
streets together.

Satia's gaze went up and down the shop stalls and
windows.

Tatiana's gaze... drifted towards the money 
pouches in the crowd.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmm...

Tatiana slowly weaved through the crowd, and 
approached someone of higher standing, with a 
fat money pouch jingling, when...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Tatiana, I have something for you to look at. 
Where'd you go?

The voice bellowed through the crowd, drawing 
most of its gazes.

The mark was included in that, and they stepped 
away from the suspicious looking Tatiana.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Dammit, why now...?

Tatiana moved her feeet back over to Satia,
if just to see what it was about.

Satia stood in front of a tailor's shop, looking
through the materials, with something in 
one hand.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It looks nice, doesn't it?

Satia held up a green ribbon; not quite Tatiana's 
hair color, but close.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: That's... really not my kind of thing, either.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Is there something wrong with it?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
That's something someone who has too much 
money and not enough sense would buy. No 
practical use.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Looking cute is a practical use, no?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Ya know what I mean.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: *Sigh*... You find what you were looking for?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I have. What about yourself?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: They... ran out of stock before I could snatch it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well, if you're done browsing, we can always head 
back to the shop.

It shouldn't be too much longer before they're 
ready, anyways.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I still have something more to do, so go ahead. I'll
catch up once I'm done.

Tatiana proceeded to quickly walk down the street 
and right past Satia.

Satia watched as Tatiana turned a corner and out 
of sight.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmm...
So Satia followed.
And then peeked around the corner.
And then saw the slight magical aura.
And it be around Tatiana's Armored Bandit armor.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Hmm...

From the alley, Tatiana slipped silently in the 
hulking armor, the crowds none the wiser.

Satia continued to follow, observing some of 
Tatiana's actions, tracking her by the 
strangely deft footsteps of the armor.
Footsteps that... shifted.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: She's...?

Satia peeked around the corner to see the armor 
enter an alleyway, so she followed.

And as she turned her head again, she saw Tatiana 
with a small bag.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Here.

The arm extended to a small family that the armor
towered over.

lines.speaker: Family's Father
lines.text: Oh, thank you so much.

They unfurled the bag, and started 
taking food from it.

lines.speaker: Child
lines.text: *Munch*...

lines.speaker: Family's Mother
lines.text:
I don't know how you managed it, but thank you. I 
won't ask questions.
As Tatiana began to turn to leave...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: She'll spot me...!

Satia ducked back into the crowd, retreating at the
last opportunity and losing Tatiana's trail.

Tatiana and Satia had regrouped, packing the 
supplies and lugging them back to camp.
It was a quiet trip, all things considered.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Between all the mess in the town, I forgot the one
reason I actually went over there. Dammit.
She whispered under her breath.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
If you need to run back, I can wait, or assist as
needed.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Ah... n- no.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
It's just ma pants. Doesn't matter. I'll just get
somethin' for it next time.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Hmm... Alright. Do you want me to give you a 
heads up when the next group goes out on a 
supply run?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: That'd actually be great. Thank you.

The rest of the day came and went, as though a
footnote.

Tatiana had yet to fully process what had 
happened. She had yet to wind down for the day.
And in that state, she entered her room to find...

...a needle, a spool of thread... as well as a small
patch and a note.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Huh...?
Tatiana's eyes dotted across the page.
It was from Satia.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
"It's not exactly what you were looking for, but I
think these should cover up the damage without 
making it worse."

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
"Give it a shot. You can always rip it off later, after
all."
Tatiana looked back down at the patch.

It wasn't extravagant or flashy, but it did have a
slight and subtle pattern around it's border,
reminiscent of flowers.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Didn't I tell you it ain't my style...

.........

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Ah... Oh well.
The next day.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Thank you. I'll just head out now.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Sure, and-

Hm?
The Crow looked over Charlotte's shoulder, seeing...
The two looked on as she passed.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: She seems chipper.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Did she? I just noticed the patch on her pants.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Had a little embroidered pattern on it.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Huh? How did you notice that sort of detail?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm a regular eagle eye~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Though, mostly...

I didn't expect her to enjoy tailoring designs like
that.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Oh Goddess... may the light guide my magic and 
make it true! Eucrasia!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Oh goddess, may the light smite my enemies with 
the one true light! Rime!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Tsk... it did not work...

Far into the depths of a makeshift lab lay a 
certain... researcher.

Not technically a shade, but 
not technically a human either.

His experiments to return to human form had 
guided him into very different paths, and this 
is but one of them.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Oh goddess, may the light smite my enemies with 
the one true light! Rime!

The cold air surrounding a piece of raw rat meat 
began to condense and encase the meat.

Soon after, ice crystals began to form, starting from
the wettest parts of the cut and ending on the 
driest parts of the bone.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Oh Goddess... may the light guide my magic and 
make it true! Eucrasia!

The frozen piece of meat began to thaw, but as it 
did so, it began to crumble.

It fell apart into meat crystals, and those
transitioned to bloody game meat once 
more after the magic faded.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Tsk... Even if I reverse the order... the results are
similar enough.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Therefore it might be safe to discard the order as a
variable.

But if that is not it... then what could it be? Maybe
in Experiment 119, I can-

Castel looked down into an empty bucket, now filled
with game meat blood instead of any usable meat.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I need to go to the provisions tent again.

Inefficient waste of time, but I can hypothesize 
while walking...

Castel hoisted his empty bucket and started 
walking towards the cafeteria.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
There are no spells that will transform me, especially
permanently, to my original form.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Weaving multiple spells together should be a faster 
way of reaching the wanted result...

Perhaps with shorter and safer spells...?
Over crafting a new spell to make it quicker.

The bucket clattered around, creating a 
contrasting sight between the elegant 
shade and the bloodied metal.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
*Sigh*... it is good that Lady Stewart agreed to 
fund my jaunts into food preservation.

Magically sustaining hunted meat is fascinating as a
topic...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
...and also offers insight I can use for my own
preservation. To be a human once more.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Morning Castel, what do you have...

I found my eyes staring into a bucket.
One that was a bloody mess within.

...and decided some things are better off not 
known.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Combining spells seems to be a challenge no one 
has truly been able to decipher.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
There have been tales of the old days where the 
ancient delivered spells in combination, but...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: ...no record of the how exists.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(Is he... talking to me? No, he's gotta be talking to
the air.)

With an unsettling feeling from the sights and 
sounds, I stepped away cautiously, and left Castel 
to his fixation.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
From the spells available to me, I have narrowed 
down the two most likely to yield the result I want, 
Rime and Eucrasia.
 One to freeze the meat, and the other to 
preserve it without major damage to the tissue...

Hmmm...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
One of my current hypotheses is that the speed of
casting might be affecting the outcome of the 
desired result.
Therefore the speed of casting needs to be 
reduced... 

But speeding up the incantation or prayer has led 
to... tongue-twisting results.
Castel stepped into the dining tent.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Cook. I require more 'experimental' meat.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
Again!? Couldn't you use your fancy firework magic 
and capture a pigeon or rat?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
First of all, changing the ingredients of the
experiment might alter the result.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: It would be best to remain consistent.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
But I will take fault... I assumed the experiment 
would have yielded results by now.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
Ugh... fine. I'll prep you another batch.

But you should ask the boss to organize some sort 
of hunting party if you continue at this rate.

The cook's cutting knife struck down 
onto the wooden board.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
This is gonna take a sec, though, since I just 
finished a big order of pasta for a guy.

Go grab a snack or somethin' in the meantime.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I don't-
*Grrroooowwlllll*

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm... lack of sustenance might lead to a lack of
focus.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Fine, I'll take some of that.

Castel picked up some of the stuffed pasta, 
put it in a bowl...

...and sat in a corner of the room as he continued 
mumbling to themselves about potential course
corrections on their current experiments.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Cook, is that pasta ready?

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
Yeah, someone took the first bite though. But 
there is plenty more from where that came from.

Gotta say, I never would have imagined stuffing 
pasta this way.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
That's how the book said to cook it. Just adapted 
to our provisions.

Nothing too extraordinary.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
You are underselling yourself a lot, man.

Just look at that... lady... over there. She has been 
staring at the table, taking a few bites,
and repeating. 
It is clear she has been enjoying it a lot.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: If you say so.

Jude grabbed a bowl of pasta, poured some sauce, 
and sat near the full-mouthed mumbling shade.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Bush if I cansh...
*Gulp*

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
There was one teaching from the Covenant about 
magical chants...
Castel grabbed another spoonful of pasta and ate it.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Chews quietly*...

Castel could feel a slightly uninterested gaze upon
him.
It wasn't intense, but it was there.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: If I... then...
*Gulp*

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: May I... help... you?

The mercenary looked around as if expecting Castel 
to be talking to someone else.
Then he realized the shade was talking to him.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Hmmm...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Don't think so...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Very well. Good.

Castel continued to mumble to himself, but every 
time he took a bite out of the pasta, Jude 
directed his gaze toward them.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Look... if you are not going to inquire about
something, can I ask you to stop staring?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I understand this... form... is a bit distracting to
all you simple-minded mercenaries, but I am 
trying to do important research here.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Munch*... 

I can give you the recipe book on the pasta.

No research needed.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Pasta...?! I...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I'll have you know I am just waiting for my 
ingredients to be ready.

I also require sustenance. Otherwise I may not be 
able to focus while I experiment.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Hmm...

Jude's usual disinterested gaze looked ever 
so slightly brighter at the words Castel used.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I am not talking about how to make food, you simpleton.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I refer to highly important research for maintaining
and preserving food for long periods of time.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
We are talking about magic that can revolutionize 
the logistics of warfare!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Preserving food...? So... spices?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
I can recommend salt. It preserves the food and
improves the taste.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Magic. MAGIC...! Not... simple salt!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Salt can be an expensive resource.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If I get this correct, even novice mages might be 
able to cast it.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Noted...  *Munch*...

What've you tried?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I am not expecting a simple mercenary 
like you to understand.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Munch*...

"Knowledge can come from the most unexpected 
of sources"

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
...Isn't that from "Bartholomew, A theoretical view
into the advances of culture"?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Munch*...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Was that not just a cooking book in disguise?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: ...Perhaps.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I know you mercs are only good for fighting and eating.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Sigh*...

Have it your way.

Jude's disinterested gaze returned, as he turned to
focus on his meal.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Now... if only I was able to cast things a bit
quicker...

I should be able to get the desired result, but 
nothing has worked so far...

As Castel mumbled out loud, the 
mercenary interjected.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Why bother praying between castings?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Because heirlooms are her blessings...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Though... not praying to the goddess...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I have heard the hypothesis that that was the
difference between eastern and western magic.

But there has been no consistent results, from the 
few papers people have written...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Not that heretical propositions are often taken
seriously...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: W- Wait a minute...!
Castel's hands slammed down onto the table.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I should not listen to some brute whose only 
purpose is to eat, sleep and fight!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Besides, that would be heretical! A sin!

Using the goddess's power without her approval 
would be blasphemous!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Hmm...  *Munch*... You didn't strike me as the 
religious type.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Well, it isn't typically... so... relevant...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I doubt you'd understand.
Jude shrugged and continued to eat.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmph... not praying for blessings...? Ludicrous.

I... This...

How can I prove him wrong?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: You know I'm still here, right?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Say, mercenary, if you are SO SURE that your 
reasoning is true, you would not mind putting it to 
the test, right?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Munch*...

As a "mercenary", you know I don't work for free.

Can you pay?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm... the gold I have goes mostly to my research...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
How about I make a bet... I could work for you for 
a day? Whoever wins does.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Surely, my assistance in any endeavor is a valuable
offer.

Jude stood in thought for a second, 
looked at the cook,
and returned his gaze to Castel.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Sure. Deal.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Heheh...

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text: Guess we'll have an assistant in the kitchen, soon...
Bennett's eyes fluttered open at the light of dawn.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Hmm...
But she just laid there in bewilderment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're awake?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Probably. Hard to tell these days.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... You seem pretty awake?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: That's the golden question, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...There was a question?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Hey, you ever have weird dreams?
Bennett rolled up into a sitting position.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or... wait...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh... Doesn't everyone have weird dreams sometimes?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Sure, but what if they just... stopped?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That'd be a good thing, right? If they're weird 
enough to call weird in the first place, then it'd 
mean...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Yeah, it should be.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right, then I'll just...

I grabbed the item I originally entered to 
acquire and made my way out, 
leaving Bennett alone again.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Yeah, it should be a good thing.

...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: But... why do I keep seeing... that hallucination?
The camera panned over.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: I need some air.

Bennett pushed herself to her feet and exited the 
tent.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: How amusing.
This went on for several weeks.

Each time Bennett saw Liebra, she rationalized it as 
a hallucination brought out by this or that.

It was only a matter of time before it drained away 
at her mental well-being.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: ...sleep...!

The night dragged on after a recent perceived
hallucination kept Bennett's heart racing.
But this didn't last forever, and eventually...
zzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz.........

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Hmm...

Bennett wasn't sure who or what she was, and her 
head felt like it was about to burst apart at the 
seams.

The dark around swayed with the pain. It coursed
through her essence as she started to feel the 
world around once more.
And that pushed her eyes open once more.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Five... more... minutes...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Nostalgic, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Ah...?!

This dream again?! I thought it had stopped?!

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: And it had. Consider this a recreation.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: A... what? A recreation?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Indeed. Much as we are.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
I think I lost the plot on that one. 
What do you mean?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Alas, in this state we lack the connection we once 
did, so I cannot simply know your thoughts 
intuitively.
Is it safe to assume you have not explored the 
nature of our existence here?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
I mean... I was curious, but I've woken up in a 
strange world before.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Really I've just been trying to stay alive and keep 
my wits about me.

While looking for Penny, Cal, Harper, and the rest, 
of course.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Then shall I elucidate to you the nature of our 
beings here?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
...

You're... being surprisingly open.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
You and I play no notable role in the story here, so
I've no reason to hold back.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Though if that changes, I will certainly let you know.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Yeah, that feels about right.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Then, your explanation?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
As I said, we are recreations.

Bodies given thought and form from a basis of 
dormant memories.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
It appears that this is the basis of several magics
here in this time.

To draw upon the memories to give form and 
power to a machination of the caster.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
And this includes the summoning magic that 
created both of us.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: You make it sound... like we're not real.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: We are not.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Hmm... I feel pretty real.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: As do I. To the point of incredulity.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Even for the human lives I have lived, they were 
never in the form of my self image as a Will as this 
is.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
So... you really were walking around the camp as...
that?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
And I see you can imagine the intrigue I've had on 
the subject.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
The core thesis is, though, that we are indeed "not
real". Not the originals, at least.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
With memories picked from the soil itself, we are 
more akin to computers running old code.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Our story is in a different place and time, seen to its
finale by our originals.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: This is... a lot to take in.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
In a sense, there's even no guarantee any of those
created by summoning were ever real in the first 
place.
After all, artificial memories are just as malleable as
our own.

Books, moving pictures, games... They very well 
could be sources for these summonings, as well, if 
the summoner stumbles upon it.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: And now we've got existential crises as a side dish.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: *Chuckles*...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
If it helps, I do think that doesn't apply to us, if
simply because we were both summoned 
independently of one another.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
And even moreso because the underlying nature of 
the world matches my understanding of it, still.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Mmm... I should be more upset over this.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
*Sigh*... maybe I'm just dulled to the idea of not
feeling like my old self?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Or maybe I'm just happy you're being open about 
it?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Hmm... While I came to some conclusions via my
knowledge of the world, much of what I learned is 
what I learned while here.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Yeah, yeah. And I was too busy just trying to stay
alive to figure it out.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
You were too busy worrying about others, like your
friends from our original struggle.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: As you often have.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
So... does us being memories mean this is... the
future?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Not necessarily.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: "Memories are timeless"

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
It was a lesson often drilled into my head in a past
life.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: That's... quite a phrase. What does it even mean?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
It means that memories have a tendency to slip 
into different parts of history.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
In Aldania, there were professions designated as
"oracles".

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Their job was to connect with Daega that could 
give hints and prophecy of the future by way of 
their recollections.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Uh... "Aldania"...? "Daega"...?

That's a lot proper nouns to dump onto me.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Ah yes... I suppose you haven't gotten to that 
point.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: *Chuckle*... In due time, then.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
The ultimate point is that there is no guarantee of
where or when we are, relative to our experiences.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
It may well be the future. 
Or the distant past. 
Or "other".

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Like this could be just another "other world" like 
the expanse was?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Hmm... I wonder.
The discussion ended up pausing at that point.

It was enough time for some more morbid 
thoughts to bubble up in Bennett's head.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
You know... with how you talk about it all... Does 
this mean we ended up dying, after all?

These memories would be... from like where we fell 
in the expanse?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: An easy enough theory to test.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Bennett Morrison, what is the last thing you 
remember?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Hmm... Good question.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
I think... we were headed off to try to rescue Mia 
and help the students at a school?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Though it's all admittedly a bit... muddled, when I
think about it too hard.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Then right before the beginning of the end...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Wait, do you remember more?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Yes.

My memories go well beyond.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: So what ended up happening?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
That I cannot say with certainty. My memories stop
before the grand finale.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
No need to fret, though. I can confirm it was
entertaining all the same to that point, as well.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: You know that's not the important part.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
I will admit, being denied the finale and closure of it
does leave a bitter taste in mouth.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Though perhaps all the more reason to stay alive 
here and watch the Pup's journey to its end?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: I guess...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
...it is sort of comforting to see that you're still
like this even now.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Then what say you? Shall you join me?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
In this reprieve of an epilogue we've been granted,
shall we watch over the new protagonists in their
struggle until the last page?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Well... I've honestly never thought about it like
that...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Will you actually explain to me how all this crap
works, for once?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
If so, then... sure. At this point I think I'd be up
for that.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Then, to "The End" of one more adventure...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: ...together.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Yeah...

...together.

think about it too hard.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Then right before the beginning of the end...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: Wait, do you remember more?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Yes.

My memories go well beyond.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: So what ended up happening?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
That I cannot say with certainty. My memories stop
before the grand finale.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
No need to fret, though. I can confirm it was
entertaining all the same to that point, as well.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: You know that's not the important part.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
I will admit, being denied the finale and closure of it
does leave a bitter taste in mouth.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Though perhaps all the more reason to stay alive here
and watch the Pup's journey to its end?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text: I guess...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
...it is sort of comforting to see that you're still
like this even now.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Then what say you? Shall you join me?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
In this reprieve of an epilogue we've been granted,
shall we watch over the new protagonists in their
struggle until the last page?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Well... I've honestly never thought about it like
that...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Will you actually explain to me how all this crap
works, for once?

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
If so, then... sure. At this point I think I'd be up
for that.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Then, to "The End" of one more adventure...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: ...together.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Yeah...

...together.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> GIVE SUPPORT REWARDS (C)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Keep your eyes forward. I'm your opponent today.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: B- But...?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh! Why?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Have YOU met an enemy that would be merciful 
in this scenario? Focus.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
B- But what if Castel comes to start another
experiment?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Look... You were the one that asked me 
to help you train.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Honestly? It... gave me a good excuse to appear 
busy.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Sigh*... Sir, why me...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Pup!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh shi-

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Pup, I have rerun some calculations from my initial
hypothesis, and I think that the next experiment 
will be more fruitful than the last.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ehh... ahh... I am currently busy... sparring with...
Norde.

With a blade stabbing into the ground with a thud,
Norde's eyes trained themselves on me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Right?

And I was on my back.

Norde had swiftly brought down a heavy
blow that I barely blocked.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: O- Ow...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm... a bruised body might yield an unexpected 
outcome in the experimental results.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... we can... ow... do this another day, right?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm... No, I don't think so.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
There's an argument to be made that it can make the
Blue magic act faster and be more effective.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I may have to adjust some numbers, but...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Happy to help.
Norde raised the axe up to strike.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh fuck...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Aghh~ That was close...!

The deliberate movements had made it more
predictable, so I was able to dodge.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You know... Castel...
I turned towards Castel as I got to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What makes you think this time it'll work?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I AM a professional, you know?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I started small and have built to this stage of the
experiment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Small to... large...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That brings some feelings of deja vu...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Keep your eyes locked on your opponent, Anton.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Huh?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
B- But... what about last time...?! With the
shrinking... a- and the... b- butt stuff?!
Norde's swing had been dodged.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Research is a matter of progress. To fail last time
paves the path forward for this time to succeed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How about the time when you did the opposite?

My back hurt due to the size of the melons 
attached to my chest!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It was a learning experience for both of us. 
Datasets must be thorough to prove effective for 
predictive experimentation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How about the time you made my hair shorter?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm? I thought you couldn't cut it?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
That is the issue we developed the experiment to 
deal with, indeed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But it back grew out within a matter of days... and 
it left me starved and malnourished.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
By that point, it was... within expectation. And
enlightening.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Using what we have learned from those 
experiments, I believe I have found the next step.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Step" is different than "solution"...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Only time and test runs may tell us if they are one 
and the same here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I... don't know...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
*Sigh*... so this can offer... what? A greater 
control over this curse?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Indeed. Of all people you'd understand the desire.
Perhaps you'd like to act as a lab assistant in-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Don't... just don't...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fine...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Excellent. You know where I have my mobile lab 
setup, then?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Unfortunately...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You really do make the most of what you're given.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Though I imagine it looks more impressive than it
really is.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So... what's next?

Are you going to make my hair longer to see if my 
chest grows smaller?

Or maybe a tonic that shortens my hair, but makes 
my lips plumper?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah.... Wait... To note, don't take those as
suggestions...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Every new thought helps.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
*Clears throat*... Anyways, the procedure should 
be simple this time so long as you have some
imagination.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you asking? Is this an insult?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
An actual question. Experiments have shown that 
some people can't imagine things when someone 
tells them to.
For this specific experiment, it is important that you
know how to visualize within your mind's eye.

Can you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh... yes? If you tell me to imagine a red apple...
I'll picture a red apple...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
This technique comes from a certain cosmetic 
medical technique originating in Rabaneau.

It involved picturing yourself as something specific.
It will guide the magic to change you in that 
specific way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So... if I think of myself as an apple, I will
transform into an apple!?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm... If it makes you think more precisely, let's 
just assume it will.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Got it! ...so do not think of red, juicy apples...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Damn, shouldn't have eaten one just before training...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Focus, Baranov. I want you to picture yourself as a
man.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... am I?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If you wish control over this, then those remnants 
of your previous self image may be your best shot.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Argh... what do you want out of me?! All you're 
doing is stressing me out more with this all...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But... I am a man?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Is that what you think?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just because... I'm like... like...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I am me. I'm a guy inside. A man. No matter what
happens.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
The emotional reaction seems a bit unnecessary... I
might have "struck a nerve".

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Anyway, continue those thoughts. I will cast some
spells, and I will tell you when I am done.

So close your eyes. Picture yourself as a man.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Think of all the stories we were told when we 
were young. Of heroes and legends...)

(Think of how strong and powerful they were. 
How able they were able to guide everyone to a 
better fate...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Think on... uh... how they're... uh... pretty buff?
Yeah. Strong guys with a manly chest.)

(Reminds me of that training I just did... and the
apples before...)

(Those apples... remind me my breasts...)

(They felt different from apples... The nipples on 
one hand... pretty hard to ignore... They rub on
EVERYTHING!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Wait...)
