I realized my train of thought had gotten 
distracted. My idle, wandering thoughts had taken 
over just enough to...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Pup... Wake up...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
...How are you feeling? Any different...? You don't
physically seem different.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I feel... good?
I checked other parts of my body.

My breasts were the size they were before. My hair 
and rear were as well.
Everything in check. Everything normal for a girl.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Wait...)

I am a b- b-... girrrlll...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Excuse me? Yes, you are a girl as it stands...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait, no. Castel, you're misunderstanding. I am...
like... girl...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Less like and more are. But yes. You are "like" a girl.
We are trying to control that process.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Has the spell messed with you mentally?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It totally, like, did! I can't get it out of my head!
It's like a tick or somethin'!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's all like, getting harder to think that I was a
girl, I mean b- b- ...girl!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Please, like, do something!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Huh... What a perplexing side effect. I certainly
didn't anticipate this result...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: You... were picturing yourself as a man?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Like, yeah! I was thinking of burly men, and then I
imagine my bouncing boobies...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...and how, like, good they felt when they rubbed
against, like my bra, and my cute clothes...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: So you ignored the instructions.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's not, like, it was my fault or anything...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Well, it wasn't MY fault. This was supposed to be...

...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
No... no... it was my fault... I did not account for
human error and the subject's incompatibility to
comprehend the task at hand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I am now totally lost...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Lessons have been learned.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Perhaps this is reason to go back to the drawing 
board, though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait... are we, like, done?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I am afraid so.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You can't, like, leave me like this! Everyone will
totally laugh at me!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I can't do anything at the current time.

There may be an option if you truly want to be a 
man. To control this curse...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I, like, totally want to!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like, j- just watch me!
I stormed off from the lab... angrily skipping.

Luckily enough, I returned to normal a couple days
after that.

title: SP: Pup x Castel A - Begining

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm... All my past attempts have ended in 
failure...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
What am I missing...?

Think, Castel. There is something you are missing...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I have eliminated the obvious and unconventional, 
so I guess the only thing left to try is...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

I found myself deep in thought as I stood naked in
front of a mirror.

I was at a point where I had decided to give being 
a girl a sincere try, and my habits were shifting 
due to it.

Charlotte had slowly worn me down to take care 
of myself a bit more...

...from a feminine perspective.

I can't say I was a fan at first... but the results had
me intrigued.

Uncomfortable as bras could be, that sensation of
intrigue outpaced it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Bouncy...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Mister and/or Miss Baranov, I found a new 
experiment that might help your predicament.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Argh...!

And so, Castel nonchalantly opened the door to 
the changing room, and I caught my breath.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmmm...? Unwarranted reaction, I feel.

Castel mentioned as much after a brief glance at 
both of our bodies.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Castel, how many times have I told you to knock 
on the door!?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: 13 times, with this time, it would be 14.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Are you experimenting with something? It isn't as
though we aren't both female at this point.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What? No! Is just that... I am not a fan of... 
someone seeing my naked body...

Or at least, after the last time... Charlotte lectured
me... so... so much...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Noted.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Anyway, I have come to the realization about our
experiments so far-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Castel. Still naked.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I don't mind. For the experiments, I believe-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Out.

I shouted as I pushed Castel out the door with a 
hip check, due to my preoccupied hands.
*Slam*...!

Shut out of the room, Castel touched his own 
breasts.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmm... So our shared situation isn't enough to 
allow that comfortability... 

I may need to look more into that later.

lines.speaker: Pup
Pup
lines.text: (What if I just... slip out the window...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Foundation, lipstick, powder, eye shadow...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Or was it powder, foundation, eyeshadow, 
lipstick...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... How do girls do this every day...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Actually, have I even ever seen Charlotte with all
this on...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Might as well try something... Maybe the lipstick...?)

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Mister and/or Miss Baranov! About the other day's
experiment...

Castel, as usual, surprised me while I was trying to
apply lipstick.

The surprise created a red line that perfectly
delineated my jaw.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Castel. Knock.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Must we? Time is such a valuable resource...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Anyways. What I was trying to say the other day 
was about the experiments...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I found a way to transform us back to being males.
I had to shake my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Castel... I'm a girl. A woman.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: And I believe to have the key to control that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like talking to a brick wall.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...
I grabbed a powder puff from the makeup set.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sorry, gotta run!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ugh...!
Castel looked at their powder face in the mirror.

His face, unusually white, looked more so like a
clown than a proper lady.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Such an enigma... Is it worth research itself? No, I
have this experiment to finish.

Castel never gave up. He kept trying and trying to
convince me into performing an experiment.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Mister and/or Miss Baranov. May I-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Castel! I'm bathing...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: One can multi-task...?!
At the most inopportune times...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Mister and/or Miss Baranov. May-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Biam Beabing (I am eating)!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
That doesn't need to stop us. If we just have you
strip-
All I could do was run away at times...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Mister and/or Miss-
A sword narrowly missed Castel.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How do I not look busy...?!
Until one day when I was about to go to sleep...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Mister and/or Miss Baranov. You seem a bit more 
relaxed at this moment. Perhaps I can proceed with 
the experiment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... Guess I have to do this...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Truly? Excellent. I brought the equipment with me, 
so it will just be-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not the experiment. I decided to be clear with 
you.

Castel...

I swiveled myself to face Castel sincerely and
directly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I want to live as a woman.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or... the best shot I can do at it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
A lot has happened. A lot I had no say in. I just...
Just give me this, okay?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Then... I am too late to fix my mistakes...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, no. It's not your fault.
Despite this, Castel began to mumble to himself.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: ...failure...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Was that... directed at me...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I may not know how to act as a man or woman any 
more, but I am by no means a failure.

You have experimented with me like a guinea pig 
since I met you. My body has changed into things 
beyond my understanding.
I have given you try after try, and you call me a
failure!?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Heheh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...You're... You're laughing now?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Miss Baranov... you fail to understand that you have
been my number one priority since I have joined 
your band of mercenaries.
Day in and out I have experimented with myself.

Formulated theories, read on research and applied 
my knowledge into simply executing experiments 
for you.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: But I understand.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I understand I may come across as little more than 
an annoyance that comes up at the most 
inopportune times. 
A failure...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I suspect the depth of my effort does not come 
across to your perception.
We both sat there in silence.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Perhaps I should stop... perhaps I should leave all
together.

It is not like my lab won't accept me back with this
form... perhaps...

We both stood in front of one another, 
an exasperated smile forming on our lips.

Our bodies, shaped beyond recognition due 
extreme circumstances inflicted on our bodies.

For better and for worse, respectively for each.

Both our eyes had puffy black marks, indicating our
lack of sleep. It seemed that we were both tired.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... I didn't mean it like that...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Look... I'm sorry...

I've taken for granted how much effort you've put 
in for my sake.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I apologize, as well.

I allowed myself to become unprofessional.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If you feel comfortable in your current body... I will
stop asking you to perform experiments.

It isn't as though I've a lack of options to satiate 
my curiosity these days.

Castel relaxed further and started to stare off into
nothing.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I myself can only claim indifference to my form on 
my best days.

The feminine elements feel alien to me, and the 
non-human ones even more.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I thought, even through a brave face, you felt the
same.

That was the source of my insistence and drive.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... It was scary.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The weight on my chest is still something I am 
getting used to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But it was the change that was scary.
Not the end result, in the end.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
For a time it seemed like that whenever I got used  
to them, they just got bigger again...
A silence fell onto us again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Say... Castel...

If you are still open to experiments, I do have one
request.

I still want to keep trying to be a woman... but 
what if we find a way to control it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't know how big my breasts are going to grow 
to, or if my mind and body will change any further.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So... what if that was the focus? And we drop the 
idea of me, at least, changing back.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm... a refined control over a pure reversion?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean... assuming it's even an option on the table.

Is it? Is it possible?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Perhaps. Do not get your hopes up.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Then again, maybe your new mindset can work miracles in
this.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If there is one thing I've learned over our efforts...

...it is that the first step of making this line of 
research work... is the subject truly wanting it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe it'll work, then?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: It might take a lot of tries... and a lot of time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If you're like this for it, I'll gladly follow you in
that pursuit this time.

I am the one asking now, after all.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Well, then the first step is to schedule time for our
efforts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I might be... a bit busy lately.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, wait... I still need to eat most days.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe over a meal?

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Oh, wait... Uh...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It does sound apt to approach it as such. Less
miscommunication, for one.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
And I feel as though I know one half of you extremely
well.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
But... the other half? I can barely say I've scratched
the surface.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know, this is actually starting to sound like... a
d- date...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I hadn't thought of that, but it does fit.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm... It sounds nice, though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
After all this, it does feel like a nice change of
pace, at least.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Is "dating" a patient against your code of conduct 
or something, though?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Or... doing... "date like" things?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I suspect my current condition would be a bigger 
deal breaker than that should I return to the 
academy.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If anything, I wonder when you'll choose if your 
talk of a "date" is a joke or sincere.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
One more thing to answer in our experiments, 
then?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
And... one more reason for us to simply sit back 
and enjoy the scientific process.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure. "Scientific process" it is, then.
*Thump*
The sound of scampering paws jolted back to me.
*Thump*
And the sound of paws, once more.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks, boy. I think I'm gonna go harder this time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grrrhhhaaaaa!!!

I threw a rubber ball. It was one of Jakson's few 
toys that he hadn't managed to destroy.

Yet.

He liked rope-like textures, but those didn't last
long. Dolls and other toys were destroyed in 
seconds.
*Thump*

The ball landed further away than the previous 
tosses.
However, for Jakson, it was only a few more hops.

For me, it was way more effort than it often
seemed to be worth, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Good boy!

I patted him on the head.

Before I could throw it again, a knight in black 
armor called me for duty.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It's your turn on the training schedule now.

...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Make sure to wash your hands of Jakson's drool.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Jakson, I need to leave you for a bit. I'll come back
soon, okay, boy?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Agitated whining*...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Is something the matter?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Jakson seems to have a bit more energy than 
usual...

Out of the corner of my eye, a distinct outfit of 
white and blue caught my attention.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Charlotte!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Eh, what? Did something happen?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Can you play fetch with Jakson while I train?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He... has a bit more energy today than usual.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I guess?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I just have to throw the ball and wait for him to 
bring it back, right? I can do that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Perfect! Thanks!

Dropping Jakson's ball into Charlotte's hand, I 
trotted off to join Norde for training.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Okay, so... this ball...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...has a lot more drool than I thought... 
Can I clean this up first?

Charlotte grabbed a nearby cloth and carefully 
patted down the moisture.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Anticipatory stare*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There we go. Now, then... fetch!

Charlotte launched the ball forward as far as she
could. After a short bit, Jakson returned the ball.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hey, good boy. You...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah... How does it have even more drool now?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Well, I'm not wasting more cleaning cloth 
for that lost cause.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: But... I do have an idea...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup just asked me to tire you out, right?

She looked around before settling her eyes on a 
nearby tree.

She chucked the ball into the tree. The ball 
bounced on it, hit the ground, and returned to 
Charlotte's hand.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine* ...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What's the matter, boy? Can't catch this?

Charlotte repeated the movement over and over 
again, taunting Jakson more and more.

Jakson looked at the ball, waiting for his chance to
strike.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
*Leans into hunting position*

...

.........

...!

Suddenly, before the ball could bounce on the 
floor, Jakson had caught it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good job!
Jakson strolled over to Charlotte, ball in mouth.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Drools*

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Okay... now drop the ball...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Stares in 'No take, only throw'*

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*...

Charlotte robotically lowered her arm to take it from
him, as if to detach herself from the act.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Eww... eww... eww...  *Sigh*... There it is.

With the ball in hand, Charlotte chucked the ball 
as hard as she could, almost like she was trying
to spin the drool off of it.

She returned to bouncing the ball on the tree 
while changing the rhythm to make it harder for 
the dog to catch.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Hmmmmmm...! Nothing like a good exercise to 
stretch the muscles.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Jakson! Where are you, boy?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Shhh! He is sleeping!
Besides Charlotte, lay a big sleeping beast.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (A once mighty beast tamed by a beau-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(...by a maide-)

...

(...by Charlotte.)
Jakson just snored away, none the wiser.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He's that tired out? How'd you manage it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh, just a few throws here and there. Nothing too
fancy.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Do you want me to teach you how to train your own dog?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha... funny. I'm good.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Come on, Jakson. Time to get going.

I poked and petted my dog until he woke up, and 
he walked towards my tent.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Eh, not a bad way to spend an afternoon.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Zzz...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Zzz...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...GAH!

In the middle of the night, a heavy weight 
thumped itself down onto Charlotte's stomach.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...I- Is this what night terrors feel like...?

Charlotte squirmed around to free her hand, and 
through that was able to get a feel of what had 
landed on her.
Whatever brown and furry lump had landed on her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait... this feels like...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Jakson...!?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Yaaawwnnnnniiinngggg whine* ...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
D- Don't look at me like it's my fault that you woke
up!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What am I supposed to...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Sigh*... fine... I'll share my bed with you 
tonight... but just for tonight, ok?
*Shuffle*...  *Slide*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...?
*Shuffle*...  *Slide*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: W- Wait...! At this rate, I'm gonna faaallll...!?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Okay. That's it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Eh... what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Dog.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What does that...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
DOG.

Your dog was in my tent. 
Made me fall. 
Take him now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Yawwnnn*... Sure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Jakson... come on in, buddy.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Midnight energetic pants*

Charlotte carefully folded up a recently cleaned 
and dried dress.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Okay, done. Now time to head back to-

With a basket of clothes in her hands, Charlotte 
peeked around it to see what had bumped into 
her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, hey there Jakson. What do you have here...?

Jakson had a white and blue striped piece of 
clothing hanging from his snout.
It seems to have been heavily sniffed...
...and licked.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...Why...?

Why... Why slobber over it?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: PUUPPP...!!!!!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Take care of your... your... your horny dog!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: My...? "Horndog"...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Just do it!
Charlotte left stomping the ground.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Horndog"...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sort of has a fun ring to it.

I looked over to Jakson, who had a strip of cloth 
still on him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah... Underwear again?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Looking away*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You gotta stop doing that, bud.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Feigning ignorance whine*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Finally... a moment of peace while I enjoy my food.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...I know that sound...

As Charlotte looked to her left, a brown sack of fur
sat down, heavily drooling over Charlotte's food.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Do you somehow know that this is one of my 
favorite foods amongst what we actually can get 
here?
No, you can't have it.

Charlotte took her plate slowly... 
and slowly stood up.

Jakson slowly stood up as well, paying close 
attention to the leaving plate.

And she ran! With the brown fuzzball in a sprint 
not far behind.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What makes you think I was going to give you a 
piece in the first place?!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Hopeful bark*...!

As Charlotte was running, she identified a familiar
location.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, that's it!

Charlotte found herself right in front of the tree 
from when she played ball with Jakson before.

She remembered that the tree had a few climbable
branches.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I will... not... relent...!

With only one hand available, she balanced her food 
and climbed the tree at the same time.
*Snap*...  *Snap*... *Snap*...

A few branches snapped as Charlotte clumsily 
climbed up the tree.

Before Jakson could catch up, Charlotte was sitting 
on a sturdy branch, looking from above as...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What's the matter, boy? I see trees are still your
weakness.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Munch*... *Munch*... *Munch*...

I have to say... food after some exercise does taste
better.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whine*...*Whine*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Slow munch*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... Fine... Here, have a piece.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Excited bark*!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ahhhh~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: It was pretty good in the end, right Jakson?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Agreeable bark*

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Now I just have to...

Charlotte looked at the broken branches 
on the ground.
She was looking straight down.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I- Is it me, or is the height suddenly feel more...
dangerous...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hey... Jakson... if I jump down... would you catch 
me?
Jakson left.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Jakson...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Jakson, I shared my food with you, you coward!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm not even heavy!

...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Jakson, come back here!

.......

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Anyone?!

Help!

HEEELLLPPPP!!!!!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Faster!

Norde sprinted around a corner, with Castel lagging 
behind.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I am... *pant*... going as fast... *pant*... as I... 
can...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
You.... You may recall... My feet are tiny and not 
well equipped for-
Castel slammed into Norde’s back.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Oof...!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: So, that’s it then.

Norde was staring at a cobblestone wall. 

A dead end.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What an astute observation.
A gang of shadowy thieves rounded the corner.

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: We’ve got you cornered now, curs. Prepare to die!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Tsk...
Earlier that day...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
The contact is a nekolyn merchant from the 
Outlands.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Fascinating. It seems my hypothesis was correct...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Pardon...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I speculated that, given your status, you’d have 
developed connections to ensure you could
acquire whatever the Crows needed.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Hmph...

Be that as it may, it’s not an option I like to rely on.

This region isn’t exactly known for locals with... 
tolerant attitudes. Therefore this merchant is 
somewhat “underground”.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Since it’s going to be a stealth operation anyway, 
we may as well see how some of your theories on
persuading people hash out.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hypotheses can rarely be tested without risk. 

I accept.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Then the meeting time is dusk. And
the meeting point...
Later that night...

The duo donned their hoods as a mob of unruly 
townspeople rushed past.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Act casual, and don’t make any sudden moves.

Part of the mob broke off from the larger group 
and started heading towards them.

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text:
Where are you two going? Don’t you know there’s 
a hunt going on?

...And what’s with those hoods? Are ya hidin’ 
somethin’?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We’re just on our way home. My sister, she’s... 
very sick.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
You see the sickness has, uh... ruined my 
appearance. I’m self conscious about it, and my 
sibling here is commiserating.

The rioter stared at them suspiciously for a few 
tense moments.

.........

A group of guards surged out of a nearby alleyway.

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
I hereby command all miscreants to disperse!

You’re disturbing the public order.

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text:
What? We just started the hunt. Old Eowyn said 
she saw one doing something devious just a heavy
minute ago!

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
Well, if someone gets a lead more than runnin’ 
around like a chick with its head cut off, I’ll let ya
know.
Til then, stop keeping all the good citizens up with 
your noise.

The moon may as well drop on down on us if you 
keep up that ruckus.

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: Ah... Tsk, fine!
The lead rioter started to disperse the group.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: That would be our cue to leave, no?
Ducking into a nearby alleyway...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: That was a smart move. Good job.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Thank you, but...

Let’s just get this over with before they regroup.

Norde knocked on an inconspicuous door on the 
side of a nearby building.

Cat styled ears poked out the door first, and a 
young male nekolyn stuck his head out.

lines.speaker: Nekolyn
lines.text: Oi, you two need to get out of here!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We won’t take too long. We just need to make 
the pickup I had...

lines.speaker: Nekolyn
lines.text:
Are you blind? Can’t see you see they’re staking me 
out?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: “They” being...?

lines.speaker: Nekolyn
lines.text: *Sigh*... just the usual miscreant lot.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I think we met the ones you’re talking about.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: They seemed violent. Are you in any danger?

lines.speaker: Nekolyn
lines.text:
It’s fine. This happens every now and again. Just 
gotta hunker down. 

Tis what happens when I forget my
hat before goin’ out for the day...

Anyways... I need to keep on the downlow, so 
shoo. And you two be safe, too.
The door slammed shut.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Well, then... That ended splendidly. What now?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: New hypothesis: you’ve gotten us hopelessly lost.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Not helping. 

Don’t do something unnecessary to 
draw attention to-

Norde’s words stopped themselves.

..........

A soft sound could be heard in the silent night.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What is...?
Castel moved towards it.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Wait... it...
Castel turned the corner, to see...

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: *Sniff*...

A young girl sobbing quietly in the 
corner of the alley.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Castel, we need to prioritize-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Excuse me, miss. But you appear to be in a state of 
great distress and I...

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: Eek! A ghost, now?! Don’t hurt me!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I- I’m no ghost. I’m a shade. A shade...! See?

Castel's robe, which was meant to hide him,
floated towards the ground.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: W- Where did...?!

A slight bump arose from the robe, and it scattered 
along before exiting as... a rodent.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: *Sniff*... You’re... a rat...?

Castel’s form re-emerged and the robe burst up 
into the air.

...and Norde went chasing after it as the winds 
above pushed it away.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Er... a “rodent” would be more taxonomically 
correct. But essentially, yes.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: Then... why... do you look like that?
Something blocked out Castel’s sight.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You dropped your robe...

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text:
And why does your friend have scales... and funny 
ears?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Mmm...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I’m a dragon.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: A- A dragon...!?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: One that scares away the bad guys...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
As... As the same with I.

I am a being of magic, sent by the Goddess to 
protect lost little girls in Zened’s blighted night.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text:
R- Really...? Daddy says there are a lot of bad 
people in the town.

Wicked creatures who want to poison and kill and 
kidnap and maim and-

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I can assure you we mean to do none of that...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Consider us a shield against those beings that have 
broke their oath to the Goddess.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text:
...*Sniff*...

You seem... nice.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Where do you and your ‘Daddy’ live? We’ll guide 
you home safely.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: I... *sniff*... I think we live...

The click of the door opening was paralleled by 
Norde and Castel disappearing around the corner.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text: Where did they...?

The girl’s surprise was cut off by the jubilation of 
a fatherly figure seeing her.

lines.speaker: Sad Girl
lines.text:
Heheh~ Daddy!

You wouldn’t believe what happened! The 
Goddess sent me a miracle!

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: There they are...!

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: Get ‘em! They tried to abduct a young girl!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: No, we...
A small, growing mob started to encircle the two.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ideas...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Don’t get caught in the first place.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Sigh*... And leave that little girl to her fate?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No, it was the right move.

Those with the power to act have an obligation to 
act when the vulnerable are within arm’s reach.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmph. I’ll accept that.

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: Everyone, on three...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then it'll come to-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Wait, is that... horse hooves...?

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: Three, two... one...!

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text: HOLD!

The constable burst into the scene on horseback, 
flanked by some of the village guard.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah... That can’t be good.

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text: Put down your weapons!

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: Yeah! Put down that axe and let us kill ya’ proper!

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
...

I wasn’t talking about them, you stonehead.

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text:
Heh...?! But one’s a savage lizard thing! And she’s... 
a... uh...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: A SHADE, you dolt!

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text:
W- Why are you stoppin’ us, constable? What, are 
you gonna charge US with some crime?!

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
How about disturbing the peace? Violating curfew?

Even possession of contraband, based on some of 
the weapons I see here.

lines.speaker: Rioter
lines.text: I... But... Why would you...?

After a few meager attempts at protest and a 
stern gaze from the constable, the mob finally 
submitted to the guards.

The constable trotted his horse over to the duo 
once the situation was well in hand.

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text: You two holding up? Not gonna keel over, are ya?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We are well, all things considered.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
But... I did not expect help after how you talked 
about us before.

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
Hmph... Some of y’all beastie sorts killed my wife a 
few years back.

But...

*Sigh*... There’s probably a good one or two of 
ya. Doin’ what you did and all...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: We’re happy to be of service, but what–

Just then their eyes settled on the horse’s other 
occupant.

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Hi, ghost lady! And hello dragon too~!
Norde and Castel exchanged a look of incredulity.

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
“Those with the power to act have an obligation to 
act when the vulnerable are within arm’s reach.”

Heh...

It’s good that lot was rowdy enough to hear from a 
mile away.

lines.speaker: Young Girl
lines.text: Did I do good, daddy?

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
Yes, dear.

Now let’s get you to bed before you get yourself 
into any more trouble.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: So... we’re free to go, then?

lines.speaker: Constable
lines.text:
Well, I would arrest you, too...

But I have a feeling the jails are going to be awfully 
full tonight.

The constable mounted his horse and trotted 
away.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Well, that was unexpected.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
To say the least. But I suppose it worked out in 
the end.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Speaking of which, I owe you an apology.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: What for?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You were right. In the end, we changed 
someone’s heart... if only slightly.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I can’t remember the last time I saw even a scrap 
of that sort of progress.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: A good academic never refuses credit.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
However, it's obvious that luck played a big role in 
this outcome.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
True, but luck only created the opportunity.

Your determination to see this through 
was what made it possible.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hrm?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
You know, it's funny. I was so sure that logic held 
the ultimate power to change hearts.

But in the end it was merely...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...humanity?

The two looked over their non-homlyn forms.

Their two “non-human” forms.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmph.

Indeed!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey, Kara...!

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Lady Kara...!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Can you...

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Wait, have you...?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Sigh*...

Voices bombard Kara, and all she could do was try
to parse each one as they spoke.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's sort of important...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We'll be off schedule if we don't...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
*Clears throat*... 

If everyone could allow me to speak?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: One at a time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well-

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Not one at a time in asking. 

I have already heard each. 

One at a time in my answers.

Kara patted down her wardrobe and took a quick, 
deep breath.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Pup, the sword from training was collected and
accounted for. Check the storeroom.

Norde, the order was handed off to the carrier 
already. You'll need to go after him on horseback.

And you two will need to fix the sharpening edge. 
New ones would be hard to come by out here.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Now, now. Let's not stand around here while work is to
be done.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I need to check that. Thanks!
The circle surrounding Kara had dispersed.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Exhale*...

But one more set of footsteps signaled another
approach.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Lady Kara.

Kara spun towards the voice.

Elliot was there to meet it, though the 
face across was unexpected.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: May I help you?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
...

I was wondering where the tea preparation 
materials were kept.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Sigh*... Of course.
Kara took a deep breath.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: They are...
...and explained the storage arrangement to Elliot.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Thank you. That will be invaluable info.

...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Might... you wish to join me?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I appreciate the offer, but I am quite busy.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The blend I got my hands on is quite exquisite. It is 
a luxury in the east.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Perhaps I can make time for one cup, then?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: That's lovely to hear.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: So, how long have you and Mr. DeClares been engaged?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Oh, the better part of a year, I believe.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Do you have a date for the wedding?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Hmph. If the man would show his face around me 
more often, that could be arranged.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
For now, I'm happy enough to let us pursue our 
goals.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
*Giggle*... Having my string around his finger to 
lead me back to him is enough... for now.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
You sound like you have an understanding of each 
other.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm... I wonder, at times.
Kara placed her cup down and poured a second.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
How has he been treating you?

You said that you are a squire assisting him in his
auditing duties?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Yes, I'll often visit Vaults and other Covenant sites.

I help trim off the excess of his work, and we "split
the load", as Mr. DeClares often says.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Then you must have quite the stories.

What sort of locations has Cainan been to recently?
What was his side of the work?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Has he not told you?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Many a times. But I imagine there are details he
forgot, didn't include, or hasn't gotten the chance 
to tell me.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Well, he recently went south to...

Elliot described their work schedule in detail. Kara
listened in with a calm face, but focused ears.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: ...and then, we'd meet back in Oadthine when done.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Very interesting...

She sat there and took a sip of tea as she 
pondered.

As she did, Elliot started to feel awkward in the
silence.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is exquisite, I might add.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The tea. It is as luxurious as you boasted.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Ah... that?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It is a blend from the east after all. I make an effort
to have one of several high end brands on hand.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It has a familiar scent...

Is this a blend from Nodhan?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Yes, it is...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As good as it is, I would not rate it above the
Republic's blend from Rasmus.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Many things from there do tend to outpace their
competitors from the Emerald Empire.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It can be quite difficult to get a hold of... with the
Crusades disrupting trade in the east and all...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
So, I try to acquire some tea bags of this brand 
when the opportunity appears.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
But yes, I also prefer blends from outside the 
Emerald Empire.

Aureria's traditions in the space are to be lauded, as
an example.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You won't hear about Aurerian tea in the west 
very often. Are you just a connoisseur, or...?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I was born in and grew up in Aureria, yes. My family
has ties to the Covenant leadership there.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Well, for your knowledge, I did as well.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: You did... what?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I was born in Aureria, like you. I spent a good 
chunk of my formative years in Aunrein, as well.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It may be considered relatively recent that I took up
residence in the Kingdom proper.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Ah, then is that how you met Sir DeClares?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Something along those lines.
Kara set her tea cup down.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Curiosity taunts me, though, on what it is like there
now.

When I dwell on the thought, it often feels like it 
has been several lifetimes since I could return.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It has been a the better part of a year for me, but
maybe I can satiate that curiosity?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: If you were there as a child...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Did you ever hear of any tall tales and myths about 
the city?

Like about the statue of Reign?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm... You mean the headless one, yes?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: The very one.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
When I studied in Aunrein, rumors about it seemed 
to swirl about the student body.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I... may have not been thoroughly involved in those
social going-ons at the time...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
But I imagine I can recall details enough to compare 
it to your experience.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
*Giggle*... Oh, it would not be wise to treat me 
as so old.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Ah, I didn't... I figured you meant that you were
around it as a child.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It likely would have been the better part of a 
decade that our attendance differed...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can understand the approach, yes.

Some days it feels like it has been more like
a century or two since I've been there.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
In this case... 

Your memories were plenty.

Thank you.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: You're welcome...

Kara returned to her cup of tea and stared into it 
as she enveloped herself in the fragrance.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Ah, to think they haven't tried to fix that statue,
yet.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I don't believe they'd want to mimic the original
creator's work.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Or can't.

Kara smiled softly as she continued to stare into 
the tea.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It is a wonder what memories a scent can unlock.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It isn't even from Aureria proper, but it has that
nostalgic tinge that floods your mind with 
moments from the past.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It's hard to disagree. It feels like it fills my mind
with reasons to return home.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: To return to my birthplace... Hmmm...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
And... memories of reasons not to.

For me, at least...

I haven't exactly fulfilled my obligation to my family
yet...
A pause silenced the conversation.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Sorry, I shouldn't have...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: No, you are not alone.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
"Reasons to not return"...

I'm not sure I could finish the list if I tried to
start it.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
But...

To need a "reason to not"...
...means there is a "reason to", no?

Kara raised the tea glass, and beckoned for 
Elliot to do the same.

And the fragrance reached both of them 
once more.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Good will never come without the bad.

For our time here, one of our duties is to 
appreciate the good, I think.
Kara took a sip.
Elliot followed suit.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Indeed.

Even this tea came from past the lines of the 
Crusades, after all.

Something exquisite... in the depths of whatever 
murk surrounds it...

It is worth pursuing.
*Slurp*... *slurp*...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: ...*Gulp*
*Slurp*... *slurp*...

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
So...

How'd you like it?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Hmm... It's thick and juicy... and it's very messy...

It splurges everywhere...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
But...

...a touch...

...more spicy.

Sitting in the dining tent, Jude was trying out new
recipes he shared with the cook.

One was an eastern method of preparing skewered 
meat using spices.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
Are you sure about it? We are a bit low on 
the stuff we'd need to make it for everyone.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Hmm... That's troublesome.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Though, the forest surrounding us probably has 
some forageable spice bases.
Jude pulled out some weird plants from a pouch.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
If you dry these up and grind them, you should 
have a better outcome.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
Eh... So these ain't gonna kill ya if you eat 'em, are
they?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Fair question.

Jude slipped one of the weird plants from the 
pouch and put it directly into his mouth without 
hesitation.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Munch munch*...

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text: H- Hey...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Hmmm...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: They should be safe.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
Wait! What would have happened if they weren't 
safe!? You could've died!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Hm? We always used to- ...Right.

Jude's words drifted off as he realized the cook
wouldn't understand.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
How to put it...?

Look. These plants are veiny, oily and often come 
in groups of twelve.

If you don't see these characteristics in these 
plants, they might be toxic. But if you look out for 
these, you will be safe.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: And to be extra sure...

Jude picked up another and plopped it 
into his mouth.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Munch munch*...

The toxic ones are bitter.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text: You don't say...?

The cook took one for himself and lightly cut off a
small piece.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text: You sure know a lot about plants.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Some. Spices, mainly. But...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Anyways, I'll finish the skewer and go back to-

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Mercenary! There you are!

The tent entry curtain flapped around 
as Castel rushed through it.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I finally have time to do some live experimenting.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
And with you being SOO eager to prove me wrong 
last time... I'd assume you'd be just as eager to 
now as well.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: I gave suggestions, not 'proofs'...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Sigh*... semantics...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Could it wait? I was in the middle of something.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: No time to wait! Time, my time, is scarce and fleeting.

Castel started pulling Jude by the hand 
to their mobile lab.

Jude passed through the tent flap, only to see one
final sight as the curtains moved about.

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text: Isn't this...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: My... skewer...

lines.speaker: Cook
lines.text:
...*Munch munch* ...

Oh! Oh!! Spicy!!
Castel pulled Jude just outside a tent.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: No tent?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Alas, we won't be here long enough to justify 
putting it all up before we leave.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: 'kay.

Castel hurried around their makeshift setup, 
grabbing heirlooms and components alike.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: So, have you figured out how to cast faster?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah, did you actually remember?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I started an extensive look into historical records on
the topic from around the world.

The old Emerald Empire seemed to have found a 
way to cast without an incantation.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
What is required is a complex technique that 
requires a mental model of all the spells 
beforehand.
To enable casting them all sequentially 
and simultaneously.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Is that how they did it? Then you don't need me.

Jude turned, but Castel's hand reached out and 
grabbed him.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Oh, no, no, no! You are very important to the 
success of the experiment.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
As you see, all of this is theoretical knowledge... 
but we are missing the practical component.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Couldn't you have done it with rats... or raw meat?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Oh, so NOW you are not so sure about this, are 
you?

You were so sure this was going to work, are you
feeling the hypothetical cold feet?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Unless you want to literally have cold feet.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: ...Fine.

Jude pulled his sleeve up, and left his hand exposed
for Castel's casted magic.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Heheh... Get ready.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I won't let anything happen...

Nothing that we couldn't fix with Blue Magic, at 
least.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: 'kay.
Castel started casting a lengthy spell.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Oh goddess, may the light be true and guide our
purpose...

The area grew colder and the aura near Castel 
grew darker as their ghosty hair strands began to 
float in the air.

After a minute passed, Castel shouted the
incantation words.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Eucrasia! Rime!
Jude's hand began to grow a thin layer of ice...

...but his hand did not crumble into pieces like the
game meat did before.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Looks pretty frozen to me.

...

Done?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
...

Will it wear off soon?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
W- Wait... you... it... did you set this up
beforehand?!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Sure, I had form fitting ice hidden up my sleeve.
*Thunk thunk*...!

Jude tapped his hand on a nearby table. The table
resonated as if it was tapped by a solid piece of 
rock.
Jude stared at Castel with a deadpan expression.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
A... a false hand? Maybe it didn't splinter the skin
because it wasn't really a hand?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Have you not seen me wield a sword? My 
technique would not work with a prosthetic.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Maybe you... maybe you... maybe you are... naturally
immune to damage? Like a lineage deviation...?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Can homlyns do that?

Castel approached Jude and flicked their finger
on Jude's forehead.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Ow.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
...

Was that acting? That could've been acting.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Didn't I just say "ow"?
Suddenly, Jude grabbed his pinky finger...
And snapped it.
Separating it from the rest of the body.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: See. Bone and blood. Frozen blood, but blood.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
...?!

ARE YOU ACTUALLY BRAIN DEAD!?

W- Why did you snap your own finger!? This goes 
against all laws of safe experimentation!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I am unsure if canceling the spell will even reattach
your own finger! What would you do if that is the 
case, eh!?

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
You did offer assurances it could be fixed with your
procedure.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Of course I did! I am not some brute!

I do my experiments in a safe environment! Of 
course, I experimented with rats beforehand!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: So... you lied?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I mean... no... but yes...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Experimentation is an in-depth process that requires
careful design, consideration, and iteration...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I am not like some mercenaries... I do not chase truth
on a hunch!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
If that's how you feel. I don't group myself with 
other mercenaries, though.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Yeah... you are the one to think with their 
stomach...

Otherwise, you wouldn't snap your finger.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
It'll be fine.

So long as we reattach it properly with blue magic 
when this magic is fading.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Yes, of course we want to reattach the finger...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
...

...So how long does the spell last?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I used enough power to sustain it for about 1 hour.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
Right...

So... "Time is fleeting"...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I- I said as much because I am inundated with work 
and research!

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Then I'm stuck here for an hour.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Alright. Any food?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I suppose I have my lunch that I could 
share.
Castel stepped to open a pack stored to the side.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Thank you. Anything else I can help with?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmmm... Something you can help me with...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I suppose there are a few topics I could use a 
second set of eyes on...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Just for the finishing touches, of course. Polish is
needed for thorough research.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: By the way... Does this mean I win the bet?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Bet? 

Oh... no...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
I've heard of some magic based, gourmet cooking
techniques from the Covenant.

A worthy research topic, I'd say.

*Munch*... After all, what is cooking, "if not the
science of art"?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
..."Bartholomew, A theoretical view into the 
advances of culture."

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Munch*...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Damn Bartholomew... that fat bastard...!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Hmm...

Rowan had only just settled down to his assigned
laundry chore when a sharp voice broke the 
morning's silence.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
...I understand that you want to assist with the
chores. I simply implied that your time is better 
used elsewhere.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Besides, it isn't as though doing laundry will take all
day for those assigned to it. You should-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...I get that you want to help. I do, too, at times.
Just... they're gonna be mad if I let you.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I can imagine your court's faces if they learned you
washed some mercenary's undergarments. They'd-

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Greetings, my fair robins. How serendipitous it shall
be to join me today.

It will surely make the time fly with so many hands.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Hello Rowan, you're here too huh?

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Prince Alexei, I did not expect you there.

Flynn took the opportunity to sit amongst the 
various Crows picking through the mountains of 
clothing.

Reagyn's gaze flickered between the two, now 
seated and working while she still stood.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
*Sigh* ... Unfortunately, I will not be joining you all 
with the laundry today.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I have a previous commitment to assist with
restructuring camp logistics and situational
optimization.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Rowan.

Flynn took the opportunity to sit amongst the 
various Crows picking through the mountains of 
clothing.

Her gaze flickered between the two, 
now seated and working while she still stood.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Don't blame me if the Kingdom nobles get upset 
over this.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
We'd happily keep your own participation in this
endeavor a secret in turn~

She turned on her heel and departed. Rowan 
watched her leave with a wistful smile.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: What a beautiful succulent rose~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
So proud and imperious her stem bedecked in 
thorns, but with blossoms so full of velvet promise.

Rowan paused to see the effect of his wordcraft 
upon his audience.

...but saw Flynn's hands over ears, with a face 
wincing in disgust.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Could you not use words like... SUCCULENT... 
when talking about my TWIN sister...?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Could you not use words like... SUCCULENT... 
when talking about our group's benefactor...?

This drew some crude chuckling from the present 
Crows.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah Flynn, I can assure you I hold her in the highest
regard.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It is with such regard that I feel compelled to speak
on the beauty that I see.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: I'm not hearing this. I'm not hearing this.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Relax my friend.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas, I'll say no more for now if it makes you
uncomfortable.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But remember that it is in our natures to 
appreciate, and to be appreciated.

Beauty is in the eye of the beholder, and it 
behooves one to reciprocate with what one has 
beheld... so that beauty may grow.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Does all that flowery poetry ever work on anyone?

Rowan looked around the laundry crew with a 
private smile.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: More than you know, my dear to-be-lord Flynn...

The two shared a light chuckle, but Rowan's 
expression shifted when a certain Crow 
approached with a bundle of clothes.

lines.speaker: Lady Crow
lines.text: Ah...

The sudden tension between them could be cut 
with a knife as she dropped her load and left 
without a word.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And mayhap it backfires more than I would
hope...at times...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Huh...? What was that about?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, yes. This discussion. A fun one.
Rowan leaned back, clearing his throat.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
She was led to believe that I invited her to sleep 
with me...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Is that deserving of that reaction?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...immediately after she iterated her great love for
her husband.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
...

Did you?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I wouldn't dare.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
No, I remarked on the beauty of her openly 
expressed love... but she took it quite differently.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
She's been cold to me ever since, and drew a lance 
on me when I tried to explain the mistake.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Haha...

The awkward laugh, shared with the Crows about,
underscored a contemplative thread of thoughts in
Flynn's head.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Hmm...

With that the group got back to the task at hand,
working through the mountainous piles of the 
Nightless Crow's laundry.

The repetition of the laundry tasks was soothing to
Flynn's nerves.
The exact hope Flynn had for this task.

Calming enough that, when done, Flynn stepped 
into the circle of chatting Crows from the chore 
group.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: ...and then they just left it there!

The group laughed as Flynn sat down 
near Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Speaking which, Flynn my dear friend...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Ah, wait. Me?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Why is it that you let others nag you so flagrantly?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Is it not clear to them that you chose this chore to
avoid that voice in your ear?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Yeah, who'd pick this crap? Harbin over there only
changes his undershit when we got laundry day!

The mercenary held up a random pair of 
underwear, implying it was the stated article, and 
the group broke out in laughter once more.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Haha... Is it... that obvious?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Yes, I believe you should simply state as much.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: "Your itinerary is insufficient for my mental health!"

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Hm. Verily.

With a sarcastic scoff, the other Crows pushed 
along to another topic, leaving the two to talk to 
each other.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
That'd require me disagreeing with the 
expectations on me... and the needs they create.
Rowan's eyebrow raised.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
She tends to be good at everything she does...
including my training schedule.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: Even if I muck that up.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: I've always followed that sort of schedule.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Only way I can actually get better is to actually do
those tasks.

Flynn began folding a uniform, punctuating the 
steps with frustrated words.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Add to that, I'm still more experienced in some 
things than those in camp.

I... shouldn't mess things up... here, at least.

Rowan nodded sympathetically. Inspecting a 
soldier's gambeson for damage before hanging 
it to dry.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
If I can't handle the simple work of a camp, how 
will I be able to handle being the lord of the Coslett 
family territory?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Balancing the log books, coordinating flood relief,
securing borders, settling trade disputes, or
calculating the harvest tax?

Flynn punctuated each duty with an 
aggressively folded cloth slapped into 
its appropriate pile.

Rowan caught himself before pointing out that 
there was unlikely to be a harvest in the Coslett 
lands this season.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Nobility... it's a responsibility to the people you
serve. A weight.. a... a...

If I make a mistake then a lot of other people could
suffer because of it.

I know it can be hard to understand for a-
Flynn paused, a gear no longer spinning.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Dearest fiery one? Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Wait... I'm remembering now... your real name is...
Alexei, right? As in Prince Alexei?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Rowan is my birth name. Alexei is the name given 
to me as imperial prince.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
And a Prince is someone... who is a noble of an entire
country... and... and...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Aaahhh.........

Of course you already understand what I'm
blathering om about...

How have I even screwed up laundry duty...?

Flynn turned beat red within a heartbeat, face 
buried in clothes and away from sight.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: AAaahhaaAAAHHhhhaaHHaAhHHaaAHhhh...

Rowan slid to sit next to Flynn and tried to use a
gentle pat to comfort Flynn.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Think nothing of it. This is what I asked of you all
when you joined. "Treat Rowan as Rowan".

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I am Rowan. Alexei is a mask I must wear at times,
but...

Here in this camp I am me, and all the trials and
tribulations of Nolvanus are frozen to me.
Rowan reached for his instrument.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ah, perhaps a tune is in order to brighten the 
mood.

I know just the one! A little tavern song I picked 
up by the shores of Lake Lagos.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: ...aaaaaaaaaaaaa..........

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Clears throat*...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: There once was a prince with a heavy brow~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Who'd fret o'er the morrow and troubles enow~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: He'd count every shadow and measure each night~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: But never a joy would his heart take to flight~

The song had gathered the gazes of the 
Crows once more...

...with looks ranging from contentment to 
exasperation.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Feeling any better?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
No, if anything I think I might be feeling worse.

Where did you say you learned that monstrosity of 
a tune?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Why, from a sailor on the shores of Lake Lagos.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Are you sure you're really a bard?

Maybe they were pulling your leg, or were stone 
drunk when they taught you? Haha...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Everyone's a critic.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Well, if the jigs of Lake Lagos are too exotic to lift
the mood of your delicate Cartenan tastes, then 
there's only one thing to do...
...continue playing until we find something enticing 
to your ears, ah ha!
There was a cheer from the Crows.
And with that, Rowan launched into a second tune.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Good.

Another arrow slammed into the bullseye of the
target.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
...

Focus...

...just...one...more...!
Elliot drew the string back and was about to fire...

Elliot turned, as rustling came from a bush behind 
the range.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Who's there? A spy? Come out with your hands up!

There was more rustling from the bush as the 
figure tried to dart away.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I warned you...!
W- Wait, it's me!
Elliot lowered the bow.
With a swoosh, Castel transfigured out of the bush.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: D- Don't shoot again!

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Goddess forbid... My apologies. I didn't realize it was
you.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Could've sworn I saw a...

Castel shuffled out of the bushes and over towards
Elliot.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Haha... think... nothing of it?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Objectively speaking, the error was mine. I 
shouldn't have been running around in the bushes 
like that.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I take it that it is because you're a shade?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
True, but... How did you know that? Or more 
importantly why are you asking?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Well, a person couldn't hide in bushes like that.

Elliot walked over towards the archery 
practice target.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Only a small creature could manage it. And then 
you just appeared out of nowhere...
Elliot pulled the arrow from the target on the tree.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I had my suspicions when we first met, but I didn't
know for sure until just now.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Excellent, for you to understand the nature of it so
quickly.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It seems like so few people do, even after 
explaining several times.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Hmm... But perhaps I shouldn't have jumped to
conclusions, still.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It was very uncouth of me to almost shoot an 
innocent maiden like that.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: ...maiden?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ah, yes. This isn't my original body... I should
explain.

As they walked, Castel recounted how their body 
changed and what they had learned of this thus 
far.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
So, you weren't always a shade? And not only that, but
you are also the famous Castel Balreig?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I had assumed the first name as a coincidence.
The two talked as they walked.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
"Famous" might be a overstatement by
a scale of degree...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
It does make sense, though. Shades may take the 
form of people and creatures, but they aren't 
known to talk.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Quite interesting, indeed.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: 'Interesting' how, if I may ask?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The Covenant archives never contained myths with
talking shades in them.

They were always nothing more than enemies for 
the heroes of old.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I've read the same stories.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
But that means you were educated by the 
Covenant too then?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Oh yes. Historical myths and legends were my 
primary field of study.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Did I say something humorous?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Not quite.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It's just that it seems like we both have a great 
deal of things in common.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I had read papers of yours during my time studying,
Professor, but...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: We have different fields of study, do we not?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
The focus of my thought was more on how we 
both can swap forms. A unique trait amongst our 
group.
Elliot fidgeted with his heirloom.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I... did not offend, did I? Apologies, if so.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Trust me, I know how strange it can be to change so
dramatically.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I am not intending to complain.

Not that I have a right to do so towards you, given 
I am not fully removed from my original state like 
you are, Professor.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Speaking of such, I had a thought...

As the two entered camp, Castel led Elliot 
to his own tent.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If we're sharing secrets, I was wondering if you 
might indulge me with the mechanism behind your 
own?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I conduct gray magic via my heirloom.

In my case, it was passed down from an ancestor in 
my noble lineage.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
The imprints of prayers my ancestor placed upon it 
give me form and skill beyond my normal aptitude.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Gray magic? I've never seen it in person before.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Does that mean your form is that of your ancestor's?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: It is quite an... enchanting form. One to be proud of!

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Ah, well...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
To avoid... naming names... my ancestor was not a
woman. He was in my lineage of grandfathers...

The form I take is... a mystery to my family.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: That... Hmm...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Ideas come to mind.

But as I go through them, I am reminded that the
research on the topic of gray magic is limited.

The time required to see the process through is 
generational in the literal sense after all... let 
alone the rarity of heirlooms capable of it...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Yes, it has been... not without speculation inside 
and outside my family.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Such is the nature of people when we've gaps to 
our knowledge.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: All the more reason to offer you my services, no?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Services...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Research of course, my dear maiden.

Elliot raised an eyebrow, and Castel sauntered over 
to a pile of books.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
In my studies for Pup and myself, I've delved deep 
into the academics of each magic.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Between our disciplines, our academics minds can 
come together to form a sum greater than their 
parts, no?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Is that why you brought me here? Hmm...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
I agree. This matter is worth getting to the bottom 
of.

And who knows? We may even be able to assist 
you as well.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Then to the investigation we shall tread.

Would you be willing to compare notes on this 
sometime? Say... over dinner?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
In this band we oeprate, it will be nice to spend 
some time with a fellow person of learning.
Elliot met Castel's eyes and smiled.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Yes, I think it will.
Castel approached Elliot, getting closer.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Thank you, I feel like...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: ...I can finally relax. It has been some time.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Sigh*...

With that, Castel stepped back, returning 
to his prior place.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Did I say something wrong?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: N- No... It is just...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: It comes to mind that...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Yes, it comes to mind that I have a place to be now.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
Then let's plan on continuing the conversation in 
my tent sometime.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I assume you could... change to the ancestor form 
when that time comes?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Sure, but... do you think it'll be needed?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I- It can be difficult to predict such things. Better
safe than sorry?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Hmm... Yes, I suppose so.
The sentence led to a silence.
One that crept into an awkward silence.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Clears throat*... I shouldn't dawdle.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Actually, a moment? I had a question.
Castel stopped with the tent flap half opened.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: It really isn't anything of consequence, but...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Might I ask what you were doing in the bushes before?

A flash of heat rose in Castel, who silently gave
thanks for shades not having the biology to enable
blushing.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I- I was just... trying to find ways to spend more time
in the more natural form of a shade.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: For... science.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Yes. Indeed. For science.

...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I- I really must not be late!

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
...

...that was strange?

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: But, okay. I look forward to it.
Elliot stretched to his quiver.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: Now...
He twirled the arrow in his fingers.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: ...where were we?

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text:
Look 'er. We found some loot on that ol' lady, we 
did.

lines.speaker: Another Bandit
lines.text:
We sure did, boss. We just had to... persuade her 
a bit.

He held a knife, waving it about, as the two rushed
from their crime into the shadows of the alleyway.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Nothing a good ol' show of force can't beat, right?

lines.speaker: Another Bandit
lines.text: You're right on that boss.

lines.speaker: Echoing Voice
lines.text: A... show of force, you say?

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Are ya deaf? A show of force, I said.

lines.speaker: Another Bandit
lines.text:
Yeah, a show of force he sa-

Gwahh...!

From the cover of the night, a hulking cluster of 
metal showed itself and quietly rushed the bandit 
into the dark of unconsciousness.

Then, as quickly as it appeared, it dipped into 
another shadow cast by the moon.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text:
Heh..?! Where did...

...

Show er'self, I say!

Ya with da police? What about the deal we 
struck?!

Slowly, the cluster of metal revealed itself to be a
person in plated armor, glistening with the light of
the moon.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text:
You er'... you er' the Armored Bandit, you er'...

You er' a bandit... just like us, you er'!

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text:
GHAAA...!

Ya... knocked me out... ya did...

The glistening armored unit punched the bandit 
in his gut hard enough to knock him out for 
several hours.
And with that, it turned its head to the scene.

The armored unit took the stolen goods and put 
the sack over its shoulder.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I am not like you.

You stole from an old innocent woman to give to
yourself.

While I steal from corrupt nobles and their lackies to
give to the normal folk.
*Knock Knock*
The door opened.

lines.speaker: Old Lady
lines.text: Huh...?

She saw a sight illuminated by the candlelight from
within her home, and it showed a coin purse on 
her front porch.

lines.speaker: Old Lady
lines.text: This... purse...? I thought the bandits had taken it.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: There we go...
