ourselves back to back and on the defensive.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You assume this isn't part of my strategy.

Flicking my sword up, I pointed it at the Crow 
that I was training with.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Not that I'm actually faring that well.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Norde isn't exactly doing so well either...)
Norde had been training with the other Crow.

I didn't get to observe since I was also sparring, 
but what little I saw seemed rough.
Slow reactions and just being a step behind...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Maybe more importantly...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (...Norde never said anything to me.)

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: C'mon little pup, you can do better than that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You won't be saying that after I've won your dinner.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: (Dammit! Again.)

I stepped back, trying to regain my balance 
as I did.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(He keeps doing that stutter step... I feel like I
normally read those well, but this time...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(Normally Norde would...)
Me eyes peeked to my side.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Rrragh...!

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Haha! Fuck, that was actually close to my head.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Stay focused.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Really? Sure that's the quip you want to end this on?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...End this on?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Heh.

Norde's weapon had flown up, landing well away 
from the two training combatants.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
Heh. First time for everything.

I win.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Norde...?)

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Stay focused!
He lunged towards me.
And with that...
...we tied.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... I'm starved.

All four of us re-entered camp under the 
setting sun.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
So I got that extra dinner I won, yeah? Wanna 
trade me some of your stash of jerky for half of it?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: I guess... I am pretty hungry today.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Really?! I can trade the entire thing.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
This is all assuming that they'll believe either of us
actually beat Norde.

The two chuckled on as they continued to the 
dining tent.
In contrast, Norde had stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not heading to the dining tent?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...I lost my dinner in the battle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh...

(I know they kept talking about it, but... I guess it
hadn't set in...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
*Inhale*...

*Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Everyone loses fights.

Norde turned and started towards the 
sleeping tents.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, not because of that.
And then Norde stopped.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You've lost fights before, even if not all that often.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What you haven't done before is...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...not correct me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
My training partner was doing a stutter step that I
wasn't reacting to correctly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I managed a draw because I eventually figured out 
it was an issue with my balance being frontloaded.

At least... in comparison to when I last trained
against that approach.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You... had that problem...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yep, and I wouldn't normally be the first to notice,
either.

You would.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Maybe, then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I challenge you to a duel.
My sword extended out towards Norde.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Winner gets my dinner.
We both jumped back after our steel met.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You're slow.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We did JUST finish training.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Though the same can be said of Norde.)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Stay focused.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, I am.
I tightened my grip.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Now... If I want to do this, then I need to...)
I breathed in.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Go!

I rushed forward blindly, each step getting longer 
into a gallop.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're slow...!
Norde... stepped to the side at the last second.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmph.
With an axe raised...
...down it went!

But I kept barreling forward, tripping into a roll
before bouncing back to my feet half a dozen feet 
from Norde.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Don't... let your guard down...!

I wound up big and slow, being just a few long 
paces away from making a large swing.
But I shifted my weight and grip.
...and unleashed a flurry of fast strikes!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hiya! Hiya! Hiya! ...Hiya!

Norde met my steel and stepped back, offering 
space to adjust angles for each blow.

I rushed forward with a long step and a long follow
through swing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Try this!

Norde... held their ground and met my 
steel with steel.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmph.

...before spinning their grip and pushing my center 
of gravity to the side.

I fell to the side, catching myself in a roll that left
me outside of Norde's range.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
I stuck my sword into the ground at a low angle.

Kicking the hilt of my sword into the ground and 
up, it boosted up a large clump of dirt.
I grabbed it, and...
...threw it!
Norde started to twitch.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Gotcha.

I stepped forward to go for the strike, and Norde
seemed to be raising their weapon to react to the 
dirt instead of my weapon.
But grabbed the clump instead!

...pushing it back at my own strike, then ducking 
under the collision.

It was then that a clear opening was visible 
to Norde.

Norde struck at my grip, knocking the sword out of 
my hand.
And soon I saw Norde's weapon pointing at me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well done.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You were sloppy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I suppose I was. But that routine works on the 
typical mercenary.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I'm not your average mercenary.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Exactly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You saw through it immediately.

I came at you like a beast, and you fought back like
man. Like a tactician.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What are you...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know this change has put you on edge.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Trust me, I know what it's like. Those doubts don't
just disappear when you want them to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But you're not a beast. You're Norde.

Skilled and clever enough to see that chance to 
repel my strong and quick attacks just like that.

Most of the Crows wouldn't have figured it out that
quickly.

You need to adapt, but you're still you.

Norde. Stalwart of the Nightless Crows, and my 
brother.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You saw through it immediately.

I came at you in basically every way I could, and 
you still repelled them all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What are you...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know this change has put you on edge.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Trust me, I know what it's like. Those doubts don't
just disappear when you want them to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But even as a woman, you're still you, Norde. Your
strengths were not only in your muscles.

I needed to learn how to fight more deliberately. 
Each step being more considered and tactical to 
the little details.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But look at you... the change fits you like a glove.
You didn't need to learn anything, just adapt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Don't let the learning curve fool you, you're still
you.

Norde. Stalwart of the Nightless Crows, and my 
family.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

*Exhale*...

I know. I know...

Norde's breathing calmed, as though the stress was
dissipating ever so slowly.
Norde had fallen to the ground.
With myself standing tall.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You didn't think I'd let you win just because I was
teaching you a lesson, did you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Heheh~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No.

Norde won.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh? Charlotte?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yup, still here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...and still being the duel judge, as requested by 
you two...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... fuck.

I slumped down, falling down onto my butt much 
like Norde had.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hahahahaha...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What's so funny? You won.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It's just... when you were standing there... I... saw 
a glimpse of Ivan.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I can't count the amount of times Ivan's training 
left me on the ground as he lectured me.

It was...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...nostalgic. If just for a moment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Alright.
I slowly stood up.
And extended my hand out to help Norde up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'll be your 'Ivan' for you.

And you, for me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If we can't live up to him, then we can lead the 
Crows together.

Each of us making up for each other's 
shortcomings. Making each other better 
at what we do.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Maybe.

Norde took my hand, and soon we were both 
on our feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That's about as close to as a 'yes' as I can get, isn't
it?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Just please try and keep up.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I'll be taking that dinner now.

Norde started to turn towards the path back 
to camp.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey!

And I chased after, as we got into a friendly sibling
feud once more.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

Those two are idiots.

title: SP-Rowan x Charlott A - New Event

lines.text: It was a windy day.

The mountains of Cartenan and Nolvanus looked 
down and into the distance.
Onto a simple camp out and down below.
A simple day within the Nightless Crows camp.
With Crows themselves lined up to eat.

A steaming soup to coax the hungry men and 
women to the call of lunch...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
...think they got some of that high grade beef for 
the stew this time?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
Hmm... *Sniff*...  *sniff*...

Nah, smells like chicken.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Really? Must have some nice spices this time cause 
that ain't a smell I remember.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Could be worse.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Mmm... *Stomach growls*...

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: ...or you could just be hungry.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: ...maybe...

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
*Sigh*... We've not been able to get much high 
quality stuff since Lockhart got invaded.

Not like trade from the east is prosperous either,
given the constant war the Empire and Republic 
have got going.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
What I'd give to get a t-bone steak sometime 
soon...

Heh, though maybe all we needed to do was help 
liberate Lockhart all proper like.

No more military occupation now, so the food 
flows~

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
Maybe..

Or... also maybe...

...those two...

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Who knows with those two?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: You mean... cuz they keep fightin'?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
More that it seems to be getting worse... They're 
more at each other's throats than ever.

And now that we actually revolutionized ol' 
Lockhart...

Those two are in line to influence what the Empire 
and Lockhart will be in the future yeah?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Argh... You're right...

...I just want my beef...

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Well... W-

The Crows felt an ominous feeling wrap around 
their shoulders.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Ye of little faith. You will have your beef, my good
man.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: R- Really?!

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: How much of that did you hear?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Do not fret.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Dear Charlotte and I are not at such dire odds. It
is... more...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yes, it is more like when we were in school.

Like the two lovebirds of a schoolyard, performing 
an awkward courting dance~

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Wait... really...?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
So you're saying...

Have you... like... with her...?
Another feeling fell onto the Crow's shoulder...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Like what... "with her"...?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: N- Nothing...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And you.

Charlotte stared daggers at Rowan, and the two 
Crows backed away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Why are you spreading rumors, now?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Have you seen the company morale? It is the least 
I can do.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: At MY expense?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Perish the thought. To think we two to be 
intermingled is but a flowering conception 
of the mind~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... You weren't like this in school.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Did something hit you on the head or something?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Heheh~ So I am now the 'Alexei' you knew from school?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Don't take that as a compliment! The current you is 
a downgrade from that sweet innocent boy.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Indeed, I am but a man now~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A 'man'?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
And they expect you to help re-establish the 
Empire...

Imagine how you'll fair if you can't defuse a tense
situation without a joke.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Indeed, a thought to be had.

The two continued on, bickering a bit more as the 
two Crows watched on.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: They're at it again...

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: So much for getting us some beef.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: "Emperor of a No Man's Land", right?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You do not need to phrase it as such.

The two watched on as the argument raised to a 
fever pitch.

Both sides appeared sincerely irritated, even the 
ever calm Rowan.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: We shall simply see, then, shall we not?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Indeed... We will see.
Each of them turned on their heels...
...and walked away.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
I feel like it's been happening more frequently, to 
be honest.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Maybe. Maybe not.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Is a bit quieter now, at least.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Duh. They stormed off and away from here.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
I could really go for some chicken stew right about
now.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: Goddess I could, too...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What does that even mean?

Your birth mother isn't even from the Empire!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: She could make a wonderful empress.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Her homemade meals alone could bring the 
Empire together!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What are you on about?

Cats are clearly best.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
How can one say that, in this camp of all places...!?

It is to invite tragedy in a place most dog oriented.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...

That was my pudding.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...

I paid for it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You're such an idiot.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Haha... That's my charm though.
And the calming wind blew across the hillside.

As Rowan's hand landed on Charlotte's head, 
patting it softly.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Mmm~

The Nightless Crow took a bite of the bread, then
dunked it back into the soup for the next bite.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text: This actually is better than normal.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Yeah, some spices they added that just work.

The two sat towards the exterior of the camp, and
watched the nearby sea as the sun set over it.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
Yeah, we didn't have this last time we had chicken 
in the stew.

Maybe...

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Maybe what?

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
I wonder if liberating Lockhart opened up a spice
warehouse or somethin'.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Ah~ Then maybe things will get a bit better on the food
front.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
Maybe, maybe...

Makes you wonder how the whole region will fair 
when we've seen this to the finish line though.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
If it tastes anything like this, then it'll 
be fan-tast-ic~

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
Eh. With the Charlotte girl and the imperial prince in
charge, though?

It'll effect more than just food supplies if they 
argue 24/7.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
Heh. Who knows...

Maybe they get off on it?

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text:
...

H- Hey... I was joking.

lines.speaker: Other Crow
lines.text:
Y- Yeah, of course, haha...

You had my mind racing there for a second.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Yeah, as if.
So the two laughed on.

Nervously, and unsure if they had discovered 
something they shouldn't have.
A secret that, in its worst case...

...was worth keeping in exchange for some tasty 
soup and bread.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Mmmgghhh...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Hmm...?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Uuuugggnnnhhh...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Hmmm.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Hrrrgghh...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Almost there...

Hold on a second...

Hrrrn!

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I... can't hold on any longer!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Aaahhh!
As two others were trying to clean a high shelf...

...a lonely redhead "priestess" was lying down on a
couch, trying to read a book to no avail.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: I'm so BORED!!!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: O- Ouch...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
H- Hey...

You're... kinda... heavy...!

Besides the bored priest, a maid and a farmer were 
down on the floor after an unsuccessful attempt at 
cleaning noted high shelf.

The modest-sized maid weighed upon the farmer's
existing... plateau.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: You know, this would be easier if you helped us...

Macy said the words carefully, as she raised herself
from the floor.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Let her rest.

Eve followed, returning herself to her feet after the
stumble.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
I am sure she is tired of doing... whatever she has
been doing... right?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What are you doing... exactly?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: I am trying to see if there are any good stories.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Where are the stories of dragons and knights? Of
wizards defeating evil demons?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Is that like... a bard thing in an age like this? Did
you ask Rowan for a song or two?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Eww...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Last time I tried, he started flirting with me.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: ...as if I were a girl...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Are you... not?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: L- Long story...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Haha... I've been there.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Where I am from, stories about the past and future 
are abundant.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Stories of spaceships, dragons, and even a few 
about dragons in space!

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: That sounds... familiar.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Even still, we have this sort of... I guess you all
would call it a magic item?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
They're called video games. They show all sorts of
fantastic sights from fictional worlds.

You could even interact with them!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Wait... are you not from this world?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: N- No... why?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: I also... came from another world.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Actually, we had something called video games 
there, too.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Me too! We had stuff called that in the world I was
born.

Each of them continued on explaining their version 
of "video games" to each other.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Ah... so is the different world we all come from... 
the same world?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Well, this is my third. I got teleported to one and
then... I guess here?

I might need a dimensional passport...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Are those a real thing?!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Where I come from, you can get a planetary 
passport now that they're colonizing Mars.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Not "dimensional" passports though.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
O- Oh, right! Mars... colonization... I might not 
watch the news enough since I don't remember
that...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: That said, I was... exaggerating a bit.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: No dimensional passport in reality, hehe.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Wait, Mars is being COLONIZED?!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Last I checked, there were rovers on the planet...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I think one of them even sang "Happy Birthday" to
itself.

Jenny raised her hand to her mouth as she 
giggled a bit in excitement.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: It sounds like the next decade will be a lot of fun!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
The 2020s will thankfully bring us closer to a Mars
colony, and nothing bad will happen!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Hmmm... Should I tell her?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Don't you dare.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Huh? What's happening?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Uhh... nothing... just... uhh... stay indoors.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
And get used to wearing a mask if you go back to your
world.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Like a... fox mask from the Japanese carnivals?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: S- Sure...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Anyways...!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: You two liked games? What sort?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Oh! I actually like strategy games! I am playing 
a game in the Water Emblem saga!

Or... was, at least.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Strategy games? I don't know... I feel that
micromanaging an army might feel a bit tedious...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
This weapon breaks, that unit is hurt, oh Jenny, 
heal me! Jenny, unlock that chest!

Oh no, I am seeing sexy visions in the cursed 
dungeon~

Just because I-

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I mean the tactician is not involved in active
combat... It doesn't mean I like micromanaging 
people!

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
I just... like the idea of having a large group of
friends.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Especially in the newest entries, you can pair up
different kinds of people.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Like the human and the succubus, or the human 
and the slime girl...

...or the human and the vampire, or the human 
and the cow girl, or the...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Seems like that might take a while.

Jenny, since you seem to have such an... 
interesting opinion on strategy games, what games 
do you like to play, or used to?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Oh! I like this franchise called Final Flight! They are
on their 15th entry at the moment.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: I think they were on the 20th over in my time?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I like stories where a small group of people 
overcome some god or demon king with the power 
of friendship.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Oh, I know those. They sort of come across as
unrealistic to me.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Why is that group of people tasked to defeat the 
evil program?

I mean, sure, they have the powers to defeat the 
evil program, but why does it have to be THEM, 
you know?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Did you not just answer your own question?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
The hero has the power to save people. 
Therefore, the responsibility of helping them!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Imagine you had the power to save someone, but chose
not to?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I guess you have a point... At least I wish
they would give me...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
I mean... the hero... give them some sort of 
thanks.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Monetary gifts would be appreciated.

Especially if the hero had to buy stuff from a person
named after the concept of greed...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
...and a human and a mermaid, and a human and 
an elf, and a human and a fox girl...

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: What about you? What games did you used to play?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Oh, I was not much of a "gamer"...

I just casually played a farming Sim called Moondew
Canyon. Very chill.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: ...and the human and the whole village...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Wait, did you say farming simulator? That sounds
tiring...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: What do you mean? It's super chill.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
You just wake up, water your plants, say hi to your
neighbor, and go to sleep.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: Very chill, very zen.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Not when you have to manually do all those 
things...

You ever carry a full water bucket before?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
...and then have to fetch all the items to make 
people happy...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Will the damn tuna be fished already?!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Oh, yeah! I remember when I was just waiting for the
duck's feather to drop. Stupid RNG.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
At the very least, I don't have to worry much 
about combat.

And there are no taxes, so I can just take my time 
and chill.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Hmm... I never thought about that...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
I do spend a lot of time with a succubus friend... 
she is teaching me... "stuff".

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: Succubus? You've met one?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Yeah, in the second world I was in. Right before 
this one.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I also met a succubus. She is a bit... "overly
friendly", if you catch my drift.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
She also wanted to teach me stuff. Like "the 
wonders of the female body".

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
I am pretty sure my breasts have grown since she
started touching them on a daily basis...
A bit of an awkward silence fell between the three.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Ok, time to change topics... sheesh... You wouldn't be
caught dead speaking like that in University...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Oh! Are you a university student? My brother is one
too...

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Well, he spent quite some time looking for one... 
he is a bit eccentric.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: He'll be starting soon. Or was at the time.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Eve... and Adam...? I wonder...

Say, Eve... is your brother going to a school called
"Orchard University"?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Sounds... familiar?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
It sounds right, so probably? Whether he goes by 
"Adam" as a nickname isn't something I am aware 
of, though.
Why?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: No... reason...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
You know, if we get the chance to return to our 
worlds, maybe I could stop by your house?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: Oh, a sleepover with friends?!

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text: That does sounds fun.

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text: I've never been to one before!

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Yeah... and you can show me your brother's 
room...

I am sure there are some things I would want to...

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text: ...repair.

...*Poke*

*Poke*

...

*Poke*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What's that feeling of-)
Gravity took me.

With a light collision, I had fallen on several pillows
instead of the hard floor.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Evening, sleepyhead.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh... What happened to the table?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Everyone has a busy schedule these days.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Speaking of which, some of the others are headed 
out to resupply.

You've been volunteered to help.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I really rather not...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No one said you volunteered yourself.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Now go do something instead of burning away 
what time we have.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like I said, I rather-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urk?!
A light kick landed into the side of my stomach.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Do it.

As I acclimated to the waking world, Charlotte left 
with those words as her finale.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Why does it end up like this again?)

Along with other members of our group, I 
begrudgingly took part in the purchase of food 
supplies we had run out of while on the run.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: That's one less apple than we were aiming to get.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Blame the stupid merchant.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
It was a compliment.

There's no reason to be mad about a compliment 
on your hair.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... As if you'd understand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Tsk... stupid waste of an apple...

Call me a girl, though? I'll just...

We were carrying the supplies we could back from 
the stores.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I can see where you're coming from if you wanted 
to be more like your father.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's just a matter of time and training.

I'll be like a true hero and...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Oh, but how you are now could really do well as a 
model!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A... what?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You don't know? I suppose they're probably not 
well known outside of Lockhart, are they?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I don't even think they're well known 
within Lockhart, haha.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
What do you mean? People know about them at 
the academy?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Were these noble friends of yours?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Why would that matter?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah, that sort of stuff.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Behind the curtains of gold, haha...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I... don't get it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just a cultural barrier, I think.

What are these models, anyways?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Simply put, they're people who get paid to look 
attractive. Using cameras and advertisements.

They can be like a spokesperson for a brand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
A spokesperson... a model... cameras... 
advertisements... Are these even real words?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But... more importantly... did you just say I was... 
attractive?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I- I'm just saying not all girls are into guys that are 
more muscle than man.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: I can attest to that truth.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sure. What sort of man are you into?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Jests such as that would be more effective if there 
was an actual insecurity to poke at.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmph.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: My point is that you'd probably do well as a model.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Without any body hair, you wouldn't even have to 
shave for it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shave for what?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I think they use oils to accentuate the... 
definition... of...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: ...of stuff...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't want to be a model.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You don't have to be. I just thought... you might 
be good at it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess I can't deny that opinion. Especially for 
something I don't really get...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It doesn't hurt that I got a look at you naked a few 
times...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sorry?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: N- Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You people some days...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It is... an intriguing change you've gone through.

I would find it difficult to not give onlookers the 
benefit of the doubt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I have no patience to deal with it constantly.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: You may be forced to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not if I have anything to say about it.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Then be sure to keep your sleeves at full length.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
The glisten of your hairless arms does accentuate 
the impression.

I turned my head away and scoffed at his 
implication.

At the same time, I adjusted my grip on the 
supplies to let my sleeves fall to their full length as 
they rested on my arms.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: More importantly...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
I have not seen you prior to this stage. Have you 
lost much in the way of height?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not a ton, but...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Was your face and hair significantly more masculine 
before?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean, I...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Have you ever, prior to these events, been 
mistaken in a similar manner?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're not talking about this.

Some light laughter came about from that 
interaction, and I could only sigh in response.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The world can be so unfair, can't it, boy?

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Confused whine*?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not you, too...

Our path took us through the setting sun, and 
soon we found ourselves back at the inn we had 
stayed at.

As we did, I noticed a unique building across the 
street from it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What's that?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: A library, I believe.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: One run by the Covenant, too.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: One of the libraries run by the Covenant.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So it's got lots of info on magic? Like... the 
Oathbreakers, maybe?
I started to step towards it.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Apologies, but I cannot let you proceed.

I will direct your gaze to the sign on the door. The 
one saying "Closed for Renovations".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...I guess you're right...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Then shall we deliver this to the stockpile? After 
that a good rest before a long trek tomorrow.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Before I head to my own lodging, I'd like to 
complete the delivery of your supplies, yes?
Later in the night...
The library stood before me in the quiet stillness.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This window isn't barred off.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I need to find something about the 
Oathbreakers.)

I sneaked through the hallways of 
dusty bookshelves.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Magics section... here it is.)

(Oathbreakers... Oathbreakers... come on...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(...Nothing? But this is a Covenant Library? I know 
it's not a big library, but...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I wonder if they have a restricted section?)

With that in mind, I was about to head off to look 
for one when a thought jumped to my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I don't actually know much about how magic 
works in the first place.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I have all night, so...)

I quickly scoured the books for a introductory text 
on magic.

My fingers flipped through the basics of the 
writings.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
('Magics are a blessing from the Goddess Aurier.')

('In the beginning, this world was created as a trial 
ground for the souls that once defied Aurier.')

('Within the spiritual realm of Miryo, this land was 
created between the dark and the light.')

I looked out to the darkness of the night sky. The 
thousands of shimmering stars looked back at me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I sometimes forget how foreboding the night can 
be. With the army of the damned scattered across 
the sky above...
My eyes turned back to the page.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
('The souls that turned away from damnation 
pledged an Oath of loyalty to Aurier.')

('So their mortality was tested in this trial ground of 
life, for said holy Oath to the Mother Soul was the
key to eternal salvation.')
...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What did this have to do with magic, again?

It was all information I knew. I had been taught 
these things since I was young.

I flipped through a few more pages. It went into 
detail about the old war between Aurier and 
Zened, the first son.
Zened was defeated and banished to the dark of 
the night.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, here's something new...

lines.speaker: Book
lines.text:
Magics are blessings granted by dutiful lineages loyal 
to Aurier or her ideals of existence.

Over generations of this loyalty and prayer, a 
Noblesse Heirloom is created.

It acts as a tool of the Goddess granted to 
true nobility.

With it, these nobles are tasked with guiding the 
people forward as exemplars of the faith.

Often simply referred to as an heirloom, Noblesse 
Heirlooms hold blessings of different forms.

lines.speaker: Book
lines.text:
These blessings are categorized into 4 different 
types.

Red Magic. Blue Magic. 
Green Magic. Gray Magic.

Red magic is elemental. Fire, electricity, wind... 
They are the energies of the world.

Blue magic is divine and spiritual. Often, this is 
associated with healing.

Green magic is creation. It controls the particulate 
that forms this world itself.

Gray magic is the magic of the soul manifested via 
tapping into red, blue, and green in equal 
measures.
While not strong enough to call on their individual 
strengths, the combination of them can allow for a
unique skill.
Pulling from memories of prayers within the 
heirloom, the user can call on the lingering noble 
soul of their ancestors.
This spirit can temporarily transmogrify the user to 
be a reflection of the soul in question.

It transforms their body to match the heights of 
their skill and strength.

It transforms their body to match their skill and 
strength.

It transforms their body... strength...

It transforms their body.

Transforms their body.

My eyes focused on a section that stood out to 
me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
('Transforms their body')

(Could that be what's happening to me?)

(Wait, it said temporary... Does that mean my 
changes are...?)

I decided to read on.

The discussion started to go over my head, but I 
did stumble upon another passage that seemed to 
clarify an element.

lines.speaker: Book
lines.text:
In contrast to Noblesse Heirloom, the Oathbreakers 
act much the opposite.

An Oathbreaker is a show of defiance towards the 
Goddess's laws of nature. It breaks said laws.

It is a cheat on the trial this life provides, and it 
breaks the Oath to the mother soul.

This is in contrast to the heirlooms, which are 
blessings within the Goddess's laws.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (So they're complete opposites?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Then... are they not compatible at all?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(That Covenant auditor said they might be able to 
offset the effects at the academy though?)

(Are they partially compatible then, or...?)
I shut the book as I sighed with audible frustration.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... This is such a pain...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Crap, is someone still here?!)

I slipped the book back and got up as carefully 
as I could.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Is someone there?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I should get out of here. I'm not supposed to be 
here.)

(What's the best approach though?)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Make up a story / Fake being a ghost / Just get out ASAP

I slid myself around the bookshelf to get a read on 
where the librarian was.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I see a candlelight moving over there. That must 
be him.)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Show yourself! Even if you're a rat, I can show 
mercy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(What excuse can I give? Maybe... didn't someone 
say something about this place being renovated?)

I turned my head to see some scaffolding not too 
far from where the librarian was.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Perfect.)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Last chance... 5... 4... 3...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did I hear someone?

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Huh? Who are you?

I walked out near the candlelight wielded by the 
librarian.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just a passerby. Are you in charge of this place?

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
How did you get in? The gate should have been 
locked before just now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Y- Yeah. I tried to knock and yell, but I didn't get 
an answer.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm only here because I thought I saw something 
questionable in the renovations.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Young lady, I don't know what you think you're 
saying, but...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Come on...

I'm just trying to help here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Have you seen this craftmanship? Shoddy as can 
be.

I picked up my hand and gave a firm pat to 
structure next to me as emphasis.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: If you look at it, then you'd notice...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...notice that...

There was a low rumbling sound.

I turned my head to see the outline of something 
in the darkness moving.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's falling?!)

The crumbling structure was falling straight into the
librarian!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Watch out!
I leaped forward!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*...

I looked back and saw a column had nearly fallen on 
us both before I knocked us out of the way.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: T- Thank you... for... saving me...

The librarian was struggling to find words after the
surprise.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: I guess you were right... after all...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Is this me being lucky or unlucky?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I'll go get someone!

I jumped to my feet and scrambled out the now 
unlocked door.

I slid myself around the bookshelf to get a read on 
where the librarian was.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I see a candlelight moving over there. That must 
be him.)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Show yourself! Even if you're a rat, I can show 
mercy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Could I convince him it wasn't a person? Maybe a 
rat...? Or a ghost...?)
I looked around and saw some rocks on the floor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (From the renovation?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (This could work, though.)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Last chance... 5... 4... 3...

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Huh? Come out! I can hear you.

...

Don't make me start counting again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Soft ghostly wailing*...

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Ha ha... very funny-
He turned on his heels in the other direction.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: How are you... You can't be in two places at once.

I tip toed towards the end of an aisle 
of bookshelves.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This should hopefully pull his eyesight away 
enough for me to get outside.)

I carefully placed a book at the end of the 
bookshelf in a precarious position.

Starting to move, I dropped another rock to pull 
him further in this direction.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Think you're being sneaky? You won't feel sneaky 
when I am done with you.

The librarian slowly scooted towards the sound.

By the time he was there, I was at the other end 
of the bookshelf.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Now just a firm shake, and...)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Ack! Begone ghost!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Time to sprint out of here!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No time to... to...)

There was a low rumbling sound.

I turned my head to see the outline of something 
in the darkness moving.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (The renovation stuff... it's falling?!)

It wasn't entirely localized, and I had to jump out of 
the way of falling debris myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Cough* *cough*...

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Goddess... Goddess help me...

*Cough*... I guess it was just this thing falling 
apart, in the end.

Oh fucking...! This shit fell apart?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Okay, he's definitely distracted now.)
I jumped to my feet and scrambled out the door.

I slid myself around the bookshelf to get a read on 
where the librarian was.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I see a candlelight moving over there. That must 
be him.)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Show yourself! Even if you're a rat, I can show 
mercy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What would be the quickest way out?)
I looked around and saw a few paths I could take.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(There aren't many wide open places because of 
the renovation.)

(I can make this work, though.)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Last chance... 5... 4... 3...

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: There you are.

The librarian walked over to a set of bookshelves 
that had make a creaking sound.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Gotcha!

Or... wait...?
He turned to the aisle and saw... nothing.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That was close...)

The silent thought felt like it echoed from where I 
was.

I had climbed the bookshelf to the top of one.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Some of the scaffolding up here leads through a 
window.)

Slowly but surely, I crawled my way along the 
bookselves' tops and to the scaffolding.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
A rat... maybe...?

Hmm...

Through the corner of my eye I saw the candlelight 
raise like he was looking towards to the top of the 
bookshelves.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Shit, did he figure it out?)
I started to rush.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No!)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: The rat?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No more time for stealth.

My feet propped myself to jump up and sprint from 
where I was, but...

There was a low rumbling sound. I turned my head 
down to see the surface beneath me falling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (The renovation stuff... it's falling?!)

The surface fell forward and forced me to tumbled 
along the path I was walking!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh!

I hit the ground hard as I fell out of a window and 
onto the ground outside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: O- Ow...
A voice could be heard from within.

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Goddess... Goddess help me...

*Cough*... I guess it was just this
thing falling apart, in the end.

Oh fucking...! This shit fell apart?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Okay, he's definitely distracted now.)

I jumped to my feet and scrambled around the 
side of the library towards its entranceway.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... *pant*...

I turned back to see the librarian wander out the 
front door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (At least he's okay.)

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Dammit, the main branch will not be happy about 
this. It'll cost a ton to fix.

The damn contractors will face the wrath of the 
Covenant!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And... I don't want any part of that.
I ran off to the inn.

With supplies on hand, our Nightless Crows 
company and allies started on our way out 
of town.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mr. DeClares, was it?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Cainan DeClares at your service.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You said that people at this... academy, was it...?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: The Theodal Royal Academy, yes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Right.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You said they'd be able to offset the symptoms of 
this curse, correct?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It is a possibility.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
But if there is any place that can, it would be them. 
They are a bastion of knowledge and research.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...
As we were talking, we passed by the library.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Did something happen here?

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text:
Hmph. Looks like the contractors we hired for the 
renovations did a poor job.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
Unfortunate. Shall I send word to Oadthine for 
assistance?

lines.speaker: Librarian
lines.text: If you could, that would be most appreciated.

The librarian headed off grumbling under 
his breath.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: I am happy I stopped you from entering.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It would do us no good if you had been trapped 
beneath the rubble.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah... That was... That was a good call...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And take one down, pass it around~ 
23 boxes left to pack~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh dear Aurier up in the sky... Please strike down 
this fool.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
The goddess would not dare starve the world of 
my lovely singing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You actually think you're good at singing?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: How about we let the goddess herself decide?

Rowan raised his chin to look towards the sky.

..........

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It appears your prayer went... unanswered?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: That doesn't mean anything.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... It is good to be goddess approved~

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: 23 boxes left to pack~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Shut up, shut up, SHUT UP!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Ai, shut it yourself. I'm trying to take a nap.
Otis was strewn about on top of a tall box nearby.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
If ya want to get it to stop, just finish up the prep 
work.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And why aren't you or your crew helping?!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Hungover, lass.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: You do wanna leave today, ay?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I wish for you to do the job you were hired for...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Then we'll leave... *yawn*... tomorrow...

Otis rolled his back towards Charlotte and quickly 
started producing snores.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You little...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: 23 boxes left to pack~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Urgh! I get it!
Charlotte turned towards the loading ramp.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Why are you unloading a box?

I stood there with a box still in my hands. It was 
covering my chest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh... well... It has good shape to get a grip on. It 
works well as a foundation to what I am carrying...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's... more efficient.

My grip on the box tightened as I drew it a little 
closer to my chest.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Sigh*... I don't care... We shouldn't even be 
doing this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well... It is what it is... so...

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: We should act like a team. / Make light of the situation. / Complain about Otis, as well.
I started to move towards and around Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We're all on the same team at this point.

Maybe they're not contributing now, but we'll be 
reliant on them once we set sail.

As I began to make my way around the two, I kept 
facing them and sidestepped as I kept moving.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's the least we can do to get from point A to 
point B safely, right?
I had made my way to the other side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We should try to all get along, no? I'll get another 
box to pack.

With those words, I quickly pivoted to facing away 
from them and scurried off from the scene.
I started to move towards and around Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What else do you expect of the bandits of the sea? 
I've heard some tales myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You should hear some of the stories the Crows 
have of pirates. Bard boy over there probably has a 
few tales, too.

As I began to make my way around the two, I kept 
facing them and sidestepped as I kept moving.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then again, if we don't want it to happen again...?

Maybe we should pour out the rum before setting 
off?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Urgh...
I had made my way to the other side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
As for this? Better to just get it over with, right? 
Haha... ha...

With those words, I quickly pivoted to facing away 
from them and scurried off from the scene.
I started to move towards and around Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, it is the typical sort of pain in the butt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That dumb nekolyn is going to be the death of us if 
this keeps up.

As I began to make my way around the two, I kept 
facing them and sidestepped as I kept moving.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Rowan, you should keep singing as a punishment 
for the dead weight snoring up there.
I had made my way to the other side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess... let's not dawdle. We can make up for 
these guys being lazy, at least.

With those words, I pivoted to facing away from 
them and scurried off from the scene.
Charlotte turned back to Rowan.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What? Not going to sing "24 boxes" since one was 
taken off?
Rowan's eyes were set on the skies above the sea.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It looks as though a storm may be setting in?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A storm...?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Shit. Kid's right.

Otis jumped down from the box. He rubbed his 
neck that was stiff from sleeping.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
I'll get me mates. We really can't burn our time if 
dark clouds are formin'.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Ah... The Crimson Sea's bloody enough without 
the cracklin' of lightnin'.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, then shouldn't we stay in port?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh, by the looks of it we can stay to its edges even 
if it gets bad.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Well, if we hurry to get going at least. 
Chop-chop, princess.

With the full crew getting whipped into action, we 
were able to get out of port soon enough.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Such unnecessary dramatics...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
At least we were able to get out of port before 
the sun was fully up.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Small victories do not always feel as such.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
At least we left before the sun was able to fully 
rise. Small victory that it is.

For my part, as the ship began to drift away from 
port, I closely grabbed onto the ship's railings.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Watching the town as it goes over the horizon?

When she approached, I scooted myself closer to 
the railing as to not face her.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah... That sounds about right?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Is it your first time?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(I guess I haven't before but...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(How could I care about that when dealing with... 
this...)

I looked down to the small protrusions on my 
chest. The ones that I was attempting to hide.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I was little at the time. It has a sort of magical air in 
my memories.

But even now it still is a pretty sight to watch.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Watching the town as it goes over the horizon?

When he approached, I scooted myself closer to 
the railing as to not face him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah... That sounds about right?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Mayhap this be your first chance to do do?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(I guess I haven't before but...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(How could I care about that when dealing with... 
this...)

I looked down to the small protrusions on my 
chest. The ones that I was attempting to hide.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It was a long time before I had an opportunity, but 
it was a surreal moment.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
No matter what hardships have come since, that 
day still stands as a nostalgic milestone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I... need to check on something.

Not handling the anxiety well, I dipped away and 
slipped towards the ship's cabins.

My conversation partner was left there looking 
confused.

The two ships we had taken set out smoothly into 
the sea.

While the storm clouds stayed in the distance, I set 
myself up with a blanket for a nap.

Then another nap.

And another.

*Shove*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What the...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Stop moping. Help grab some supplies for meal 
time.

I quickly grabbed the blanket again to cover myself 
with.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sure...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Don't drag your feet, then.

Norde walked away and the intense feeling of 
vulnerability that had washed over me died down.

I slowly got up to my feet and made my way 
through the ship cabins, blanket still covering me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There you are. Where've you been hiding?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... just resting.
I turned away to not face her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Then can you-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- Norde already asked me for some help.

With that, I scurried off around a corner of the 
internal corridors.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Okay...

Hmm... Wasn't that direction the way back 
outside?

Bursting onto deck, I breathed a sigh of relief. The 
light drizzle was enough for me to raise the blanket 
over my head.
But I was quickly met with a gust of wind!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah!

The blanket was ripped from my grip and flew 
overboard.

I took my jacket off to shield me from the rain as I 
ran after it.

My hand reached out and...!

Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Dammit... Now I can't sneak back inside.

A jerk of the ship left me grabbing onto a railing 
nearby.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(What now... Maybe I should get...)

(Wait, Norde never told me what to get.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Whatever, I can just ride it out here. Hopefully no 
one-)

Another jerk of the boat tested my grip.

Yet, at the same time, an alien sensation of weight 
pulling on my chest flashed in my senses.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Crap... I really don't want to deal with these 
bouncing around now of all times...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I really need to just go and-
*Splash*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Was that just...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Was that just a wave... of water?

My mouth was agape, me stuttering much the 
same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Could you stop shaking about, you stupid ship?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Do these really need to be so... mobile...?!

The feeling of the breasts interacting with gravity 
became a lot more apparent.

At least it was after that strong first bounce and 
subsequent turbulence.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It isn't even like they're that... big?!

I tried to stabilize at least one of them with a free 
hand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And so noticeable through the wet shirt?!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh shit...

How can I hide this...?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hide what?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nothing!

I spun towards Charlotte's voice, but draped my 
front with my jacket.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, I was just getting some air...

And there was... like... some rain and... water... 
and... uh...

I wasn't doing nothing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh, I don't care, just get inside. Even at the edge 
of the storm, it's dangerous to be out here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Thank the goddess, she won't notice after all.)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, did Pup start a wet shirt competition?

Rowan poked his head from the door Charlotte had 
exited.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Charlotte, you must join in!

Surely your breasts will glimmer in the stormy skies 
as well?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Say another word and die, cretin.
Rowan retreated within the ship again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How did...

How did... he know?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Come on.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: H- How did... How did...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Everyone knows! Now get inside!

Charlotte grabbed my non-functioning self and 
dragged me back into the ship cabin.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We've literally got a walking, talking, and drinking 
example of the sort of thing happening to you.

It's not a difficult guess!

She said as my body autonomously went along with 
her dragging me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.. But... How... I...

My mind was dulled.

Static buzzed like white noise among my thoughts.
Recent events felt unreal.

They felt detached from my end goal.

My destination.

My...

*Bump*

The bumps of the carriage wheel along the 
roadside had shaken me out of my stupor.

I was greeted with the sight of the port and 
lodgings we were at... being left behind.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
So, you've simply been traveling aimlessly since 
dropping out of the academy?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: 'Aimless' might be the wrong word, but...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It has indeed been a glorious sequence of 
happenstance on many occasion.

An awkward air filled my senses.

I felt like an outsider to every word being 
discussed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Right, this is why I tried to zone out...)

Turning my head, I looked again at the situation 
playing out in the carriage.

The greater group had been split among carriages 
for a tour of the Cartenan capital.

I had somehow ended up with this group.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Haha... to think that young boy Alexei would be 
able to travel the world like so.

I still remember that time you collapsed from 
running in the physical education courses.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah... I do insist. "Rowan" is my name.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: And believe me. I would still faint.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
("Kara"... and "Alexei"... This is... Who even are 
these people? These names?)

I turned my head away from that conversation to 
our fourth passenger...
...who was staring daggers at Rowan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Has she blinked?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, maybe this is better than nothing.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Isn't this crazy? All this talk about a "prince" and 
stuff?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah... like... all that stuff.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Allegedly... he just had a growth spurt.

And a complete personality shift.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... you actually knew him? Do you buy that?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Allegedly... he dropped out of school to go 
wandering about who knows where.

Allegedly... he hasn't spoken to his royal parentage 
since before all that took place.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... I wasn't really...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Allegedly... he thought it a good idea to just not 
mention any of this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (She's not really listening to me.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Allegedly... allegedly... allegedly...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I've no qualms about pretending this was never 
revealed to the world at large.

It was my intent, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Yeah... just try putting that genie back in 
the bottle.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Why is it that you kept this from your old friend?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Alleged friend.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It was not my initial intent, but Charlotte didn't 
recognize me.

Afterwards, my mind was aflutter with concepts of 
grand reveals.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Imagine me, the foreign prince, stationing myself 
on a border with legions in tow.

Am I friend or foe? What twists and turns does 
such a dramatic endeavor bring impending?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
With an army in tow? But Lockhart has already 
been invaded?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I... was still in the planning phases.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Alleged planning phases.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: What a nostalgic feeling this conversation has.
The carriage came to a stop.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We must be here.

With Kara leading the group out of the carriage, we 
found ourselves in a grand courtyard.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
This is our first stop on the tour.

Theodal's Grand Cathedral to the Goddess.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(Holy... that's massive.)

(They make buildings this big?!)

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: An elegant visage, as always.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah. Kara, why the tour anyways? We've lived 
here for years back in school.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: "We" have?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Allegedly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It is good to refamiliarize yourself with subjects 
you've not touched in years.

Places and... people... you may not recognize as 
well as you once did.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well, if it's you that's saying so...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Now, if you'll see here...

We toured the Cathedral, seeing the various works 
of art that made it up.

Afterwards, we continued on to other locations, 
until...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: U- Uh...
A finger was poking me in the forehead.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Elasticity of section 1... minimal.

Now section 2...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Careful where you...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Are you able to cure me or not? I got excited 
when they said you could do something.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It will be several days before the Queen can take 
your meeting.

Until then, we have recruited a professor from the 
Royal College to assist in your case.

His name is Castel Balreig. He is a specialist in various 
types of magical research.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: This would be a good time for you to meet him.

I looked around the room as I sat on the 
examination table.

The others were in an observation room off to the 
side, but towards my front...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Sigh*... Impatience only leads to folly.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
And cure? I don't know about that. This is the 
work of an Oathbreaker after all.

They work outside the bounds of the laws of the 
Goddess. To use the miracles within those bounds 
has no guaranteed counter.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So... you can't? Then why...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
What I can do is introduce you to cosmetic essence 
manipulation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Cosmet... what?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I guess you'd be unaware, wouldn't you? It's most 
commonly used by the gentry, after all.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It is a very specialized way to use magic.

Red magic is the magic of energy. Of power and 
elements.

Green magic is the magic of creation. Of matter. 
The bits and pieces that make up our world.

And blue magic is the magic of the divine. The soul 
and essence that defines the self.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Imagine if those were to be used in precise 
coordination.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
You could control the fabric of the self. You could 
mold a being to your design.

Power, stamina, longevity. Nothing is truly outside 
of our grasp.

This combination of the three is called "Gray" 
magic.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You could... anything?!

How... How is this not a massive thing?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It is... an ongoing research initiative that has lots of
financiers to pursue it.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
But to manipulate anything so specifically... the 
amount of calculations and skill required is massive.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
*Sigh*...It is a very complicated field of research, to 
say it simply.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: The math...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
The math involved is among the most complicated 
any can do.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: If that allows you to understand properly.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then... If it's so complicated, then how are you 
supposed to help me?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
There is one area of the field that is fairly well 
developed. Something that nobles jump at the 
chance to finance the research of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That being...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
As said before... cosmetics.

Remove aging wrinkles. Change or grow hair.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Enlarge external sexual characteristics...

He looked at me as and could tell I still wasn't 
entirely keeping up.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Bigger boobs. Bigger butts. Bigger penises.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Nobles can be very open with their wallets when 
these possibilities are at stake.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nobles do...

I turned to the watching audience. The ones who 
were left outside of the lab to wait and listen.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Nobles do... that...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
How old do you think I am?! I don't need some 
stupid stuff like that.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I never have, but I've always been intrigued by the 
field.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Ah, come on, Kara. You're plenty young and 
pretty.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I am simply a fan of humanity's ability to push 
boundaries.
My eyes turned to the last audience member.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah. Myself?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I shall leave it to your imagination.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Then my imagination won't partake, please and 
thank you.)
I turned back to Professor Balreig.
...who was touching my hair now.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
A non-standard texture given the predicament.

Perhaps green magic could help? Textures are 
formed by surface interactions after all.
He moved to check my forearms.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
And no body hair? It is almost unnaturally smooth.

Then red magic to counter this? To metabolize the 
hair growth?

After poking and prodding at my body, he stepped 
back to look over my body.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I suppose there is no guarantee any of it will work, 
but... theoretically...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Okay, this is getting weird.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Think of it as what it is. A medical procedure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess that helps a bit, yeah.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Now strip.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
If I am to analyze the extent of the changes to 
you, then I must see the body proper. From head 
to toe.
You are covered with a bulky, unwieldy jacket and 
other gear.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I... Do I... have to...?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Of course you do. This is questionable if it even can 
work.

There is no room for error. So, I need to start the 
detailed preparations to-

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Clears throat*

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: M- Ms. Lyons...!

Kara had appeared suddenly next to Professor 
Balreig.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It was a lovely visit, but we do not have time on 
our schedule for this level of detail.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Thank you...

(I feel like she saved me...)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
The stripping will simply have to be done at a later 
date.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Wait, wh- what?!

Kara grabbed my hand and began to lead me and 
the group out to the carriage again.

Rushed into the carriage, the tour continued 
without many more thoughts on that subject for 
the time.
With that, it passed through my thoughts into 
memory as we made a few more stops.

The last one being a restaurant. An incredibly fancy 
and high end restaurant.

"Click" went the porcelain glass that was set in 
front of me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(They said this was... tea?)

I thought I knew what I was in for when the 
option of tea was available, but the presentation 
threw me off.
The aroma smelled like nothing I smelled before, 
and the cup itself had so many impractical details 
that it'd be fruitless to try to start counting.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What, never drank tea before?
She said as she took a sip.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course I have.

I grabbed the cup and quickly raised it to my 
mouth.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Oh... Anton, was it?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is an etiquette to tea drinking in such an 
establishment.

You shouldn't raise the saucer with it, and your 
pinky should be-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Slurp*!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Ah! Sips! Sips!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(That was...)

(That was better than I thought, but...)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh?

I didn't like her teasing expression.

I decided to...

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Compliment the tea. / Lean into the teasing. / Lambast the tea.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That is quite good.

Compliments to the... uh... chef?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Teamaker. Or brewer perhaps?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Wait, what would it be? We should-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, so this is what tea tastes like?

Ah, my life is changed! How did I ever live 
without it!
?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Hmm...

Is that the game you want to play?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess it tastes like tea. Like most tea.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like... dirty water.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You want to play that game? Then...
*Clap clap*

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Now now. The food will be here soon. No need to 
rile yourselves up before a good meal, yes?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You may be surprised at the joy a rowdy round of 
food can bring.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
So says the guy who... allegedly... attended the 
same etiquette classes as the rest of us.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I do recall him doing well in those courses.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: The elegant hand is but a tool for one to wield.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm... Is that so...?

The discussion began to meander off into old 
school stories and references.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(There they go into that again.)

(I can see why I was with Kara's group because of 
my... situation. But...)
Their conversation continued.
And continued...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (When will that food get here?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe I could try to change the subject? Or make 
it more relevant to something I can talk about?)
I decided to...

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Ally with Charlotte against Rowan's suspiciousness. / Gossip about the others' pasts via Kara. / Ally with Rowan to make "sides" to the conversation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You know...
I leaned over towards Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You really think Rowan is this "Alexei" guy?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... Good question.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Well, we should keep an eye out for any... foul play 
by him, right?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We could make a great team for doing just that.

With your brains and my brawn, we could cover the 
gambit.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'd be up for being cautious. Too many alleged 
claims not to be.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
But are you sure about that last part?

Me brains and you brawn? Is that how that'd work 
out?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Uh... I mean, why wouldn't it? I'm a mercenary and 
you're a princess.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... I wonder.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
There was a time when Charlotte loved to play the 
big bad guardian.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hey. You were just a little kid.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Was I?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A- Allegedly...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So...
I leaned over towards Kara.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're supposed to be a friend of these two, right?

Have they always been at each others' necks like 
this?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: They had their moments.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
But they always made for a cute pairing of 
underclassman and upperclassman.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Moments, then? Anything particularly scandalous? 
Stuff that surprised you?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can't say anything comes to mind. Not much will 
surprise me these days.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ah, come on. I'm sure there's something fun like 
that.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I cannot say I remember the last time I was truly 
surprised by something.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You'd be better off rephrasing your question.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... O- Okay...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then... maybe...?
As I was about to do just that...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What are you talking about "no surprises"?

There was that time Alexei got dragged by a horse 
in riding class.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ugh... What a cruel memory to introduce.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
*Giggle*... I don't believe that to be a perfectly 
accurate account. After all, there was...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You know...
I leaned over towards Rowan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
