This 'Alexei' thing...

I don't know if I buy it, but Charlotte definitely 
seems to want your head on a pike.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I have grown used to it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
You had a similar sentiment as of
just recently, did you not?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
R- Right... Out of the fire and into another, I 
guess?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You do tend to do everything you can to stop 
people from trusting you, though.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: At this rate I may need a bodyguard.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Might you be willing to take up that mantle?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
B- Bodyguard? You mean...?

(Wait, is he being serious?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
As if a bodyguard would keep you safe if I really 
wanted to.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
This reminds me of that one boy you sought 
revenge on in the academy.

What did he do? Try to take your hat from you?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah, and if you want to end up like him...

And so each of them went back to their nostalgic 
topics.

So I sat back and just waited.

Less than a minute later a plate was put before me 
with a meal.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Looks good...

I picked at the food with my fork and took small 
bites.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Looks good. Is good...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I wonder if I could take some as leftovers?)

(It'll be my turn for a supply run soon. Maybe that'll 
get me out of it?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Maybe.
*Click*
*Click*
*Click*

*Click*

The carriage moved swiftly, but the click of wheels 
on brick roads were loud.

Very loud.

*Click*

I started to feel like I was going to hurl as the next 
bump of the brick road rattled my senses.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (The Queen... We need to talk to... the Queen...)

I tried to focus my attention into staring at a single 
point.

In this case, it was my arm.

I stared at my...

I expected to see hairs standing on edge, but I 
didn’t have any body hair to do so.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Right, I had that-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ugh...

(I need to stop thinking about it...)

I stared at my...

I expected to see hairs standing on edge, but I 
didn’t have any body hair to do so.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It really is just hitting me all-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ugh...

(I need to stop thinking about it...)

As my eyes unfocused and my breathing caught up 
with me, I tilted towards the carriage window.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Snowy... mountains... how... how pretty?)

My mind struggled to focus on it, so I gave in to 
the distractions.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Do not lose focus.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I know. I know, I know...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Mmm...

Norde had a drop of sweat going down his brow.

His breathing was distinctly controlled and calm, 
as though it required effort.

And he couldn’t get that look of frustration off his 
face anymore.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You’re also...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Do not... say it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Yeah, he is.)

(I can’t be mad at him about it. He’s handling it 
way better than I am...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It... will not be long now.

As Norde said as much, the city... and the palace... 
was coming into view.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: ...You DARE set foot here as such?!
The outburst shook me from my stupor.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: ...a sacred place of authority and...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...n’t have done it if...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...not know the minds of...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...save the kingdom and then...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And then...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (And then...?!)

I tried to pay attention to the conversation they 
were having with the Queen. I really did.

But I couldn’t.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What did she...?

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Shh!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: S- Sorry...

We had been placed in a group boxed by royal 
guards.

Only Charlotte, Kara, and Rowan were allowed to 
approach due to their statuses within the world.

But being away from the conversation wasn’t the 
main reason I had trouble hearing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh...

A dull, ringing sensation underscored the sounds I 
heard.

It accompanied a sore sensation that left only a 
partial feeling coming from my nerves.

I tried to grip my hand tighter, if only to 
reinvigorate my ability to sense the surrounding 
world.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text: ...foolish enough to...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...what everyone said about...

Goosebumps slid across my back and up across my 
head, where the roots of my hair felt like they 
were stinging.
Along with it, feelings of heat pulsated through the 
rest of my body. With emphasis around my chest 
and hips.
I tried very hard to not think about what any of 
that meant, as much as my mind wanted to 
wander to it.
And I... bit my tongue.

The tighter grip didn’t work, so...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Keep focus... I can’t mess up now.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Crows just happened to...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...if you could...

...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...come over...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...PUP!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup, please come tell the Queen about it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right... Yeah...

lines.speaker: Knight
lines.text: Don’t make any sudden moves as you approach.
I nodded my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Approach... for...?)

We hadn’t had a chance to discuss our strategy for 
this meeting before.

So I simply followed the directions and approached 
the part of the throne room with Charlotte and 
them.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Thank you very much for your assistance here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Anton here was there when it happened.

So, as a first hand testimony...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Oh, so she wants...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, I can do that.
I turned towards the Queen.

lines.speaker: Avalina
lines.text:
Then, Anton Baranov of the Nightless Crows... Tell 
me of this ordeal.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I am... Anton Baranov. I am the current acting 
head of the Nightless Crows Mercenary Corp.

Not too long ago, we... we...

My words were starting to get stuck. I took a 
breath and tried to reset myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not too long ago, we were hired to... and...

And the telegram lines. They were.. And then... 
then...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...there were... bandits and...
I hit my limit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...

With but a second of grogginess, I became aware 
again.

Patting my body around, a morbid curiosity quickly 
took over me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Nothing... No changes...

...yet...

I felt significantly better. I still felt woozy, but the 
bout of weakness that had overtaken me had 
subsided.
With that, my attention swung to the present.

Voices came from beyond my bedside.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: ...would not be wise to let him go...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
...not like we’re lacking in people. We could leave 
him with...
A discussion was being had.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It’s about me.)

(Did they get the Queen’s assistance?)

...
They were just around the corner.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I’m not staying behind if the Empire is showing up 
again.)
I needed to pick my words carefully.

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Try to reason with them / Try to appeal to their emotions / Just refuse outright

I rose to my feet and pulled the bedside curtain 
out of the way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can help.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You’re awake?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We all remember what happened in Lockhart. We 
need everyone we can get.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I’m better.

I’m ready to help.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You believe yourself to be fit to fight?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
After what happened at Lockhart. I need to help. I 
can.

We don’t even have... We don’t even have my 
father this time.

There isn’t room for debate on this.

I rose to my feet and pulled the bedside curtain 
out of the way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So we’re headed out now? Let’s get going.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You’re awake?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Sorry if I have some bed head, but I think we have 
more important things to deal with.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I’m doing as well as one can expect.

I wouldn’t dare sit this one out.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You believe yourself to be fit to fight?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I know I can handle a sword. Maybe even swing it 
with some righteous fury, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If this is the Empire... I... You all know I cannot just 
sit this out.

This is too important for too many reasons to 
debate.

I rose to my feet and pulled the bedside curtain 
out of the way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Let’s get going, then.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You’re awake?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And ready to go.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I’m ready to fight.

I wouldn’t dare sit this one out.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You believe yourself to be fit to fight?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I believe I will fight. I KNOW I will.

If this is anything like Lockhart... I’m not going to 
just let it pass me by.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I will make a difference. I won’t... I won’t be the 
reason for sacrifices being made.

The stares that came my way were wary.
I could press the issue only so much.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I... agree.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You... what?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: We shouldn’t...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You... wait, really?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
If one is compelled to action and can make a true 
difference...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Do you think you could make a true difference, 
Anton?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I support it, then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you...

I turned back and stared at the others with a 
determined face.
But...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Is it the curse again?!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: U- Uh... I can get a first aid kit!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Eh, lad. Knowin’ ya limits are important.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Especially in the early days for ya.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Yeah, this is getting irresponsible.

A barrage of worried faces that couldn’t look 
anymore like antagonists filled my vision.

Voices of worry barraged my hearing.

And I dreaded the approaching hands of mercy.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I can...!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then make a promise.

There it was. An opening.

A path through the ocean of goodwill.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Promise everyone you will not allow yourself to die.

That you will stop yourself when you cross that line 
of becoming a hindrance.
A medic approached Kara.

lines.speaker: Medic
lines.text:
These are the supplies you wanted me to run out 
and get, right?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: They are. Thank you.

As the medic scurried off, she seemed to start 
preparing a small sort of tonic.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Promise.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Okay. I promise.

I promise I will retreat when it goes too far.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Good.

With her tonic nearly complete, she unbuttoned 
her collar and took out a necklace.

Soon enough, it shone with a brilliant light.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Magic? This is an heirloom?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Are you enchanting the tonic in some way?

The shimmering lights of the magic settled into 
the tonic.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
This will not cure you. This will not ease your 
symptoms.

It will, however, stop them from getting worse for 
a time.

And that is all it will be. Time. Time that you must 
make the most of.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... How did you...?

I looked down at the bottle she had placed in my 
hand.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Thank you.

I... I will not break your faith.

The others around didn’t have anything more to 
say.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I look forward to seeing you rise to this challenge.

I looked her in the eyes and nodded.

I gave no attention to the others.
To their gazes of worry.

Hope had won.

Over the tides of goodwill.

The fluttering rays of light filtered through the
morning haze.

Blinded by it in the awakening daze, I could only 
hear the ruckus of something from afar.

I couldn't make out words, but I assumed 
something had happened.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Apologies, but excuse me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Hello?

A woman was standing over my sleeping bag,
folding some sort of a fabric.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Oh, did I wake you? I'm so sorry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Oh wait...)

Mrs. Ranasseur.

Mrs. Marya Ranasseur was standing over me. 
Atticus's wife.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I was just getting an early start on rolling up your
supplies here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why... would you do that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Did someone spot the army in the area already?)
I picked myself up and yawned.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Well...

As I knelt down to start collecting my own sleeping
bag, she told me about how the Oathbreaker was 
gone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- What?!

(After everything we did?! How did... How did that
happen?!)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
That sweet girl Charlotte agreed to help track it 
down as part of your group's efforts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, of course we can help.
I quickened my rolling of the sleeping bag.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Thank you. I know it would do my husband's heart 
good to know you have his back wholeheartedly.
With a huff, I pulled the stored sleeping bag up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course. After all, if we don't, then who will?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: In this case, especially.
Kara approached, with Charlotte not far behind her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How did they get it in the night? We were all here...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If there's a trail to follow, we're the only ones with
a shot of finding that lead.

It would be weeks before a Covenant deployment
could be here to start an investigation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll carry this over to the horses and-
I stepped forward.
As I did...
...I stumbled a little.

My clothes had gotten tangled with the sleeping 
bag a little, catching on it in a way I didn't expect.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I'll just be on my way.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Oh my, are you alright?

You're absolutely swimming in that outfit...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, you noticed, too?

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Sweetie, I can offer you something that may fit 
better, if it'd help?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Despite the problem, that is a bit much to ask of 
you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, these will suit me fine...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That was not what I said.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
It really is no trouble. If anything getting rid of
some of the clothes stored around here would be a 
help to us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I don't-
Charlotte grabbed the sleeping bag...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup. Take the offer.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It really has gotten unmanageable. One wrong 
move in a fight and you could open yourself up
to a fatal attack.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just... need to adjust the tailoring again a little.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A little...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You know what? Want me to bribe you "a little" 
instead?

What about some sweets at the next village?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like... what sort of sweet...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Kara and I have probably tried things you've never 
even heard of before. Maybe one of those?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean....
I shook my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
N- No! Of course I'm not gonna get bought with a 
little chocolate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that supposed to tempt me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not one of your schoolgirl classmates from when 
you were at the academy.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You may be surprised by how delectable some offerings
are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not gonna fall for that either...

No means no.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well, then that just means you're doing it for free.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Charlotte... the only clothes she'd have that'd 
fit me are women's clothes...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I mean...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Actually, did you not say to treat you as a girl?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Why would your wardrobe be an exception?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh yeah, nice catch.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... That's not what I meant by-
All of sudden, I was pulled forward a little.

Charlotte swiftly took the sleeping bag while I was
distracted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No more excuses. Just go make sure you're not 
gonna get yourself killed over it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But I'm not gonna-
And this time, I felt a grip on my gambeson.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Oh, it won't take long, dear. Trust me.

Now a tug, only for the scene in front of me to 
start getting father away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We'll get everything ready to go.
...with their waves to accompany the farewell.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Fuuuccckkk...)

Entering the Vault's dormitory halls, I could only
sigh.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (They got me roped into this again...)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
...and then Xavier joined Lefen on his quest. I am
proud, though I'd probably be happier if they were 
safe and sound.
Add to that, Euna and Pelus actually have time to 
visit from time to time. I wish they all could.

Marya guided me through the halls, and quickly 
found herself talking about her children.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I guess it must have been a while since she had
someone new to talk to out here.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(But... to immediately start talking about your
kids...?)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Ah, if only you could meet. I'm sure Euna could 
help you pick which clothes would best suit you.

Though maybe the mother's touch has gotten to 
her sense of fashion too~

I really must go out there to see my grandson 
again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Are all mother's like this?)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Ah, sorry. Maybe I'm getting a bit off topic?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Haha... It's no worry. You seem so excited about it
that it'd be a shame to stop you.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I suppose so! I am just going off on my own 
tangents.

You'll understand once you're a mother.
I stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What did she... say...? Did I mishear her...?)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: And here it is.

Not far in front of my stopped location, she opened 
a door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I must have misheard her...  *Clears throat* ...
So I stepped through the door.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Tada!

It was a dress! 

I wasn't surprised.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Euna always looked so cute in it when she wore it. 
And it's warmer than your typical dress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Your... daughter's... dress...?

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I'm sure she won't mind. It was among the 
wardrobe she left behind when she moved out...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I'm not sure I could work with a dress. It is a
battlefield after all.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Are you sure? I saw multiple of your allies wearing
dresses, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Haha... haha... I'm sure... they're just more used to
it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It'd be much safer for me to just get this old thing
tailored again.
I backed away towards the door.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: There are other outfits I can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, I think it'd be too much of me to ask for your
daughter's hand-me- downs.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- You really don't have to worry about it.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: If... you insist.

As I was one foot out the door, I tried to not look 
her in the eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It... really was nice hearing about your family.

I gave a brief but sincere smile, and hurried my 
way back the way we came.

She crossed her arms and sighed like a 
disappointed mother.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I assume that means Pup didn't take the outfit?

Kara, watching me as I hurriedly headed back, 
stepped through the door to meet with Marya.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: It's a shame, I think it suited her, too.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
What a cute dress. It would have indeed went with Pup's
hair.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Is she okay? I never imagined she'd be so against it
once here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is a bit of a story behind that.

...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Though, I do have an idea...

Our path took us from the vault, leading us out of 
the mountains.

Luckily, signs of our pursuers from the Cartenan
struggle were few and far between.
We had time.

So we moved along a safe path to head south 
within the empire, all while we looked for any signs 
of the Oathbreaker thief.
There were... thoughts beyond the effort, as well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I can't believe you didn't take the damn outfit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha... haha...

It wasn't long until we were at the base of the
mountains.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We'll be stopping at this village here.

Norde pointed towards a map. It was a village at 
the base of the mountains, often used for 
resupplying for expeditions into them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A supply town... They'd probably have...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A tailor?

The sun just rose, so they should be open soon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah...

lines.speaker: Tailor
lines.text:
...and that'll be maybe an hour or so to finish once 
it gets to the top of my queue.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you.

I paid the shopkeep, while keeping an eye out over 
my shoulder for the other tagalongs.

...amongst other Crows that needed repairs from 
the long trek in the mountains.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Tailor
lines.text: Here, follow me.

The shopkeep led me towards the changing 
room, since I needed my current clothes adjusted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Charlotte and them don't seem... suspicious?)

I watched her and the others happily look through 
the displays.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(They do seem to be having fun... Makes me 
wonder... what would look good on them?)

I tilted my chin upwards and started to let my mind
drift as we walked.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Here you go.

I passed along my clothes through the changing 
room tarp.

lines.speaker: Tailor
lines.text:
Perfect. I'll be back with a basic spare set. Then 
you can return later when the work is done.

They left and I could hear the footsteps echo off 
into the distance, so I exhaled a bit.

Slipping back into the changing room chair in just 
my under layers, I tried not to look into the mirror 
too much.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I wonder what sort of clothes Charlotte and them 
are looking at?)
Instead, I distracted myself with an idle thought.

I tried to imagine some of them in the outfits they 
may be looking at, but...
Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I... don't have the faintest clue of what clothes
those were.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(To be honest, I'm not even sure what they might 
be looking at.)
An itch of curiosity washed over me.

And it was in that moment that I heard footsteps
outside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(The shopkeep is back with the temporary
clothes? That was fast.)

Standing up, I stepped over to the curtain 
and poked my head out.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Here, hand me-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hand you what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Some clothes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: C- Charlotte?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup, we had a thought.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So, a little... sponsor's whim here.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: No need to dance around it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: My dear Pup...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: We have some outfits for you to try~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
To say it simply, you need to try one of these 
outfits.

Breath taken away, I breathed deeply as I looked 
from outfit to person.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh, come on. You're waiting on the tailor to adjust
your normal outfit, so you need something to try 
on until she's done.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The shopkeep said they had some spare sets for
situations like this. Basic clothes...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Don't worry. We already told her we'd take care of it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I think the shopkeep assumes we took on
that responsibility now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Why did you push that set of dominoes?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Come on. It's too late to take it back.

She pushed the outfit she held in my 
general direction.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It's... more fun than you give it credit for.

Just try it the one time before you say no.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What sort of self proclaimed girl can't try on an
outfit?
I pulled myself back behind the curtain.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Dammit...)

Fine. Just... Just one of them.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Perfect!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There's a few options here.
She listed off what had been grabbed.

Something formal. 
Something flowy. 
Something with armor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, if I'm gonna try one, then I might as well...)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Formal Outfit / Flowy Outfit / Battle Outfit

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just... give me the formal one.

(That's... probably going to be the most normal? I
think...)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good choice.

Her hand stuck through the curtain, and I 
grabbed the clothes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If you need any help with a part of it, just say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...
I laid it out to get a better look.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Hmm... It's somewhat normal but has all these 
bells and whistles. Like a noble would have.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Or maybe like... a diplomat or something?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just... give me the flowy one.

(If they're gonna insist, better to go big or not at
all... I think.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good choice.

Her hand stuck through the curtain, and I 
grabbed the clothes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If you need any help with a part of it, just say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...
I laid it out to get a better look.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Hmm... It's so fancy. Like something a noble would
wear.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Or maybe like... a dancer or something?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just... give me the armored one.

(If I'm gonna do this, it's best to do something I'm
more used to.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good choice.

Her hand stuck through the curtain, and I 
grabbed the clothes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If you need any help with a part of it, just say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...
I laid it out to get a better look.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Hmm... It does seem like its more meant for
mercenaries.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(But it has so many little bells and whistles... Why is
it so... fancy?)
I stared at the outfit.
On the edge of moving.
On the edge... of acting...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ... I can't.

I folded the clothes back up again, and 
handed them out.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh well...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you for trying, at least.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: At least you tried. So thanks.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We'll have the shopkeep bring the normal 
temporary outfit now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks...

I dropped to the seat and could only exhale to try 
and relax.

The footsteps got farther away, and I did overhear 
one last thing before it went silent.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It went better than last time. Maybe next time, we
can...
I closed my eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I am... a girl. A woman.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Even if I change back later, I can't get away 
from that now. But...)
It felt like a point of no return.
It wasn't that it didn't make sense that I should.

It wasn't that my own motivations didn't lead to 
the same conclusion that the girls gave.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Maybe it was just how... feminine they felt...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I sort of wished I just took Marya's offer if I was
gonna do this. It was a bit of a simpler outfit
in comparison, after all...)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup, are you in there?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Kara...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. I'm here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I feared a worse disposition.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...after overhearing the ending earlier.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Of course you did. You've got a future as 
a spy.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Did you want to try them on?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No... Maybe? I don't know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just not... now. Not with the outfits they gave 
me.

(If I'm lucky, maybe I won't have a NEED need to 
until this is all settled and we can think about fixing 
the curse properly.)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Here.
A pile of clothes was passed through the curtain.
A stepped up and took them in my hand.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
That pile has the temporary outfit the shopkeep has for
customers.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It also has the outfit that Marya offered before.

I looked at it, and as she said, the dress 
from before was under the other garment.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Under no situation is there an obligation for you to
act on that in any way.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Consider it an option, though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Thank you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I am glad to be of assistance.

With a shifting sound as though she curtsied, she 
then walked away, and the footsteps went out of 
hearing range.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How does...?)

I stepped in front of the mirror, fearful of what I
might see.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It'll be... fine.

My eyes were half closed, and my other senses 
were stronger for it.

The cool air across my smooth and exposed thighs 
was a new feeling.

The cool air across my exposed thighs was a new
feeling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...It's okay Anton... You're a girl now, even if its
for the time being.

You're a... a... girl...

So I opened my eyes further, and full turned 
towards the mirror.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... a different person.)
I felt like I didn't recognize who I saw.
The silhouette alone took me by surprise.

From how my legs came out of the dress to how 
the corset created a shape around my waist.

Then there was the cleavage showing, and the 
small feminine details like ribbons.

And even my normal features felt new, like how 
each strand of my silky hair fell down to frame my 
face, and how that worked with the dress.

And even my normal features felt new, like my hair
framing my face with the shape the dress created.

I had looked myself over when I had last changed, 
but this... This felt different.
Even in this more modest dress... I was...

I stared, the thoughts passing through my mind 
much like how I had thought about Charlotte and 
the others trying on new outfits before.
Like it was someone else.

At least until a particular thought settled 
in my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... me.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: T- That's... me...?!
The dots had connected.

I switched to the temporary outfit, though my 
heart still raced, and set the dress aside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
I looked at the dress again.
I made sure to fold it carefully.

It wasn't too much longer until my normal clothes 
were tailored to fit better.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hello, Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... Yeah, hey. See you back at camp.
She just smiled, and pressed no further.

I started walking away, but some words quietly 
made their way out.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks... again...
Back at camp, I still had the dress in hand.
After a little hesitation, I stored it in my luggage.
Towards the bottom.
STAGE DIRECTION> IN BETWEEN CHAPTER 10->11 ONLY
STAGE DIRECTION> BLACK SCREEN, WAIT 60 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE VERDURE
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO WHITE BG

The fluttering rays of light filtered through the
morning haze.

Blinded by it in the awakening daze, I could only hear
the ruckus of something from afar.

I couldn't make out words, but I assumed something had
happened.
STAGE DIRECTION> .........

STAGE DIRECTION> MARYA IS ATTICUS'S WIFE. SHE CAN HAVE
A GENERIC PORTRAIT. NICE OLDER LADY.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Apologies, but excuse me.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG DLC SNOW_CASTLE (DAY)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Hello?

A woman was standing over my sleeping bag, folding a
fabric.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Oh, did I wake you? I'm so sorry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who are...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Oh wait...)

Mrs. Ranasseur.

Mrs. Marya Ranasseur was standing over me. Atticus's
wife.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I was just getting an early start on rolling up your
supplies here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why... would you do that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Did someone spot the army in the area already?)
I picked myself up and yawn.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Well...

As I knelt down to start collecting my own sleeping
bag, she told me about how the Oathbreaker was gone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- What?!

(After everything we did?! How did... How did that
happen?!)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
That sweet girl Charlotte agreed to help track it down
as part of your group's efforts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, of course we can.
My motions to roll the sleeping bag hurried.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Thank you. I know it would do my husband's heart good
to know you have his back wholeheartedly.
With a huff, I pulled the stored sleeping bag up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course. After all, if we don't, then who will?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: In this case especially.
Kara approached, with Charlotte not far behind her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How did they get it in the night? We were all here...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If there's a trail to follow, we're the only ones with
a shot of finding that lead.

Any Covenant deployment couldn't be here to start
anytime soon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll get this over to the horses and-
A stepped forward.
As I did...
...I stumbled a little.

My clothes had gotten tangled with the sleeping bag a
little, catching on it in a way I didn't expect.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I'll just be on my way.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Oh my, are you alright?

You're absolutely swimming in that outfit...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, you noticed, too?

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Sweetie, I can offer you something that may fit better,
if it'd help?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Despite the problem, that is a bit much to ask of you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, these will suit me fine...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That was not what I said.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
It really is no trouble. If anything getting rid of
some of the clothes stored around here would be a help
to us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I don't-
Charlotte grabbed the sleeping bag...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup. Take the offer.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It really is at a point where one wrong move and you
could open yourself up to a fatal attack...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just... need to adjust the tailoring again a little.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A little...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You know what? Want me to bribe you "a little" instead?

What about some sweets at the next village?
##### If Sweet tooth TF

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like... what sort of sweet...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Kara and I have probably tried things you've never even
heard of before. Maybe one of those?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean....
I shook my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
N- No! Of course I'm not gonna get bought with a little
chocolate.
###### If Not

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that supposed to tempt me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not one of your schoolgirl classmates from when you
were at school.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You may be surprised by how delectable some offerings
are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not gonna fall for that either...

No means no.
STAGE DIRECTION> ###############

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well, then that just means you're doing it for free.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Charlotte... she's only going to have women's clothes
that fit me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I mean...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Actually, did you not say to treat you as a girl?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Why would your wardrobe be an exception?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh yeah, nice catch.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... That's not what I meant by-
All of sudden, I was pulled forward a little.

Charlotte swiftly took the sleeping bag while I was
distracted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No more excuses. Just go make sure you're not gonna get
yourself killed over it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But I'm not gonna-
And this time, I felt a grip on my gambeson.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Oh, it won't take long, dear. Trust me.

Now a tug, only for the scene in front of my to start
getting father away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We'll get everything ready to go.
...with their waves to accompany the farewell.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Fuuuccckkk...)
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 120 FRAMES

Entering the Vault's dormitory halls, I could only
sigh.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (They got me roped into this again...)
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> PLAY BGM PERITUNE FOLK_ROMA
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BG PRISON (BOOKSHELF VERSION)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
...and then Xavier joined Lefen on his quest. I am
proud, though I'd probably be happier if they were safe
and sound.

Add to that, Euna and Pelus actually have time to visit
from time to time. I wish they all could.

Marya guided me through the halls, and quickly found
herself talking about her children.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I guess it must have been a while since she had
someone new to talk to out here.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(But... to immediately start talking about your
kids...?)

lines.speaker: Marya

Ah, if only you could meet. I'm sure Euna could help

I really must go out there to see my grandson again.

lines.speaker: Pup

lines.text: Ah, sorry. Maybe I'm getting a bit off topic?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Haha... It's no worry. You seem so excited about it

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I suppose so! I am just going off on my own tangents.

You'll understand once you're a mother.
I stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What did she... say...? Did I mishear her...?)

lines.speaker: Marya

Not far in front of my stopped location, she opened a
door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I must have misheard her... 
Clears throat
...
So I stepped through the door.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Tada!
It was a dress! I wasn't surprised.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Euna always looked so cute in it when she wore it. And

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Your... daughter's... dress...?

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I'm sure she won't mind. It was among the wardrobe she

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I'm not sure I could work with a dress. It is a

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: There are other outfits I can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, I think it'd be too much of me to ask for your

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- You really don't have to worry about it.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: If... you insist.

As I was one foot out the door, I tried to not look her

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It... really was nice hearing about your family.

I gave a brief but sincere smile, and hurried my way

She crossed her arms and sighed like a disappointed
mother.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I assume that means Pup didn't take the outfit?

Kara, watching me as I hurriedly headed back, stepped
through the door to meet with Marya.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: It's a shame, I think it suited her, too.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
What a cute dress. It would have indeed went with Pup's

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Is she okay? I never imagined she'd be so against it

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is a bit of a story behind that.

...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Though, I do have an idea...

Our path took us from the vault, leading us out of the

Luckily, signs of our pursuers from the Cartenan
struggle were few and far between.
We had time.

So we moved along a safe path to head south within the
empire, all while we looked for any signs of the
Oathbreaker thief.
There were... thoughts beyond the effort, as well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I can't believe you didn't take the damn outfit.

lines.speaker: Pup

It wasn't long until we were at the base of the

lines.speaker: Pup

Perfect. I'll be back with a basic spare set. Then you

They left and I could hear the footsteps echo off into

Slipping back into the changing room chair in just my

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I wonder what sort of clothes Charlotte and them are

Instead, I distracted myself with an idle thought.

Nothing.

(I... don't have the faintest clue of what clothes

lines.text:
...

An itch of curiosity washed over me.

And it was in that moment that I heard footsteps

lines.speaker: Pup

Standing up, I stepped over to the curtain and poked my

(Hmm... It's somewhat normal but has all these bells

lines.text:

Her hand stuck through the curtain, and I grabbed the

(Hmm... It's so fancy. Like something a noble would

On the edge of moving.

lines.speaker: Pup

The footsteps got farther away, and I did overhear one

It went better than last time. Maybe next time, we

lines.speaker: Pup

It felt like a point of no return.
It wasn't that it didn't make sense that I should.

It wasn't that my own motivations didn't lead to the

lines.speaker: Pup

lines.speaker: Pup

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Under no situation is there an obligation for you to

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Consider it an option, though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Thank you.

lines.speaker: Kara

lines.text: It'll be... fine.

My eyes were half closed, and my other senses were

The cool air across my smooth and exposed thighs was a

The cool air across my exposed thighs was a new

lines.speaker: Pup

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... a different person.)
I felt like I didn't recognize who I saw.
The silhouette alone took me by surprise.

From how my legs came out of the dress to how the
corset created a shape around my waist.

Then there was the cleavage showing, and the small
feminine details like ribbons.
####### If silky hair TF

And even my normal features felt new, like how each
strand of my silky hair fell down to frame my face, and
how that worked with the dress.
##### If not

And even my normal features felt new, like my hair
framing my face with the shape the dress created.
STAGE DIRECTION> ###############

I had looked myself over when I had last changed, but
this... This felt different.
Even in this more modest dress... I was...

I stared, the thoughts passing through my mind much
like how I had thought about Charlotte and the others
trying on new outfits before.
Like it was someone else.
At least until a particular thought settled in my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... me.)
STAGE DIRECTION> REMOVE NARRATION AND DIALOGUE

Our group reached the western border of the 
Kingdom of Cartenan.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Here, Pup. Just hold on and try to get your energy
back.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton... It'll be...

Carried from the battlefield, I had only recently
stopped slipping in and out of consciousness.

My exhaustion from the fight and the effects of the
curse had hit me hard.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I'll admit, even I'm at a bit of a loss.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: For now... regrouping feels like the apt step to take.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
All of our group was scattered in the retreat. Crows
and otherwise.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We'll need to find a safe place to regroup soon if 
we hope to reform.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Is it... safe to stop here?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Hmm...

Sir Norde. How are the effects of that curse for 
you?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Manageable.

Norde adjusted his equipment as though he was 
insecure about what might be beneath.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
At least with your concoction. It assisted at staving
off the worst, if just for a time.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Be careful with attempting to hold it back too 
much.
Kara eyed over to me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It seems resistance can have more... explosive 
changes, if the cards play out that way.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
All the more reason to establish this 'regrouping
point' sooner over later.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Any ideas, Kara? You know the Kingdom better 
than anyone.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A few... potentially viable options come to mind.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Works for me. Let's do one of those.

How about you all in the Crows?
Does it sound agreeable?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It'll be-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...F- fine... We'll be... fine to keep going.

If there's a better place to stop, then... then...

Argh...

I started to fall over as my consciousness slipped 
for a second.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Are you okay?

I had fallen in a pile of snow,
and Rowan went to help me up.

Between the newfound winter and our 
group reaching the edge of the mountain
range, it was all over the place.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Ignore Anton. We can follow your lead. Choose 
what you think is best.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ugh...
Kara led us to a nearby cave.

She told us that it was an old mine used as a 
hidden reserve for military operations.

At least, I thought she did. My mind was still foggy 
as I tried to force myself to keep moving forward.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...
Resting against a wall, my face felt flush and hot.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Mmm...

O- Okay... What... What next...?
My voice echoed.

As did the drip of water from my clothes. 

The snow was melting quickly.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I can organize the regrouping.

It'd give me opportunity to organize some of the
stragglers of the kingdom's forces as well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then I can...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Nope.
I didn't have the wherewithal to argue.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then, I can focus on the Crows and...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
...let me know all about what I'll need to do to get
our supply situation sorted out, yes?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Some of us... more than one... could stand to not 
exert themselves too much at this time.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Fine.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Then let us discuss the plans for my merry little 
jaunt of a 'supply run', shall we?
Rowan and Norde moved away from the group.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I can stay back, then.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I don't... I don't need...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Shush.

Your jacket is soaked. Here, let me help with that.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you, Charlotte.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'll focus on seeing what options we have for bedding.
That cave wall doesn't look the most comfortable.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It sounds as though we've all put ourselves in 
motion.

I'll try to be swift in my own endeavors, then.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I'm trusting my sister to you. Tell her hello when 
her group catches up.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That I can do.

With a nod to Charlotte and everyone, Kara headed 
out of the cave.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Now... where were we?

Strip.

My feverish mind was getting a bit tipsy and loopy 
as Charlotte reached for me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What are you...!?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We need to get you out of those wet clothes.

She said as much, but I got distracted by the drip 
of water from my gambeson to the cave floor.
Soon enough, it was off. That piece was, at least.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, uh...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Clears throat*

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
N- Nothing. Not sure what I was expecting, 
just... uh...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Y- Yeah, don't worry about it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...it's cold...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, that's sort of how it works when the 
greenest nation in the world gets a sudden onset 
winter.
...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...Okay, now I made myself sad.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I... should probably get some kindling to start a fire.

Your clothes aren't going to dry anytime soon
otherwise.

Charlotte grabbed the snow soaked gambeson and 
moved it to the place she planned to set up a fire.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Stay here. I need to find some dry wood.

Charlotte turned the corner of the cave as my mind
tried to process the words she said.

I couldn't quite understand it myself, but I was
distinctly in a daze from the exhaustion and an
oncoming sickness.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Wood... WOOD... wood...)

(What did she mean by...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh, wait...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Didn't she say something about stripping?)

...

Without another thought, my hand reached to the 
buttons on my damp shirt.

...

I kept taking the steps forward.
One step into another.
And another

lines.text: Why... would you do that?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Did someone spot the army in the area already?)
I picked myself up and yawned.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Well...

As I knelt down to start collecting my own sleeping
bag, she told me about how the Oathbreaker was 
gone.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
W- What?!

(After everything we did?! How did... How did that
happen?!)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
That sweet girl Charlotte agreed to help track it 
down as part of your group's efforts.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, of course we can help.
I quickened my rolling of the sleeping bag.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Thank you. I know it would do my husband's heart 
good to know you have his back wholeheartedly.
With a huff, I pulled the stored sleeping bag up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Of course. After all, if we don't, then who will?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: In this case, especially.
Kara approached, with Charlotte not far behind her.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: How did they get it in the night? We were all here...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If there's a trail to follow, we're the only ones with
a shot of finding that lead.

It would be weeks before a Covenant deployment
could be here to start an investigation.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'll carry this over to the horses and-
I stepped forward.
As I did...
...I stumbled a little.

My clothes had gotten tangled with the sleeping 
bag a little, catching on it in a way I didn't expect.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I'll just be on my way.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Oh my, are you alright?

You're absolutely swimming in that outfit...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh, you noticed, too?

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Sweetie, I can offer you something that may fit 
better, if it'd help?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Despite the problem, that is a bit much to ask of 
you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah, these will suit me fine...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: That was not what I said.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ah...

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
It really is no trouble. If anything getting rid of
some of the clothes stored around here would be a 
help to us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I don't-
Charlotte grabbed the sleeping bag...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Pup. Take the offer.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It really has gotten unmanageable. One wrong 
move in a fight and you could open yourself up
to a fatal attack.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just... need to adjust the tailoring again a little.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: A little...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You know what? Want me to bribe you "a little" 
instead?

What about some sweets at the next village?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Like... what sort of sweet...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Kara and I have probably tried things you've never 
even heard of before. Maybe one of those?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I mean....
I shook my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
N- No! Of course I'm not gonna get bought with a 
little chocolate.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that supposed to tempt me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not one of your schoolgirl classmates from when 
you were at the academy.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You may be surprised by how delectable some offerings
are.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm not gonna fall for that either...

No means no.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well, then that just means you're doing it for free.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Charlotte... the only clothes she'd have that'd 
fit me are women's clothes...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I mean...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Actually, did you not say to treat you as a girl?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Why would your wardrobe be an exception?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh yeah, nice catch.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... That's not what I meant by-
All of sudden, I was pulled forward a little.

Charlotte swiftly took the sleeping bag while I was
distracted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No more excuses. Just go make sure you're not 
gonna get yourself killed over it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But I'm not gonna-
And this time, I felt a grip on my gambeson.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Oh, it won't take long, dear. Trust me.

Now a tug, only for the scene in front of me to 
start getting father away.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We'll get everything ready to go.
...with their waves to accompany the farewell.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Fuuuccckkk...)

Entering the Vault's dormitory halls, I could only
sigh.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (They got me roped into this again...)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
...and then Xavier joined Lefen on his quest. I am
proud, though I'd probably be happier if they were 
safe and sound.
Add to that, Euna and Pelus actually have time to 
visit from time to time. I wish they all could.

Marya guided me through the halls, and quickly 
found herself talking about her children.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I guess it must have been a while since she had
someone new to talk to out here.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(But... to immediately start talking about your
kids...?)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Ah, if only you could meet. I'm sure Euna could 
help you pick which clothes would best suit you.

Though maybe the mother's touch has gotten to 
her sense of fashion too~

I really must go out there to see my grandson 
again.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Are all mother's like this?)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Ah, sorry. Maybe I'm getting a bit off topic?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Haha... It's no worry. You seem so excited about it
that it'd be a shame to stop you.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I suppose so! I am just going off on my own 
tangents.

You'll understand once you're a mother.
I stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What did she... say...? Did I mishear her...?)

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: And here it is.

Not far in front of my stopped location, she opened 
a door.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I- I must have misheard her...  *Clears throat* ...
So I stepped through the door.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: Tada!

It was a dress! 

I wasn't surprised.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Euna always looked so cute in it when she wore it. 
And it's warmer than your typical dress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Your... daughter's... dress...?

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
I'm sure she won't mind. It was among the 
wardrobe she left behind when she moved out...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I- I'm not sure I could work with a dress. It is a
battlefield after all.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Are you sure? I saw multiple of your allies wearing
dresses, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Haha... haha... I'm sure... they're just more used to
it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It'd be much safer for me to just get this old thing
tailored again.
I backed away towards the door.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: There are other outfits I can-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Oh, I think it'd be too much of me to ask for your
daughter's hand-me- downs.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- You really don't have to worry about it.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: If... you insist.

As I was one foot out the door, I tried to not look 
her in the eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It... really was nice hearing about your family.

I gave a brief but sincere smile, and hurried my 
way back the way we came.

She crossed her arms and sighed like a 
disappointed mother.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I assume that means Pup didn't take the outfit?

Kara, watching me as I hurriedly headed back, 
stepped through the door to meet with Marya.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text: It's a shame, I think it suited her, too.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
What a cute dress. It would have indeed went with Pup's
hair.

lines.speaker: Marya
lines.text:
Is she okay? I never imagined she'd be so against it
once here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
There is a bit of a story behind that.

...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Though, I do have an idea...

Our path took us from the vault, leading us out of 
the mountains.

Luckily, signs of our pursuers from the Cartenan
struggle were few and far between.
We had time.

So we moved along a safe path to head south 
within the empire, all while we looked for any signs 
of the Oathbreaker thief.
There were... thoughts beyond the effort, as well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I can't believe you didn't take the damn outfit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha... haha...

It wasn't long until we were at the base of the
mountains.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We'll be stopping at this village here.

Norde pointed towards a map. It was a village at 
the base of the mountains, often used for 
resupplying for expeditions into them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A supply town... They'd probably have...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
A tailor?

The sun just rose, so they should be open soon.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yeah...

lines.speaker: Tailor
lines.text:
...and that'll be maybe an hour or so to finish once 
it gets to the top of my queue.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you.

I paid the shopkeep, while keeping an eye out over 
my shoulder for the other tagalongs.

...amongst other Crows that needed repairs from 
the long trek in the mountains.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Tailor
lines.text: Here, follow me.

The shopkeep led me towards the changing 
room, since I needed my current clothes adjusted.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Charlotte and them don't seem... suspicious?)

I watched her and the others happily look through 
the displays.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(They do seem to be having fun... Makes me 
wonder... what would look good on them?)

I tilted my chin upwards and started to let my mind
drift as we walked.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Here you go.

I passed along my clothes through the changing 
room tarp.

lines.speaker: Tailor
lines.text:
Perfect. I'll be back with a basic spare set. Then 
you can return later when the work is done.

They left and I could hear the footsteps echo off 
into the distance, so I exhaled a bit.

Slipping back into the changing room chair in just 
my under layers, I tried not to look into the mirror 
too much.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I wonder what sort of clothes Charlotte and them 
are looking at?)
Instead, I distracted myself with an idle thought.

I tried to imagine some of them in the outfits they 
may be looking at, but...
Nothing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I... don't have the faintest clue of what clothes
those were.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

(To be honest, I'm not even sure what they might 
be looking at.)
An itch of curiosity washed over me.

And it was in that moment that I heard footsteps
outside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(The shopkeep is back with the temporary
clothes? That was fast.)

Standing up, I stepped over to the curtain 
and poked my head out.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Here, hand me-

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hand you what?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Some clothes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: C- Charlotte?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Pup, we had a thought.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So, a little... sponsor's whim here.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: No need to dance around it.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: My dear Pup...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: We have some outfits for you to try~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
To say it simply, you need to try one of these 
outfits.

Breath taken away, I breathed deeply as I looked 
from outfit to person.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Oh, come on. You're waiting on the tailor to adjust
your normal outfit, so you need something to try 
on until she's done.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The shopkeep said they had some spare sets for
situations like this. Basic clothes...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Don't worry. We already told her we'd take care of it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I think the shopkeep assumes we took on
that responsibility now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Why did you push that set of dominoes?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Come on. It's too late to take it back.

She pushed the outfit she held in my 
general direction.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
It's... more fun than you give it credit for.

Just try it the one time before you say no.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
What sort of self proclaimed girl can't try on an
outfit?
I pulled myself back behind the curtain.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Dammit...)

Fine. Just... Just one of them.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Perfect!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: There's a few options here.
She listed off what had been grabbed.

Something formal. 
Something flowy. 
Something with armor.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Well, if I'm gonna try one, then I might as well...)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Formal Outfit / Flowy Outfit / Battle Outfit

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just... give me the formal one.

(That's... probably going to be the most normal? I
think...)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good choice.

Her hand stuck through the curtain, and I 
grabbed the clothes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If you need any help with a part of it, just say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...
I laid it out to get a better look.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Hmm... It's somewhat normal but has all these 
bells and whistles. Like a noble would have.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Or maybe like... a diplomat or something?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just... give me the flowy one.

(If they're gonna insist, better to go big or not at
all... I think.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good choice.

Her hand stuck through the curtain, and I 
grabbed the clothes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If you need any help with a part of it, just say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...
I laid it out to get a better look.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Hmm... It's so fancy. Like something a noble would
wear.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Or maybe like... a dancer or something?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just... give me the armored one.

(If I'm gonna do this, it's best to do something I'm
more used to.)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Good choice.

Her hand stuck through the curtain, and I 
grabbed the clothes.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: If you need any help with a part of it, just say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ...
I laid it out to get a better look.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Hmm... It does seem like its more meant for
mercenaries.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(But it has so many little bells and whistles... Why is
it so... fancy?)
I stared at the outfit.
On the edge of moving.
On the edge... of acting...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh* ... I can't.

I folded the clothes back up again, and 
handed them out.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It's okay.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh well...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Thank you for trying, at least.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: At least you tried. So thanks.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We'll have the shopkeep bring the normal 
temporary outfit now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks...

I dropped to the seat and could only exhale to try 
and relax.

The footsteps got farther away, and I did overhear 
one last thing before it went silent.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It went better than last time. Maybe next time, we
can...
I closed my eyes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I am... a girl. A woman.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Even if I change back later, I can't get away 
from that now. But...)
It felt like a point of no return.
It wasn't that it didn't make sense that I should.

It wasn't that my own motivations didn't lead to 
the same conclusion that the girls gave.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Maybe it was just how... feminine they felt...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I sort of wished I just took Marya's offer if I was
gonna do this. It was a bit of a simpler outfit
in comparison, after all...)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Pup, are you in there?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Kara...?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah. I'm here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I feared a worse disposition.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...after overhearing the ending earlier.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Of course you did. You've got a future as 
a spy.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Did you want to try them on?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No... Maybe? I don't know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just not... now. Not with the outfits they gave 
me.

(If I'm lucky, maybe I won't have a NEED need to 
until this is all settled and we can think about fixing 
the curse properly.)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Here.
A pile of clothes was passed through the curtain.
A stepped up and took them in my hand.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
That pile has the temporary outfit the shopkeep has for
customers.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It also has the outfit that Marya offered before.

I looked at it, and as she said, the dress 
from before was under the other garment.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Under no situation is there an obligation for you to
act on that in any way.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Consider it an option, though.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

Thank you.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I am glad to be of assistance.

With a shifting sound as though she curtsied, she 
then walked away, and the footsteps went out of 
hearing range.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How does...?)

I stepped in front of the mirror, fearful of what I
might see.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It'll be... fine.

My eyes were half closed, and my other senses 
were stronger for it.

The cool air across my smooth and exposed thighs 
was a new feeling.

The cool air across my exposed thighs was a new
feeling.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...It's okay Anton... You're a girl now, even if its
for the time being.

You're a... a... girl...

So I opened my eyes further, and full turned 
towards the mirror.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... a different person.)
I felt like I didn't recognize who I saw.
The silhouette alone took me by surprise.

From how my legs came out of the dress to how 
the corset created a shape around my waist.

Then there was the cleavage showing, and the 
small feminine details like ribbons.

And even my normal features felt new, like how 
each strand of my silky hair fell down to frame my 
face, and how that worked with the dress.

And even my normal features felt new, like my hair
framing my face with the shape the dress created.

I had looked myself over when I had last changed, 
but this... This felt different.
Even in this more modest dress... I was...

I stared, the thoughts passing through my mind 
much like how I had thought about Charlotte and 
the others trying on new outfits before.
Like it was someone else.

At least until a particular thought settled 
in my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (That's... me.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: T- That's... me...?!
The dots had connected.

I switched to the temporary outfit, though my 
heart still raced, and set the dress aside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
I looked at the dress again.
I made sure to fold it carefully.

It wasn't too much longer until my normal clothes 
were tailored to fit better.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hello, Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... Yeah, hey. See you back at camp.
She just smiled, and pressed no further.

I started walking away, but some words quietly 
made their way out.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thanks... again...
Back at camp, I still had the dress in hand.
After a little hesitation, I stored it in my luggage.
Towards the bottom.

We stepped through the bustling morning 
of Crekskia.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So... big changes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: In a sense.

I hiked up my gambeson to over my shoulders 
once more.

But, after a few more steps, the jostling had 
pushed them to slide off again, with the straps on 
my clothes being what kept it on overall.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
First of all, you slept outside for the night, yes?

It may have not been for long, but do you feel 
alright?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'm feeling okay... maybe a little sore?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So why did you head off like that?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Yeah, what happened to cause... you to change more?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Indeed. What brought you out to a graveyard?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Or, better yet, what led you to that chamber in 
the first place?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You did have some strange behavior as you uncovered it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Well...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: One question at a time, yes?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Few of us have had much sleep, Anton included.

I looked over to Norde, who had cut off the topic
before I could be piled underneath the questions.
I smiled softly at the gesture.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Actually, I had a question, too.

What happened to the Imperials we were fighting? 
I missed the last bits of that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yours truly rallied the town and Crows to the 
rescue.

Hand in hand, their leader was placed under our 
very own lock and key.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That fox eared lady merc? We captured her?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Amongst others.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
In fact, she was set to the side to be interrogated 
by our very own Charlotte~

Rowan said in a melodic tone, and tilted his head
towards Charlotte as he did.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I'm... taking a break.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: *Sigh*... it's way too early in the morning for that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Yes, a break.

Before even starting.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I don't exactly see you benefiting from beauty 
sleep yourself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Alas, I was too worried for our fair Pup.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: So was I...!

The two's familiar bickering seemed to trail off in 
the background, and I could only chuckle.

Soon enough, Kara's face popped forward and 
into my view.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
On that topic, we are tasked with completing parts of
the resupply.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Isn't that what we did last night?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Well, the fight with the Imperials chipped away at 
that progress.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Not after that fight with the imperials.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I'm sure Pup is exhausted. One of us can help you 
back to the housing, and the rest can focus on said 
supply run.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No need. I can help.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
You don't want to overexert yourself. It can be
dangerous.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Overexerting oneself is not a good idea.
I twinged a bit at the assertion.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can help...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You don't know how much this change has 
impacted you. Best to take it easy until we move 
out.
I wanted to still help.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (But how to get through to them...?)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: I wanna thank the townsfolk. / We’ll get better deals. /  I’m a mercenary. I can do this.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No, I should come along.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You really mustn't force yourself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then... I promise I won't.

If I feel like I'm pushing myself, I'll take the initiative 
to step away and rest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I can at least help some... even if its not as much 
as others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We don't want to take another person away from 
the effort just to help me, either.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Plus... I wanna talk to the townsfolk.

I wanna thank them. On behalf of the Crows and...
myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I would like to help and come along.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You really mustn't force yourself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then you have my word that I won't.

If I feel like anything I'm doing properly strenuous,
I'll speak up and step aside.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I can at least help some... even if its not as much 
as others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We don't want to take another person away from the
effort just to help me, either.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Plus... I'm not lacking in self awareness enough to 
not realize that my appearance helps.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
People like seeing a cute smile. It'll get us at least
a little better deals.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I wouldn't be much of a mercenary if I didn't come
along.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: You really mustn't force yourself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Be assured that I won't, then.

I can set a good example and continue to be 
bodyguard to Charlotte, at least, if not more.

I'll work to my limits and step aside if it becomes 
too much for me currently.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'd at least help some... even if its not as much as
others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We don't want to take another person away from 
the effort just to help me, either.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Plus... I'm not unaware that without my father, 
people will look to me as one of the Crow's leaders.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's important I set that example of what a good 
Crow is. Strong, but wise.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmmm...!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Fine.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
We're gonna make sure you actually hold to those 
words, though.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: It was very well said, Pup.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I'll be sure to keep you to that, as well. I'll be
vigilant.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No objections from me.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It seems we have an agreement then. Shall we?
