We stepped through the markets of Crekskia, 
talking to townsfolk and having some quick 
conversations.

Some were sweet, and others a bit awkward, but I 
could feel the warmth of the village as we moved 
through its mountainous and snowy streets.

Smiles were had, laughs were shared, and in time 
we entered store after store as we worked 
through the tasks.

More than a few of us split off from the group as 
we got enough supplies to send people back to 
the full group with a load.

As we did, we found ourselves at the final 
destination of this supply run...
The tailor's shop.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I mean, at this amount, it probably warrants a small
discount?

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text: Eh? But you need a rush job.

We needed to get some of our leather armor 
repaired before we headed out, and we wanted to 
leave sooner over later.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Kara said... with that Nora woman captured... we
gained maybe a day or two on the main forces of 
that regiment?)
The shopkeep gave me a knowing look.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Very well. We appreciate you doing the rush job for us.

I set down the payment, and stepped back to take 
a deep breath.

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text: Thank ya.

I was starting to get a bit tired. So, I let myself
relax and take in the moment.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: ...cute...

A few words tickled the ear from the other side of 
the shop.

Charlotte and the others had stepped aside when I 
was talking to the shopkeep.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...indeed...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Where did they go...?)

I headed towards the sounds, and continued to 
hear more of their conversation.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It's made from a nice texture.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Definitely. It probably got imported through 
Lockhart early in the year.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Really, I just like the design.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I saw a lot of fun designs from all over the 
continent when I was at school, so I stopped 
caring as much about the fabric.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Doesn't mean nice fabric doesn't help though.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Haha... You're not wrong.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I do like how the skirt's color transitions between 
the two.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It feels quite... fairytale.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Right, right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The sash works well with it, too.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

I was now in the clothes section, standing to their
side. It would only take a few long steps to join 
them.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
The gloves are nice. Do you think they go with the 
rest of the dress?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I believe they intended the gloves to match the 
shoes. Like a sort of framing.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ah, yeah. I can see that.

They continued on, chattering away about some of 
the dress sets on the rack.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

...they do look... nice.
I whispered.

But it was a mistimed moment. It was a moment 
where one could hear a pin drop.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hm? Did you say something...?
The group of woman turned to me.

All of them were stuck in that pin drop moment, as
though processing what they had heard.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh...

In fact, I hadn't truly processed what had slipped
through my mouth myself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Did I say something weird?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Heh.

Each of them looked back towards one another, 
and smiled.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What are they...?)

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Might you want to... try one?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: "Try one"...?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Try on an outfit.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Wait, why? What brought this on?!

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Wouldn't it look good on you?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed, I think the colors go well with your hair, 
Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- What? How does-? What?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Heheh~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Come here, lil Pup. We've got something great for you~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
H- Hey! We don't have time for... whatever it is 
you have in mind!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: The tailor's repairs aren't a short endeavor.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Heheh~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: W- Wait...!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I do like the asymmetrical design of this one.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It's not bad, but it might be a bit hard for Pup to 
get on.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
This one could be good. Both pretty and with 
space to add protective gear for a mercenary.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: It feels like one you'd choose, sis.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A very Charlotte styled choice.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Perhaps this? It flows and sways with a unique charm?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Weren't you supposed to get Satia?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: She can't arrive soon.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Don't you have a job to do?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I am not the only one.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
But I shall go back to my work and leave you ladies 
to it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Not that I get a say in this...
This went on for longer than I imagined it could.
Yet...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's... sort of fun.)

Hectic energy seemed to follow the adventure as I 
was pulled by one girl to another, each eager to 
show me some grand idea they were formulating.

I barely got a second to think, let alone actually
consider what was happening or what my actual 
thoughts were.

It was in that hecticness that a thought bubbled 
up alongside the others.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You know...

Are any of these gonna fit me?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Sure, we can just ask the tailor to adjust them to 
your measurements.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ..."Measurement"...?

The word was legitimately foreign to me. I had little
to no reason in all my life to think on it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I guess I used to be... a medium?
I looked down at my chest.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe a large now...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Charlotte, Pup would've never gotten 
measurements before.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh... I mean...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Shoot...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Now that I think about it... does the tailor even 
have time? They're working on the Crows' 
equipment.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I'm unsure if we'd have time to ask for the 
adjustments anyways, given the tailor is working on 
equipment.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Whose side are you on?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It cannot be helped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I have taken measurements for family members 
before though.

Would you like to get that before we leave?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I...

I... guess... I should?
Her words sounded like a requirement to me.
A gate pass to do... something we were trying to.

In all honesty, my mind had yet to catch up to my
mouth.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'll ask the tailor for a room to do so in then.

With Kara's soft and warm smile, I felt like I was in
good hands, at least.

She took my own, and we stepped further into the 
store.

None of the rooms were available, so the tailor
directed us to a small tent behind the store.

It was used as a shared place to store overflow
supplies for the local shops.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Take off your clothes.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

She said the words with a nonchalant aura that 
took me off guard. Combined with the direction 
itself, I was speechless.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Don't worry, I won't take long.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Why do I have to...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I couldn't possibly get accurate measurements of 
your bust and waist with that gambeson on.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that what we're doing?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Of course. Now, let's not dawdle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Y- Yes ma'am!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You only need to take off your top, by the way.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(My top...?)

Oh, just my shirt and gambeson.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Good. Arms up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mmm...
Air chilled over my body.

We were up in the mountains and it wasn't as 
though it was the middle of summer.

Between my hardening nipples and the soft 
footsteps behind me, I felt my heart race.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I should try to... calm down.)

(Maybe I can-)

Like a secret operative, Kara was behind me before 
I could even notice her.

A tape measure wrapped around my bare breasts, 
and whatever cold I felt burned away as my 
flushed face radiated heat.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
It was kind of the tailor to let us borrow a 
measuring tape. This won't take long.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Y- Yeah... Not really something you'd... walk 
around with.
I felt the tape tighten a bit around my breasts.
A tingling feel arose in small waves across my body.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Kara is...)

The image of what was happening behind me 
popped into my head, and the stimulating waves 
got stronger.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I... need to calm down...)
My heart was racing.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Here, I just need to...

Her arm reached forward, and she brushed my 
hair outwards and made room for the tape 
measure to get behind me.

Each tickle of arm and hair on my back was 
something that I felt like I could feel twice as 
strong as normally.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...minus one... or maybe...

Is it tight?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A little...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Well, you typically want it a little snug.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's probably... a little past snug.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Then I can...

She backed off some, and it felt like a retreat 
within my mental realm.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Inhale*...

...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Exhale*...
I was still on edge, but I felt more calm.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: There.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Thank the Goddess it's over.)

The tape slid downward, slipping over my 
waist instead.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Next waist, then hips.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Haha...?!
A ticklish feeling came about.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Oh, are you ticklish?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I wasn't...?)

My body disagreed, and Kara appeared to switch to 
a more gentle grip.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'll try to be more careful.

I twitched a little, and I tried to stave off the
laughter.

It was over in a few more seconds, even if it felt
significantly longer in my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Now just the hip....

She moved, and she was getting more efficient 
with it as she took each next step.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Fully done now.
She stepped back.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Mumbling*...

And with that, she was mumbling what sounded
like a few numbers over and over.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'll be right back. I should write these down.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're done...?

I started to let my arms down, and my heart was 
still racing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Is this what it's like... to actually be a girl?)

My whole day had been as far from what I could've
imagined it being just yesterday, or even this 
morning.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A girl... a woman...

I lowered my arms, and almost by instinct my hands
gravitated towards my breasts.

They settled into my grip, and I could feel their 
true weight without distraction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Heavy...)

With a slight squeeze, the sensation of electric
ripples gave me goosebumps.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I don't think it feels as... strong, as when Kara
touched me...)
But it still felt nice.

I massaged them some more. The soft waves of 
pleasure washed along my body.
Each one comforting, hypnotizing, and soft.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (So this is what women feel like... when they...)
I hit a sensitive spot, and I flinched.

After a quick breath, I tried touching it again, 
but it wasn't as strong.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(What, did I catch myself by surprise?)

(Honestly, it really did feel a bit better when Kara
was...)

The thought was idling, but it brought me back to 
the moment.
And...
It felt better.

Imagining that moment again... One of - not even 
Kara specifically - but another person touching me.

Flashes of indiscriminate fantasy flared into 
my mind.

I let my hands fall from me silhouette and to 
my side.

I slouched down, stepping over to one of the 
barrels and sitting against it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This is what its like to actually feel like a
woman...)

(To imagine myself as one...)

(Being... touched... by...)

.........
I didn't know what to think.
Did I like it? Did it feel natural?
Did I hate it? Did it feel alien?

Each of those felt both right and wrong at different
times as I let the thoughts swirl through my head.
This was who I am now.

With no guarantee to ever be anything different 
again.

I buried my head into my knees. My increasingly 
fetal sitting position felt more like a protective 
bubble the more I did.
I was simply... overwhelmed.
Did it feel wrong?

I opened my mouth slightly, and a few words 
whispered out.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...no... it didn't...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I'm sorry that took so long. The tailor was busy so I
needed to talk to-

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: ...Pup?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'm going to head back to the staging site.

I'll keep my word. I've pushed myself too far.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...Okay.

Do you need any help?

She stepped to the side and grabbed my shirt 
to hand to me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you.
I slowly let myself start rising to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And no... I'm... okay.

Probably would be better by myself for a bit.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Understood.

Do be safe.

It didn't take me long to put back on my familiar
getup.
As I left, I just thought on the point of it all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(It's not like... I was considering getting a new
outfit to replace this anyways...)

(I...)

(I don't know.)

Kara followed me to the tailor's exit, and she 
insisted they'd be fine transporting the fixed 
leatherwork back to the staging area.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Was that Pup?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Is everything okay?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
I believe it is alright. But my expertise in such
things is... limited.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Was it as bad as the last time we tried to get them 
to buy a new outfit?

We didn't even suggest something specific this 
time.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Nor did Pup try anything on...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Well... yeah.

Hope Satia doesn't end up too disappointed when 
she gets here.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Well... yeah.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
They seemed... overwhelmed.

In contrast to seeming resistant.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: You think?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That's a good sign, right?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... it does seem positive.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Add to that... I did get measurements.
Kara waved around a small slip of paper.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Nice. Then we'll have those for next time.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Actually, if I may make a request of you, the sponsor
of this group...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If the chess pieces move in the ways I suspect...

There may be a need sooner over later.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: You really think so?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Sad to say, I know some of the major players 
perhaps too well.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Like the queen?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Yes, amongst others.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Alright. I can agree to buy a little something.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What did you have in mind? Maybe we get a few?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Only the one is needed, I would say.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Maybe that first one we were looking at?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Didn't Pup seem to like it?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A good point.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps we can look at the one Pup themself said 
looked good?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I can get behind that.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Oh tailor~

lines.speaker: Tailor
lines.text: Hm?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We have another job for you.

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text: Step aside young lady. We are fulfilling justice here!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Justice? Yeah, I'm not even going to give you the 
time of day.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Really good job you're doing here. You do your 
lineage proud.

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text:
That voice...

Is that the insect from before?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
...

Thanks. You gave me another reason for you to 
die.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Everyone is scattered about...

What can we do...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'll have to trust them. I'll head to the town center 
where we can hopefully meet up.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(And maybe deal with some of these soldiers on 
the way...)

I placed my hand on my sword and turned to the 
girl I had met in this havoc.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Stay as safe as possible. I'll handle these guys as 
best I can.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What? Do you want to get yourself killed?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Believe it or not, I'm a mercenary. One with allies in 
town with me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I just need to regroup with them...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You're still gonna...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: *Sigh*... What to do?

Win Condition: The officer dies
Lose Condition: Pup, Tatiana, Rowan or Charlotte 
die.

Win Condition: The officer dies
Lose Condition: Pup, Otis, Tatiana, Rowan or 
Charlotte  die.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What are you still doing here?! I said get to safety!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: To think they'd go this far? Could I even...?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Argh! Fuck it! I'll kill them myself!
She looked around the area.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
It looks like everyone else has ran away? It should 
be safe to do it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Are you even listening?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I'll clean up my own mess, thank you very much.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Now...

She raised her hand and a bracelet she wore 
around her wrist seemed to glisten in the sun.

After a second silence, there was a whoosh of air 
approaching us and ringing through me ears.

As my head turned to it, the object in question 
flew in and out of my sight only for it to snap to 
the girl's arm.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What in the Goddess's name is that?!

A gauntlet had attached itself to her hand. It was 
double the size of her actual hand, even.

Another whoosh of air came as a metal boot did 
the same to her foot.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Well if you're too dumb to put two and two 
together, then that makes this simpler.

One after another, pieces of armor attached to her 
body.

What stood before me at the end was a hulking 
set of armor that was at least double her size.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The... "Armored Bandit"?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Took you long enough.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Let's keep this our little secret, yeah?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I didn't even catch your name.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Tatiana. Not that'd help those idiots try and catch 
me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So many questions...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I'll save them, though. You up for trying to meet 
up with my allies?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
If I get to boot stomp that fuckwad in charge of 
the soldiers? Gladly.
Tatiana was recruited!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Might I ask... How are you... you know? How are 
you doing that?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
The armor?

I'm not going to pretend I get the theory, but I've 
got a knack for being able to manipulate it.

One day I found an heirloom, and moving shit 
around was the thing that worked for me when I 
tried to use it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So you're... using magic to hold it in place around 
you? And move it around as you need to?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
As best as I understand it? Yeah. Some shit like 
that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's... pretty cool...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I need to ask the others how that could work... 
Maybe I could...)

(No, for now we need to focus on the task at 
hand.)

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Wh- Why are the soldiers acting like this?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Some commander likely got too big for their 
britches.

What to do... They look like they're looking for 
someone or something.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Shouldn't we find the others? What if they're in 
danger?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Very true! Focus on keeping our friends and loved 
ones safe.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: That should be our number 1 priority.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: Just let me know what I need to do.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Concerned bark*

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No, you may not carry the meat.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Disagreeable bark*

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Because you will eat it.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Offended bark*

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Because you've done it before.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
More enemies approach. Do not distract me 
further.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Huff*...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Hmm... This appears to be troublesome.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: We can't go anywhere nice, can we?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Shall we, then?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
The big bad auditor is going to stand up to the 
local army?

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: It is but a trifle.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
May I escort you through the flames of battle, 
princess?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Why not? Be sure to watch out for friendly fire, 
dear auditor.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: This... What are the soldiers doing?

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: Looks like a raid to me.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It was such a pleasant day, too.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: I don't know... This looks pretty fun, too.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Wait, don't run off! We were supposed to be 
purchasing sanitary supplies!

The Nightless Crows had been traveling to a new 
destination among the many in their journey.

Along that path, they came across a medium sized 
village that they could rest and resupply within.

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text:
Fresh lobster! 20% off until noontime!

Get your lobster! So fresh you'd think you're 
swimming seaside yourself!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Why give a discount to super fresh lobster? I think 
I smell a little white lie in that.)
I approached the food stand.

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text:
Welcome, welcome! Lobster for your evening 
dinner?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A little rich for my blood.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You have any trout in stock?

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text: Splendid choice! Let me see...

Away from the market town scene, some rumbling 
from horse hooves and steel boots rattled the 
eardrum.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Are those...?

lines.speaker: Another Villager
lines.text: Maybe we should move.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...

Looking at the trout, I wasn't sure how actually 
fresh it was.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: May I?

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text:
Of course. I wouldn't ask you to not trust your 
own senses.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Thank you.

I picked up one of the fish and stepped back a few 
paces to smell it for how fresh it was away from 
the other fish.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
*Sniff*...

(It doesn't smell like it's going bad... I think?)

(I could probably-)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Grk!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What the-...?!

I turned to see an annoyed soldier looking down 
on me.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Watch where you're going!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: YOU hit me.

I looked over to the ground around me.

The fish I was holding was covered in the 
surrounding's dirt.

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text: My- My product?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Goddess dammit...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You going to pay for that?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Pay for... a fish? Hahaha! You don't know who 
you're talking to, do you?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A minimum wage hired hand?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Hmph. Maybe we should teach you a lesson?

You scuffed my armor. How about you treat us to 
a nice fish dinner?

The other soldiers had gathered around the 
first. They started chuckling along with him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Tsk. I...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Hey ladies~

Gossiping without me?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

I turned to see a girl around my age sitting on the 
food stand I was at before.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
You know... gossip is often better in hushed 
whispers.

Better than spilling your drama across the 
marketplace, at least.

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text: Who are you?!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Shh... The grown-ups are talking now.

With the shopkeep stunned into silence, the girl 
jumped down from the food stand and walked 
over.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Hmph. Did you invite your friend to help cook for 
us daring heroes?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Never met her before.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Yeah, I'll cook. I'll cook your balls to a crisp and 
make some Crimson Sea Oysters.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Wh- What? What did you just say?!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Maybe you should stop trying to perform your 
little play in the steets?

Unless you really think harassing some young girl is 
really going to make you look good.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... I'm... just...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Uh... I'm... not...

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: You little-

The soldier started to take a step forward towards 
the girl.

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text: What is the hold up here?

Another figure stepped forward in more regal gear 
than the normal soldier. He had a round belly that 
stood out to everyone involved.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Your soldiers were harassing this girl for some fish.

Maybe you should try feeding them at some point 
instead of just yourself?

The commander seemed to go quiet as he looked 
at the girl... with a focus on her ears.

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text: Einlyn, aren't you?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What's it to you?

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text:
Soldiers, we don't have time for exterminating 
insects. Bigger and better things are planned today.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You piece of shit...

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Yes, sir!

Without even acknowledging the girl's existence for 
another second, the soldiers regained their 
formation before heading off down the street.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well, that was unexpected.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Here.
Her hand reached down and helped me to my feet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You okay?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Shouldn't I be asking you that?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: But yeah. You get used to it.

I quickly introduced myself and asked for her
name as well.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Oh, I'm no one important.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Anyways, don't you have more important things to 
worry about?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What do you mean?

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text: MY FISH!?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... crap...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I'll just leave you to it.

As the girl started to walk away, everyone was 
distracted by the shouts from afar.

lines.speaker: Wealthy Villager
lines.text: Soldiers! Soldiers!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: More?

lines.speaker: Wealthy Villager
lines.text: I've been robbed!

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text:
And what, pray tell, do you expect us to do about 
it?

lines.speaker: Wealthy Villager
lines.text: I- I... You could catch them?!

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text: Petty crimes are petty.

The scene seemed to have played out as the 
regiment of soldiers started to move on.

lines.speaker: Wealthy Villager
lines.text: It... It might have been the Armored Bandit!
Then the commander stopped.

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text:
...

The Armored Bandit, you say?

lines.speaker: Wealthy Villager
lines.text:
Y- Yes. It was a hulking set of armor that cornered 
me and took my coin purse!

While the group down the street yelled loud 
enough for many to hear, a question mark popped 
into my head.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The "Armored Bandit"?

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text:
Have you never heard?

The Armored Bandit is a vigilante who steals from 
the rich and noble then gives to the poor.

They say he's massive! Multiple heads taller than 
either of you ladies.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Seriously, I'm not...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: They'll never catch him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Why not? It sounds like he just committed a 
robbery. He's probably still here.

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text:
That's the mystery! No one knows who he is.

Despite being as big as a giant, his identity is 
obscured by the armor.

And every tale of him ends with him 
disappearing right after!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Really?

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text: Some say he's a vengeful ghost.

The commander had turned to the burgled 
individual.

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text: How sure of this are you?

lines.speaker: Wealthy Villager
lines.text:
Uh... P- Pretty sure! It matches what the rumors 
say.

He turned a corner and... poof! No giant armor to 
be seen.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I imagine this scene has played out a hundred times 
before, so I'll just-

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text:
Heheh... What fantastic timing...

Soldiers! New orders!

Find this Armored Bandit! I don't care what you 
need to do in order to do so!

Every house! Around every corner! Check every 
piece of existence in this town!

Do not let the fugitive escape! At any cost!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Yes, sir!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: What are they doing?
We saw a soldier approach a nearby house.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Hey! What are you-?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
He just broke in! Are they going to tear apart the 
city?!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: W- Why would they...?

lines.speaker: Shopkeep
lines.text:
I... I'm going to close up shop for the day! You can 
pay for the trout later!

I watched as the shopkeep ran off towards another 
part of the town.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Goddess dammit...

(What do I do? Everyone else is scattered around 
town!)

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text: You... disgusting... insect!

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmph. Got what he deserved.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Ahhh! The- The soldier is dead!?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Tell everyone that the Armored Bandit is to be 
feared!

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Eek!

The villagers around the fight all ran off well away 
from our group.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
*Sigh*... Maybe that'll keep those assholes down 
for a bit.

I'd hate for this sort of thing to happen again...

Tatiana released the magic she was using on the 
armor and it fell to the ground around her.

With another swipe of her hand, the armor came 
together into a bundle like it was magnetized.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: What's this now?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: It's easier to carry like this.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: No... I mean... everything.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is it okay to tell?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I guess. You bunch seem alright. You did help keep 
this asshole from harassing the whole town.
I did my best to explain the situation.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The "Armored Bandit"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Have you heard of her?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It's a boogeyman story they tell in the halls of 
nobility.

And probably an older story than this girl is.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You're not that much older than me

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
I believe the point our fair lady was trying to make 
was less accusatory than that.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
If the tale predates your activity, then it is likely 
people made the connection between the two 
rather than you inspiring it.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Quite a clever bit of luck. To grasp onto reputation 
beyond your own.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Well, I've never heard of it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
It's sort of beside the point.

Knowing the idiot local nobility here, they're 
probably going to get more aggressive.

They may truly tear this town down to nothing just 
to chase the "evil" boogeyman they grew up 
hearing about.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
No way...

I need to get out of here, then. Maybe I can...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We can't just let that happen, either.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Indeed, but what to do?

Perhaps if we intercept any rumors and remove the 
"Armored Bandit"'s involvement?

That would quell the deep seated fears that 
motivate the nobles.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I don't think we could stop that knowledge from 
getting out at this point.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I've got a better idea, anyways.

Tatiana looked onto the group planning up a 
method to help her and the town.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Maybe they really are okay people...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Sorry, what was that?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Nah. Nothing to worry about.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Is that...?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text:
The- The Armored Bandit?!

He's heading out of town!

The crowd just watched as Tatiana gave them a 
small performance.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
This should direct their attention away from the 
town, at least.
Everyone gathered in the plains nearby.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
You should try to keep your head down for a while.

Don't give them a trail to follow by calling attention 
to yourself.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Mayhap you start a career as an actress? Star in a 
play about the Armored Bandit's legend?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
*Sigh*... That might actually work. In a weird 
way...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Actually...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Maybe I could tag along with you guys for a while?

I could stay out of sight while also getting some 
chances to help people.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You wouldn't be the first criminal in our group, I 
suppose...

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: What's one more? We can party harder!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I guess it would be foolish to turn down good 
help...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Perfect!
Tatiana grabbed Charlotte's shoulders.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Keep being not assholes and we'll get along great.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I- Uh... Right...

Swinging away from Charlotte, Tatiana swung her 
arm around my shoulder.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: I get the feeling us ladies will make a great team!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
In regards to that... There's something I need to 
let you know...

title: Paralogue1 Post Story - Tatiana not recluited

lines.speaker: Noble Officer
lines.text: Damn you... bastards!

The girl from before ran up and saw the 
commander as he fell.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Hmph. Got what he deserved.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.text: Ahhh! The- The soldier is dead!?

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I saw the Armored Bandit landed the killing blow! 
Tell everyone to flee!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What?

The girl began to flee herself, but turned to give 
me a wink and smile in her departure.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The Armored Bandit?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
That's a boogeyman tale that is passed around as a 
rumor in noble hallways.

Why would she...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I saw her before and was hearing about this myth. 
The soldiers were looking for that Armored Bandit,
even.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe she wanted to shift the blame away from
us?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
On us would be better, though? The nobles might 
attack this place again if they think their 
boogeyman is here.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Maybe she didn't realize?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
She was pretty confident in them not finding the 
Armored Bandit, though.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Intriguing. You don't think...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: N- No way...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Could that even be possible? For someone with her 
size and frame?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: They do say the Armored Bandit is a giant...

All of us stood there, silent, for what was likely a 
minute but felt like much longer.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I wonder if we'll ever meet that girl again?)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Yes, I'd imagine this would make for a good place 
to hunt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It's... been a while.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I'm sure you'll find the instincts coming back.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
For hunting, the first time can be the... biggest
learning curve, in a sense.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Ugh... Can we not talk about it? I'm already feeling 
a bit... Ugh...

Let's just start.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Argh...!

B- Back away!

lines.speaker: Beast
lines.text: Rrargh!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I had enough to deal with already with the imperial
soldiers...!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: You're not getting away this time!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hmph. Regardless, I am prepared for you after 
what happened before!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Behold my heirloom's might. I may specialize in red
magic, but I can also access green magic!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Summonings, go!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: N- Now! Protect me!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, a damsel in distress~

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Hmm... He looks familiar.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Is that Professor Castel Balreig?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Wait... That's the Professor from the Kingdom's
capital? The one who was trying to help me control 
the curse?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I... believe so. We may need to get closer to confirm.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I guess we should help, then?

Defeat Condition: Pup, Rowan, Charlotte, Kara, or 
Castel dies.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: S- Stay back...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I- I need to do something more.

Can I do another summoning? I only prepared for...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hmph...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: S- Summoning...!

lines.speaker: Castel?
lines.text:
H- Huh...?!

W- What just...!?

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Alright, we're here.

lines.speaker: Unknown_4294967295
lines.text: Alright, we're here.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Professor Balreig, we've arrived to help-!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: N- No!

Kara ran over to the body of Castel lying limp on 
the ground.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah! Were we too late to save the damsel in distress?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
I'm sorry, but... there's no signs of life. No
breathing... no... anything...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: He doesn't look... like he's... breathing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of... Of course...

(Time after time, we just keep...)

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah... Lady Lyons?

Kara turned towards the figure, with fiery fingertips
ready to strike.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
N- N- N- No! It's me!

I'm here. I'm Professor Balreig!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Why is a shade talking?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Shades... aren't those... like magical rats?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Correct.

They can mimic the silhouette of anything and are 
beast enough to have their actions controlled.

Summoners will commonly use them as a base for 
their pawns, as a result.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I- I- I tried to summon another shade, and... next
thing I knew...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: You somehow transferred your soul to the new body.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Yes, indeed! I did-

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I did... that...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... I'm not sure I get it.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Yeah, me neither. That's not exactly something I 
can imagine when compared to my engineering 
experience.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is quite simple, my dear friends...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
It merely means we have a damsel even more 
enchanting than before~
Rowan approached Castel in his new form.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: We shall assist you however we can.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
S- Stay back!

What are... Who even are you all!? Are you the 
ones who invaded the Kingdom?!

The ethereal like form of Castel dropped into a 
mage's battle stance.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
I wasn't so dumb as to not retrieve my heirloom, 
at least! I can and will fight!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
...

Professor Balreig...

Castel...

We can fix this.

Castel's panicked panting subsided as he scanned 
Kara and the group.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Hah... Then... my apologies. I let myself get ahead 
of myself.

With Lady Lyons with you, I know I can trust you 
enough to stick with you, at least.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Lady Lyons and others. If I may accompany you? At 
least until I can fix my body.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What's one more mouth to feed?
Castel joins the party!

lines.speaker: Lumberjack
lines.text:
If you see 3 lone beasts wandering the woods, do 
not approach them. 

They are savaged beasts that have survived the 
harshest environments. 

If you leave them alone long enough, they will 
scatter. 

If you are foolish enough to approach them, take 
my bow. Bring me some of their meat if you are 
succesful.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It has been some time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Oh... were you talking to me? Some time since what?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Some time since we hunted together.

Opportunities became less and less as Ivan had the
group work within the Republic, after all.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Right.

I ended my thought there. I didn't want to think 
about it further.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Well, I will choose to remember him, then.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
What lovely hair you have cascading down your 
back~

It is like glass in its beauty.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ugh...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah! My dear, is something wrong?!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Despite my... predicament, I am still a man.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And where, pray tell, is the problem? Such is the 
spice of life.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I am not interested!

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Alas, that was all you needed to say, as 
disheartened as I may be.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: So, pretty little noble lady has hunted before?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As a necessity, but yes.

And, after all, some nobles do need to hunt. Minor
ones, especially.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Well?

It get ya off-kiltered to be hurtin' them animals like
the other nobles who never had to?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Oh, I am quite neutral on the subject.

I've neither the stature of a huntswoman nor the
resolve to fight for the Goddess's creatures.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Eh. The "Goddess's creatures"? Quite 
complimentary of you to the latter in ya phrasin'.

Ya sure you're okay with killin' the critters yourself?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
People will do what they must.

But if we allow ourselves to forget the ideals, then 
we lose sight of a better tomorrow.

Such is the balance of life.

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: We're talkin' about huntin', right?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Giggle* ... That we are.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Eh! Get back here, ya beast!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: You need to be quieter on your approach.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
You make an unnatural ruckus in that armor. I- I'm 
just saying that it scares the animals away.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
Gotcha. Stealth mode it is.

Thanks.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: Now I'll hunt ya down, you annoying little...!
Tatiana clamored off... more quietly.

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Wow... So that's what it's like to teach someone 
for once.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: On your left.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: You seem quite experienced in tracking prey.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Yes... In such a remote location, supply drops often
are delayed.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
And even before the Vault, life does not always go 
the way you want.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: What of you? You also seem familiar.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: I've had a similar plight at times.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Though that was small fry in comparison to these
beasts.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
But it did help develop a skill I could use later with
the Crows.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Haha... One man's crisis is another's life lesson at
times, it seems.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
*Sniff sniff* ...?

*Directional bark* !

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
You found one?!

Hrrraaaaaggghhh!!!
Reagyn's lance proved true to find its target.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: Good job, boy!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
I thought you were more of a rescue dog type 
breed, unlike our hunting dogs from back home.

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
But I guess that just means you're quite skilled at
finding things.

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Happy bark* !
Our journey had taken us to many lands.

But through those trials and tribulations, a certain
truth became self evident.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: *Stomach growling*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I actually heard that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Stomach growling*...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: And another?!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I wonder if we could get them in sequence? Like a
chorus?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I think it just means we've reached lunchtime.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: That does sound nice right now.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: A splendid proposition.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Mmm...

As with our many lengthy treks, we had prepared 
rations to expedite the meal process for such a big 
group.

Taking shifts to ensure we couldn't be ambushed, 
we started during our break in our march.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Ah, that does hit the spot at times like these~

As Rowan chowed down, I looked on from a seat 
off to the side of the wider group.
It was a basic bread roll.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmm...
I took a bite.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...
The blandness of it got to me.

After an extensive last few days, I felt emotionally
exhausted.

This blandness was the lack of frosting on the
metaphorical cake.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(I feel like we've had only bread for the past several
days, too.)

Apparently, my sigh was enough to attract 
attention.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Are you okay?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Fan of the food?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Perhaps it is due to the bread.

We've run out of some of our designated ration 
stock.

Kara seemed to be choosing her words very 
carefully. Each one a little more deliberate than I 
was used to.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I think she's trying to be nice...)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(But regardless of that, if we're out of meat and
stuff...)

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I guess it has been sometime since we could resupply in
a town.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Indeed. It was unfortunate that the last village's
disrupted supply lines left its stocks so depleted.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Where is the closest town?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde might know, but we don't operate a ton in 
this area.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: We should have enough to get by on our current path.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Just trying to live on the pile of bread we have
left...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Urgh...

I turned away from the two with my instinctual and
tired grunt.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: There is one option.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
I knew a little poking and prodding could get a
solution out of you~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What do we have to do?
Standing to my feet, I was at full attention.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
In times of revolution, armies would often need to
resupply outside of traditional supply lines.

By hunting. And by foraging.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I can do that!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The crows are rarely all that far from a proper 
outpost, but we have had some times of 
scarcity where we needed to hunt.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
Uh... Where would we do that? Is there a health 
risk on the food?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: I have enough experience to ensure safety.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
As for where, we'll likely need to find a place for a
small detour...

I imagine there is a half decent spot along our
current path.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Pant*... Is that... all of them?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Clear in this section.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: FLANK.

Uncharacteristically, Norde yelled across the
battlefield to get the all clear.

lines.speaker: Crow
lines.text: Clear over here!
The voice was difficult to hear, but audible.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Who are... Who are you all?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Professor Balreig.
Kara inserted herself into Castel's vision.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah, Lady Lyons.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
It is a pleasure to-

...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: ...my glasses.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Glasses? Those would still be with the...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: The uh... yeah...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Do you still need them, though?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I guess... not.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I feel naked without them, though.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
But... I will simply have to adjust.

For now my focus should be on getting my body 
back.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Uh...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: ...What?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Professor, this is something we will need to account
for immediately in our efforts.
Kara gave a meaningful look.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Blasted, did my body last so little time without a
soul?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
From what I heard of such an event before, your 
body loses the instinct to do vital processes when 
the soul is removed.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: "Heard before"?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Only rumors. But, between that and your 
misfortune here, it does make one thing clear.

It is controllable.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If you master the technique you used and your 
summoning abilities, then you can reconstruct your 
body.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah, very true. Very true indeed.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Maybe I can craft an even better body...

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I guess you weren't all that attached to it, then.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
And who would be with such an upgrade as we see before
us?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Hm? What you do you mean?

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: It is simple, my dear.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
Beautiful hair with the aura of stained glass...

A wisp of shadow forming a gown like those of an 
opera diva...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: All framing a form that is a delight to the eyes.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: For an accident, you chose a body of exquisite taste.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I think you broke him.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
If... a female form makes you uncomfortable, you 
may be able to take solace in it being reversible.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
You'd still need to make that scientific 
breakthrough, but if anyone was equipped to...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I- I... How are you all taking this in stride?!

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Ah, that element.
Eyes shifted to me.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
To say it's become a familiar revelation... wouldn't 
be wrong.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Yes, it seems the Goddess smiles upon us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I really don't need this right now.)

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah, you! That girl!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hey, can-
Castel hustled up to my face.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: The one cursed by the Oathbreaker to become a woman.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You know it really isn't that simple and-

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Yes.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
Yes, this is serendipitous.

I had my regrets over not fixing you before, and 
now fate has given me all the motivation I need to 
solve these mysteries~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I really wouldn't call it the same thing.

Aren't... Aren't you like... a rat, technically?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
A shade is a magically imbued rodent type creature,
yes.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
They've developed the ability to imprint a 
silhouette of any creature at a young age.

They can take that form as a defense mechanism 
against predators.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: An... example of this silhouette being...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So yeah, you're a rat.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: A 'rodent' would be more technically correct.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: I'm sure you're a cute rat, too.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: No, a...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Exhale*
Castel took a few steps back from Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hmph...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Very well.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Then it is but one more challenge to overcome.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Goddess, I take on your trials with vigor!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Come now, all! We have work to do!
Castel started marching off in a direction.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Is that even the way we need to go?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
What we NEED to do is collect the hunted meat 
and store it.

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
Yes, it seems our dining tent will be greeted with 
two new upheavals soon.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Both graciously welcomed~

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That... does sound pretty good right about now.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: *Pant*...  *Pant*...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I- Is that all of them?
A rustling sound could be heard from nearby.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Oh damsel~?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Ah!
Castel scattered off into the distance.

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: I- I can... then I can...

He did so while formulating plans on how to deal 
with his new situation.
All without...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Hmm...?
The group entered the area.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text:
No sign of the professor?

Might've we just been mistaken?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: It isn't impossible.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: We've completed the resupply hunt, at least.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text: Which is almost as good as saving a damsel in distress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That... does sound pretty good right now.

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Who the fuck are you lot?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Why are YOU attacking a village of teenagers and
children?

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Tsk. Not gonna take shit from a fucking lizard!

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Ya just gonna-!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
R- Run...!

The commander is down! The commander is down!

RUN!!!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... Is that enough...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (They're not exactly all that coordinated, but...)

What was left of the raiding soldiers started to
scatter.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good... Everyone got out safely.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Run! Your type of trash is no longer welcome here!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Damn... playing guardian for the brats?! They made 
a deal with a lizard beast!

A few raiders threw some less than kind words our 
way as they ran, and took some lazy swings our 
way as they passed.

I raised my own sword to deflect a swing and 
scuttled towards a more defensible position.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...!

(Good, keep running.)

My eyes drifted towards Norde, who seemed like 
he was starting to relax a little.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank the goddess...

But as I saw that, another sight came into the 
corner of my vision.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: Here, get to...
...and to his side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Ya stupid...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: SONTH!!!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What...?!
It was as though in an instant.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh...!?

A hand gripped around the raider's neck 
like a noose.
A scene aligned above a crimson pool.
One that, without mistake, signaled an end.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: I- I- Ugh...!
He couldn't get a word out.

There was a crackling feeling that I could 
practically feel the edges of myself.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: M- Mister Norde. What are you...

Seeing the crimson from afar, one of the nearby 
orphans was the first to gather at a distance away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde, you need to-
I began to run towards them.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: Wait. Sonth... Is Sonth...?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: B- B- Bast...ard... kid...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No, Norde, not in front of the kids...!)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Die.
The tightening grip was audible.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ugh...!

(This feeling?!)

(It's like... like...)
The curse.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (This is the same curse as I have?! I can feel it!)

A sensation from within my own chest emanated 
outwards, matching the feelings I had whenever
the curse was at its strongest.
It was a feeling of reverberation.

As though the curse leaked so strongly from 
Norde's own aura that it created a resonance 
within my own soul.

As though whatever self control and willpower that 
had held it back so far broke like a dam.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: G- Good... Riddance... ya fuckin'... l- lizard...!
Norde stepped forward.
And dropped his weight.
Down.

Fragments of the world's crust burst upwards, 
flanked by droplets of crimson carried by the 
same momentum.
No scream followed. There was no air to do so.

He stayed there, being grinded into the cracks of 
the crater... 

...by the person above who had not 
relinquished his grip.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...You worthless... piece... of...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Norde is... more beast like...?!)
As I reached Norde's side...

The raider's arms fell. Any resistance gone from 
what was left.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...worthless... piece of...!
Norde raised his arm to strike again.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: *Sniff*... No...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Stop! He's already dead!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: RRAAAAAAAAAAAGGGGGHHH!!!
I caught his arm, stopping him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde... He's already dead.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...a... worthless... piece of...

As I held his caught arm, I could feel his fist
tighten.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And you got him. Please try to-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I am... a worthless... pieces of garbage...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Norde...?

(The curse... That feeling, again...?)

The resonance made it feel like the curse itself was
leaking out, like steam into air.

A steam rose from him, and the heat was
accompanied by a shift in the change.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I'm a failure. I always have been.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ivan... He'd had been better off leaving me to rot.

I've only proven to be... a disgrace to his legacy...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (His face... and hair...?!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This change, it is entirely different than before.
It's more like...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I'm... no better than his own child. Just a stain... 
on what impact he tried to leave on the world...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This is... him thinking we're the same. The same 
as he sees me. He's mirroring my changes.)
I let go of his arm, and he didn't strike the corpse.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A disgrace...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...or a beast.

The changes were basic, but enough to see Norde 
being pulled in two different directions.

Each like reversberating in pure magical energy
and creating a smoke signal of the steam.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What is... even the point, anymore...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I've never seen him like this.)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What is even...!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...the point!

His fist landed into the ground, cracking it at its
seams.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: ...Mister Norde...?
The other children had largely gathered now.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Leave me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Whether beast or disgrace... I have... nothing left 
to offer.
Norde stood up, wobbly as he did.
And started walking away.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: That's not true!
He stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're right.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde... You are not worthless.

I've spent most of my life watching my father's 
back as he blazed forward like a comet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
All... I've ever wanted to do was to catch up, and 
do the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But... he's not the only one that I watched. You
trailed starlight too, even if it was in his wake.

I stood and turned to Norde, 
with his back facing me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You've been my role model, too! My brother!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Just... get the kids to-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Grrhhh...!

With his body changing rapidly, he landed on the 
ground with a thud.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's not giving him a break!)
Running up to him, I tried to find the words.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Norde... what do I even say?!)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: We're not the same!  / You're better than these bandits!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde, we'll never be the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I know... I know I haven't lived up to my father...

That I played a part... in why he died...

I stopped, and I took a deep breath 
before continuing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But you are not me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde, you're the one that I've looked towards if I
ever wondered what might my father do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're the closest thing I've ever knew to what my
father was to both of us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...I don't...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Urgh...?!

I could still feel the aura of the curse, and it
weakened.
But it did not disappear.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
How could... just some animal... live up to... a
hero...?

Norde gritted his teeth as the curse's pull from
his worries over legacy became meek in
comparison.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Grrr...!

His scales grew, crawling up his face and across the
rest of his body.

His hands dug into the dirt. Each tightening of the
grip was accompanied by a more claw like hand.

I could see him grit his teeth, growling, as his
canines became more fang like. 

His eyes transforming more lizard like as 
they visually appeared with a slit type 
structure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Norde!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: GRRR....!

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
No! You're not a beast! No beast would be sent by 
the goddess!

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
You've always been like... a star...! One sent from 
the sky by the goddess.

When you saved us before... Then again... and 
again... and even now...

How could such a savior be a beast?!
The children gathered around Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You... You shouldn't rely on...

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
The one who saved us?

The one who always shows up when things are
at their worst?

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: Mister Norde. You are our hero.

Norde's breathing... calmed...

I don't know how long we waited,
but he slowly normalized.

The effects of the curse had not faded physically, 
but it was clear a cloud over his mind was fading.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You... all deserve better.

But...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you. All of you.

Norde's gaze landed on me as well, 
smile not wavering.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Perhaps... family can be a blessing... siblings,
included.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I just... need... a second...
Norde laid his head back. Falling asleep.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde, do you think you're no better than those
bandits?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You act as if it was just them.
His form continued to fluctuate.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: They've never stopped telling me. Just... a beast.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And what does that make them?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If you're just a beast, what does that make those
scum?!

How low would they need to fall to make you a 
beast in comparison?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde... You are not a beast.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I know my father saw you as more than just the average
person, too.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...I don't...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Urgh...?!

I could still feel the aura of the curse, and it
weakened.

But it did not disappear.

Steam continued to rise.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It doesn't matter. It never mattered if they were
right.

Beast... person... I've... only wasted the time 
that the goddess gave me.

Norde started breathing faster. 

The worries over any animalistic nature within 
him became meek in comparison to another.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I failed Ivan. I failed him. How can I ever call myself
anything but a disgrace...?
Norde's hair grew, in a sight I felt all too familiar.

Hands digging into the dirt... Each tightening of the
grip was accompanied by a slimmer set of fingers.

The armor started to sag. It no longer fit well, as
though in an instant... And I could guess easily 
what else started to change below.

Norde's breaths became deeper, and each inhale 
and exhale seemed to refine their face into one I 
had seen before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde... I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
This is... my stain. My disgrace.

I am sorry for ever pushing that shame on you.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
No! You're not a disgrace! You are an idol! No one
would ever be ashamed of you!

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
You've always been like... a star...! One sent from 
the sky by the goddess.

When you saved us before... Then again... and 
again... and even now...

How could such a savior ever disgrace their idol?!
The children gathered around Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You... You shouldn't rely on...

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
The one who saved us?

The one who always shows up when things
are at their worst?

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: You are our hero.

Norde's breathing... calmed...

I don't know how long we sat there waiting,
but it... was normalized.

The the effects of the curse were dramatic and did 
not fade physically. But a sense of mental clarity 
could be felt.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You... all deserve better.

But...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you. All of you.

Norde's gaze landed on me as well, 
smile not wavering.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Perhaps... family can be a blessing... siblings,
included.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I just... need... a second...
Norde laid their head back. Falling asleep.
Once upon a time.

A rumor was born of a safe haven. A refuge from 
war and strife.

It was a tale of a promised land that spread 
through the whispering voices of war orphans.
"A society for us, by us." ...so the orphans said.
It was not real.

So the orphans decided to make the 
rumor a reality.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Heh.

But with that sliver of truth for refuge came 
attention and violence.
Tragedy was fated.
Expected.
Unless...

Unless those with the power to intervene 
chose to act.
Unless those unrelated...
...those uninvolved...
...those with nothing to gain...
...chose to make a better world.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: *Sniff* ...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We'll have to find a new home for these kids.

So... what about after that?
We stood among many.
Many of the displaced orphans that were saved.
And those that were not.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If people reacted poorly to you not being a homlyn
before, this will only make that worse.
Norde's eyes scanned over the makeshift graves.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The Crows aren't going to care much, but...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Those who assumed it before will be the same to 
see me as such now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But what if it gets worse? This is the curse, after
all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then I'll cross that bridge when it comes to it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're... sort of in the same boat now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'd offer to teach you a thing or two about it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But I suspect you'd be teaching me before I knew 
it, haha...

Norde's eyes stayed trained on the 
makeshift graves.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I... don't think I'm helping.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I guess the curse has a one track mind at times.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Heh... I guess it does, in a sense.

A palpable irony to it, even...

Looking over at Norde, the glint of laughter was 
only for that moment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess this result is only natural for me at this
point.

My own failures dragging you down. Worrying that 
you'll end up like me...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe all this misfortune could've been avoided in its
entirety.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
My failures are my own to carry.

You did nothing wrong.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde, if I'm the source of one of the anchors that
weighed you down here, then...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then it is still not your fault.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I would not blame the tree for a rotten apple that I
chose to eat.

You did nothing wrong. It is my fault for letting it
impact me as such.
The words settled on my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (My fuck ups just keep spreading, don't they...?)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton... No, I mean...  *Sigh* ...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I was wrong. You didn't kill Ivan.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I just...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde...?
Norde was taking deep breaths again.
This topic gave me a similar feeling of uneasiness.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
A hero is someone that saves a soul.

One who holds great power, and wields it for those 
most vulnerable.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
For them not to act... would they even be qualified 
to be called "good" anymore?

Could a man be a "good person" if they refuse to 
act despite having the power to make a difference?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
To be called an admirable person, let alone a hero...
it would be a stain on the goddess's oath...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A thoroughly stained world, in that case...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Though we both know that.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
As we also both know what its like to meet the
opposite. A true hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(After all the stories I heard of legends... to grow 
up seeing my father in action...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ivan was my hero. He saved my soul.

I owe him a greater debt than I could ever pay.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: And at the same time, I am amongst his legacy...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We two are those left behind.

To be a good person. An admirable person. A hero, 
if we dared...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
That... That is what I struggle with.

The question of whether I even can.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Whether either of us... as Ivan's legacy, can live up
to even the foundation he left behind.
Norde breathed in.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: As to not waste the chance he gave us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (My father's legacy...)
I raised my hand and gripped it into a fist.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe that's also at the core of what I struggle 
over, too. At least in part.)

(That question... can I? Can Norde? Can anyone?)

...
I felt experience tell me an answer.

Knowing how much it could take for people to just 
get along and do their best for one another...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Peace is a struggle. A never ending one. After all,
ideals are far from homogenized...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who knows? Maybe it's for the best.

I raised my hand to my chin, a thought spurring 
into my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Whether we actually can live up to the power and 
will of his legacy... let alone if we actually do...

It's a mystery. But one that keeps pushing us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe we'll get there without even knowing. And 
maybe its best we don't realize if we do.
My instincts told me an answer.

A glint of my insight on others, and knowledge of 
how human nature can sway society...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who knows?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
All we can know are the smiles on the faces of 
those we help.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What other feedback can you get that you're on the
right track, after all?

I chuckled a little, rubbing my neck as 
though a little embarassed to say it aloud.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just keep trying to be the sort of person that can 
make another smile...

Through heroics, laughter, or... anything else...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Who knows if we'll reach it? To have the ability and
will to be worthy of it.

But so long as we never stop trying, then we have 
a chance.
My gut told me an answer.

Through all our battles, I had an instinct for what
it'd take to get the future one may strive for...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't think we'll ever know if we can reach that.

To have power and will enough to be worthy of it.

I lowered my hand to rest on my 
sheathed sword's hilt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You just gotta keep trying. Step forward, blade at 
the ready to help when needed.

Even if we never reach it... Then at least we tried.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I suppose so.

Perhaps you have gained more wisdom then I give 
you credit for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Thank you, Norde.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're not half-bad yourself.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Heh...

We stood there for a while, and watched over the
orphans as they each felt it was time to head out.
 
Each thanked us, especially Norde, for everything.
All until it was only us two left.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...You know...

I remember a story my father once told me.

About how you got the name "Norde" because you 
misheard him saying to go "north".

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: And?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just... a thought came to mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That first child we met when we came here.

"Sonth".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who gave him his name?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...himself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He was a good kid.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Indeed. 

I couldn't be more proud of him. 

Of all of them.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: The following will come from our PALM.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (What...? Did he say something odd there?)

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: M- More of them?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It seems they're so unorganized that they're
