basically coming in waves.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Of course.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Keep an eye out for signs of another group arriving.

I doubt they are trying very hard to hide that
activity.

Win Condition: 
- Survive all waves

Lose Condition: 
- Pup, Norde, Charlotte, Rowan, Kara dies. 
- Any Orphan dies

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: From the THICKET there will be 3.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Then the SUN will SET on the village.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: The beach that will ensure the EASTERN flood.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: The cavalry will be HILL-ed.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: All for me to arrive, at a FLOWER bed of enemies!
## Pup x Norde ##

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde! Calm down and focus.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I. Am. Calm.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Focus on protecting the vulnerable.

To do so...

Norde went into a detailed list of the various orphans
and their quirks helpful in protecting them.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Understood?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Y- Yeah...

(Angry as he is... he's still focused on the
objective.)
## Satia x Norde ##

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Norde, is this...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Yes.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Then I will try my utmost.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you.
## Satia x Pup ##

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So... do you know much about this? Norde seems to have
a history here.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Yes, though I don't know if it's my place to say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What could have happened to make you say that?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Nothing. Only that it is personal to him. It is not
part of my world.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Then we've orphans to save. Let's make sure we do that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...
## Norde x Jakson ##

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Curious whine
...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I do not have time to-

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
Adamant bark
...!

...
Jakson looked to Norde with resolve.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I understand.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you, boy. We'll get everyone to safety.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Norde, is this...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Yes.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Then I will try my utmost.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
So... do you know much about this? Norde seems 
to have a history here.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: Yes, though I don't know if it's my place to say.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What could have happened to make you say that?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Nothing. Only that it is personal to him. It is not
part of my world.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Then...?

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Then we've orphans to save. Let's make sure we 
do that.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Curious whine* ...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I do not have time to-

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text:
*Adamant bark* ...!

...
Jakson looked to Norde with resolve.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I understand.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you, boy. We'll get everyone to safety.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde! Calm down and focus.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I. Am. Calm.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: R- Right...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Focus on protecting the vulnerable.

To do so...

Norde went into a detailed list of the various 
orphans and their quirks helpful in protecting them.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Understood?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Y- Yeah...

(Angry as he is... he's still focused on the 
objective.)

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Ugh...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*...  *pant*...

The soldier fell to the ground, having met a fate 
most deserving.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So...  *pant*... this is the place?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yes. Yes, this is the place.

He stepped forward, staring forward as he moved 
towards the nearby village.
Or, more accurately...
What remained of it.

We hadn't stopped traveling for the better part of 
two days. We were working off just a few hours 
of sleep.

Norde had received a letter from, as he said, 'a 
group of children he once saved from a life 
threatening situation'.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This doesn't look like a village that's been saved.
Not anymore.)
Another enemy down.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
*Inhales slowly*... 

*Exhale*...

We had arrived on the scene, a small and normally
isolated village, only to find a raid in progress.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Have they been dealing with this all along?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No. The letter did not mention it.

It only mentioned a singular recent confrontation 
with a bandit group, and nothing in regards to 
imperial soldiers.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: So it's escalated since then.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Move. Faster.

Norde and I entered the village proper, 
with the other Crows that had tagged along 
not far behind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: This...?! This is...?!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How did... bandits did this?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: How long have they been at this...?!

The village was more rough in certain parts, but at 
its worse, we saw several buildings had been 
stripped for parts.

Norde scanned the village. Eyes dotting from hiding
place to hiding place.
There.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Sonth?
Norde dashed over to a partially collapsed wall.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: Mister... N- Norde...?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Sonth, it's going to be okay.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: You're... You're actually here...!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Just... take a deep breath.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: M- Mister... *sniff*...Norde...
Norde leaned in and...
...hugged the child.
Gently, like a big brother or father might.
In a way... I had never seen before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde...?

(This is... a new side to him. Even with kids in
general.)

(Why is he like that with this kid specifically? Being
protective of a kid he saved before?)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I'm here now. I'll do whatever is necessary to resolve
this.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: T- Thank you...

The two stood back on their own, and Norde 
looked back to me before turning back to 
the child.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Please. Catch me up on the situation.

Sonth was able to compose himself, telling of the 
days since they sent Norde that letter.

Initially, they had come into contact with a few 
men from the Imperial Army moving through the 
area.

It was cordial, but a small incident with a local
shopkeep put each side on edge. That was when 
the letter was sent.

Ever since, the soldiers had started instigating 
more and more violent encounters.

And at a point, like the snapping of a twig 
underfoot, they stopped even pretending 
to keep it civil.

They became bandits, raiding the town for fun and
supplies at every opportunity.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
My best guess would be that the unit deserted 
from the imperial military.

Perhaps its leadership was even thrown out and 
replaced by a more unhinged core.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: You... You really think that's why?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
The soldiers we've come across have acted a lot 
more like bandits, at least. We've fought plenty of 
those before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
And I can't help but remember a story that this reminds
me of. One that another Crow told me about once.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: Who are you...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Me...? I'm Pup.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I am part of the Nightless Crows mercenary 
company, just like Norde here.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: Does that mean... you're a hero, too?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Hero?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
N- Nothing quite like that. I'm just half decent with 
a sword, really.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (..."Too"? Does that mean he sees Norde as a hero?)

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: If Mister Norde trusts you, then so do I.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You can count on me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Whether they're rogue imperial soldiers is probably
beside the point. At least currently.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Sonth, do you know where the others are? We need to get
you all the safety.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: But we don't have anywhere to go...

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text:
If anyone could get to safety...

I at least remember what direction the others
moved in when they attacked this time.

I... think they prefer to terrorize us than kill us, 
so hopefully they're all alright.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just means we'll need to hurry before some stupid
soldier takes it too far.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: Y- Yeah.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Sonth, start laying out where everyone might be.

And for you and the others, retreat to-

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I've got your back.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Can't leave a bunch of vulnerable kids out there at 
the mercy of these garbage people, after all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: It's my obligation to...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
No, of course.

Thank you. Pup.

I doubt they are trying very hard to hide that

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Who the fuck are you lot?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Why are YOU attacking a village of teenagers and
children?

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Tsk. Not gonna take shit from a fucking lizard!
STAGE DIRECTION> SWORD CLASH SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Ya just gonna-!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
R- Run...!

The commander is down! The commander is down!

RUN!!!
STAGE DIRECTION> RUNNING AWAY SE
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 60 FRAMES

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Pant
... Is that enough...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (They're not exactly all that coordinated, but...)

What was left of the raiding soldiers started to
scatter.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good... Everyone got out safely.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Run! Your type of trash is no longer welcome here!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Damn... playing guardian for the brats?! They made a
deal with a lizard beast!

A few raiders threw some less than kind words our way
as they ran, and took some lazy swings our way as they
passed.

of his legacy... let alone if we actually do...

A glint of my insight on others, and knowledge of how

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who knows?

lines.text:
All we can know are the smiles on the faces of those we
help.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What other feedback can you get that you're on the
right track, after all?

I chucked a little, rubbing my neck as though a little

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just keep trying to be the sort of person that can make
another smile...

Through heroics, laughter, or... anything else...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Who knows if we'll reach it? To have the ability and
will to be worthy of it.

But so long as we never stop trying, then we have a
chance.

Through all our battles, I had an instinct for what
it'd take to get the future one may strive for...

lines.text:

I lowered my hand to rest on my sheathed sword's hilt.

You just gotta keep trying. Step forward, blade at the

Even if we never reach it... Then at least we tried.

lines.text: He was a good kid.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Yeah. I couldn't be more proud of him. Of all of them.
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE TO BLACK BG
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 90 FRAMES
STAGE DIRECTION> CHAPTER END CARD SHOWS
Paralogue 04 END
To be Beauty or Beast
STAGE DIRECTION> FADE MUSIC VERY SLOWLY
STAGE DIRECTION> WAIT 180 FRAMES

STAGE DIRECTION> GIVE B LEVEL SUPPORT REWARDS (SORT OF
FINISHING ONE WITH THIS)

STAGE DIRECTION> SET A FLAG THAT THIS PARALOGUE IS
COMPLETED FOR SUPPORTS AND SUCH

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Who the fuck are you lot?!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Why are YOU attacking a village of teenagers and
children?

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Tsk. Not gonna take shit from a fucking lizard!

lines.speaker: Raider Leader
lines.text: Ya just gonna-!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
R- Run...!

The commander is down! The commander is down!

RUN!!!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Pant*... Is that enough...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (They're not exactly all that coordinated, but...)

What was left of the raiding soldiers started to
scatter.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Good... Everyone got out safely.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Run! Your type of trash is no longer welcome here!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text:
Damn... playing guardian for the brats?! They made 
a deal with a lizard beast!

A few raiders threw some less than kind words our 
way as they ran, and took some lazy swings our 
way as they passed.

I raised my own sword to deflect a swing and 
scuttled towards a more defensible position.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...!

(Good, keep running.)

My eyes drifted towards Norde, who seemed like 
he was starting to relax a little.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank the goddess...

But as I saw that, another sight came into the 
corner of my vision.

lines.speaker: Sonth
lines.text: Here, get to...
...and to his side.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Ya stupid...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: SONTH!!!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What...?!
It was as though in an instant.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: Argh...!?

A hand gripped around the raider's neck 
like a noose.
A scene aligned above a crimson pool.
One that, without mistake, signaled an end.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: I- I- Ugh...!
He couldn't get a word out.

There was a crackling feeling that I could 
practically feel the edges of myself.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: M- Mister Norde. What are you...

Seeing the crimson from afar, one of the nearby 
orphans was the first to gather at a distance away.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde, you need to-
I began to run towards them.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: Wait. Sonth... Is Sonth...?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: B- B- Bast...ard... kid...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (No, Norde, not in front of the kids...!)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Die.
The tightening grip was audible.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Ugh...!

(This feeling?!)

(It's like... like...)
The curse.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (This is the same curse as I have?! I can feel it!)

A sensation from within my own chest emanated 
outwards, matching the feelings I had whenever
the curse was at its strongest.
It was a feeling of reverberation.

As though the curse leaked so strongly from 
Norde's own aura that it created a resonance 
within my own soul.

As though whatever self control and willpower that 
had held it back so far broke like a dam.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.text: G- Good... Riddance... ya fuckin'... l- lizard...!
Norde stepped forward.
And dropped his weight.
Down.

Fragments of the world's crust burst upwards, 
flanked by droplets of crimson carried by the 
same momentum.
No scream followed. There was no air to do so.

He stayed there, being grinded into the cracks of 
the crater... 

...by the person above who had not 
relinquished his grip.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...You worthless... piece... of...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Norde is... more beast like...?!)
As I reached Norde's side...

The raider's arms fell. Any resistance gone from 
what was left.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...worthless... piece of...!
Norde raised his arm to strike again.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: *Sniff*... No...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Stop! He's already dead!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: RRAAAAAAAAAAAGGGGGHHH!!!
I caught his arm, stopping him.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde... He's already dead.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...a... worthless... piece of...

As I held his caught arm, I could feel his fist
tighten.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And you got him. Please try to-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I am... a worthless... pieces of garbage...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...Norde...?

(The curse... That feeling, again...?)

The resonance made it feel like the curse itself was
leaking out, like steam into air.

A steam rose from him, and the heat was
accompanied by a shift in the change.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I'm a failure. I always have been.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ivan... He'd had been better off leaving me to rot.

I've only proven to be... a disgrace to his legacy...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (His face... and hair...?!)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This change, it is entirely different than before.
It's more like...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I'm... no better than his own child. Just a stain... 
on what impact he tried to leave on the world...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(This is... him thinking we're the same. The same 
as he sees me. He's mirroring my changes.)
I let go of his arm, and he didn't strike the corpse.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: A disgrace...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...or a beast.

The changes were basic, but enough to see Norde 
being pulled in two different directions.

Each like reverberating in pure magical energy
and creating a smoke signal of the steam.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What is... even the point, anymore...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I've never seen him like this.)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What is even...!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...the point!

His fist landed into the ground, cracking it at its
seams.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: ...Mister Norde...?
The other children had largely gathered now.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Leave me.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Whether beast or disgrace... I have... nothing left 
to offer.
Norde stood up, wobbly as he did.
And started walking away.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: That's not true!
He stopped.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: They're right.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde... You are not worthless.

I've spent most of my life watching my father's 
back as he blazed forward like a comet.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
All... I've ever wanted to do was to catch up, and 
do the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But... he's not the only one that I watched. You
trailed starlight too, even if it was in his wake.

I stood and turned to Norde, 
with his back facing me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You've been my role model, too! My brother!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
...

Just... get the kids to-

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...Grrhhh...!

With his body changing rapidly, he landed on the 
ground with a thud.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (It's not giving him a break!)
Running up to him, I tried to find the words.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Norde... what do I even say?!)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: We're not the same!  / You're better than these bandits!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde, we'll never be the same.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I know... I know I haven't lived up to my father...

That I played a part... in why he died...

I stopped, and I took a deep breath 
before continuing.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: But you are not me.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde, you're the one that I've looked towards if I
ever wondered what might my father do.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You're the closest thing I've ever knew to what my
father was to both of us.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...I don't...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Urgh...?!

I could still feel the aura of the curse, and it
weakened.
But it did not disappear.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
How could... just some animal... live up to... a
hero...?

Norde gritted his teeth as the curse's pull from
his worries over legacy became meek in
comparison.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Grrr...!

His scales grew, crawling up his face and across the
rest of his body.

His hands dug into the dirt. Each tightening of the
grip was accompanied by a more claw like hand.

I could see him grit his teeth, growling, as his
canines became more fang like. 

His eyes transforming more lizard like as 
they visually appeared with a slit type 
structure.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Norde!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: GRRR....!

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
No! You're not a beast! No beast would be sent by 
the goddess!

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
You've always been like... a star...! One sent from 
the sky by the goddess.

When you saved us before... Then again... and 
again... and even now...

How could such a savior be a beast?!
The children gathered around Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You... You shouldn't rely on...

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
The one who saved us?

The one who always shows up when things are
at their worst?

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: Mister Norde. You are our hero.

Norde's breathing... calmed...

I don't know how long we waited,
but he slowly normalized.

The effects of the curse had not faded physically, 
but it was clear a cloud over his mind was fading.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You... all deserve better.

But...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you. All of you.

Norde's gaze landed on me as well, 
smile not wavering.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Perhaps... family can be a blessing... siblings,
included.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I just... need... a second...
Norde laid his head back. Falling asleep.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde, do you think you're no better than those
bandits?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You act as if it was just them.
His form continued to fluctuate.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: They've never stopped telling me. Just... a beast.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: And what does that make them?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: What...?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If you're just a beast, what does that make those
scum?!

How low would they need to fall to make you a 
beast in comparison?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde... You are not a beast.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I know my father saw you as more than just the average
person, too.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...I don't...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Urgh...?!

I could still feel the aura of the curse, and it
weakened.

But it did not disappear.

Steam continued to rise.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
It doesn't matter. It never mattered if they were
right.

Beast... person... I've... only wasted the time 
that the goddess gave me.

Norde started breathing faster. 

The worries over any animalistic nature within 
him became meek in comparison to another.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I failed Ivan. I failed him. How can I ever call myself
anything but a disgrace...?
Norde's hair grew, in a sight I felt all too familiar.

Hands digging into the dirt... Each tightening of the
grip was accompanied by a slimmer set of fingers.

The armor started to sag. It no longer fit well, as
though in an instant... And I could guess easily 
what else started to change below.

Norde's breaths became deeper, and each inhale 
and exhale seemed to refine their face into one I 
had seen before.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde... I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
This is... my stain. My disgrace.

I am sorry for ever pushing that shame on you.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
No! You're not a disgrace! You are an idol! No one
would ever be ashamed of you!

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
You've always been like... a star...! One sent from 
the sky by the goddess.

When you saved us before... Then again... and 
again... and even now...

How could such a savior ever disgrace their idol?!
The children gathered around Norde.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: You... You shouldn't rely on...

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text:
The one who saved us?

The one who always shows up when things
are at their worst?

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: You are our hero.

Norde's breathing... calmed...

I don't know how long we sat there waiting,
but it... was normalized.

The the effects of the curse were dramatic and did 
not fade physically. But a sense of mental clarity 
could be felt.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
You... all deserve better.

But...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Thank you. All of you.

Norde's gaze landed on me as well, 
smile not wavering.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Perhaps... family can be a blessing... siblings,
included.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I... Yeah...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I just... need... a second...
Norde laid their head back. Falling asleep.
Once upon a time.

A rumor was born of a safe haven. A refuge from 
war and strife.

It was a tale of a promised land that spread 
through the whispering voices of war orphans.
"A society for us, by us." ...so the orphans said.
It was not real.

So the orphans decided to make the 
rumor a reality.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.text: Heh.

But with that sliver of truth for refuge came 
attention and violence.
Tragedy was fated.
Expected.
Unless...

Unless those with the power to intervene 
chose to act.
Unless those unrelated...
...those uninvolved...
...those with nothing to gain...
...chose to make a better world.

lines.speaker: Orphan
lines.text: *Sniff* ...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
We'll have to find a new home for these kids.

So... what about after that?
We stood among many.
Many of the displaced orphans that were saved.
And those that were not.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
If people reacted poorly to you not being a homlyn
before, this will only make that worse.
Norde's eyes scanned over the makeshift graves.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: The Crows aren't going to care much, but...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Those who assumed it before will be the same to 
see me as such now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But what if it gets worse? This is the curse, after
all.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then I'll cross that bridge when it comes to it.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: We're... sort of in the same boat now.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I'd offer to teach you a thing or two about it...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
But I suspect you'd be teaching me before I knew 
it, haha...

Norde's eyes stayed trained on the 
makeshift graves.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I... don't think I'm helping.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...

I guess the curse has a one track mind at times.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Heh... I guess it does, in a sense.

A palpable irony to it, even...

Looking over at Norde, the glint of laughter was 
only for that moment.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*... I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I guess this result is only natural for me at this
point.

My own failures dragging you down. Worrying that 
you'll end up like me...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe all this misfortune could've been avoided in its
entirety.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Huh?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
My failures are my own to carry.

You did nothing wrong.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Norde, if I'm the source of one of the anchors that
weighed you down here, then...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Then it is still not your fault.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I would not blame the tree for a rotten apple that I
chose to eat.

You did nothing wrong. It is my fault for letting it
impact me as such.
The words settled on my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (My fuck ups just keep spreading, don't they...?)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton... No, I mean...  *Sigh* ...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Anton...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I was wrong. You didn't kill Ivan.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: I just...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: *Exhale*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Norde...?
Norde was taking deep breaths again.
This topic gave me a similar feeling of uneasiness.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
A hero is someone that saves a soul.

One who holds great power, and wields it for those 
most vulnerable.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
For them not to act... would they even be qualified 
to be called "good" anymore?

Could a man be a "good person" if they refuse to 
act despite having the power to make a difference?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
To be called an admirable person, let alone a hero...
it would be a stain on the goddess's oath...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: A thoroughly stained world, in that case...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Though we both know that.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
As we also both know what its like to meet the
opposite. A true hero.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(After all the stories I heard of legends... to grow 
up seeing my father in action...)

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ivan was my hero. He saved my soul.

I owe him a greater debt than I could ever pay.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: And at the same time, I am amongst his legacy...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
We two are those left behind.

To be a good person. An admirable person. A hero, 
if we dared...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
That... That is what I struggle with.

The question of whether I even can.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Whether either of us... as Ivan's legacy, can live up
to even the foundation he left behind.
Norde breathed in.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: As to not waste the chance he gave us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (My father's legacy...)
I raised my hand and gripped it into a fist.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Maybe that's also at the core of what I struggle 
over, too. At least in part.)

(That question... can I? Can Norde? Can anyone?)

...
I felt experience tell me an answer.

Knowing how much it could take for people to just 
get along and do their best for one another...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Peace is a struggle. A never ending one. After all,
ideals are far from homogenized...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: *Sigh*...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who knows? Maybe it's for the best.

I raised my hand to my chin, a thought spurring 
into my mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Whether we actually can live up to the power and 
will of his legacy... let alone if we actually do...

It's a mystery. But one that keeps pushing us.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe we'll get there without even knowing. And 
maybe its best we don't realize if we do.
My instincts told me an answer.

A glint of my insight on others, and knowledge of 
how human nature can sway society...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who knows?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
All we can know are the smiles on the faces of 
those we help.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
What other feedback can you get that you're on the
right track, after all?

I chuckled a little, rubbing my neck as 
though a little embarassed to say it aloud.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Just keep trying to be the sort of person that can 
make another smile...

Through heroics, laughter, or... anything else...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Who knows if we'll reach it? To have the ability and
will to be worthy of it.

But so long as we never stop trying, then we have 
a chance.
My gut told me an answer.

Through all our battles, I had an instinct for what
it'd take to get the future one may strive for...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: No.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
I don't think we'll ever know if we can reach that.

To have power and will enough to be worthy of it.

I lowered my hand to rest on my 
sheathed sword's hilt.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You just gotta keep trying. Step forward, blade at 
the ready to help when needed.

Even if we never reach it... Then at least we tried.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I suppose so.

Perhaps you have gained more wisdom then I give 
you credit for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: ...Thank you, Norde.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You're not half-bad yourself.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Heh...

We stood there for a while, and watched over the
orphans as they each felt it was time to head out.
 
Each thanked us, especially Norde, for everything.
All until it was only us two left.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
...You know...

I remember a story my father once told me.

About how you got the name "Norde" because you 
misheard him saying to go "north".

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: And?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Just... a thought came to mind.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
That first child we met when we came here.

"Sonth".

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Who gave him his name?

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: Well...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: ...himself.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: He was a good kid.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Indeed. 

I couldn't be more proud of him. 

Of all of them.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: next to

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: text

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Pup's leaning and "class" (Will fake it for now)

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Pup is Diplomatic / Pup is Direct / Pup is CHarismatic

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Norde is beast / Norde is Female

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Chapter number ~

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: CH 12 / CHarlotte Reagyn B / CHarlotte Reagyn A / Tatiana x Atticus C / Eve x Macy x Jenny C / Supply RUn 11-12 / Pup Norde A / Rowan Charlotte A
Turn off NSFW content for the following scene?

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: I want to see NSFW Images / I DONT want to see NSFW
I stood in my tent at camp.

In the process of changing, I found myself looking 
over my body.
I saw a face and body I had seen many times before.

I saw a face and body that was innately altered 
from journey's start.

Changes had happened, and I couldn't deny that in 
this state.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Why am I focusing on how I look?)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I look like how I've always looked.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: That's...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: It really does look longer.

It was hard to deny, my hair had grown notably. It
wasn't long, but it was longer than it was.

I brushed my hand through it quickly, and it 
flickered back and forth as its longest tips tickled 
the bottom of my neck.

My face also looked slightly different. This was 
harder to be confident in, but it felt softer to me.

I didn't have a rough looking face before, so I
squinted trying to tell if features had changed.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (I'm not imagining it, am I?)

My general frame had, however, clearly adjusted 
in a more discernable way.

I could feel that from how my clothes fit. I had to
clasp belts slightly farther down the leather.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Is it more height loss, or...)

My eyes settled on my chest at the center of my
previous thought.

They seemed less defined, like I had gained some
weight. It was subtle.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Slightly... puffy...?)

Those words came to mind, and I tried not to think 
of it more deeply. There was a clear implication and 
one I preferred to look elsewhere on.
Downwards, I looked over my butt and legs.

Once more I wasn't sure how much of it changed 
or if the rest of the changes reframed parts of my 
body.

Have I ever told you two a tale of the

It's an old legend that goes back a millennia.

The great and respected King Minae had two

parentage of a baby.
But only one could be the true mother of the child. 
So the good king was asked to give judgement.

His edict was to split the babe in two. One half for

Minae then knew the true mother. For such

of the wisdom King Minae showed to the world 
that day.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
But you are a commanding officer of the Hell's 
Raisers mercenary corp, yes?

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: ...What of it?

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
"What of it?"... You've made few friends in the 
past few weeks.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Raiding... Pillaging... Though I guess that in itself is 
nothing new to you.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
It's got the local governors in a panic. That much is 
certain.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
Something most would avoid. It's why the typical 
bandit raiding corp avoids staying in one place 
too long.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I imagine you can tell where I am going with this? 
What we were hired to do?

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Hmph. I thought you wanted me to sell out my 
fellow "bandits"?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Is this guy really more willing to sell out 
his comrades than just admit what they 
were up to here?)
With a few steps, I pulled my father to the side.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Let me try.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: You don't have to.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: ...Very well.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Don't worry. I can do this.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Be wary over your approach. You came into this 
wanting to use it as training, after all.

It's the little things that influence how you develop 
as a warrior. As a person.

How you carry yourself will bleed into your view of 
every aspect of the world in due time.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
(Yeah, but I just need to do what works. If it gets 
me results, then I'll gladly take that route.)

Choices for Pup are choices on how he approaches 
certain types of conflict.

NOTE: They will always be in this order: 
Diplomatic, Charismatic, Aggressive. 

-Diplomatic- 
Attempt to get people to compromise on solutions.

-Charismatic- 
Attempt to charm and persuade people to 
your solution.
-Aggressive- 
Use force to place priority on your solution.

These choices will pop up in the story every so 
often. Eventually, the summation of these choices 
will determine minor story and gameplay deviations.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (How to approach this...?)

I turned on my heel to place myself in front of the 
bandit.

lines.speaker: [Choice]
lines.text: Appeal to a common goal of continued life for all /  Persuade him to work with your group / Threaten more than just his own health

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You keep surprising me. Whatever it is you're after 
over your own life? 

What sort of priority is that?

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: You don't actually care about what I'm looking for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
How would I know? I don't know what
it is.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Not that I don't want to just take a hot bath at 
this point. Much better than getting another axe 
swung my way.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
I mean it. You don't care about it. You just think 
you do because you've got gold on the line.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Then what's so hard about just telling us. If it's 
nothing to us then it's nothing to us.

Better yet. Then we can all go home for that hot 
bath and plenty of our life still to live.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
You're not very subtle, runt. Even for me.

You think it's clever to have identified that I want 
to live?

Fuck man... How did that idiot lose to you, 
hahaha...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
You keep surprising me. It's a weird thing to throw 
your life away for.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: You don't actually care about what I'm looking for.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Of course I don't.

I don't know exactly what it is, but what little I 
heard before doesn't make it sound like it's worth 
your life.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: Might be worth your life... heh...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Maybe we could go half and half, then?

That's not actually a horrible idea. Working 
together? It certainly could save a few gray hairs on 
my father's head.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
You're not very subtle, runt. Even for me.

You think you're clever? "Work together"? Give 
me a break.

Fuck man... How did that idiot lose to you, 
hahaha...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Talk.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Already told you I'd tell you anything you'd want to 
know about those dumbasses.

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Fine. How about this?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Tell me the person in your corp that
truly means something to you.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: Heh? What are you going on about now?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Truly you're not going to say you don't even have 
a friend in that group? One who you'll miss? 
That'll miss you?

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text: How dare you... You monster...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Exactly. Wouldn't it be best if we could just not-

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Ha! That was what you wanted me to say, wasn't 
it?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: What... Don't just...

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
You're not very subtle, runt. Even for me.

You're trying to threaten a merc with hurting 
his friends? How soft hearted.

Fuck man... How did that idiot lose to you, 
hahaha...

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Final offer. I give you info on the rest of those 
deadbeats and you let me walk.

Heheh... We both know you can't walk away 
empty handed.

I briskly took several steps forward before 
grabbing the man's collar.

As I pulled in the man, an arm split us apart.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Now now, Pup.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Should've sent the lass. She might've put a blade 
to my throat, haha!

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: ...I still might.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.text:
Offer one more time and I might be into then, 
sweetie.

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: What did I say before about wasting our time? We-

Once more, we heard a rumbling from the forest 
around.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text: More of these bandits?

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: (Whatever it is, it's getting closer...)

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text: Satia. Pup.
END OF CURRENT CONTENT

We're paying a Nightless Crow mercenary to join
us on the front lines during this adventure.

(Choose a mercenary to acquire at the cost of a
token. These are supplemental characters that
do not have supports.)

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Goddess damn you!

I... I... can't fall here.... Not
now... Not yet... Not with so much
left undone...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This... This is the end?

So many hopes... So many dreams...
Please, see them through,
everyone...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This view... This ending...

This is not the dream I grasped for.
Clawed for... No, this is... this
is...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
Goddess damn you!

I... I... can't fall here.... Not
now... Not yet... Not with so much
left undone...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This... This is the end?

So many hopes... So many dreams...
Please, see them through,
everyone...

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text:
This view... This ending...

This is not the dream I grasped for.
Clawed for... No, this is... this
is...

lines.speaker: Ivan
lines.text:
I will not fall here! I- I cannot...

Anton... still needs a guiding hand... Please... 
Please let me... do one last good thing...

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whines in pain*...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Boy, no... Jakson... No...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: You bastards! I'll never forgive you!

lines.speaker: Jakson
lines.text: *Whines in pain*...!

lines.speaker: Pup
lines.text: Boy, get to safety! We can take it from here!

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No... No... Not now... Ngh...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I must... retreat... to keep our
promise.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No... No... Not now... Ngh...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ivan... I promised you. I will keep Anton safe. But I 
must retire to see that promise through.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No... No... Not now... Ngh...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
I must... retreat... to keep our
promise.

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text: No... No... Not now... Ngh...

lines.speaker: Norde
lines.text:
Ivan... I promised you. I will keep Anton safe. But I 
must retire to see that promise through.

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
Blood... That is a lot of blood. Ngh... So much more 
than normal...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
It'll be okay, my little Pup... You're... You're not so 
little anymore...

lines.speaker: Satia
lines.text:
I need to get to safety. Pup, you'll be fine. You 
will.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
That was a clever... clever move of yours... I'm 
impressed.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
At least... At least I could see my end... with just 
that one lingering regret...

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
That was a clever... clever move of yours... I'm 
impressed.

lines.speaker: Rowan
lines.text:
At least... At least I could see my end... with just 
that one lingering regret...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text: Wait... Am I... Am I actually...?

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
To think. Here of all places... After all this... all 
this...

lines.speaker: Kara
lines.text:
That truly stings... If I do not have these treated, 
then... I must retreat.

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I... will not go down this easily!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ngh!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Crap... this is actually it, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: I... will not go down this easily!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Ngh!

lines.speaker: Charlotte
lines.text: Crap... this is actually it, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Ah... It- It hurts...

Charlotte, please keep pushing forward... I know 
you...

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text: I know you'll be great.

lines.speaker: Mariel
lines.text:
Ah... That really hurts. O- Ow... This means I need 
to retreat, right?

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Well... I guess it's game over. 

I wonder if I will get back home.

lines.speaker: Jenny
lines.text:
Anothis always said better safe than dead. Good 
luck everyone else!

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
So I'm dying again? How many worlds does this 
make this now?

At least I did some good in my short time here. I 
wonder... if I'll get to meet that Goddess again?

lines.speaker: Eve
lines.text:
Ah, I don't want to die... again! Sorry everyone. I 
need to get to safety for now.

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Time for Cypher to beam me back in... but why... 
does it feel... cold...?

lines.speaker: Macy
lines.text:
Time for Cypher to beam me back in... oh, right... 
retreating is going to be harder without her.

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Crap... I guess this makes sense for it to end this 
way...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
I just... hope I didn't make it worse before... 
before...

lines.speaker: Bennett
lines.text:
Crap, this now? Maybe I can...? No, I don't think 
they'll let me. I have to retreat.

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Hmph... So these are the limits of this constructed 
body...?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Ah... I wished to see the end of this story...

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text:
Hmph... So these are the limits of this constructed 
body...?

lines.speaker: Liebra
lines.text: Then, to see the end of this story, I must retreat...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: *Pant*... S- Shit... This isn’t... worth it...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
I just... wanted...

...one more taste...

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text:
*Pant*... This isn’t worth the
payment at this point.

lines.speaker: Jude
lines.text: Sorry... but gotta retreat.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Argh! That... stings...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It seems I must... pull back for now. Apologies for 
this embarrassment.

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text: Argh! That... stings...

lines.speaker: Cainan
lines.text:
It seems I must... pull back for now. Apologies for 
this embarrassment.

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: You think I'd- I'd...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text: ...I'd go down... that... that... eas...i...ly...

lines.speaker: Tatiana
lines.text:
I... I'm not gonna die to these assholes. They're 
not... not worth it!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
Y- You think... You think this could take me 
down..?!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
*Gasping cough*! ...Wait... This... No, this isn't... 
this isn't funny...!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text: You... Argh! Fine, I'll maim ya later ya asshats!

lines.speaker: Otis
lines.text:
*Gasping cough*! ...Wait... This... No, this isn't... 
this isn't funny...!

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: This... This is just... a flesh wound...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text: I can keep... can keep... going...

lines.speaker: Reagyn
lines.text:
Curse you... This is just a flesh wound, but... Fine, I 
will retreat!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text: O- Ow... No, this one feels... a bit...

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Haha... Of course I messed up. Everyone... finish 
it...!

lines.speaker: Flynn
lines.text:
Curses... Of course I messed up. I can't die here, 
though! I'll retreat.

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text:
*Cough*... Just... one more...

...one... More... shot...!

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: *Cough*... Is that... no...

lines.speaker: Elliot
lines.text: I have to retreat? I’m sorry... mother... father...

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: T- To think... Bested here?

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text:
T- This isn't the end... *cough*... I... I... I won't 
give... up... yet...!

lines.speaker: Castel
lines.text: Bested here? Oh well, I guess I must retreat.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
This... is it? Hmm... I wasn’t expecting it to... 
end... here...

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Marya, Lefen, Euna, Pelus, Xavier... Live wonderful 
lives.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text: Augh... That’s... about as far as I can go.

lines.speaker: Atticus
lines.text:
Apologies. For my left side not being able to... keep 
up. I need to retreat.
